1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%1%%In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%2%%And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep: and the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%3%%And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%4%%And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%5%%And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night: and the evening and the morning were the first day.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%6%%And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%7%%And God made the firmament; and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%8%%And God called the firmament Heaven: and the evening and the morning were the second day.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%9%%And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered into one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%10%%And God called the dry land Earth, and the collection of waters he called Seas: and God saw that it was good.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%11%%And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit-tree yielding fruit after its kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%12%%And the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after its kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after its kind: and God saw that it was good.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%13%%And the evening and the morning were the third day.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%14%%And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven, to divide the day from the night: and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%15%%And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven, to give light upon the earth: and it was so.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%16%%And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%17%%And God set them in the firmament of the heaven, to give light upon the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%18%%And to rule over the day, and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%19%%And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%20%%And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%21%%And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%22%%And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%23%%And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%24%%And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and the creeping animal, and the beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%25%%And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every animal that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that it was good.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%26%%And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping animal that creepeth upon the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%27%%So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%28%%And God blessed them, and God said to them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living animal that moveth upon the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%29%%And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for food.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%30%%And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every animal that creepeth upon the earth, in which is life, I have given every green herb for food: and it was so.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%1%%31%%And God saw every thing that he had made, and behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%1%%Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%2%%And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%3%%And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%4%%These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%5%%And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain on the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%6%%But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%7%%And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%8%%And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%9%%And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%10%%And a river went out of Eden to water the garden: and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%11%%The name of the first is Pison, which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%12%%And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx-stone.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%13%%And the name of the second river is Gihon: the same that compasseth the whole land of Cush.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%14%%And the name of the third river is Hiddekel: which floweth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%15%%And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden, to dress it, and to keep it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%16%%And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%17%%But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest of it thou shalt surely die.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%18%%And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone: I will make him a help meet for him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%19%%And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air, and brought them to Adam to see what he would call them; and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was its name.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%20%%And Adam gave names to all cattle, and to the fowls of the air, and to every beast of the field: but for Adam there was not found a help meet for him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%21%%And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept; and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh in its place.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%22%%And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, he made woman, and brought her to the man.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%23%%And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of man.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%24%%Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave to his wife: and they shall be one flesh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%2%%25%%And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%1%%Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made: and he said to the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%2%%And the woman said to the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%3%%But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%4%%And the serpent said to the woman, Ye shall not surely die:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%5%%For God doth know, that in the day ye eat of it, then your eyes shall be opened: and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%6%%And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise; she took of its fruit, and ate, and gave also to her husband with her, and he ate.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%7%%And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked: and they sewed fig-leaves together, and made for themselves aprons.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%8%%And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%9%%And the LORD God called to Adam, and said to him, Where art thou?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%10%%And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden: and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%11%%And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree of which I commanded thee, that thou shouldest not eat?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%12%%And the man said, The woman, whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I ate.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%13%%And the LORD God said to the woman, What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I ate.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%14%%And the LORD God said to the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field: upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%15%%And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed: it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%16%%To the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children: and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%17%%And to Adam he said, Because thou hast hearkened to the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree of which I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it: cursed is the ground for thy sake; in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%18%%Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%19%%In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou shalt return to the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and to dust shalt thou return.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%20%%And Adam called his wife's name Eve, because she was the mother of all living.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%21%%For Adam also and for his wife the LORD God made coats of skins, and clothed them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%22%%And the LORD God said, Behold, the man hath become as one of us, to know good and evil. And now, lest he should put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%23%%Therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from which he was taken.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%3%%24%%So he drove out the man: and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubim, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%1%%And Adam knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bore Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%2%%And she again bore his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%3%%And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering to the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%4%%And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock, and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect to Abel, and to his offering:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%5%%But to Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%6%%And the LORD said to Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%7%%If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And to thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%8%%And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%9%%And the LORD said to Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: Am I my brother's keeper?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%10%%And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth to me from the ground.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%11%%And now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%12%%When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield to thee its strength: A fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%13%%And Cain said to the LORD, My punishment is greater than I can bear.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%14%%Behold, thou hast driven me this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it will come to pass, that every one that findeth me will slay me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%15%%And the LORD said to him, Therefore whoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him seven-fold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%16%%And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%17%%And Cain knew his wife, and she conceived, and bore Enoch: and he built a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son Enoch.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%18%%And to Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael: and Mehujael begat Methusael: and Methusael begat Lamech.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%19%%And Lamech took to him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%20%%And Adah bore Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of such as have cattle.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%21%%And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%22%%And Zillah, she also bore Tubalcain, an instructor of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%23%%And Lamech said to his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice, ye wives of Lamech, hearken to my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%24%%If Cain shall be avenged seven-fold, truly Lamech seventy and seven-fold.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%25%%And Adam knew his wife again, and she bore a son, and called his name Seth: For God, said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%4%%26%%And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enos: then began men to call upon the name of the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%1%%This is the book of the generations of Adam: In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%2%%Male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%3%%And Adam lived a hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, after his image; and called his name Seth:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%4%%And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%5%%And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%6%%And Seth lived a hundred and five years, and begat Enos:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%7%%And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%8%%And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years; and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%9%%And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%10%%And Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%11%%And all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years; and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%12%%And Cainan lived seventy years, and begat Mahalaleel:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%13%%And Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%14%%And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years; and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%15%%And Mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%16%%And Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%17%%And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years; and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%18%%And Jared lived a hundred sixty and two years, and he begat Enoch:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%19%%And Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%20%%And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years; and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%21%%And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%22%%And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%23%%And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%24%%And Enoch walked with God, and he was not: for God took him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%25%%And Methuselah lived a hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%26%%And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%27%%And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years; and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%28%%And Lamech lived a hundred eighty and two years; and begat a son:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%29%%And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%30%%And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%31%%And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years; and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%5%%32%%And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%1%%And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born to them,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%2%%That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all whom they chose.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%3%%And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be a hundred and twenty years.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%4%%There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of God came in to the daughters of men, and they bore children to them: the same became mighty men, who were of old, men of renown.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%5%%And GOD saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%6%%And the LORD repented that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%7%%And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created, from the face of the earth, both man and beast, and the creeping animal, and the fowls of the air; for I repent that I have made them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%8%%But Noah found grace in the eyes of the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%9%%These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man, and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%10%%And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%11%%The earth also was corrupt before God; and the earth was filled with violence.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%12%%And God looked upon the earth, and behold, it was corrupt: for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%13%%And God said to Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them: and behold, I will destroy them with the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%14%%Make thee an ark of gopher-wood: rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%15%%And this is the fashion in which thou shalt make it: the length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%16%%A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in its side: with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%17%%And behold, I, even I do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, in which is the breath of life, from under heaven: and every thing that is on the earth shall die.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%18%%But with thee will I establish my covenant: and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons' wives with thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%19%%And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee: they shall be male and female.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%20%%Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping animal of the earth after its kind, two of every sort shall come to thee, to keep them alive.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%21%%And take thou to thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%6%%22%%Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%1%%And the LORD said to Noah, Come thou and all thy house into the ark: for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%2%%Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%3%%Of fowls of the air also by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive on the face of all the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%4%%For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights: and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from the face of the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%5%%And Noah did according to all that the LORD commanded him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%6%%And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was on the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%7%%And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%8%%Of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of fowls, and of every animal that creepeth upon the earth;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%9%%There went in two and two to Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%10%%And it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%11%%In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%12%%And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%13%%In the same day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah's wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%14%%They, and every beast after his kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping animal that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%15%%And they went in to Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh, in which is the breath of life.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%16%%And they that entered, went in male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the LORD shut him in.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%17%%And the flood was forty days upon the earth: and the waters increased, and bore up the ark, and it was lifted above the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%18%%And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth: and the ark moved upon the face of the waters.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%19%%And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills that were under the whole heaven were covered.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%20%%Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail: and the mountains were covered.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%21%%And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of beast, and of every creeping animal that creepeth upon the earth, and every man:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%22%%All in whose nostrils was the breath of life, of all that was on the dry land, died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%23%%And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping animals, and the fowl of heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth; and Noah only remained alive, and they that were with him in the ark.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%7%%24%%And the waters prevailed upon the earth a hundred and fifty days.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%1%%And God remembered Noah, and every living animal, and all the cattle that were with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters were checked.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%2%%The fountains also of the deep, and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%3%%And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%4%%And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%5%%And the waters decreased continually, till the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%6%%And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%7%%And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, till the waters were dried from off the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%8%%Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%9%%But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned to him into the ark; for the waters were on the face of the whole earth. Then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in to him into the ark.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%10%%And he stayed yet other seven days, and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%11%%And the dove came in to him in the evening, and lo, in her mouth was an olive-leaf plucked off: So Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%12%%And he stayed yet other seven days, and sent forth the dove; which returned not again to him any more.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%13%%And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and behold, the face of the ground was dry.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%14%%And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%15%%And God spoke to Noah, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%16%%Go forth from the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons' wives with thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%17%%Bring forth with thee every living animal that is with thee, of all flesh, of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping animal that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly on the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%18%%And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%19%%Every beast, every creeping animal, and every fowl, and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went out of the ark.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%20%%And Noah built an altar to the LORD, and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt-offerings on the altar.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%21%%And the LORD smelled a sweet savor; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth: neither will I again smite any more every living animal as I have done.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%8%%22%%While the earth remaineth, seed-time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%1%%And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%2%%And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, upon all that moveth on the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%3%%Every moving thing that liveth shall be food for you; even as the green herb have I given you all things:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%4%%But flesh with the life of it, which is its blood, shall ye not eat.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%5%%And surely your blood of your lives will I require: at the hand of every beast will I require it: and at the hand of man, at the hand of every man's brother will I require the life of man.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%6%%Whoever sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God made he man.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%7%%And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply, bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%8%%And God spoke to Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%9%%And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%10%%And with every living creature that is with you, of the fowl, of the cattle, and of every beast of the earth with you, from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%11%%And I will establish my covenant with you; neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%12%%And God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%13%%I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%14%%And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%15%%And I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%16%%And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%17%%And God said to Noah, This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%18%%And the sons of Noah that went forth from the ark, were Shem, and Ham, and Japheth: and Ham was the father of Canaan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%19%%These three were the sons of Noah: and from them was the whole earth overspread.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%20%%And Noah began to be a husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%21%%And he drank the wine, and was drunken, and he was uncovered within his tent.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%22%%And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%23%%And Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father: and their faces were backward, and they saw not their father's nakedness.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%24%%And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done to him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%25%%And he said, Cursed be Canaan, a servant of servants shall he be to his brethren.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%26%%And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%27%%God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%28%%And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%9%%29%%And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%10%%1%%Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah; Shem, Ham, and Japheth: and to them were sons born after the flood.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%10%%8%%And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%10%%19%%And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar, to Gaza; as thou goest to Sodom and Gomorrah, and Admah, and Zeboim, even to Lashah.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%1%%And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%2%%And it came to pass as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and they dwelt there.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%3%%And they said one to another, come, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for mortar.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%4%%And they said, come, let us build us a city, and a tower, whose top may reach to heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we should be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%5%%And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men were building.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%6%%And the LORD said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%7%%Come, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%8%%So the LORD scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%11%%9%%Therefore is the name of it called Babel, because the LORD there confounded the language of all the earth: and from thence did the LORD scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%1%%Now the LORD had said to Abram, Depart from thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father's house, to a land that I will show thee:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%2%%And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%4%%So Abram departed, as the LORD had spoken to him, and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed from Haran.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%5%%And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother's son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went to go forth into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%9%%And Abram journeyed, going on still towards the south.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%10%%And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to dwell there; for the famine was grievous in the land.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%11%%And it came to pass, when he had come near to enter into Egypt, that he said to Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%12%%Therefore it will come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they will say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%13%%Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%14%%And it came to pass, that when Abram had come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%15%%The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%16%%And he treated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he-asses, and men-servants, and maid-servants, and she-asses, and camels.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%17%%And the LORD afflicted Pharaoh and his house with great plagues, because of Sarai, Abram's wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%18%%And Pharaoh called Abram, and said, What is this that thou hast done to me? why didst thou not tell me that she is thy wife?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%19%%Why saidst thou, She is my sister? so I might have taken her to me for a wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%12%%20%%And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%13%%1%%And Abram returned from Egypt, he, and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him, into the south.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%13%%2%%And Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%13%%3%%And he went on his journeys from the south even to Beth-el, to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Beth-el and Hai;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%13%%4%%To the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first: and there Abram called on the name of the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%13%%5%%And Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%13%%6%%And the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%1%%After these things the word of the LORD came to Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%2%%And Abram said, Lord GOD, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%3%%And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and lo, one born in my house is my heir.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%4%%And behold, the word of the LORD came to him, saying, This shall not be thy heir; but he that shall come forth out of thy own bowels shall be thy heir.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%5%%And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now towards heaven, and tell the stars, if thou art able to number them: and he said to him, So shall thy seed be.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%6%%And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%7%%And he said to him, I am the LORD that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%8%%And he said, Lord GOD, by what shall I know that I shall inherit it?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%9%%And he said to him, Take me a heifer of three years old, and a she-goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtle-dove, and a young pigeon.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%10%%And he took to him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds he did not divide.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%11%%And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%12%%And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and lo, a horror of great darkness fell upon him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%13%%And he said to Abram, Know certainly that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%14%%And also that nation which they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%15%%And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%16%%But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%17%%And it came to pass, that when the sun had gone down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%15%%19%%The Kenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%1%%Now Sarai, Abram's wife, bore him no children: and she had a handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name was Hagar.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%2%%And Sarai said to Abram, Behold, now, the LORD hath restrained me from bearing: I pray thee go in to my maid; it may be that I may obtain children by her. And Abram hearkened to the voice of Sarai.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%3%%And Sarai, Abram's wife, took Hagar her maid, the Egyptian, after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%4%%And he went in to Hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%5%%And Sarai said to Abram, my wrong be upon thee: I have given my maid into thy bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, I was despised in her eyes: the LORD judge between me and thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%6%%But Abram said to Sarai, Behold, thy maid is in thy hand; do to her as it pleaseth thee. And when Sarai dealt hardly with her, she fled from her face.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%7%%And the angel of the LORD found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%8%%And he said, Hagar, Sarai's maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%9%%And the angel of the LORD said to her, Return to thy mistress, and submit thyself under her hands.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%10%%And the angel of the LORD said to her, I will multiply thy seed exceedingly, that it shall not be numbered for multitude.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%11%%And the angel of the LORD said to her, Behold, thou art with child, and shalt bear a son, and shalt call his name Ishmael; because the LORD hath heard thy affliction.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%12%%And he will be a wild man; his hand will be against every man, and every man's hand against him; and he shall dwell in the presence of all his brethren.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%13%%And she called the name of the LORD that spoke to her, Thou God seest me: for she said, Have I also here looked after him that seeth me?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%14%%Wherefore the well was called Beer-la-hai-roi; behold, it is between Kadesh and Bered.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%15%%And Hagar bore Abram a son: and Abram called his son's name, which Hagar bore, Ishmael.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%16%%16%%And Abram was eighty six years old, when Hagar bore Ishmael to Abram.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%1%%And when Abram was ninety and nine years old, the LORD appeared to Abram, and said to him, I am the Almighty God; walk before me, and be thou perfect.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%2%%And I will make my covenant between me and thee, and will multiply thee exceedingly.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%3%%And Abram fell on his face: and God talked with him, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%4%%As for me, behold, my covenant is with thee, and thou shalt be a father of many nations.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%5%%Neither shall thy name any more be called Abram, but thy name shall be Abraham; for a father of many nations have I made thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%6%%And I will make thee exceedingly fruitful, and I will make nations of thee; and kings shall proceed from thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%7%%And I will establish my covenant between me and thee, and thy seed after thee, in their generations, for an everlasting covenant; to be a God to thee and to thy seed after thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%8%%And I will give to thee, and to thy seed after thee, the land in which thou art a stranger, all the land of Canaan, for an everlasting possession; and I will be their God.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%9%%And God said to Abraham, Thou shalt keep my covenant therefore, thou, and thy seed after thee, in their generations.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%10%%This is my covenant, which ye shall keep between me and you, and thy seed after thee; Every male-child among you shall be circumcised.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%11%%And ye shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin; and it shall be a token of the covenant betwixt me and you.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%12%%And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised among you, every male-child in your generations, he that is born in the house, or bought with money of any stranger, who is not of thy seed.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%13%%He that is born in thy house, and he that is bought with thy money, must needs be circumcised: and my covenant shall be in your flesh for an everlasting covenant.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%14%%And the uncircumcised male-child, whose flesh of his foreskin is not circumcised, that soul shall be cut off from his people; he hath broken my covenant.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%15%%And God said to Abraham, As for Sarai thy wife, thou shalt not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall her name be.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%16%%And I will bless her, and give thee a son also by her: yea, I will bless her, and she shall be a mother of nations; kings of people shall proceed from her.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%17%%Then Abraham fell upon his face, and laughed, and said in his heart, Shall a child be born to him that is a hundred years old? and shall Sarah, who is ninety years old, bear?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%18%%And Abraham said to God, O that Ishmael might live before thee!
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%19%%And God said, Sarah thy wife shall bear thee a son indeed; and thou shalt call his name Isaac: and I will establish my covenant with him for an everlasting covenant, and with his seed after him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%20%%And as for Ishmael, I have heard thee: Behold, I have blessed him, and will make him fruitful, and will multiply him exceedingly; twelve princes shall he beget, and I will make him a great nation.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%21%%But my covenant will I establish with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to thee at this set time in the next year.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%17%%22%%And he ceased talking with him, and God went up from Abraham.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%1%%And the LORD appeared to him in the plains of Mamre: and he sat in the tent door in the heat of the day;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%2%%And he lifted up his eyes and looked, and lo, three men stood by him: and when he saw them, he ran to meet them from the tent door, and bowed himself toward the ground,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%3%%And said, My Lord, if now I have found favor in thy sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thy servant:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%4%%Let a little water, I pray you, be brought, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%5%%And I will bring a morsel of bread, and comfort ye your hearts; after that you shall pass on: for therefore are ye come to your servant. And they said, So do, as thou hast said.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%6%%And Abraham hastened into the tent to Sarah, and said, Make ready quickly three measures of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes upon the hearth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%7%%And Abraham ran to the herd, and brought a calf tender and good, and gave it to a young man; and he hasted to dress it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%8%%And he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed, and set it before them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they ate.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%9%%And they said to him, Where is Sarah thy wife? And he said, Behold, in the tent.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%10%%And he said, I will certainly return to thee according to the time of life; and lo, Sarah thy wife shall have a son. And Sarah heard it in the tent door, which was behind him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%11%%Now Abraham and Sarah were old and far advanced in age; and it ceased to be with Sarah after the manner of women.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%12%%Therefore Sarah laughed within herself, saying, After I am become old shall I have pleasure, my lord being old also?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%13%%And the LORD said to Abraham, Why did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I certainly bear a child, who am old?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%14%%Is any thing too hard for the LORD? At the time appointed I will return to thee, according to the time of life, and Sarah shall have a son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%15%%Then Sarah denied, saying, I laughed not; for she was afraid. And he said, Nay; but thou didst laugh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%16%%And the men rose up from thence, and looked toward Sodom: and Abraham went with them to bring them on the way.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%17%%And the LORD said, Shall I hide from Abraham that thing which I do;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%18%%Seeing that Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation, and all the nations of the earth shall be blessed in him?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%19%%For I know him, that he will command his children and his household after him, and they will keep the way of the LORD, to do justice and judgment; that the LORD may bring upon Abraham that which he hath spoken of him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%20%%And the LORD said, Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%21%%I will go down now, and see whether they have done altogether according to the cry of it, which is come to me; and if not, I will know.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%22%%And the men turned their faces from thence, and went towards Sodom: but Abraham stood yet before the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%23%%And Abraham drew near, and said, Wilt thou also destroy the righteous with the wicked?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%24%%Peradventure there are fifty righteous within the city: wilt thou also destroy and not spare the place for the fifty righteous that are in it?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%25%%That be far from thee to do after this manner, to slay the righteous with the wicked: and that the righteous should be as the wicked, that be far from thee: Shall not the Judge of all the earth do right?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%26%%And the LORD said, If I find in Sodom fifty righteous within the city, then I will spare all the place for their sakes.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%27%%And Abraham answered and said, Behold now, I, who am dust and ashes, have taken upon me to speak to the Lord.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%28%%Peradventure there will lack five of the fifty righteous: wilt thou destroy all the city for lack of five? And he said, If I find there forty and five, I will not destroy it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%29%%And he spoke to him yet again, and said, Peradventure there will be forty found there. And he said, I will not do it for forty's sake.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%30%%And he said, Oh, let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak: Peradventure there will thirty be found there. And he said, I will not do it, if I find thirty there.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%31%%And he said, Behold now, I have taken upon me to speak to the Lord: Peradventure there will be twenty found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for twenty's sake.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%32%%And he said, Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak yet but this once: Peradventure ten will be found there. And he said, I will not destroy it for ten's sake.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%18%%33%%And the LORD went his way, as soon as he had left communing with Abraham: and Abraham returned to his place.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%1%%And there came two angels to Sodom at evening; and Lot sat in the gate of Sodom; and Lot seeing them, rose to meet them; and he bowed himself with his face towards the ground;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%2%%And he said, Behold now, my lords, turn, I pray you, into your servant's house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise early, and go on your ways. And they said, Nay; but we will abide in the street all night.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%3%%And he urged them greatly; and they turned in to him, and entered into his house; and he made them a feast, and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%4%%But before they lay down, the men of the city, even the men of Sodom, surrounded the house, both old and young, all the people from every quarter:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%5%%And they called to Lot, and said to him, Where are the men who came in to thee this night? bring them out to us, that we may know them.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%7%%And said, I pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%9%%And they said, Stand back. And they said again, This one man came in to sojourn, and he will needs be a judge: Now will we deal worse with thee than with them. And they pressed hard upon the man, Lot, and came near to break the door.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%10%%But the men put forth their hand, and pulled Lot into the house to them, and shut the door.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%11%%And they smote the men that were at the door of the house with blindness, both small and great: so that they wearied themselves to find the door.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%13%%For we will destroy this place, because the cry of them has become great before the face of the LORD; and the LORD hath sent us to destroy it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%14%%And Lot went out and spoke to his sons-in-law, who married his daughters, and said, Arise, depart from this place; for the LORD will destroy this city: but he seemed to his sons-in-law as one that mocked.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%15%%And when the morning arose, then the angels hastened Lot, saying, Arise, take thy wife, and thy two daughters who are here; lest thou be consumed in the iniquity of the city.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%16%%And while he lingered, the men laid hold upon his hand, and upon the hand of his wife, and upon the hand of his two daughters: the LORD being merciful to him: and they brought him forth, and set him without the city.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%17%%And it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad, that he said, Escape for thy life: look not behind thee, neither stay thou in all the plain: escape to the mountain, lest thou be consumed.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%18%%And Lot said to them, Oh, not so, my Lord!
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%19%%Behold now, thy servant hath found grace in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast shown to me in saving my life: and I cannot escape to the mountain, lest some evil should take me, and I die:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%20%%Behold now, this city is near to flee to, and it is a small one: Oh, let me escape thither! (Is it not a small one?) and my soul shall live.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%21%%And he said to him, See, I have accepted thee concerning this thing also, that I will not overthrow this city, for which thou hast spoken.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%22%%Haste thee, escape thither: for I cannot do any thing till thou hast come thither: therefore the name of the city was called Zoar.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%23%%The sun had risen upon the earth when Lot entered into Zoar.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%24%%Then the LORD rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the LORD out of heaven;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%25%%And he overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%26%%But his wife looked back from behind him, and she became a pillar of salt.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%28%%And he looked towards Sodom and Gomorrah, and towards all the land of the plain, and beheld, and lo, the smoke of the country went up as the smoke of a furnace.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%29%%And it came to pass, when God destroyed the cities of the plain, that God remembered Abraham, and sent Lot out of the midst of the overthrow, when he overthrew the cities in which Lot dwelt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%30%%And Lot went up from Zoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he feared to dwell in Zoar: and he dwelt in a cave, he, and his two daughters.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%32%%Come, let us make our father drink wine, and we will lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%33%%And they made their father drink wine that night: and the first-born went in and lay with her father; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%34%%And it came to pass on the morrow that the first born said to the younger, Behold, I lay yesternight with my father; let us make him drink wine this night also; and go thou in, and lie with him, that we may preserve seed of our father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%35%%And they made their father drink wine that night also: and the younger arose and lay with him; and he perceived not when she lay down, nor when she arose.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%19%%36%%Thus were both the daughters of Lot with child by their father.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%20%%4%%But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, Lord, wilt thou also slay a righteous nation?

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%21%%And he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran: and his mother took for him a wife out of the land of Egypt.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%23%%Now therefore swear to me here by God, that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son's son: but according to the kindness that I have done to thee, thou shalt do to me, and to the land in which thou hast sojourned.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%24%%And Abraham said, I will swear.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%28%%And Abraham set seven ewe-lambs of the flock by themselves.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%29%%And Abimelech said to Abraham, What mean these seven ewe-lambs, which thou hast set by themselves?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%30%%And he said, For these seven ewe-lambs shalt thou take from my hand, that they may be a witness to me, that I have digged this well.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%31%%Wherefore he called that place Beer-sheba: because there they swore both of them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%32%%Thus they made a covenant at Beer-sheba: Then Abimelech arose, and Phichol the chief captain of his host, and they returned into the land of the Philistines.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%33%%And Abraham planted a grove in Beer-sheba, and called there on the name of the LORD, the everlasting God.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%21%%34%%And Abraham sojourned in the land of the Philistines many days.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%1%%And it came to pass after these things, that God tempted Abraham, and said to him, Abraham: and he said, Behold, here I am.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%2%%And he said, Take now thy son, thy only son Isaac, whom thou lovest, and go into the land of Moriah; and offer him there for a burnt-offering upon one of the mountains which I will name to thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%3%%And Abraham rose early in the morning, and saddled his ass, and took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son, and cleft the wood for the burnt-offering, and rose and went to the place which God had named to him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%4%%Then on the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place afar off.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%5%%And Abraham said to his young men, Abide you here with the ass, and I and the lad will go yonder and worship, and return to you.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%6%%And Abraham took the wood of the burnt-offering, and laid it upon Isaac his son; and he took the fire in his hand, and a knife: and they went both of them together.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%7%%And Isaac spoke to Abraham his father, and said, My father: and he said, here am I, my son. And he said, Behold the fire and the wood: but where is the lamb for a burnt-offering?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%8%%And Abraham said, My son, God will provide himself a lamb for a burnt-offering: so they went both of them together.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%9%%And they came to the place which God had named to him; and Abraham built an altar there, and laid the wood in order; and bound Isaac his son, and laid him on the altar upon the wood.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%10%%And Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slay his son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%11%%And the angel of the LORD called to him from heaven, and said, Abraham, Abraham. And he said, Here am I.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%12%%And he said, Lay not thy hand upon the lad, neither do thou any thing to him: for now I know that thou fearest God, seeing thou hast not withheld from me thy son, thy only son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%13%%And Abraham lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold, behind him a ram caught in a thicket by his horns: And Abraham went and took the ram, and offered him for a burnt-offering in the stead of his son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%14%%And Abraham called the name of that place Jehovah-jireh: as it is said to this day, In the mount of the LORD it will be seen.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%15%%And the angel of the LORD called to Abraham from heaven the second time,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%16%%And said, By myself have I sworn, saith the LORD, for because thou hast done this thing, and hast not withheld thy son, thy only son:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%17%%That in blessing I will bless thee, and in multiplying I will multiply thy seed as the stars of heaven, and as the sand which is on the sea shore; and thy seed shall possess the gate of his enemies;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%18%%And in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed: because thou hast obeyed my voice.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%19%%So Abraham returned to his young men, and they rose and went together to Beer-sheba; and Abraham dwelt at Beer-sheba.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%20%%And it came to pass after these things, that it was told to Abraham, saying, Behold, Milcah, she hath also borne children to thy brother Nahor;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%21%%Huz his first-born, and Buz his brother, and Kemuel the father of Aram,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%22%%And Chesed, and Hazo, and Pildash, and Jidlaph, and Bethuel.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%22%%24%%And his concubine, whose name was Reumah, she bore also Tebah, and Gaham, and Thahash, and Maachah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%1%%And Sarah was a hundred and twenty-seven years old: these were the years of the life of Sarah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%2%%And Sarah died in Kirjath-arba; the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan: And Abraham came to mourn for Sarah, and to weep for her.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%3%%And Abraham stood up from before his dead, and spoke to the sons of Heth, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%4%%I am a stranger and a sojourner with you; give me a possession of a burying-place with you, that I may bury my dead out of my sight.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%5%%And the children of Heth answered Abraham, saying to him,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%6%%Hear us, my lord; thou art a mighty prince among us: in the choice of our sepulchers bury thy dead: none of us will withhold from thee his sepulcher, but that thou mayest bury thy dead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%7%%And Abraham stood up and bowed himself to the people of the land, to the children of Heth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%8%%And he communed with them, saying, If it is your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight, hear me, and entreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%9%%That he may give me the cave of Machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of his field; for as much money as it is worth he shall give it me, for a possession of a burying-place among you.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%10%%And Ephron dwelt among the children of Heth. And Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the audience of the children of Heth, of all that entered the gates of his city, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%11%%Nay, my lord, hear me: the field give I to thee, and the cave that is in it, I give it to thee; in the presence of the sons of my people I give it to thee: bury thy dead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%12%%And Abraham bowed himself before the people of the land.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%13%%And he spoke to Ephron in the audience of the people of the land, saying, But if thou wilt give it, I pray thee, hear me: I will give thee money for the field: take it of me, and I will bury my dead there.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%14%%And Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%15%%My lord, hearken to me: the land is worth four hundred shekels of silver; what is that betwixt me and thee? bury therefore thy dead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%16%%And Abraham hearkened to Ephron; and Abraham weighed to Ephron the silver which he had named in the audience of the sons of Heth, four hundred shekels of silver, current money with the merchant.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%17%%And the field of Ephron, which was in Machpelah, which was before Mamre, the field and the cave which was in it, and all the trees that were in the field, that were in all the borders round about, were made sure
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%18%%To Abraham for a possession in the presence of the children of Heth, before all that entered the gate of his city.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%19%%And after this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah, before Mamre: the same is Hebron in the land of Canaan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%23%%20%%And the field, and the cave that is in it were made sure to Abraham for a possession of a burying-place, by the sons of Heth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%1%%And Abraham was old and far advanced in age: and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%2%%And Abraham said to his eldest servant of his house, that ruled over all that he had, Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%3%%And I will make thee swear by the LORD, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that thou wilt not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I dwell:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%4%%But thou shalt go to my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son Isaac.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%5%%And the servant said to him, It may be the woman will not be willing to follow me to this land: must I needs bring thy son again to the land from whence thou camest?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%6%%And Abraham said to him, Beware that thou bring not my son thither again.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%7%%The LORD God of heaven, who took me from my father's house, and from the land of my kindred, and who spoke to me, and who swore to me, saying, To thy seed I will give this land: he will send his angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife for my son from thence.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%8%%And if the woman shall not be willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath; only bring not my son thither again.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%9%%And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and swore to him concerning that matter.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%10%%And the servant took ten camels, of the camels of his master, and departed; (for all the goods of his master were in his hands:) and he arose, and went to Mesopotamia, to the city of Nahor.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%11%%And he made his camels to kneel down without the city by a well of water, at the time of the evening, the time when women go out to draw water:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%12%%And he said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, I pray thee, prosper me this day, and show kindness to my master Abraham.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%13%%Behold, I stand here by the well of water; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%14%%And let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say, Let down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink; and she shall say, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy servant Isaac; and by that shall I know that thou hast shown kindness to my master.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%15%%And it came to pass before he had done speaking, that behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%16%%And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%17%%And the servant ran to meet her, and said, Let me, I pray thee, drink a little water from thy pitcher.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%18%%And she said, Drink, my lord. And she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%19%%And when she had done giving him drink, she said, I will draw water for thy camels also, till they have done drinking.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%20%%And she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again to the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%21%%And the man, wondering at her, held his peace, to know whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous, or not.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%22%%And it came to pass as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden ear-ring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%23%%And said, Whose daughter art thou? tell me, I pray thee: is there room in thy father's house for us to lodge in?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%24%%And she said to him, I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, whom she bore to Nahor.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%25%%She said moreover to him, We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%26%%And the man bowed his head, and worshipped the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%27%%And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of my master Abraham, who hath not left my master destitute of his mercy and his truth: I being in the way, the LORD led me to the house of my master's brethren.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%28%%And the damsel ran, and told these things to her mother's house.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%29%%And Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban: and Laban ran out to the man, to the well.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%30%%And it came to pass when he saw the ear-ring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spoke the man to me; that he came to the man; and behold, he stood by the camels at the well.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%31%%And he said, Come in, thou blessed of the LORD; why standest thou without? for I have prepared the house, and room for the camels.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%32%%And the man came into the house: and he ungirded his camels, and gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet, and the men's feet that were with him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%33%%And there was set food before him to eat: but he said, I will not eat, until I have told my errand. And he said, Speak on.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%34%%And he said, I am Abraham's servant.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%35%%And the LORD hath blessed my master greatly, and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks, and herds, and silver, and gold, and men-servants, and maid-servants, and camels, and asses.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%36%%And Sarah, my master's wife, bore a son to my master when she was old: and to him hath he given all that he hath.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%37%%And my master made me swear, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife for my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%38%%But thou shalt go to my father's house, and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%39%%And I said to my master, It may be the woman will not follow me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%40%%And he said to me, The LORD, before whom I walk, will send his angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father's house.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%41%%Then shalt thou be clear from this my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give not thee one, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%42%%And I came this day to the well, and said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, if now thou dost prosper my way which I go:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%43%%Behold, I stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw water, and I say to her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher to drink;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%44%%And she saith to me, Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels: let the same be the woman whom the LORD hath pointed out for my master's son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%45%%And before I had done speaking in my heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down to the well, and drew water: and I said to her, Let me drink, I pray thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%46%%And she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: so I drank, and she made the camels drink also.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%47%%And I asked her, and said, Whose daughter art thou? And she said, The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him: and I put the ear-ring upon her face, and the bracelets upon her hands.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%48%%And I bowed my head, and worshipped the LORD, and blessed the LORD God of my master Abraham, who had led me in the right way to take my master's brother's daughter for his son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%49%%And now if you will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me; and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%50%%Then Laban and Bethuel answered, and said, The thing proceedeth from the LORD: we cannot speak to thee bad or good.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%51%%Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master's son's wife, as the LORD hath spoken.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%52%%And it came to pass, that when Abraham's servant heard their words, he worshipped the LORD, bowing himself to the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%53%%And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah: He gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%54%%And they ate and drank, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose in the morning, and he said, Send me away to my master.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%55%%And her brother and her mother said, Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%56%%And he said to them, Hinder me not, seeing the LORD hath prospered my way: send me away, that I may go to my master.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%57%%And they said, We will call the damsel, and inquire at her mouth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%58%%And they called Rebekah, and said to her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said, I will go.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%59%%And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham's servant, and his men.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%60%%And they blessed Rebekah, and said to her, Thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the gate of those who hate them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%61%%And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man: and the servant took Rebekah, and went his way.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%65%%For she had said to the servant, What man is this that walketh in the field to meet us? And the servant had said, It is my master: therefore she took a vail and covered herself.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%66%%And the servant told Isaac all things that he had done.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%24%%67%%And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah's tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her: and Isaac was comforted after his mother's death.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%1%%Then again Abraham took a wife, and her name was Keturah.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%3%%And Jokshan begat Sheba, and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were Asshurim, and Letushim and Leummim.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%4%%And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abidah, and Eldaah. All these were the children of Keturah.
