1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%6%%But to the sons of the concubines which Abraham had, Abraham gave gifts, and sent them away from Isaac his son (while he yet lived) eastward, to the east country.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%7%%And these are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived, a hundred and seventy five years.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%8%%Then Abraham expired, and died in a good old age, an old man, and full of years; and was gathered to his people.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%10%%The field which Abraham purchased of the sons of Heth: there was Abraham buried, and Sarah his wife.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%19%%And these are the generations of Isaac, Abraham's son: Abraham begat Isaac:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%20%%And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Syrian of Padan-aram, the sister to Laban the Syrian.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%21%%And Isaac entreated the LORD for his wife, because she was barren: and the LORD was entreated of him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%22%%And the children struggled together within her: and she said, If it is so, why am I thus? And she went to inquire of the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%23%%And the LORD said to her, Two nations are in thy womb, and two manner of people shall be separated from thy bowels: and the one people shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall serve the younger.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%24%%And when her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%25%%And the first was born red, all over like a hairy garment: and they called his name Esau.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%26%%And after that his brother was born, and his hand took hold on Esau's heel; and his name was called Jacob: and Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%27%%And the boys grew: and Esau was a skillful hunter, a man of the field; and Jacob was a plain man dwelling in tents.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%28%%And Isaac loved Esau, because he ate of his venison: but Rebekah loved Jacob.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%29%%And Jacob boiled pottage: and Esau came from the field, and he was faint.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%30%%And Esau said to Jacob, Feed me, I pray thee, with that same red pottage; for I am faint: therefore was his name called Edom.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%31%%And Jacob said, Sell to me this day thy birth-right.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%32%%And Esau said, Behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit shall this birth-right bring to me?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%33%%And Jacob said, Swear to me this day; and he swore to him: and he sold his birth-right to Jacob.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%25%%34%%Then Jacob gave Esau bread and pottage of lentiles; and he ate and drank, and rose and went his way: thus Esau despised his birth-right.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%1%%And there was a famine in the land, besides the first famine that was in the days of Abraham. And Isaac went to Abimelech king of the Philistines to Gerar.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%2%%And the LORD appeared to him, and said, Go not down into Egypt: dwell in the land which I shall tell thee of.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%3%%Sojourn in this land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee: for to thee, and to thy seed I will give all these countries, and I will perform the oath which I swore to Abraham thy father;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%4%%And I will make thy seed to multiply as the stars of heaven, and will give to thy seed all these countries: and in thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%5%%Because that Abraham obeyed my voice, and kept my charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%6%%And Isaac dwelt in Gerar:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%7%%And the men of the place asked him of his wife; and he said, She is my sister: for he feared to say, She is my wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for Rebekah; because she was fair to look upon.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%8%%And it came to pass when he had been there a long time, that Abimelech king of the Philistines looked out at a window, and saw, and behold, Isaac was sporting with Rebekah his wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%9%%And Abimelech called Isaac, and said, Behold, surely she is thy wife: and how saidst thou, She is my sister? and Isaac said to him, Because I said, Lest I should die on her account.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%10%%And Abimelech said, What is this thou hast done to us? one of the people might lightly have lain with thy wife, and thou wouldst have brought guiltiness upon us.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%11%%And Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He that toucheth this man or his wife shall surely be put to death.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%12%%Then Isaac sowed in that land, and received in the same year a hundred-fold: and the LORD blessed him:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%13%%And the man became great, and went forward, and grew until he became very great:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%14%%For he had possession of flocks, and possession of herds, and very many servants: And the Philistines envied him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%15%%For all the wells which his father's servants had digged in the days of Abraham his father, the Philistines had stopped them, and filled them with earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%16%%And Abimelech said to Isaac, Go from us: for thou art much mightier than we.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%17%%And Isaac departed thence, and pitched his tent in the valley of Gerar, and dwelt there.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%18%%And Isaac digged again the wells of water which they had digged in the days of Abraham his father; for the Philistines had stopped them after the death of Abraham: and he called their names after the names by which his father had called them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%19%%And Isaac's servants digged in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%20%%And the herdmen of Gerar contended with Isaac's herdmen, saying, The water is ours: and he called the name of the well Esek; because they strove with him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%21%%And they digged another well, and contended for that also: and he called the name of it Sitnah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%22%%And he removed from thence, and digged another well; and for that they did not contend: and he called the name of it Rehoboth; and he said, For now the LORD hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful in the land.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%23%%And he went up from thence to Beer-sheba.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%24%%And the LORD appeared to him the same night, and said, I am the God of Abraham thy father: fear not, for I am with thee, and will bless thee, and multiply thy seed for my servant Abraham's sake.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%25%%And he built an altar there, and called upon the name of the LORD, and pitched his tent there: and there Isaac's servants digged a well.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%26%%Then Abimelech went to him from Gerar, and Ahuzzath one of his friends, and Phichol the chief captain of his army.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%27%%And Isaac said to them, Why come ye to me, seeing ye hate me, and have sent me away from you?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%28%%And they said, We saw certainly that the LORD was with thee: and we said, Let there be now an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a covenant with thee;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%29%%That thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not touched thee, and as we have done to thee nothing but good, and have sent thee away in peace: thou art now the blessed of the LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%30%%And he made them a feast, and they ate and drank.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%31%%And they rose betimes in the morning, and swore one to another: and Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%32%%And it came to pass the same day, that Isaac's servants came and told him concerning the well which they had digged, and said to him, We have found water.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%33%%And he called it Shebah: therefore the name of the city is Beer-sheba to this day.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%34%%And Esau was forty years old when he took for a wife Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite, and Bashemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%26%%35%%Who were a grief of mind to Isaac and Rebekah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%1%%And it came to pass, that when Isaac was old, and his eyes were dim, so that he could not see, he called Esau his eldest son, and said to him, My son: and he said to him, Behold, here am I.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%2%%And he said, Behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my death:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%3%%Now therefore take, I pray thee, thy weapons, thy quiver and thy bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%4%%And make me savory meat, such as I love, and bring it to me, that I may eat; that my soul may bless thee before I die.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%5%%And Rebekah heard when Isaac spoke to Esau his son; and Esau went to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%6%%And Rebekah spoke to Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard thy father speak to Esau thy brother, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%7%%Bring me venison, and make me savory meat, that I may eat, and bless thee before the LORD, before my death.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%8%%Now therefore, my son, obey my voice, according to that which I command thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%9%%Go now to the flock, and bring me from thence two good kids of the goats; and I will make them savory meat for thy father, such as he loveth:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%10%%And thou shalt bring it to thy father, that he may eat, and that he may bless thee before his death.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%11%%And Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%12%%My father perhaps will feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a curse upon me, and not a blessing.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%13%%And his mother said to him, upon me be thy curse, my son; only obey my voice, and go, bring them to me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%14%%And he went, and took, and brought them to his mother: and his mother made savory meat, such as his father loved.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%15%%And Rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son Esau, which was with her in the house, and put it upon Jacob her younger son:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%16%%And she put the skins of the kids of the goats on his hands, and on the smooth part of his neck:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%17%%And she gave the savory meat, and the bread which she had prepared, into the hand of her son Jacob.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%18%%And he came to his father, and said, My father: And he said, Here am I; who art thou, my son?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%19%%And Jacob said to his father, I am Esau thy first-born; I have done according as thou badest me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thy soul may bless me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%20%%And Isaac said to his son, How is it that thou hast found it so quickly, my son? And he said, Because the LORD thy God brought it to me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%21%%And Isaac said to Jacob, Come near, I pray thee, that I may feel thee, my son, whether thou art my very son Esau, or not.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%22%%And Jacob went near to Isaac his father; and he felt him, and said, The voice is Jacob's voice, but the hands are the hands of Esau.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%23%%And he discerned him not, because his hands were hairy, as his brother Esau's hands: So he blessed him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%24%%And he said, Art thou my very son Esau? And he said, I am.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%25%%And he said, bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's venison, that my soul may bless thee. And he brought it near to him, and he ate: and he brought him wine, and he drank.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%26%%And his father Isaac said to him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%27%%And he came near, and kissed him: and he smelled the smell of his raiment, and blessed him, and said, See, the smell of my son is as the smell of a field which the LORD hath blessed:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%28%%Therefore God give thee of the dew of heaven, and the fatness of the earth, and plenty of corn and wine:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%29%%Let people serve thee, and nations bow down to thee; be lord over thy brethren, and let thy mother's sons bow down to thee: cursed be every one that curseth thee, and blessed be he that blesseth thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%30%%And it came to pass, as soon as Isaac had made an end of blessing Jacob, and Jacob had yet scarcely gone out from the presence of Isaac his father, that Esau his brother came in from his hunting.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%31%%And he also had made savory meat, and brought it to his father; and said to his father, Let my father arise, and eat of his son's venison, that thy soul may bless me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%32%%And Isaac his father said to him, Who art thou? And he said, I am thy son, thy first-born Esau.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%33%%And Isaac trembled exceedingly, and said, Who? where is he that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before thou camest, and have blessed him? yea, and he shall be blessed.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%35%%And he said, Thy brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away thy blessing.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%36%%And he said, Is he not rightly named Jacob? for he hath supplanted me twice: he took away my birth-right; and behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. And he said, Hast thou not reserved a blessing for me?

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%40%%And by thy sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve thy brother: and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the dominion, that thou shalt break his yoke from off thy neck.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%41%%And Esau hated Jacob, because of the blessing with which his father blessed him: and Esau said in his heart, The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother Jacob.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%42%%And these words of Esau her elder son were told to Rebekah: and she sent and called Jacob her younger son, and said to him, Behold, thy brother Esau, as concerning thee, doth comfort himself, purposing to kill thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%43%%Now therefore, my son, obey my voice: and arise, flee thou to Laban my brother to Haran;

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%27%%45%%Till thy brother's anger shall turn away from thee, and he shall forget that which thou hast done to him: then I will send, and bring thee from thence. Why should I be deprived also of you both in one day?

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%14%%And Rachel and Leah answered, and said to him, Is there yet any portion or inheritance for us in our father's house?

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%16%%For all the riches which God hath taken from our father, that is ours, and our children's: now then whatever God hath said to thee, do.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%17%%Then Jacob arose, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%18%%And he carried away all his cattle, and all his goods which he had gained, the cattle of his getting, which he had gained in Padan-aram; to go to Isaac, his father, in the land of Canaan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%19%%And Laban went to shear his sheep; and Rachel had stolen the images that were her father's.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%20%%And Jacob stole away unawares to Laban the Syrian, in that he told him not that he was about to depart.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%21%%So he fled with all that he had; and he arose, and passed over the river, and set his face towards the mount Gilead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%22%%And it was told Laban on the third day that Jacob had fled.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%23%%And he took his brethren with him, and pursued after him seven days' journey: and they overtook him in the mount Gilead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%24%%And God came to Laban, the Syrian, in a dream by night, and said to him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%25%%Then Laban overtook Jacob. Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the mount: and Laban, with his brethren, pitched in the mount of Gilead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%26%%And Laban said to Jacob, What hast thou done, that thou hast stolen away unawares to me, and carried away my daughters, as captives taken with the sword?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%27%%Why didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me, and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%28%%And hast not suffered me to kiss my sons, and my daughters? thou hast now done foolishly in so doing.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%29%%It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the God of your father spoke to me yesternight, saying, Take thou heed that thou speak not to Jacob either good or bad.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%30%%And now, though thou wouldest needs be gone, because thou didst earnestly long after thy father's house; yet why hast thou stolen my gods?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%31%%And Jacob answered and said to Laban, Because I was afraid: for I said, It may be thou wouldest take thy daughters from me by force.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%32%%With whomsoever thou findest thy gods, let him not live: before our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee: for Jacob knew not that Rachel had stolen them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%33%%And Laban went into Jacob's tent, and into Leah's tent, and into the two maid-servants' tents; but he found them not. Then he went out of Leah's tent, and entered into Rachel's tent.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%34%%Now Rachel had taken the images, and put them in the camel's furniture, and sat upon them. And Laban searched all the tent, but found them not.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%35%%And she said to her father, Let it not displease my lord that I cannot rise up before thee; for the custom of women is upon me. And he searched, but found not the images.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%36%%And Jacob was wroth, and chid with Laban: and Jacob answered, and said to Laban, What is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast so eagerly pursued after me?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%37%%Whereas thou hast searched all my stuff, what hast thou found of all thy household-stuff? set it here before my brethren, and thy brethren, that they may judge betwixt us both.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%38%%These twenty years have I been with thee: thy ewes and thy she-goats have not cast their young, and the rams of thy flock have I not eaten.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%39%%That which was torn by beasts, I brought not to thee; I bore the loss of it; of my hand didst thou require it, whether stolen by day, or stolen by night.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%40%%Thus I was; in the day the drouth consumed me, and the frost by night; and my sleep departed from my eyes.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%41%%Thus have I been twenty years in thy house: I served thee fourteen years for thy two daughters, and six years for thy cattle: and thou hast changed my wages ten times.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%42%%Except the God of my father, the God of Abraham, and the fear of Isaac had been with me, surely thou hadst now sent me away empty. God hath seen my affliction, and the labor of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%43%%And Laban answered, and said to Jacob, These daughters are my daughters, and these children are my children, and these cattle are my cattle, and all that thou seest is mine; and what can I do this day to these my daughters, or to their children which they have borne?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%44%%Now therefore come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and let it be for a witness between me and thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%45%%And Jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%46%%And Jacob said to his brethren, Gather stones; and they took stones, and made a heap: and they ate there upon the heap.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%47%%And Laban called it Jegar-sahadutha: but Jacob called it Galeed:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%48%%And Laban said, This heap is a witness between me and thee this day. Therefore was the name of it called Galeed:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%49%%And Mizpah; for he said, The LORD watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from another.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%50%%If thou shalt afflict my daughters, or if thou shalt take other wives besides my daughters; no man is with us; See, God is witness betwixt me and thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%51%%And Laban said to Jacob, Behold this heap, and behold this pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%31%%52%%This heap be witness, and this pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over this heap and this pillar to me, for harm.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%3%%And Jacob sent messengers before him to Esau his brother, to the land of Seir, the country of Edom.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%4%%And he commanded them, saying, Thus shall ye speak to my lord Esau: Thy servant Jacob saith thus, I have sojourned with Laban, and stayed there till now:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%5%%And I have oxen, and asses, flocks, and men-servants, and women-servants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that I may find grace in thy sight.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%6%%And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, We came to thy brother Esau, and also he is coming to meet thee, and four hundred men with him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%7%%Then Jacob was greatly afraid, and distressed: and he divided the people that were with him, and the flocks, and herds, and camels, into two bands;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%8%%And said, If Esau shall come to the one company, and smite it, then the other company which is left, will escape.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%9%%And Jacob said, O God of my father Abraham, and God of my father Isaac, the LORD who saidst to me, Return to thy country, and to thy kindred, and I will deal well with thee;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%10%%I am not worthy of the least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast shown to thy servant: for with my staff I passed over this Jordan, and now I am become two bands.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%11%%Deliver me, I pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the hand of Esau: for I fear him, lest he shall come and smite me, and the mother with the children.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%12%%And thou saidst, I will surely do thee good, and make thy seed as the sand of the sea, which cannot be numbered for multitude.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%15%%Thirty milch camels with their colts, forty cows and ten bulls, twenty she-asses and ten foals.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%16%%And he delivered them into the hand of his servants, every drove by themselves; and said to his servants, Pass over before me, and put a space betwixt drove and drove.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%17%%And he commanded the foremost, saying, When Esau, my brother, meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying, Whose art thou? and whither goest thou? and whose are these before thee?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%18%%Then thou shalt say, They are thy servant Jacob's: it is a present sent to my lord Esau: and behold also he is behind us.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%19%%And so he commanded the second, and the third, and all that followed the droves, saying, In this manner shall ye speak to Esau, when ye find him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%20%%And say ye moreover, Behold, thy servant Jacob is behind us. For he said, I will appease him with the present that goeth before me, and afterward I will see his face; peradventure he will accept of me.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%25%%And when he saw that he prevailed not against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh: and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was out of joint, as he wrestled with him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%32%%26%%And he said, Let me go, for the day breaketh; And he said, I will not let thee go, except thou bless me.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%1%%And Dinah the daughter of Leah, which she bore to Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%3%%And his soul cleaved to Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spoke kindly to the damsel.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%4%%And Shechem spoke to his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel for a wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%5%%And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter (now his sons were with his cattle in the field:) and Jacob held his peace till they had come.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%6%%And Hamor the father of Shechem went out to Jacob to commune with him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%7%%And the sons of Jacob came from the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in Israel, in lying with Jacob's daughter; which thing ought not to be done.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%8%%And Hamor communed with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem longeth for your daughter: I pray you give her to him for a wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%9%%And make ye marriages with us: give your daughters to us, and take our daughters to you.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%10%%And ye shall dwell with us: and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%11%%And Shechem said to her father, and to her brethren, Let me find favor in your eyes, and what ye shall say to me, I will give.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%12%%Ask me never so much dower and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say to me: but give me the damsel for a wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%13%%And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully, and said, (because he had defiled Dinah their sister,)
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%14%%And they said to them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised: for that would be a reproach to us:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%15%%But in this will we consent to you: If ye will be as we are, that every male of you shall be circumcised;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%16%%Then will we give our daughters to you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%17%%But if ye will not hearken to us, to be circumcised; then will we take our daughter, and we will be gone.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%18%%And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor's son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%19%%And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob's daughter: and he was more honorable than all the house of his father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%20%%And Hamor and Shechem his son came to the gate of their city, and communed with the men of their city, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%21%%These men are peaceable with us, therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein: for the land, behold, it is large enough for them: let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%22%%Only herein, will the men consent to us to dwell with us, to be one people, if every male among us shall be circumcised, as they are circumcised.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%23%%Will not their cattle, and their substance, and every beast of theirs be ours? only let us consent to them, and they will dwell with us.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%24%%And to Hamor and to Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city: and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%25%%And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the city boldly, and slew all the males.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%26%%And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went out.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%27%%The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and spoiled the city; because they had defiled their sister.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%28%%They took their sheep, and their oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the city, and that which was in the field.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%34%%29%%And all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their wives they took captive, and spoiled even all that was in the house.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%1%%Now these are the generations of Esau, who is Edom.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%3%%And Bashemath, Ishmael's daughter, sister of Nebajoth.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%5%%And Aholibamah bore Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah: These are the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%6%%And Esau took his wives, and his sons, and his daughters, and all the persons of his house, and his cattle, and all his beasts, and all his substance which he had acquired in the land of Canaan; and went into the country from the face of his brother Jacob.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%7%%For their riches were more than that they might dwell together: and the land wherein they were strangers could not sustain them, because of their cattle.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%8%%Thus dwelt Esau in mount Seir: Esau is Edom.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%9%%And these are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites, in mount Seir:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%10%%These are the names of Esau's sons; Eliphaz the son of Adah the wife of Esau, Reuel the son of Bashemath the wife of Esau.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%11%%And the sons of Eliphaz were, Teman, Omar, Zepho, and Gatam, and Kenaz.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%13%%And these are the sons of Reuel; Nahath, and Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah: these were the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%14%%And these were the sons of Aholibamah, the daughter of Anah, the daughter of Zibeon Esau's wife: and she bore to Esau, Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%16%%Duke Korah, duke Gatam, and duke Amalek: these are the dukes, descendants of Eliphaz, in the land of Edom: these were the sons of Adah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%17%%And these are the sons of Reuel Esau's son; duke Nahath, duke Zerah, duke Shammah, duke Mizzah: these are the dukes, descendants of Reuel, in the land of Edom: these are the sons of Bashemath Esau's wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%18%%And these are the sons of Aholibamah Esau's wife; duke Jeush, duke Jaalam, duke Korah: these were the dukes, descendants of Aholibamah the daughter of Anah Esau's wife.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%21%%And Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan: these are the dukes of the Horites, the children of Seir in the land of Edom.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%22%%And the children of Lotan were Hori, and Heman: and Lotan's sister was Timna.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%23%%And the children of Shobal were these; Alvan, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%24%%And these are the children of Zibeon; both Ajah and Anah; this was that Anah that found the mules in the wilderness, as he fed the asses of Zibeon his father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%25%%And the children of Anah were these; Dishon, and Aholibamah the daughter of Anah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%26%%And these are the children of Dishon; Hemdan, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%27%%The children of Ezer are these; Bilhan, and Zaavan, and Achan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%28%%The children of Dishan are these; Uz, and Aran.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%29%%These are the dukes, descendants of the Horites; duke Lotan, duke Shobal, duke Zibeon, duke Anah,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%30%%Duke Dishon, duke Ezer, duke Dishan; these are the dukes, descendants of Hori, among their dukes in the land of Seir.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%31%%And these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%32%%And Bela the son of Beor reigned in Edom: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%33%%And Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%34%%And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of Temani reigned in his stead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%35%%And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad (who smote Midian in the field of Moab) reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%36%%And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%37%%And Samlah died, and Saul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%38%%And Saul died, and Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%39%%And Baal-hanan the son of Achbor died, and Hadar reigned in his stead; and the name of his city was Pau; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%40%%And these are the names of the dukes, descendants of Esau, according to their families, after their places, by their names; duke Timnah, duke Alvah, duke Jetheth,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%36%%41%%Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%1%%And Jacob dwelt in the land in which his father was a stranger, in the land of Canaan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%2%%These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph being seventeen years old, was feeding the flock with his brethren, and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah, and with the sons of Zilpah, his father's wives: and Joseph brought to his father their evil report.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%3%%Now Israel loved Joseph more than all his children, because he was the son of his old age: and he made him a coat of many colors.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%4%%And when his brethren saw that their father loved him more than all his brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably to him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%5%%And Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brethren: and they hated him yet the more.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%6%%And he said to them, Hear, I pray you, this dream which I have dreamed:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%7%%For behold, we were binding sheaves in the field, and lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and behold, your sheaves stood around and made obeisance to my sheaf.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%8%%And his brethren said to him, Shalt thou indeed reign over us? or shalt thou indeed have dominion over us? and they hated him yet the more for his dreams and for his words.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%9%%And he dreamed yet another dream, and told it to his brethren, and said, Behold, I have dreamed a dream more: and behold, the sun and the moon and the eleven stars made obeisance to me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%10%%And he told it to his father, and to his brethren: and his father rebuked him, and said to him, what is this dream that thou hast dreamed? Shall I and thy mother and thy brethren indeed come to bow down ourselves to thee to the earth?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%11%%And his brethren envied him; but his father observed the saying.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%12%%And his brethren went to feed their father's flock in Shechem.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%13%%And Israel said to Joseph, Do not thy brethren feed the flock in Shechem? Come, and I will send thee to them. And he said to him, Here am I.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%14%%And he said to him, Go, I pray thee, see whether it is well with thy brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he sent him from the vale of Hebron, and he came to Shechem.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%15%%And a certain man found him, and behold he was wandering in the field: and the man asked him, saying, What seekest thou?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%16%%And he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed their flocks.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%17%%And the man said, They have departed hence: for I heard them say, Let us go to Dothan. And Joseph went after his brethren and found them in Dothan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%18%%And when they saw him afar off, even before he came near to them, they conspired against him to slay him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%19%%And they said one to another, Behold, this dreamer is coming.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%20%%Come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some pit; and we will say, Some evil beast hath devoured him; and we shall see what will become of his dreams.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%21%%And Reuben heard it, and he delivered him from their hands: and said, Let us not kill him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%22%%And Reuben said to them, Shed no blood; cast him into this pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might deliver him from their hands, to bring him back to his father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%23%%And it came to pass when Joseph had come to his brethren, that they stripped Joseph of his coat, his coat of many colors that was on him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%24%%And they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the pit was empty; there was no water in it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%25%%And they sat down to eat bread: and they lifted up their eyes and looked, and behold, a company of Ishmaelites came from Gilead, with their camels bearing spicery, and balm, and myrrh, going to carry them down to Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%26%%And Judah said to his brethren, What profit is it if we slay our brother, and conceal his blood.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%27%%Come, and let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our brother, our flesh: and his brethren were content.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%28%%Then there passed by Midianites, merchants; and they drew and lifted Joseph out of the pit, and sold Joseph to the Ishmaelites for twenty pieces of silver: and they brought Joseph into Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%29%%And Reuben returned to the pit; and behold, Joseph was not in the pit: and he rent his clothes.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%30%%And he returned to his brethren, and said, The child is not: and I, whither shall I go?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%31%%And they took Joseph's coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%32%%And they sent the coat of many colors, and they brought it to their father; and said, This have we found: know now whether it is thy son's coat or not.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%33%%And he knew it, and said, It is my son's coat; an evil beast hath devoured him: Joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%34%%And Jacob rent his clothes, and put sackcloth on his loins, and mourned for his son many days.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%35%%And all his sons and all his daughters rose up to comfort him; but he refused to be comforted; and he said, For I will go down into the grave to my son mourning: Thus his father wept for him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%37%%36%%And the Midianites sold him into Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%1%%And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%2%%And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name was Shuah; and he took her, and went in to her.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%3%%And she conceived, and bore a son; and he called his name Er.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%4%%And she conceived again, and bore a son; and she called his name Onan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%5%%And she yet again conceived, and bore a son; and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bore him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%6%%And Judah took a wife for Er his first-born, whose name was Tamar.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%7%%And Er, Judah's first-born, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD slew him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%8%%And Judah said to Onan, Go in to thy brother's wife, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%9%%And Onan knew that the seed would not be his: and it came to pass, when he went in to his brother's wife, that he frustrated the purpose, lest he should give seed to his brother.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%10%%And the thing which he did displeased the LORD: wherefore he slew him also.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%11%%Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter-in-law, Remain a widow at thy father's house, till Shelah my son shall be grown; (for he said, Lest perhaps he die also as his brethren did:) and Tamar went and dwelt in her father's house.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%12%%And in process of time, the daughter of Shuah Judah's wife died: and Judah was comforted, and went up to his sheep-shearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%13%%And it was told to Tamar, saying, Behold, thy father-in-law goeth up to Timnath, to shear his sheep.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%14%%And she put off from her, her widow's garments, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to Timnath: for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given to him for a wife.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%15%%When Judah saw her, he thought her to be a harlot; because she had covered her face.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%16%%And he turned to her by the way, and said, Come, I pray thee, let me have access to thee; (for he knew not that she was his daughter-in-law:) and she said, What wilt thou give me, that thou mayst have access to me?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%17%%And he said, I will send thee a kid from the flock: and she said, Wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou sendest it?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%18%%And he said, What pledge shall I give thee? and she said, Thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thy hand: and he gave them to her, and came in to her, and she conceived by him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%19%%And she arose and went her way and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%20%%And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman's hand: but he found her not.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%21%%Then he asked the men of that place, saying, where is the harlot that was openly by the way-side? and they said, There was no harlot in this place.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%22%%And he returned to Judah, and said, I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%23%%And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%24%%And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told to Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter-in-law hath played the harlot; and also, behold she is with child by lewdness: and Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%25%%When she was brought forth, she sent to her father-in-law, saying, By the man whose these are, am I with child: and she said, Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%26%%And Judah acknowledged them, and said She hath been more righteous than I; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son: and he knew her again no more.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%27%%And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that behold, twins were in her womb.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%28%%And it came to pass when she travailed, that the one put out his hand; and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%29%%And it came to pass as he drew back his hand, that behold, his brother came out; and she said, How hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called Pharez.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%38%%30%%And afterwards came out his brother that had the scarlet thread upon his hand; and his name was called Zarah.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%1%%And Joseph was brought down to Egypt: and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, captain of the guard, an Egyptian, bought him of the hands of the Ishmaelites, who had brought him down thither.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%2%%And the LORD was with Joseph, and he was a prosperous man: and he was in the house of his master the Egyptian.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%3%%And his master saw that the LORD was with him, and that the LORD made all that he did to prosper in his hand.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%4%%And Joseph found grace in his sight, and he served him: and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%5%%And it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer in his house, and over all that he had, that the LORD blessed the Egyptian's house for Joseph's sake: and the blessing of the LORD was on all that he had in the house, and in the field.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%6%%And he left all that he had in Joseph's hand; and he knew not aught he had, save the bread which he ate; and Joseph was a goodly person, and well favored.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%7%%And it came to pass after these things, that his master's wife cast her eyes upon Joseph: and she said, Lie with me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%8%%But he refused, and said to his master's wife, Behold, my master knoweth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed all that he hath to my hand:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%9%%There is none greater in his house than I; neither hath he kept back any thing from me but thee, because thou art his wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%10%%And it came to pass, as she spoke to Joseph day by day, that he hearkened not to her, to lie by her, or to be with her.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%11%%And it came to pass, about this time, that Joseph went into the house to do his business; and there was none of the men of the house there within.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%12%%And she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with me: and he left his garment in her hand, and fled, and went out.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%13%%And it came to pass, when she saw that he had left his garment in her hand, and had fled forth,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%14%%That she called to the men of her house, and spoke to them, saying, See, he hath brought in a Hebrew to us to mock us: he came in to me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%15%%And it came to pass, when he heard that I raised my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled, and went out.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%16%%And she laid up his garment by her until his lord came home.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%17%%And she spoke to him according to these words, saying, The Hebrew servant, which thou hast brought to us, came in to me to mock me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%18%%And it came to pass, as I raised my voice and cried, that he left his garment with me, and fled.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%19%%And it came to pass, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spoke to him, saying, After this manner did thy servant to me; that his wrath was kindled.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%20%%And Joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, a place where the king's prisoners were bound: and he was there in the prison.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%21%%But the LORD was with Joseph, and showed him mercy, and gave him favor in the sight of the keeper of the prison.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%22%%And the keeper of the prison committed to Joseph's hand all the prisoners that were in the prison; and whatever they did there, was done by him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%39%%23%%The keeper of the prison looked not to any thing that was under his hand; because the LORD was with him: and that which he did the LORD made it to prosper.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%1%%And it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the king of Egypt and his baker had offended their lord the king of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%2%%And Pharaoh was wroth with two of his officers, with the chief of the butlers, and with the chief of the bakers.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%3%%And he put them in custody in the house of the captain of the guard, into the prison, the place where Joseph was bound.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%4%%And the captain of the guard charged Joseph with them, and he served them; and they continued a season in custody.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%5%%And they dreamed a dream both of them, each man his dream in one night, each man according to the interpretation of his dream; the butler and the baker of the king of Egypt, who were bound in the prison.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%6%%And Joseph came to them in the morning, and looked upon them, and behold, they were sad.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%7%%And he asked Pharaoh's officers that were with him in the ward of his lord's house, saying, Why look ye so sad to-day?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%8%%And they said to him, We have dreamed a dream, and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said to them, Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them, I pray you.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%9%%And the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, In my dream, behold, a vine was before me;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%10%%And on the vine were three branches: and it was as though it budded, and its blossoms shot forth; and its clusters brought forth ripe grapes:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%11%%And Pharaoh's cup was in my hand: and I took the grapes, and pressed them into Pharaoh's cup, and I gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%12%%And Joseph said to him, This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%13%%Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head, and restore thee to thy place: and thou shalt deliver Pharaoh's cup into his hand, after the former manner when thou wast his butler.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%14%%But think on me when it shall be well with thee, and show kindness to me, I pray thee, and make mention of me to Pharaoh, and bring me out of this house:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%15%%For indeed I was stolen away from the land of the Hebrews: and here also have I done nothing that they should put me into the dungeon.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%16%%When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was good, he said to Joseph, I also was in my dream, and behold, I had three white baskets on my head:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%17%%And in the uppermost basket there was of all manner of bake-meats for Pharaoh; and the birds ate them out of the basket upon my head.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%18%%And Joseph answered, and said, This is the interpretation of it: The three baskets are three days:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%19%%Yet within three days shall Pharaoh lift up thy head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a tree; and the birds shall eat thy flesh from off thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%20%%And it came to pass the third day, which was Pharaoh's birth-day, that he made a feast to all his servants: and he lifted up the head of the chief butler and of the chief baker among his servants.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%21%%And he restored the chief butler to his butlership again; and he gave the cup into Pharaoh's hand:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%22%%But he hanged the chief baker: as Joseph had interpreted to them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%40%%23%%Yet the chief butler did not remember Joseph, but forgot him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%1%%And it came to pass at the end of two full years, that Pharaoh dreamed: and behold, he stood by the river.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%2%%And behold, there came up out of the river seven well-favored cows and fat-fleshed; and they fed in a meadow.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%3%%And behold, seven other cows came up after them out of the river, ill-favored and lean-fleshed; and stood by the other cows upon the brink of the river.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%4%%And the ill-favored and lean-fleshed cows ate up the seven well-favored and fat cows. So Pharaoh awoke.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%5%%And he slept and dreamed the second time: and behold, seven ears of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%6%%And behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%7%%And the seven thin ears devoured the seven rank and full ears. And Pharaoh awoke, and behold, it was a dream.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%8%%And it came to pass in the morning, that his spirit was troubled; and he sent and called for all the magicians of Egypt, and all the wise men thereof: and Pharaoh told them his dream; but there was none that could interpret them to Pharaoh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%9%%Then spoke the chief butler to Pharaoh, saying, I do remember my faults this day:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%10%%Pharaoh was wroth with his servants, and put me in custody in the captain of the guard's house, both me, and the chief baker:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%11%%And we dreamed a dream in one night, I and he: we dreamed each man according to the interpretation of his dream.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%12%%And there was there with us a young man, a Hebrew, servant to the captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpreted to us our dreams; to each man according to his dream he interpreted.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%13%%And it came to pass, as he interpreted to us, so it was: me he restored to my office, and him he hanged.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%14%%Then Pharaoh sent and called Joseph, and they brought him hastily out of the dungeon: and he shaved himself, and changed his raiment, and came before Pharaoh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%15%%And Pharaoh said to Joseph, I have dreamed a dream, and there is none that can interpret it: and I have heard it said of thee, that thou canst understand a dream to interpret it.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%16%%And Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It is not in me: God will give Pharaoh an answer of peace.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%17%%And Pharaoh said to Joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood upon the bank of the river:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%18%%And behold, there came out of the river seven cows, fat-fleshed, and well-favored; and they fed in a meadow:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%19%%And behold, seven other cows came out after them, poor, and very ill-favored, and lean-fleshed, such as I never saw in all the land of Egypt for badness:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%20%%And the lean and the ill-favored cows ate up the first seven fat cows:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%21%%And when they had eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but they were still ill-favored, as at the beginning. So I awoke.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%22%%And I saw in my dream, and behold, seven ears came up on one stalk, full and good:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%23%%And behold, seven ears, withered, thin, and blasted with the east wind, sprung up after them:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%24%%And the thin ears devoured the seven good ears: and I told this to the magicians; but there was none that could explain it to me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%25%%And Joseph said to Pharaoh, The dream of Pharaoh is one; God hath showed Pharaoh what he is about to do.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%26%%The seven good cows are seven years; and the seven good ears are seven years: the dream is one.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%27%%And the seven thin and ill-favored cows that came up after them are seven years; and the seven empty ears blasted with the east wind will be seven years of famine.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%28%%This is the thing which I have spoken to Pharaoh: What God is about to do he showeth to Pharaoh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%29%%Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%30%%And there shall arise after them seven years of famine; and all the plenty shall be forgotten in the land of Egypt; and the famine shall consume the land;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%31%%And the plenty shall not be known in the land by reason of the famine following: for it will be very grievous.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%32%%And for that the dream was doubled to Pharaoh twice; it is because the thing is established by God, and God will shortly bring it to pass.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%33%%Now therefore let Pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and set him over the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%34%%Let Pharaoh do this, and let him appoint officers over the land, and take up the fifth part of the land of Egypt in the seven plenteous years.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%35%%And let them gather all the food of those good years that come, and lay up corn under the hand of Pharaoh; and let them keep food in the cities.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%36%%And that food shall be for store to the land against the seven years of famine, which shall be in the land of Egypt; that the land may not perish through the famine.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%37%%And the thing was good in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of all his servants.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%38%%And Pharaoh said to his servants, Can we find such a man as this is, a man in whom the spirit of God is?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%39%%And Pharaoh said to Joseph, Forasmuch as God hath shown thee all this, there is none so discreet and wise as thou art:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%40%%Thou shalt be over my house, and according to thy word shall all my people be ruled: only in the throne will I be greater than thou.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%41%%And Pharaoh said to Joseph, See, I have set thee over all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%42%%And Pharaoh took off his ring from his hand, and put it upon Joseph's hand, and arrayed him in vestures of fine linen, and put a gold chain about his neck;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%43%%And he made him to ride in the second chariot which he had: and they cried before him, Bow the knee: and he made him ruler over all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%44%%And Pharaoh said to Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without thee shall no man lift up his hand or foot in all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%45%%And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphnath-paaneah; and he gave him for a wife Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah priest of On: and Joseph went over all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%46%%And Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt: and Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%47%%And in the seven plenteous years the earth brought forth by handfulls.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%48%%And he gathered all the food of the seven years which were in the land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field which was around every city, he laid up in the same.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%49%%And Joseph gathered corn as the sand of the sea, very much, until he left numbering; for it was without number.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%50%%And to Joseph were born two sons before the years of famine came: which Asenath the daughter of Poti-pherah priest of On bore to him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%51%%And Joseph called the name of the first-born Manasseh: For God, said he, hath made me forget all my toil, and all my father's house.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%52%%And the name of the second called he Ephraim: for God hath caused me to be fruitful in the land of my affliction.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%53%%And the seven years of plenteousness that was in the land of Egypt, were ended.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%54%%And the seven years of dearth began to come, according as Joseph had said: and the dearth was in all lands; but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%55%%And when all the land of Egypt was famished, the people cried to Pharaoh for bread: and Pharaoh said to all the Egyptians, Go to Joseph; what he saith to you, do.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%56%%And the famine was over all the face of the earth; and Joseph opened all the store-houses, and sold to the Egyptians; and the famine became severe in the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%41%%57%%And all countries came into Egypt to Joseph to buy corn; because the famine was distressing in all lands.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%1%%Now when Jacob saw that there was corn in Egypt, Jacob said to his sons, Why do ye look one upon another?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%2%%And he said, Behold, I have heard that there is corn in Egypt: go down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%3%%And Joseph's ten brethren went down to buy corn in Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%4%%But Benjamin, Joseph's brother, Jacob sent not with his brethren: for he said, Lest perhaps mischief shall befall him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%5%%And the sons of Israel came to buy corn among those that came: for the famine was in the land of Canaan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%6%%And Joseph was the governor over the land, and he it was that sold to all the people of the land: and Joseph's brethren came, and bowed themselves before him with their faces to the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%7%%And Joseph saw his brethren, and he knew them, but made himself strange to them, and spoke roughly to them; and he said to them, Whence come ye? And they said, From the land of Canaan to buy food.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%8%%And Joseph knew his brethren, but they knew not him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%9%%And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said to them, Ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land have ye come.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%10%%And they said to him, No, my lord, but to buy food have thy servants come.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%11%%We are all one man's sons; we are true men; thy servants are no spies.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%12%%And he said to them, No, but to see the nakedness of the land have ye come.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%13%%And they said, Thy servants are twelve brethren, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is not.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%14%%And Joseph said to them, That is what I spoke to you, saying, Ye are spies:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%15%%By this ye shall be proved: By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest brother shall come hither.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%16%%Send one of you, and let him bring your brother, and ye shall be kept in prison, that your words may be proved, whether there is any truth in you: or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye are spies.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%17%%And he put them all together into custody three days.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%18%%And Joseph said to them the third day, This do, and live; for I fear God:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%19%%If ye are true men, let one of your brethren be bound in the house of your prison: go ye, carry corn for the famine of your houses:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%20%%But bring your youngest brother to me; so shall your words be verified, and ye shall not die. And they did so.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%21%%And they said one to another, We are verily guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the anguish of his soul, when he besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%22%%And Reuben answered them, saying, Did I not speak to you, saying, Do not sin against the young man; and ye would not hear? therefore behold also his blood is required.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%23%%And they knew not that Joseph understood them; for he spoke to them by an interpreter.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%24%%And he turned himself away from them, and wept; and returned to them again, and communed with them, and took from them Simeon, and bound him before their eyes.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%25%%Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn, and to restore every man's money into his sack, and to give them provision for the way: and thus did he to them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%26%%And they loaded their asses with the corn, and departed thence.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%27%%And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn, he espied his money: for behold, it was in his sack's mouth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%28%%And he said to his brethren, My money is restored; and see it is even in my sack: and their heart failed them, and they were afraid, saying one to another, What is this that God hath done to us?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%29%%And they came to Jacob their father to the land of Canaan, and told him all that befell them, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%30%%The man who is the lord of the land, spoke roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%31%%And we said to him, We are true men; we are no spies:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%32%%We are twelve brethren, sons of our father: one is not, and the youngest is this day with our father in the land of Canaan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%33%%And the man, the lord of the country, said to us, By this shall I know that ye are true men: leave one of your brethren here with me, and take food for the famine of your households, and depart:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%34%%And bring your youngest brother to me: then shall I know that ye are no spies, but that ye are true men: then will I deliver to you your brother, and ye shall traffick in the land.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%35%%And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that behold, every man's bundle of money was in his sack; and when they and their father saw the bundles of money, they were afraid.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%36%%And Jacob their father said to them, Me have ye bereaved: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin away: all these things are against me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%37%%And Reuben spoke to his father, saying, Slay my two sons, if I bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand, and I will bring him to thee again.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%38%%And he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief shall befall him by the way in which ye go, then will ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%42%%39%%And the famine was severe in the land.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%1%%And it came to pass, when they had consumed the corn which they had brought from Egypt, their father said to them, Go again, buy us a little food.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%2%%And Judah spoke to him, saying, The man did solemnly protest to us, saying, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%3%%If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy thee food:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%4%%But if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down, for the man said to us, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with you.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%5%%And Israel said, Why dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell the man whether ye had yet a brother?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%6%%And they said, The man asked us strictly concerning our state, and our kindred, saying, Is your father yet alive? have ye another brother? and we told him according to the tenor of these words: Could we certainly know that he would say, Bring your brother down?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%7%%And Judah said to Israel, his father, Send the lad with me, and we will arise and go; that we may live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our little ones.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%8%%I will be surety for him; of my hand shalt thou require him: if I bring him not to thee, and set him before thee, then let me bear the blame for ever:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%9%%For except we had delayed, surely now we had returned this second time.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%10%%And their father Israel said to them, If it must be so now, do this; take of the best fruits in the land in your vessels, and carry to the man a present, a little balm, and a little honey, spices, and myrrh, nuts, and almonds:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%11%%And take double money in your hand; and the money that was returned in the mouth of your sacks, carry it again in your hand; it may be it was an oversight:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%12%%Take also your brother, and arise, go again to the man:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%13%%And God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may send away your other brother, and Benjamin: If I be bereaved, I am bereaved.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%14%%And the men took that present, and they took double money in their hand, and Benjamin; and arose, and went down to Egypt, and stood before Joseph.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%15%%And when Joseph saw Benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of his house, Bring these men home, and slay, and make ready: for these men shall dine with me at noon.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%16%%And the man did as Joseph commanded: and the man brought the men into Joseph's house.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%17%%And the men were afraid, because they were brought into Joseph's house; and they said, Because of the money that was returned in our sacks at the first time, are we brought in; that he may seek occasion against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bond-men, and our asses.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%18%%And they came near to the steward of Joseph's house, and they communed with him at the door of the house,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%19%%And said, O sir, we came down indeed at the first time to buy food:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%20%%And it came to pass, when we came to the inn, that we opened our sacks, and behold, every man's money was in the mouth of his sack, our money in full weight: and we have brought it again in our hand.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%21%%And other money have we brought down in our hands to buy food: we cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%22%%And he said, Peace be to you, fear not: your God, and the God of your father, hath given you treasure in your sacks: I had your money. And he brought Simeon out to them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%23%%And the man brought the men into Joseph's house, and gave them water, and they washed their feet; and he gave their asses provender.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%24%%And they made ready the present against Joseph should come at noon: for they heard that they should eat bread there.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%25%%And when Joseph came home, they brought him the present which was in their hand into the house, and bowed themselves to him to the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%26%%And he asked them of their welfare, and said, Is your father well, the old man of whom ye spoke? Is he yet alive?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%27%%And they answered, Thy servant, our father, is in good health, he is yet alive: and they bowed their heads and made obeisance.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%28%%And he lifted up his eyes, and saw his brother Benjamin, his mother's son, and said, Is this your younger brother, of whom ye spoke to me? And he said, God be gracious to thee, my son.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%29%%And Joseph made haste; for his bowels yearned towards his brother: and he sought where to weep; and he entered into his chamber, and wept there.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%30%%And he washed his face, and went out, and refrained himself, and said, Set on bread.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%31%%And they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians who ate with him, by themselves; because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews; for that is an abomination to the Egyptians.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%32%%And they sat before him, the first-born according to his birth-right, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men wondered one at another.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%43%%33%%And he took and sent messes to them from before him: but Benjamin's mess was five times so much as any of theirs. And they drank, and were merry with him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%1%%And he commanded the steward of his house, saying, Fill the men's sacks with food, as much as they can carry, and put every man's money in his sack's mouth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%2%%And put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack's mouth of the youngest, and his corn money: and he did according to the word that Joseph had spoken.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%3%%As soon as the morning was light, the men were sent away, they, and their asses.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%4%%And when they had gone out of the city, and were not yet far off, Joseph said to his steward, Arise, follow after the men; and when thou dost overtake them, say to them, Why have ye rewarded evil for good?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%5%%Is not this the cup in which my lord drinketh, and by which indeed he divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%6%%And he overtook them, and he spoke to them these same words.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%7%%And they said to him, Why saith my lord these words? Far be it from us that thy servants should do according to this thing:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%8%%Behold, the money which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought again to thee from the land of Canaan: how then should we steal from thy lord's house silver or gold?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%9%%With whom soever of thy servants it shall be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord's bond-men.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%10%%And he said, Now also let it be according to your words: he with whom it shall be found, shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%11%%Then they speedily took down every man his sack to the ground, and opened every man his sack.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%12%%And he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the youngest: and the cup was found in Benjamin's sack.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%13%%Then they rent their clothes, and loaded every man his ass, and returned to the city.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%14%%And Judah and his brethren came to Joseph's house, (for he was yet there:) and they fell before him on the ground.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%15%%And Joseph said to them, What deed is this that ye have done? knew ye not that such a man as I can certainly divine?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%16%%And Judah said, What shall we say to my lord? what shall we speak? or how shall we clear ourselves? God hath found out the iniquity of thy servants: behold we are my lord's servants, both we, and he also with whom the cup is found.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%17%%And he said, Far be it from me that I should do so: the man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you, go in peace to your father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%18%%Then Judah came near to him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord's ears, and let not thy anger burn against thy servant; for thou art even as Pharaoh.
