1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%20%%And we said to my lord, We have a father, an old man, and a child of his old age, a little one: and his brother is dead, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loveth him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%21%%And thou saidst to thy servants, Bring him down to me, that I may set my eyes upon him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%22%%And we said to my lord, The lad cannot leave his father; for if he should leave his father, his father would die.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%23%%And thou saidst to thy servants, Except your youngest brother shall come down with you, ye shall see my face no more.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%24%%And it came to pass, when we came to thy servant, my father, we told him the words of my lord.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%25%%And our father said, Go again; buy us a little food.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%26%%And we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother shall be with us, then will we go down; for we may not see the man's face, except our youngest brother shall be with us.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%27%%And thy servant my father, said to us, Ye know that my wife bore me two sons:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%28%%And the one went out from me, and I said, Surely he is torn in pieces; and I have not seen him since:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%29%%And if ye take this also from me, and mischief shall befall him, ye will bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%30%%Now therefore, when I come to thy servant my father, and the lad is not with us; (seeing that his life is bound up in the lad's life)
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%31%%It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with us, that he will die: and thy servants will bring down the gray hairs of thy servant our father, with sorrow to the grave.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%32%%For thy servant became surety for the lad to my father, saying, If I bring him not to thee, then I will bear the blame to my father for ever.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%33%%Now therefore, I pray thee, let thy servant abide instead of the lad, a bond-man to my lord; and let the lad return with his brethren.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%44%%34%%For how shall I return to my father, and the lad be not with me? lest perhaps I see the evil that shall come on my father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%1%%Then Joseph could not refrain himself before all them that stood by him; and he cried, Cause every man to go out from me: and there stood no man with him, while Joseph made himself known to his brethren.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%2%%And he wept aloud; and the Egyptians and the house of Pharaoh heard.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%3%%And Joseph said to his brethren, I am Joseph; doth my father yet live? And his brethren could not answer him; for they were troubled at his presence.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%4%%And Joseph said to his brethren, Come near to me, I pray you: and they came near. And he said, I am Joseph your brother, whom ye sold into Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%5%%Now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither; for God sent me before you to preserve life.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%6%%For these two years hath the famine been in the land: and yet there are five years, in which there shall neither be tillage nor harvest.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%7%%And God sent me before you, to preserve for you a posterity in the earth, and to save your lives by a great deliverance.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%8%%So now it was not you that sent me hither, but God: and he hath made me a father to Pharaoh, and lord of all his house, and a ruler throughout all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%9%%Haste ye, and return to my father, and say to him, Thus saith thy son Joseph, God hath made me lord of all Egypt; come down to me; delay not:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%10%%And thou shalt dwell in the land of Goshen, and thou shalt be near to me, thou, and thy children, and thy children's children, and thy flocks, and thy herds, and all that thou hast:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%11%%And there will I nourish thee, (for yet there are five years of famine,) lest thou, and thy household, and all that thou hast, should come to poverty.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%12%%And behold, your eyes see, and the eyes of my brother Benjamin, that it is my mouth that speaketh to you.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%13%%And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that ye have seen: and ye shall haste, and bring down my father hither.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%14%%And he fell upon his brother Benjamin's neck, and wept; and Benjamin wept upon his neck.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%16%%And the fame of this was heard in Pharaoh's house, saying, Joseph's brethren are come: and it pleased Pharaoh well, and his servants.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%17%%And Pharaoh said to Joseph, Say to thy brethren, This do ye; load your beasts, and go, return to the land of Canaan;
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%18%%And take your father, and your households, and come to me: and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and ye shall eat the fat of the land.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%19%%Now thou art commanded, this do ye; take for yourselves wagons from the land of Egypt for your little ones, and for your wives, and bring your father, and come.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%20%%Also regard not your furniture; for the good of all the land of Egypt is yours.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%23%%And to his father he sent after this manner; ten asses laden with the good things of Egypt, and ten she-asses laden with corn and bread and meat, for his father by the way.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%24%%So he sent his brethren away, and they departed: and he said to them, See that ye contend not by the way.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%25%%And they went up from Egypt, and came into the land of Canaan, to Jacob their father,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%26%%And told him, saying, Joseph is yet alive, and he is governor over all the land of Egypt. And Jacob's heart fainted, for he believed them not.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%27%%And they told him all the words of Joseph, which he had said to them: and when he saw the wagons which Joseph had sent to carry him, the spirit of Jacob their father revived:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%45%%28%%And Israel said, It is enough; Joseph my son is yet alive: I will go and see him before I die.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%1%%And Israel took his journey with all that he had, and came to Beer-sheba, and offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%4%%I will go down with thee into Egypt; and I will also surely bring thee up again: and Joseph shall put his hand upon thine eyes.

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%28%%And he sent Judah before him to Joseph, to direct his face to Goshen; and they came into the land of Goshen.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%29%%And Joseph made ready his chariot, and went to meet Israel his father to Goshen; and presented himself to him: and he fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%30%%And Israel said to Joseph, Now let me die, since I have seen thy face, because thou art yet alive.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%31%%And Joseph said to his brethren, and to his father's house, I will go up, and show Pharaoh, and say to him, My brethren, and my father's house, who were in the land of Canaan are come to me.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%32%%And the men are shepherds, for their employment hath been to feed cattle; and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%33%%And it shall come to pass, when Pharaoh shall call you, and shall say, What is your occupation?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%46%%34%%That ye shall say, The occupation of thy servants hath been about cattle from our youth even until now, both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination to the Egyptians.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%1%%Then Joseph came and told Pharaoh, and said, My father and my brethren, and their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have, have come from the land of Canaan; and behold, they are in the land of Goshen.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%2%%And he took some of his brethren, even five men, and presented them to Pharaoh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%3%%And Pharaoh said to his brethren, What is your occupation? And they said to Pharaoh, Thy servants are shepherds, both we, and also our fathers.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%4%%They said moreover to Pharaoh, We have come to sojourn in the land: for thy servants have no pasture for their flocks, for the famine is severe in the land of Canaan: now therefore, we pray thee, let thy servants dwell in the land of Goshen.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%5%%And Pharaoh spoke to Joseph, saying, Thy father and thy brethren have come to thee:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%6%%The land of Egypt is before thee; in the best of the land make thy father and brethren to dwell; in the land of Goshen let them dwell; and if thou knowest any men of activity among them, then make them rulers over my cattle.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%7%%And Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and set him before Pharaoh: and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%8%%And Pharaoh said to Jacob, How old art thou?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%9%%And Jacob said to Pharaoh, The days of the years of my pilgrimage are a hundred and thirty years: few and evil have been the days of the years of my life, nor have they attained to the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%10%%And Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from before Pharaoh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%11%%And Joseph placed his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%12%%And Joseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father's household, with bread according to their families.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%13%%And there was no bread in all the land; for the famine was very distressing, so that the land of Egypt, and all the land of Canaan, fainted by reason of the famine.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%14%%And Joseph gathered all the money that was found in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, for the corn which they bought: and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh's house.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%15%%And when money failed in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph, and said, Give us bread: for why should we die in thy presence: for the money faileth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%16%%And Joseph said, Give your cattle; and I will give you for your cattle, if money hath failed.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%17%%And they brought their cattle to Joseph: and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for horses, and for the flocks, and for the cattle of the herds, and for the asses; and he fed them with bread, for all their cattle, for that year.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%18%%When that year was ended, they came to him the second year, and said to him, We will not hide from my lord, how that our money is spent; my lord also hath our herds of cattle; there is not aught left in the sight of my lord, but our bodies and our lands:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%19%%Why shall we die before thy eyes, both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants to Pharaoh: and give us seed, that we may live, and not die, that the land be not desolate.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%20%%And Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh; for the Egyptians sold every man his field, because the famine prevailed over them: so the land became Pharaoh's.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%21%%And as for the people, he removed them to cities from one end of the borders of Egypt even to the other end thereof.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%22%%Only the land of the priests bought he not; for the priests had a portion assigned them by Pharaoh, and ate their portion which Pharaoh gave them: wherefore they sold not their lands.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%23%%Then Joseph said to the people, Behold, I have bought you this day and your land for Pharaoh: lo, here is seed for you, and ye shall sow the land.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%24%%And it shall come to pass in the increase, that ye shall give the fifth part to Pharaoh, and four parts shall be your own, for seed of the field, and for your food, and for them of your households, and for food for your little ones.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%25%%And they said, Thou hast saved our lives: let us find grace in the sight of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh's servants.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%26%%And Joseph made it a law over the land of Egypt to this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth part; except the land of the priests only, which became not Pharaoh's.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%27%%And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt, in the country of Goshen; and they had possessions in it and grew, and multiplied exceedingly.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%28%%And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years: so the whole age of Jacob was a hundred and forty seven years.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%29%%And the time drew nigh that Israel must die: and he called his son Joseph, and said to him, If now I have found grace in thy sight, put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh, and deal kindly and truly with me; bury me not, I pray thee, in Egypt:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%30%%But I will lie with my fathers, and thou shalt carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their burying-place. And he said, I will do as thou hast said.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%47%%31%%And he said, Swear to me: and he swore to him. And Israel bowed himself upon the bed's head.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%1%%And it came to pass after these things, that one told Joseph, Behold, thy father is sick: and he took with him his two sons, Manasseh and Ephraim.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%2%%And one told Jacob, and said, Behold, thy son Joseph cometh to thee: and Israel strengthened himself, and sat upon the bed.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%3%%And Jacob said to Joseph, God Almighty appeared to me at Luz, in the land of Canaan, and blessed me,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%4%%And said to me, Behold I will make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, and I will make of thee a multitude of people; and will give this land to thy seed after thee, for an everlasting possession.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%5%%And now, thy two sons, Ephraim and Manasseh, who were born to thee in the land of Egypt, before I came to thee into Egypt, are mine; as Reuben and Simeon, they shall be mine.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%6%%And thy issue, which thou begettest after them, shall be thine, and shall be called after the name of their brethren in their inheritance.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%7%%And as for me, when I came from Padan, Rachel died by me in the land of Canaan, in the way, when yet there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and I buried her there in the way of Ephrath, the same is Beth-lehem.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%8%%And Israel beheld Joseph's sons, and said, Who are these?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%9%%And Joseph said to his father, They are my sons, whom God hath given me in this place. And he said, Bring them, I pray thee, to me, and I will bless them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%10%%(Now the eyes of Israel were dim for age, so that he could not see:) And he brought them near to him; and he kissed them, and embraced them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%11%%And Israel said to Joseph, I had not thought to see thy face: and lo, God hath shown me also thy seed.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%12%%And Joseph brought them out from between his knees, and he bowed himself with his face to the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%13%%And Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand towards Israel's left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand towards Israel's right hand, and brought them near to him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%14%%And Israel stretched out his right hand, and laid it upon Ephraim's head, who was the younger, and his left hand upon Manasseh's head, guiding his hands by design; for Manasseh was the first-born.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%15%%And he blessed Joseph, and said, God, before whom my fathers Abraham and Isaac did walk, the God who hath fed me all my life long to this day,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%16%%The angel who hath redeemed me from all evil, bless the lads; and let my name be named on them, and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac: and let them grow into a multitude in the midst of the earth.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%17%%And when Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand upon the head of Ephraim, it displeased him: and he lifted his father's hand, to remove it from Ephraim's head to Manasseh's head.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%18%%And Joseph said to his father, Not so, my father; for this is the first-born; put thy right hand upon his head.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%19%%And his father refused, and said, I know it, my son, I know it; he also shall become a people, and he also shall be great; but truly his younger brother shall be greater than he, and his seed shall become a multitude of nations.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%20%%And he blessed them that day, saying, In thee shall Israel bless, saying, God make thee as Ephraim and as Manasseh: and he set Ephraim before Manasseh.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%21%%And Israel said to Joseph, Behold, I die; but God shall be with you, and bring you again to the land of your fathers.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%48%%22%%Moreover I have given to thee one portion above thy brethren, which I took out of the hand of the Amorite with my sword and with my bow.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%1%%And Jacob called to his sons, and said, Assemble yourselves, that I may tell you that which shall befall you in the last days.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%2%%Assemble yourselves, and hear, ye sons of Jacob: and hearken to Israel your father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%3%%Reuben, thou art my first-born, my might, and the beginning of my strength, the excellence of dignity, and the excellence of power:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%4%%Unstable as water, thou shalt not excel; because thou wentest up to thy father's bed; then defiledst thou it; he went up to my couch.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%5%%Simeon and Levi are brethren: instruments of cruelty are in, their habitations.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%6%%O my soul, come not thou into their secret; to their assembly, my honor, be not thou united: for in their anger they slew a man, and in their self-will they digged down a wall.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%7%%Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce: and their wrath, for it was cruel: I will divide them in Jacob, and scatter them in Israel.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%8%%Judah, thou art he whom thy brethren shall praise; thy hand shall be on the neck of thy enemies: thy father's children shall bow down before thee.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%9%%Judah is a lion's whelp; from the prey, my son, thou hast gone up: he stooped down, he couched as a lion, and as an old lion: who shall rouse him up?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%10%%The scepter shall not depart from Judah, nor a lawgiver from between his feet, until Shiloh shall come: and to him shall be the gathering of the people.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%11%%Binding his foal to the vine, and his ass's colt to the choice vine; he washed his garments in wine, and his clothes in the blood of grapes:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%12%%His eyes shall be red with wine, and his teeth white with milk.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%13%%Zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea; and he shall be for a haven of ships; and his border shall be to Zidon.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%14%%Issachar is a strong ass, couching down between two burdens:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%15%%And he saw that rest was good, and the land that it was pleasant; and bowed his shoulder to bear, and became a servant to tribute.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%16%%Dan shall judge his people, as one of the tribes of Israel.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%17%%Dan shall be a serpent by the way, an adder in the path, that biteth the horse-heels, so that his rider shall fall backward.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%18%%I have waited for thy salvation O LORD.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%19%%Gad, a troop shall overcome him: but he shall overcome at the last.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%20%%Out of Asher his bread shall be fat, and he shall yield royal dainties.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%21%%Naphtali is a hind let loose: he giveth goodly words.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%22%%Joseph is a fruitful bough, even a fruitful bough by a well; whose branches run over the wall:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%23%%The archers have sorely grieved him, and shot at him, and hated him:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%24%%But his bow abode in strength, and the arms of his hands were made strong by the hands of the mighty God of Jacob: from thence is the shepherd the stone of Israel:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%25%%Even by the God of thy father, who shall help thee, and by the Almighty, who shall bless thee with blessings of heaven above, blessings of the deep that lieth beneath, blessings of the breasts, and of the womb:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%26%%The blessings of thy father have prevailed above the blessings of my progenitors to the utmost bound of the everlasting hills; they shall be on the head of Joseph, and on the crown of the head of him that was separate from his brethren.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%27%%Benjamin shall raven as a wolf: in the morning he shall devour the prey, and at night he shall divide the spoil.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%28%%All these are the twelve tribes of Israel: and this is it which their father spoke to them, and blessed them; every one according to his blessing he blessed them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%29%%And he charged them, and said to them, I am to be gathered to my people: bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%30%%In the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought with the field of Ephron the Hittite for a possession of a burying-place.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%49%%31%%(There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife; there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife; and there I buried Leah,)

1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%1%%And Joseph fell upon his father's face, and wept upon him, and kissed him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%2%%And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father: and the physicians embalmed Israel.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%3%%And forty days were fulfilled for him; (for so are fulfilled the days of those who are embalmed:) and the Egyptians mourned for him seventy days.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%4%%And when the days of his mourning were past, Joseph spoke to the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found grace in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%5%%My father made me swear, saying, Lo, I die: in my grave which I have digged for me in the land of Canaan, there shalt thou bury me. Now therefore let me go, I pray thee, and bury my father, and I will come again.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%6%%And Pharaoh said, Go up, and bury thy father, according as he made thee swear.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%7%%And Joseph went up to bury his father: and with him went all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, and all the elders of the land of Egypt,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%8%%And all the house of Joseph, and his brethren, and his father's house: only their little ones, and their flocks, and their herds they left in the land of Goshen.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%9%%And there went with him both chariots and horsemen: and it was a very great company.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%10%%And they came to the threshing-floor of Atad, which is beyond Jordan, and there they mourned with a great and very sore lamentation: and he made a mourning for his father seven days.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%11%%And when the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, saw the mourning in the floor of Atad, they said, This is a grievous mourning to the Egyptians: wherefore the name of it was called Abel-mizraim, which is beyond Jordan.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%12%%And his sons did to him according as he commanded them:
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%13%%For his sons carried him into the land of Canaan, and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, which Abraham bought with the field for a possession of a burying-place of Ephron the Hittite, before Mamre.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%14%%And Joseph returned to Egypt, he and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%15%%And when Joseph's brethren saw that their father was dead, they said, Joseph will perhaps hate us, and will certainly requite us all the evil which we did to him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%16%%And they sent messengers to Joseph, saying, Thy father commanded before he died, saying,
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%17%%So shall ye say to Joseph, Forgive, I pray thee now, the trespass of thy brethren, and their sin; for they did to thee evil: and now, we pray thee, forgive the trespass of the servants of the God of thy father. And Joseph wept when they spoke to him.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%18%%And his brethren also went and fell down before his face: and they said, Behold, we are thy servants.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%19%%And Joseph said to them, Fear not: for am I in the place of God?
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%20%%But as for you, ye thought evil against me; but God meant it for good, to bring to pass, as it is this day, to save many people alive.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%21%%Now therefore fear ye not: I will nourish you, and your little ones. And he comforted them, and spoke kindly to them.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%22%%And Joseph dwelt in Egypt, he, and his father's house: and Joseph lived a hundred and ten years.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%23%%And Joseph saw Ephraim's children of the third generation: the children also of Machir, the son of Manasseh, were brought up upon Joseph's knees.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%24%%And Joseph said to his brethren, I die: and God will surely visit you, and bring you out of this land, to the land which he swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%25%%And Joseph took an oath of the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you, and ye shall carry up my bones from hence.
1000005%%Genesis%%OT%%50%%26%%So Joseph died, being a hundred and ten years old: and they embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%1%%Now these are the names of the children of Israel, who came into Egypt; every man and his household came with Jacob.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%2%%Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%3%%Issachar, Zebulun, and Benjamin,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%4%%Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%5%%And all the souls that descended from Jacob, were seventy souls: for Joseph was in Egypt already.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%6%%And Joseph died, and all his brethren, and all that generation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%7%%And the children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and became exceeding mighty; and the land was filled with them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%8%%Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who knew not Joseph.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%9%%And he said to his people, Behold, the people of the children of Israel are more and mightier than we.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%10%%Come, let us deal wisely with them: lest they multiply, and it shall come to pass, that when there falleth out any war, they will join with our enemies, and fight against us, and depart from the land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%11%%Therefore they set over them task-masters, to afflict them with their burdens. And they built for Pharaoh treasure-cities, Pithom, and Raamses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%12%%But the more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and grew. And they were grieved because of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%13%%And the Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigor.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%14%%And they made their lives bitter with hard bondage, in mortar, and in brick, and in all manner of service in the field: all their service in which they made them serve, was with rigor.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%15%%And the king of Egypt spoke to the Hebrew midwives (of which the name of one was Shiphrah, and the name of the other Puah:)
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%16%%And he said, When ye do the office of a midwife to the Hebrew women, and see them upon the stools; if it shall be a son, then ye shall kill him; but if it shall be a daughter, then she shall live.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%17%%But the midwives feared God, and did not as the king of Egypt commanded them, but saved the male-children alive.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%18%%And the king of Egypt called for the midwives, and said to them, Why have ye done this thing, and have saved the male-children alive?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%19%%And the midwives said to Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women are not as the Egyptian women: for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives come in to them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%20%%Therefore God dealt well with the midwives: and the people multiplied, and became very mighty.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%21%%And it came to pass, because the midwives feared God, that he made them houses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%1%%22%%And Pharaoh charged all his people, saying, Every son that is born ye shall cast into the river, and every daughter ye shall save alive.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%1%%And there went a man of the house of Levi, and married a daughter of Levi.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%2%%And the woman conceived, and bore a son: and when she saw him that he was a goodly child, she hid him three months.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%3%%And when she could no longer hide him, she took for him an ark of bulrushes, and daubed it with slime and with pitch, and put the child therein; and she laid it in the flags by the river's brink.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%4%%And his sister stood afar off, to know what would be done to him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%5%%And the daughter of Pharaoh came down to wash herself at the river, and her maidens walked along by the river's side: and when she saw the ark among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%6%%And when she had opened it, she saw the child: and behold, the babe wept. And she had compassion on him, and said, This is one of the Hebrews' children.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%7%%Then said his sister to Pharaoh's daughter, Shall I go, and call to thee a nurse of the Hebrew women, that she may nurse the child for thee?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%8%%And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Go. And the maid went and called the child's mother.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%9%%And Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Take this child away and nurse it for me, and I will give thee thy wages. And the woman took the child and nursed it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%10%%And the child grew, and she brought him to Pharaoh's daughter, and he became her son. And she called his name Moses: and she said, Because I drew him out of the water.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%11%%And it came to pass in those days, when Moses was grown, that he went out to his brethren, and looked on their burdens: and he spied an Egyptian smiting a Hebrew, one of his brethren.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%12%%And he looked this way and that way, and when he saw that there was no man, he slew the Egyptian, and hid him in the sand.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%13%%And when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the Hebrews strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong, Why smitest thou thy fellow?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%14%%And he said, Who made thee a prince and a judge over us? intendest thou to kill me, as thou killedst the Egyptian? And Moses feared, and said, Surely this thing is known.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%15%%Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian: and he sat down by a well.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%16%%Now the priest of Midian had seven daughters: and they came and drew water, and filled the troughs to water their father's flock.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%17%%And the shepherds came and drove them away: but Moses stood up and helped them, and watered their flock.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%18%%And when they came to Reuel their father, he said, How is it that you are come so soon to day?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%19%%And they said, An Egyptian delivered us from the hand of the shepherds, and also drew water enough for us, and watered the flock.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%20%%And he said to his daughters, And where is he? why is it that ye have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%21%%And Moses was content to dwell with the man: and he gave Moses Zipporah his daughter.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%22%%And she bore him a son, and he called his name Gershom: for he said, I have been a stranger in a strange land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%23%%And it came to pass in process of time, that the king of Egypt died: and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage, and they cried; and their cry ascended to God, by reason of the bondage.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%24%%And God heard their groaning, and God remembered his covenant with Abraham, with Isaac, and with Jacob.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%2%%25%%And God looked upon the children of Israel, and God had respect to them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%1%%Now Moses kept the flock of Jethro his father-in-law, the priest of Midian: and he led the flock to the backside of the desert, and came to the mountain of God, even to Horeb.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%2%%And the angel of the LORD appeared to him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and behold, the bush burned with fire, and the bush was not consumed.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%3%%And Moses said, I will now turn aside, and see this great sight, why the bush is not burnt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%4%%And when the LORD saw that he turned aside to see, God called to him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses, Moses. And he said, Here am I.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%5%%And he said, Approach not hither: put off thy shoes from thy feet, for the place on which thou standest is holy ground.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%6%%Moreover he said, I am the God of thy father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. And Moses hid his face: for he was afraid to look upon God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%7%%And the LORD said, I have surely seen the affliction of my people who are in Egypt, and have heard their cry by reason of their task-masters; for I know their sorrows;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%8%%And I am come down to deliver them from the hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them out of that land, to a good land, and a large, to a land flowing with milk and honey; to the place of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%9%%Now therefore, behold, the cry of the children of Israel is come to me: and I have also seen the oppression with which the Egyptians oppress them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%10%%Come now therefore, and I will send thee to Pharaoh, that thou mayest bring forth my people the children of Israel out of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%11%%And Moses said to God, Who am I, that I should go to Pharaoh, and that I should bring forth the children of Israel out of Egypt?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%12%%And he said, Certainly I will be with thee; and this shall be a token to thee, that I have sent thee: When thou hast brought forth the people out of Egypt, ye shall serve God upon this mountain.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%13%%And Moses said to God, Behold, when I come to the children of Israel, and shall say to them, The God of your fathers hath sent me to you; and they shall say to me, What is his name? What shall I say to them?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%14%%And God said to Moses, I AM THAT I AM: And he said, Thus shalt thou say to the children of Israel, I AM hath sent me to you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%15%%And God said, moreover, to Moses, Thus shalt thou say to the children of Israel, The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath sent me to you: this is my name for ever, and this is my memorial to all generations.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%16%%Go and assemble the elders of Israel, and say to them, The LORD God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob, appeared to me, saying, I have surely visited you, and seen that which is done to you in Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%17%%And I have said, I will bring you out of the affliction of Egypt to the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, to a land flowing with milk and honey.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%18%%And they shall hearken to thy voice: and thou shalt come, thou and the elders of Israel, to the king of Egypt, and ye shall say to him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath met with us: and now let us go (we beseech thee) three days journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%19%%And I am sure that the king of Egypt will not let you go, no, not by a mighty hand.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%20%%And I will stretch out my hand, and smite Egypt with all my wonders which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will let you go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%21%%And I will give this people favor in the sight of the Egyptians: and it shall come to pass, that when ye go, ye shall not go empty:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%3%%22%%But every woman shall borrow of her neighbor, and of her that dwelleth in her house, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment: and ye shall put them upon your sons, and upon your daughters: and ye shall spoil the Egyptians.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%1%%And Moses answered and said, But behold, they will not believe me, nor hearken to my voice: for they will say, The LORD hath not appeared to thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%2%%And the LORD said to him, What is that in thy hand? And he said, A rod.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%3%%And he said, Cast it on the ground. And he cast it on the ground, and it became a serpent: and Moses fled from before it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%4%%And the LORD said to Moses, Put forth thy hand, and take it by the tail. And he put forth his hand, and caught it, and it became a rod in his hand:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%5%%That they may believe that the LORD God of their fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob, hath appeared to thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%6%%And the LORD said furthermore to him, Put now thy hand into thy bosom. And he put his hand into his bosom: and when he took it out, behold, his hand was leprous as snow.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%7%%And he said, Put thy hand into thy bosom again. And he put his hand into his bosom again, and drew it out of his bosom, and behold, it was turned again as his other flesh.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%8%%And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe thee, neither hearken to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%9%%And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe also these two signs, neither hearken to thy voice, that thou shalt take of the water of the river, and pour it upon the dry land: and the water which thou takest out of the river shall become blood upon the dry land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%10%%And Moses said to the LORD, O my Lord, I am not eloquent, neither heretofore, nor since thou hast spoke to thy servant: but I am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%11%%And the LORD said to him, Who hath made man's mouth? or who maketh the dumb, or deaf, or the seeing, or the blind? have not I the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%12%%Now therefore go, and I will be with thy mouth, and teach thee what thou shalt say.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%13%%And he said, O my Lord, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him whom thou wilt send.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%14%%And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Moses, and he said, Is not Aaron the Levite thy brother? I know that he can speak well. And also behold, he cometh forth to meet thee: and when he seeth thee, he will be glad in his heart.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%15%%And thou shalt speak to him, and put words in his mouth: and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%16%%And he shall speak for thee to the people: and he shall be, even he shall be to thee instead of a mouth, and thou shalt be to him instead of God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%17%%And thou shalt take this rod in thy hand, with which thou shalt perform signs.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%18%%And Moses went and returned to Jethro his father-in-law, and said to him, Let me go, I pray thee, and return to my brethren who are in Egypt, and see whether they are yet alive. And Jethro said to Moses, Go in peace.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%19%%And the LORD said to Moses in Midian, Go, return into Egypt; for all the men are dead who sought thy life.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%20%%And Moses took his wife, and his sons, and set them upon an ass, and he returned to the land of Egypt. And Moses took the rod of God in his hand.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%21%%And the LORD said to Moses, When thou goest to return into Egypt, see that thou perform all those wonders before Pharaoh which I have put in thy hand: but I will harden his heart, that he shall not let the people go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%22%%And thou shalt say to Pharaoh, Thus saith the LORD, Israel is my son, even my first-born.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%23%%And I say to thee, Let my son go, that he may serve me: and if thou shalt refuse to let him go, behold, I will slay thy son, even thy first-born.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%24%%And it came to pass by the way in the inn, that the LORD met him, and sought to kill him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%25%%Then Zipporah took a sharp stone, and cut off the foreskin of her son, and cast it at his feet, and said, Surely a bloody husband art thou to me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%26%%So he let him go: then she said, A bloody husband thou art, because of the circumcision.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%27%%And the LORD said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. And he went, and met him in the mount of God, and kissed him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%28%%And Moses told Aaron all the words of the LORD who had sent him, and all the signs which he had commanded him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%29%%And Moses and Aaron went, and assembled all the elders of the children of Israel:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%30%%And Aaron spoke all the words which the LORD had spoken to Moses, and performed the signs in the sight of the people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%4%%31%%And the people believed: and when they heard that the LORD had visited the children of Israel, and that he had looked upon their affliction, then they bowed their heads, and worshiped.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%1%%And afterward Moses and Aaron went in, and told Pharaoh, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a feast to me in the wilderness.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%2%%And Pharaoh said, Who is the LORD, that I should obey his voice to let Israel go? I know not the LORD, neither will I let Israel go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%3%%And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrifice to the LORD our God; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the sword.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%4%%And the king of Egypt said to them, Why do ye, Moses and Aaron, hinder the people from their works; go you to your burdens.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%5%%And Pharaoh said, Behold, the people of the land now are many, and ye make them rest from their burdens.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%6%%And Pharaoh commanded the same day the task-masters of the people, and their officers, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%7%%Ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick, as heretofore; let them go and gather straw for themselves.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%8%%And the number of the bricks which they made heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish aught thereof; for they are idle: therefore they cry, saying, Let us go and sacrifice to our God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%9%%Let more work be laid upon the men, that they may labor therein: and let them not regard vain words.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%10%%And the task-masters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spoke to the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will not give you straw.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%11%%Go ye, get you straw where ye can find it: yet not aught of your work shall be diminished.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%12%%So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt, to gather stubble instead of straw.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%13%%And the task-masters hastened them, saying, Fulfill your works, your daily tasks, as when there was straw.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%14%%And the officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh's task-masters had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, Why have ye not fulfilled your task in making brick, both yesterday and to-day, as heretofore?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%15%%Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried to Pharaoh, saying, Why dealest thou thus with thy servants?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%16%%There is no straw given to thy servants, and they say to us, Make brick: and behold, thy servants are beaten; but the fault is in thy own people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%17%%But he said, Ye are idle, ye are idle: therefore ye say, Let us go, and do sacrifice to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%18%%Go therefore now, and work; for there shall no straw be given you, yet shall ye deliver the number of bricks.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%19%%And the officers of the children of Israel saw that they were in evil case, after it was said, Ye shall not diminish aught from your bricks of your daily task.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%20%%And they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%21%%And they said to them, The LORD look upon you, and judge; because ye have made our savor to be abhorred in the eyes of Pharaoh, and in the eyes of his servants, to put a sword in their hands to slay us.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%22%%And Moses returned to the LORD, and said, Lord, why hast thou so ill treated this people? why is it that thou hast sent me?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%5%%23%%For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he hath done evil to this people; neither hast thou delivered thy people at all.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%1%%Then the LORD said to Moses, Now shalt thou see what I will do to Pharaoh; for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a strong hand shall he drive them from his land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%2%%And God spoke to Moses, and said to him, I am the LORD:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%3%%And I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, by the name of God Almighty, but by my name JEHOVAH was I not known to them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%4%%And I have also established my covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, in which they were strangers.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%5%%And I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage: and I have remembered my covenant.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%6%%Wherefore say to the children of Israel, I am the LORD, and I will bring you from under the burdens of the Egyptians, and I will deliver you from their bondage, and I will redeem you with out-stretched arm, and with great judgments:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%7%%And I will take you to me for a people, and I will be to you a God: and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God, who bringeth you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%8%%And I will bring you into the land, concerning which I swore to give it to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob; and I will give it to you for a heritage: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%9%%And Moses spoke so to the children of Israel: but they hearkened not to Moses, by reason of anguish of spirit, and cruel bondage.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%10%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%11%%Go in, speak to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel depart from his land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%12%%And Moses spoke before the LORD, saying, Behold, the children of Israel have not hearkened to me; how then shall Pharaoh hear me, who am of uncircumcised lips?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%13%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, and to Aaron, and gave them a charge to the children of Israel, and to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%14%%These are the heads of their father's houses: The sons of Reuben the first-born of Israel; Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi: these are the families of Reuben.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%15%%And the sons of Simeon; Jemuel, and Jamin, and Ohad, and Jachin, and Zohar, and Shaul the son of a Canaanitish woman: these are the families of Simeon.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%16%%And these are the names of the sons of Levi, according to their generations; Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari. And the years of the life of Levi were a hundred and thirty-seven years.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%17%%The sons of Gershon; Libni, and Shimi, according to their families.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%18%%And the sons of Kohath; Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel: and the years of the life of Kohath were a hundred and thirty-three years.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%19%%And the sons of Merari; Mahali and Mushi: these are the families of Levi, according to their generations.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%20%%And Amram took him Jochebed, his father's sister, for a wife; and she bore him Aaron and Moses. And the years of the life of Amram were a hundred and thirty-seven years.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%21%%And the sons of Izhar; Korah, and Nepheg, and Zichri.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%22%%And the sons of Uzziel; Mishael, and Elzaphan, and Zithri.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%23%%And Aaron took him Elisheba daughter of Amminadab, sister of Naashon, for a wife; and she bore him Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%24%%And the sons of Korah; Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph: these are the families of the Korhites.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%25%%And Eleazar, Aaron's son, took him one of the daughters of Putiel for a wife; and she bore to him Phinehas: these are the heads of the fathers of the Levites, according to their families.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%26%%These are that Aaron and Moses, to whom the LORD said, Bring out the children of Israel from the land of Egypt according to their armies.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%27%%These are they who spoke to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, to bring out the children of Israel from Egypt: these are that Moses and Aaron.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%28%%And it came to pass, on the day when the LORD spoke to Moses in the land of Egypt,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%29%%That the LORD spoke to Moses, saying, I am the LORD: speak thou to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, all that I say to thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%6%%30%%And Moses said before the LORD, Behold, I am of uncircumcised lips, and how shall Pharaoh hearken to me?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%1%%And the LORD said to Moses, See, I have made thee a god to Pharaoh: and Aaron thy brother shall be thy prophet.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%2%%Thou shalt speak all that I command thee: and Aaron thy brother shall speak to Pharaoh, that he send the children of Israel out of his land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%3%%And I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%4%%But Pharaoh shall not hearken to you, that I may lay my hand upon Egypt, and bring forth my armies, my people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt, by great judgments.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%5%%And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I stretch forth my hand upon Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%6%%And Moses and Aaron did as the LORD commanded them, so did they.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%7%%And Moses was eighty years old, and Aaron eighty and three years old, when they spoke to Pharaoh.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%8%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, and to Aaron, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%9%%When Pharaoh shall speak to you, saying, Show a miracle for you: then thou shalt say to Aaron, Take thy rod, and cast it before Pharaoh, and it shall become a serpent.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%10%%And Moses and Aaron went in to Pharaoh, and they did so as the LORD had commanded: And Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh, and before his servants, and it became a serpent.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%11%%Then Pharaoh also called the wise-men, and the sorcerers: now the magicians of Egypt, they also did in like manner with their enchantments.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%12%%For they cast down every man his rod, and they became serpents: but Aaron's rod swallowed up their rods.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%13%%And he hardened Pharaoh's heart that he hearkened not to them; as the LORD had said.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%14%%And the LORD said to Moses, Pharaoh's heart is hardened; he refuseth to let the people go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%15%%Go to Pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out to the water, and thou shalt stand by the river's brink against he cometh; and the rod which was turned to a serpent shalt thou take in thy hand.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%16%%And thou shalt say to him, The LORD God of the Hebrews hath sent me to thee, saying, Let my people go, that they may serve me in the wilderness: and behold, hitherto thou wouldest not hear.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%17%%Thus saith the LORD, In this thou shalt know that I am the LORD: behold, I will smite with the rod that is in my hand upon the waters which are in the river, and they shall be turned to blood.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%18%%And the fish that is in the river shall die, and the river shall be offensive in smell; and the Egyptians shall lothe to drink of the water of the river.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%19%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, Say to Aaron, Take thy rod, and stretch out thy hand upon the waters of Egypt, upon their streams, upon their rivers, and upon their ponds, and upon all their pools of water, that they may become blood: and that there may be blood throughout all the land of Egypt, both in vessels of wood, and in vessels of stone.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%20%%And Moses and Aaron did so, as the LORD commanded; and he lifted up the rod and smote the waters that were in the river, in the sight of Pharaoh, and in the sight of his servants; and all the waters that were in the river were turned into blood.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%21%%And the fish that was in the river died; and the river was offensive in smell, and the Egyptians could not drink of the water of the river; and there was blood throughout all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%22%%And the magicians of Egypt did so with their enchantments: and Pharaoh's heart was hardened, neither did he hearken to them; as the LORD had said.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%23%%And Pharaoh turned and went into his house, neither did he regard this also.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%24%%And all the Egyptians digged round about the river for water to drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%7%%25%%And seven days were fulfilled after that the LORD had smitten the river.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, Go to Pharaoh, and say to him, Thus saith the LORD, Let my people go that they may serve me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%2%%And if thou shalt refuse to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy borders with frogs:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%3%%And the river shall bring forth frogs abundantly, which shall go up and come into thy house, and into thy bed-chamber, and upon thy bed, and into the house of thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy ovens, and into thy kneading troughs:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%4%%And the frogs shall come up both on thee, and upon thy people, and upon all thy servants.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%5%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, Say to Aaron, Stretch forth thy hand with thy rod over the streams, over the rivers, and over the ponds, and cause frogs to come up on the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%6%%And Aaron stretched his hand over the waters of Egypt; and the frogs came up, and covered the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%7%%And the magicians did so with their enchantments, and brought up frogs upon the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%8%%Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron, and said, Entreat the LORD that he may take away the frogs from me, and from my people: and I will let the people go, that they may do sacrifice to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%9%%And Moses said to Pharaoh, Glory over me: when shall I entreat for thee, and for thy servants, and for thy people, to destroy the frogs from thee, and thy houses, that they may remain in the river only?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%10%%And he said, To-morrow. And he said, Be it according to thy word; that thou mayest know that there is none like the LORD our God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%11%%And the frogs shall depart from thee, and from thy houses, and from thy servants, and from thy people; they shall remain in the river only.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%12%%And Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh: and Moses cried to the LORD, because of the frogs which he had brought against Pharaoh.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%13%%And the LORD did according to the word of Moses: and the frogs died out of the houses, out of the villages, and out of the fields.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%14%%And they gathered them into heaps: and the land was offensive in smell.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%15%%But when Pharaoh saw that there was respit, he hardened his heart, and hearkened not to them, as the LORD had said.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%16%%And the LORD said to Moses, Say to Aaron, Stretch out thy rod, and smite the dust of the land, that it may become lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%17%%And they did so: for Aaron stretched out his hand with his rod, and smote the dust of the earth, and it became lice in man and in beast; all the dust of the land became lice throughout all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%18%%And the magicians did so with their inchantments to bring forth lice, but they could not: so there were lice upon man and upon beast.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%19%%Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, This is the finger of God: and Pharaoh's heart was hardened, and he hearkened not to them; as the LORD had said.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%20%%And the LORD said to Moses, Rise early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh; (lo, he cometh forth to the water) and say to him, Thus saith the LORD, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%21%%Else, if thou wilt not let my people go, behold, I will send swarms of flies upon thee, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people, and into thy houses: and the houses of the Egyptians shall be full of swarms of flies, and also the ground on which they are.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%22%%And I will sever in that day the land of Goshen, in which my people dwell, that no swarms of flies shall be there; to the end thou mayest know that I am the LORD in the midst of the earth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%23%%And I will put a division between my people and thy people: to-morrow shall this sign be.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%24%%And the LORD did so: and there came a grievous swarm of flies into the house of Pharaoh, and into his servants' houses, and into all the land of Egypt: the land was corrupted by reason of the swarm of flies.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%25%%And Pharaoh called for Moses, and for Aaron, and said, Go ye, sacrifice to your God in the land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%26%%And Moses said, It is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians to the LORD our God: Lo, shall we sacrifice the abomination of the Egyptians before their eyes, and will they not stone us?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%27%%We will go three days' journey into the wilderness, and sacrifice to the LORD our God as he shall command us.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%28%%And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness; only ye shall not go very far away: entreat for me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%29%%And Moses said, Behold, I go out from thee, and I will entreat the LORD that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, to-morrow: but let not Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more, in not letting the people go to sacrifice to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%30%%And Moses went out from Pharaoh, and entreated the LORD:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%31%%And the LORD did according to the word of Moses; and he removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people; there remained not one.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%8%%32%%And Pharaoh hardened his heart at this time also, neither would he let the people go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%1%%Then the LORD said to Moses, Go in to Pharaoh, and tell him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%2%%For if thou shalt refuse to let them go, and wilt hold them still,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%3%%Behold, the hand of the LORD is upon thy cattle which are in the field, upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the oxen, and upon the sheep: there shall be a very grievous murrain.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%4%%And the LORD shall sever between the cattle of Israel, and the cattle of Egypt: and there shall nothing die of all that belongs to the children of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%5%%And the LORD appointed a set time, saying, To-morrow the LORD will do this thing in the land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%6%%And the LORD did that thing on the morrow, and all the cattle of Egypt died: but of the cattle of the children of Israel died not one.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%7%%And Pharaoh sent, and behold, there was not one of the cattle of the Israelites dead. And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, and he did not let the people go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%8%%And the LORD said to Moses and to Aaron, Take to you handfuls of ashes of the furnace, and let Moses sprinkle it towards heaven in the sight of Pharaoh.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%9%%And it shall become small dust in all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast, throughout all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%10%%And they took ashes of the furnace, and stood before Pharaoh; and Moses sprinkled it towards heaven; and it became a boil breaking forth with blains upon man, and upon beast.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%11%%And the magicians could not stand before Moses, because of the boil: for the boil was upon the magicians, and upon all the Egyptians.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%12%%And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh, and he hearkened not to them; as the LORD had spoke to Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%13%%And the LORD said to Moses, Rise early in the morning, and stand before Pharaoh, and say to him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, Let my people go, that they may serve me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%14%%For I will at this time send all my plagues upon thy heart, and upon thy servants, and upon thy people: that thou mayest know that there is none like me in all the earth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%15%%For now I will stretch out my hand, that I may smite thee and thy people with pestilence; and thou shalt be cut off from the earth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%16%%And in very deed for this cause have I raised thee up, to show in thee my power; and that my name may be declared throughout all the earth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%17%%As yet dost thou exalt thyself against my people, that thou wilt not let them go?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%18%%Behold, to-morrow about this time I will cause it to rain a very grievous hail, such as hath not been in Egypt since its foundation even until now.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%19%%Send therefore now, and gather thy cattle, and all that thou hast in the field: for upon every man and beast which shall be found in the field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon them, and they shall die.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%20%%He that feared the word of the LORD, among the servants of Pharaoh, made his servants and his cattle flee into the houses:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%21%%And he that regarded not the word of the LORD, left his servants and his cattle in the field.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%22%%And the LORD said to Moses, Stretch forth thy hand towards heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of Egypt, upon man, and upon beast, and upon every herb of the field, throughout the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%23%%And Moses stretched forth his rod towards heaven, and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and the fire ran along upon the ground: and the LORD rained hail upon the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%24%%So there was hail, and fire mingled with the hail, very grievous, such as there had been none like it in all the land of Egypt, since it became a nation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%25%%And the hail smote, throughout all the land of Egypt, all that was in the field, both man and beast, and the hail smote every herb of the field and broke every tree of the field.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%26%%Only in the land of Goshen, where the children of Israel were, there was no hail.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%27%%And Pharaoh sent, and called for Moses and Aaron, and said to them, I have sinned this time: the LORD is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%28%%Entreat the LORD (for it is enough) that there be no more mighty thunderings and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no longer.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%29%%And Moses said to him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands to the LORD; and the thunder shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that thou mayest know how that the earth is the LORD'S.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%30%%But as for thee and thy servants, I know that ye will not yet fear the LORD God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%31%%And the flax and the barley were smitten: for the barley was in the ear, and the flax was bolled.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%32%%But the wheat and the rye were not smitten; for they were not grown up.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%33%%And Moses went out of the city from Pharaoh, and spread abroad his hands to the LORD: and the thunders and hail ceased, and the rain was not poured upon the earth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%34%%And when Pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders had ceased, he sinned yet more, and hardened his heart, he and his servants.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%9%%35%%And the heart of Pharaoh was hardened, neither would he let the children of Israel go; as the LORD had spoken by Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%1%%And the LORD said to Moses, Go in to Pharaoh: for I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants; that I might show these my signs before him:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%2%%And that thou mayest tell in the ears of thy son, and of thy son's son, what things I have wrought in Egypt, and my signs which I have done among them; that ye may know how that I am the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%3%%And Moses and Aaron came in to Pharaoh, and said to him, Thus saith the LORD God of the Hebrews, How long wilt thou refuse to humble thyself before me? Let my people go, that they may serve me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%4%%Else, if thou shalt refuse to let my people go, behold, to-morrow will I bring the locusts into thy border:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%5%%And they shall cover the face of the earth, that one cannot be able to see the earth: and they shall eat the residue of that which hath escaped, which remaineth to you from the hail, and shall eat every tree which groweth for you out of the field:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%6%%And they shall fill thy houses, and the houses of all thy servants, and the houses of all the Egyptians; which neither thy fathers, nor thy fathers' fathers have seen, since the day that they were upon the earth to this day. And he turned himself, and went out from Pharaoh.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%7%%And Pharaoh's servants said to him, How long shall this man be a snare to us? Let the men go, that they may serve the LORD their God: knowest thou not yet that Egypt is destroyed?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%8%%And Moses and Aaron were brought again to Pharaoh: and he said to them, Go, serve the LORD your God: but who are they that shall go?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%9%%And Moses said, We will go with our young and with our old, with our sons and with our daughters, with our flocks and with our herds will we go; for we must hold a feast to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%10%%And he said to them, Let the LORD be so with you, as I will let you go, and your little ones: look to it; for evil is before you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%11%%Not so: go now ye that are men, and serve the LORD; for that you desired. And they were driven out from Pharaoh's presence.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%12%%And the LORD said to Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the land of Egypt for the locusts, that they may come upon the land of Egypt, and eat every herb of the land, even all that the hail hath left.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%13%%And Moses stretched forth his rod over the land of Egypt, and the LORD brought an east wind upon the land all that day, and all that night: and when it was morning, the east wind brought the locusts.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%14%%And the locusts went up over all the land of Egypt, and rested in all the borders of Egypt: very grievous were they; before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them will be such.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%15%%For they covered the face of the whole earth, so that the land was darkened; and they ate every herb of the land, and all the fruit of the trees which the hail had left: and there remained not any green thing on the trees, or in the herbs of the field, through all the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%16%%Then Pharaoh called for Moses and Aaron in haste; and he said, I have sinned against the LORD your God, and against you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%17%%Now therefore forgive, I pray thee, my sin only this once, and entreat the LORD your God that he may take away from me this death only.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%18%%And he went out from Pharaoh, and entreated the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%19%%And the LORD turned a mighty strong west wind which took away the locusts, and cast them into the Red sea: there remained not one locust in all the borders of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%20%%But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%21%%And the LORD said to Moses, Stretch out thy hand towards heaven, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%22%%And Moses stretched forth his hand towards heaven: and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%23%%They saw not one another, neither rose any from his place for three days: but all the children of Israel had light in their dwellings.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%24%%And Pharaoh called to Moses, and said, Go ye, serve the LORD; only let your flocks and your herds be stayed: let your little ones also go with you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%25%%And Moses said, Thou must give us also sacrifices, and burnt-offerings, that we may sacrifice to the LORD our God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%26%%Our cattle also shall go with us; there shall not a hoof be left behind; for of them must we take to serve the LORD our God; and we know not with what we must serve the LORD, until we come thither.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%27%%But the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, and he would not let them go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%28%%And Pharaoh said to him, Depart from me, take heed to thyself, see my face no more: for in that day thou seest my face, thou shalt die.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%10%%29%%And Moses said, Thou hast spoken well, I will see thy face again no more.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%1%%And the LORD said to Moses, Yet will I bring one plague more upon Pharaoh, and upon Egypt; afterwards he will let you go hence: when he shall let you go, he shall surely thrust you out hence altogether.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%2%%Speak now in the ears of the people, and let every man borrow of his neighbor, and every woman of her neighbor, jewels of silver, and jewels of gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%3%%And the LORD gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover, the man Moses was very great in the land of Egypt, in the sight of Pharaoh's servants, and in the sight of the people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%4%%And Moses said, Thus saith the LORD, About midnight will I go out into the midst of Egypt:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%5%%And all the first-born in the land of Egypt shall die, from the first-born of Pharaoh that sitteth upon his throne, even to the first-born of the maid-servant that is behind the mill; and all the first-born of beasts.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%6%%And there shall be a great cry throughout all the land of Egypt, such as there hath been none like it, nor shall be like it any more.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%7%%But against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog move his tongue, against man or beast: that ye may know how the LORD doth put a difference between the Egyptians and Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%8%%And all these thy servants shall come down to me, and bow down themselves to me, saying, Depart thou, and all the people that follow thee; and after that I will depart: and he went out from Pharaoh in a great anger.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%9%%And the LORD said to Moses, Pharaoh will not hearken to you; that my wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%11%%10%%And Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh; and the LORD hardened Pharaoh's heart, so that he would not let the children of Israel depart from his land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%2%%This month shall be to you the beginning of months: it shall be the first month of the year to you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%3%%Speak ye to all the congregation of Israel, saying, In the tenth day of this month they shall take to them every man a lamb, according to the house of their fathers, a lamb for a house:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%4%%And if the household shall be too small for the lamb, let him and his neighbor next to his house take it according to the number of the souls; every man according to his eating shall make your count for the lamb.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%5%%Your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of the first year: ye shall take it from the sheep or from the goats:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%6%%And ye shall keep it until the fourteenth day of the same month: and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it in the evening.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%7%%And they shall take of the blood, and strike it on the two side-posts, and on the upper door-post of the houses, in which they shall eat it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%8%%And they shall eat the flesh in that night, roasted with fire; and unleavened bread, and with bitter herbs they shall eat it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%9%%Eat not of it raw, nor boiled at all with water, but roasted with fire; its head with its legs, and with its entrails.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%10%%And ye shall let nothing of it remain till the morning: and that which remaineth of it till the morning ye shall burn with fire.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%11%%And thus shall ye eat it; with your loins girded, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand: and ye shall eat it in haste; it is the LORD'S passover.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%12%%For I will pass through the land of Egypt this night, and will smite all the first-born in the land of Egypt, both man and beast: and against all the gods of Egypt I will execute judgment: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%13%%And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where ye are: and when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and the plague shall not be upon you to destroy you, when I smite the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%14%%And this day shall be to you for a memorial; and ye shall keep it a feast to the LORD throughout your generations: ye shall keep it a feast by an ordinance for ever.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%15%%Seven days shall ye eat unleavened bread; even the first day ye shall put away leaven out of your houses: for whoever eateth leavened bread, from the first day till the seventh day, that soul shall be cut off from Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%16%%And in the first day there shall be a holy convocation, and in the seventh day there shall be a holy convocation to you: no manner of work shall be done in them, save that which every man must eat, that only may be done by you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%17%%And ye shall observe the feast of unleavened bread; for in this same day have I brought your armies out of the land of Egypt: therefore shall ye observe this day in your generations by an ordinance for ever.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%18%%In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at evening, ye shall eat unleavened bread, till the one and twentieth day of the month at evening.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%19%%Seven days shall there be no leaven found in your houses: for whoever eateth that which is leavened, even that soul shall be cut off from the congregation of Israel, whether he shall be a stranger, or born in the land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%20%%Ye shall eat nothing leavened: in all your habitations shall ye eat unleavened bread.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%21%%Then Moses called for all the elders of Israel, and said to them, Draw out, and take you a lamb, according to your families, and kill the passover.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%22%%And ye shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two side-posts with the blood that is in the basin: and none of you shall go out at the door of his house till the morning.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%23%%For the LORD will pass through to smite the Egyptians; and when he seeth the blood upon the lintel, and on the two side-posts, the LORD will pass over the door, and will not suffer the destroyer to come in to your houses to smite you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%24%%And ye shall observe this thing for an ordinance to thee and to thy sons for ever.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%25%%And it shall come to pass, when ye shall have come to the land which the LORD will give you, according as he hath promised, that ye shall keep this service.
