1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%26%%And it shall come to pass, when your children shall say to you, What mean you by this service?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%27%%That ye shall say, It is the sacrifice of the LORD'S passover, who passed over the houses of the children of Israel in Egypt, when he smote the Egyptians, and delivered our houses. And the people bowed the head and worshiped.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%28%%And the children of Israel went away, and did as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%29%%And it came to pass, that at midnight the LORD smote all the first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of Pharaoh that sat on his throne, to the first-born of the captive that was in the dungeon; and all the first-born of cattle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%30%%And Pharaoh rose in the night, he, and all his servants, and all the Egyptians; and there was a great cry in Egypt: for there was not a house where there was not one dead.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%31%%And he called for Moses and Aaron by night, and said, Arise, and depart from among my people, both ye and the children of Israel: and go, serve the LORD, as ye have said.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%32%%Also take your flocks and your herds, as ye have said, and be gone: and bless me also.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%33%%And the Egyptians were urgent upon the people, that they might send them out of the land in haste; for they said, We are all dead men.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%34%%And the people took their dough before it was leavened, their kneading troughs being bound up in their clothes upon their shoulders.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%35%%And the children of Israel did according to the word of Moses: and they borrowed of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%36%%And the LORD gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians, so that they lent to them such things as they requested: and they spoiled the Egyptians.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%37%%And the children of Israel journeyed from Rameses to Succoth, about six hundred thousand on foot that were men, besides children.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%38%%And a mixed multitude went up also with them; and flocks, and herds, even very many cattle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%39%%And they baked unleavened cakes of the dough which they brought from Egypt, for it was not leavened: because they were driven from Egypt, and could not tarry, neither had they prepared for themselves any victuals.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%40%%Now the sojourning of the children of Israel who dwelt in Egypt, was four hundred and thirty years.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%41%%And it came to pass, at the end of the four hundred and thirty years, even the same day it came to pass, that all the hosts of the LORD departed from the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%42%%It is a night to be much observed to the LORD, for bringing them out from the land of Egypt: this is that night of the LORD to be observed by all the children of Israel in their generations.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%43%%And the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, This is the ordinance of the passover: there shall no stranger eat of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%44%%But every man's servant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised him, then shall he eat of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%45%%A foreigner, and a hired servant shall not eat of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%46%%In one house shall it be eaten; thou shalt not carry aught of the flesh abroad out of the house: neither shall ye break a bone of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%47%%All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%48%%And when a stranger shall sojourn with thee, and will keep the passover to the LORD, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as one that is born in the land: for no uncircumcised person shall eat of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%49%%One law shall be to him that is home-born, and to the stranger that sojourneth among you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%50%%Thus did all the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses and Aaron, so did they.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%12%%51%%And it came to pass the same day, that the LORD brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt by their armies.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%2%%Sanctify to me all the first-born, whatever openeth the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and of beast: it is mine.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%3%%And Moses said to the people, Remember this day, in which ye came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand the LORD brought you out from this place: there shall no leavened bread be eaten.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%4%%This day ye came out in the month Abib.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%5%%And it shall be when the LORD shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, which he swore to thy fathers to give thee, a land flowing with milk and honey; that thou shalt keep this service in this month.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%6%%Seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread, and in the seventh day shall be a feast to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%7%%Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days: and there shall no leavened bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen with thee in all thy quarters.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%8%%And thou shalt show thy son in that day, saying, This is done because of that which the LORD did to me when I came forth out of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%9%%And it shall be for a sign to thee upon thy hand, and for a memorial between thy eyes; that the LORD'S law may be in thy mouth: for with a strong hand hath the LORD brought thee out of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%10%%Thou shalt therefore keep this ordinance in its season from year to year.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%11%%And it shall be when the LORD shall bring thee into the land of the Canaanites, as he swore to thee and to thy fathers, and shall give it to thee,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%12%%That thou shall set apart to the LORD all that openeth the matrix; and every firstling that cometh of a beast which thou hast, the males shall be the LORD'S.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%13%%And every firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb; and if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break his neck: and all the first-born of man among thy children shalt thou redeem.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%14%%And it shall be when thy son asketh thee in time to come, saying, What is this? that thou shalt say to him, By strength of hand the LORD brought us out from Egypt, from the house of bondage:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%15%%And it came to pass, when Pharaoh would hardly let us go, that the LORD slew all the first-born in the land of Egypt, both the first-born of man, and the first-born of beasts: therefore I sacrifice to the LORD all that openeth the matrix, being males; but all the first-born of my children I redeem.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%16%%And it shall be for a token upon thy hand, and for frontlets between thy eyes: for by strength of hand the LORD brought us forth out of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%17%%And it came to pass, when Pharaoh had let the people go, that God led them not through the way of the land of the Philistines, although that was near, for God said, Lest peradventure the people repent when they see war, and they return to Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%18%%But God led the people about, through the way of the wilderness of the Red Sea: and the children of Israel went up harnassed from the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%19%%And Moses took the bones of Joseph with him: for he had strictly sworn the children of Israel, saying, God will surely visit you; and ye shall carry up my bones hence with you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%20%%And they took their journey from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, in the edge of the wilderness.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%21%%And the LORD went before them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them in the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them light: to go by day and night.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%13%%22%%He took not away the pillar of the cloud by day, nor the pillar of fire by night, from before the people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, that they turn and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea, over against Baal-zephon: before it shall ye encamp by the sea.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%3%%For Pharaoh will say of the children of Israel, They are entangled in the land, the wilderness hath shut them in.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%4%%And I will harden Pharaoh's heart, that he shall follow them; and I will be honored upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host; that the Egyptians may know that I am the LORD. And they did so.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%5%%And it was told to the king of Egypt that the people fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was turned against the people, and they said, Why have we done this, that we have let Israel go from serving us?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%6%%And he made ready his chariot, and took his people with him:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%7%%And he took six hundred chosen chariots, and all the chariots of Egypt, and captains over every one of them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%8%%And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he pursued the children of Israel: and the children of Israel went out with a high hand.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%9%%But the Egyptians pursued them (all the horses and chariots of Pharaoh, and his horsemen, and his army) and overtook them encamping by the sea, beside Pi-hahiroth, before Baal-zephon.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%10%%And when Pharaoh drew nigh, the children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians marched after them; and they were greatly afraid; and the children of Israel cried to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%11%%And they said to Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? Why hast thou dealt thus with us, to conduct us out of Egypt?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%12%%Is not this the word that we told thee in Egypt, Saying, Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians? For it had been better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%13%%And Moses said to the people, Fear ye not, stand still, and see the salvation of the LORD, which he will show to you to-day: for the Egyptians whom ye have seen to-day, ye shall see them again no more for ever.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%14%%The LORD will fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%15%%And the LORD said to Moses, Why criest thou to me? Speak to the children of Israel, that they go forward:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%16%%But lift thou thy rod, and stretch out thy hand over the sea, and divide it; and the children of Israel shall go on dry ground through the midst of the sea.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%17%%And I, behold I, will harden the hearts of the Egyptians, and they shall follow them: and I will get me honor upon Pharaoh, and upon all his host, upon his chariots and upon his horsemen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%18%%And the Egyptians shall know that I am the LORD, when I have gotten me honor upon Pharaoh, upon his chariots, and upon his horsemen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%19%%And the angel of God, who went before the camp of Israel, removed, and went behind them; and the pillar of the cloud went from before their face, and stood behind them:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%20%%And it came between the camp of the Egyptians and the camp of Israel; and it was a cloud and darkness to them, but it gave light by night to these: so that the one came not near the other all the night.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%21%%And Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and the LORD caused the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and made the sea dry land, and the waters were divided.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%22%%And the children of Israel went into the midst of the sea upon the dry ground: and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand, and on their left.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%23%%And the Egyptians pursued, and went in after them to the midst of the sea, even all Pharaoh's horses, his chariots, and his horsemen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%24%%And it came to pass, that, in the morning-watch, the LORD looked to the host of the Egyptians through the pillar of fire, and of the cloud, and troubled the host of the Egyptians,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%25%%And took off their chariot-wheels, and made them to move heavily, so that the Egyptians said, Let us flee from the face of Israel; for the LORD fighteth for them against the Egyptians.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%26%%And the LORD said to Moses, Stretch out thy hand over the sea, that the waters may come again upon the Egyptians, upon their chariots, and upon their horsemen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%27%%And Moses stretched forth his hand over the sea, and the sea returned to its strength when the morning appeared; and the Egyptians fled against it; and the LORD overthrew the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%28%%And the waters returned, and covered the chariots, and the horsemen, and all the host of Pharaoh that came into the sea after them; there remained not so much as one of them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%29%%But the children of Israel walked upon dry land in the midst of the sea; and the waters were a wall to them on their right hand, and on their left.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%30%%Thus the LORD saved Israel that day from the hand of the Egyptians: and Israel saw the Egyptians dead upon the sea-shore.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%14%%31%%And Israel saw that great work which the LORD did upon the Egyptians: and the people feared the LORD, and believed the LORD, and his servant Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%1%%Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song to the LORD, and spoke, saying, I will sing to the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%2%%The LORD is my strength and song, and he is become my salvation: he is my God, and I will prepare him a habitation; my father's God, and I will exalt him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%3%%The LORD is a man of war: the LORD is his name.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%4%%Pharaoh's chariots and his host hath he cast into the sea: his chosen captains also are drowned in the Red sea.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%5%%The depths have covered them: they sunk to the bottom as a stone.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%6%%Thy right hand, O LORD, is become glorious in power: thy right hand, O LORD, hath dashed in pieces the enemy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%7%%And in the greatness of thy excellence thou hast overthrown them that rose up against thee: thou sentest forth thy wrath, which consumed them as stubble.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%8%%And with the blast of thy nostrils the waters were collected, the floods stood upright as a heap, and the depths were congealed in the heart of the sea.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%9%%The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; my lust shall be satisfied upon them; I will draw my sword, my hand shall destroy them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%10%%Thou didst blow with thy wind, the sea covered them: they sunk as lead in the mighty waters.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%11%%Who is like to thee, O LORD, among the gods? who is like thee, glorious in holiness, fearful in praises, doing wonders!
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%12%%Thou stretchedst out thy right hand, the earth swallowed them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%13%%Thou in thy mercy hast led forth the people which thou hast redeemed: thou hast guided them in thy strength to thy holy habitation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%14%%The people shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on the inhabitants of Palestina.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%15%%Then the dukes of Edom shall be amazed; the mighty men of Moab, trembling shall take hold upon them; all the inhabitants of Canaan shall melt away.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%16%%Fear and dread shall fall upon them; by the greatness of thy arm they shall be as still as a stone; till thy people pass over, O LORD, till the people pass over, which thou hast purchased.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%17%%Thou shalt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of thy inheritance, in the place, O LORD, which thou hast made for thee to dwell in; in the sanctuary, O Lord. which thy hands have established.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%18%%The LORD shall reign for ever and ever.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%19%%For the horse of Pharaoh went in with his chariots and with his horsemen into the sea, and the LORD brought again the waters of the sea upon them; but the children of Israel went on dry land in the midst of the sea.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%20%%And Miriam the prophetess, the sister of Aaron, took a timbrel in her hand; and all the women went out after her, with timbrels, and with dances.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%21%%And Miriam answered them, Sing ye to the LORD, for he hath triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider hath he thrown into the sea.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%22%%So Moses brought Israel from the Red sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no water.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%23%%And when they came to Marah, they could not drink of the waters of Marah; for they were bitter: therefore the name of it was called Marah.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%24%%And the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%25%%And he cried to the LORD; and the LORD showed him a tree, which he cast into the waters, and the waters were made sweet: there he made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there he proved them,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%26%%And said, If thou wilt diligently hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, and wilt do that which is right in his sight, and wilt give ear to his commandments, and keep all his statutes; I will put none of these diseases upon thee, which I have brought upon the Egyptians; for I am the LORD that healeth thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%15%%27%%And they came to Elim, where were twelve wells of water, and seventy palm-trees: and they encamped there by the waters.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%1%%And they took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departure from the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%2%%And the whole congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron in the wilderness.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%3%%And the children of Israel said to them, O that we had died by the hand of the LORD in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the flesh-pots, and when we did eat bread to the full: for ye have brought us forth into this wilderness, to kill this whole assembly with hunger.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%4%%Then said the LORD to Moses, Behold, I will rain bread from heaven for you; and the people shall go out and gather a certain rate every day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or not.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%5%%And it shall come to pass, that on the sixth day they shall prepare that which they bring in; and it shall be twice as much as they gather daily.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%6%%And Moses and Aaron said to all the children of Israel, At evening, then ye shall know that the LORD hath brought you out from the land of Egypt:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%7%%And in the morning, then ye shall see the glory of the LORD; for that he heareth your murmurings against the LORD: And what are we, that ye murmur against us?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%8%%And Moses said, This shall be when the LORD shall give you in the evening flesh to eat, and in the morning bread to the full; for that the LORD heareth your murmurings which ye murmur against him: And what are we? your murmurings are not against us, but against the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%9%%And Moses spoke to Aaron, Say to all the congregation of the children of Israel, Come near before the LORD: for he hath heard your murmurings.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%10%%And it came to pass, as Aaron spoke to the whole congregation of the children of Israel, that they looked towards the wilderness, and behold, the glory of the LORD appeared in the cloud.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%11%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%12%%I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel; Speak to them, saying, At evening ye shall eat flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread: and ye shall know that I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%13%%And it came to pass, that at evening the quails came up, and covered the camp: and in the morning the dew lay around the host.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%14%%And when the dew that lay was gone up, behold, upon the face of the wilderness there lay a small round thing, as small as the hoar frost on the ground:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%15%%And when the children of Israel saw it, they said one to another, It is manna: for they knew not what it was. And Moses said to them, This is the bread which the LORD hath given you to eat.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%16%%This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded, Gather of it every man according to his eating: an omer for every man according to the number of your persons, take ye every man for them who are in his tents.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%17%%And the children of Israel did so, and gathered, some more, some less.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%18%%And when they measured it with an omer, he that gathered much had nothing over, and he that gathered little had no lack: they gathered every man according to his eating.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%19%%And Moses said, Let no man leave of it till the morning.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%20%%Notwithstanding, they hearkened not to Moses; but some of them left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and became offensive; and Moses was wroth with them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%21%%And they gathered it every morning, every man according to his eating: and when the sun became hot, it melted.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%22%%And it came to pass, that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for one man: and all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%23%%And he said to them, This is that which the LORD hath said, To-morrow is the rest of the holy sabbath to the LORD: bake that which ye will bake to-day, and boil that ye will boil; and that which remaineth over, lay up for you to be kept until the morning.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%24%%And they laid it up till the morning, as Moses ordered: and it did not putrefy, neither was there any worm therein.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%25%%And Moses said, Eat that to-day; for to-day is a sabbath to the LORD; to-day ye will not find it in the field.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%26%%Six days ye shall gather it; but on the seventh day, which is the sabbath, in it there will be none.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%27%%And it came to pass, that some of the people went out on the seventh day to gather, and they found none.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%28%%And the LORD said to Moses, How long refuse ye to keep my commandments and my laws?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%29%%See, for that the LORD hath given you the sabbath, therefore he giveth you on the sixth day the bread of two days: abide ye every man in his place, let no man go out of his place on the seventh day.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%30%%So the people rested on the seventh day.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%31%%And the house of Israel called its name Manna: and it was like coriander-seed, white; and the taste of it was like wafers made with honey.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%32%%And Moses said, This is the thing which the LORD commanded, Fill an omer of it to be kept for your generations; that they may see the bread with which I fed you in the wilderness, when I brought you forth from the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%33%%And Moses said to Aaron, Take a pot, and put an omer full of manna therein, and lay it up before the LORD, to be kept for your generations.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%34%%As the LORD commanded Moses, so Aaron laid it up before the Testimony, to be kept.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%35%%And the children of Israel ate manna forty years, until they came to a land inhabited: they ate manna, until they came to the borders of the land of Canaan.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%16%%36%%Now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%1%%And all the congregation of the children of Israel journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, after their journeys, according to the commandment of the LORD, and encamped in Rephidim: and there was no water for the people to drink.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%2%%Wherefore the people contended with Moses, and said, Give us water that we may drink. And Moses said to them, Why chide you with me? why do ye tempt the LORD?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%3%%And the people thirsted there for water; and the people murmured against Moses, and said, Why is this that thou hast brought us out of Egypt to kill us and our children and our cattle with thirst?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%4%%And Moses cried to the LORD, saying, What shall I do to this people? they are almost ready to stone me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%5%%And the LORD said to Moses, Go on before the people, and take with thee of the elders of Israel: and thy rod, with which thou smotest the river, take in thy hand, and go.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%6%%Behold, I will stand before thee there on the rock in Horeb; and thou shalt smite the rock, and water shall come out of it, that the people may drink. And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%7%%And he called the name of the place Massah, and Meribah, because of the chiding of the children of Israel, and because they tempted the LORD, saying, Is the LORD among us, or not?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%8%%Then came Amalek, and fought with Israel in Rephidim.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%9%%And Moses said to Joshua, Choose us out men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to-morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%10%%So Joshua did as Moses had said to him, and fought with Amalek: and Moses, Aaron, and Hur, went up to the top of the hill.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%11%%And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed: and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%12%%But Moses's hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat upon it: and Aaron and Hur supported his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%13%%And Joshua discomfited Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%14%%And the LORD said to Moses, Write this for a memorial in a book, and rehearse it in the ears of Joshua: for I will utterly blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%15%%And Moses built an altar, and called the name of it JEHOVAH-nissi:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%17%%16%%For he said, Because the LORD hath sworn that the LORD will have war with Amalek from generation to generation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%1%%When Jethro the priest of Midian, Moses's father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses, and for Israel his people, and that the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%2%%Then Jethro, Moses's father-in-law, took Zipporah Moses's wife, after he had sent her back,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%3%%And her two sons; of which the name of the one was Gershom; (for he said, I have been an alien in a strange land:)
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%4%%And the name of the other was Eliezer; (for the God of my father, said he, was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh:)
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%5%%And Jethro, Moses's father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses into the wilderness, where he encamped at the mount of God:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%6%%And he said to Moses, I thy father-in-law Jethro have come to thee, and thy wife, and her two sons with her.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%7%%And Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and did obeisance, and kissed him: and they asked each other of their welfare: and they came into the tent.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%8%%And Moses told his father-in-law all that the LORD had done to Pharaoh, and to the Egyptians for Israel's sake, and all the travail that had come upon them by the way, and how the LORD delivered them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%9%%And Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which the LORD had done to Israel, whom he had delivered out of the hand of the Egyptians.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%10%%And Jethro said, Blessed be the LORD, who hath delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh, who hath delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%11%%Now I know that the LORD is greater than all gods: for in the thing in which they dealt proudly, he was above them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%12%%And Jethro, Moses's father-in-law, took a burnt-offering and sacrifices for God: and Aaron came, and all the elders of Israel to eat bread with Moses's father-in-law before God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%13%%And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses sat to judge the people: and the people stood by Moses from the morning to the evening.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%14%%And when Moses's father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, What is this thing that thou doest to the people? Why sittest thou thyself alone, and all the people stand by thee from morning to evening?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%15%%And Moses said to his father-in-law, Because the people come to me to inquire of God:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%16%%When they have a matter, they come to me, and I judge between one and another, and I make them know the statutes of God, and his laws.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%17%%And Moses's father-in-law said to him, The thing that thou doest is not good.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%18%%Thou wilt surely wear away, both thou, and this people that is with thee: for this thing is too heavy for thee; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%19%%Hearken now to my voice, I will give thee counsel, and God shall be with thee: Be thou for the people toward God, that thou mayest bring the causes to God:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%20%%And thou shalt teach them ordinances and laws, and shalt show them the way in which they must walk, and the work that they must do.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%21%%Moreover, thou shalt provide out of all the people, able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place such over them to be rulers of thousands, and rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%22%%And let them judge the people at all seasons: and it shall be, that every great matter they shall bring to thee, but every small matter they shall judge: So shall it be easier for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%23%%If thou shalt do this thing, and God command thee so, then thou shalt be able to endure, and all this people shall also go to their place in peace.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%24%%So Moses hearkened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%25%%And Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%26%%And they judged the people at all seasons: the hard causes they brought to Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%18%%27%%And Moses let his father-in-law depart; and he went his way into his own land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%1%%In the third month, when the children of Israel had gone forth from the land of Egypt, the same day they came into the wilderness of Sinai.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%2%%For they had departed from Rephidim, and had come to the desert of Sinai, and had pitched in the wilderness; and there Israel encamped before the mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%3%%And Moses went up to God, and the LORD called to him from the mountain, saying, Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%4%%Ye have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I bore you on eagles' wings, and brought you to myself.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%5%%Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye shall be a peculiar treasure to me above all people: for all the earth is mine:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%6%%And ye shall be to me a kingdom of priests, and a holy nation. These are the words which thou shalt speak to the children of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%7%%And Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and laid before their faces all these words which the LORD commanded him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%8%%And all the people answered together, and said, All that the LORD hath spoken we will do. And Moses returned the words of the people to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%9%%And the LORD said to Moses, Lo, I come to thee in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%10%%And the LORD said to Moses, Go to the people, and sanctify them to-day and to-morrow, and let them wash their clothes,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%11%%And be ready against the third day: for on the third day the LORD will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%12%%And thou shalt set bounds to the people round about, saying, Take heed to yourselves, that ye go not up upon the mount, or touch the border of it: whoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%13%%There shall not a hand touch it, but he shall surely be stoned or shot through: whether it be beast or man, it shall not live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%14%%And Moses went down from the mount to the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their clothes.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%15%%And he said to the people, Be ready against the third day: come not at your wives.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%16%%And it came to pass on the third day in the morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and the voice of the trumpet exceeding loud; so that all the people that were in the camp trembled.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%17%%And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%18%%And mount Sinai was altogether in a smoke, because the LORD descended upon it in fire: and the smoke of it ascended as the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mount trembled greatly.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%19%%And when the voice of the trumpet sounded long, and grew louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him by a voice.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%20%%And the LORD came down upon mount Sinai, on the top of the mount: and the LORD called Moses to the top of the mount; and Moses went up.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%21%%And the LORD said to Moses, Go down, charge the people, lest they break through to the LORD to gaze, and many of them perish.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%22%%And let the priests also who come near to the LORD, sanctify themselves, lest the LORD break forth upon them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%23%%And Moses said to the LORD, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai: for thou chargedst us, saying, Set bounds about the mount, and sanctify it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%24%%And the LORD said to him, Away, go down, and thou shalt come up, thou, and Aaron with thee: But let not the priests and the people break through, to come up to the LORD, lest he break forth upon them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%19%%25%%So Moses went down to the people, and spoke to them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%1%%And God spoke all these words, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%2%%I am the LORD thy God, who have brought thee out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%3%%Thou shalt have no other gods before me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%4%%Thou shalt not make to thee any graven image, or any likeness of any thing that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%5%%Thou shalt not bow down thyself to them, nor serve them: for I the LORD thy God am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children to the third and fourth generation of them that hate me;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%6%%And showing mercy to thousands of them that love me, and keep my commandments.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%7%%Thou shalt not take the name of the LORD thy God in vain: for the LORD will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%8%%Remember the sabbath-day to keep it holy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%9%%Six days shalt thou labor, and do all thy work:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%10%%But the seventh day is the sabbath of the LORD thy God: in it thou shalt not do any work, thou, nor thy son, nor thy daughter, thy man-servant, nor thy maid-servant, nor thy cattle, nor thy stranger that is within thy gates:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%11%%For in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day: wherefore the LORD blessed the sabbath-day, and hallowed it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%12%%Honor thy father and thy mother; that thy days may be long upon the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%13%%Thou shalt not kill.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%14%%Thou shalt not commit adultery.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%15%%Thou shalt not steal.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%16%%Thou shalt not bear false witness against thy neighbor.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%17%%Thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's house, thou shalt not covet thy neighbor's wife, nor his man-servant, nor his maid-servant, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that is thy neighbor's.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%18%%And all the people saw the thunderings, and the lightnings, and the noise of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking: and when the people saw it, they removed, and stood afar off.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%19%%And they said to Moses, Speak thou with us, and we will hear: but let not God speak with us, lest we die.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%20%%And Moses said to the people, Fear not: for God is come to prove you, and that his fear may be before your faces, that ye sin not.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%21%%And the people stood afar off, and Moses drew near to the thick darkness where God was.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%22%%And the LORD said to Moses, Thus thou shalt say to the children of Israel; Ye have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%23%%Ye shall not make with me gods of silver, neither shall ye make to you gods of gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%24%%An altar of earth thou shalt make to me, and shalt sacrifice thereon thy burnt-offerings, and thy peace-offerings, thy sheep, and thy oxen: in all places where I record my name I will come to thee, and I will bless thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%25%%And if thou wilt make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build it of hewn stone: for if thou shalt lift up thy tool upon it, thou hast polluted it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%20%%26%%Neither shalt thou go up by steps to my altar, that thy nakedness be not discovered thereon.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%1%%Now these are the judgments which thou shalt set before them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%2%%If thou shalt buy a Hebrew servant, six years he shall serve: and in the seventh he shall depart free for nothing.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%3%%If he came in by himself, he shall depart by himself: if he was married, then his wife shall depart with him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%4%%If his master hath given him a wife, and she hath borne him sons or daughters; the wife and her children shall be her master's, and he shall depart by himself.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%5%%And if the servant shall plainly say, I love my master, my wife, and my children; I will not depart free:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%6%%Then his master shall bring him to the judges; he shall also bring him to the door, or to the door-post: and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl; and he shall serve him for ever.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%7%%And if a man shall sell his daughter to be a maid-servant, she shall not depart as the men-servants do.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%8%%If she shall not please her master, who hath betrothed her to himself, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell her to a strange nation he shall have no power, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully with her.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%9%%And if he hath betrothed her to his son, he shall deal with her after the manner of daughters.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%10%%If he shall take him another wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty of marriage shall he not diminish.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%11%%And if he shall not perform these three to her, then shall she depart free without money.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%12%%He that smiteth a man, so that he dieth, shall be surely put to death.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%13%%And if a man shall not lie in wait, but God shall deliver him into his hand; then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%14%%But if a man shall come presumptuously upon his neighbor, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from my altar, that he may die.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%15%%And he that smiteth his father, or his mother, shall be surely put to death.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%16%%And he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, or if he shall be found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%17%%And he that curseth his father, or his mother, shall surely be put to death.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%18%%And if men contend together, and one shall smite another with a stone, or with his fist, and he shall not die, but keep his bed:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%19%%If he shall rise again, and walk abroad upon his staff, then shall he that smote him be quit: only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall cause him to be thoroughly healed.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%20%%And if a man shall smite his servant, or his maid, with a rod, and he shall die under his hand; he shall be surely punished.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%21%%Notwithstanding, if he shall continue a day or two, he shall not be punished; for he is his money.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%22%%If men shall contend, and hurt a woman with child, so that her fruit shall depart from her, and yet no mischief follow: he shall be surely punished, according as the woman's husband will lay upon him; and he shall pay as the judges determine.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%23%%And if any mischief shall follow, then thou shalt give life for life,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%24%%Eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%25%%Burning for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%26%%And if a man shall smite the eye of his servant, or the eye of his maid, that it shall perish; he shall let him go free for his eye's sake.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%27%%And if he shall smite out his man-servant's tooth, or his maid-servant's tooth; he shall let him go free for his tooth's sake.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%28%%If an ox shall gore a man or a woman, that they die: then the ox shall be surely stoned, and his flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall be quit.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%29%%But if the ox was accustomed to push with his horn in time past, and it hath been testified to his owner, and he hath not restrained him, but that he hath killed a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and his owner also shall be put to death.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%30%%If there shall be laid on him a sum of money, then he shall give for the ransom of his life whatever is laid upon him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%31%%Whether he hath gored a son, or hath gored a daughter, according to this judgment shall it be done to him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%32%%If the ox shall push a man-servant, or maid-servant; he shall give to their master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%33%%And if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit, and not cover it, and an ox or an ass shall fall into it;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%34%%The owner of the pit shall make compensation, and give money to the owner of them; and the dead beast shall be his.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%35%%And if one man's ox shall hurt another's that he shall die, then they shall sell the live ox, and divide the money of it, and the dead ox also they shall divide.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%21%%36%%Or if it shall be known that the ox hath used to push in time past, and his owner hath not restrained him; he shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead shall be his own.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%1%%If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it; he shall restore five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%2%%If a thief shall be found breaking through, and be smitten that he die, there shall no blood be shed for him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%3%%If the sun shall have risen upon him, there shall be blood shed for him: for he should make full restitution; if he have nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%4%%If the theft shall be certainly found in his hand alive, whether an ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restore double.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%5%%If a man shall cause a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall put in his beast, and shall feed in another man's field: of the best of his own field, and of the best of his own vineyard shall he make restitution.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%6%%If fire shall break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field shall be consumed; he that kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%7%%If a man shall deliver to his neighbor money or stuff to keep, and it be stolen out of the man's house; if the thief shall be found, let him pay double.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%8%%If the thief shall not be found, then the master of the house shall be brought to the judges, to see whether he hath put his hand to his neighbor's goods.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%9%%For all manner of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for sheep, for raiment, or for any manner of lost thing which another challengeth to be his: the cause of both parties shall come before the judges; and he whom the judges shall condemn, shall pay double to his neighbor.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%10%%If a man shall deliver to his neighbor an ass, or an ox, or a sheep, or any beast to keep; and it shall die, or be hurt, or driven away, no man seeing it:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%11%%Then shall an oath of the LORD be between them both, that he hath not put his hand to his neighbor's goods; and the owner of it shall accept of it, and he shall not make restitution.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%12%%And if it shall be stolen from him, he shall make restitution to the owner of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%13%%If it shall be torn in pieces; then let him bring it for witness, and he shall not make good that which was torn.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%14%%And if a man shall borrow aught of his neighbor, and it shall be hurt, or die, the owner of it being not with it, he shall surely make it good.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%15%%But if the owner of it shall be with it, he shall not make it good: if it be a hired thing, it came for his hire.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%16%%And if a man shall entice a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with her, he shall surely endow her to be his wife.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%17%%If her father shall utterly refuse to give her to him, he shall pay money according to the dower of virgins.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%18%%Thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%19%%Whoever lieth with a beast shall surely be put to death.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%20%%He that sacrificeth to any god, save to the LORD only, he shall be utterly destroyed.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%21%%Thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%22%%Ye shall not afflict any widow, or fatherless child.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%23%%If thou shalt afflict them in any wise, and they cry at all to me, I will surely hear their cry:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%24%%And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%25%%If thou shalt lend money to any of my people that is poor by thee, thou shalt not be to him as a usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon him usury.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%26%%If thou shalt at all take thy neighbor's raiment to pledge, thou shalt deliver it to him by the setting of the sun.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%27%%For that is his only covering, it is his raiment for his skin: wherein shall he sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth to me, that I will hear; for I am gracious.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%28%%Thou shalt not revile the gods, nor curse the ruler of thy people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%29%%Thou shalt not delay to offer the first of thy ripe fruits, and of thy liquors: the first-born of thy sons shalt thou give to me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%30%%Likewise shalt thou do with thy oxen, and with thy sheep: seven days it shall be with his dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give it to me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%22%%31%%And ye shall be holy men to me: neither shall ye eat any flesh that is torn of beasts in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%1%%Thou shalt not raise a false report: put not thy hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%2%%Thou shalt not follow a multitude to do evil; neither shalt thou speak in a cause to decline after many to wrest judgment:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%3%%Neither shalt thou countenance a poor man in his cause.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%4%%If thou shalt meet thy enemy's ox or his ass going astray, thou shalt surely bring it back to him again.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%5%%If thou shalt see the ass of him that hateth thee lying under his burden, and wouldest forbear to help him, thou shalt surely help with him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%6%%Thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thy poor in his cause.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%7%%Keep thee far from a false matter; and the innocent and righteous slay thou not: for I will not justify the wicked.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%8%%And thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and perverteth the words of the righteous.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%9%%Also thou shalt not oppress a stranger; for ye know the heart of a stranger, seeing ye were strangers in the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%10%%And six years thou shalt sow thy land, and shalt gather in the fruits thereof:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%11%%But the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and lie still; that the poor of thy people may eat: and what they leave, the beasts of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with thy vineyard, and with thy olive-yard.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%12%%Six days thou shalt do thy work, and on the seventh day thou shalt rest: that thy ox and thy ass may rest, and the son of thy handmaid, and the stranger, may be refreshed.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%13%%And in all things that I have said to you be circumspect: and make no mention of the names of other gods, neither let it be heard from thy mouth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%14%%Three times thou shalt keep a feast to me in the year.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%15%%Thou shalt keep the feast of unleavened bread: (thou shalt eat unleavened bread seven days, as I commanded thee, in the time appointed of the month Abib; for in it thou camest out from Egypt: and none shall appear before me empty:)
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%16%%And the feast of harvest, the first-fruits of thy labors, which thou hast sown in the field: and the feast of in-gathering, which is in the end of the year, when thou hast gathered in thy labors out of the field.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%17%%Three times in the year all thy males shall appear before the Lord GOD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%18%%Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the fat of my sacrifice remain until the morning.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%19%%The first of the first-fruits of thy land thou shalt bring into the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%20%%Behold, I send an Angel before thee, to keep thee in the way, and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%21%%Beware of him, and obey his voice, provoke him not; for he will not pardon your transgressions: for my name is in him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%22%%But if thou shalt indeed obey his voice, and do all that I speak; then I will be an enemy to thy enemies, and an adversary to thy adversaries.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%23%%For my Angel shall go before thee, and bring thee in to the Amorites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites; and I will cut them off.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%24%%Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works: but thou shalt utterly overthrow them, and quite break down their images.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%25%%And ye shall serve the LORD your God, and he will bless thy bread, and thy water; and I will take sickness away from the midst of thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%26%%There shall nothing cast their young, nor be barren, in thy land: I will complete the number of thy days.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%27%%I will send my fear before thee, and will destroy all the people to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thy enemies turn their backs to thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%28%%And I will send hornets before thee, which shall drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite from before thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%29%%I will not drive them out from before thee in one year; lest the land should become desolate, and the beast of the field should multiply against thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%30%%By little and little I will drive them out from before thee, until thou shalt be increased and inherit the land.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%31%%And I will set thy bounds from the Red sea even to the sea of the Philistines, and from the desert to the river: for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand; and thou shalt drive them out before thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%32%%Thou shalt make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%23%%33%%They shall not dwell in thy land, lest they make thee to sin against me: for if thou shalt serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%1%%And he said to Moses, Come up to the LORD, thou, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship ye afar off.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%2%%And Moses alone shall come near the LORD: but they shall not come nigh; neither shall the people go up with him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%3%%And Moses came and told the people all the words of the LORD, and all the judgments: and all the people answered with one voice, and said, All the words which the LORD hath said will we perform.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%4%%And Moses wrote all the words of the LORD, and rose early in the morning, and built an altar under the hill, and twelve pillars according to the twelve tribes of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%5%%And he sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered burnt-offerings, and sacrificed peace-offerings of oxen to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%6%%And Moses took half of the blood, and put it in basins; and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%7%%And he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audience of the people: and they said, All that the LORD hath said will we do, and be obedient.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%8%%And Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Behold, the blood of the covenant, which the LORD hath made with you concerning all these words.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%9%%Then went up Moses, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%10%%And they saw the God of Israel: and there was under his feet as it were a paved work of a sapphire-stone, and as it were the body of heaven in its clearness.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%11%%And upon the nobles of the children of Israel he laid not his hand: also they saw God, and ate and drank.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%12%%And the LORD said to Moses, Come up to me on the mount, and be there: and I will give thee tables of stone, and a law, and commandments which I have written; that thou mayst teach them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%13%%And Moses rose up, and his minister Joshua: and Moses went up upon the mount of God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%14%%And he said to the elders, Tarry ye here for us, until we come again to you: and behold, Aaron and Hur are with you: if any man hath any matters to do, let him come to them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%15%%And Moses went up upon the mount, and a cloud covered the mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%16%%And the glory of the LORD abode upon mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days: and the seventh day he called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%17%%And the sight of the glory of the LORD was like devouring fire on the top of the mount, in the eyes of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%24%%18%%And Moses went into the midst of the cloud, and ascended the mount: and Moses was on the mount forty days and forty nights.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, that they bring me an offering: of every man that giveth it willingly with his heart ye shall take my offering.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%3%%And this is the offering which ye shall take of them; gold, and silver and brass,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%4%%And blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%5%%And rams' skins dyed red, and badgers' skins, and shittim wood.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%6%%Oil for the light, spices for anointing oil, and for sweet incense,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%7%%Onyx stones, and stones to be set in the ephod, and in the breast-plate.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%8%%And let them make me a sanctuary; that I may dwell among them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%9%%According to all that I show thee after the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all its instruments, even so shall ye make it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%10%%And they shall make an ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half shall be its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its hight.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%11%%And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without shalt thou overlay it, and shalt make upon it a crown of gold around it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%12%%And thou shalt cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in its four corners; and two rings shall be in the one side of it, and two rings in the other side of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%13%%And thou shalt make staffs of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%14%%And thou shalt put the staffs into the rings by the sides of the ark, that the ark may be borne with them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%15%%The staffs shall be in the rings of the ark: they shall not be taken from it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%16%%And thou shalt put into the ark the testimony which I shall give thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%17%%And thou shalt make a mercy-seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half shall be its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%18%%And thou shalt make two cherubim of gold, of beaten work shalt thou make them, in the two ends of the mercy-seat.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%19%%And make one cherub on the one end, and the other cherub on the other end: even of the mercy-seat shall ye make the cherubim on its two ends.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%20%%And the cherubim shall stretch forth their wings on high, covering the mercy-seat with their wings, and their faces shall look one to another; towards the mercy-seat shall the faces of the cherubim be.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%21%%And thou shalt put the mercy-seat above upon the ark; and in the ark thou shalt put the testimony that I shall give thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%22%%And there I will meet with thee, and I will commune with thee from above the mercy-seat, from between the two cherubim which are upon the ark of the testimony, of all things which I will give thee in commandment to the children of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%23%%Thou shalt also make a table of shittim wood: its length shall be two cubits, and its breadth a cubit, and its hight a cubit and a half.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%24%%And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, and make to it a crown of gold around it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%25%%And thou shalt make to it a border of an hand-breadth around it, and thou shalt make a golden crown to its border around it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%26%%And thou shalt make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that are on its four feet.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%27%%Over against the border shall the rings be for places of the staffs to bear the table.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%28%%And thou shalt make the staffs of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be borne with them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%29%%And thou shalt make its dishes, and its spoons, and its covers, and its bowls, to cover it with: of pure gold shalt thou make them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%30%%And thou shalt set upon the table show-bread before me always.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%31%%And thou shalt make a candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work shall the candlestick be made: its shaft, and its branches, its bowls, its knobs, and its flowers, shall be of the same.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%32%%And six branches shall extend from the sides of it; three branches of the candlestick from the one side, and three branches of the candlestick from the other side:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%33%%Three bowls made like to almonds, with a knob and a flower in one branch; and three bowls made like almonds in the other branch, with a knob and a flower: so in the six branches that project from the candlestick.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%34%%And in the candlesticks shall be four bowls made like to almonds, with their knobs and their flowers.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%35%%And there shall be a knob under two branches of the same, and a knob under two branches of the same, and a knob under two branches of the same, according to the six branches that project from the candlestick.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%36%%Their knobs and their branches shall be of the same: all of it shall be one beaten work of pure gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%37%%And thou shalt make its seven lamps: and they shall light its lamps, that they may give light over against it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%38%%And its tongs, and its snuff-dishes, shall be of pure gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%39%%Of a talent of pure gold shall he make it, with all these vessels.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%25%%40%%And look that thou make them after their pattern, which was shown thee on the mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%1%%Moreover, thou shalt make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubim of curious work shalt thou make them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%2%%The length of one curtain shall be eight and twenty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and every one of the curtains shall have one measure.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%3%%The five curtains shall be coupled together one to another; and other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%4%%And thou shalt make loops of blue upon the edge of the one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling; and likewise shalt thou make in the uttermost edge of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%5%%Fifty loops shalt thou make in the one curtain, and fifty loops shalt thou make in the edge of the curtain that is in the coupling of the second; that the loops may take hold one of another.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%6%%And thou shalt make fifty buttons of gold, and couple the curtains together with the buttons: and it shall be one tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%7%%And thou shalt make curtains of goats' hair to be a covering upon the tabernacle: eleven curtains shalt thou make.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%8%%The length of one curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: and the eleven curtains shall be all of one measure.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%9%%And thou shalt couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and shalt double the sixth curtain in the front of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%10%%And thou shalt make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain that is outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops in the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%11%%And thou shalt make fifty buttons of brass, and put the buttons into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%12%%And the remnant that remaineth of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remaineth, shall hang over the backside of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%13%%And a cubit on the one side, and a cubit on the other side of that which remaineth in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%14%%And thou shalt make a covering for the tent, of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering above of badgers' skins.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%15%%And thou shalt make boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood standing up.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%16%%Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a half shall be the breadth of one board.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%17%%Two tenons shall there be in one board, set in order one against another: thus shalt thou make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%18%%And thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards on the south side southward.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%19%%And thou shalt make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%20%%And for the second side of the tabernacle on the north side there shall be twenty boards:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%21%%And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%22%%And for the sides of the tabernacle westward thou shalt make six boards.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%23%%And two boards shalt thou make for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%24%%And they shall be coupled together beneath, and they shall be coupled together above the head of it to one ring: thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%25%%And they shall be eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%26%%And thou shalt make bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%27%%And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the two sides westward.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%28%%And the middle bar in the midst of the boards shall reach from end to end.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%29%%And thou shalt overlay the boards with gold, and make their rings of gold for places for the bars; and thou shalt overlay the bars with gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%30%%And thou shalt rear up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which was shown thee on the mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%31%%And thou shalt make a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen of curious work: with cherubim shall it be made.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%32%%And thou shalt hang it upon four pillars of shittim wood overlaid with gold: their hooks shall be of gold, upon the four sockets of silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%33%%And thou shalt hang the vail under the buttons, that thou mayst bring in thither within the vail the ark of the testimony: and the vail shall divide to you between the holy place and the most holy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%34%%And thou shalt put the mercy-seat upon the ark of the testimony, in the most holy place.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%35%%And thou shalt set the table without the vail, and the candlestick over against the table on the side of the tabernacle towards the south: and thou shalt put the table on the north side.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%36%%And thou shalt make a hanging for the door of the tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needle work.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%26%%37%%And thou shalt make for the hanging five pillars of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold, and their hooks shall be of gold: and thou shalt cast five sockets of brass for them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%1%%And thou shalt make an altar of shittim wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and its hight shall be three cubits.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%2%%And thou shalt make the horns of it upon the four corners thereof: its horns shall be of the same: and thou shalt overlay it with brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%3%%And thou shalt make its pans to receive its ashes, and its shovels, and its basins, and its flesh-hooks, and its fire-pans: all its vessels thou shalt make of brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%4%%And thou shalt make for it a grate of net-work of brass; and upon the net shalt thou make four brazen rings in its four corners.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%5%%And thou shalt put it under the compass of the altar beneath, that the net may be even to the midst of the altar.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%6%%And thou shalt make staffs for the altar, staffs of shittim wood, and overlay them with brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%7%%And the staffs shall be put into the rings, and the staffs shall be upon the two sides of the altar, to bear it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%8%%Hollow with boards shalt thou make it: as it was shown thee on the mount, so shall they make it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%9%%And thou shalt make the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward there shall be hangings for the court of fine twined linen of a hundred cubits long for one side:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%10%%And its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets shall be of brass: the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%11%%And likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings of a hundred cubits long, and its twenty pillars and their twenty sockets of brass: the hooks of the pillars and their fillets of silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%12%%And for the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits: their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%13%%And the breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be fifty cubits.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%14%%The hangings of one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits: their pillars three, and their sockets three.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%15%%And on the other side shall be hangings, fifteen cubits: their pillars three, and their sockets three.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%16%%And for the gate of the court shall be a hanging of twenty cubits, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, wrought with needle-work: and their pillars shall be four, and their sockets four.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%17%%All the pillars around the court shall be filleted with silver: their hooks shall be of silver, and their sockets of brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%18%%The length of the court shall be a hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty every where, and the hight five cubits of fine twined linen, and their sockets of brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%19%%All the vessels of the tabernacle in all the service thereof, and all the pins thereof, and all the pins of the court, shall be of brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%20%%And thou shalt command the children of Israel, that they bring the pure olive-oil beaten for the light, to cause the lamp to burn always.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%27%%21%%In the tabernacle of the congregation without the vail, which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall order it from evening to morning before the LORD: It shall be a statute for ever to their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%1%%And take thou to thee Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may minister to me in the priest's office, even Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron's sons.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%2%%And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, for glory and for beauty.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%3%%And thou shalt speak to all that are wise in heart, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron's garments to consecrate him, that he may minister to me in the priest's office.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%4%%And these are the garments which they shall make; a breast-plate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a broidered coat, a miter, and a girdle; and they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, and his sons, that he may minister to me in the priest's office.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%5%%And they shall take gold, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%6%%And they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, and of purple, of scarlet, and fine twined linen, with curious work.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%7%%It shall have the two shoulder-pieces thereof joined at the two edges thereof; and so it shall be joined together.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%8%%And the curious girdle of the ephod, which is upon it, shall be of the same, according to its work; even of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%9%%And thou shalt take two onyx stones, and engrave on them the names of the children of Israel:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%10%%Six of their names on one stone, and the six names of the rest on the other stone, according to their birth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%11%%With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, shalt thou engrave the two stones with the names of the children of Israel: thou shalt make them to be set in ouches of gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%12%%And thou shalt put the two stones upon the shoulders of the ephod for stones of memorial to the children of Israel: and Aaron shall bear their names before the LORD upon his two shoulders for a memorial.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%13%%And thou shalt make ouches of gold;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%14%%And two chains of pure gold at the ends; of wreathed work shalt thou make them, and fasten the wreathed chains to the ouches.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%15%%And thou shalt make the breast-plate of judgment with curious work; after the work of the ephod thou shalt make it; of gold, of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine twined linen shalt thou make it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%16%%Foursquare it shall be, being doubled; a span shall be its length, and a span shall be its breadth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%17%%And thou shalt set in it settings of stones, even four rows of stones: the first row shall be a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this shall be the first row.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%18%%And the second row shall be an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%19%%And the third row a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%20%%And the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%21%%And the stones shall be with the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet; every one with his name shall they be according to the twelve tribes.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%22%%And thou shalt make upon the breast-plate chains at the ends of wreathed work of pure gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%23%%And thou shalt make upon the breast-plate two rings of gold, and shalt put the two rings on the two ends of the breast-plate.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%24%%And thou shalt put the two wreathed chains of gold in the two rings which are on the ends of the breast-plate.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%25%%And the other two ends of the two wreathed chains thou shalt fasten in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod before it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%26%%And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and thou shalt put them upon the two ends of the breast-plate in its border, which is in the side of the ephod inward.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%27%%And two other rings of gold thou shalt make, and shalt put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, towards the forepart of it, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%28%%And they shall bind the breast-plate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breast-plate be not loosed from the ephod.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%29%%And Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breast-plate of judgment upon his heart, when he entereth into the holy place, for a memorial before the LORD continually.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%30%%And thou shalt put in the breast-plate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be upon Aaron's heart, when he goeth in before the LORD: and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel upon his heart before the LORD continually.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%31%%And thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%32%%And there shall be a hole in the top of it, in the midst of it: it shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as the hole of an habergeon, that it be not rent.
