1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%33%%And beneath, upon the hem of it thou shalt make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, round about its hem; and bells of gold between them around it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%34%%A golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe around it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%35%%And it shall be upon Aaron, to minister: and his sound shall be heard when he goeth in to the holy place before the LORD, and when he cometh out; that he may not die.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%36%%And thou shalt make a plate of pure gold, and engrave upon it, like the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%37%%And thou shalt put it on a blue lace, that it may be upon the miter; upon the front of the miter it shall be.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%38%%And it shall be upon Aaron's forehead, that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the children of Israel shall hallow in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always upon his forehead, that they may be accepted before the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%39%%And thou shalt embroider the coat of fine linen, and thou shalt make the miter of fine linen, and thou shalt make the girdle of needle-work.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%40%%And for Aaron's sons thou shalt make coats, and thou shalt make for them girdles, and bonnets shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%41%%And thou shalt put them upon Aaron thy brother, and on his sons with him: and shalt anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister to me in the priest's office.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%42%%And thou shalt make them linen breeches to cover their nakedness: from the loins even to the thighs they shall reach:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%28%%43%%And they shall be upon Aaron, and upon his sons, when they enter in to the tabernacle of the congregation, or when they come near to the altar to minister in the holy place; that they bear not iniquity, and die. It shall be a statute for ever to him, and to his seed after him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%1%%And this is the thing that thou shalt do to them to hallow them, to minister to me in the priest's office: Take one young bullock, and two rams without blemish,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%2%%And unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil; of wheat flour shalt thou make them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%3%%And thou shalt put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%4%%And Aaron and his sons thou shalt bring to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shalt wash them with water.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%5%%And thou shalt take the garments, and put upon Aaron, the coat, and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breast-plate, and gird him with the curious girdle of the ephod:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%6%%And thou shalt put the miter upon his head, and put the holy crown upon the miter.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%7%%Then shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour it upon his head, and anoint him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%8%%And thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%9%%And thou shalt gird them with girdles (Aaron and his sons) and put the bonnets on them; and the priest's office shall be theirs for a perpetual statute: and thou shalt consecrate Aaron and his sons.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%10%%And thou shalt cause a bullock to be brought before the tabernacle of the congregation; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the bullock.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%11%%And thou shalt kill the bullock before the LORD, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%12%%And thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and put it upon the horns of the altar with thy finger, and pour all the blood beside the bottom of the altar.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%13%%And thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul that is above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and burn them upon the altar.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%14%%But the flesh of the bullock, and his skin, and his dung shalt thou burn with fire without the camp: it is a sin-offering.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%15%%Thou shalt also take one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%16%%And thou shalt slay the ram, and thou shalt take his blood, and sprinkle it around upon the altar.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%17%%And thou shalt cut the ram in pieces, and wash the inwards of him, and his legs, and put them to his pieces, and to his head.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%18%%And thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar: it is a burnt-offering to the LORD: it is a sweet savor, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%19%%And thou shalt take the other ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%20%%Then shalt thou kill the ram, and take of his blood, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and upon the tip of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%21%%And thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be hallowed, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons garments with him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%22%%Also thou shalt take of the ram the fat and the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder; for it is a ram of consecration:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%23%%And one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread, that is before the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%24%%And thou shalt put all in the hands of Aaron, and in the hands of his sons; and shalt wave them for a wave-offering before the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%25%%And thou shalt receive them from their hands, and burn them upon the altar for a burnt-offering, for a sweet savor before the LORD: it is an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%26%%And thou shalt take the breast of the ram of Aaron's consecration, and wave it for a wave-offering before the LORD: and it shall be thy part.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%27%%And thou shalt sanctify the breast of the wave-offering, and the shoulder of the heave-offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up of the ram of the consecration, even of that which is for Aaron, and of that which is for his sons:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%28%%And it shall be Aaron's and his sons' by a statute for ever, from the children of Israel: for it is a heave-offering: and it shall be a heave-offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifice of their peace-offerings, even their heave-offering to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%29%%And the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons' after him, to be anointed therein, and to be consecrated in them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%30%%And that son, that is priest in his stead, shall put them on seven days, when he cometh into the tabernacle of the congregation to minister in the holy place.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%31%%And thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%32%%And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%33%%And they shall eat those things with which the atonement was made, to consecrate and to sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat of them, because they are holy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%34%%And if aught of the flesh of the consecration, or of the bread, shall remain till the morning, then thou shalt burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%35%%And thus shalt thou do to Aaron, and to his sons, according to all things which I have commanded thee: seven days shalt thou consecrate them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%36%%And thou shalt offer every day a bullock for a sin-offering for atonement; and thou shalt cleanse the altar, when thou hast made an atonement for it, and thou shalt anoint it, to sanctify it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%37%%Seven days thou shalt make an atonement for the altar, and sanctify it; and it shall be an altar most holy: whatever toucheth the altar shall be holy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%38%%Now this is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar; two lambs of the first year, day by day continually.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%39%%The one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning; and the other lamb thou shalt offer at evening.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%40%%And with the one lamb a tenth-portion of flour mingled with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil; and the fourth part of a hin of wine for a drink-offering.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%41%%And the other lamb thou shalt offer at evening, and shalt do thereto according to the meat-offering of the morning, and according to the drink-offering thereof, for a sweet savor, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%42%%This shall be a continual burnt-offering throughout your generations at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD: where I will meet you to speak there to thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%43%%And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and the tabernacle shall be sanctified by my glory.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%44%%And I will sanctify the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar: I will sanctify also both Aaron and his sons, to minister to me in the priest's office.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%45%%And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%29%%46%%And they shall know that I am the LORD their God, that brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell among them: I am the LORD their God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%1%%And thou shalt make an altar to burn incense upon: of shittim wood shalt thou make it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%2%%A cubit shall be its length, and a cubit its breadth; foursquare shall it be; and two cubits shall be its hight: its horns shall be of the same.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%3%%And thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, its top, and its sides round about, and its horns; and thou shalt make to it a crown of gold round about.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%4%%And two golden rings shalt thou make to it under the crown of it, by its two corners, upon the two sides of it shalt thou make it; and they shall be for places for the staffs to bear it with.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%5%%And thou shalt make the staffs of shittim wood, and overlay them with gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%6%%And thou shalt put it before the vail that is by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy-seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%7%%And Aaron shall burn upon it sweet incense every morning: when he dresseth the lamps, he shall burn incense upon it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%8%%And when Aaron lighteth the lamps at evening, he shall burn incense upon it; a perpetual incense before the LORD, throughout your generations.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%9%%Ye shall offer no strange incense upon it, nor burnt-sacrifice, nor meat-offering; neither shall ye pour drink-offering upon it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%10%%And Aaron shall make an atonement upon the horns of it once in a year, with the blood of the sin-offering of atonements: once in a year shall he make atonement upon it throughout your generations: it is most holy to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%11%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%12%%When thou takest the sum of the children of Israel after their number, then shall they give every man a ransom for his soul to the LORD, when thou numberest them: that there may be no plague among them, when thou numberest them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%13%%This they shall give, every one that passeth among them that are numbered, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary: (a shekel is twenty gerahs:) a half shekel shall be the offering of the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%14%%Every one that passeth among them that are numbered from twenty years old and above, shall give an offering to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%15%%The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when they give an offering to the LORD to make an atonement for your souls.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%16%%And thou shalt take the atonement-money of the children of Israel, and shalt appoint it for the service of the tabernacle of the congregation; that it may be a memorial to the children of Israel before the LORD, to make an atonement for your souls.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%17%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%18%%Thou shalt also make a laver of brass, and its foot also of brass, to wash in: and thou shalt put it between the tabernacle of the congregation and the altar, and thou shalt put water therein.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%19%%For Aaron and their sons shall wash their hands and their feet thereat:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%20%%When they go into the tabernacle of the congregation, they shall wash with water, that they die not: or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%21%%So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they die not: and it shall be a statute for ever to them, even to him and to his seed throughout their generations.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%22%%Moreover the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%23%%Take thou also to thee principal spices, of pure myrrh five hundred shekels, and of sweet cinnamon half as much, even two hundred and fifty shekels, and of sweet calamus two hundred and fifty shekels,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%24%%And of cassia five hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, and of olive-oil a hin:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%25%%And thou shalt make it an oil of holy ointment, an ointment compound after the art of the apothecary: it shall be a holy anointing oil.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%26%%And thou shalt anoint the tabernacle of the congregation with it, and the ark of the testimony,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%27%%And the table and all its vessels, and the candlestick and its vessels, and the altar of incense,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%28%%And the altar of burnt-offering with all its vessels, and the laver and its foot.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%29%%And thou shalt sanctify them, that they may be most holy: whatever toucheth them shall be holy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%30%%And thou shalt anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that they may minister to me in the priest's office.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%31%%And thou shalt speak to the children of Israel, saying, This shall be a holy anointing oil to me, throughout your generations.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%32%%Upon man's flesh shall it not be poured, neither shall ye make any other like it, after the composition of it: it is holy, and it shall be holy to you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%33%%Whoever compoundeth any like it, or whoever putteth any of it upon a stranger, shall even be cut off from his people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%34%%And the LORD said to Moses, Take to thee sweet spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum; these sweet spices with pure frankincense: of each shall there be a like weight:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%35%%And thou shalt make it a perfume, a confection after the art of the apothecary, tempered together, pure and holy:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%36%%And thou shalt beat some of it very small, and put of it before the testimony in the tabernacle of the congregation, where I will meet with thee: it shall be to you most holy:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%37%%And as for the perfume which thou shalt make, ye shall not make to yourselves according to its composition: it shall be to thee holy for the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%30%%38%%Whoever shall make the like to that, to smell thereto, shall even be cut off from his people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%2%%See, I have called by name Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%3%%And I have filled him with the spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%4%%To devise curious works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%5%%And in cutting of stones to set them, and in carving of timber, to work in all manner of workmanship.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%6%%And I, behold, I have given with him Aholiab the son of Ahisamach of the tribe of Dan; and in the hearts of all that are wise-hearted I have put wisdom; that they may make all that I have commanded thee:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%7%%The tabernacle of the congregation, and the ark of the testimony, and the mercy-seat that is upon it, and all the furniture of the tabernacle,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%8%%And the table and its furniture, and the pure candlestick with all its furniture, and the altar of incense,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%9%%And the altar of burnt-offering, with all its furniture, and the laver and its foot,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%10%%And the clothes of service, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest's office,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%11%%And the anointing oil, and sweet incense for the holy place: according to all that I have commanded thee, shall they do.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%12%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%13%%Speak thou also to the children of Israel, saying, Verily my sabbaths ye shall keep: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that ye may know that I am the LORD that doth sanctify you.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%14%%Ye shall keep the sabbath therefore: for it is holy to you. Every one that profaneth it shall surely be put to death: for whoever doeth any work therein, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%15%%Six days may work be done, but in the seventh is the sabbath of rest, holy to the LORD: whoever doeth any work in the sabbath-day, he shall surely be put to death.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%16%%Wherefore the children of Israel shall keep the sabbath, to observe the sabbath throughout their generations, for a perpetual covenant.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%17%%It is a sign between me and the children of Israel for ever: for in six days the LORD made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%31%%18%%And to Moses, when he had made an end of communing with him upon mount Sinai, he gave two tables of testimony, tables of stone, written with the finger of God.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%1%%And when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mount, the people assembled themselves to Aaron, and said to him, Arise, make us gods which shall go before us: for as for this Moses, the man that brought us out of the land of Egypt, we know not what is become of him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%2%%And Aaron said to them, Break off the golden ear-rings which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them to me.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%3%%And all the people broke off the golden ear-rings which were in their ears, and brought them to Aaron.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%4%%And he received them at their hand, and fashioned it with a graving tool, after he had made it a molten calf: and they said, These are thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%5%%And when Aaron saw it, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made proclamation, and said, To-morrow is a feast to the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%6%%And they rose early on the morrow, and offered burnt-offerings, and brought peace-offerings: and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%7%%And the LORD said to Moses, Go, go down; for thy people, which thou broughtest out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%8%%They have turned aside quickly from the way which I commanded them: they have made them a molten calf, and have worshiped it, and have sacrificed to it, and said, These are thy gods, O Israel, which have brought thee out of the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%9%%And the LORD said to Moses, I have seen this people, and behold it is a stiff-necked people:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%10%%Now therefore let me alone, that my wrath may wax hot against them, and that I may consume them: and I will make of thee a great nation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%11%%And Moses besought the LORD his God, and said, LORD, why [] thy wrath wax hot against thy people, which thou hast [] forth from the land of Egypt, with great power, and with [] mighty hand?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%12%%Why should the Egyptians speak and say, For evil did he bring them out, to slay them in the mountains, and to consume them from the face of the earth? Turn from thy fierce wrath, and repent of this evil against thy people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%13%%Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel thy servants, to whom thou sworest by thine own self, and saidst to them, I will multiply your seed as the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have spoken of will I give to your seed, and they shall inherit it for ever.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%14%%And the LORD repented of the evil which he thought to do to his people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%15%%And Moses turned, and went down from the mount, and the two tables of the testimony were in his hand: the tables were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other were they written.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%16%%And the tables were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, graven upon the tables.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%17%%And when Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, There is a noise of war in the camp.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%18%%And he said, It is not the voice of them that shout for mastery, neither is it the voice of them that cry for being overcome: but the noise of them that sing do I hear.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%19%%And it came to pass as soon as he came nigh to the camp, that he saw the calf, and the dancing: and Moses's anger waxed hot, and he cast the tables from his hands, and broke them beneath the mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%20%%And he took the calf which they had made, and burnt it in the fire, and ground it to powder, and strewed it upon the water, and made the children of Israel drink of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%21%%And Moses said to Aaron, What did this people to thee, that thou hast brought so great a sin upon them?
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%22%%And Aaron said, Let not the anger of my lord wax hot: thou knowest the people that they are set on mischief.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%23%%For they said to me, Make us gods which shall go before us: for as for this Moses, the man that brought us out of the land of Egypt, we know not what is become of him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%24%%And I said to them, Whoever hath any gold, let them break it off: So they gave it to me: then I cast it into the fire, and there came out this calf.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%25%%And when Moses saw that the people were naked (for Aaron had made them naked to their shame, among their enemies:)

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%27%%And he said to them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Put every man his sword by his side, and go in and out from gate to gate throughout the camp, and slay every man his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%28%%And the children of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%29%%For Moses had said, Consecrate yourselves to-day to the LORD, even every man upon his son, and upon his brother; that he may bestow upon you a blessing this day.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%30%%And it came to pass on the morrow, that Moses said to the people, Ye have sinned a great sin: and now I will go up to the LORD; it may be I shall make an atonement for your sin.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%32%%Yet now, if thou wilt, forgive their sin: and if not, blot me, I pray thee, out of thy book which thou hast written.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%32%%35%%And the LORD afflicted the people, because they made the calf which Aaron made.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%1%%And the LORD said to Moses, Depart and go up hence, thou and the people which thou hast conducted from the land of Egypt, to the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, to thy seed will I give it:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%2%%And I will send an angel before thee; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%3%%To a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou art a stiff-necked people: lest I consume thee in the way.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%4%%And when the people heard these evil tidings, they mourned: and no man put on him his ornaments.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%5%%For the LORD had said to Moses, Say to the children of Israel, Ye are a stiff-necked people: I will come up into the midst of thee in a moment, and consume thee: therefore now put off thy ornaments from thee, that I may know what to do to thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%6%%And the children of Israel stripped themselves of their ornaments, by the mount Horeb.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%7%%And Moses took the tabernacle, and pitched it without the camp far from the camp, and called it the Tabernacle of the congregation. And it came to pass, that every one who sought the LORD, went out to the tabernacle of the congregation, which was without the camp.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%8%%And it came to pass when Moses went out to the tabernacle, that all the people rose, and stood every man at his tent-door, and looked after Moses, until he had gone into the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%9%%And it came to pass, as Moses entered into the tabernacle, the cloudy pillar descended, and stood at the door of the tabernacle, and the LORD talked with Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%10%%And all the people saw the cloudy pillar stand at the tabernacle door: and all the people rose and worshiped, every man in his tent-door.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%11%%And the LORD spoke to Moses face to face, as a man speaketh to his friend. And he turned again into the camp; but his servant Joshua the son of Nun, a young man, departed not out of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%12%%And Moses said to the LORD, See, thou sayest to me, Bring up this people: and thou hast not let me know whom thou wilt send with me. Yet thou hast said, I know thee by name, and thou hast also found grace in my sight.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%13%%Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found grace in thy sight, show me now thy way, that I may know thee, that I may find grace in thy sight: and consider that this nation is thy people.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%14%%And he said, My presence shall attend thee, and I will give thee rest.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%15%%And he said to him, If thy presence shall not attend me, conduct us not hence.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%16%%For wherein shall it be known here that I and thy people have found grace in thy sight? Is it not in that thou goest with us? So shall we be separated, I and thy people, from all the people that are upon the face of the earth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%17%%And the LORD said to Moses, I will do this thing also that thou hast spoken: for thou hast found grace in my sight, and I know thee by name.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%18%%And he said, I beseech thee, show me thy glory.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%19%%And he said, I will make all my goodness pass before thee, and I will proclaim the name of the LORD before thee; and will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%20%%And he said, Thou canst not see my face: for there shall no man see me, and live.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%21%%And the LORD said, Behold, there is a place by me, and thou shalt stand upon a rock:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%22%%And it shall come to pass, while my glory passeth by, that I will put thee in a cleft of the rock: and will cover thee with my hand while I pass by:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%33%%23%%And I will take away my hand, and thou shalt see my back parts: but my face shall not be seen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%1%%And the LORD said to Moses, Hew thee two tables of stone like the first; and I will write upon these tables the words that were in the first tables which thou didst break.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%2%%And be ready in the morning, and come up in the morning to mount Sinai, and present thyself there to me on the top of the mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%3%%And no man shall come up with thee, neither let any man be seen throughout all the mount: neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mount.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%4%%And he hewed two tables of stone, like the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up to mount Sinai, as the LORD had commanded him, and took in his hand the two tables of stone.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%5%%And the LORD descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of the LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%6%%And the LORD passed by before him, and proclaimed, The LORD, The LORD God, merciful and gracious, long-suffering, and abundant in goodness and truth.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%7%%Keeping mercy for thousands, forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin, and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and upon the children's children, to the third and to the fourth generation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%8%%And Moses made haste, and bowed his head towards the earth, and worshiped.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%9%%And he said, If now I have found grace in thy sight, O Lord, let my Lord, I pray thee, go among us (for it is a stiff-necked people) and pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for thy inheritance.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%10%%And he said, Behold, I make a covenant: before all thy people I will do wonders, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in any nation: and all the people among which thou art, shall see the work of the LORD: for it is a terrible thing that I will do with thee.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%11%%Observe thou that which I command thee this day: Behold, I drive out before thee the Amorite, and the Canaanite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Hivite, and the Jebusite.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%12%%Take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%13%%But ye shall destroy their altars, break their images, and cut down their groves.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%14%%For thou shalt worship no other god: for the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%15%%Lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, and they go astray after their gods, and do sacrifice to their gods, and one call thee, and thou eat of his sacrifice;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%16%%And thou take of their daughters to thy sons, and their daughters go astray after their gods, and make thy sons go astray after their gods.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%17%%Thou shalt make thee no molten gods.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%18%%The feast of unleavened bread shalt thou keep. Seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread, as I commanded thee, in the time of the month Abib: for in the month Abib thou camest out of from Egypt.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%19%%Every first-born is mine: and every firstling among thy cattle, whether ox or sheep, that is male.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%20%%But the firstling of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb: and if thou shalt not redeem him, then shalt thou break his neck. All the first-born of thy sons thou shalt redeem. And none shall appear before me empty.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%21%%Six days thou shalt work, but on the seventh day thou shalt rest: in time of plowing and in harvest thou shalt rest.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%22%%And thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, of the first-fruits of wheat-harvest, and the feast of in-gathering at the year's end.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%23%%Thrice in the year shall all your male children appear before the Lord GOD, the God of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%24%%For I will drive out the nations before thee, and enlarge thy borders: neither shall any man desire thy land, when thou shalt go up to appear before the LORD thy God, thrice in the year.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%25%%Thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leaven, neither shall the sacrifice of the feast of the passover be left until the morning.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%26%%The first of the first-fruits of thy land thou shalt bring to the house of the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%27%%And the LORD said to Moses, Write thou these words: for after the tenor of these words I have made a covenant with thee, and with Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%28%%And he was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights; he neither ate bread nor drank water: and he wrote upon the tables the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%29%%And it came to pass when Moses came down from mount Sinai (with the two tables of testimony in Moses's hand, when he came down from the mount) that Moses knew not that the skin of his face shone, while he talked with him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%30%%And when Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone, and they were afraid to come nigh him.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%31%%And Moses called to them; and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned to him; and Moses talked with them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%32%%And afterward all the children of Israel came nigh: and he gave them in commandment all that the LORD had spoken with him in mount Sinai.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%34%%34%%But when Moses went in before the LORD to speak with him, he took the vail off, until he came out. And he came out and spoke to the children of Israel that which he was commanded.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%1%%Then wrought Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whom the LORD put wisdom and understanding, to know how to work all manner of work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that the LORD had commanded.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%2%%And Moses called Bezaleel and Aholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart the LORD had put wisdom, even every one whose heart excited him to come to the work to do it:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%3%%And they received from Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, to make it. And they brought yet to him free-offerings every morning.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%4%%And all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary, came every man from his work which they made.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%5%%And they spoke to Moses, saying, The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work, which the LORD commanded to make.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%6%%And Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, Let neither man nor woman make any more work for the offering of the sanctuary. So the people were restrained from bringing.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%7%%For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%8%%And every wise-hearted man among them that wrought the work of the tabernacle made ten curtains of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: he made them with cherubim of curious work.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%9%%The length of one curtain was twenty and eight cubits, and the breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtains were all of one size.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%10%%And he coupled the five curtains one to another: and the other five curtains he coupled one to another.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%11%%And he made loops of blue on the edge of one curtain from the selvedge in the coupling: likewise he made in the extremity of another curtain, in the coupling of the second.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%12%%Fifty loops he made in one curtain, and fifty loops he made in the edge of the curtain which was in the coupling of the second: the loops held one curtain to another.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%13%%And he made fifty buttons of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the buttons. So it became one tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%14%%And he made curtains of goats' hair for the tent over the tabernacle: eleven curtains he made them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%15%%The length of one curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits was the breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtains were of one size.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%16%%And he coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%17%%And he made fifty loops upon the outermost edge of the curtain in the coupling, and fifty loops made he upon the edge of the curtain which coupleth the second.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%18%%And he made fifty buttons of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be one.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%19%%And he made a covering for the tent of rams' skins dyed red, and a covering of badgers' skins above that.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%20%%And he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood, standing up.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%21%%The length of a board was ten cubits, and the breadth of a board one cubit and a half.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%22%%One board had two tenons, equally distant one from another; thus did he make for all the boards of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%23%%And he made boards for the tabernacle; twenty boards for the south side southward:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%24%%And forty sockets of silver he made under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%25%%And for the other side of the tabernacle which is towards the north corner, he made twenty boards.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%26%%And their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%27%%And for the sides of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%28%%And two boards he made for the corners of the tabernacle in the two sides.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%29%%And they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%30%%And there were eight boards; and their sockets were sixteen sockets of silver, under every board two sockets.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%31%%And he made bars of shittim wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%32%%And five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the sides westward.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%33%%And he made the middle bar to shoot through the boards from the one end to the other.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%34%%And he overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold to be places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%35%%And he made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim he made it of curious work.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%36%%And he made to it four pillars of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold: their hooks were of gold; and he cast for them four sockets of silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%37%%And he made a hanging for the tabernacle-door of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, of needle-work;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%36%%38%%And the five pillars of it, with their hooks: and he overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold: but their five sockets were of brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%1%%And Bezaleel made the ark of shittim wood: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a cubit and a half the hight of it:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%2%%And he overlaid it with pure gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%3%%And he cast for it four rings of gold, to be set by the four corners of it; even two rings upon the one side of it, and two rings upon the other side of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%4%%And he made staffs of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%5%%And he put the staffs into the rings by the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%6%%And he made the mercy-seat of pure gold: two cubits and a half was the length of it, and one cubit and a half the breadth of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%7%%And he made two cherubim of gold, beaten out of one piece he made them, on the two ends of the mercy-seat;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%8%%One cherub on the end on this side, and another cherub on the other end on that side: out of the mercy-seat made he the cherubim on the two ends of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%9%%And the cherubim spread out their wings on high, and covered with their wings over the mercy-seat, with their faces one to another; even towards the mercy-seat were the faces of the cherubim.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%10%%And he made the table of shittim wood: two cubits was its length, and a cubit its breadth, and a cubit and a half its hight:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%11%%And he overlaid it with pure gold, and made to it a crown of gold round about.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%12%%Also he made to it a border of a hand-breadth round about; and made a crown of gold for its border round about.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%13%%And he cast for it four rings of gold, and put the rings upon the four corners that were in its four feet.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%14%%Over against the border were the rings, the places for the staffs, to bear the table.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%15%%And he made the staffs of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold, to bear the table.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%16%%And he made the vessels which were upon the table, its dishes, and its spoons, and its bowls, and its covers to cover with, of pure gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%17%%And he made the candlestick of pure gold; of beaten work he made the candlestick; its shaft, and its branch, its bowls, its knobs, and its flowers were of the same:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%18%%And six branches proceeding from its sides; three branches of the candlestick from the one side of it, and three branches of the candlestick from the other side of it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%19%%Three bowls made after the fashion of almonds in one branch, a knob and a flower; and three bowls made like almonds in another branch, a knob and a flower: so throughout the six branches proceeding from the candlestick.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%20%%And in the candlestick were four bowls made like almonds, its knobs, and its flowers:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%21%%And a knob under two branches of the same, and a knob under two branches of the same, and a knob under two branches of the same, according to the six branches proceeding from it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%22%%Their knobs and their branches were of the same: all of it was one beaten work of pure gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%23%%And he made its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff-dishes, of pure gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%24%%Of a talent of pure gold he made it, and all its vessels.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%25%%And he made the incense-altar of shittim wood: the length of it was a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit; it was foursquare; and two cubits was the hight of it; the horns of it were of the same.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%26%%And he overlaid it with pure gold, both the top of it, and its sides round about, and its horns: also he made to it a crown of gold round about.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%37%%29%%And he made the holy anointing oil, and the pure incense of sweet spices, according to the work of the apothecary.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%1%%And he made the altar of burnt-offering of shittim wood: five cubits was the length of it, and five cubits the breadth of it; it was foursquare; and its hight was three cubits.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%2%%And he made its horns on the four corners of it; its horns were of the same: and he overlaid it with brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%3%%And he made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, and the shovels, and the basins, and the flesh-hooks, and the fire-pans: all the vessels of it he made of brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%4%%And he made for the altar a brazen grate of net-work under the compass of it beneath to the midst of it.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%6%%And he made the staffs of shittim wood, and overlaid them with brass.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%8%%And he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass, of the looking-glasses of the women assembling, who assembled at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%9%%And he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, a hundred cubits:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%10%%Their pillars were twenty, and their brazen sockets twenty; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, were of silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%11%%And for the north side, the hangings were a hundred cubits, their pillars were twenty, and their sockets of brass twenty: the hooks of the pillars, and their filets, of silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%12%%And for the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%13%%And for the east side eastward fifty cubits.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%14%%The hangings of the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%15%%And for the other side of the court-gate, on this hand and that hand, were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%16%%All the hangings of the court round about were of fine twined linen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%17%%And the sockets for the pillars were of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver; and the overlaying of their capitals of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%18%%And the hanging for the gate of the court was needle-work, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen: and twenty cubits was the length, and the hight in the breadth was five cubits, answerable to the hangings of the court.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%19%%And their pillars were four, and their sockets of brass four; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals and their fillets of silver.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%20%%And all the pins of the tabernacle, and of the court round about, were of brass.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%21%%This is the sum of the tabernacle, even of the tabernacle of testimony, as it was counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, son to Aaron the priest.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%22%%And Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%23%%And with him was Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a skillful workman, and an embroiderer in blue, and in purple, and in scarlet, and fine linen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%24%%All the gold that was occupied for the work in all the work of the holy place, even the gold of the offering, was twenty and nine talents, and seven hundred and thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%25%%And the silver of them that were numbered of the congregation was a hundred talents, and a thousand seven hundred and seventy five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%26%%A bekah for every man, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for every one that went to be numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty men.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%38%%28%%And of the thousand seven hundred seventy and five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, and overlaid their capitals, and filleted them.

1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%1%%And of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made clothes of service, to do service in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%2%%And he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%3%%And they beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, with curious work.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%4%%They made shoulder-pieces for it, to couple it together: by the two edges was it coupled together.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%5%%And the curious girdle of his ephod, that was upon it, was of the same, according to the work thereof; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%6%%And they wrought onyx stones inclosed in ouches of gold, graven as signets are graven, with the names of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%7%%And he put them on the shoulders of the ephod, that they should be stones for a memorial to the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%8%%And he made the breast-plate of curious work, like the work of the ephod; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%9%%It was foursquare; they made the breast-plate double: a span was the length of it, and a span the breadth of it, being doubled.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%10%%And they set in it four rows of stones: the first row was a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this was the first row.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%11%%And the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%12%%And the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%13%%And the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: they were inclosed in ouches of gold in their inclosings.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%14%%And the stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet, every one with his name, according to the twelve tribes.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%15%%And they made upon the breast-plate chains at the ends, of wreathed work of pure gold.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%16%%And they made two ouches of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings in the two ends of the breast-plate.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%17%%And they put the two wreathed chains of gold in the two rings on the ends of the breast-plate.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%18%%And the two ends of the two wreathed chains they fastened in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulder-pieces of the ephod, before it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%19%%And they made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breast-plate, upon the border of it, which was on the side of the ephod inward.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%20%%And they made two other golden rings, and put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, towards the forepart of it, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%21%%And they bound the breast-plate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breast-plate might not be loosed from the ephod; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%22%%And he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%23%%And there was a hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of an habergeon, with a band around the hole, that it should not rend.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%24%%And they made upon the hems of the robe pomegranates of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and twined linen.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%25%%And they made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates upon the hem of the robe, around between the pomegranates;
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%26%%A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the hem of the robe to minister in; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%27%%And they made coats of fine linen, of woven work, for Aaron and for his sons,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%28%%And a miter of fine linen, and goodly bonnets of fine linen, and linen breeches of fine twined linen,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%29%%And a girdle of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, of needle-work; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%30%%And they made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote upon it a writing, like to the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%31%%And they tied to it a lace of blue, to fasten it on high upon the miter; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%32%%Thus was all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation finished: and the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did they.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%33%%And they brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent, and all its furniture, its buttons, its boards, its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%34%%And the covering of rams' skins dyed red, and the covering of badgers' skins, and the vail of the covering,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%35%%The ark of the testimony, and its staffs, and the mercy-seat,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%36%%The table, and all its vessels, and the show-bread,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%37%%The pure candlestick, with its lamps, even with the lamps to be set in order, and all its vessels, and the oil for light,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%38%%And the golden altar, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the tabernacle-door,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%39%%The brazen altar, and its grate of brass, its staffs, and all its vessels, the laver and its foot,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%40%%The hangings of the court, its pillars, and its sockets, and the hanging for the court-gate, its cords, and its pins, and all the vessels of the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of the congregation,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%41%%The clothes of service to do service in the holy place, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and his sons' garments, to minister in the priest's office.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%42%%According to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so the children of Israel made all the work.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%39%%43%%And Moses looked upon all the work, and behold, they had done it as the LORD had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%2%%On the first day of the first month shalt thou set up the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%3%%And thou shalt put in it the ark of the testimony, and cover the ark with the vail.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%4%%And thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the candlestick, and light its lamps.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%5%%And thou shalt set the altar of gold for the incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the hanging of the door to the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%6%%And thou shalt set the altar of the, burnt-offering before the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%7%%And thou shalt set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and shalt put water in it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%8%%And thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the hanging at the court-gate.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%9%%And thou shalt take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is in it, and shalt hallow it, and all its vessels: and it shall be holy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%10%%And thou shalt anoint the altar of the burnt-offering and all its vessels, and sanctify the altar: and it shall be an altar most holy.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%11%%And thou shalt anoint the laver and its foot, and sanctify it.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%12%%And thou shalt bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and wash them with water.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%13%%And thou shalt put upon Aaron the holy garments, and anoint him, and sanctify him; that he may minister to me in the priest's office.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%14%%And thou shalt bring his sons, and clothe them with coats:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%15%%And thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that they may minister to me in the priest's office: for their anointing shall surely be an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%16%%Thus did Moses; according to all that the LORD commanded him, so did he.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%17%%And it came to pass in the first month, in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was reared up.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%18%%And Moses reared up the tabernacle, and fastened its sockets, and set up its boards, and put in its bars, and reared up its pillars.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%19%%And he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%20%%And he took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the staffs on the ark, and put the mercy-seat above upon the ark:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%21%%And he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the vail of the covering, and covered the ark of the testimony; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%22%%And he put the table in the tent of the congregation, upon the side of the tabernacle northward, without the vail.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%23%%And he set the bread in order upon it before the LORD; as the LORD had commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%24%%And he put the candlestick in the tent of the congregation, over against the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%25%%And he lighted the lamps before the LORD, as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%26%%And he put the golden altar in the tent of the congregation, before the vail:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%27%%And he burnt sweet incense on it; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%28%%And he set up the hanging at the door of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%29%%And he put the altar of burnt-offering by the door of the tabernacle of the tent of the congregation, and offered upon it the burnt-offering, and the meat-offering; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%30%%And he set the laver between the tent of the congregation and the altar, and put water there, to wash with.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%31%%And Moses, and Aaron, and his sons, washed their hands and their feet thereat:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%32%%When they went into the tent of the congregation, and when they came near to the altar, they washed; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%33%%And he reared up the court round about the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the hanging of the court-gate: so Moses finished the work.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%34%%Then a cloud covered the tent of the congregation, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%35%%And Moses was not able to enter into the tent of the congregation, because the cloud abode upon it, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%36%%And when the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward in all their journeys:
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%37%%But if the cloud was not taken up, then they journeyed not till the day that it was taken up.
1000005%%Exodus%%OT%%40%%38%%For the cloud of the LORD was upon the tabernacle by day, and fire was on it by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%1%%And the LORD called to Moses, and spoke to him out of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, If any man of you shall bring an offering to the LORD, ye shall bring your offering of the cattle, even of the herd, and of the flock.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%3%%If his offering shall be a burnt-sacrifice of the herd, let him offer a male without blemish: he shall offer it of his own voluntary will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%4%%And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt-offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%5%%And he shall kill the bullock before the LORD: and the priests, Aaron's sons, shall bring the blood, and sprinkle the blood around upon the altar that is by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%6%%And he shall flay the burnt-offering, and cut it into its pieces,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%7%%And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar, and lay the wood in order upon the fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%8%%And the priests, Aaron's sons, shall lay the parts, the head, and the fat, in order upon the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%9%%But his inwards and his legs shall he wash in water: and the priest shall burn all on the altar, to be a burnt-sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%10%%And if his offering be of the flocks, namely, of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt-sacrifice; he shall bring it a male without blemish.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%11%%And he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before the LORD: and the priests, Aaron's sons, shall sprinkle his blood around upon the altar:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%12%%And he shall cut it into its pieces, with its head and its fat: and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%13%%But he shall wash the inwards and the legs with water: and the priest shall bring it all, and burn it upon the altar: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%14%%And if the burnt sacrifice for his offering to the LORD shall be of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtle doves, or of young pigeons.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%15%%And the priest shall bring it to the altar, and wring off its head, and burn it on the altar: and its blood shall be wrung out at the side of the altar:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%16%%And he shall pluck away its crop with its feathers, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, by the place of the ashes:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%1%%17%%And he shall cleave it with its wings, but shall not divide it asunder: and the priest shall burn it upon the altar, upon the wood that is upon the fire: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%1%%And when any will offer a meat-offering to the LORD, his offering shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense upon it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%2%%And he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests: and he shall take out of it his handful of its flour, and of its oil, with all its frankincense; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar, to be an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to the LORD:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%3%%And the remnant of the meat-offering shall be Aaron's and his sons': it is a thing most holy of the offerings of the LORD made by fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%4%%And if thou shalt bring an oblation of a meat-offering baked in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%5%%And if thy oblation shall be a meat-offering baked in a pan, it shall be of fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%6%%Thou shalt part it in pieces, and pour oil upon it: it is a meat-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%7%%And if thy oblation shall be a meat-offering baked in the frying-pan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%8%%And thou shalt bring the meat-offering that is made of these things to the LORD: and when it is presented to the priest, he shall bring it to the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%9%%And the priest shall take from the meat-offering a memorial of it, and shall burn it upon the altar: it is an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%10%%And that which is left of the meat-offering shall be Aaron's and his sons': it is a thing most holy, of the offerings of the LORD made by fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%11%%No meat-offering which ye shall bring to the LORD shall be made with leaven: for ye shall burn no leaven, nor any honey, in any offering of the LORD made by fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%12%%As for the oblation of the first-fruits, ye shall offer them to the LORD: but they shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savor.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%13%%And every oblation of thy meat-offering shalt thou season with salt: neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the covenant of thy God to be lacking from thy meat-offering: with all thy offerings thou shalt offer salt.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%14%%And if thou shalt offer a meat-offering of thy first-fruits to the LORD, thou shalt offer for the meat-offering of thy first-fruits, green ears of corn dried by the fire, even corn beaten out of full ears.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%15%%And thou shalt put oil upon it, and lay frankincense upon it: it is a meat-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%2%%16%%And the priest shall burn the memorial of it, part of its beaten corn, and part of its oil, with all its frankincense: it is an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%1%%And if his oblation shall be a sacrifice of peace-offering, if he shall offer it of the herd, whether a male or female; he shall offer it without blemish before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%2%%And he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and kill it at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron's sons the priests shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%3%%And he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace-offering, an offering made by fire to the LORD; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%4%%And the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%5%%And Aaron's sons shall burn it on the altar, upon the burnt-sacrifice which is upon the wood that is on the fire: it is an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%6%%And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace-offering to the LORD shall be of the flock, male or female; he shall offer it without blemish.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%7%%If he shall offer a lamb for his offering, then shall he offer it before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%8%%And he shall lay his hand upon the head of his offering, and kill it before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron's sons shall sprinkle the blood of it around upon the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%9%%And he shall offer of the sacrifice of the peace-offering an offering made by fire to the LORD: its fat, and the whole rump, that shall he take off hard by the back-bone; and the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%10%%And the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, that shall he take away.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%11%%And the priest shall burn it upon the altar: it is the food of the offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%12%%And if his offering shall be a goat, then he shall offer it before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%13%%And he shall lay his hand upon the head of it, and kill it before the tabernacle of the congregation: and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its blood upon the altar round about.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%14%%And he shall offer of it his offering, even an offering made by fire to the LORD; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%15%%And the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, that shall he take away.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%16%%And the priest shall burn them upon the altar: it is the food of the offering made by fire for a sweet savor: all the fat is the LORD'S.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%3%%17%%It shall be a perpetual statute for your generations throughout all your dwellings, that ye eat neither fat nor blood.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, saying, If a soul shall sin through ignorance against any of the commandments of the LORD concerning things which ought not to be done, and shall violate any of them:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%3%%If the priest that is anointed shall sin according to the sin of the people; then let him bring, for his sin which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish to the LORD for a sin-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%4%%And he shall bring the bullock to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD; and shall lay his hand upon the bullock's head, and kill the bullock before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%5%%And the priest that is anointed shall take of the bullock's blood, and bring it to the tabernacle of the congregation:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%6%%And the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle of the blood seven times before the LORD, before the vail of the sanctuary.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%7%%And the priest shall put some of the blood upon the horns of the altar of sweet incense before the LORD, which is in the tabernacle of the congregation; and shall pour all the blood of the bullock at the bottom of the altar of the burnt-offering, which is at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%8%%And he shall take off from it all the fat of the bullock for the sin-offering; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%9%%And the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the flanks, and the caul above the liver, with the kidneys, that shall he take away,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%10%%As it was taken off from the bullock of the sacrifice of peace-offerings: and the priest shall burn them upon the altar of the burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%11%%And the skin of the bullock, and all his flesh, with his head, and with his legs, and his inwards, and his dung,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%12%%Even the whole bullock shall he carry forth without the camp to a clean place, where the ashes are poured out, and burn him on the wood with fire: where the ashes are poured out shall he be burnt.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%13%%And if the whole congregation of Israel shall sin through ignorance, and the thing be hid from the eyes of the assembly, and they have done somewhat against any of the commandments of the LORD concerning things which should not be done, and are guilty;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%14%%When the sin which they have sinned against it is known, then the congregation shall offer a young bullock for the sin, and bring him before the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%15%%And the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands upon the head of the bullock before the LORD: and the bullock shall be killed before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%16%%And the priest that is anointed shall bring of the bullock's blood to the tabernacle of the congregation:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%17%%And the priest shall dip his finger in some of the blood, and sprinkle it seven times before the LORD, even before the vail.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%18%%And he shall put some of the blood upon the horns of the altar which is before the LORD, that is in the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall pour out all the blood at the bottom of the altar of the burnt-offering, which is at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%19%%And he shall take all his fat from him, and burn it upon the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%20%%And he shall do with the bullock as he did with the bullock for a sin-offering, so shall he do with this: and the priest shall make an atonement for them, and it shall be forgiven them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%21%%And he shall carry forth the bullock without the camp, and burn him as he burned the first bullock: it is a sin-offering for the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%22%%When a ruler hath sinned, and done somewhat through ignorance against any of the commandments of the LORD his God concerning things which should not be done, and is guilty;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%23%%Or if his sin, in which he hath sinned, shall come to his knowledge; he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a male without blemish:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%24%%And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they kill the burnt-offering before the LORD: it is a sin-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%25%%And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt-offering, and shall pour out his blood at the bottom of the altar of burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%26%%And he shall burn all his fat upon the altar, as the fat of the sacrifice of peace-offerings: and the priest shall make an atonement for him as concerning his sin, and it shall be forgiven him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%27%%And if any one of the common people shall sin through ignorance, while he doeth somewhat against any of the commandments of the LORD concerning things which ought not to be done, and be guilty;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%28%%Or if his sin which he hath sinned shall come to his knowledge: then he shall bring his offering, a kid of the goats, a female without blemish, for his sin which he hath sinned.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%29%%And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin-offering, and slay the sin-offering in the place of the burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%30%%And the priest shall take of the blood of it with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt-offering, and shall pour out all the blood thereof at the bottom of the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%31%%And he shall take away all its fat, as the fat is taken away from off the sacrifice of peace-offerings; and the priest shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savor to the LORD; and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and it shall be forgiven him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%32%%And if he shall bring a lamb for a sin-offering, he shall bring it a female without blemish.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%33%%And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the sin-offering, and slay it for a sin-offering in the place where they kill the burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%34%%And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar of burnt-offering, and shall pour out all the blood of it at the bottom of the altar:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%4%%35%%And he shall take away all its fat, as the fat of the lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of the peace-offerings; and the priest shall burn them upon the altar, according to the offerings made by fire to the LORD: and the priest shall make an atonement for his sin that he hath committed, and it shall be forgiven him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%1%%And if a soul shall sin, and hear the voice of swearing, and be a witness, whether he hath seen or known of it; if he doth not utter it, then he shall bear his iniquity.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%2%%Or if a soul shall touch any unclean thing, whether a carcass of an unclean beast, or a carcass of unclean cattle, or the carcass of unclean creeping animals, and it shall be hidden from him; he also shall be unclean, and guilty.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%3%%Or if he shall touch the uncleanness of man, whatever uncleanness it may be that a man shall be defiled with, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth of it, then he shall be guilty.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%4%%Or if a soul shall swear, pronouncing with his lips to do evil, or to do good, whatever it may be, that a man shall pronounce with an oath, and it be hid from him; when he knoweth of it, then he shall be guilty in one of these.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%5%%And it shall be, when he shall be guilty in one of these things, that he shall confess that he hath sinned in that thing:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%6%%And he shall bring his trespass-offering to the LORD for his sin which he hath sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb or a kid of the goats, for a sin-offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his sin.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%7%%And if he shall not be able to bring a lamb, then he shall bring for his trespass which he hath committed, two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, to the LORD; one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%8%%And he shall bring them to the priest, who shall offer that which is for the sin-offering first, and wring off his head from his neck, but shall not divide it asunder:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%9%%And he shall sprinkle of the blood of the sin-offering upon the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be wrung out at the bottom of the altar: it is a sin-offering.
