1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%10%%And he shall offer the second for a burnt-offering, according to the manner: and the priest shall make an atonement for him for his sin which he hath sinned, and it shall be forgiven him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%11%%But if he shall not be able to bring two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons; then he that sinned shall bring for his offering the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin-offering; he shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put any frankincense upon it: for it is a sin-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%12%%Then shall he bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it, even a memorial of it, and burn it on the altar, according to the offerings made by fire to the LORD: it is a sin-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%13%%And the priest shall make an atonement for him as concerning his sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and the remnant shall be the priest's, as a meat-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%14%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%15%%If a soul shall commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the LORD; then he shall bring for his trespass to the LORD a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass-offering:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%16%%And he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy thing, and shall add to it the fifth part, and give it to the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass-offering, and it shall be forgiven him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%17%%And if a soul shall sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the LORD; though he knew it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%18%%And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass-offering to the priest; and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred and knew it not, and it shall be forgiven him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%19%%It is a trespass-offering: he hath certainly trespassed against the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%20%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%21%%If a soul shall sin, and commit a trespass against the LORD, and lie to his neighbor, in that which was delivered him to keep, or in fellowship, or in a thing taken away by violence, or hath deceived his neighbor;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%22%%Or hath found that which was lost, and lieth concerning it, and sweareth falsely; in any of all these that a man doeth, sinning therein:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%23%%Then it shall be, because he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took by force, or the thing which he obtained by deceit, or that which was delivered him to keep, or the lost thing which he found,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%24%%Or all that about which he hath sworn falsely; he shall even restore it in the principal, and shall add to it the fifth part more, and give it to him to whom it appertaineth, in the day of his trespass-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%25%%And he shall bring his trespass-offering to the LORD, a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass-offering, to the priest:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%5%%26%%And the priest shall make an atonement for him before the LORD: and it shall be forgiven him for any thing of all that he hath done in trespassing therein.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%2%%Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This is the law of the burnt-offering: It is the burnt-offering, because of the burning upon the altar all night until the morning, and the fire of the altar shall be burning in it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%3%%And the priest shall put on his linen garment, and his linen breeches shall he put upon his flesh, and take up the ashes which the fire hath consumed with the burnt-offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%4%%And he shall put off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry forth the ashes without the camp to a clean place.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%5%%And the fire upon the altar shall be burning on it; it shall not be extinguished: and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and lay the burnt-offering in order upon it; and he shall burn on it the fat of the peace-offerings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%6%%The fire shall ever be burning upon the altar; it shall never go out.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%7%%And this is the law of the meat-offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before the LORD, before the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%8%%And he shall take of it his handful, of the flour of the meat-offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincense which is upon the meat-offering, and shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet savor, even the memorial of it, to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%9%%And the remainder of it shall Aaron and his sons eat: with unleavened bread shall it be eaten in the holy place; in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation they shall eat it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%10%%It shall not be baked with leaven. I have given it to them for their portion of my offerings made by fire; It is most holy, as is the sin-offering, and as the trespass-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%11%%All the males among the children of Aaron shall eat of it. It shall be a statute for ever in your generations concerning the offerings of the LORD made by fire: every one that toucheth them shall be holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%12%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%13%%This is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer to the LORD in the day when he is anointed; the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meat-offering perpetual, half of it in the morning, and half of it at night.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%14%%In a pan it shall be made with oil; and when it is baked, thou shalt bring it in: and the baked pieces of the meat-offering shalt thou offer for a sweet savor to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%15%%And the priest of his sons that is anointed in his stead shall offer it: it is a statute for ever to the LORD; it shall be wholly burnt.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%16%%For every meat-offering for the priest shall be wholly burnt: it shall not be eaten.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%17%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%18%%Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, This is the law of the sin-offering: In the place where the burnt-offering is killed shall the sin-offering be killed before the LORD: it is most holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%19%%The priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy place shall it be eaten, in the court of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%20%%Whatever shall touch the flesh of it shall be holy: and when there is sprinkled of its blood upon any garment, thou shalt wash that on which it was sprinkled in the holy place.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%21%%But the earthen vessel in which it is boiled shall be broken: and if it shall be boiled in a brazen pot, it shall be both scoured, and rinsed in water.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%22%%All the males among the priests shall eat of it: it is most holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%6%%23%%And no sin-offering, of which any of the blood is brought into the tabernacle of the congregation to make reconciliation in the holy place, shall be eaten: it shall be burnt in the fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%1%%Likewise this is the law of the trespass-offering: it is most holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%2%%In the place where they kill the burnt-offering shall they kill the trespass-offering: and the blood of it shall he sprinkle around upon the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%3%%And he shall offer of it all its fat; the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%4%%And the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the caul that is above the liver, with the kidneys, that shall he take away:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%5%%And the priest shall burn them upon the altar for an offering made by fire to the LORD: it is a trespass-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%6%%Every male among the priests shall eat of it: it shall be eaten in the holy place: it is most holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%7%%As the sin-offering is, so is the trespass-offering: there is one law for them: the priest that maketh atonement with it shall have it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%8%%And the priest that offereth any man's burnt-offering, even the priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt-offering which he hath offered.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%9%%And all the meat-offering that is baked in the oven, and all that is dressed in the frying-pan, and in the pan, shall be the priest's that offereth it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%10%%And every meat-offering mingled with oil, and dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have, one as much as another.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%11%%And this is the law of the sacrifice of peace-offerings, which he shall offer to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%12%%If he shall offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour, fried.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%13%%Besides the cakes, he shall offer for his offering, leavened bread, with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace-offerings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%14%%And of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblation for a heave-offering to the LORD, and it shall be the priest's that sprinkleth the blood of the peace-offerings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%15%%And the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace-offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day that it is offered; he shall not leave any of it until the morning.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%16%%But if the sacrifice of his offering shall be a vow or a voluntary offering, it shall be eaten the same day that he offereth his sacrifice: and on the morrow also the remainder of it shall be eaten:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%17%%But the remainder of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burnt with fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%18%%And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace-offerings shall be eaten at all on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed to him that offereth it; it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear his iniquity.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%19%%And the flesh that toucheth any unclean thing shall not be eaten; it shall be burnt with fire: and as for the flesh, all that shall be clean shall eat of it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%20%%But the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace-offerings that pertain to the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%21%%Moreover, the soul that shall touch any unclean thing, as the uncleanness of man, or any unclean beast, or any abominable unclean thing, and eat of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace-offerings which pertain to the LORD, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%22%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%23%%Speak to the children of Israel, saying, Ye shall eat no manner of fat, of ox, or of sheep, or of goat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%24%%And the fat of the beast that dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn with beasts, may be used for any other purpose; but ye shall in no wise eat of it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%25%%For whoever eateth the fat of the beast, of which men offer an offering made by fire to the LORD, even the soul that eateth it shall be cut off from his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%26%%Moreover, ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether of fowl or of beast, in any of your dwellings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%27%%Whatever soul it may be that eateth any manner of blood, even that soul shall be cut off from his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%28%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%29%%Speak to the children of Israel, saying, He that offereth the sacrifice of his peace-offerings to the LORD, shall bring his oblation to the LORD of the sacrifice of his peace-offerings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%30%%His own hands shall bring the offerings of the LORD made by fire, the fat with the breast, that shall he bring, that the breast may be waved for a wave-offering before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%31%%And the priest shall burn the fat upon the altar: but the breast shall be Aaron's and his sons'.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%32%%And the right shoulder shall ye give to the priest for a heave-offering of the sacrifices of your peace-offerings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%33%%He among the sons' of Aaron that offereth the blood of the peace-offerings, and the fat, shall have the right shoulder for his part.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%34%%For the wave-breast and the heave-shoulder have I taken of the children of Israel from off the sacrifices of their peace-offerings, and have given them to Aaron the priest, and to his sons, by a statute for ever, from among the children of Israel.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%35%%This is the portion of the anointing of Aaron, and of the anointing of his sons, out of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, in the day when he presented them to minister to the LORD in the priest's office;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%36%%Which the LORD commanded to be given to them by the children of Israel, in the day that he anointed them, by a statute for ever throughout their generations.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%37%%This is the law of the burnt-offering, of the meat-offering, and of the sin-offering, and of the trespass-offering, and of the consecrations, and of the sacrifice of the Peace-offerings;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%7%%38%%Which the LORD commanded Moses in mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their oblations to the LORD, in the wilderness of Sinai.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%2%%Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and a bullock for the sin-offering, and two rams, and a basket of unleavened bread;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%3%%And assemble thou all the congregation to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%4%%And Moses did as the LORD commanded him; and the assembly was gathered to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%5%%And Moses said to the congregation, This is the thing which the LORD commanded to be done.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%6%%And Moses brought Aaron and his sons, and washed them with water.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%7%%And he put upon him the coat, and girded him with the girdle, and clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod upon him, and he girded him with the curious girdle of the ephod, and bound it to him with it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%8%%And he put the breast-plate upon him: also he put in the breast-plate the Urim and the Thummim.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%9%%And he put the miter upon his head; also upon the miter, even upon his front, did he put the golden plate, the holy crown; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%10%%And Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was in it, and sanctified them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%11%%And he sprinkled part of it upon the altar seven times, and anointed the altar and all its vessels, both the laver and its foot, to sanctify them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%12%%And he poured of the anointing oil upon Aaron's head, and anointed him, to sanctify him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%13%%And Moses brought Aaron's sons, and put coats upon them, and girded them with girdles, and put bonnets upon them; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%14%%And he brought the bullock for the sin-offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the bullock for the sin-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%15%%And he slew it; and Moses took the blood, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about with his finger, and purified the altar, and poured the blood at the bottom of the altar, and sanctified it, to make reconciliation upon it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%16%%And he took all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and Moses burned it upon the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%17%%But the bullock, and his hide, his flesh, and his dung, he burnt with fire without the camp; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%18%%And he brought the ram for the burnt-offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%19%%And he killed it; and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%20%%And he cut the ram into pieces; and Moses burnt the head, and the pieces, and the fat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%21%%And he washed the inwards and the legs in water; and Moses burnt the whole ram upon the altar: it was a burnt-sacrifice for a sweet savor, and an offering made by fire to the LORD; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%22%%And he brought the other ram, the ram of consecration: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the head of the ram.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%23%%And he slew it; and Moses took of its blood, and put it upon the tip of Aaron's right ear, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%24%%And he brought Aaron's sons, and Moses put of the blood upon the tip of their right ear, and upon the thumbs of their right hands, and upon the great toes of their right feet: and Moses sprinkled the blood upon the altar round about.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%25%%And he took the fat, and the rump, and all the fat that was upon the inwards, and the caul above the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and the right shoulder:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%26%%And out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before the LORD, he took one unleavened cake, and a cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and put them on the fat, and upon the right shoulder:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%27%%And he put all upon Aaron's hands, and upon his sons' hands, and waved them for a wave-offering before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%28%%And Moses took them from off their hands, and burnt them on the altar upon the burnt-offering: they were consecrations for a sweet savor: it is an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%29%%And Moses took the breast, and waved it for a wave-offering before the LORD: for of the ram of consecration it was Moses's part; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%30%%And Moses took of the anointing oil, and of the blood which was upon the altar, and sprinkled it upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon his sons' garments with him; and sanctified Aaron, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons' garments with him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%31%%And Moses said to Aaron and to his sons, Boil the flesh at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation; and there eat it with the bread that is in the basket of consecrations, as I commanded, saying, Aaron and his sons shall eat it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%32%%And that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread shall ye burn with fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%33%%And ye shall not go out of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation in seven days, until the days of your consecration shall be at an end: for seven days shall he consecrate you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%34%%As he hath done this day, so the LORD hath commanded to do, to make an atonement for you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%35%%Therefore shall ye abide at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation day and night seven days, and keep the charge of the LORD, that ye die not: for so I am commanded.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%8%%36%%So Aaron and his sons did all things which the LORD commanded by the hand of Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%1%%And it came to pass on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%2%%And he said to Aaron, Take thee a young calf for a sin-offering, and a ram for a burnt-offering, without blemish, and offer them before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%3%%And to the children of Israel thou shalt speak, saying, Take ye a kid of the goats for a sin-offering; and a calf and a lamb, both of the first year, without blemish, for a burnt-offering;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%4%%Also a bullock and a ram for peace-offerings, to sacrifice before the LORD; and a meat-offering mingled with oil: for to-day the LORD will appear to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%5%%And they brought that which Moses commanded before the tabernacle of the congregation: and all the congregation drew near and stood before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%6%%And Moses said, This is the thing which the LORD commanded that ye should do: and the glory of the LORD shall appear to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%7%%And Moses said to Aaron, Go to the altar, and offer thy sin-offering, and thy burnt-offering, and make an atonement for thyself, and for the people: and offer the offering of the people, and make an atonement for them; as the LORD commanded.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%8%%Aaron therefore went to the altar, and slew the calf of the sin-offering, which was for himself.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%9%%And the sons of Aaron brought the blood to him: and he dipped his finger in the blood, and put it upon the horns of the altar, and poured out the blood at the bottom of the altar:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%10%%But the fat, and the kidneys, and the caul above the liver of the sin-offering, he burnt upon the altar; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%11%%And the flesh and the hide he burnt with fire without the camp.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%12%%And he slew the burnt-offering; and Aaron's sons presented to him the blood, which he sprinkled around upon the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%13%%And they presented the burnt-offering to him, with the pieces of it, and the head: and he burnt them upon the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%14%%And he washed the inwards and the legs, and burnt them upon the burnt-offering on the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%15%%And he brought the people's offering, and took the goat, which was the sin-offering for the people, and slew it, and offered it for sin, as the first.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%16%%And he brought the burnt-offering, and offered it according to the manner.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%17%%And he brought the meat-offering, and took a handful of it, and burnt it upon the altar, beside the burnt-sacrifice of the morning.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%18%%He slew also the bullock and the ram for a sacrifice of peace-offerings, which was for the people: and Aaron's sons presented to him the blood, which he sprinkled around upon the altar,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%19%%And the fat of the bullock, and of the ram, the rump, and that which covereth the inwards, and the kidneys, and the caul above the liver:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%20%%And they put the fat upon the breasts, and he burnt the fat upon the altar:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%21%%And the breasts and the right shoulder Aaron waved for a wave-offering before the LORD; as Moses commanded.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%22%%And Aaron lifted up his hand towards the people, and blessed them; and came down from offering the sin-offering, and the burnt-offering, and peace-offerings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%23%%And Moses and Aaron went into the tabernacle of the congregation, and came out, and blessed the people: and the glory of the LORD appeared to all the people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%9%%24%%And there came out a fire from before the LORD, and consumed upon the altar the burnt-offering and the fat: which, when all the people saw, they shouted, and fell on their faces.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%1%%And Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, took each of them his censer, and put fire in it, and put incense on it, and offered strange fire before the LORD, which he commanded them not.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%2%%And there went out fire from the LORD, and devoured them, and they died before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%3%%Then Moses said to Aaron, This is what the LORD spoke, saying, I will be sanctified in them that come nigh me, and before all the people I will be glorified. And Aaron held his peace.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%4%%And Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, Come near, carry your brethren from before the sanctuary out of the camp.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%5%%So they went near, and carried them in their coats out of the camp; as Moses had said.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%6%%And Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons, Uncover not your heads, neither rend your clothes; lest ye die, and lest wrath come upon all the people: but let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which the LORD hath kindled.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%7%%And ye shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: for the anointing oil of the LORD is upon you. And they did according to the word of Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%8%%And the LORD spoke to Aaron, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%9%%Do not drink wine nor strong drink, thou, nor thy sons with thee, when ye go into the tabernacle of the congregation, lest ye die: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%10%%And that ye may make a difference between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%11%%And that ye may teach the children of Israel all the statutes which the LORD hath spoken to them by the hand of Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%12%%And Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons that were left, Take the meat-offering that remaineth of the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside the altar: for it is most holy:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%13%%And ye shall eat it in the holy place, because it is thy due, and thy sons' due, of the sacrifices of the LORD made by fire: for so I am commanded.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%14%%And the wave-breast and heave-shoulder shall ye eat in a clean place; thou, and thy sons, and thy daughters with thee: for they are thy due, and thy sons' due, which are given out of the sacrifices of peace-offerings of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%15%%The heave-shoulder and the wave-breast shall they bring, with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave-offering before the LORD; and it shall be thine, and thy sons' with thee, by a statute for ever; as the LORD hath commanded.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%16%%And Moses diligently sought the goat of the sin-offering, and behold, it was burnt: and he was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were left alive, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%17%%Why have ye not eaten the sin-offering in the holy place, seeing it is most holy, and God hath given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the LORD?
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%18%%Behold, the blood of it was not brought within the holy place: ye should indeed have eaten it in the holy place, as I commanded.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%19%%And Aaron said to Moses, Behold, this day have they offered their sin-offering, and their burnt-offering before the LORD; and such things have befallen me: and if I had eaten the sin-offering to day, would it have been accepted in the sight of the LORD?
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%10%%20%%And when Moses heard that, he was content.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying to them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, saying, These are the beasts which ye may eat among all the beasts that are on the earth.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%3%%Whatever parteth the hoof, and is cloven-footed, and cheweth the cud among the beasts, that shall ye eat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%4%%Nevertheless, these shall ye not eat, of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hoof: the camel, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%5%%And the coney, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%6%%And the hare, because he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the hoof: he is unclean to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%7%%And the swine, though he divideth the hoof, and is cloven-footed, yet he cheweth not the cud; he is unclean to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%8%%Of their flesh shall ye not eat, and their carcass shall ye not touch; they are unclean to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%9%%These shall ye eat, of all that are in the waters: whatever hath fins and scales in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them shall ye eat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%10%%And all that have not fins nor scales in the seas, and in the rivers, of all that move in the waters, and of any living animal which is in the waters, they shall be an abomination to you:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%11%%They shall be even an abomination to you; ye shall not eat of their flesh, but ye shall have their carcasses in abomination.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%12%%Whatever hath no fins nor scales in the waters, that shall be an abomination to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%13%%And these are they which ye shall have in abomination among the fowls; they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%14%%And the vultur, and the kite after his kind;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%15%%Every raven after his kind;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%16%%And the owl, and the night-hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%17%%And the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%18%%And the swan, and the pelican, and the gier-eagle,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%19%%And the stork, and the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%20%%All fowls that creep, going upon all four, shall be an abomination to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%21%%Yet these may ye eat, of every flying creeping animal that goeth upon all four, which have legs above their feet, to leap with upon the earth;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%22%%Even these of them ye may eat; the locust after its kind, and the bald locust after its kind, and the beetle after its kind, and the grasshopper after its kind.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%23%%But all other flying creeping animals, which have four feet, shall be an abomination to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%24%%And for these ye shall be unclean: whoever toucheth the carcass of them shall be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%25%%And whoever beareth aught of the carcass of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%26%%The carcasses of every beast which divideth the hoof, and is not cloven-footed, nor cheweth the cud, are unclean to you: every one that toucheth them shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%27%%And whatever goeth upon its paws, among all manner of beasts that go on all four, those are unclean to you: whoever toucheth their carcass shall be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%28%%And he that beareth the carcass of them shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening: they are unclean to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%29%%These also shall be unclean to you among the creeping animals that creep upon the earth; the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise, after its kind,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%30%%And the ferret and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%31%%These are unclean to you among all that creep: whoever doth touch them, when they are dead, shall be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%32%%And upon whatever any of them, when they are dead, doth fall, it shall be unclean; whether it is any vessel of wood, or raiment, or skin, or sack, whatever vessel it is, in which any work is done, it must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the evening; so it shall be cleansed.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%33%%And every earthen vessel, into which any of them falleth, whatever is in it shall be unclean; and ye shall break it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%34%%Of all meat which may be eaten, that on which such water cometh shall be unclean: and all drink that may be drank in every such vessel, shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%35%%And every thing on which any part of their carcass falleth, shall be unclean; whether an oven, or ranges for pots, they shall be broken down: for they are unclean, and shall be unclean to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%36%%Nevertheless, a fountain or pit, in which there is plenty of water, shall be clean: but that which toucheth their carcass shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%37%%And if any part of their carcass shall fall upon any sowing-seed which is to be sown, it shall be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%38%%But if any water shall be put upon the seed, and any part of their carcass shall fall on it, it shall be unclean to you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%39%%And if any beast, of which ye may eat, shall die; he that toucheth its carcass shall be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%40%%And he that eateth of its carcass shall wash his clothes, and be unclean until the evening; he also that beareth its carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%41%%And every creeping animal that creepeth upon the earth shall be an abomination; it shall not be eaten.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%42%%Whatever goeth upon the belly, and whatever goeth upon all four, or whatever hath more feet among all creeping animals that creep upon the earth, them ye shall not eat; for they are an abomination.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%43%%Ye shall not make your selves abominable with any creeping animal that creepeth, neither shall ye make yourselves unclean with them, that ye should be defiled by them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%44%%For I am the LORD your God: ye shall therefore sanctify yourselves, and ye shall be holy; for I am holy: neither shall ye defile yourselves with any manner of creeping animal that creepeth upon the earth.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%45%%For I am the LORD that bringeth you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: ye shall therefore be holy, for I am holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%46%%This is the law of the beasts, and of the fowl, and of every living creature that moveth in the waters, and of every creature that creepeth upon the earth;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%11%%47%%To make a difference between the unclean and the clean, and between the beast that may be eaten and the beast that may not be eaten.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%12%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%12%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, saying, If a woman hath conceived seed, and borne a male-child; then she shall be unclean seven days; according to the days of the separation for her infirmity shall she be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%12%%3%%And in the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%12%%4%%And she shall then continue in the blood of her purifying three and thirty days: she shall touch no hallowed thing, nor come into the sanctuary, until the days of her purifying be fulfilled.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%12%%5%%But if she shall bear a female-child, then she shall be unclean two weeks, as in her separation: and she shall continue in the blood of her purifying sixty six days.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%12%%6%%And when the days of her purifying are fulfilled, for a son, or for a daughter, she shall bring a lamb of the first year for a burnt-offering, and a young pigeon, or a turtle-dove, for a sin-offering, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to the priest;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%12%%7%%Who shall offer it before the LORD, and make an atonement for her; and she shall be cleansed from the issue of her blood. This is the law for her that hath borne a male or a female.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%12%%8%%And if she shall not be able to bring a lamb, then she shall bring two turtles, or two young pigeons; the one for the burnt-offering, and the other for a sin-offering: and the priest shall make an atonement for her, and she shall be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%2%%When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the skin of his flesh like the plague of leprosy; then he shall be brought to Aaron the priest, or to one of his sons the priests:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%3%%And the priest shall look on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and when the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight is deeper than the skin of his flesh, it is a plague of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%4%%If the bright spot is white in the skin of his flesh, and in sight, not deeper than the skin, and the hair of it not turned white; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague seven days:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%5%%And the priest shall look on him the seventh day: and behold, if the plague in his sight is at a stay, and the plague spreadeth not in the skin; then the priest shall shut him up seven days more:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%6%%And the priest shall look on him again the seventh day: and behold, if the plague is somewhat dark, and the plague spreadeth not in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean: it is but a scab: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%7%%But if the scab shall spread much in the skin, after he hath been seen by the priest for his cleansing, he shall be seen by the priest again:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%8%%And if the priest shall see, that behold, the scab spreadeth in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a leprosy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%9%%When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought to the priest:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%10%%And the priest shall see him: and behold, if the rising is white in the skin, and it hath turned the hair white, and there is raw flesh in the rising;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%11%%It is an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean, and shall not shut him up; for he is unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%12%%And if a leprosy shall break out in the skin, and the leprosy shall cover all the skin of him that hath the plague from his head even to his foot, wherever the priest looketh;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%13%%Then the priest shall consider: and behold, if the leprosy hath covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: it is all turned white: he is clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%14%%But when raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%15%%And the priest shall see the raw flesh, and pronounce him to be unclean: for the raw flesh is unclean: it is a leprosy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%16%%Or if the raw flesh shall turn again, and be changed into white, he shall come to the priest;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%17%%And the priest shall see him: and behold, if the plague is turned into white: then the priest shall pronounce him clean that hath the plague: he is clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%18%%The flesh also, in which, even in the skin of it, was a boil, and is healed,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%19%%And in the place of the boil there shall be a white rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reddish, and it be showed to the priest;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%20%%And if, when the priest seeth it, behold, it is in sight lower than the skin, and the hair of it is turned white; the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague of leprosy broken out of the boil.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%21%%But if the priest shall look on it, and behold, there are no white hairs in it, and if it is not lower than the skin, but somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%22%%And if it hath spread much in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a plague.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%23%%But if the bright spot shall stay in its place, and not spread, it is a burning boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%24%%Or if there is any flesh, in the skin of which there is a hot burning, and the live flesh that burneth hath a white bright spot, somewhat reddish or white;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%25%%Then the priest shall look upon it: and behold, if the hair in the bright spot is turned white, and it is in sight deeper than the skin: it is a leprosy broken out of the burning: wherefore the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%26%%But if the priest shall look on it, and behold, there is no white hair in the bright spot, and it is no lower than the other skin, but is somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%27%%And the priest shall look upon him the seventh day: and if it is spread much in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is the plague of leprosy,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%28%%And if the bright spot shall stay in its place, and not spread in the skin, but be somewhat dark; it is a rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean: for it is an inflammation of the burning.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%29%%If a man or woman shall have a plague upon the head or the beard;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%30%%Then the priest shall see the plague: and behold, if it is in sight deeper than the skin, and there is in it a yellow thin hair; then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it is a dry scall, even a leprosy upon the head or beard.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%31%%And if the priest shall look on the plague of the scall, and behold, it is not in sight deeper than the skin, and no black hair in it; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plague of the scall seven days:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%32%%And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague: and behold, if the scall spreadeth not, and there is in it no yellow hair, and the scall is not in sight deeper than the skin;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%33%%He shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up him that hath the scall seven days more:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%34%%And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall: and behold, if the scall is not spread in the skin, nor is in sight deeper than the skin; then the priest shall pronounce him clean: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%35%%But if the scall shall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%36%%Then the priest shall look on him: and behold, if the scall is spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for yellow hair; he is unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%37%%But if the scall shall be in his sight at a stay, and there is black hair grown in it; the scall is healed, he is clean: and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%38%%If a man also or a woman shall have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, even white bright spots;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%39%%Then the priest shall look: and behold, if the bright spots in the skin of their flesh are darkish white; it is a freckled spot that groweth in the skin; he is clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%40%%And the man whose hair hath fallen off his head, he is bald; yet is he clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%41%%And he that hath his hair fallen off from the part of his head towards his face, he is forehead-bald; yet is he clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%42%%And if there is in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white reddish sore; it is a leprosy sprung up on his bald head, or his bald forehead.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%43%%Then the priest shall look upon it: and behold, if the rising of the sore is white reddish on his bald head, or on his bald forehead, as the leprosy appeareth in the skin of the flesh;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%44%%He is a leprous man, he is unclean: the priest shall pronounce him utterly unclean; his plague is in his head.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%45%%And the leper in whom the plague is, his clothes shall be rent, and his head bare, and he shall put a covering upon his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean, unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%46%%All the days in which the plague shall be in him he shall be defiled; he is unclean: he shall dwell alone, without the camp shall his habitation be.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%47%%The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, whether a woolen garment, or a linen garment;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%48%%Whether in the warp, or woof, of linen, or of woolen: whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%49%%And if the plague is greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin: it is a plague of leprosy, and shall be shown to the priest:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%50%%And the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up that which hath the plague seven days:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%51%%And he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague is spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in a skin, or in any work that is made of skin: the plague is a fretting leprosy; it is unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%52%%He shall therefore burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in woolen or in linen, or any thing of skin, in which the plague is: for it is a fretting leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%53%%And if the priest shall look, and behold, the plague is not spread in the garment, either in the warp or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%54%%Then the priest shall command that they wash the thing in which the plague is, and he shall shut it up seven days more:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%55%%And the priest shall look on the plague after it is washed: and behold, if the plague hath not changed its color, and the plague hath not spread; it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it is fret inward, whether it is bare within or without.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%56%%And if the priest shall look, and behold, the plague is somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%57%%And if it shall appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it is a spreading plague: thou shalt burn that in which the plague is, with fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%58%%And the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatever thing of skin it is, which thou shalt wash, if the plague hath departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%13%%59%%This is the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of woolen or linen, either in the warp or woof, or any thing of skins, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%2%%This shall be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought to the priest:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%3%%And the priest shall go forth out of the camp: and the priest shall look, and behold, if the plague of leprosy is healed in the leper;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%4%%Then shall the priest command to take for him that is to be cleansed two birds alive, and clean, and cedar-wood, and scarlet, and hyssop.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%5%%And the priest shall command that one of the birds be killed in an earthen vessel, over running water.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%6%%As for the living bird, he shall take it, and the cedar-wood, and the scarlet, and the hyssop, and shall dip them, and the living bird, in the blood of the bird that was killed over the running water.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%7%%And he shall sprinkle upon him that is to be cleansed from the leprosy seven times, and shall pronounce him clean, and shall let the living bird loose into the open field.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%8%%And he that is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and wash himself in water, that he may be clean: and after that he shall come into the camp, and shall tarry abroad out of his tent seven days.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%9%%But it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his hair off his head, and his beard, and his eye-brows, even all his hair he shall shave off; and he shall wash his clothes, also he shall wash his flesh in water, and he shall be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%10%%And on the eighth day he shall take two he-lambs without blemish, and one ewe-lamb of the first year without blemish, and three tenth-parts of fine flour for a meat-offering, mingled with oil, and one log of oil.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%11%%And the priest that maketh him clean, shall present the man that is to be made clean, and those things, before the LORD, at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%12%%And the priest shall take one he-lamb, and offer him for a trespass-offering, and the log of oil, and wave them for a wave-offering before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%13%%And he shall slay the lamb in the place where he shall kill the sin-offering and the burnt-offering, in the holy-place: for as the sin-offering is the priest's, so is the trespass-offering: it is most holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%14%%And the priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass-offering, and the priest shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%15%%And the priest shall take some of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%16%%And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in his left hand, and shall sprinkle of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%17%%And of the rest of the oil that is in his hand, shall the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the blood of the trespass-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%18%%And the remnant of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall pour upon the head of him that is to be cleansed: and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%19%%And the priest shall offer the sin-offering, and make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed from his uncleanness; and afterward he shall kill the burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%20%%And the priest shall offer the burnt-offering, and the meat-offering upon the altar: and the priest shall make an atonement for him, and he shall be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%21%%And if he is poor, and cannot get so much; then he shall take one lamb for a trespass-offering to be waved, to make an atonement for him, and one tenth-part of fine flour mingled with oil for a meat-offering, and a log of oil;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%22%%And two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, such as he is able to get; and the one shall be a sin-offering, and the other a burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%23%%And he shall bring them on the eighth day for his cleansing to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%24%%And the priest shall take the lamb of the trespass-offering, and the log of oil, and the priest shall wave them for a wave-offering before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%25%%And he shall kill the lamb of the trespass-offering, and the priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass-offering, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%26%%And the priest shall pour of the oil into the palm of his own left hand.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%27%%And the priest shall sprinkle with his right finger some of the oil that is in his left hand seven times before the LORD:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%28%%And the priest shall put of the oil that is in his hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the great toe of his right foot, upon the place of the blood of the trespass-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%29%%And the rest of the oil that is in the priest's hand he shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed, to make an atonement for him before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%30%%And he shall offer one of the turtle-doves, or of the young pigeons, such as he can get;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%31%%Even such as he is able to get, the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering, with the meat-offering. And the priest shall make an atonement for him that is to be cleansed, before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%32%%This is the law of him in whom is the plague of leprosy, whose hand is not able to get that which pertaineth to his cleansing.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%33%%And the LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%34%%When ye shall have come into the land of Canaan, which I give to you for a possession, and I put the plague of leprosy in a house of the land of your possession;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%35%%And he that owneth the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, it seemeth to me there is as it were a plague in the house:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%36%%Then the priest shall command that they empty the house, before the priest shall enter to see the plague, that all that is in the house may not be made unclean; and afterward the priest shall go in to see the house:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%37%%And he shall look on the plague, and behold, if the plague is in the walls of the house, with hollow streaks, greenish, or reddish, which in sight are lower than the wall;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%38%%Then the priest shall go out of the house to the door of the house, and shut up the house seven days:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%39%%And the priest shall come again the seventh day, and shall look; and behold, if the plague is spread in the walls of the house;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%40%%Then the priest shall command that they take away the stones in which the plague is, and they shall cast them into an unclean place without the city:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%41%%And he shall cause the house to be scraped within on all sides, and they shall pour out the dust that they scrape off without the city into an unclean place:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%42%%And they shall take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he shall take other mortar, and shall plaster the house.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%43%%And if the plague shall return, and break out in the house, after that he hath taken away the stones, and after he hath scraped the house, and after it is plastered;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%44%%Then the priest shall come and look; and behold, if the plague is spread in the house, it is a fretting leprosy in the house: it is unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%45%%And he shall break down the house, its stones, and its timber, and all the mortar of the house: and he shall carry them forth out of the city to an unclean place.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%46%%Moreover, he that goeth into the house all the while that it is shut up, shall be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%47%%And he that lieth in the house shall wash his clothes: and he that eateth in the house shall wash his clothes.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%48%%And if the priest shall come in, and look upon it, and behold, the plague hath not spread in the house, after the house was plastered: then the priest shall pronounce the house clean, because the plague is healed.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%49%%And he shall take to cleanse the house two birds, and cedar-wood, and scarlet, and hyssop:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%50%%And he shall kill one of the birds in an earthen vessel, over running water:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%51%%And he shall take the cedar-wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%52%%And he shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, and with the living bird, and with the cedar wood, and with the hyssop, and with the scarlet:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%53%%But he shall let go the living bird out of the city into the open fields, and make an atonement for the house: and it shall be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%54%%This is the law for all manner of plague of leprosy, and scall,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%55%%And for the leprosy of a garment, and of a house,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%56%%And for a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%14%%57%%To teach when it is unclean, and when it is clean: this is the law of leprosy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, When any man hath a running issue out of his flesh, because of his issue he is unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%3%%And this shall be his uncleanness in his issue: whether his flesh shall run with his issue, or his flesh be stopped from his issue, it is his uncleanness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%4%%Every bed on which he lieth that hath the issue, is unclean: and every thing on which he sitteth, shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%5%%And whoever toucheth his bed, shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%6%%And he that sitteth on any thing on which he sat that hath the issue, shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%7%%And he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issue, shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%8%%And if he that hath the issue shall spit upon him that is clean; then he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%9%%And whatever saddle he rideth upon that hath the issue, shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%10%%And whoever toucheth any thing that was under him shall be unclean until the evening; and he that beareth any of those things, shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%11%%And whomsoever he toucheth that hath the issue (and hath not rinsed his hands in water) he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%12%%And the vessel of earth that he toucheth who hath the issue, shall be broken: and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%13%%And when he that hath an issue is cleansed of his issue; then he shall number to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in running water, and shall be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%14%%And on the eighth day he shall take to him two turtle-doves, or two young pigeons, and come before the LORD to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and give them to the priest:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%15%%And the priest shall offer them, the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the LORD for his issue.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%16%%And if any man's seed of copulation shall go from him, then he shall wash all his flesh in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%17%%And every garment, and every skin on which is the seed of copulation, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%18%%The woman also with whom man shall lie with seed of copulation, they shall both bathe themselves in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%19%%And if a woman shall have an issue, and her issue in her flesh be blood, she shall be put apart seven days: and whoever toucheth her shall be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%20%%And every thing that she lieth upon in her separation shall be unclean: every thing also that she sitteth upon shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%21%%And whoever toucheth her bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%22%%And whoever toucheth any thing that she sat upon shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%23%%And if it be on her bed, or on any thing on which she sitteth, when he toucheth it, he shall be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%24%%And if any man shall lie with her at all, and her flowers be upon him, he shall be unclean seven days: and all the bed on which he lieth shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%25%%And if a woman shall have an issue of her blood many days out of the time of her separation, or if it shall run beyond the time of her separation; all the days of the issue of her uncleanness shall be as the days of her separation: she shall be unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%26%%Every bed on which she lieth all the days of her issue shall be to her as the bed of her separation: and whatever she sitteth upon shall be unclean as the uncleanness of her separation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%27%%And whoever toucheth those things shall be unclean, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%28%%But if she shall be cleansed of her issue, then she shall number to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%29%%And on the eighth day she shall take to her two turtles, or two young pigeons, and bring them to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%30%%And the priest shall offer the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for her before the LORD for the issue of her uncleanness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%31%%Thus shall ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness: that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile my tabernacle that is among them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%32%%This is the law of him that hath an issue, and of him whose seed goeth from him, and he is defiled therewith.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%15%%33%%And of her that is sick of her flowers, and of him that hath an issue, of the man and of the woman, and of him that lieth with her that is unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they offered before the LORD, and died:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%2%%And the LORD said to Moses, Speak to Aaron thy brother, that he come not at all times into the holy place within the vail, before the mercy-seat, which is upon the ark; that he may not die: for I will appear in the cloud upon the mercy-seat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%3%%Thus shall Aaron come into the holy place: with a young bullock for a sin-offering, and a ram for a burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%4%%He shall put on the holy linen coat, and he shall have the linen breeches upon his flesh, and shall be girded with the linen girdle, and with the linen miter shall he be attired: these are holy garments; therefore shall he wash his flesh in water, and so put them on.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%5%%And he shall take of the congregation of the children of Israel two kids of the goats for a sin-offering, and one ram for a burnt-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%6%%And Aaron shall offer his bullock of the sin-offering, which is for himself, and make an atonement for himself, and for his house.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%7%%And he shall take the two goats, and present them before the LORD at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%8%%And Aaron shall cast lots upon the two goats; one lot for the LORD, and the other lot for the scape-goat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%9%%And Aaron shall bring the goat upon which the LORD'S lot fell, and offer him for a sin-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%10%%But the goat on which the lot fell to be the scape-goat, shall be presented alive before the LORD, to make an atonement with him, and to let him go for a scape-goat into the wilderness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%11%%And Aaron shall bring the bullock of the sin-offering, which is for himself, and shall make an atonement for himself, and for his house, and shall kill the bullock of the sin-offering which is for himself:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%12%%And he shall take a censer full of burning coals of fire from off the altar before the LORD, and his hands full of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the vail:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%13%%And he shall put the incense upon the fire before the LORD, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy-seat that is upon the testimony, that he may not die.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%14%%And he shall take of the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it with his finger upon the mercy-seat eastward: and before the mercy-seat shall he sprinkle of the blood with his finger seven times.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%15%%Then shall he kill the goat of the sin-offering that is for the people, and bring his blood within the vail, and do with that blood as he did with the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it upon the mercy-seat, and before the mercy-seat:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%16%%And he shall make an atonement for the holy place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions in all their sins: and so shall he do for the tabernacle of the congregation that remaineth among them in the midst of their uncleanness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%17%%And there shall be no man in the tabernacle of the congregation when he goeth in to make an atonement in the holy place, until he shall come out, and shall have made an atonement for himself, and for his household, and for all the congregation of Israel.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%18%%And he shall go out to the altar that is before the LORD, and make an atonement for it; and shall take of the blood of the bullock, and of the blood of the goat, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%19%%And he shall sprinkle of the blood upon it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and hallow it from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%20%%And when he hath made an end of reconciling the holy place, and the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar, he shall bring the live goat:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%21%%And Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions in all their sins, putting them upon the head of the goat, and shall send him away by the hand of a fit man into the wilderness:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%22%%And the goat shall bear upon him all their iniquities to a land not inhabited: and he shall let go the goat in the wilderness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%23%%And Aaron shall come into the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall put off the linen garments which he put on when he went into the holy place, and shall leave them there:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%24%%And he shall wash his flesh with water in the holy place, and put on his garments, and come forth, and offer his burnt-offering, and the burnt-offering of the people, and make an atonement for himself, and for the people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%25%%And the fat of the sin-offering shall he burn upon the altar.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%26%%And he that let go the goat for the scape-goat shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward come into the camp.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%27%%And the bullock for the sin-offering, and the goat for the sin-offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the holy place, shall one carry forth without the camp; and they shall burn in the fire their skins, and their flesh, and their dung.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%28%%And he that burneth them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%29%%And this shall be a statute for ever to you: that in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, ye shall afflict your souls, and do no work at all, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger that sojourneth among you:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%30%%For on that day shall the priest make an atonement for you, to cleanse you, that ye may be clean from all your sins before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%31%%It shall be a sabbath of rest to you, and ye shall afflict your souls by a statute for ever.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%32%%And the priest whom he shall anoint, and whom he shall consecrate to minister in the priest's office in his father's stead, shall make the atonement, and shall put on the linen clothes, even the holy garments:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%33%%And he shall make an atonement for the holy sanctuary, and he shall make an atonement for the tabernacle of the congregation, and for the altar: and he shall make an atonement for the priests, and for all the people of the congregation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%16%%34%%And this shall be an everlasting statute to you, to make an atonement for the children of Israel for all their sins once a year. And he did as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%2%%Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them, This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%3%%Whatever man there may be of the house of Israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb, or goat in the camp, or that killeth it out of the camp,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%4%%And bringeth it not to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer an offering to the LORD before the tabernacle of the LORD; blood shall be imputed to that man; he hath shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%5%%To the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices which they offer in the open field, even that they may bring them to the LORD, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to the priest, and offer them for peace-offerings to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%6%%And the priest shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar of the LORD at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and burn the fat for a sweet savor to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%7%%And they shall no more offer their sacrifices to idols, with which they have committed idolatry: This shall be a statute for ever to them throughout their generations.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%8%%And thou shalt say to them, Whatever man there may be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers which sojourn among you, that offereth a burnt-offering or sacrifice,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%9%%And bringeth it not to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer it to the LORD; even that man shall be cut off from among his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%10%%And whatever man there may be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, that eateth any manner of blood; I will even set my face against that soul that eateth blood, and will cut him off from among his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%11%%For the life of the flesh is in the blood: and I have given it to you upon the altar, to make an atonement for your souls: for it is the blood that maketh an atonement for the soul.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%12%%Therefore I said to the children of Israel, No soul of you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blood.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%13%%And whatever man there may be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, who hunteth and catcheth any beast or fowl that may be eaten; he shall even pour out its blood, and cover it with dust.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%14%%For it is the life of all flesh, the blood of it is for the life of it; therefore I said to the children of Israel, Ye shall eat the blood of no manner of flesh: for the life of all flesh is its blood: whoever eateth it shall be cut off.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%15%%And every soul that eateth that which died of itself, or that which was torn with beasts, (whether it is one of your own country, or a stranger) he shall both wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening; then shall he be clean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%17%%16%%But if he doth not wash them, nor bathe his flesh; then he shall bear his iniquity.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%3%%After the doings of the land of Egypt in which ye dwelt, shall ye not do: and after the doings of the land of Canaan whither I bring you, shall ye not do: neither shall ye walk in their ordinances.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%4%%Ye shall perform my judgments, and keep my ordinances, to walk in them; I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%5%%Ye shall therefore keep my statutes and my judgments: which if a man doeth, he shall live in them: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%6%%None of you shall approach to any that is near of kin to him, to uncover their nakedness: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%7%%The nakedness of thy father, or the nakedness of thy mother, shalt thou not uncover: she is thy mother, thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%8%%The nakedness of thy father's wife shalt thou not uncover: it is thy father's nakedness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%9%%The nakedness of thy sister, the daughter of thy father, or daughter of thy mother, whether born at home, or born abroad, even their nakedness thou shalt not uncover.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%10%%The nakedness of thy son's daughter, or of thy daughter's daughter, even their nakedness thou shalt not uncover: for theirs is thy own nakedness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%11%%The nakedness of thy father's wife's daughter, begotten by thy father, (she is thy sister) thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%12%%Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father's sister: she is thy father's near kinswoman.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%13%%Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister: for she is thy mother's near kinswoman.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%14%%Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father's brother, thou shalt not approach to his wife: she is thy aunt.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%15%%Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy daughter-in-law: she is thy son's wife, thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%16%%Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy brother's wife: it is thy brother's nakedness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%17%%Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, neither shalt thou take her son's daughter, or her daughter's daughter, to uncover her nakedness; for they are her near kinswomen: it is wickedness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%18%%Neither shalt thou take a wife to her sister, to vex her, to uncover her nakedness besides the other in her life-time.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%19%%Also thou shalt not approach to a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is put apart for her uncleanness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%20%%Moreover, thou shalt not lie carnally with thy neighbor's wife, to defile thyself with her.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%21%%And thou shalt not let any of thy seed pass through the fire to Molech, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%22%%Thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind: it is abomination.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%23%%Neither shalt thou lie with any beast to defile thyself therewith: neither shall any woman stand before a beast to lie down thereto: it is confusion.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%24%%Defile not ye yourselves in any of these things; for in all these the nations are defiled which I cast out before you:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%25%%And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit its iniquity upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%26%%Ye shall therefore keep my statutes and my judgments, and shall not commit any of these abominations; neither any of your own nation, nor any stranger that sojourneth among you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%27%%(For all these abominations have the men of the land done, who were before you, and the land is defiled;)
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%28%%That the land may not vomit you out also, when ye defile it, as it vomited out the nations that were before you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%29%%For whoever shall commit any of these abominations, even the souls that commit them shall be cut off from among their people.
