1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%18%%30%%Therefore shall ye keep my ordinance, that ye commit not any one of these abominable customs, which were committed before you, and that ye defile not yourselves in them; I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%2%%Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say to them, Ye shall be holy: for I the LORD your God am holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%3%%Ye shall fear every man his mother and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%4%%Turn ye not to idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%5%%And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace-offerings to the LORD, ye shall offer it at your own will.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%6%%It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if aught shall remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%7%%And if it shall be eaten at all on the third day, it is abominable; it shall not be accepted.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%8%%Therefore every one that eateth it shall bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the hallowed thing of the LORD; and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%9%%And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corners of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%10%%And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather every grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%11%%Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%12%%And ye shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%13%%Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbor, neither rob him: the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%14%%Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling-block before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%15%%Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment; thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty: but in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbor.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%16%%Thou shalt not go up and down as a tale-bearer among thy people; neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbor; I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%17%%Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thy heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbor, and not suffer sin upon him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%18%%Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself; I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%19%%Ye shall keep my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle engender with a diverse kind: Thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed: neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woolen come upon thee.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%20%%And whoever lieth carnally with a woman that is a bond-maid betrothed to a husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged: they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%21%%And he shall bring his trespass-offering to the LORD, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, even a ram for a trespass-offering.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%22%%And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass-offering before the LORD for his sin which he hath done; and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%23%%And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food; then ye shall count its fruit as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised to you: it shall not be eaten of.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%24%%But in the fourth year all its fruit shall be holy to praise the LORD with.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%25%%And in the fifth year shall ye eat of its fruit, that it may yield to you its increase: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%26%%Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%27%%Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%28%%Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%29%%Do not prostitute thy daughter to cause her to be a harlot: lest the land should fall to lewdness, and the land become full of wickedness.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%30%%Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%31%%Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%32%%Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honor the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%33%%And if a stranger shall sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not oppress him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%34%%But the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be to you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%35%%Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in weight, in measure of length or of capacity.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%36%%Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%19%%37%%Therefore shall ye observe all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%2%%Again thou shalt say to the children of Israel, Whoever he be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn in Israel, that giveth any of his seed to Molech, he shall surely be put to death: the people of the land shall stone him with stones.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%3%%And I will set my face against that man, and will cut him off from among his people; because he hath given of his seed to Molech, to defile my sanctuary, and to profane my holy name.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%4%%And if the people of the land do any ways hide their eyes from the man, when he giveth of his seed to Molech, and kill him not;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%5%%Then I will set my face against that man, and against his family, and will cut him off, and all that go astray after him, to commit lewdness with Molech from among their people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%6%%And the soul that turneth after such as have familiar spirits, and after wizards, to go astray after them, I will even set my face against that soul, and will cut him off from among his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%7%%Sanctify yourselves therefore and be ye holy: for I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%8%%And ye shall keep my statutes, and do them: I am the LORD who sanctify you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%9%%For every one that curseth his father or his mother, shall surely be put to death: he hath cursed his father or his mother; his blood shall be upon him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%10%%And the man that committeth adultery with another man's wife, even he that committeth adultery with his neighbor's wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%11%%And the man that lieth with his father's wife hath uncovered his father's nakedness; both of them shall surely be put to death: their blood shall be upon them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%12%%And if a man shall lie with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death: they have wrought confusion; their blood shall be upon them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%13%%If a man also shall lie with mankind, as he lieth with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%14%%And if a man shall take a wife and her mother, it is wickedness: they shall be burnt with fire, both he and they: that there be no wickedness among you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%15%%And if a man shall lie with a beast, he shall surely be put to death: and ye shall slay the beast.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%16%%And if a woman shall approach to any beast, and lie down thereto, thou shalt kill the woman and the beast; they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%17%%And if a man shall take his sister, his father's daughter, or his mother's daughter, and see her nakedness, and she see his nakedness; it is a wicked thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of their people: he hath uncovered his sister's nakedness; he shall bear his iniquity.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%18%%And if a man shall lie with a woman having her sickness, and shall uncover her nakedness; he hath discovered her fountain, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blood: and both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%19%%And thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister, nor of thy father's sister: for he uncovereth his near kin: they shall bear their iniquity.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%20%%And if a man shall lie with his uncle's wife, he hath uncovered his uncle's nakedness: they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%21%%And if a man shall take his brother's wife, it is an unclean thing: he hath uncovered his brother's nakedness; they shall be childless.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%22%%Ye shall therefore keep all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: that the land whither I bring you to dwell therein, may not vomit you out.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%23%%And ye shall not walk in the manners of the nations which I cast out before you: for they committed all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%24%%But I have said to you, Ye shall inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess it, a land that floweth with milk and honey: I am the LORD your God, who have separated you from other people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%25%%Ye shall therefore distinguish between clean beasts and unclean, and between unclean fowls and clean: and ye shall not make your souls abominable by beast or by fowl, or by any manner of living animal that creepeth on the ground, which I have separated from you as unclean.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%26%%And ye shall be holy to me: for I the LORD am holy, and have severed you from other people, that ye should be mine.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%20%%27%%A man also or a woman that hath a familiar spirit, or that is a wizard, shall surely be put to death: they shall stone them with stones: their blood shall be upon them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%1%%And the LORD said to Moses, Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them, There shall none be defiled for the dead among his people:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%2%%But for his kin, that is near to him, that is, for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%3%%And for his sister a virgin, that is nigh to him, who hath had no husband: for her he may be defiled.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%4%%But he shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%5%%They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corner of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%6%%They shall be holy to their God, and not profane the name of their God: for the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and the bread of their God they do offer: therefore they shall be holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%7%%They shall not take a wife that is a lewd woman, or profane; neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband: for he is holy to his God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%8%%Thou shalt sanctify him therefore, for he offereth the bread of thy God: he shall be holy to thee: for I the LORD, who sanctify you, am holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%9%%And the daughter of any priest, if she shall profane herself by lewdness, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%10%%And he that is the high priest among his brethren, upon whose head the anointing oil was poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not uncover his head, nor rend his clothes;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%11%%Neither shall he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father, or for his mother;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%12%%Neither shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%13%%And he shall take a wife in her virginity.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%14%%A widow, or a divorced woman, or profane, or a harlot, these shall he not take: but he shall take a virgin of his own people for a wife.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%15%%Neither shall he profane his seed among his people: for I the LORD do sanctify him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%16%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%17%%Speak to Aaron, saying, whoever he may be of thy seed in their generations that hath any blemish, let him not approach to offer the bread of his God:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%18%%For whatever man he may be that hath a blemish, he shall not approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath a flat nose, or any thing superfluous,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%19%%Or a man that is broken-footed, or broken-handed,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%20%%Or crooked-backed, or a dwarf, or that hath a blemish in his eye, or be scurvy, or scabbed, or hath his peculiar members broken:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%21%%No man of the seed of Aaron the priest, that hath a blemish, shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire; he hath a blemish, he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of his God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%22%%He shall eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%23%%Only he shall not go in to the vail, nor come nigh to the altar, because he hath a blemish; that he may not profane my sanctuaries: for I the LORD do sanctify them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%21%%24%%And Moses told it to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%2%%Speak to Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they profane not my holy name in those things which they hallow to me: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%3%%Say to them, Whoever he may be of all your seed among your generations, that approacheth the holy things, which the children of Israel hallow to the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from my presence: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%4%%Whatever man of the seed of Aaron is a leper, or hath a running issue; he shall not eat of the holy things, until he is clean. And whoever toucheth any thing that is unclean by the dead, or a man whose seed goeth from him;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%5%%Or whoever toucheth any creeping animal, by which he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleanness, whatever uncleanness he hath:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%6%%The soul which hath touched any such shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless he shall wash his flesh with water.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%7%%And when the sun is set, he shall be clean, and shall afterward eat of the holy things, because it is his food.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%8%%That which dieth of itself, or is torn by beasts, he shall not eat to defile himself with it: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%9%%They shall therefore keep my ordinance, lest they bear sin for it, and die therefore, if they profane it: I the LORD do sanctify them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%10%%There shall no stranger eat of the holy thing: a sojourner of the priest, or a hired servant, shall not eat of the holy thing.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%11%%But if the priest shall buy any soul with his money, he shall eat of it, and he that is born in his house: they shall eat of his meat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%12%%If the priest's daughter also shall be married to a stranger, she may not eat of an offering of the holy things.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%13%%But if the priest's daughter shall be a widow, or divorced, and shall have no child, and have returned to her father's house, as in her youth, she shall eat of her father's meat; but there shall no stranger eat of it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%14%%And if a man shall eat of the holy thing unknowingly, then he shall put to it the fifth part, and shall give it to the priest, with the holy thing.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%15%%And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel which they offer to the LORD;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%16%%Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%17%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%18%%Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them, Whoever he may be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that will offer his oblation for all his vows, and for all his free-will-offerings, which they will offer to the LORD for a burnt-offering:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%19%%Ye shall offer at your own will a male without blemish of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%20%%But whatever hath a blemish, that shall ye not offer: for it shall not be acceptable for you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%21%%And whoever offereth a sacrifice of peace-offerings to the LORD to accomplish his vow, or a free-will-offering in beeves, or sheep, it shall be perfect to be accepted: there shall be in it no blemish.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%22%%Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scabbed, ye shall not offer these to the LORD, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%23%%Either a bullock, or a lamb that hath any thing superfluous or lacking in his parts, that mayest thou offer for a free-will-offering; but for a vow it shall not be accepted.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%24%%Ye shall not offer to the LORD that which is bruised, or crushed, or broken, or cut; neither shall ye make any offering thereof in your land.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%25%%Neither from a stranger's hand shall ye offer the bread of your God of any of these; because their corruption is in them, and blemishes are in them: they shall not be accepted for you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%26%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%27%%When a bullock, or a sheep, or a goat is brought forth, then it shall be seven days under the dam; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be accepted for an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%28%%And whether it is cow, or ewe, ye shall not kill it and her young both in one day.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%29%%And when ye will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the LORD, offer it at your own will.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%30%%On the same day it shall be eaten up, ye shall leave none of it until the morrow: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%31%%Therefore shall ye keep my commandments, and do them: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%32%%Neither shall ye profane my holy name; but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel: I am the LORD who hallow you,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%22%%33%%That brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, Concerning the feasts of the LORD, which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, even these are my feasts.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%3%%Six days shall work be done: but the seventh day is the sabbath of rest, a holy convocation: ye shall do no work in it: it is the sabbath of the LORD in all your dwellings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%4%%These are the feasts of the LORD, holy convocations, which ye shall proclaim in their seasons.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%5%%In the fourteenth day of the first month at evening is the LORD'S passover.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%6%%And on the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast of unleavened bread to the LORD, seven days ye must eat unleavened bread.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%7%%In the first day ye shall have a holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work in it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%8%%But ye shall offer an offering made by fire to the LORD seven days: in the seventh day is a holy convocation, ye shall do no servile work in it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%9%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%10%%Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, When ye shall have come into the land which I give to you, and shall reap the harvest thereof, then ye shall bring a sheaf of the first-fruits of your harvest to the priest:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%11%%And he shall wave the sheaf before the LORD, to be accepted for you: on the morrow after the sabbath the priest shall wave it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%12%%And ye shall offer, that day when ye wave the sheaf, a he-lamb without blemish of the first year for a burnt-offering to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%13%%And the meat-offering thereof shall be two tenth-parts of fine flour mingled with oil, an offering made by fire to the LORD for a sweet savor: and the drink-offering thereof shall be of wine, the fourth part of a hin.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%14%%And ye shall eat neither bread, nor parched corn, nor green ears, until the same day that ye have brought an offering to your God: It shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%15%%And ye shall count to you from the morrow after the sabbath, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave-offering; seven sabbaths shall be complete:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%16%%Even to the morrow after the seventh sabbath shall ye number fifty days; and ye shall offer a new meat-offering to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%17%%Ye shall bring out of your habitations two wave-loaves of two tenth-parts: they shall be of fine flour, they shall be baked with leaven, they are the first-fruits to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%18%%And ye shall offer with the bread seven lambs without blemish of the first year, and one young bullock, and two rams: they shall be for a burnt-offering to the LORD, with their meat-offering, and their drink offerings, even an offering made by fire of a sweet savor to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%19%%Then ye shall sacrifice one kid of the goats for a sin-offering, and two lambs of the first year for a sacrifice of peace-offerings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%20%%And the priest shall wave them with the bread of the first-fruits for a wave-offering before the LORD, with the two lambs: they shall be holy to the LORD for the priest.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%21%%And ye shall proclaim on the same day, that it may be a holy convocation to you: ye shall do no servile work in it. it shall be a statute for ever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%22%%And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not make clean riddance of the corners of thy field when thou reapest, neither shalt thou gather any gleaning of thy harvest: thou shalt leave them to the poor, and to the stranger: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%23%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%24%%Speak to the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first day of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, a holy convocation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%25%%Ye shall do no servile work in it; but ye shall offer an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%26%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%27%%Also on the tenth day of this seventh month there shall be a day of atonement; it shall be a holy convocation to you, and ye shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%28%%And ye shall do no work in that same day; for it is a day of atonement, to make an atonement for you before the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%29%%For whatever soul it may be that shall not be afflicted in that same day, he shall be cut off from among his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%30%%And whatever soul it may be that doeth any work in that same day, the same soul will I destroy from among his people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%31%%Ye shall do no manner of work. It shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%32%%It shall be to you a sabbath of rest, and ye shall afflict your souls in the ninth day of the month at evening: from evening to evening shall ye celebrate your sabbath.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%33%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%34%%Speak to the children of Israel, saying, The fifteenth day of this seventh month shall be the feast of tabernacles for seven days to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%35%%On the first day shall be a holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work in it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%36%%Seven days ye shall offer an offering made by fire to the LORD: on the eighth day shall be a holy convocation to you, and ye shall offer an offering made by fire to the LORD: it is a solemn assembly; and ye shall do no servile work in it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%37%%These are the feasts of the LORD, which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, to offer an offering made by fire to the LORD, a burnt-offering, and a meat-offering, a sacrifice, and drink-offerings, every thing upon its day:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%38%%Beside the sabbaths of the LORD, and beside your gifts, and beside all your vows, and beside all your free-will-offerings, which ye give to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%39%%Also in the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when ye have gathered in the fruit of the land, ye shall keep a feast to the LORD seven days: on the first day shall be a sabbath, and on the eighth day shall be a sabbath.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%40%%And ye shall take you on the first day the boughs of goodly trees, branches of palm-trees, and the boughs of thick trees, and willows of the brook; and ye shall rejoice before the LORD your God seven days.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%41%%And ye shall keep it a feast to the LORD seven days in the year. It shall be a statute for ever in your generations; ye shall celebrate it in the seventh month.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%42%%Ye shall dwell in booths seven days: all that are Israelites born shall dwell in booths:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%43%%That your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in booths, when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%23%%44%%And Moses declared to the children of Israel the feasts of the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%2%%Command the children of Israel, that they bring to thee pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause the lamps to burn continually.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%3%%Without the vail of the testimony, in the tabernacle of the congregation, shall Aaron order it from the evening to the morning before the LORD continually: It shall be a statute for ever in your generations.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%4%%Ye shall order the lamps upon the pure candlestick before the LORD continually.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%5%%And thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes of it: two tenth-parts shall be in one cake.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%6%%And thou shalt set them in two rows, six in a row, upon the pure table before the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%7%%And thou shalt put pure frankincense upon each row, that it may be on the bread for a memorial, even an offering made by fire to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%8%%Every sabbath he shall set it in order before the LORD continually, being taken from the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%9%%And it shall be Aaron's and his sons'; and they shall eat it in the holy place: for it is most holy to him of the offerings of the LORD made by fire by a perpetual statute.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%10%%And the son of an Israelitish woman whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel; and this son of the Israelitish woman and a man of Israel strove together in the camp;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%11%%And the Israelitish woman's son blasphemed the name of the LORD, and cursed: and they brought him to Moses: (and his mother's name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan:)
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%12%%And they put him in custody, that the mind of the LORD might be shown to them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%13%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%14%%Bring forth him that hath cursed without the camp; and let all that heard him lay their hands upon his head, and let all the congregation stone him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%15%%And thou shalt speak to the children of Israel, saying, Whoever curseth his God shall bear his sin.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%16%%And he that blasphemeth the name of the LORD, he shall surely be put to death, and all the congregation shall certainly stone him: as well the stranger, as he that is born in the land, when he blasphemeth the name of the LORD, shall be put to death.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%17%%And he that killeth any man shall surely be put to death.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%18%%And he that killeth a beast shall make it good; beast for beast.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%19%%And if a man shall cause a blemish in his neighbor; as he hath done, so shall it be done to him;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%20%%Breach for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth: as he hath caused a blemish in a man, so shall it be done to him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%21%%And he that killeth a beast, he shall restore it: and he that killeth a man, he shall be put to death.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%22%%Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger, as for one of your own country: for I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%24%%23%%And Moses spoke to the children of Israel, that they should bring forth him that had cursed out of the camp, and stone him with stones: and the children of Israel did as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses in mount Sinai, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, When ye come into the land which I give you, then shall the land keep a sabbath to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%3%%Six years thou shalt sow thy field, and six years thou shalt prune thy vineyard, and gather in the fruit thereof;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%4%%But in the seventh year shall be a sabbath of rest to the land, a sabbath for the LORD: thou shalt neither sow thy field, nor prune thy vineyard.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%5%%That which groweth of its own accord of thy harvest, thou shalt not reap, neither gather the grapes of thy vine undressed: for it is a year of rest to the land.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%6%%And the sabbath of the land shall be food for you; for thee, and for thy servant, and for thy maid, and for thy hired servant, and for thy stranger that sojourneth with thee,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%7%%And for thy cattle, and for the beast that are in thy land, shall all the increase of it be food.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%8%%And thou shalt number seven sabbaths of years to thee, seven times seven years; and the space of the seven sabbaths of years shall be to thee forty and nine years.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%9%%Then shalt thou cause the trumpet of the jubilee to sound, on the tenth day of the seventh month, in the day of atonement shall ye make the trumpet sound throughout all your land.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%10%%And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout all the land to all its inhabitants: it shall be a jubilee to you; and ye shall return every man to his possession, and ye shall return every man to his family.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%11%%A jubilee shall that fiftieth year be to you: ye shall not sow, neither reap that which groweth of itself in it, nor gather the grapes in it of thy vine undressed.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%12%%For it is the jubilee; it shall be holy to you: ye shall eat the increase of it out of the field.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%13%%In the year of this jubilee ye shall return every man to his possession.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%14%%And if thou shalt sell aught to thy neighbor, or buy aught of thy neighbor's hand, ye shall not oppress one another:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%15%%According to the number of years after the jubilee thou shalt buy of thy neighbor, and according to the number of years of the fruits he shall sell to thee:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%16%%According to the multitude of years thou shalt increase the price of it, and according to the fewness of years thou shalt diminish the price of it: for according to the number of the years of the fruits doth he sell to thee.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%17%%Ye shall not therefore oppress one another; but thou shalt fear thy God: for I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%18%%Wherefore ye shall do my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do them; and ye shall dwell in the land in safety.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%19%%And the land shall yield her fruit, and ye shall eat your fill, and dwell in it in safety.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%20%%And if ye shall say, What shall we eat the seventh year? behold, we shall not sow nor gather in our increase:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%21%%Then I will command my blessing upon you in the sixth year, and it shall bring forth fruit for three years.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%22%%And ye shall sow the eighth year, and eat of old fruit until the ninth year; until its fruits come in ye shall eat of the old store.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%23%%The land shall not be sold for ever; for the land is mine, for ye are strangers and sojourners with me.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%24%%And in all the land of your possession ye shall grant a redemption for the land.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%25%%If thy brother shall have become poor, and have sold some of his possession, and if any of his kin shall come to redeem it, then shall he redeem that which his brother sold.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%26%%And if the man shall have none to redeem it, and himself be able to redeem it;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%27%%Then let him count the years of the sale of it, and restore the overplus to the man to whom he sold it; that he may return to his possession.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%28%%But if he shall not be able to restore it to him, then that which is sold shall remain in the hand of him that hath bought it until the year of jubilee: and in the jubilee it shall go out, and he shall return to his possession.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%29%%And if a man shall sell a dwelling-house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold: within a full year may he redeem it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%30%%And if it shall not be redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be established for ever to him that bought it, throughout his generations: it shall not go out in the jubilee,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%31%%But the houses of the villages which have no walls around them, shall be counted as the fields of the country: they may be redeemed, and they shall go out in the jubilee.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%32%%Notwithstanding the cities of the Levites, and the houses of the cities of their possession, may the Levites redeem at any time.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%33%%And if a man shall purchase of the Levites, then the house that was sold, and the city of his possession shall go out in the year of jubilee; for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%34%%But the field of the suburbs of their cities may not be sold, for it is their perpetual possession.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%35%%And if thy brother shall have become poor, and fallen in decay with thee; then thou shalt relieve him: yea, though he may be a stranger, or a sojourner; that he may live with thee.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%36%%Take thou no interest of him, or increase; but fear thy God; that thy brother may live with thee.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%37%%Thou shalt not give him thy money upon interest, nor lend him thy victuals for increase.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%38%%I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, and to be your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%39%%And if thy brother that dwelleth by thee shall have become poor, and be sold to thee; thou shalt not compel him to serve as a bond servant:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%40%%But as a hired servant, and as a sojourner he shall be with thee, and shall serve thee to the year of jubilee.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%41%%And then shall he depart from thee, both he and his children with him, and shall return to his own family, and to the possession of his fathers shall he return.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%42%%For they are my servants, which I brought out of the land of Egypt; they shall not be sold as bond-men.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%43%%Thou shalt not rule over him with rigor, but shalt fear thy God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%44%%Both thy bond-men, and thy bond-maids, which thou shalt have, shall be of the heathen that are around you; of them shall ye buy bond-men and bond-maids.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%45%%Moreover of the children of the strangers that sojourn among you, of them shall ye buy, and of their families that are with you, which they begat in your land: and they shall be your possession.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%46%%And ye shall take them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit them for a possession, they shall be your bond-men for ever: but over your brethren the children of Israel, ye shall not rule one over another with rigor.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%47%%And if a sojourner or a stranger shall become rich by thee, and thy brother that dwelleth by him shall become poor, and sell himself to the stranger or sojourner by thee, or to the stock of the stranger's family:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%48%%After that he is sold he may be redeemed again; one of his brethren may redeem him:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%49%%Either his uncle, or his uncle's son may redeem him, or any that is nigh of kin to him of his family, may redeem him; or if he is able, he may redeem himself.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%50%%And he shall reckon with him that bought him, from the year that he was sold to him, to the year of jubilee: and the price of his sale shall be according to the number of years, according to the time of a hired servant shall it be with him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%51%%If there shall be yet many years behind, according to them he shall give again the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%52%%And if there shall remain but few years to the year of jubilee, then he shall count with him, and according to his years shall he give him again the price of his redemption.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%53%%And as a yearly hired servant shall he be with him: and the other shall not rule with rigor over him in thy sight.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%54%%And if he shall not be redeemed in these years, then he shall go out in the year of jubilee, both he, and his children with him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%25%%55%%For to me the children of Israel are servants, they are my servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%1%%Ye shall make you no idols nor graven image, neither rear you up a standing image, neither shall ye set up any image of stone in your land, to bow down to it: for I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%2%%Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%3%%If ye walk in my statutes, and keep my commandments, and do them;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%4%%Then I will give you rain in due season, and the land shall yield her increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%5%%And your threshing shall reach to the vintage, and the vintage shall reach to the sowing time; and ye shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%6%%And I will give peace in the land, and ye shall lie down, and none shall make you afraid: and I will rid the land of evil beasts, neither shall the sword go through your land.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%7%%And ye shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%8%%And five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall put ten thousand to flight: and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%9%%For I will have respect to you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, and establish my covenant with you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%10%%And ye shall eat old store, and bring forth the old because of the new.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%11%%And I will set my tabernacle among you: and my soul shall not abhor you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%12%%And I will walk among you, and will be your God, and ye shall be my people.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%13%%I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, that ye should not be their bond-men, and I have broken the bands of your yoke, and made you go upright.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%14%%But if ye will not hearken to me, and will not do all these commandments;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%15%%And if ye shall despise my statutes, or if your soul shall abhor my judgments, so that ye will not do all my commandments, but that ye break my covenant:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%16%%I also will do this to you, I will even appoint over you terror, consumption, and the burning ague, that shall consume the eyes, and cause sorrow of heart: and ye shall sow your seed in vain, for your enemies shall eat it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%17%%And I will set my face against you, and ye shall be slain before your enemies: they that hate you shall reign over you, and ye shall flee when none pursueth you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%18%%And if ye will not yet for all this hearken to me, then I will punish you seven times more for your sins.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%19%%And I will break the pride of your power; and I will make your heaven as iron, and your earth as brass:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%20%%And your strength shall be spent in vain: for your land shall not yield her increase, neither shall the trees of the land yield their fruits.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%21%%And if ye shall walk contrary to me, and will not hearken to me, I will bring seven times more plagues upon you according to your sins.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%22%%I will also send wild beasts among you, which shall rob you of your children, and destroy your cattle, and make you few in number, and your high-ways shall be desolate.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%23%%And if ye will not be reformed by me by these things, but will walk contrary to me;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%24%%Then will I also walk contrary to you, and I will punish you yet seven times for your sins.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%25%%And I will bring a sword upon you, that shall avenge the quarrel of my covenant: and when ye are gathered within your cities, I will send the pestilence among you: and ye shall be delivered into the hand of the enemy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%26%%And when I have broke the staff of your bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall deliver you your bread again by weight: and ye shall eat, and not be satisfied.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%27%%And if ye will not for all this hearken to me, but walk contrary to me;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%28%%Then I will walk contrary to you also in fury; and I, even I, will chastise you seven times for your sins.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%29%%And ye shall eat the flesh of your sons, and the flesh of your daughters shall ye eat.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%30%%And I will destroy your high places, and cut down your images, and cast your carcasses upon the carcasses of your idols, and my soul shall abhor you.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%31%%And I will make your cities waste, and bring your sanctuaries to desolation, and I will not smell the savor of your sweet odors.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%32%%And I will bring the land into desolation: and your enemies who dwell in it shall be astonished at it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%33%%And I will scatter you among the heathen, and will draw out a sword after you: and your land shall be desolate, and your cities waste.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%34%%Then shall the land enjoy its sabbaths, as long as it lieth desolate, and ye are in your enemies' land; even then shall the land rest, and enjoy its sabbaths.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%35%%As long as it lieth desolate, it shall rest; because it did not rest in your sabbaths, when ye dwelt upon it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%36%%And upon them that are left alive of you, I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of a shaken leaf shall chase them; and they shall flee, as fleeing from a sword; and they shall fall, when none pursueth.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%37%%And they shall fall one upon another, as it were before a sword, when none pursueth: and ye shall have no power to stand before your enemies.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%38%%And ye shall perish among the heathen, and the land of your enemies shall eat you up.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%39%%And they that are left of you shall pine away in their iniquity in your enemies' lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers shall they pine away with them.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%40%%If they shall confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, with their trespass which they trespassed against me, and that also they have walked contrary to me;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%41%%And that I also have walked contrary to them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts shall be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%42%%Then will I remember my covenant with Jacob, and also my covenant with Isaac, and also my covenant with Abraham will I remember; and I will remember the land.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%43%%The land also shall be left by them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity; because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%44%%And yet for all that, when they shall be in the land of their enemies, I will not cast them away, neither will I abhor them, to destroy them utterly, and to break my covenant with them; for I am the LORD their God.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%45%%But I will for their sakes remember the covenant of their ancestors, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the heathen, that I might be their God: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%26%%46%%These are the statutes, and judgments, and laws, which the LORD made between him and the children of Israel in mount Sinai by the hand of Moses.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%2%%Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, When a man shall make a singular vow, the persons shall be for the LORD, by thy estimation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%3%%And thy estimation shall be, of the male from twenty years old even to sixty years old, even thy estimation shall be fifty shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%4%%And if it shall be a female, then thy estimation shall be thirty shekels.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%5%%And if it shall be from five years old even to twenty years old, then thy estimation shall be of the male twenty shekels, and for the female ten shekels.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%6%%And if it shall be from a month old even to five years old, then thy estimation shall be of the male five shekels of silver, and for the female thy estimation shall be three shekels of silver.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%7%%And if it shall be from sixty years old and above; if a male, then thy estimation shall be fifteen shekels, and for the female ten shekels.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%8%%But if he shall be poorer than thy estimation, then he shall present himself before the priest, and the priest shall value him: according to his ability that vowed shall the priest value him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%9%%And if it shall be a beast of which men bring an offering to the LORD, all that any man giveth of such to the LORD shall be holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%10%%He shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good: and if he shall at all change beast for beast, then it and the exchange of it shall be holy.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%11%%And if it shall be any unclean beast, of which they do not offer a sacrifice to the LORD, then he shall present the beast before the priest:
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%12%%And the priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad: as thou valuest it, who art the priest, so shall it be.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%13%%But if he will at all redeem it, then he shall add a fifth part of it to thy estimation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%14%%And when a man shall sanctify his house to be holy to the LORD, then the priest shall estimate it, whether it is good or bad: as the priest shall estimate it, so shall it stand.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%15%%And if he that sanctified it will redeem his house, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thy estimation to it, and it shall be his.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%16%%And if a man shall sanctify to the LORD some part of a field of his possession, then thy estimation shall be according to the seed of it: a homer of barley seed shall be valued at fifty shekels of silver.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%17%%If he shall sanctify his field from the year of jubilee, according to thy estimation it shall stand.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%18%%But if he shall sanctify his field after the jubilee, then the priest shall reckon to him the money according to the years that remain, even to the year of the jubilee, and it shall be abated from thy estimation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%19%%And if he that sanctified the field will in any wise redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thy estimation to it, and it shall be assured to him.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%20%%And if he will not redeem the field, or if he shall have sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%21%%But the field, when it goeth out in the jubilee, shall be holy to the LORD, as a field devoted: the possession of it shall be the priest's.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%22%%And if a man shall sanctify to the LORD a field which he hath bought, which is not of the fields of his possession;
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%23%%Then the priest shall reckon to him the worth of thy estimation, even to the year of the jubilee, and he shall give thy estimation in that day, as a holy thing to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%24%%In the year of the jubilee, the field shall return to him of whom it was bought, even to him to whom the possession of the land belonged.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%25%%And all thy estimations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs shall be the shekel.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%26%%Only the firstling of the beasts, which should be the LORD'S firstling, no man shall sanctify it; whether ox, or sheep: it is the LORD'S.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%27%%And if it shall be of an unclean beast, then he shall redeem it, according to thy estimation, and shall add to it a fifth part of it: or if it shall be not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to thy estimation.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%28%%Notwithstanding, no devoted thing that a man shall devote to the LORD of all that he hath, both of man and beast, and of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%29%%None devoted, which shall be devoted by men, shall be redeemed: but shall surely be put to death.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%30%%And all the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land, or of the fruit of the tree, is the LORD'S: it is holy to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%31%%And if a man will at all redeem aught of his tithes, he shall add to it the fifth part of it.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%32%%And concerning the tithe of the herd, or of the flock, even of whatever passeth under the rod, the tenth shall be holy to the LORD.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%33%%He shall not search whether it is good or bad, neither shall he change it: and if he shall change it at all, then both it and the change of it shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.
1000005%%Leviticus%%OT%%27%%34%%These are the commandments which the LORD commanded Moses for the children of Israel in mount Sinai.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tabernacle of the congregation, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%2%%Take ye the sum of all the congregation of the children of Israel, after their families by the house of their fathers, with the number of their names, every male by their poll:
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%3%%From twenty years old and upward, all that are able to go forth to war in Israel; thou and Aaron shall number them by their armies.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%4%%And with you there shall be a man of every tribe; every one head of the house of his fathers.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%5%%And these are the names of the men that shall stand with you: Of the tribe of Reuben; Elizur the son of Shedeur.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%6%%Of Simeon; Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%7%%Of Judah; Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%8%%Of Issachar; Nethaneel the son of Zuar.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%9%%Of Zebulun; Eliab the son of Helon.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%10%%Of the children of Joseph: of Ephraim; Elishama the son of Ammihud; of Manasseh; Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%11%%Of Benjamin; Abidan the son of Gideoni.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%12%%Of Dan; Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%13%%Of Asher; Pagiel the son of Ocran.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%14%%Of Gad; Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%15%%Of Naphtali; Ahira the son of Enan.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%16%%These were the renowned of the congregation, princes of the tribes of their fathers, heads of thousands in Israel.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%17%%And Moses and Aaron took these men who are expressed by their names:
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%18%%And they assembled all the congregation on the first day of the second month, and they declared their pedigrees after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, by their polls.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%19%%As the LORD commanded Moses, so he numbered them in the wilderness of Sinai.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%20%%And the children of Reuben, Israel's eldest son, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, by their polls, every male from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%21%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Reuben, were forty and six thousand and five hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%22%%Of the children of Simeon, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, those that were numbered of them according to the number of the names, by their polls, every male from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%23%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Simeon, were fifty and nine thousand and three hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%24%%Of the children of Gad, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%25%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Gad, were forty and five thousand six hundred and fifty.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%26%%Of the children of Judah, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%27%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Judah, were seventy and four thousand and six hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%28%%Of the children of Issachar, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%29%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Issachar, were fifty and four thousand and four hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%30%%Of the children of Zebulun, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%31%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Zebulun, were fifty and seven thousand and four hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%32%%Of the children of Joseph, namely, of the children of Ephraim, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%33%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Ephraim, were forty thousand and five hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%34%%Of the children of Manasseh, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%35%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Manasseh, were thirty and two thousand and two hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%36%%Of the children of Benjamin, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%37%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Benjamin, were thirty and five thousand and four hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%38%%Of the children of Dan, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%39%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Dan, were sixty and two thousand and seven hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%40%%Of the children of Asher, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%41%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Asher, were forty and one thousand and five hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%42%%Of the children of Naphtali, throughout their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%43%%Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Naphtali, were fifty and three thousand and four hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%44%%These are those that were numbered, which Moses and Aaron numbered, and the princes of Israel, being twelve men: each one was for the house of his fathers.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%45%%So were all those that were numbered of the children of Israel, by the house of their fathers, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war in Israel;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%46%%Even all they that were numbered, were six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%47%%But the Levites, after the tribe of their fathers, were not numbered among them.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%48%%For the LORD had spoken to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%49%%Only thou shalt not number the tribe of Levi, neither take the sum of them among the children of Israel:
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%50%%But thou shalt appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of testimony, and over all its vessels, and over all things that belong to it: they shall bear the tabernacle, and all its vessels, and they shall minister to it, and shall encamp around the tabernacle.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%51%%And when the tabernacle moveth forward, the Levites shall take it down; and when the tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%52%%And the children of Israel shall pitch their tents every man by his own camp, and every man by his own standard, throughout their hosts.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%53%%But the Levites shall pitch around the tabernacle of testimony; that there may be no wrath upon the congregation of the children of Israel: and the Levites shall keep the charge of the tabernacle of testimony.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%1%%54%%And the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses, so did they.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%2%%Every man of the children of Israel shall pitch by his own standard, with the ensign of their father's house: far off about the tabernacle of the congregation shall they pitch.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%3%%And on the east side towards the rising of the sun shall they of the standard of the camp of Judah pitch throughout their armies: and Nahshon the son of Amminadab shall be captain of the children of Judah.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%4%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were seventy and four thousand and six hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%5%%And those that shall pitch next to him, shall be the tribe of Issachar: and Nethaneel the son of Zuar shall be captain of the children of Issachar.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%6%%And his host, and those that were numbered of it, were fifty and four thousand and four hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%7%%Then the tribe of Zebulun: and Eliab the son of Helon shall be captain of the children of Zebulun.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%8%%And his host, and those that were numbered of it, were fifty and seven thousand and four hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%9%%All that were numbered in the camp of Judah were a hundred thousand and eighty thousand and six thousand and four hundred throughout their armies: these shall first move forward.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%10%%On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of Reuben according to their armies: and the captain of the children of Reuben shall be Elizur the son of Shedeur.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%11%%And his host, and those that were numbered of it were forty and six thousand and five hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%12%%And those who pitch by him shall be the tribe of Simeon: and the captain of the children of Simeon shall be Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%13%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were fifty and nine thousand and three hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%14%%Then the tribe of Gad: and the captain of the sons of Gad shall be Eliasaph the son of Reuel.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%15%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were forty and five thousand and six hundred and fifty.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%16%%All that were numbered in the camp of Reuben were a hundred thousand and fifty and one thousand and four hundred and fifty, throughout their armies: and they shall move forward in the second rank.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%17%%Then the tabernacle of the congregation shall move forward with the camp of the Levites, in the midst of the camp: as they encamp, so shall they move forward, every man in his place by their standards.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%18%%On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of Ephraim, according to their armies: and the captain of the sons of Ephraim shall be Elishama the son of Ammihud.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%19%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were forty thousand and five hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%20%%And by him shall be the tribe of Manasseh: and the captain of the children of Manasseh shall be Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%21%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were thirty and two thousand and two hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%22%%Then the tribe of Benjamin: and the captain of the sons of Benjamin shall be Abidan the son of Gideoni.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%23%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were thirty and five thousand and four hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%24%%All that were numbered of the camp of Ephraim, were a hundred thousand and eight thousand and a hundred, throughout their armies: and they shall go forward in the third rank.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%25%%The standard of the camp of Dan shall be on the north side by their armies: and the captain of the children of Dan shall be Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%26%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were sixty and two thousand and seven hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%27%%And those that encamp by him shall be the tribe of Asher: and the captain of the children of Asher shall be Pagiel the son of Ocran.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%28%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were forty and one thousand and five hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%29%%Then the tribe of Naphtali: and the captain of the children of Naphtali shall be Ahira the son of Enan.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%30%%And his host, and those that were numbered of them, were fifty and three thousand and four hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%31%%All they that were numbered in the camp of Dan were a hundred thousand and fifty and seven thousand and six hundred: they shall go hindmost with their standards.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%32%%These are those who were numbered of the children of Israel by the house of their fathers. All those that were numbered of the camps throughout their hosts, were six hundred thousand and three thousand and five hundred and fifty.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%33%%But the Levites were not numbered among the children of Israel; as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%2%%34%%And the children of Israel did according to all that the LORD commanded Moses: so they pitched by their standards, and so they moved forward, every one after their families, according to the house of their fathers.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%1%%These also are the generations of Aaron and Moses, in the day that the LORD spoke with Moses in mount Sinai.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%2%%And these are the names of the sons of Aaron; Nadab the first-born, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%3%%These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests who were anointed, whom he consecrated to minister in the priest's office.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%4%%And Nadab and Abihu died before the LORD, when they offered strange fire before the LORD, in the wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children: and Eleazar and Ithamar ministered in the priest's office in the sight of Aaron their father.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%5%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%6%%Bring the tribe of Levi near, and present them before Aaron the priest, that they may minister to him.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%7%%And they shall keep his charge, and the charge of the whole congregation before the tabernacle of the congregation, to do the service of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%8%%And they shall keep all the instruments of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the charge of the children of Israel, to do the service of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%9%%And thou shalt give the Levites to Aaron and to his sons: they are wholly given to him out of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%10%%And thou shalt appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall wait on their priest's office: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%11%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%12%%And I, behold, I have taken the Levites from among the children of Israel, instead of all the first-born that openeth the matrix among the children of Israel: therefore the Levites shall be mine;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%13%%Because all the first-born are mine; for on the day that I smote all the first-born in the land of Egypt, I hallowed to me all the first-born in Israel, both man and beast: mine they shall be: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%14%%And the LORD spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%15%%Number the children of Levi after the house of their fathers, by their families: every male from a month old and upward shalt thou number them.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%16%%And Moses numbered them according to the word of the LORD, as he was commanded.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%17%%And these were the sons of Levi, by their names; Gershon, and Kohath, and Merari.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%18%%And these are the names of the sons of Gershon by their families; Libni, and Shimei.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%19%%And the sons of Kohath by their families; Amram, and Izehar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%20%%And the sons of Merari by their families; Mahli, and Mushi: these are the families of the Levites, according to the house of their fathers.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%21%%Of Gershon was the family of the Libnites, and the family of the Shimites: these are the families of the Gershonites.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%22%%Those that were numbered of them, according to the number of all the males, from a month old and upward, even those that were numbered of them, were seven thousand and five hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%23%%The families of the Gershonites shall pitch behind the tabernacle westward.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%24%%And the chief of the house of the father of the Gershonites shall be Eliasaph the son of Lael.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%25%%And the charge of the sons of Gershon in the tabernacle of the congregation shall be the tabernacle, and the tent, its covering, and the hanging for the door of the tabernacle of the congregation,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%26%%And the hangings of the court, and the curtain for the door of the court, which is by the tabernacle, and by the altar round about, and the cords of it, for all the service of it.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%27%%And of Kohath was the family of the Amramites, and the family of the Izharites, and the family of the Hebronites, and the family of the Uzzielites: these are the families of the Kohathites.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%28%%In the number of all the males from a month old and upward, were eight thousand and six hundred, keeping the charge of the sanctuary.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%29%%The families of the sons of Kohath shall pitch on the side of the tabernacle southward.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%30%%And the chief of the house of the father of the families of the Kohathites shall be Elizaphan the son of Uzziel.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%31%%And their charge shall be the ark, and the table, and the candlestick, and the altars, and the vessels of the sanctuary with which they minister, and the hanging, and all the service of it.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%32%%And Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest shall be chief over the chief of the Levites, and have the oversight of them that keep the charge of the sanctuary.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%33%%Of Merari was the family of the Mahlites, and the family of the Mushites: these are the families of Merari.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%34%%And those that were numbered of them, according to the number of all the males from a month old and upward, were six thousand and two hundred.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%35%%And the chief of the house of the father of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail: these shall pitch on the side of the tabernacle northward.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%36%%And under the custody and charge of the sons of Merari shall be the boards of the tabernacle, and its bars, and its pillars, and its sockets, and all its vessels, and all that serveth to it.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%37%%And the pillars of the court round about, and their sockets, and their pins, and their cords.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%38%%But those that encamp before the tabernacle towards the east, even before the tabernacle of the congregation eastward shall be Moses and Aaron, and his sons, keeping the charge of the sanctuary, for the charge of the children of Israel; and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%39%%All that were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered at the commandment of the LORD, throughout their families, all the males from a month old and upward, were twenty and two thousand.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%40%%And the LORD said to Moses, number all the first-born of the males of the children of Israel, from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%41%%And thou shalt take the Levites for me (I am the LORD) instead of all the first-born among the children of Israel; and the cattle of the Levites, instead of all the firstlings among the cattle of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%42%%And Moses numbered, as the LORD commanded him, all the first-born among the children of Israel.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%43%%And all the first-born males by the number of names, from a month old and upward, of those that were numbered of them, were twenty and two thousand two hundred and seventy and three.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%44%%And the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%45%%Take the Levites instead of all the first-born among the children of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites instead of their cattle; and the Levites shall be mine: I am the LORD.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%46%%And for those that are to be redeemed of the two hundred and seventy and three, of the first-born of the children of Israel, which are more than the Levites:
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%47%%Thou shalt even take five shekels apiece by the poll, after the shekel of the sanctuary shalt thou take them: the shekel is twenty gerahs.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%48%%And thou shalt give to Aaron and to his sons the money, with which the odd number of them is to be redeemed.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%49%%And Moses took the redemption-money of them that were over and above them that were redeemed by the Levites:
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%50%%Of the first-born of the children of Israel he took the money; a thousand three hundred and sixty and five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%3%%51%%And Moses gave the money of them that were redeemed to Aaron, and to his sons, according to the word of the LORD, as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%1%%And the LORD spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%2%%Take the sum of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, after their families, by the house of their fathers;
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%3%%From thirty years old and upward, even until fifty years old, all that enter into the host, to do the work in the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%4%%This shall be the service of the sons of Kohath in the tabernacle of the congregation, about the most holy things.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%5%%And when the camp moveth forward, Aaron shall come, and his sons, and they shall take down the covering vail, and cover the ark of testimony with it:
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%6%%And shall put on it the covering of badgers' skins, and shall spread over it a cloth wholly of blue, and shall put in the staffs of it.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%7%%And upon the table of show-bread they shall spread a cloth of blue, and put on it the dishes, and the spoons, and the bowls, and covers to cover with: and the continual bread shall be upon it.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%8%%And they shall spread upon them a cloth of scarlet, and cover the same with a covering of badgers' skins, and shall put in the staffs of it.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%9%%And they shall take a cloth of blue, and cover the candlestick of the light, and its lamps, and its tongs, and its snuff-dishes, and all its oil vessels, with which they minister to it:
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%10%%And they shall put it, and all its vessels, within a covering of badgers' skins, and shall put it upon a bar.
1000005%%Numbers%%OT%%4%%11%%And upon the golden altar they shall spread a cloth of blue, and cover it with a covering of badgers' skins, and shall put to it its staffs.
