1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%12%%And ye shall rejoice before the LORD your God, ye, and your sons, and your daughters, and your men-servants, and your maid-servants, and the Levite that is within your gates; forasmuch as he hath no part nor inheritance with you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%13%%Take heed to thyself that thou offer not thy burnt-offerings in every place that thou seest:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%14%%But in the place which the LORD shall choose in one of thy tribes, there thou shalt offer thy burnt-offerings, and there thou shalt do all that I command thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%15%%Notwithstanding, thou mayest kill and eat flesh in all thy gates, whatever thy soul desireth, according to the blessing of the LORD thy God which he hath given thee: the unclean and the clean may eat of it as of the roebuck, and as of the hart.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%16%%Only ye shall not eat the blood; ye shall pour it upon the earth as water.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%17%%Thou mayest not eat within thy gates the tithe of thy corn, or of thy wine, or of thy oil, or the firstlings of thy herds or of thy flock, nor any of thy vows which thou vowest, nor thy free-will-offerings, or heave-offering of thy hand:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%18%%But thou must eat them before the LORD thy God in the place which the LORD thy God shall choose, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy man-servant, and thy maid-servant, and the Levite that is within thy gates: and thou shalt rejoice before the LORD thy God in all that thou puttest thine hands to.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%19%%Take heed to thyself that thou forsake not the Levite as long as thou livest upon the earth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%20%%When the LORD thy God shall enlarge thy border, as he hath promised thee, and thou shalt say, I will eat flesh, because thy soul longeth to eat flesh; thou mayest eat flesh, whatever thy soul desireth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%21%%If the place which the LORD thy God hath chosen to put his name there, shall be too far from thee, then thou shalt kill of thy herd and of thy flock, which the LORD hath given thee, as I have commanded thee, and thou shalt eat in thy gates whatever thy soul desireth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%22%%Even as the roebuck and the hart is eaten, so thou shalt eat them: the unclean and the clean shall eat of them alike.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%23%%Only be sure that thou eat not the blood: for the blood is the life; and thou mayest not eat the life with the flesh.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%24%%Thou shalt not eat it: thou shalt pour it upon the earth as water.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%25%%Thou shalt not eat it; that it may be well with thee, and with thy children after thee, when thou shalt do that which is right in the sight of the LORD.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%26%%Only thy holy things which thou hast, and thy vows, thou shalt take, and go to the place which the LORD shall choose:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%27%%And thou shalt offer thy burnt-offerings, the flesh and the blood, upon the altar of the LORD thy God: and the blood of thy sacrifices shall be poured out upon the altar of the LORD thy God, and thou shalt eat the flesh.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%28%%Observe and hear all these words which I command thee, that it may be well with thee, and with thy children after thee for ever, when thou doest that which is good and right in the sight of the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%29%%When the LORD thy God shall cut off the nations from before thee, whither thou goest to possess them, and thou succeedest them, and dwellest in their land;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%30%%Take heed to thyself that thou be not snared by following them, after that they are destroyed from before thee; and that thou inquire not after their gods, saying, How did these nations serve their gods? even so will I do likewise.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%31%%Thou shalt not do so to the LORD thy God; for every abomination to the LORD which he hateth have they done to their gods; for even their sons and their daughters they have burnt in the fire to their gods.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%12%%32%%Whatever thing I command you, observe to do it: thou shalt not add to it, nor diminish from it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%1%%If there shall arise among you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and give thee a sign or a wonder.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%2%%And the sign or the wonder shall come to pass, of which he spoke to thee, saying, Let us go after other gods, which thou hast not known, and let us serve them;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%3%%Thou shalt not hearken to the words of that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams: for the LORD your God proveth you, to know whether ye love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%4%%Ye shall walk after the LORD your God, and fear him, and keep his commandments, and obey his voice, and ye shall serve him, and cleave to him.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%5%%And that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to death; because he hath spoken to turn you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed you from the house of bondage, to thrust thee out of the way which the LORD thy God commanded thee to walk in. So shalt thou remove the evil from the midst of thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%6%%If thy brother, the son of thy mother, or thy son, or thy daughter, or the wife of thy bosom, or thy friend, who is as thy own soul, shall entice thee secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which thou hast not known, thou, nor thy fathers;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%7%%Namely, of the gods of the people who are around you, nigh to thee, or far off from thee, from one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%8%%Thou shalt not consent to him, nor hearken to him; neither shall thy eye pity him, neither shalt thou spare, neither shalt thou conceal him:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%9%%But thou shalt surely kill him; thy hand shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the people.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%10%%And thou shalt stone him with stones that he shall die; because he hath sought to thrust thee away from the LORD thy God, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt from the house of bondage.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%11%%And all Israel shall hear, and fear, and shall do no more any such wickedness as this is, among you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%12%%If thou shalt hear, in one of thy cities, which the LORD thy God hath given thee to dwell there, saying,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%13%%Certain men, the children of Belial, have gone out from among you, and have withdrawn the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods, which ye have not known;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%14%%Then shalt thou inquire, and make search, and ask diligently; and behold, if it is truth, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought among you;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%15%%Thou shalt surely smite the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is in it, and its cattle, with the edge of the sword.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%16%%And thou shalt gather all the spoil of it into the midst of its street, and shalt burn with fire the city, and all the spoil of it every whit, for the LORD thy God: and it shall be a heap forever; it shalt not be built again.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%17%%And there shall cleave naught of the cursed thing to thy hand: that the LORD may turn from the fierceness of his anger, and show thee mercy, and have compassion upon thee, and multiply thee, as he hath sworn to thy fathers;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%13%%18%%When thou shalt hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, to keep all his commandments which I command thee this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%1%%Ye are the children of the LORD your God: ye shall not cut yourselves, nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%2%%For thou art a holy people to the LORD thy God, and the LORD hath chosen thee to be a peculiar people to himself, above all the nations that are upon the earth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%3%%Thou shalt not eat any abominable thing.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%4%%These are the beasts which ye shall eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%5%%The hart, and the roebuck, and the fallow-deer, and the wild-goat, and the pygarg, and the wild ox, and the chamois.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%6%%And every beast that parteth the hoof, and cleaveth the cleft into two claws, and cheweth the cud among the beasts, that ye shall eat.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%7%%Nevertheless, these ye shall not eat, of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the cloven hoof; the camel, and the hare, and the coney: for they chew the cud, but divide not the hoof; therefore they are unclean to you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%8%%And the swine, because it divideth the hoof, yet cheweth not the cud, is unclean to you: ye shall not eat of their flesh, nor touch their dead carcass.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%9%%These ye shall eat, of all that are in the waters: all that have fins and scales shall ye eat:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%10%%And whatever hath not fins and scales ye may not eat; it is unclean to you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%11%%Of all clean birds ye shall eat.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%12%%But these are they of which ye shall not eat: the eagle, and the ossifrage, and the ospray,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%13%%And the glede, and the kite, and the vultur after his kind,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%14%%And every raven after his kind,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%15%%And the owl, and the night-hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after his kind,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%16%%The little owl, and the great owl, and the swan,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%17%%And the pelican, and the gier-eagle, and the cormorant,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%18%%And the stork, and the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%19%%And every creeping animal that flieth is unclean to you: they shall not be eaten.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%20%%But of all clean fowls ye may eat.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%21%%Ye shall not eat of any thing that dieth of itself: thou shalt give it to the stranger that is in thy gates, that he may eat it; or thou mayest sell it to an alien: for thou art a holy people to the LORD thy God. Thou shalt not seethe a kid in his mother's milk.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%22%%Thou shalt truly tithe all the increase of thy seed, that the field bringeth forth year by year.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%23%%And thou shalt eat before the LORD thy God, in the place which he shall choose to place his name there, the tithe of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thy oil, and the firstlings of thy herds and of thy flocks; that thou mayest learn to fear the LORD thy God always.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%24%%And if the way is too long for thee, so that thou art not able to carry it; or if the place is too far from thee, which the LORD thy God shall choose to set his name there, when the LORD thy God hath blessed thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%25%%Then shalt thou turn it into money, and bind up the money in thy hand, and shalt go to the place which the LORD thy God shall choose:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%26%%And thou shalt bestow that money for whatever thy soul desireth, for oxen, or for sheep, or for wine, or for strong drink, or for whatever thy soul desireth: and thou shalt eat there before the LORD thy God, and thou shalt rejoice, thou, and thy household.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%27%%And the Levite that is within thy gates, thou shalt not forsake him; for he hath no part nor inheritance with thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%28%%At the end of three years thou shalt bring forth all the tithe of thy increase the same year, and shalt lay it up within thy gates:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%14%%29%%And the Levite, (because he hath no part nor inheritance with thee) and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, who are within thy gates, shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that the LORD thy God may bless thee in all the work of thy hand which thou doest.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%1%%At the end of every seven years thou shalt make a release.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%2%%And this is the manner of the release: Every creditor that lendeth aught to his neighbor shall release it; he shall not exact it of his neighbor, or of his brother; because it is called the LORD'S release.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%3%%Of a foreigner thou mayest exact it again: but that which is thine with thy brother thy hand shall release:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%4%%Save when there shall be no poor among you; for the LORD shall greatly bless thee in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance to possess it:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%5%%Only if thou shalt carefully hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, to observe to do all these commandments which I command thee this day.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%6%%For the LORD thy God shall bless thee, as he promised thee: and thou shalt lend to many nations, but thou shalt not borrow; and thou shalt reign over many nations, but they shall not reign over thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%7%%If there shall be among you a poor man of one of thy brethren within any of thy gates in thy land which the LORD the God giveth thee, thou shalt not harden thy heart, nor shut thy hand from thy poor brother:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%8%%But thou shalt open thy hand wide to him, and shalt surely lend him sufficient for his need, in that which he wanteth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%9%%Beware that there be not a thought in thy wicked heart, saying, The seventh year, the year of release, is at hand; and thy eye shall be evil against thy poor brother, and thou shalt give him naught; and he shall cry to the LORD against thee, and it shall be sin to thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%10%%Thou shalt surely give him, and thy heart shall not be grieved when thou givest to him: because that for this thing the LORD thy God shall bless thee in all thy works, and in all that thou puttest thy hand to.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%11%%For the poor shall never cease from the land: therefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt open thy hand wide to thy brother, to thy poor, and to thy needy, in thy land.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%12%%And if thy brother, a Hebrew man, or a Hebrew woman, shall be sold to thee, and serve thee six years; then in the seventh year thou shalt let him go free from thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%13%%And when thou sendest him out free from thee, thou shalt not let him depart empty:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%14%%Thou shalt furnish him liberally out of thy flock, and out of thy floor, and out of thy wine-press: of that with which the LORD thy God hath blessed thee thou shalt give to him.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%15%%And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bond-man in the land of Egypt, and the LORD thy God redeemed thee: therefore I command thee this thing this day.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%16%%And it shall be, if he shall say to thee, I will not leave thee; because he loveth thee and thy house, because he is well with thee;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%17%%Then thou shalt take an awl, and thrust it through his ear into the door, and he shall be thy servant for ever. And also to thy maid-servant thou shalt do likewise.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%18%%It shall not seem hard to thee, when thou sendest him away free from thee; for he hath been of double the worth of a hired servant to thee, in serving thee six years: and the LORD thy God shall bless thee in all that thou doest.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%19%%All the firstling males that come of thy herd and of thy flock thou shalt sanctify to the LORD thy God: thou shalt do no work with the firstling of thy bullock, nor shear the firstling of thy sheep.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%20%%Thou shalt eat it before the LORD thy God year by year in the place which the LORD shall choose, thou and thy household.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%21%%And if there is any blemish in it, as if it is lame, or blind, or hath any ill blemish, thou shalt not sacrifice it to the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%22%%Thou shalt eat it within thy gates: the unclean and the clean person shall eat it alike, as the roebuck, and as the hart.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%15%%23%%Only thou shalt not eat its blood; thou shalt pour it upon the ground as water.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%1%%Observe the month Abib, and keep the passover to the LORD thy God: for in the month of Abib the LORD thy God brought thee forth from Egypt by night.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%2%%Thou shalt therefore sacrifice the passover to the LORD thy God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which the LORD shall choose to place his name there.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%3%%Thou shalt eat no leavened bread with it; seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread with it, even the bread of affliction; for thou camest forth from the land of Egypt in haste: that thou mayest remember the day when thou camest forth from the land of Egypt, all the days of thy life.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%4%%And there shall be no leavened bread seen with thee in all thy borders seven days; neither shall there any thing of the flesh, which thou didst sacrifice the first day at evening, remain all night until the morning.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%5%%Thou mayest not sacrifice the passover within any of thy gates, which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%6%%But at the place which the LORD thy God shall choose to place his name in, there thou shalt sacrifice the passover at evening, at the setting of the sun, at the time of thy departure from Egypt.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%7%%And thou shalt roast and eat it in the place which the LORD thy God shall choose: and thou shalt turn in the morning, and go to thy tents.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%8%%Six days thou shalt eat unleavened bread: and on the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to the LORD thy God: in it thou shalt do no work.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%9%%Seven weeks shalt thou number to thee: begin to number the seven weeks from the time when thou beginnest to put the sickle to the corn.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%10%%And thou shalt keep the feast of weeks to the LORD thy God with a tribute of a free-will-offering of thy hand, which thou shalt give to the LORD thy God, according as the LORD thy God hath blessed thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%11%%And thou shalt rejoice before the LORD thy God, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy man-servant, and thy maid-servant, and the Levite that is within thy gates, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are among you, in the place which the LORD thy God hath chosen to place his name there.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%12%%And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bond-man in Egypt: and thou shalt observe and do these statutes.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%13%%Thou shalt observe the feast of tabernacles seven days, after that thou hast gathered in thy corn, and thy wine.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%14%%And thou shalt rejoice in thy feast, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy man-servant, and thy maid-servant, and the Levite, the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that are within thy gates:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%15%%Seven days shalt thou keep a solemn feast to the LORD thy God in the place which the LORD shall choose: because the LORD thy God shall bless thee in all thy increase, and in all the works of thy hands, therefore thou shalt surely rejoice.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%16%%Three times in a year shall all thy males appear before the LORD thy God in the place which he shall choose; in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles: and they shall not appear before the LORD empty:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%17%%Every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of the LORD thy God which he hath given thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%18%%Judges and officers shalt thou make thee in all thy gates, which the LORD thy God giveth thee, throughout thy tribes: and they shall judge the people with just judgment.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%19%%Thou shalt not wrest judgment; thou shalt not respect persons, neither take a gift; for a gift doth blind the eyes of the wise, and pervert the words of the righteous.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%20%%That which is altogether just shalt thou follow, that thou mayest live, and inherit the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%21%%Thou shalt not plant thee a grove of any trees near to the altar of the LORD thy God, which thou shalt make for thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%16%%22%%Neither shalt thou set thee up any image; which the LORD thy God hateth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%1%%Thou shalt not sacrifice to the LORD thy God any bullock, or sheep, in which is blemish, or any evil favoredness: for that is an abomination to the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%2%%If there shall be found among you, within any of thy gates which the LORD thy God giveth thee, man or woman that hath wrought wickedness in the sight of of the LORD thy God, in transgressing his covenant,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%3%%And hath gone and served other gods, and worshiped them, either the sun, or moon, or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%4%%And it shall be told thee, and thou hast heard of it, and inquired diligently, and behold, it is true, and the thing certain, that such abomination is wrought in Israel:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%5%%Then shalt thou bring forth to thy gates that man or that woman, who have committed that wicked thing, even that man or that woman, and shalt stone them with stones, till they die.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%6%%At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he that is worthy of death be put to death; but at the mouth of one witness he shall not be put to death.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%7%%The hands of the witnesses shall be first upon him to put him to death, and afterward the hands of all the people. So thou shalt remove the evil from among you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%8%%If there shall arise a matter too hard for thee in judgment, between blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke, being matters of controversy within thy gates: then shalt thou arise, and go up to the place which the LORD thy God shall choose;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%9%%And thou shalt come to the priests the Levites, and to the judge that shall be in those days, and inquire; and they shall show thee the sentence of judgment:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%10%%And thou shalt do according to the sentence, which they of that place which the LORD shall choose shall show thee; and thou shalt observe to do according to all that they inform thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%11%%According to the sentence of the law which they shall teach thee, and according to the judgment which they shall tell thee, thou shalt do: thou shalt not decline from the sentence which they shall show thee, to the right hand, nor to the left.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%12%%And the man that will do presumptuously, and will not hearken to the priest that standeth to minister there before the LORD thy God, or to the judge, even that man shall die: and thou shalt remove the evil from Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%13%%And all the people shall hear, and fear, and do no more presumptuously.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%14%%When thou art come into the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, and shalt possess it, and shalt dwell in it, and shalt say, I will set a king over me, like as all the nations that are about me;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%15%%Thou shalt in any wise set him king over thee whom the LORD thy God shall choose: one from among thy brethren shalt thou set king over thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, who is not thy brother.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%16%%But he shall not multiply horses to himself, nor cause the people to return to Egypt, to the end that he should multiply horses: forasmuch as the LORD hath said to you, ye shall henceforth return no more that way.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%17%%Neither shall he multiply wives to himself, that his heart may turn not away: neither shall he greatly accumulate to himself silver and gold.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%18%%And it shall be when he sitteth upon the throne of his kingdom, that he shall write him a copy of this law in a book out of that which is before the priests the Levites.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%19%%And it shall be with him, and he shall read in it all the days of his life: that he may learn to fear the LORD his God, to keep all the words of this law and these statutes, to do them:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%17%%20%%That his heart may not be lifted above his brethren, and that he may not turn aside from the commandment to the right hand or to the left: to the end that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, he, and his children, in the midst of Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%1%%The priests the Levites, and all the tribe of Levi, shall have no part nor inheritance with Israel: they shall eat the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and his inheritance.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%2%%Therefore shall they have no inheritance among their brethren: the LORD is their inheritance, as he hath said to them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%3%%And this shall be the priest's due from the people, from them that offer a sacrifice, whether ox or sheep; and they shall give to the priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%4%%The first-fruit also of thy corn, of thy wine, and of thy oil, and the first of the fleece of thy sheep, shalt thou give him.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%5%%For the LORD thy God hath chosen him out of all thy tribes, to stand to minister in the name of the LORD, him and his sons for ever.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%6%%And if a Levite shall come from any of thy gates out of all Israel, where he sojourned, and come with all the desire of his mind to the place which the LORD shall choose;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%7%%Then he shall minister in the name of the LORD his God, as all his brethren the Levites do, who stand there before the LORD.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%8%%They shall have like portions to eat, beside that which cometh of the sale of his patrimony.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%9%%When thou art come into the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, thou shalt not learn to do after the abominations of those nations.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%10%%There shall not be found among you any one that maketh his son or his daughter to pass through the fire, or that useth divination, or an observer of times, or an enchanter, or a witch,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%11%%Or a charmer, or a consulter with familiar spirits, or a wizard, or a necromancer.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%12%%For all that do these things are an abomination to the LORD: and because of these abominations the LORD thy God doth drive them out from before thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%13%%Thou shalt be perfect with the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%14%%For these nations, which thou shalt possess, hearkened to observers of times, and to diviners: but as for thee, the LORD thy God hath not suffered thee so to do.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%15%%The LORD thy God will raise up to thee a Prophet from the midst of thee, of thy brethren, like to me; to him ye shall hearken.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%16%%According to all that thou desiredst of the LORD thy God in Horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, Let me not hear again the voice of the LORD my God, neither let me see this great fire any more, that I may not die.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%17%%And the LORD said to me, They have well spoken of that which they have spoken.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%18%%I will raise up to them a prophet from among their brethren, like thee, and will put my words in his mouth; and he shall speak to them all that I shall command him.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%19%%And it shall come to pass, that whoever will not hearken to my words which he shall speak in my name, I will require it of him.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%20%%But the prophet, who shall presume to speak a word in my name, which I have not commanded him to speak, or that shall speak in the name of other gods, even that prophet shall die.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%21%%And if thou shalt say in thy heart, How shall we know the word which the LORD hath not spoken?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%18%%22%%When a prophet speaketh in the name of the LORD, if the thing doth not follow, nor come to pass, that is the thing which the LORD hath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%1%%When the LORD thy God hath cut off the nations, whose land the LORD thy God giveth thee, and thou succeedest them, and dwellest in their cities, and in their houses;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%2%%Thou shalt separate three cities for thee in the midst of thy land which the LORD thy God giveth thee to possess it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%3%%Thou shalt prepare thee a way, and divide the limits of thy land which the LORD thy God giveth thee to inherit, into three parts, that every slayer may flee thither.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%4%%And this is the case of the slayer, who shall flee thither, that he may live: Whoever killeth his neighbor ignorantly, whom he hated not in time past;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%5%%As when a man goeth into the wood with his neighbor to hew wood, and his hand maketh a stroke with the ax to cut down the tree, and the head slippeth from the helve, and falleth upon his neighbor, that he dieth: he shall flee to one of these cities, and live:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%6%%Lest the avenger of blood shall pursue the slayer, while his heart is hot, and overtake him, because the way is long, and slay him; whereas he was not worthy of death, inasmuch as he hated him not in time past.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%7%%Wherefore I command thee, saying, Thou shalt separate three cities for thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%8%%And if the LORD thy God shall enlarge thy limits, as he hath sworn to thy fathers, and give thee all the land which he promised to give to thy fathers;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%9%%If thou shalt keep all these commandments to do them, which I command thee this day, to love the LORD thy God, and to walk ever in his ways; then shalt thou add three cities more for thee, besides these three:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%10%%That innocent blood may not be shed in thy land, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance, and so blood be upon thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%11%%But if any man shall hate his neighbor, and lie in wait for him, and rise up against him, and smite him mortally, that he dieth, and he shall flee into one of these cities:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%12%%Then the elders of his city shall send and bring him thence, and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, that he may die.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%13%%Thy eye shall not pity him, but thou shall remove the guilt of innocent blood from Israel, that it may be well with thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%14%%Thou shalt not remove thy neighbor's landmark, which they of old time have set in thy inheritance, which thou shalt inherit in the land that the LORD thy God giveth thee to possess it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%15%%One witness shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity, or for any sin, in any sin that he sinneth; at the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall the matter be established.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%16%%If a false witness shall rise up against any man to testify against him that which is wrong;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%17%%Then both the men between whom the controversy is shall stand before the LORD, before the priests, and the judges, who shall be in those days;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%18%%And the judges shall make diligent inquisition: and behold, if the witness is a false witness, and hath testified falsely against his brother;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%19%%Then shall ye do to him, as he had thought to do to his brother: so shalt thou remove the evil from among you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%20%%And those who remain shall hear, and fear, and shall henceforth commit no more any such evil among you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%19%%21%%And thy eye shall not pity; but life shall go for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%1%%When thou goest out to battle against thy enemies, and seest horses, and chariots, and a people more than thou, be not afraid of them: for the LORD thy God is with thee, who brought thee out of the land of Egypt.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%2%%And it shall be when ye are come nigh to the battle, that the priest shall approach and speak to the people,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%3%%And shall say to them, Hear, O Israel, ye approach this day to battle against your enemies: let not your hearts faint, fear not, and do not tremble, neither be ye terrified because of them;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%4%%For the LORD your God is he that goeth with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%5%%And the officers shall speak to the people, saying, What man is there that hath built a new house, and hath not dedicated it? let him go and return to his house, lest he should die in the battle, and another man should dedicate it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%6%%And what man is he that hath planted a vineyard, and hath not yet eaten of it? let him also go and return to his house, lest he should die in the battle, and another man should eat of it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%7%%And what man is there that hath betrothed a wife, and hath not taken her? let him go and return to his house, lest he should die in battle, and another man should take her.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%8%%And the officers shall speak further to the people, and they shall say, What man is there that is fearful and faint-hearted? let him go and return to his house, lest his brethren's heart should faint as well as his heart.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%9%%And it shall be, when the officers have made an end of speaking to the people, that they shall make captains of the armies to lead the people.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%10%%When thou comest nigh to a city to fight against it, then proclaim peace to it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%11%%And it shall be, if it shall make thee answer of peace, and open to thee, then it shall be, that all the people that are found therein, shall be tributaries to thee, and they shall serve thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%12%%And if it will make no peace with thee, but will make war against thee, then thou shalt besiege it:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%13%%And when the LORD thy God hath delivered it into thy hands, thou shalt smite every male of it with the edge of the sword:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%14%%But the women, and the little ones, and the cattle, and all that is in the city, even all the spoil of it, shalt thou take to thyself: and thou shalt eat the spoil of thy enemies, which the LORD thy God hath given thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%15%%Thus shalt thou do to all the cities which are very distant from thee, which are not of the cities of these nations.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%16%%But of the cities of these people which the LORD thy God doth give thee for an inheritance, thou shalt save alive nothing that breatheth:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%17%%But thou shalt utterly destroy them, namely, the Hittites, and the Amorites, the Canaanites, and the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, as the LORD thy God hath commanded thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%18%%That they may not teach you to do after all their abominations which they have done to their gods; so would ye sin against the LORD your God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%19%%When thou shalt besiege a city a long time in making war against it to take it, thou shalt not destroy the trees of it by forcing an ax against them; for thou mayest eat of them: and thou shalt not cut them down (for the tree of the field is man's life) to employ them in the siege:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%20%%20%%Only the trees which thou knowest that they are not trees for food, thou shalt destroy and cut them down; and thou shalt build bulwarks against the city that maketh war with thee, until it shall be subdued.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%1%%If one shall be found slain in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee to possess it, lying in the field, and it be not known who hath slain him:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%2%%Then thy elders and thy judges shall come forth, and they shall measure to the cities which are around him that is slain:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%3%%And it shall be that the city which is next to the slain man, even the elders of that city shall take a heifer which hath not been wrought with, and which hath not drawn in the yoke;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%4%%And the elders of that city shall bring down the heifer to a rough valley, which is neither tilled nor sown, and shall strike off the heifer's neck there in the valley;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%5%%And the priests the sons of Levi shall come near (for them the LORD thy God hath chosen to minister to him, and to bless in the name of the LORD) and by their word shall every controversy and every stroke be tried;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%6%%And all the elders of that city that are next to the slain man, shall wash their hands over the heifer that is beheaded in the valley:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%7%%And they shall answer and say, Our hands have not shed this blood, neither have our eyes seen it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%8%%Be merciful, O LORD, to thy people Israel, whom thou hast redeemed, and lay not innocent blood to the charge of thy people Israel. And the blood shall be forgiven them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%9%%So shalt thou remove the guilt of innocent blood from among you, when thou shalt do that which is right in the sight of the LORD.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%10%%When thou goest forth to war against thy enemies, and the LORD thy God hath delivered them into thy hands, and thou hast taken them captive,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%11%%And thou seest among the captives a beautiful woman, and hast a desire to her, that thou wouldest have her for thy wife:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%12%%Then thou shalt bring her home to thy house, and she shall shave her head, and pare her nails:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%13%%And she shall put off from her the raiment of her captivity, and shall remain in thy house, and bewail her father and her mother a full month: and after that, thou shalt go in to her, and be her husband, and she shall be thy wife.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%14%%And it shall be, if thou shalt have no delight in her, then thou shalt let her go whither she will; but thou shalt not sell her at all for money; thou shalt not make merchandise of her, because thou hast humbled her.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%15%%If a man shall have two wives, one beloved, and another hated, and they have borne him children, both the beloved and the hated; and if the first-born son be hers that was hated:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%16%%Then it shall be, when he maketh his sons to inherit that which he hath, that he may not prefer the son of the beloved first-born, before the son of the hated, which is indeed the first-born:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%17%%But he shall acknowledge the son of the hated for the first-born, by giving him a double portion of all that he hath: for he is the beginning of his strength; the right of the first-born is his.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%18%%If a man shall have a stubborn and rebellious son, who will not obey the voice of his father, or the voice of his mother, and who, when they have chastened him, will not hearken to them:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%19%%Then shall his father and his mother lay hold on him, and bring him out to the elders of his city, and to the gate of his place;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%20%%And they shall say to the elders of his city, This our son is stubborn and rebellious, he will not obey our voice; he is a glutton, and a drunkard.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%21%%And all the men of his city shall stone him with stones, that he may die: so shalt thou remove evil from among you, and all Israel shall hear, and fear.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%22%%And if a man shall have committed a sin worthy of death, and he must be put to death, and thou shalt hang him on a tree:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%21%%23%%His body shall not remain all night upon the tree, but thou shalt in any wise bury him that day; (for he that is hanged is accursed of God;) that thy land may not be defiled, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%1%%Thou shalt not see thy brother's ox or his sheep go astray, and hide thyself from them: thou shalt in any case bring them again to thy brother.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%2%%And if thy brother shall not be nigh to thee, or if thou shalt not know him, then thou shalt bring it to thy own house, and it shall be with thee until thy brother shall seek after it, and thou shalt restore it to him again.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%3%%In like manner shalt thou do with his ass; and so shalt thou do with his raiment; and with all lost things of thy brother's, which he hath lost, and thou hast found, shalt thou do likewise: thou mayest not hide thyself.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%4%%Thou shalt not see thy brother's ass or his ox fall down by the way, and hide thyself from them: thou shalt surely help him to lift them up again.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%5%%A woman shall not wear that which pertaineth to a man, neither shall a man put on a woman's garment: for all that do so are abomination to the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%6%%If a bird's nest shall chance to be before thee in the way on any tree, or on the ground, whether with young ones, or eggs, and the dam sitting upon the young, or upon the eggs, thou shalt not take the dam with the young:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%7%%But thou shalt in any wise let the dam go, and take the young to thee; that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest prolong thy days.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%8%%When thou buildest a new house, then thou shalt make a battlement for thy roof, that thou mayest not bring blood upon thy house, if any man shall fall from thence.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%9%%Thou shalt not sow thy vineyard with divers seeds: lest the fruit of thy seed which thou hast sown, and the fruit of thy vineyard, should be defiled.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%10%%Thou shalt not plow with an ox and an ass together.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%11%%Thou shalt not wear a garment of divers sorts, as of woolen and linen together.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%12%%Thou shalt make thee fringes upon the four quarters of thy vesture, with which thou coverest thyself.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%13%%If any man shall take a wife, and go in to her, and hate her,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%14%%And give occasions of speech against her, and bring an evil name upon her, and say, I took this woman, and when I came to her, I found her not a maid:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%15%%Then shall the father of the damsel, and her mother, take and bring forth the tokens of the damsel's virginity to the elders of the city in the gate:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%16%%And the damsel's father shall say to the elders, I gave my daughter to this man for a wife, and he hateth her,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%17%%And lo, he hath given occasions of speech against her, saying, I found not thy daughter a maid; and yet these are the tokens of my daughter's virginity. And they shall spread the cloth before the elders of the city.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%18%%And the elders of that city shall take that man and chastise him;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%19%%And they shall amerce him in a hundred shekels of silver, and give them to the father of the damsel, because he hath brought an evil name upon a virgin of Israel: and she shall be his wife; he may not put her away all his days.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%20%%But if this thing shall be true, and the tokens of virginity be not found for the damsel:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%21%%Then they shall bring out the damsel to the door of her father's house, and the men of her city shall stone her with stones that she may die: because she hath wrought folly in Israel, to be guilty of lewdness in her father's house: so shalt thou remove evil from among you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%22%%If a man shall be found lying with a woman married to a husband, then they shall both of them die, both the man that lay with the woman, and the woman: so shalt thou remove evil from Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%23%%If a damsel that is a virgin shall be betrothed to a husband, and a man shall find her in the city, and lie with her;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%24%%Then ye shall bring them both out to the gate of that city, and ye shall stone them with stones that they may die; the damsel, because she cried not, being in the city; and the man, because he hath humbled his neighbor's wife: so thou shalt remove evil from among you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%25%%But if a man shall find a betrothed damsel in the field, and the man shall force her, and lie with her; then the man only that lay with her shall die:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%26%%But to the damsel thou shalt do nothing; there is in the damsel no sin worthy of death: for as when a man riseth against his neighbor, and slayeth him, even so is this matter:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%27%%For he found her in the field, and the betrothed damsel cried, and there was none to save her.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%28%%If a man shall find a damsel that is a virgin, who is not betrothed, and lay hold on her, and lie with her, and they be found;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%29%%Then the man that lay with her shall give to the damsel's father fifty shekels of silver, and she shall be his wife; because he hath humbled her, he may not put her away all his days.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%22%%30%%A man shall not take his father's wife, nor discover his father's skirt.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%1%%He that is wounded or mutilated in his secrets, shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%2%%A bastard shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD; even to his tenth generation shall he not enter into the congregation of the LORD.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%3%%An Ammonite or Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the LORD; even to their tenth generation shall they not enter into the congregation of the LORD for ever:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%4%%Because they met you not with bread and with water in the way, when ye came forth from Egypt; and because they hired against thee Balaam the son of Beor of Pethor of Mesopotamia, to curse thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%5%%Nevertheless, the LORD thy God would not hearken to Balaam: but the LORD thy God turned the curse into a blessing to thee, because the LORD thy God loved thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%6%%Thou shalt not seek their peace, nor their prosperity all thy days for ever.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%7%%Thou shalt not abhor an Edomite, for he is thy brother: thou shalt not abhor an Egyptian, because thou wast a stranger in his land.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%8%%The children that are begotten by them shall enter into the congregation of the LORD in their third generation.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%9%%When the host goeth forth against thy enemies, then keep thee from every wicked thing.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%10%%If there shall be among you any man that is not clean by reason of uncleanness that chanceth to him by night, then shall he go abroad out of the camp, he shall not come within the camp:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%11%%But it shall be, when evening cometh on, he shall wash himself with water: and when the sun is down, he shall come into the camp again.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%12%%Thou shalt have a place also without the camp, whither thou shalt go forth abroad:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%13%%And thou shalt have a paddle upon thy weapon: and it shall be when thou wilt ease thyself abroad, thou shalt dig with it, and shalt turn back, and cover that which cometh from thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%14%%For the LORD thy God walketh in the midst of thy camp, to deliver thee, and to give up thy enemies before thee; therefore shall thy camp be holy: that he may see no unclean thing in thee, and turn away from thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%15%%Thou shalt not deliver to his master the servant who hath escaped from his master to thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%16%%He shall dwell with thee, even among you in that place which he shall choose in one of thy gates where it pleaseth him best: thou shalt not oppress him.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%17%%There shall be no harlot of the daughters of Israel, nor a sodomite of the sons of Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%18%%Thou shalt not bring the hire of a harlot, or the price of a dog into the house of the LORD thy God for any vow: for even both these are abomination to the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%19%%Thou shalt not lend upon interest to thy brother; interest of money, interest of victuals, interest of any thing that is lent upon interest:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%20%%To a stranger thou mayest lend upon interest; but to thy brother thou shalt not lend upon interest; that the LORD thy God may bless thee in all that thou settest thy hand to in the land whither thou goest to possess it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%21%%When thou shalt vow a vow to the LORD thy God, thou shalt not defer to pay it: for the LORD thy God will surely require it of thee; and it would be sin in thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%22%%But if thou shalt forbear to vow, it shall be no sin in thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%23%%That which is uttered by thy lips thou shalt keep and perform; even a free-will-offering, according as thou hast vowed to the LORD thy God, which thou hast promised with thy mouth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%24%%When thou comest into thy neighbor's vineyard, then thou mayest satisfy thy appetite with grapes at thy own pleasure; but thou shalt not put any in thy vessel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%23%%25%%When thou comest into the standing-corn of thy neighbor, then thou mayest pluck the ears with thy hand: but thou shalt not move a sickle to thy neighbor's standing-corn.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%1%%When a man hath taken a wife, and married her, and it shall come to pass that she findeth no favor in his eyes, because he hath found some uncleanness in her: then let him write her a bill of divorcement, and give it in her hand, and send her out of his house.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%2%%And when she hath departed from his house, she may go and be another man's wife.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%3%%And if the latter husband shall hate her, and write her a bill of divorcement, and give it in her hand, and send her out of his house; or if the latter husband shall die, who took her to be his wife;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%4%%Her former husband who sent her away, may not take her again to be his wife, after that she is defiled; for that is abomination before the LORD: and thou shalt not cause the land to sin, which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%5%%When a man hath newly taken a wife, he shall not go out to war, neither shall he be charged with any business: but he shall be free at home one year, and shall cheer his wife which he hath taken.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%6%%No man shall take the nether or the upper millstone for a pledge: for he taketh a man's life for a pledge.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%7%%If a man shall be found stealing any of his brethren of the children of Israel, and shall make merchandise of him, or sell him; then that thief shall die; and thou shalt remove evil from among you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%8%%Take heed in the plague of leprosy, that thou observe diligently, and do according to all that the priests the Levites shall teach you: as I commanded them, so ye shall observe to do.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%9%%Remember what the LORD thy God did to Miriam by the way, after that ye come forth from Egypt.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%10%%When thou dost lend thy brother any thing, thou shalt not go into his house to take his pledge:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%11%%Thou shalt stand abroad, and the man to whom thou dost lend shall bring out the pledge abroad to thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%12%%And if the man is poor, thou shalt not sleep with his pledge:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%13%%In any case thou shalt deliver to him the pledge again when the sun goeth down, that he may sleep in his own raiment, and bless thee; and it shall be righteousness to thee before the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%14%%Thou shalt not oppress a hired servant that is poor and needy, whether he is of thy brethren, or of thy strangers that are in thy land within thy gates:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%15%%At his day thou shalt give him his hire, neither shall the sun go down upon it, for he is poor, and setteth his heart upon it: lest he should cry against thee to the LORD, and it be sin to thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%16%%The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers: every man shall be put to death for his own sin.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%17%%Thou shalt not pervert the judgment of the stranger, nor of the fatherless, nor take a widow's raiment for a pledge:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%18%%But thou shalt remember that thou wast a bond-man in Egypt, and the LORD thy God redeemed thee thence: therefore I command thee to do this thing.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%19%%When thou cuttest down thy harvest in thy field, and hast forgot a sheaf in the field, thou shalt not go again to fetch it: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow: that the LORD thy God may bless thee in all the work of thy hands.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%20%%When thou beatest thy olive-tree, thou shalt not go over the boughs again: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%21%%When thou gatherest the grapes of thy vineyard, thou shalt not glean it afterward: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%24%%22%%And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bond-man in the land of Egypt: therefore I command thee to do this thing.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%1%%If there shall be a controversy between men, and they come to judgment, that the judges may judge them; then they shall justify the righteous, and condemn the wicked.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%2%%And it shall be, if the wicked man be worthy to be beaten, that the judge shall cause him to lie down, and to be beaten before his face, according to his fault, by a certain number.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%3%%Forty stripes he may give him, and not exceed: lest if he should exceed, and beat him above these with many stripes, then thy brother should seem vile to thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%4%%Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out the corn.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%5%%If brethren shall dwell together, and one of them shall die and have no child, the wife of the dead shall not marry without to a stranger: her husband's brother shall go in to her, and take her to him for a wife, and perform the duty of a husband's brother to her.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%6%%And it shall be, that the first-born which she beareth, shall succeed in the name of his brother who is dead, that his name may not become extinct in Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%7%%And if the man shall not like to take his brother's wife, then let his brother's wife go up to the gate to the elders, and say, My husband's brother refuseth to raise up to his brother a name in Israel, he will not perform the duty of my husband's brother.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%8%%Then the elders of his city shall call him, and speak to him: and if he shall stand to it, and say, I like not to take her,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%9%%Then shall his brother's wife come to him in the presence of the elders, and loose his shoe from off his foot, and spit in his face, and shall answer and say, So shall it be done to that man that will not build up his brother's house.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%10%%And his name shall be called in Israel, The house of him that hath his shoe loosed.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%11%%When men strive together one with another, and the wife of the one draweth near to deliver her husband from the hand of him that smiteth him, and putteth forth her hand, and taketh him by the secrets:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%12%%Then thou shalt cut off her hand, thy eye shall not pity her.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%13%%Thou shalt not have in thy bag divers weights, a great and a small:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%14%%Thou shalt not have in thy house divers measures, a great and a small:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%15%%But thou shalt have a perfect and just weight, a perfect and just measure shalt thou have; that thy days may be lengthened in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%16%%For all that do such things, and all that do unrighteously, are an abomination to the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%17%%Remember what Amalek did to thee by the way, when ye had come forth from Egypt;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%18%%How he met thee by the way, and smote the hindmost of thee, even all that were feeble behind thee, when thou wast faint and weary; and he feared not God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%25%%19%%Therefore it shall be, when the LORD thy God hath given thee rest from all thy enemies on all sides, in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance to possess it, that thou shalt blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven; thou shalt not forget it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%1%%And it shall be, when thou hast come in to the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee for an inheritance, and possessest it, and dwellest therein;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%2%%That thou shalt take of the first of all the fruit of the earth, which thou shalt bring of thy land that the LORD thy God giveth thee, and shalt put it in a basket, and shalt go to the place which the LORD thy God shall choose to place his name there.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%3%%And thou shalt go to the priest that shall be in those days, and say to him, I profess this day to the LORD thy God, that I have come to the country which the LORD swore to our fathers to give us.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%4%%And the priest shall take the basket from thy hand, and set it down before the altar of the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%5%%And thou shalt speak and say before the LORD thy God, A Syrian ready to perish was my father, and he went down to Egypt, and sojourned there with a few, and became there a nation, great, mighty, and populous:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%6%%And the Egyptians ill-treated us, and afflicted us, and laid upon us hard bondage:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%7%%And when we cried to the LORD God of our fathers, the LORD heard our voice, and looked on our affliction, and our labor, and our oppression:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%8%%And the LORD brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand, and with an out-stretched arm, and with great terribleness, and with signs, and with wonders;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%9%%And he hath brought us into this place, and hath given us this land, even a land that floweth with milk and honey.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%10%%And now, behold, I have brought the first-fruits of the land, which thou, O LORD, hast given me: and thou shalt set it before the LORD thy God, and worship before the LORD thy God:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%11%%And thou shalt rejoice in every good thing which the LORD thy God hath given to thee, and to thy house, thou, and the Levite, and the stranger that is among you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%12%%When thou hast made an end of tithing all the tithes of thy increase the third year, which is the year of tithing, and hast given it to the Levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, that they may eat within thy gates, and be filled:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%13%%Then thou shalt say before the LORD thy God, I have brought away the hallowed things out of my house, and also have given them to the Levite, and to the stranger, to the fatherless, and to the widow, according to all thy commandments which thou hast commanded me: I have not transgressed thy commandments, neither have I forgotten them:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%14%%I have not eaten of it in my mourning, neither have I taken away aught of it for any unclean use, nor given aught of it for the dead: but I have hearkened to the voice of the LORD my God, and have done according to all that thou hast commanded me.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%15%%Look down from thy holy habitation, from heaven, and bless thy people Israel, and the land which thou hast given us, as thou didst swear to our fathers, a land that floweth with milk and honey.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%16%%This day the LORD thy God hath commanded thee to perform these statutes and judgments: thou shalt therefore keep and do them with all thy heart, and with all thy soul.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%17%%Thou hast avouched the LORD this day to be thy God, and to walk in his ways, and to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and to hearken to his voice:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%18%%And the LORD hath avouched thee this day to be his peculiar people, as he hath promised thee, and that thou shouldst keep all his commandments;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%26%%19%%And to make thee high above all nations which he hath made, in praise, and in name, and in honor; and that thou mayest be a holy people to the LORD thy God, as he hath spoken.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%1%%And Moses with the elders of Israel commanded the people, saying, Keep all the commandments which I command you this day.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%2%%And it shall be on the day when ye shall pass over Jordan to the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, that thou shalt set thee up great stones, and plaster them with plaster:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%3%%And thou shalt write upon them all the words of this law, when thou hast passed over, that thou mayest enter in to the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee, a land that floweth with milk and honey; as the LORD God of thy fathers hath promised thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%4%%Therefore it shall be when ye have gone over Jordan, that ye shall set up these stones, which I command you this day, in mount Ebal, and thou shalt plaster them with plaster.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%5%%And there shalt thou build an altar to the LORD thy God, an altar of stones: thou shalt not lift up any iron tool upon them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%6%%Thou shalt build the altar of the LORD thy God of whole stones: and thou shalt offer on it burnt-offerings to the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%7%%And thou shalt offer peace-offerings, and shalt eat there, and rejoice before the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%8%%And thou shalt write upon the stones all the words of this law, very plainly.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%9%%And Moses and the priests the Levites spoke to all Israel, saying, Take heed and hearken, O Israel, this day thou art become the people of the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%10%%Thou shalt therefore obey the voice of the LORD thy God, and do his commandments and his statutes which I command thee this day.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%11%%And Moses charged the people the same day, saying,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%12%%These shall stand upon mount Gerizim to bless the people, when ye have come over Jordan; Simeon, and Levi, and Judah, and Issachar, and Joseph, and Benjamin:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%13%%And these shall stand upon mount Ebal to curse; Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%14%%And the Levites shall speak, and say to all the men of Israel with a loud voice,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%15%%Cursed be the man that maketh any graven or molten image, an abomination to the LORD, the work of the hands of the artificer, and putteth it in a secret place: and all the people shall answer, and say Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%16%%Cursed be he that setteth light by his father or his mother: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%17%%Cursed be he that removeth his neighbor's landmark: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%18%%Cursed be he that maketh the blind to wander out of the way: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%19%%Cursed be he that perverteth the judgment of the stranger, fatherless, and widow: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%20%%Cursed be he that lieth with his father's wife; because he uncovereth his father's skirt: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%21%%Cursed be he that lieth with any manner of beast: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%22%%Cursed be he that lieth with his sister, the daughter of his father, or the daughter of his mother: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%23%%Cursed be he that lieth with his mother-in-law: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%24%%Cursed be he that smiteth his neighbor secretly: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%25%%Cursed be he that taketh reward to slay an innocent person: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%27%%26%%Cursed be he that confirmeth not all the words of this law to do them: and all the people shall say, Amen.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%1%%And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken diligently to the voice of the LORD thy God, to observe and to do all his commandments which I command thee this day; that the LORD thy God will set thee on high above all nations of the earth:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%2%%And all these blessings shall come on thee, and overtake thee, if thou shalt hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%3%%Blessed shalt thou be in the city, and blessed shalt thou be in the field.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%4%%Blessed shall be the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy ground, and the fruit of thy cattle, the increase of thy cattle, and the flocks of thy sheep.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%5%%Blessed shall be thy basket and thy store.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%6%%Blessed shalt thou be when thou comest in, and blessed shalt thou be when thou goest out.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%7%%The LORD shall cause thy enemies that rise up against thee to be smitten before thy face: they shall come out against thee one way, and flee before thee seven ways.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%8%%The LORD shall command the blessing upon thee in thy store-houses, and in all that thou settest thy hand to: and he shall bless thee in the land which the LORD thy God giveth thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%9%%The LORD shall establish thee a holy people to himself, as he hath sworn to thee, if thou shalt keep the commandments of the LORD thy God, and walk in his ways.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%10%%And all the people of the earth shall see that thou art called by the name of the LORD; and they shall be afraid of thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%11%%And the LORD shall make thee to abound in goods, in the fruit of thy body, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy ground, in the land which the LORD swore to thy fathers to give thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%12%%The LORD shall open to thee his good treasure, the heaven to give rain to thy land in its season, and to bless all the work of thy hand: and thou shalt lend to many nations, and thou shalt not borrow.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%13%%And the LORD shall make thee the head, and not the tail; and thou shalt be above only, and thou shalt not be beneath; if thou shalt hearken to the commandments of the LORD thy God, which I command thee this day, to observe and to do them:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%14%%And thou shalt not go aside from any of the words which I command thee this day, to the right hand or to the left, to go after other gods to serve them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%15%%But it shall come to pass, if thou wilt not hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes which I command thee this day; that all these curses shall come upon thee, and overtake thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%16%%Cursed shalt thou be in the city, and cursed shalt thou be in the field.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%17%%Cursed shall be thy basket and thy store.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%18%%Cursed shall be the fruit of thy body, and the fruit of thy land, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%19%%Cursed shalt thou be when thou comest in, and cursed shalt thou be when thou goest out.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%20%%The LORD shall send upon thee cursing, vexation, and rebuke, in all that thou undertakest to perform, until thou shalt be destroyed, and until thou shalt perish quickly; because of the wickedness of thy doings by which thou hast forsaken me.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%21%%The LORD shall make the pestilence cleave to thee, until he shall have consumed thee from off the land, whither thou goest to possess it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%22%%The LORD shall smite thee with a consumption, and with a fever, and with an inflammation, and with an extreme burning, and with the sword, and with blasting, and with mildew: and they shall pursue thee until thou dost perish.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%23%%And thy heaven that is over thy head shall be brass, and the earth that is under thee shall be iron.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%24%%The LORD shall make the rain of thy land powder and dust: from heaven shall it come down upon thee, until thou art destroyed.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%25%%The LORD shall cause thee to be smitten before thy enemies: thou shalt go out one way against them, and flee seven ways before them; and shalt be removed into all the kingdoms of the earth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%26%%And thy carcass shall be food to all fowls of the air, and to the beasts of the earth, and no man shall drive them away.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%27%%The LORD will smite thee with the botch of Egypt, and with the emerods, and with the scab, and with the itch, of which thou canst not be healed.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%28%%The LORD shall smite thee with the madness, and blindness, and astonishment of heart:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%29%%And thou shalt grope at noon-day, as the blind gropeth in darkness, and thou shalt not prosper in thy ways: and thou shalt be only oppressed and spoiled evermore, and no man shall save thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%30%%Thou shalt betroth a wife, and another man shall lie with her: thou shalt build a house, and thou shalt not dwell in it: thou shalt plant a vineyard, and shalt not gather the grapes of it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%31%%Thy ox shall be slain before thy eyes, and thou shalt not eat of it: thy ass shall be violently taken away from before thy face, and shall not be restored to thee: thy sheep shall be given to thy enemies, and thou shalt have none to rescue them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%32%%Thy sons and thy daughters shall be given to another people, and thy eyes shall look, and fail with longing for them all the day long: and there shall be no might in thy hand.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%33%%The fruit of thy land, and all thy labors, shall be eaten by a nation which thou knowest not: and thou shalt be only oppressed and crushed always:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%34%%So that thou shalt be mad for the sight of thy eyes which thou shalt see.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%35%%The LORD shall smite thee in the knees, and in the legs, with a sore botch that cannot be healed, from the sole of thy foot to the top of thy head.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%36%%The LORD shall bring thee, and thy king which thou shalt set over thee, to a nation which neither thou nor thy fathers have known; and there shalt thou serve other gods, wood and stone.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%37%%And thou shalt become an astonishment, a proverb, and a by-word, among all nations whither the LORD shall lead thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%38%%Thou shalt carry much seed into the field, and shalt gather but little: for the locust shall consume it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%39%%Thou shalt plant vineyards and dress them, but shalt neither drink of the wine, nor gather the grapes: for the worm shall eat them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%40%%Thou shalt have olive-trees throughout all thy coasts, but thou shalt not anoint thyself with the oil: for thy olive shall cast its fruit.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%41%%Thou shalt beget sons and daughters, but thou shalt not enjoy them: for they shall go into captivity.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%42%%All thy trees and fruit of thy land shall the locust consume.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%43%%The stranger that is within thee shall rise above thee very high; and thou shalt come down very low.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%44%%He shall lend to thee, and thou shalt not lend to him: he shall be the head, and thou shalt be the tail.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%45%%Moreover, all these curses shall come upon thee, and shall pursue thee, and overtake thee, till thou art destroyed: because thou hearkenedst not to the voice of the LORD thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which he commanded thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%46%%And they shall be upon thee for a sign and for a wonder, and upon thy seed for ever.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%47%%Because thou didst not serve the LORD thy God with joyfulness and with gladness of heart, for the abundance of all things:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%48%%Therefore shalt thou serve thy enemies which the LORD shall send against thee, in hunger, and in thirst, and in nakedness, and in want of all things: and he shall put a yoke of iron upon thy neck, until he hath destroyed thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%49%%The LORD shall bring a nation against thee from far, from the end of the earth, as swift as the eagle flieth, a nation whose language thou shalt not understand:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%50%%A nation of fierce countenance, which shall not regard the person of the old, nor show favor to the young:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%51%%And he shall eat the fruit of thy cattle, and the fruit of thy land, until thou art destroyed: which also shall not leave thee either corn, wine, or oil, or the increase of thy cattle, or flocks of thy sheep, until he hath destroyed thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%52%%And he shall besiege thee in all thy gates, until thy high and fortified walls come down, in which thou didst trust, throughout all thy land; and he shall besiege thee in all thy gates throughout all thy land which the LORD thy God hath given thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%53%%And thou shalt eat the fruit of thy own body, the flesh of thy sons and of thy daughters which the LORD thy God hath given thee, in the siege and in the straitness with which thy enemies shall distress thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%54%%So that the man that is tender among you, and very delicate, his eye shall be evil towards his brother, and towards the wife of his bosom, and towards the remnant of his children whom he shall leave:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%55%%So that he will not give to any of them of the flesh of his children whom he shall eat: because he hath nothing left him in the siege and in the straitness with which thy enemies shall distress thee in all thy gates.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%56%%The tender and delicate woman among you, who would not venture to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delicateness and tenderness, her eye shall be evil towards the husband of her bosom, and towards her son, and towards her daughter,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%57%%And towards her young one, her own offspring, and towards her children which she shall bear: for she shall eat them for want of all things secretly in the siege and straitness with which thy enemy shall distress thee in thy gates.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%58%%If thou wilt not observe to do all the words of this law that are written in this book, that thou mayest fear this glorious and fearful name, THE LORD THY GOD;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%59%%Then the LORD will make thy plagues wonderful, and the plagues of thy seed, even great plagues, and of long continuance, and severe sicknesses, and of long continuance.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%60%%Moreover, he will bring upon thee all the diseases of Egypt, of which thou wast afraid; and they shall cleave to thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%61%%Also every sickness, and every plague which is not written in the book of this law, them will the LORD bring upon thee, until thou art destroyed.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%62%%And ye shall be left few in number, whereas ye were as the stars of heaven for multitude; because thou wouldst not obey the voice of the LORD thy God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%63%%And it shall come to pass, that as the LORD rejoiced over you to do you good, and to multiply you; so the LORD will rejoice over you to destroy you, and to bring you to naught; and ye shall be plucked from off the land whither thou goest to possess it.
