1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%64%%And the LORD shall scatter thee among all people from the one end of the earth even to the other; and there thou shalt serve other gods, which neither thou nor thy fathers have known, even wood and stone.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%65%%And among these nations shalt thou find no ease, neither shall the sole of thy foot have rest: but the LORD shall give thee there a trembling heart, and failing of eyes, and sorrow of mind:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%66%%And thy life shall hang in doubt before thee; and thou shalt fear day and night, and shalt have no assurance of thy life:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%67%%In the morning thou shalt say, O that it were evening, and at evening thou shalt say, O that it were morning! for the fear of thy heart with which thou shalt fear, and for the sight of thy eyes which thou shalt see.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%28%%68%%And the LORD shall bring thee into Egypt again with ships, by the way of which I have said to thee, Thou shalt see it no more again: and there ye shall be sold to your enemies for bond-men and bond-women, and no man shall buy you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%1%%These are the words of the covenant which the LORD commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%2%%And Moses called to all Israel, and said to them, Ye have seen all that the LORD did before your eyes in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%3%%The great temptations which thy eyes have seen, the signs, and those great miracles:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%4%%Yet the LORD hath not given you a heart to perceive, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, to this day.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%5%%And I have led you forty years in the wilderness: your clothes have not become old upon you, and thy shoe hath not become old upon thy foot.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%6%%Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drank wine or strong drink: that ye might know that I am the LORD your God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%7%%And when ye came to this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, came out against us to battle, and we smote them:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%8%%And we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance to the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%9%%Keep therefore the words of this covenant, and do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye do.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%10%%Ye stand this day all of you before the LORD your God; your captains of your tribes, your elders, and your officers, with all the men of Israel,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%11%%Your little ones, your wives, and thy stranger that is in thy camp, from the hewer of thy wood to the drawer of thy water:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%12%%That thou shouldst enter into covenant with the LORD thy God, and into his oath, which the LORD thy God maketh with thee this day:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%13%%That he may establish thee to-day for a people to himself, and that he may be to thee a God, as he hath said to thee, and as he hath sworn to thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%14%%Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%15%%But with him that standeth here with us this day before the LORD our God, and also with him that is not here with us this day:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%16%%(For ye know how we have dwelt in the land of Egypt; and how we came through the nations which ye passed by;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%17%%And ye have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them:)
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%18%%Lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turneth away this day from the LORD our God, to go and serve the gods of these nations; lest there should be among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%19%%And it should come to pass, when he heareth the words of this curse, that he should bless himself in his heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk in the imagination of my heart, to add drunkenness to thirst:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%20%%The LORD will not spare him, but then the anger of the LORD and his jealousy shall smoke against that man, and all the curses that are written in this book shall lie upon him, and the LORD shall blot out his name from under heaven.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%21%%And the LORD shall separate him to evil out of all the tribes of Israel according to all the curses of the covenant that are written in this book of the law:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%22%%So that the generation to come of your children that shall arise after you, and the stranger that shall come from a distant land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses which the LORD hath laid upon it;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%23%%And that the whole land of it is brimstone, and salt, and burning, that it is not sown, nor doth it bear, nor doth any grass grow in it, like the overthrow of Sodom, and Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboim, which the LORD overthrew in his anger and in his wrath:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%24%%Even all the nations shall say, Why hath the LORD done thus to this land? what meaneth the heat of this great anger?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%25%%Then men shall say, Because they have forsaken the covenant of the LORD God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth from the land of Egypt:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%26%%For they went and served other gods, and worshiped them, gods which they knew not, and which he had not given to them:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%27%%And the anger of the LORD was kindled against this land, to bring upon it all the curses that are written in this book:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%28%%And the LORD rooted them out of their land in anger and in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as it is this day.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%29%%29%%The secret things belong to the LORD our God: but those things which are revealed belong to us, and to our children for ever, that we may do all the words of this law.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%1%%And it shall come to pass, when all these things have come upon thee, the blessing and the curse, which I have set before thee, and thou shalt call them to mind among all the nations whither the LORD thy God hath driven thee,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%2%%And shalt return to the LORD thy God, and shalt obey his voice according to all that I command thee this day, thou and thy children, with all thy heart, and with all thy soul;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%3%%That then the LORD thy God will turn thy captivity, and have compassion upon thee, and will return and gather thee from all the nations whither the LORD thy God hath scattered thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%4%%If any of thine shall be driven out to the outmost parts of heaven, from thence will the LORD thy God gather thee, and from thence will he bring thee:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%5%%And the LORD thy God will bring thee into the land which thy fathers possessed, and thou shalt possess it: and he will do thee good, and multiply thee above thy fathers.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%6%%And the LORD thy God will circumcise thy heart, and the heart of thy seed, to love the LORD thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, that thou mayest live.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%7%%And the LORD thy God will put all these curses upon thy enemies, and on them that hate thee, who persecuted thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%8%%And thou shalt return and obey the voice of the LORD, and do all his commandments which I command thee this day.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%9%%And the LORD thy God will make thee to abound in every work of thy hand, in the fruit of thy body, and in the fruit of thy cattle, and in the fruit of thy land, for good: for the LORD will again rejoice over thee for good, as he rejoiced over thy fathers:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%10%%If thou shalt hearken to the voice of the LORD thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes which are written in this book of the law, and if thou shalt turn to the LORD thy God with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%11%%For this commandment which I command thee this day, it is not hid from thee, neither is it far off.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%12%%It is not in heaven, that thou shouldst say, Who shall ascend for us to heaven, and bring it to us, that we may hear it, and do it?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%13%%Neither is it beyond the sea, that thou shouldst say, Who shall go over the sea for us, and bring it to us, that we may hear it, and do it?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%14%%But the word is very nigh to thee, in thy mouth, and in thy heart, that thou mayest do it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%15%%See, I have set before thee this day life and good, and death and evil;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%16%%In that I command thee this day to love the LORD thy God, to walk in his ways, and to keep his commandments, and his statutes, and his judgments, that thou mayest live and multiply: and the LORD thy God shall bless thee in the land whither thou goest to possess it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%17%%But if thy heart shall turn away, so that thou wilt not hear, but shalt be drawn away, and worship other gods, and serve them;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%18%%I denounce to you this day, that ye shall surely perish, and that ye shall not prolong your days upon the land, whither thou passest over Jordan to go to possess it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%19%%I call heaven and earth to record this day against you, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and cursing: therefore choose life, that both thou and thy seed may live:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%30%%20%%That thou mayest love the LORD thy God, and that thou mayest obey his voice, and that thou mayest cleave to him (for he is thy life, and the length of thy days) that thou mayest dwell in the land which the LORD swore to thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%1%%And Moses went and spoke these words to all Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%2%%And he said to them, I am a hundred and twenty years old this day; I can no more go out and come in: also the LORD hath said to me, thou shalt not go over this Jordan.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%3%%The LORD thy God, he will go over before thee, and he will destroy these nations from before thee, and thou shalt possess them: and Joshua he shall go over before thee, as the LORD hath said.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%4%%And the LORD shall do to them as he did to Sihon, and to Og, kings of the Amorites, and to the land of them, whom he destroyed.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%5%%And the LORD shall give them up before your face, that ye may do to them according to all the commandments which I have commanded you.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%6%%Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the LORD thy God, he it is that doth go with thee, he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%7%%And Moses called to Joshua, and said to him in the sight of all Israel, Be strong and of a good courage: for thou must go with this people to the land which the LORD hath sworn to their fathers to give them; and thou shalt cause them to inherit it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%8%%And the LORD, he it is that doth go before thee; he will be with thee, he will not fail thee, neither forsake thee: fear not, neither be dismayed.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%9%%And Moses wrote this law, and delivered it to the priests the sons of Levi, who bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and to all the elders of Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%10%%And Moses commanded them, saying, At the end of every seven years, in the solemnity of the year of release, in the feast of tabernacles,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%11%%When all Israel is come to appear before the LORD thy God in the place which he shall choose, thou shalt read this law before all Israel in their hearing.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%12%%Convene the people, men, and women, and children, and thy stranger that is within thy gates, that they may hear, and that they may learn, and fear the LORD your God, and observe to do all the words of this law:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%13%%And that their children who have not known any thing, may hear, and learn to fear the LORD your God, as long as ye live in the land whither ye go over Jordan to possess it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%14%%And the LORD said to Moses, Behold, thy days approach that thou must die: call Joshua, and present yourselves in the tabernacle of the congregation, that I may give him a charge. And Moses and Joshua went and presented themselves in the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%15%%And the LORD appeared in the tabernacle in a pillar of a cloud; and the pillar of the cloud stood over the door of the tabernacle.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%16%%And the LORD said to Moses, Behold, thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, and this people will rise up, and commit idolatry with the gods of the strangers of the land, whither they go to be among them, and will forsake me, and break my covenant which I have made with them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%17%%Then my anger shall be kindled against them in that day, and I will forsake them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall be devoured, and many evils and troubles shall befall them, so that they will say in that day, Have not these evils come upon us, because our God is not among us?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%18%%And I will surely hide my face in that day for all the evils which they shall have wrought, in that they are turned to other gods.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%19%%Now therefore write ye this song for you, and teach it to the children of Israel: put it in their mouths, that this song may be a witness for me against the children of Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%20%%For when I shall have brought them into the land which I swore to their fathers, that floweth with milk and honey; and they shall have eaten and filled themselves, and waxed fat; then will they turn to other gods, and serve them, and provoke me, and break my covenant.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%21%%And it shall come to pass, when many evils and troubles have befallen them, that this song shall testify against them as a witness: for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed: for I know their imagination which they form, even now, before I have brought them into the land which I swore.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%22%%Moses therefore wrote this song the same day, and taught it to the children of Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%23%%And he gave Joshua the son of Nun a charge, and said, Be strong and of a good courage: for thou shalt bring the children of Israel into the land which I swore to them: and I will be with thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%24%%And it came to pass, when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this law in a book, until they were finished,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%25%%That Moses commanded the Levites who bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, saying,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%26%%Take this book of the law, and put it in the side of the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, that it may be there for a witness against thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%27%%For I know thy rebellion, and thy stiff neck: behold, while I am yet alive with you this day, ye have been rebellious against the LORD; and how much more after my death?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%28%%Assemble to me all the elders of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these words in their ears, and call heaven and earth to record against them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%29%%For I know that after my death ye will utterly corrupt yourselves, and turn aside from the way which I have commanded you; and evil will befall you in the latter days; because ye will do evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger through the work of your hands.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%31%%30%%And Moses spoke in the ears of all the congregation of Israel the words of this song until they were ended.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%1%%Give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the words of my mouth.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%2%%My doctrine shall drop as the rain, my speech shall distill as the dew, as the small rain upon the tender herb, and as the showers upon the grass:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%3%%Because I will publish the name of the LORD: ascribe ye greatness to our God.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%4%%He is the Rock, his work is perfect: for all his ways are judgment: a God of truth and without iniquity: just and right is he.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%5%%They have corrupted themselves, their spot is not the spot of his children: they are a perverse and crooked generation.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%6%%Do ye thus requite the LORD, O foolish people and unwise? is not he thy father that hath bought thee? hath he not made thee, and established thee?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%7%%Remember the days of old, consider the years of many generations: ask thy father, and he will show thee; thy elders, and they will tell thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%8%%When the Most High divided to the nations their inheritance, when he separated the sons of Adam, he set the bounds of the people according to the number of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%9%%For the LORD'S portion is his people; Jacob is the lot of his inheritance.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%10%%He found him in a desert land, and in the waste howling wilderness; he led him about, he instructed him, he kept him as the apple of his eye.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%11%%As an eagle stirreth up her nest, fluttereth over her young, spreadeth abroad her wings, taketh them, beareth them on her wings;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%12%%So the LORD alone did lead him, and there was no strange God with him.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%13%%He made him ride on the high places of the earth, that he might eat the increase of the fields; and he made him to suck honey out of the rock, and oil out of the flinty rock;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%14%%Butter of cows, and milk of sheep, with fat of lambs, and rams of the breed of Bashan, and goats, with the fat of kidneys of wheat; and thou didst drink the pure blood of the grape.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%15%%But Jeshurun waxed fat, and kicked: thou hast waxed fat, thou art grown thick, thou art covered with fatness; then he forsook God who made him, and lightly esteemed the Rock of his salvation.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%16%%They provoked him to jealousy with strange gods, with abominations they provoked him to anger.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%17%%They sacrificed to devils, not to God; to gods which they knew not, to new gods that came newly up, whom your fathers feared not.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%18%%Of the Rock that begat thee thou art unmindful, and hast forgotten God that formed thee.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%19%%And when the LORD saw it, he abhorred them, because of the provoking of his sons, and of his daughters.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%20%%And he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what their end will be: for they are a very froward generation, children in whom is no faith.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%21%%They have moved me to jealousy with that which is not God; they have provoked me to anger with their vanities: and I will move them to jealousy with those who are not a people; I will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%22%%For a fire is kindled in my anger, and shall burn to the lowest hell, and shall consume the earth with her increase, and set on fire the foundations of the mountains.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%23%%I will heap mischiefs upon them; I will spend my arrows upon them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%24%%They shall be burnt with hunger, and devoured with burning heat, and with bitter destruction: I will also send the teeth of beasts upon them, with the poison of serpents of the dust.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%25%%The sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the young man and the virgin, the suckling also with the man of gray hairs.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%26%%I said, I would scatter them into corners, I would make the remembrance of them to cease from among men;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%27%%Were it not that I feared the wrath of the enemy, lest their adversaries should behave themselves strangely, and lest they should say, Our hand is high, and the LORD hath not done all this.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%28%%For they are a nation void of counsel, neither is there any understanding in them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%29%%O that they were wise, that they understood this, that they would consider their latter end!
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%30%%How should one chase a thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, except their Rock had sold them, and the LORD had shut them up?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%31%%For their rock is not as our Rock, even our enemies themselves being judges:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%32%%For their vine is of the vine of Sodom, and of the fields of Gomorrah: their grapes are grapes of gall, their clusters are bitter:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%33%%Their wine is the poison of dragons, and the cruel venom of asps.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%34%%Is not this laid up in store with me, and sealed up among my treasures?
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%35%%To me belongeth vengeance, and recompense; their foot shall slide in due time: for the day of their calamity is at hand, and the things that shall come upon them make haste.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%36%%For the LORD shall judge his people, and repent for his servants: when he seeth that their power is gone, and there is none shut up, or left.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%37%%And he shall say, Where are their gods, their rock in whom they trusted,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%38%%Which ate the fat of their sacrifices, and drank the wine of their drink-offerings? let them rise up and help you, and be your protection.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%39%%See now that I, even I am he, and there is no god with me: I kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal: neither is there any that can deliver out of my hand.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%40%%For I lift up my hand to heaven, and say, I live for ever.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%41%%If I shall whet my glittering sword, and my hand take hold on judgment; I will render vengeance to my enemies, and will reward them that hate me.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%42%%I will make my arrows drunk with blood, and my sword shall devour flesh; and that with the blood of the slain and of the captives from the beginning of revenges upon the enemy.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%43%%Rejoice, O ye nations, with his people: for he will avenge the blood of his servants, and will render vengeance to his adversaries, and will be merciful to his land, and to his people.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%44%%And Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the ears of the people, he and Hoshea the son of Nun.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%45%%And Moses made an end of speaking all these words to all Israel;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%46%%And he said to them, Set your hearts to all the words which I testify among you this day, which ye shall command your children to observe to do, all the words of this law.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%47%%For it is not a vain thing for you: because it is your life; and through this thing ye shall prolong your days in the land whither ye go over Jordan to possess it.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%48%%And the LORD spoke to Moses that same day, saying,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%49%%Ascend this mountain Abarim, to mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is over against Jericho; and behold the land of Canaan which I give to the children of Israel for a Possession:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%50%%And die in the mount whither thou goest, and be gathered to thy people; as Aaron thy brother died in mount Hor, and was gathered to his people:
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%51%%Because ye trespassed against me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah-Kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin; because ye sanctified me not in the midst of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%32%%52%%Yet thou shalt see the land before thee, but thou shalt not go thither to the land which I give the children of Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%1%%And this is the with which Moses, the man of God, blessed the children of Israel before his death.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%2%%And he said, the LORD came from Sinai, and rose up from Seir to them; he shined forth from mount Paran, and he came with ten thousands of saints: from his right hand went a fiery law for them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%3%%Yea, he loved the people; all his saints are in thy hand: and they sat down at thy feet; every one shall receive of thy words.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%4%%Moses commanded us a law; even the inheritance of the congregation of Jacob.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%5%%And he was king in Jeshurun, when the heads of the people and the tribes of Israel were assembled.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%6%%Let Reuben live, and not die; and let not his men be few.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%7%%And this is the blessing of Judah: and he said, Hear, LORD, the voice of Judah, and bring him to his people: let his hands be sufficient for him, and be thou a help to him from his enemies.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%8%%And of Levi he said, Let thy Thummim and thy Urim be with thy holy one, whom thou didst prove at Massah, and with whom thou didst strive at the waters of Meribah;
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%9%%Who said to his father and to his mother, I have not seen him, neither did he acknowledge his brethren, nor know his own children: for they have observed thy word, and kept thy covenant.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%10%%They shall teach Jacob thy judgments, and Israel thy law; they shall put incense before thee, and whole burnt sacrifice upon thy altar.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%11%%Bless, LORD, his substance, and accept the work of his hands: smite through the loins of them that rise against him, and of them that hate him, that they rise not again.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%12%%And of Benjamin he said, The beloved of the LORD shall dwell in safety by him; and the LORD shall cover him all the day long, and he shall dwell between his shoulders.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%13%%And of Joseph he said, Blessed of the LORD be his land, for the precious things of heaven, for the dew, and for the deep that coucheth beneath,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%14%%And for the precious fruits brought forth by the sun, and for the precious things put forth by the moon,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%15%%And for the chief things of the ancient mountains, and for the precious things of the lasting hills,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%16%%And for the precious things of the earth and fullness of it, and for the good will of him that dwelt in the bush; let the blessing come upon the head of Joseph, and upon the top of the head of him that was separated from his brethren.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%17%%His glory is like the firstling of his bullock, and his horns are like the horns of unicorns: with them he shall push the people together to the ends of the earth: and they are the ten thousands of Ephraim, and they are the thousands of Manasseh.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%18%%And of Zebulun he said, Rejoice, Zebulun, in thy going out; and Issachar, in thy tents.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%19%%They shall call the people to the mountain; there they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness: for they shall suck of the abundance of the seas, and of treasures hid in the sand.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%20%%And of Gad he said: Blessed be he that enlargeth Gad: he dwelleth as a lion, and teareth the arm with the crown of the head.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%21%%And he provided the first part for himself, because there, in a portion of the lawgiver, was he seated: and he came with the heads of the people, he executed the justice of the LORD, and his judgments with Israel.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%22%%And of Dan he said, Dan is a lion's whelp: he shall leap from Bashan.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%23%%And of Naphtali he said, O Naphtali, satisfied with favor, and full with the blessing of the LORD: possess thou the west and the south.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%24%%And of Asher he said, Let Asher be blessed with children; let him be acceptable to his brethren, and let him dip his foot in oil.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%25%%Thy shoes shall be iron and brass; and as thy days, so shall thy strength be.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%26%%There is none like to the God of Jeshurun, who rideth upon the heaven in thy help, and in his excellence on the sky.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%27%%The eternal God is thy refuge, and underneath are the everlasting arms: and he shall thrust out the enemy from before thee, and shall say, Destroy them.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%28%%Israel then shall dwell in safety alone; the fountain of Jacob shall be upon a land of corn and wine, also his heavens shall drop down dew.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%33%%29%%Happy art thou, O Israel: who is like to thee, O people saved by the LORD, the shield of thy help, and who is the sword of thy excellence! and thy enemies shall be found liars to thee; and thou shalt tread upon their high places.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%1%%And Moses went up from the plains of Moab, upon the mountain of Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, that is over against Jericho: and the LORD showed him all the land of Gilead, to Dan,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%2%%And all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim, and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, to the utmost sea,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%3%%And the south, and the plain of the valley of Jericho, the city of palm-trees, to Zoar.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%4%%And the LORD said to him, This is the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, I will give it to thy seed: I have caused thee to see it with thy eyes, but thou shalt not go over thither.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%5%%So Moses the servant of the LORD died there in the land of Moab, according to the word of the LORD.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%6%%And he buried him in a valley in the land of Moab, over against Beth-peor: but no man knoweth of his sepulcher to this day.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%7%%And Moses was a hundred and twenty years old when he died: his eye was not dim, nor his natural force abated.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%8%%And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab thirty days: so the days of weeping and mourning for Moses were ended.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%9%%And Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom; for Moses had laid his hands upon him: and the children of Israel hearkened to him, and did as the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%10%%And there arose not a prophet afterwards in Israel like to Moses, whom the LORD knew face to face,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%11%%In all the signs and the wonders which the LORD sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land,
1000005%%Deuteronomy%%OT%%34%%12%%And in all that mighty hand, and in all the great terror which Moses showed in the sight of all Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%1%%Now after the death of Moses the servant of the LORD, it came to pass, that the LORD spoke to Joshua the son of Nun, Moses's minister, saying,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%2%%Moses my servant is dead; now therefore arise, go over this Jordan, thou, and all this people, to the land which I do give to them, even to the children of Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%3%%Every place that the sole of your foot shall tread upon, that have I given to you, as I said to Moses.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%4%%From the wilderness and this Lebanon even to the great river, the river Euphrates, all the land of the Hittites, and to the great sea towards the setting of the sun, shall be your border.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%5%%There shall not any man be able to stand before thee all the days of thy life: as I was with Moses, so I will be with thee: I will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%6%%Be strong and of a good courage: for to this people shalt thou divide for an inheritance the land which I swore to their fathers to give them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%7%%Only be thou strong and very courageous, that thou mayest observe to do according to all the law which Moses my servant commanded thee: turn not from it to the right hand or to the left, that thou mayest prosper whithersoever thou goest.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%8%%This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth; but thou shalt meditate in it day and night, that thou mayest observe to do according to all that is written therein: for then thou shalt make thy way prosperous, and then thou shalt have good success.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%9%%Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the LORD thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%10%%Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%11%%Pass through the host, and command the people, saying, Prepare you provisions; for within three days ye shall pass over this Jordan, to go in to possess the land which the LORD your God giveth you to possess it.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%12%%And to the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh, spoke Joshua, saying,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%13%%Remember the word which Moses the servant of the LORD commanded you, saying, The LORD your God hath given you rest, and hath given you this land.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%14%%Your wives, your little ones, and your cattle shall remain in the land which Moses gave you on this side of Jordan; but ye shall pass before your brethren armed, all the mighty men of valor, and help them;
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%15%%Until the LORD shall have given your brethren rest, as he hath given you, and they also have possessed the land which the LORD your God giveth them: then ye shall return to the land of your possession, and enjoy it, which Moses the LORD'S servant gave you on this side of Jordan towards the sun-rising.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%16%%And they answered Joshua, saying, All that thou commandest us, we will do, and whithersoever thou sendest us, we will go.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%17%%According as we hearkened to Moses in all things, so will we hearken to thee: only the LORD thy God be with thee, as he was with Moses.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%1%%18%%Every one that doth rebel against thy commandment, and will not hearken to thy words in all that thou commandest him, shall be put to death: only be strong and of a good courage.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%1%%And Joshua the son of Nun sent from Shittim two men to spy secretly, saying, Go, view the land, even Jericho. And they went, and came into the house of a harlot, named Rahab, and lodged there.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%2%%And it was told the king of Jericho, saying, Behold, there came men in hither to-night of the children of Israel, to search out the country.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%3%%And the king of Jericho sent to Rahab, saying, Bring forth the men that have come to thee, who have entered into thy house: for they have come to search out all the country.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%4%%And the woman took the two men, and hid them, and said thus, There came men to me, but I knew not whence they were:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%5%%And it came to pass about the time of shutting the gate, when it was dark, that the men went out: whither the men went, I know not: pursue after them quickly; for ye will overtake them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%6%%But she had brought them up to the roof of the house, and hid them with the stalks of flax, which she had laid in order upon the roof.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%7%%And the men pursued them the way to Jordan to the fords: and as soon as they who pursued them had gone out, they shut the gate.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%8%%And before they had lain down, she came up to them upon the roof;
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%9%%And she said to the men, I know that the LORD hath given you the land, and that your terror hath fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land faint because of you.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%10%%For we have heard how the LORD dried up the water of the Red sea for you, when ye came out of Egypt; and what ye did to the two kings of the Amorites, that were on the other side of Jordan, Sihon and Og, whom ye utterly destroyed.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%11%%And as soon as we had heard these things, our hearts did melt, neither did there remain any more courage in any man, because of you: for the LORD your God, he is God in heaven above, and in earth beneath.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%12%%Now therefore, I pray you, swear to me by the LORD, since I have showed you kindness, that ye will also show kindness to my father's house, and give me a true token:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%13%%And that ye will save alive my father, and my mother, and my brethren, and my sisters, and all that they have, and deliver our lives from death.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%14%%And the men answered her, Our life for yours, if ye utter not this our business. And it shall be, when the LORD hath given us the land, that we will deal kindly and truly with thee.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%15%%Then she let them down by a cord through the window: for her house was upon the town-wall, and she dwelt upon the wall.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%16%%And she said to them, Depart to the mountain, lest the pursuers meet you; and hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers have returned: and afterward ye may go your way.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%17%%And the men said to her, We will be blameless of this thy oath which thou hast made us swear.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%18%%Behold, when we come into the land, thou shalt bind this line of scarlet thread in the window by which thou didst let us down: and thou shalt bring thy father, and thy mother, and thy brethren, and all thy father's household home to thee.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%19%%And it shall be, that whoever shall go out of the doors of thy house into the street, his blood shall be upon his head, and we will be guiltless: and whoever shall be with thee in the house, his blood shall be on our head, if any hand be upon him.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%20%%And if thou shalt utter this our business, then we will be quit of thy oath which thou hast made us to swear.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%21%%And she said, According to your words, so be it. And she sent them away, and they departed: and she bound the scarlet line in the window.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%22%%And they went, and came to the mountain, and abode there three days, until the pursuers had returned: and the pursuers sought them throughout all the way, but found them not.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%23%%So the two men returned, and descended from the mountain, and passed over, and came to Joshua the son of Nun, and told him all things that befell them:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%2%%24%%And they said to Joshua, Truly the LORD hath delivered into our hands all the land; for even all the inhabitants of the country do faint because of us.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%1%%And Joshua rose early in the morning; and they removed from Shittim, and came to Jordan, he and all the children of Israel, and lodged there before they passed over.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%2%%And it came to pass after three days, that the officers went through the host;
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%3%%And they commanded the people, saying, When ye see the ark of the covenant of the LORD your God, and the priests the Levites bearing it, then ye shall remove from your place, and go after it.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%4%%Yet there shall be a space between you and it, about two thousand cubits by measure: come not near to it, that ye may know the way by which ye must go: for ye have not passed this way heretofore.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%5%%And Joshua said to the people, Sanctify yourselves: for to-morrow the LORD will do wonders among you.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%6%%And Joshua spoke to the priests, saying, Take up the ark of the covenant, and pass over before the people. And they took up the ark of the covenant, and went before the people.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%7%%And the LORD said to Joshua, This day will I begin to magnify thee in the sight of all Israel, that they may know that as I was with Moses, so I will be with thee.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%8%%And thou shalt command the priests that bear the ark of the covenant, saying, When ye have come to the brink of the water of Jordan, ye shall stand still in Jordan.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%9%%And Joshua said to the children of Israel, Come hither, and hear the words of the LORD your God.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%10%%And Joshua said, By this ye shall know that the living God is among you, and that he will without fail drive out from before you the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Hivites, and the Perizzites, and the Girgashites, and the Amorites, and the Jebusites.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%11%%Behold, the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth passeth over before you into Jordan.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%12%%Now therefore take you twelve men out of the tribes of Israel, out of every tribe a man.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%13%%And it shall come to pass, as soon as the soles of the feet of the priests that bear the ark of the LORD, the Lord of all the earth, shall rest in the waters of Jordan, that the waters of Jordan shall be cut off from the waters that come down from above; and they shall stand in a heap.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%14%%And it came to pass, when the people removed from their tents to pass over Jordan, and the priests bearing the ark of the covenant before the people;
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%15%%And as they that bore the ark had come to Jordan, and the feet of the priests that bore the ark were dipped in the brim of the water, (for Jordan overfloweth all its banks all the time of harvest,)
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%16%%That the waters which came down from above stood and rose up in a heap very far from the city Adam, that is beside Zaretan; and those that came down towards the sea of the plain, even the salt sea, failed, and were cut off: and the people passed over right against Jericho.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%3%%17%%And the priests that bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firm on dry ground in the midst of Jordan, and all the Israelites passed over on dry ground, until all the people had passed quite over Jordan.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%1%%And it came to pass, when all the people had quite passed over Jordan, that the LORD spoke to Joshua, saying,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%2%%Take you twelve men from the people, from every tribe a man,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%3%%And command ye them, saying, Take you hence out of the midst of Jordan, from the place where the priests' feet stood firm, twelve stones, and ye shall carry them over with you, and leave them in the lodging-place where ye shall lodge this night.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%4%%Then Joshua called the twelve men, whom he had prepared of the children of Israel, of every tribe a man:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%5%%And Joshua said to them, Pass over before the ark of the LORD your God into the midst of Jordan, and take ye up every man of you a stone upon his shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the children of Israel:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%6%%That this may be a sign among you, that when your children ask their fathers in time to come, saying, What mean ye by these stones?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%7%%Then ye shall answer them, That the waters of Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of the LORD; when it passed over Jordan, the waters of Jordan were cut off: and these stones shall be for a memorial to the children of Israel for ever.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%8%%And the children of Israel did so as Joshua commanded, and took up twelve stones from the midst of Jordan, as the the LORD commanded Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the children of Israel, and carried them over with them to the place where they lodged, and laid them down there.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%9%%And Joshua set up twelve stones in the midst of Jordan, in the place where the feet of the priests who bore the ark of the covenant stood: and they are there to this day.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%10%%For the priests who bore the ark stood in the midst of Jordan, until every thing was finished that the LORD commanded Joshua to speak to the people, according to all that Moses commanded Joshua: and the people hasted and passed over.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%11%%And it came to pass, when all the people had quite passed over, that the ark of the LORD passed over, and the priests in the presence of the people.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%12%%And the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh, passed over armed before the children of Israel, as Moses directed them:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%13%%About forty thousand prepared for war passed over before the LORD to battle, to the plains of Jericho.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%14%%On that day the LORD magnified Joshua in the sight of all Israel, and they feared him, as they feared Moses, all the days of his life.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%15%%And the LORD spoke to Joshua, saying,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%16%%Command the priests that bear the ark of the testimony, that they come up out of Jordan.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%17%%Joshua therefore commanded the priests, saying, Come ye up out of Jordan.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%18%%And it came to pass, when the priests that bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD had come up out of the midst of Jordan, and the soles of the priests' feet were lifted up upon the dry land, that the waters of Jordan returned to their place, and flowed over all its banks, as they did before.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%19%%And the people came up out of Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and encamped in Gilgal, in the east border of Jericho.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%20%%And those twelve stones which they took out of Jordan, did Joshua set up in Gilgal.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%21%%And he spoke to the children of Israel, saying, When your children shall ask their fathers in time to come, saying, What mean these stones?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%22%%Then ye shall let your children know, saying, Israel came over this Jordan on dry land.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%23%%For the LORD your God dried up the waters of Jordan from before you, until ye had passed over, as the LORD your God did to the Red sea, which he dried up from before us, until we had gone over:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%4%%24%%That all the people of the earth might know the hand of the LORD that it is mighty: that ye might fear the LORD your God for ever.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%1%%And it came to pass, when all the kings of the Amorites who were on the side of Jordan westward, and all the kings of the Canaanites who were by the sea, heard that the LORD had dried up the waters of Jordan from before the children of Israel, until we had passed over, that their heart melted; neither was there spirit in them any more, because of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%2%%At that time the LORD said to Joshua, Make thee sharp knives, and circumcise again the children of Israel the second time.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%3%%And Joshua made him sharp knives, and circumcised the children of Israel at the hill of the foreskins.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%4%%And this is the cause why Joshua did circumcise: All the people that came out of Egypt, that were males, even all the men of war died in the wilderness by the way, after they came out of Egypt.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%5%%Now all the people that came out were circumcised; but all the people that were born in the wilderness by the way as they came forth from Egypt, them they had not circumcised.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%6%%For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness, till all the people that were men of war who came out of Egypt were consumed, because they obeyed not the voice of the LORD: to whom the LORD swore that he would not show them the land which the LORD swore to their fathers that he would give us, a land that floweth with milk and honey.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%7%%And their children, whom he raised up in their stead, them Joshua circumcised: for they were uncircumcised, because they had not circumcised them by the way.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%8%%And it came to pass when they had done circumcising all the people, that they abode in their places in the camp, till they were whole.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%9%%And the LORD said to Joshua, This day have I rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you: Wherefore the name of the place is called Gilgal to this day.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%10%%And the children of Israel encamped in Gilgal, and kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the month at evening in the plains of Jericho.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%11%%And they ate of the old corn of the land on the morrow after the passover, unleavened cakes, and parched corn in the same day.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%12%%And the manna ceased on the morrow after they had eaten of the old corn of the land; neither had the children of Israel manna any more; but they ate of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%13%%And it came to pass when Joshua was by Jericho, that he lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, there stood a man over against him with his sword drawn in his hand: and Joshua went to him, and said to him, Art thou for us, or for our adversaries?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%14%%And he said, No; but as captain of the host of the LORD am I now come. And Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and worshiped, and said to him, What saith my lord to his servant?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%5%%15%%And the captain of the LORD'S host said to Joshua, Loose thy shoe from off thy foot, for the place on which thou standest is holy: and Joshua did so.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%1%%Now Jericho was closely shut up because of the children of Israel: none went out, and none came in.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%2%%And the LORD said to Joshua, See, I have given into thy hand Jericho, and its king, and the mighty men of valor.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%3%%And ye shall compass the city, all ye men of war, and go round the city once: thus shalt thou do six days.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%4%%And seven priests shall bear before the ark seven trumpets of rams' horns: and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times, and the priests shall blow with the trumpets.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%5%%And it shall come to pass, that when they make a long blast with the ram's horn, and when ye hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout: and the wall of the city shall fall down flat, and the people shall ascend every man straight before him.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%6%%And Joshua the son of Nun called the priests, and said to them, Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests bear seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of the LORD.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%7%%And he said to the people, Pass on, and compass the city, and let him that is armed pass on before the ark of the LORD.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%8%%And it came to pass, when Joshua had spoken to the people, that the seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams' horns passed on before the LORD, and blew with the trumpets: and the ark of the covenant of the LORD followed them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%9%%And the armed men went before the priests that blew with the trumpets, and the rear-guard came after the ark, the priests going on, and blowing with the trumpets.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%10%%And Joshua had commanded the people, saying, Ye shall not shout, nor make any noise with your voice, neither shall any word proceed from your mouth, until the day I bid you shout, then shall ye shout.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%11%%So the ark of the LORD compassed the city, going about it once: and they came into the camp, and lodged in the camp.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%12%%And Joshua rose early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of the LORD.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%13%%And seven priests bearing seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of the LORD went on continually, and blew with the trumpets: and the armed men went before them; but the rear-guard came after the ark of the LORD, the priests going on, and blowing with the trumpets.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%14%%And the second day they compassed the city once, and returned into the camp. So they did six days.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%15%%And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they rose early about the dawning of the day, and compassed the city after the same manner seven times: only on that day they compassed the city seven times.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%16%%And it came to pass at the seventh time, when the priests blew with the trumpets, Joshua said to the people, Shout; for the LORD hath given you the city.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%17%%And the city shall be accursed, even it, and all that are in it, to the LORD: only Rahab the harlot shall live, she and all that are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers that we sent.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%18%%And ye, in any wise keep yourselves from the accursed thing, lest ye make yourselves accursed, when ye take of the accursed thing, and make the camp of Israel a curse, and trouble it.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%19%%But all the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are consecrated to the LORD: they shall come into the treasury of the LORD.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%20%%So the people shouted when the priests blew with the trumpets: and it came to pass, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, and the people shouted with a great shout, that the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%21%%And they utterly destroyed all that was in the city, both man and woman, young and old, and ox, and sheep, and ass, with the edge of the sword.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%22%%But Joshua had said to the two men that spied out the country, Go into the harlot's house, and bring out thence the woman, and all that she hath, as ye swore to her.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%23%%And the young men that were spies went in, and brought out Rahab, and her father, and her mother, and her brethren, and all that she had; and they brought out all her kindred, and left them without the camp of Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%24%%And they burnt the city with fire, and all that was in it: only the silver, and the gold, and the vessels of brass and of iron, they put into the treasury of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%25%%And Joshua saved Rahab the harlot alive, and her father's household, and all that she had; and she dwelleth in Israel even to this day; because she hid the messengers which Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%26%%And Joshua adjured them at that time, saying, Cursed be the man before the LORD, that riseth up and buildeth this city Jericho: he shall lay its foundation in his first-born, and in his youngest son shall he set up the gates of it.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%6%%27%%So the LORD was with Joshua; and his fame was noised throughout all the country.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%1%%But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the accursed thing: for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of the accursed thing: and the anger of the LORD was kindled against the children of Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%2%%And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth-aven, on the east side of Beth-el, and spoke to them, saying, Go up and view the country. And the men went up and viewed Ai.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%3%%And they returned to Joshua, and said to him, Let not all the people go up; but let about two or three thousand men go up and smite Ai; and make not all the people to labor thither; for they are but few.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%4%%So there went up thither of the people about three thousand men: and they fled before the men of Ai.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%5%%And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty and six men: for they chased them from before the gate even to Shebarim, and smote them in the going down: wherefore the hearts of the people melted, and became as water.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%6%%And Joshua rent his clothes, and fell to the earth upon his face before the ark of the LORD until the evening, he and the elders of Israel, and put dust upon their heads.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%7%%And Joshua said, Alas, O Lord GOD, why hast thou at all brought this people over Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us? O that we had been content, and dwelt on the other side of Jordan.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%8%%O Lord, what shall I say, when Israel turn their backs before their enemies!
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%9%%For the Canaanites, and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of it, and will environ us, and cut off our name from the earth: and what wilt thou do to thy great name?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%10%%And the LORD said to Joshua, Arise; Why liest thou thus upon thy face?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%11%%Israel hath sinned, and they have also transgressed my covenant which I commanded them: for they have even taken of the accursed thing, and have also stolen, and dissembled also, and they have put it even among their own goods.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%12%%Therefore the children of Israel could not stand before their enemies, but turned their backs before their enemies, because they were accursed: neither will I be with you any more, except ye destroy the accursed from among you.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%13%%Rise, sanctify the people, and say, Sanctify yourselves against to-morrow: for thus saith the LORD God of Israel, There is an accursed thing in the midst of thee, O Israel: thou canst not stand before thy enemies, until ye take away the accursed thing from among you.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%14%%In the morning therefore ye shall be brought according to your tribes: and it shall be, that the tribe which the LORD taketh shall come according to their families: and the family which the LORD shall take shall come by households; and the household which the LORD shall take shall come man by man.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%15%%And it shall be, that he that is taken with the accursed thing shall be burnt with fire, he and all that he hath: because he hath transgressed the covenant of the LORD, and because he hath wrought folly in Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%16%%So Joshua rose early in the morning, and brought Israel by their tribes; and the tribe of Judah was taken:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%17%%And he brought the family of Judah; and he took the family of the Zarhites: and he brought the family of the Zarhites man by man; and Zabdi was taken:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%18%%And he brought his household man by man; and Achan the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%19%%And Joshua said to Achan, My son, give, I pray thee, glory to the LORD God of Israel, and make confession to him; and tell me now what thou hast done, hide it not from me.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%20%%And Achan answered Joshua, and said, Indeed I have sinned against the LORD God of Israel, and thus and thus have I done.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%21%%When I saw among the spoils a goodly Babylonish garment, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, then I coveted them, and took them, and behold, they are hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%22%%So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent, and behold, it was hid in his tent, and the silver under it.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%23%%And they took them from the midst of the tent, and brought them to Joshua, and to all the children of Israel, and laid them out before the LORD.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%24%%And Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan the son of Zerah, and the silver, and the garment, and the wedge of gold, and his sons, and his daughters, and his oxen, and his asses, and his sheep, and his tent, and all that he had: and they brought them to the valley of Achor.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%25%%And Joshua said, why hast thou troubled us? the LORD shall trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones, and burned them with fire, after they had stoned them with stones.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%7%%26%%And they raised over him a great heap of stones to this day. So the LORD turned from the fierceness of his anger: wherefore the name of that place was called the valley of Achor to this day.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%1%%And the LORD said to Joshua, Fear not, neither be thou dismayed: take all the people of war with thee, and arise, go up to Ai: see, I have given into thy hand the king of Ai, and his people, and his city, and his land:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%2%%And thou shalt do to Ai and her king, as thou didst to Jericho and her king: only its spoil, and its cattle, shall ye take for a prey to yourselves: lay thee an ambush for the city behind it.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%3%%So Joshua arose, and all the people of war, to go up against Ai: and Joshua chose out thirty thousand mighty men of valor, and sent them away by night.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%4%%And he commanded them, saying, Behold, ye shall lie in wait against the city, even behind the city: go not very far from the city, but be ye all ready:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%5%%And I, and all the people that are with me, will approach to the city: and it shall come to pass when they come out against us, as at the first, that we will flee before them,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%6%%(For they will come out after us) till we have drawn them from the city; for they will say, They flee before us, as at the first: therefore we will flee before them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%7%%Then ye shall rise from the ambush and seize upon the city: for the LORD your God will deliver it into your hand,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%8%%And it shall be when ye have taken the city, that ye shall set the city on fire: according to the commandment of the LORD shall ye do. See, I have commanded you.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%9%%Joshua therefore sent them forth; and they went to lie in ambush, and abode between Beth-el and Ai, on the west side of Ai: but Joshua lodged that night among the people.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%10%%And Joshua rose early in the morning, and numbered the people, and went up, he and the elders of Israel, before the people to Ai.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%11%%And all the people, even the people of war that were with him, went up, and drew nigh, and came before the city, and pitched on the north side of Ai: now there was a valley between them and Ai.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%12%%And he took about five thousand men; and set them to lie in ambush between Beth-el and Ai, on the west side of the city.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%13%%And when they had set the people, even all the host that was on the north of the city, and their liers in wait on the west of the city, Joshua went that night into the midst of the valley.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%14%%And it came to pass when the king of Ai saw it, that they hasted and rose early, and the men of the city went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at a time appointed, before the plain: but he knew not that there were liers in ambush against him behind the city.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%15%%And Joshua and all Israel made as if they were beaten before them, and fled by the way of the wilderness.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%16%%And all the people that were in Ai were called together to pursue them: and they pursued Joshua, and were drawn away from the city.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%17%%And there was not a man left in Ai, or Beth-el that went not out after Israel: and they left the city open, and pursued Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%18%%And the LORD said to Joshua, Stretch out the spear that is in thy hand towards Ai; for I will give it into thy hand. And Joshua stretched out the spear that he had in his hand towards the city.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%19%%And the ambush arose quickly out of their place, and they ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand: and they entered into the city, and took it, and hasted, and set the city on fire.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%20%%And when the men of Ai looked behind them, they saw, and behold, the smoke of the city ascended to heaven, and they had no power to flee this way or that way: and the people that fled to the wilderness turned back upon the pursuers.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%21%%And when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had taken the city, and that the smoke of the city ascended, then they turned again and slew the men of Ai.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%22%%And the other issued out of the city against them; so they were in the midst of Israel, some on this side, and some on that side: and they smote them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%23%%And the king of Ai they took alive, and brought him to Joshua.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%24%%And it came to pass when Israel had made an end of slaying all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness in which they chased them, and when they had all fallen on the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, that all the Israelites returned to Ai, and smote it with the edge of the sword.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%25%%And so it was, that all that fell that day, both of men and women, were twelve thousand, even all the men of Ai.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%26%%For Joshua drew not his hand back with which he stretched out the spear, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%27%%Only the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took for a prey to themselves, according to the word of the LORD which he commanded Joshua.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%28%%And Joshua burnt Ai, and made it a heap for ever, even a desolation to this day.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%29%%And the king of Ai he hanged on a tree until evening: and as soon as the sun was down, Joshua commanded that they should take his carcass down from the tree, and cast it at the entering of the gate of the city, and raise upon it a great heap of stones, that remaineth to this day.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%30%%Then Joshua built an altar to the LORD God of Israel in mount Ebal,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%31%%As Moses the servant of the LORD commanded the children of Israel, as it is written in the book of the law of Moses, an altar of whole stones, over which no man hath lifted up any iron: and they offered upon it burnt-offerings to the LORD, and sacrificed peace-offerings.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%32%%And he wrote there upon the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he wrote in the presence of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%33%%And all Israel, and their elders, and officers, and their judges, stood on this side of the ark, and on that side, before the priests the Levites, who bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, as well the stranger, as he that was born among them; half of them over against mount Gerizim, and half of them over against mount Ebal; as Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded before, that they should bless the people of Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%34%%And afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessings and cursings, according to all that is written in the book of the law.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%8%%35%%There was not a word of all that Moses commanded, which Joshua read not before all the congregation of Israel, with the women, and the little ones, and the strangers that were conversant among them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%1%%And it came to pass, when all the kings who were on this side Jordan, in the hills, and in the valleys, and in all the coasts of the great sea over against Lebanon, the Hittite, and the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite heard these things,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%2%%That they assembled themselves, to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%3%%And when the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done to Jericho and to Ai,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%4%%They did work craftily, and went and made as if they had been embassadors, and took old sacks upon their asses, and wine-bottles, old, and rent, and bound up;
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%5%%And old shoes and patched upon their feet, and old garments upon them; and all the bread of their provision was dry and moldy.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%6%%And they went to Joshua to the camp at Gilgal, and said to him, and to the men of Israel, We have come from a far country: now therefore make ye a league with us.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%7%%And the men of Israel said to the Hivites, It may be ye dwell among us; and how shall we make a league with you?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%8%%And they said to Joshua, we are thy servants. And Joshua said to them, Who are ye? and whence come ye?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%9%%And they said to him, From a very far country thy servants have come because of the name of the LORD thy God: for we have heard the fame of him, and all that he did in Egypt,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%10%%And all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites, that were beyond Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon, and to Og king of Bashan, who was at Ashtaroth.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%11%%Wherefore our elders, and all the inhabitants of our country spoke to us, saying, Take provisions with you for the journey, and go to meet them, and say to them, We are your servants: therefore now make ye a league with us:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%12%%This our bread we took hot for our provision out of our houses on the day we came forth to go to you; but now, behold, it is dry, and it is moldy:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%13%%And these bottles of wine which we filled, were new, and behold, they are rent: and these our garments and our shoes are become old by reason of the very long journey.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%14%%And the men took of their provisions, and asked not counsel at the mouth of the LORD.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%15%%And Joshua made peace with them, and made a league with them, to let them live: and the princes of the congregation swore to them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%16%%And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had made a league with them, that they heard that they were their neighbors, and that they dwelt among them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%17%%And the children of Israel journeyed, and came to their cities on the third day. Now their cities were Gibeon, and Chephirah, and Beeroth, and Kirjath-jearim.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%18%%And the children of Israel smote them not, because the princes of the congregation had sworn to them by the LORD God of Israel. And all the congregation murmured against the princes.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%19%%But all the princes said to all the congregation, We have sworn to them by the LORD God of Israel: now therefore we may not touch them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%20%%This we will do to them; we will even let them live, lest wrath be upon us, because of the oath which we swore to them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%21%%And the princes said to them, Let them live; but let them be hewers of wood, and drawers of water to all the congregation; as the princes had promised them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%22%%And Joshua called for them, and he spoke to them, saying, Why have ye deceived us, saying, We are very far from you; when ye dwell among us?
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%23%%Now therefore ye are cursed, and there shall none of you be freed from being bond-men, and hewers of wood and drawers of water for the house of my God.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%24%%And they answered Joshua, and said, Because it was certainly told thy servants, how the LORD thy God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you, therefore we were greatly afraid for our lives because of you, and have done this thing.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%25%%And now, behold, we are in thy hand: do as it seemeth good and right to thee to do to us,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%26%%And so did he to them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, that they slew them not.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%9%%27%%And Joshua made them that day hewers of wood and drawers of water for the congregation, and for the altar of the LORD, even to this day, in the place which he should choose.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%1%%Now it came to pass, when Adoni-zedec king of Jerusalem had heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them;
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%2%%That they feared greatly, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities, and because it was greater than Ai, and all the men of it were mighty.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%3%%Wherefore Adoni-zedec king of Jerusalem sent to Hoham king of Hebron, and to Piram king of Jarmuth, and to Japhia king of Lachish, and to Debir king of Eglon, saying,
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%4%%Come up to me, and help me, that we may smite Gibeon: for it hath made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%5%%Therefore the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, the king of Eglon, assembled themselves, and went up, they and all their hosts, and encamped before Gibeon, and made war against it.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%6%%And the men of Gibeon sent to Joshua to the camp at Gilgal, saying, Slack not thy hand from thy servants; come up to us quickly, and save us, and help us: for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the mountains, are assembled against us.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%7%%So Joshua ascended from Gilgal, he, and all the people of war with him, and all the mighty men of valor.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%8%%And the LORD said to Joshua, Fear them not: for I have delivered them into thy hand; there shall not a man of them stand before thee.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%9%%Joshua therefore came to them suddenly, and went up from Gilgal all night.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%10%%And the LORD discomfited them before Israel, and slew them with a great slaughter at Gibeon, and chased them along the way that goeth up to Beth-horon, and smote them to Azekah, and to Makkedah.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%11%%And it came to pass as they fled from before Israel, and were in the descent to Beth-horon, that the LORD cast down great stones from heaven upon them to Azekah, and they died: they were more who died with hailstones than they whom the children of Israel slew with the sword.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%12%%Then spoke Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon, and thou Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%13%%And the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the people had avenged themselves upon their enemies. Is not this written in the book of Jasher? So the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and hasted not to go down about a whole day.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%14%%And there was no day like that before it or after it, that the LORD hearkened to the voice of a man: for the LORD fought for Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%15%%And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp at Gilgal.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%16%%But these five kings fled, and hid themselves in a cave at Makkedah.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%17%%And it was told Joshua, saying, The five kings are found hid in a cave at Makkedah.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%18%%And Joshua said, Roll great stones upon the mouth of the cave, and set men by it to keep them:
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%19%%And stay you not, but pursue your enemies, and smite the hindmost of them; suffer them not to enter into their cities: for the LORD your God hath delivered them into your hand.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%20%%And it came to pass, when Joshua and the children of Israel had made an end of slaying them with a very great slaughter, till they were consumed, that the rest who remained of them entered into fortified cities.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%21%%And all the people returned to the camp to Joshua at Makkedah in peace: none moved his tongue against any of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%22%%Then said Joshua, Open the mouth of the cave, and bring those five kings to me out of the cave.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%23%%And they did so, and brought those five kings to him out of the cave, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%24%%And it came to pass, when they brought out those kings to Joshua, that Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said to the captains of the men of war who went with him, Come near, put your feet upon the necks of these kings. And they came near, and put their feet upon the necks of them.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%25%%And Joshua said to them, Fear not, nor be dismayed, be strong and of good courage: for thus shall the LORD do to all your enemies against whom ye fight.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%26%%And afterward Joshua smote them, and slew them, and hanged them on five trees: and they were hanging upon the trees until the evening.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%27%%And it came to pass at the time of the setting of the sun, that Joshua commanded, and they took them down from the trees, and cast them into the cave in which they had been hid, and laid great stones upon the cave's mouth, which remain until this very day.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%28%%And that day Joshua took Makkedah, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king of it he utterly destroyed, them, and all the souls that were in it; he let none remain: and he did to the king of Makkedah as he did to the king of Jericho.
1000005%%Joshua%%OT%%10%%29%%Then Joshua passed from Makkedah, and all Israel with him, to Libnah, and fought against Libnah:
