1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%3%%Namely, five lords of the Philistines, and all the Canaanites, and the Sidonians, and the Hivites that dwelt on mount Lebanon, from mount Baal-hermon to the entrance of Hamath.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%4%%And they were to prove Israel by them, to know whether they would hearken to the commandments of the LORD, which he commanded their fathers by the hand of Moses.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%5%%And the children of Israel dwelt among the Canaanites, Hittites, and Amorites, and Perizzites, and Hivites, and Jebusites:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%6%%And they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their daughters to their sons, and served their gods.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%7%%And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the LORD, and forgot the LORD their God, and served Baalim, and the groves.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%8%%Therefore the anger of the LORD was hot against Israel, and he sold them into the hand of Chushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia: and the children of Israel served Chushan-rishathaim eight years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%9%%And when the children of Israel cried to the LORD, the LORD raised up a deliverer to the children of Israel, who delivered them, even Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%10%%And the Spirit of the LORD came upon him, and he judged Israel, and went out to war: and the LORD delivered Chushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand; and his hand prevailed against Chushan-rishathaim.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%11%%And the land had rest forty years: and Othniel the son of Kenaz died.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%12%%And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD: and the LORD strengthened Eglon the king of Moab against Israel, because they had done evil in the sight of the LORD.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%13%%And he gathered to him the children of Ammon and Amalek, and went and smote Israel, and possessed the city of palm-trees.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%14%%So the children of Israel served Eglon the king of Moab eighteen years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%15%%But when the children of Israel cried to the LORD, the LORD raised them up a deliverer, Ehud the son of Gera, a Benjaminite, a man left-handed: and by him the children of Israel sent a present to Eglon king of Moab.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%16%%But Ehud made him a dagger which had two edges, of a cubit length; and he girded it under his raiment upon his right thigh.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%17%%And he brought the present to Eglon king of Moab: and Eglon was a very fat man.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%18%%And when he had made an end to offer the present, he sent away the people that bore the present.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%19%%But he himself turned again from the quarries that were by Gilgal, and said, I have a secret errand to thee, O king: who said, Keep silence. And all that stood by him went out from him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%20%%And Ehud came to him; and he was sitting in a summer-parlor, which he had for himself alone: and Ehud said, I have a message from God to thee. And he arose from his seat.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%21%%And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the dagger from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%22%%And the haft also entered after the blade: and the fat closed upon the blade, so that he could not draw the dagger out of his belly; and the dirt came out.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%23%%Then Ehud went forth through the porch, and shut the doors of the parlor upon him, and locked them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%24%%When he had gone out, his servants came; and when they saw that, behold, the doors of the parlor were locked, they said, Surely he covereth his feet in his summer-chamber.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%25%%And they tarried till they were ashamed: and behold, he opened not the doors of the parlor, therefore they took a key and opened them: and behold, their lord lay dead on the earth.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%26%%And Ehud escaped while they tarried; and passed beyond the quarries, and escaped to Seirath.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%27%%And it came to pass when he had come, that he blew a trumpet in the mountain of Ephraim, and the children of Israel went down with him from the mount, and he before them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%28%%And he said to them, Follow me: for the LORD hath delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand. And they went down after him, and took the fords of Jordan towards Moab, and suffered not a man to pass over.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%29%%And they slew of Moab at that time about ten thousand men, all lusty, and all men of valor: and there escaped not a man.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%30%%So Moab was subdued that day under the hand of Israel: and the land had rest eighty years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%3%%31%%And after him was Shamgar the son of Anath, who slew of the Philistines six hundred men with an ox-goad; and he also delivered Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%1%%And the children of Israel again did evil in the sight of the LORD, after Ehud was dead.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%2%%And the LORD sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan that reigned in Hazor, the captain of whose host was Sisera, who dwelt in Harosheth of the Gentiles.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%3%%And the children of Israel cried to the LORD; for he had nine hundred chariots of iron; and twenty years he mightily oppressed the children of Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%4%%And Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lapidoth, she judged Israel at that time.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%5%%And she dwelt under the palm-tree of Deborah, between Ramah and Beth-el in mount Ephraim: and the children of Israel came up to her for judgment.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%6%%And she sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam from Kedesh-naphtali, and said to him, Hath not the LORD God of Israel commanded, saying, Go, and draw towards mount Tabor, and take with thee ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali, and of the children of Zebulun?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%7%%And I will draw to thee, to the river Kishon, Sisera the captain of Jabin's army, with his chariots and his multitude; and I will deliver him into thy hand.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%8%%And Barak said to her, if thou wilt go with me, then I will go: but if thou wilt not go with me, then I will not go.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%9%%And she said, I will surely go with thee: notwithstanding the journey that thou takest shall not be for thy honor; for the LORD will sell Sisera into the hand of a woman. And Deborah arose, and went with Barak to Kedesh.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%10%%And Barak called Zebulun and Naphtali to Kedesh; and he went up with ten thousand men at his feet: and Deborah went up with him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%11%%Now Heber the Kenite, who was of the children of Hobab the father-in-law of Moses, had severed himself from the Kenites, and pitched his tent to the plain of Zaanaim, which is by Kedesh.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%12%%And they showed Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam had gone up to mount Tabor.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%13%%And Sisera collected all his chariots, even nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people that were with him, from Harosheth of the Gentiles to the river of Kishon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%14%%And Deborah said to Barak, Arise, for this is the day in which the LORD hath delivered Sisera into thy hand: hath not the LORD gone out before thee? So Barak went down from mount Tabor, and ten thousand men after him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%15%%And the LORD discomfited Sisera, and all his chariots, and all his host, with the edge of the sword before Barak; so that Sisera alighted from his chariot, and fled away on his feet.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%16%%But Barak pursued the chariots, and the host, to Harosheth of the Gentiles: and all the host of Sisera fell upon the edge of the sword; and there was not a man left.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%17%%Howbeit, Sisera fled away on his feet to the tent of Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite: for there was peace between Jabin the king of Hazor and the house of Heber the Kenite.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%18%%And Jael went out to meet Sisera, and said to him, Turn in, my lord, turn in to me; fear not. And when he had turned in to her into the tent, she covered him with a mantle.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%19%%And he said to her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water to drink; for I am thirsty. And she opened a bottle of milk, and gave him drink, and covered him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%20%%Again he said to her, stand in the door of the tent, and it shall be, when any man doth come and inquire of thee, and say, Is there any man here? that thou shalt say, No.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%21%%Then Jael, Heber's wife, took a nail of the tent, and took a hammer in her hand, and went softly to him, and smote the nail into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast asleep, and weary. So he died.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%22%%And behold, as Barak pursued Sisera, Jael came out to meet him, and said to him, Come, and I will show thee the man whom thou seekest. And when he came into her tent, behold, Sisera lay dead, and the nail was in his temples.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%23%%So God subdued on that day Jabin the king of Canaan before the children of Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%4%%24%%And the hand of the children of Israel prospered, and prevailed against Jabin the king of Canaan, until they had destroyed Jabin king of Canaan.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%1%%Then sang Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam on that day, saying,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%2%%Praise ye the LORD for the avenging of Israel, when the people willingly offered themselves.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%3%%Hear, O ye kings; give ear, O ye princes; I, even I, will sing to the LORD; I will sing praise to the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%4%%LORD, when thou wentest out of Seir, when thou marchedst out of the field of Edom, the earth trembled, and the heavens dropped, the clouds also dropped water.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%5%%The mountains melted from before the LORD, even that Sinai from before the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%6%%In the days of Shamgar the son of Anath, in the days of Jael, the highways were unoccupied, and the travelers walked through by-ways.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%7%%The inhabitants of the villages ceased, they ceased in Israel, until that I Deborah arose, that I arose a mother in Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%8%%They chose new gods; then was war in the gates: was there a shield or spear seen among forty thousand in Israel?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%9%%My heart is towards the governors of Israel that offered themselves willingly among the people: Bless ye the LORD.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%10%%Speak, ye that ride on white asses, ye that sit in judgment, and walk by the way.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%11%%They that are delivered from the noise of archers in the places of drawing water, there shall they rehearse the righteous acts of the LORD, even the righteous acts towards the inhabitants of his villages in Israel: then shall the people of the LORD go down to the gates.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%12%%Awake, awake, Deborah; awake, awake, utter a song: arise, Barak, and lead thy captivity captive, thou son of Abinoam.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%13%%Then he made him that remaineth have dominion over the nobles among the people: the LORD made me have dominion over the mighty.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%14%%Out of Ephraim was there a root of them against Amalek; after thee, Benjamin, among thy people; out of Machir came down governors, and out of Zebulun they that handle the pen of the writer.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%15%%And the princes of Issachar were with Deborah: even Issachar, and also Barak: he was sent on foot into the valley. For the divisions of Reuben there were great thoughts of heart.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%16%%Why abodest thou among the sheep-folds, to hear the bleatings of the flocks? For the divisions of Reuben there were great searchings of heart.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%17%%Gilead abode beyond Jordan: and why did Dan remain in ships? Asher continued on the sea-shore, and abode in his breaches.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%18%%Zebulun and Naphtali were a people that jeoparded their lives to death in the high places of the field.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%19%%The kings came and fought, then fought the kings of Canaan in Tanach by the waters of Megiddo; they took no gain of money.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%20%%They fought from heaven; the stars in their courses fought against Sisera.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%21%%The river of Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. O my soul, thou hast trodden down strength.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%22%%Then were the horse's hoofs broken by the means of the prancings, the prancings of their mighty ones.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%23%%Curse ye Meroz, said the angel of the LORD, curse ye bitterly its inhabitants; because they came not to the help of the LORD, to the help of the LORD against the mighty.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%24%%Blessed above women shall Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite be, blessed shall she be above women in the tent.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%25%%He asked water, and she gave him milk; she brought forth butter in a lordly dish.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%26%%She put her hand to the nail, and her right hand to the workmen's hammer; and with the hammer she smote Sisera, she smote off his head, when she had pierced and struck through his temples.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%27%%At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay down: at her feet he bowed, he fell: where he bowed, there he fell down dead.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%28%%The mother of Sisera looked out at a window, and cried through the lattice, Why is his chariot so long in coming? why tarry the wheels of his chariots?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%29%%Her wise ladies answered her, yes, she returned answer to herself.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%30%%Have they not found; have they not divided the prey; to every man a damsel or two; to Sisera a prey of divers colors, a prey of divers colors of needle-work, of divers colors of needle-work on both sides, meet for the necks of them that take the spoil?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%5%%31%%So let all thy enemies perish, O LORD: but let them that love him be as the sun when he goeth forth in his might. And the land had rest forty years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%1%%And the children of Israel did evil in the sight of the LORD: and the LORD delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%2%%And the hand of Midian prevailed against Israel: and because of the Midianites the children of Israel made them the dens which are in the mountains, and caves, and strong holds.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%3%%And so it was, when Israel had sown, that the Midianites came up, and the Amalekites, and the children of the east, even they came up against them;
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%4%%And they encamped against them, and destroyed the increase of the earth, till thou comest to Gaza; and left no sustenance for Israel, neither sheep, nor ox, nor ass.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%5%%For they came up with their cattle, and their tents, and they came as grasshoppers for multitude; for both they and their camels were without number: and they entered into the land to destroy it.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%6%%And Israel was greatly impoverished because of the Midianites; and the children of Israel cried to the LORD.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%7%%And it came to pass, when the children of Israel cried to the LORD because of the Midianites,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%8%%That the LORD sent a prophet to the children of Israel, who said to them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, I brought you up from Egypt, and brought you forth from the house of bondage;
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%9%%And I delivered you from the hand of the Egyptians, and from the hand of all that oppressed you, and drove them out from before you, and gave you their land;
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%10%%And I said to you, I am the LORD your God; fear not the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but ye have not obeyed my voice.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%11%%And there came an angel of the LORD, and sat under an oak which was in Ophrah, that pertained to Joash the Abi-ezrite: and his son Gideon thrashed wheat by the wine-press, to hide it from the Midianites.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%12%%And the angel of the LORD appeared to him, and said to him, The LORD is with thee, thou mighty man of valor.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%13%%And Gideon said to him, O my Lord, if the LORD is with us, why then hath all this befallen us? and where are all his miracles which our fathers told us of, saying, Did not the LORD bring us up from Egypt? but now the LORD hath forsaken us, and delivered us into the hands of the Midianites.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%14%%And the LORD looked upon him, and said, Go in this thy might, and thou shalt save Israel from the hand of the Midianites: have not I sent thee?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%15%%And he said to him, O my Lord, by what means shall I save Israel? behold, my family is poor in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father's house.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%16%%And the LORD said to him, Surely I will be with thee, and thou shalt smite the Midianites as one man.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%17%%And he said to him, If now I have found grace in thy sight, then show me a sign that thou talkest with me.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%18%%Depart not hence, I pray thee, until I come to thee, and bring forth my present, and set it before thee. And he said, I will tarry until thou comest again.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%19%%And Gideon went in, and made ready a kid, and unleavened cakes of an ephah of flour: the flesh he put in a basket, and he put the broth in a pot, and brought it out to him under the oak, and presented it.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%20%%And the angel of God said to him, Take the flesh and the unleavened cakes, and lay them upon this rock, and pour out the broth. And he did so.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%21%%Then the angel of the LORD put forth the end of the staff that was in his hand, and touched the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and there rose fire out of the rock, and consumed the flesh and the unleavened cakes. Then the angel of the LORD departed from his sight.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%22%%And when Gideon perceived that he was an angel of the LORD, Gideon said, Alas, O Lord GOD! for because I have seen an angel of the LORD face to face.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%23%%And the LORD said to him, Peace be to thee; fear not: thou shalt not die.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%24%%Then Gideon built an altar there to the LORD, and called it Jehovah-shalom: to this day it is yet in Ophrah of the Abi-ezrites.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%25%%And it came to pass the same night, that the LORD said to him, Take thy father's young bullock, even the second bullock of seven years old, and throw down the altar of Baal that thy father hath, and cut down the grove that is by it:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%26%%And build an altar to the LORD thy God upon the top of this rock, in the ordered place, and take the second bullock, and offer a burnt-sacrifice with the wood of the grove which thou shalt cut down.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%27%%Then Gideon took ten men of his servants, and did as the LORD had said to him: and so it was, because he feared his father's household, and the men of the city, that he could not do it by day, that he did it by night.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%28%%And when the men of the city arose early in the morning, behold, the altar of Baal was cast down, and the grove was cut down that was by it, and the second bullock was offered upon the altar that was built.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%29%%And they said one to another, Who hath done this thing? And when they inquired and asked, they said, Gideon the son of Joash hath done this thing.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%30%%Then the men of the city said to Joash, Bring out thy son, that he may die: because he hath cast down the altar of Baal, and because he hath cut down the grove that was by it.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%31%%And Joash said to all that stood against him, Will ye plead for Baal? will ye save him? he that will plead for him, let him be put to death whilst it is yet morning: if he is a god, let him plead for himself, because one hath cast down his altar.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%32%%Therefore on that day he called him Jerubbaal, saying, Let Baal plead against him, because he hath thrown down his altar.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%33%%Then all the Midianites, and the Amalekites, and the children of the east were assembled, and went over, and encamped in the valley of Jezreel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%34%%But the Spirit of the LORD came upon Gideon, and he blew a trumpet; and Abiezer was called after him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%35%%And he sent messengers throughout all Manasseh; who also was called after him: and he sent messengers to Asher, and to Zebulun, and to Naphtali; and they came up to meet them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%36%%And Gideon said to God, If thou wilt save Israel by my hand, as thou hast said,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%37%%Behold, I will put a fleece of wool on the floor; and if the dew shall be on the fleece only, and it shall be dry upon all the earth besides, then shall I know that thou wilt save Israel by my hand, as thou hast said.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%38%%And it was so: for he rose early on the morrow, and pressed the fleece, and wrung the dew out of the fleece, a bowl-full of water.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%39%%And Gideon said to God, Let not thy anger be hot against me, and I will speak but this once: Let me make trial, I pray thee, but this once with the fleece; let it now be dry only upon the fleece, and upon all the ground let there be dew.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%6%%40%%And God did so that night: for it was dry upon the fleece only, and there was dew on all the ground.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%1%%Then Jerubbaal (who is Gideon) and all the people that were with him, rose early, and encamped beside the well of Harod: so that the host of the Midianites were on the north side of them by the hill of Moreh, in the valley.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%2%%And the LORD said to Gideon, The people that are with thee are too many for me to give the Midianites into their hands, lest Israel vaunt themselves against me, saying, My own hand hath saved me.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%3%%Now therefore, proclaim in the ears of the people, saying, Whoever is fearful and afraid, let him return and depart early from mount Gilead. And there returned of the people twenty and two thousand; and there remained ten thousand.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%4%%And the LORD said to Gideon, The people are yet too many; bring them down to the water, and I will try them for thee there; and it shall be, that of whom I say to thee, This shall go with thee, the same shall go with thee; and of whomsoever I say to thee, This shall not go with thee, the same shall not go.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%5%%So he brought down the people to the water: and the LORD said to Gideon, Every one that lappeth of the water with his tongue as a dog lappeth, him shalt thou set by himself; likewise every one that boweth down upon his knees to drink.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%6%%And the number of them that lapped, putting their hand to their mouth, were three hundred men: but all the rest of the people bowed down upon their knees to drink water.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%7%%And the LORD said to Gideon, By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thy hand: and let all the other people go every man to his place.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%8%%So the people took victuals in their hand, and their trumpets: and he sent of all the rest of Israel every man to his tent, and retained those three hundred men. And the host of Midian was beneath him in the valley.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%9%%And it came to pass the same night, that the LORD said to him, Arise, go down to the host; for I have delivered it into thy hand.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%10%%But if thou fearest to go down, go thou with Phurah thy servant down to the host:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%11%%And thou shalt hear what they say; and afterward shall thy hands be strengthened to go down to the host. Then went he down with Phurah his servant to the outside of the armed men that were in the host.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%12%%And the Midianites, and the Amalekites, and all the children of the east, lay along in the valley like grasshoppers for multitude; and their camels were without number, as the sand by the sea side for multitude.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%13%%And when Gideon had come, behold, there was a man that told a dream to his fellow, and said, Behold, I dreamed a dream, and lo, a cake of barley-bread rolled into the host of Midian, and came to a tent, and smote it that it fell, and overturned it that the tent lay along.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%14%%And his fellow answered, and said, This is nothing else save the sword of Gideon the son of Joash, a man of Israel: for into his hand hath God delivered Midian, and all the host.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%15%%And it was so, when Gideon heard the telling of the dream, and its interpretation, that he worshiped, and returned to the host of Israel, and said, Arise; for the LORD hath delivered into your hand the host of Midian.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%16%%And he divided the three hundred men into three companies, and he put a trumpet in every man's hand, with empty pitchers, and lamps within the pitchers.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%17%%And he said to them, Look on me, and do likewise: and behold, when I come to the outside of the camp, it shall be that as I do, so shall ye do.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%18%%When I blow with a trumpet, I and all that are with me, then blow ye the trumpets also on every side of all the camp, and say, The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%19%%So Gideon, and the hundred men that were with him, came to the outside of the camp in the beginning of the middle watch; and they had but newly set the watch: and they blew the trumpets, and broke the pitchers that were in their hands.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%20%%And the three companies blew the trumpets, and broke the pitchers, and held the lamps in their left hands, and the trumpets in their right hands to blow with: and they cried, The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%21%%And they stood every man in his place around the camp; and all the host ran, and cried, and fled.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%22%%And the three hundred blew the trumpets, and the LORD set every man's sword against his fellow, even throughout all the host: and the host fled to Beth-shittah in Zereroth, and to the border of Abel-meholah, to Tabbath.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%23%%And the men of Israel assembled out of Naphtali, and out of Asher, and out of all Manasseh, and pursued the Midianites.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%24%%And Gideon sent messengers throughout all mount Ephraim, saying, Come down against the Midianites, and take before them the waters to Beth-barah and Jordan. Then all the men of Ephraim assembled, and took the waters to Beth-barah and Jordan.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%7%%25%%And they took two princes of the Midianites, Oreb and Zeeb; and they slew Oreb upon the rock Oreb, and Zeeb they slew at the wine-press of Zeeb, and pursued Midian, and brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon on the other side of Jordan.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%1%%And the men of Ephraim said to him, Why hast thou treated us thus, that thou calledst us not when thou wentest to fight with the Midianites? and they chid with him sharply.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%2%%And he said to them, What have I done now in comparison of you? Is not the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%3%%God hath delivered into your hands the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb: and what was I able to do in comparison of you? Then, when he had said that, their anger towards him abated.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%4%%And Gideon came to Jordan, and passed over, he, and the three hundred men that were with him, faint, yet pursuing them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%5%%And he said to the men of Succoth, Give, I pray you, loaves of bread to the people that follow me: for they are faint, and I am pursuing Zebah and Zalmunna, kings of Midian.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%6%%And the princes of Succoth said, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thy hand, that we should give bread to thy army?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%7%%And Gideon said, Therefore when the LORD hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%8%%And he went up thence to Penuel, and spoke to them likewise: and the men of Penuel answered him as the men of Succoth had answered him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%9%%And he spoke also to the men of Penuel, saying, When I come again in peace, I will break down this tower.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%10%%Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor, and their hosts with them, about fifteen thousand men, all that were left of all the hosts of the children of the east: for there fell a hundred and twenty thousand men that drew sword.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%11%%And Gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and smote the host: for the host was secure.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%12%%And when Zebah and Zalmunna fled, he pursued them, and took the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and discomfited all the host.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%13%%And Gideon the son of Joash returned from battle before the sun had risen,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%14%%And caught a young man of the men of Succoth, and inquired of him: and he described to him the princes of Succoth, and its elders, even seventy seven men.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%15%%And he came to the men of Succoth, and said, Behold Zebah and Zalmunna, with whom ye upbraided me, saying, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thy hand, that we should give bread to thy men that are weary?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%16%%And he took the elders of the city, and thorns of the wilderness, and briers, and with them he taught the men of Succoth.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%17%%And he beat down the tower of Penuel, and slew the men of the city.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%18%%Then said he to Zebah and Zalmunna, What manner of men were they whom ye slew at Tabor? And they answered, As thou art, so were they; each one resembled the children of a king.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%19%%And he said, They were my brethren, even the sons of my mother: as the LORD liveth, if ye had saved them alive, I would not slay you.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%20%%And he said to Jether his first-born, Arise, and slay them. But the youth drew not his sword: for he feared, because he was yet a youth.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%21%%Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, Rise thou, and fall upon us: for as the man is, so is his strength. And Gideon arose, and slew Zebah and Zalmunna, and took away the ornaments that were on their camels' necks.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%22%%Then the men of Israel said to Gideon, Rule thou over us, both thou, and thy son, and thy son's son also: for thou hast delivered us from the hand of Midian.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%23%%And Gideon said to them, I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you: the LORD shall rule over you.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%24%%And Gideon said to them, I would desire a request of you, that you would give me every man the ear-rings of his prey. (For they had golden ear-rings, because they were Ishmaelites.)
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%25%%And they answered, We will willingly give them. And they spread a garment, and cast into it every man the ear-rings of his prey.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%26%%And the weight of the golden ear-rings that he requested, was a thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold; besides ornaments, and collars, and purple raiment that was on the kings of Midian, and besides the chains that were about their camels' necks.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%27%%And Gideon made of it an ephod, and put it in his city, even in Ophrah: and all Israel went thither astray after it: which thing became a snare to Gideon, and to his house.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%28%%Thus was Midian subdued before the children of Israel, so that they raised their heads no more. And the country was in quietness forty years in the days of Gideon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%29%%And Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and dwelt in his own house.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%30%%And Gideon had seventy sons of his body begotten: for he had many wives.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%31%%And his concubine that was in Shechem, she also bore him a son, whose name he called Abimelech.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%32%%And Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the sepulcher of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abi-ezrites.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%33%%And it came to pass as soon as Gideon was dead, that the children of Israel turned again, and went astray after Baalim, and made Baal-berith their god.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%34%%And the children of Israel remembered not the LORD their God, who had delivered them from the hands of all their enemies on every side:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%8%%35%%Neither showed they kindness to the house of Jerubbaal, namely Gideon, according to all the goodness which he had shown to Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%1%%And Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem to his mother's brethren, and communed with them, and with all the family of the house of his mother's father, saying,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%2%%Speak, I pray you, in the ears of all the men of Shechem, Which is better for you, either that all the sons of Jerubbaal, which are seventy persons, should reign over you, or that one should reign over you? remember also that I am your bone and your flesh.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%3%%And his mother's brethren spoke of him in the ears of all the men of Shechem all these words: and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech; for they said, He is our brother.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%4%%And they gave him seventy pieces of silver out of the house of Baal-berith, with which Abimelech hired vain and light persons, who followed him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%5%%And he went to his father's house at Ophrah, and slew his brethren the sons of Jerubbaal, being seventy persons, upon one stone; notwithstanding, yet Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left; for he hid himself.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%6%%And all the men of Shechem assembled, and all the house of Millo, and went and made Abimelech king, by the plain of the pillar that was in Shechem.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%7%%And when they told it to Jotham, he went and stood in the top of mount Gerizim, and lifted up his voice and cried, and said to them, Hearken to me, ye men of Shechem, that God may hearken to you.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%8%%The trees went forth on a time to anoint a king over them; and they said to the olive-tree, Reign thou over us.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%9%%But the olive-tree said to them, Should I leave my fatness, with which by me they honor God and man, and go to be promoted over the trees?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%10%%And the trees said to the fig-tree, Come thou, and reign over us.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%11%%But the fig-tree said to them, Should I forsake my sweetness, and my good fruit, and go to be promoted over the trees?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%12%%Then said the trees to the vine, Come thou, and reign over us.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%13%%And the vine said to them, Should I leave my wine, which cheereth God and man, and go to be promoted over the trees?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%14%%Then said all the trees to the bramble, Come thou, and reign over us.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%15%%And the bramble said to the trees, If in truth ye anoint me king over you, then come and put your trust in my shadow: and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%16%%Now therefore, if ye have done truly and sincerely, in that ye have made Abimelech king, and if ye have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house, and have done to him according to the deserving of his hands:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%17%%(For my father fought for you, and adventured his life far, and delivered you from the hand of Midian:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%18%%And ye have risen up against my father's house this day, and have slain his sons, seventy persons, upon one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his maid-servant, king over the men of Shechem, because he is your brother:)
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%19%%If ye then have dealt truly and sincerely with Jerubbaal and with his house this day, then rejoice ye in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%20%%But if not, let fire come out from Abimelech, and devour the men of Shechem, and the house of Millo; and let fire come out from the men of Shechem, and from the house of Millo, and devour Abimelech.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%21%%And Jotham ran away, and fled, and went to Beer, and dwelt there, for fear of Abimelech his brother.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%22%%When Abimelech had reigned three years over Israel,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%23%%Then God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the men of Shechem; and the men of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%24%%That the cruelty done to the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might come, and their blood be laid upon Abimelech their brother who slew them, and upon the men of Shechem who aided him in the killing of his brethren.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%25%%And the men of Shechem set liers in wait for him on the top of the mountains, and they robbed all that came along that way by them: and it was told Abimelech.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%26%%And Gaal the son of Ebed came with his brethren, and went over to Shechem: and the men of Shechem put their confidence in him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%27%%And they went out into the fields, and gathered their vineyards, and trod the grapes, and made merry, and went into the house of their god, and ate and drank, and cursed Abimelech.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%28%%And Gaal the son of Ebed said, Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve him; is not he the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? Serve the men of Hamor the father of Shechem: for why should we serve him?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%29%%And would that this people were under my hand! then would I remove Abimelech. And he said to Abimelech, Increase thy army, and come out.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%30%%And when Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed, his anger was kindled.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%31%%And he sent messengers to Abimelech privately, saying, Behold, Gaal the son of Ebed, and his brethren, are come to Shechem; and behold, they fortify the city against thee.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%32%%Now therefore rise by night, thou, and the people that are with thee, and lie in wait in the field:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%33%%And it shall be, that in the morning, as soon as the sun hath risen, thou shalt rise early, and attack the city: and behold, when he and the people that are with him come out against thee, then mayest thou do to them as thou shalt find occasion.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%34%%And Abimelech rose, and all the people that were with him, by night, and they laid wait against Shechem in four companies.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%35%%And Gaal the son of Ebed went out, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city: and Abimelech rose, and the people that were with him, from lying in wait.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%36%%And when Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, Behold, there come people down from the top of the mountains. And Zebul said to him, Thou seest the shadow of the mountains as if they were men.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%37%%And Gaal spoke again, and said, See, there come people down by the middle of the land, and another company come along by the plain of Meonenim.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%38%%Then said Zebul to him, Where is now thy mouth, with which thou saidst, Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him? are not these the people that thou hast despised? go out, I pray now, and fight with them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%39%%And Gaal went out before the men of Shechem, and fought with Abimelech.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%40%%And Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him, and many were overthrown and wounded, even to the entrance of the gate.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%41%%And Abimelech dwelt at Arumah: and Zebul thrust out Gaal and his brethren, that they should not dwell in Shechem.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%42%%And it came to pass on the morrow, that the people went out into the field; and they told Abimelech.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%43%%And he took the people, and divided them into three companies, and laid wait in the field, and looked, and behold, the people had come out of the city; and he rose up against them, and smote them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%44%%And Abimelech, and the company that was with him, rushed forward, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city: and the two other companies ran upon all the people that were in the fields, and slew them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%45%%And Abimelech fought against the city all that day; and he took the city, and slew the people that were in it, and beat down the city, and sowed it with salt.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%46%%And when all the men of the tower of Shechem heard that, they entered into a hold of the house of the god Berith.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%47%%And it was told to Abimelech, that all the men of the tower of Shechem were assembled.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%48%%And Abimelech ascended mount Zalmon, he and all the people that were with him; and Abimelech took an ax in his hand, and cut down a bough from the trees, and took it, and laid it on his shoulder, and said to the people that were with him, What ye have seen me do, make haste, and do as I have done.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%49%%And all the people likewise cut down every man his bough, and followed Abimelech, and put them to the hold, and set the hold on fire upon them: so that all the men of the tower of Shechem died also, about a thousand men and women.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%50%%Then went Abimelech to Thebez, and encamped against Thebez, and took it.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%51%%But there was a strong tower within the city, and thither fled all the men and women, and all they of the city, and shut it after them, and ascended to the top of the tower.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%52%%And Abimelech came to the tower, and fought against it, and came near to the door of the tower to burn it with fire.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%53%%And a certain woman cast a piece of of a millstone upon Abimelech's head, and broke his skull.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%54%%Then he called hastily to the young man his armor-bearer, and said to him, Draw thy sword, and slay me, that men say not of me, A woman slew him. And his young man thrust him through, and he died.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%55%%And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, they departed every man to his place.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%56%%Thus God rendered the wickedness of Abimelech, which he did to his father, in slaying his seventy brethren:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%9%%57%%And all the evil of the men of Shechem did God render upon their heads: and upon them came the curse of Jotham the son of Jerubbaal.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%1%%And after Abimelech there arose to defend Israel Tola the son of Puah, the son of Dodo, a man of Issachar; and he dwelt in Shamir in mount Ephraim.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%2%%And he judged Israel twenty and three years, and died, and was buried in Shamir.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%3%%And after him arose Jair, a Gileadite, and judged Israel twenty and two years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%4%%And he had thirty sons that rode on thirty ass colts, and they had thirty cities, which are called Havoth-jair to this day, which are in the land of Gilead.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%5%%And Jair died, and was buried in Camon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%6%%And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD, and served Baalim, and Ashtaroth, and the gods of Syria, and the gods of Zidon, and the gods of Moab, and the gods of the children of Ammon, and the gods of the Philistines, and forsook the LORD, and served not him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%7%%And the anger of the LORD was hot against Israel, and he sold them into the hands of the Philistines, and into the hands of the children of Ammon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%8%%And that year they harassed and oppressed the children of Israel eighteen years, all the children of Israel that were on the other side of Jordan in the land of the Amorites, which is in Gilead.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%9%%Moreover, the children of Ammon passed over Jordan, to fight also against Judah, and against Benjamin, and against the house of Ephraim; so that Israel was greatly distressed.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%10%%And the children of Israel cried to the LORD, saying, We have sinned against thee, both because we have forsaken our God, and also served Baalim.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%11%%And the LORD said to the children of Israel, Did not I deliver you from the Egyptians, and from the Amorites, from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%12%%The Zidonians also, and the Amalekites, and the Maonites oppressed you; and ye cried to me, and I delivered you out of their hand.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%13%%Yet ye have forsaken me, and served other gods: wherefore I will deliver you no more.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%14%%Go and cry to the gods which ye have chosen; let them deliver you in the time of your tribulation.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%15%%And the children of Israel said to the LORD, We have sinned: do thou to us whatever seemeth good to thee; deliver us only, we pray thee, this day.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%16%%And they put away the strange gods from among them, and served the LORD: and his soul was grieved for the misery of Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%17%%Then the children of Ammon were assembled, and encamped in Gilead. And the children of Israel assembled themselves, and encamped in Mizpeh.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%10%%18%%And the people and princes of Gilead said one to another, What man is he that will begin to fight against the children of Ammon? he shall be head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%1%%Now Jephthah the Gileadite was a mighty man of valor, and he was the son of a harlot: and Gilead begat Jephthah.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%2%%And Gilead's wife bore him sons; and his wife's sons grew up, and they thrust out Jephthah, and said to him, Thou shalt not inherit in our father's house; for thou art the son of a strange woman.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%3%%Then Jephthah fled from his brethren, and dwelt in the land of Tob: and there were gathered vain men to Jephthah, and they went out with him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%4%%And it came to pass in process of time, that the children of Ammon made war against Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%5%%And it was so, that when the children of Ammon made war against Israel, the elders of Gilead went to bring Jephthah out of the land of Tob:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%6%%And they said to Jephthah, Come, and be our captain, that we may fight with the children of Ammon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%7%%And Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, Did ye not hate me, and expel me from my father's house; and why have ye come to me now when ye are in distress?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%8%%And the elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, Therefore we turn again to thee now, that thou mayest go with us, and fight against the children of Ammon, and be our head over all the inhabitants of Gilead.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%9%%And Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, If ye bring me home again to fight against the children of Ammon, and the LORD deliver them before me, shall I be your head?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%10%%And the elders of Gilead said to Jephthah, The LORD be a witness between us, if we do not so according to thy words.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%11%%Then Jephthah went with the elders of Gilead, and the people made him head and captain over them: and Jephthah uttered all his words before the LORD in Mizpeh.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%12%%And Jephthah sent messengers to the king of the children of Ammon, saying, What hast thou to do with me, that thou hast come against me to fight in my land?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%13%%And the king of the children of Ammon answered to the messengers of Jephthah, Because Israel took away my land, when they came out of Egypt, from Arnon even to Jabbok, and to Jordan: now therefore restore those lands again peaceably.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%14%%And Jephthah sent messengers again to the king of the children of Ammon:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%15%%And said to him, Thus saith Jephthah, Israel took not away the land of Moab, nor the land of the children of Ammon:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%16%%But when Israel came up from Egypt, and walked through the wilderness to the Red sea, and came to Kadesh;
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%17%%Then Israel sent messengers to the king of Edom, saying, Let me, I pray thee, pass through thy land: but the king of Edom would not hearken to it. And in like manner they sent to the king of Moab; but he would not consent. And Israel abode in Kadesh.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%18%%Then they went along through the wilderness, and compassed the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and pitched on the other side of Arnon, but came not within the border of Moab: for Arnon was the border of Moab.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%19%%And Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, the king of Heshbon; and Israel said to him, Let us pass, we pray thee, through thy land to my place.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%20%%But Sihon trusted not Israel to pass through his border: but Sihon collected all his people, and encamped in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%21%%And the LORD God of Israel delivered Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel, and they smote them: so Israel possessed all the land of the Amorites, the inhabitants of that country.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%22%%And they possessed all the borders of the Amorites, from Arnon even to Jabbok, and from the wilderness even to Jordan.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%23%%So now the LORD God of Israel hath dispossessed the Amorites from before his people Israel, and shouldst thou possess it?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%24%%Wilt not thou possess that which Chemosh thy god giveth thee to possess? So whomsoever the LORD our God shall drive out from before us, them will we possess.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%25%%And now art thou any thing better than Balak the son of Zippor king of Moab? did he ever strive against Israel, or did he ever fight against them,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%26%%While Israel dwelt in Heshbon and her towns, and in Aroer and her towns, and in all the cities that are along by the borders of Arnon, three hundred years? why therefore did ye not recover them within that time?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%27%%Wherefore I have not sinned against thee, but thou doest me wrong to war against me: the LORD the Judge be judge this day between the children of Israel and the children of Ammon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%28%%But, the king of the children of Ammon hearkened not to the words of Jephthah which he sent him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%29%%Then the Spirit of the LORD came upon Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead, and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed over to the children of Ammon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%30%%And Jephthah vowed a vow to the LORD, and said, If thou shalt without fail deliver the children of Ammon into my hands,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%31%%Then it shall be, that whatever cometh out of the doors of my house to meet me, when I return in peace from the children of Ammon, shall surely be the LORD'S, and I will offer it for a burnt-offering.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%32%%So Jephthah passed over to the children of Ammon to fight against them; and the LORD delivered them into his hands.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%33%%And he smote them from Aroer even till thou comest to Minnith, even twenty cities, and to the plain of the vineyards, with a very great slaughter. Thus the children of Ammon were subdued before the children of Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%34%%And Jephthah came to Mizpeh to his house, and behold, his daughter came out to meet him with timbrels and with dances: and she was his only child; beside her he had neither son nor daughter.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%35%%And it came to pass, when he saw her, that he rent his clothes, and said Alas, my daughter! thou hast brought me very low, and thou art one of them that trouble me: for I have opened my mouth to the LORD, and I cannot go back.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%36%%And she said to him, My father, if thou hast opened thy mouth to the LORD, do to me according to that which hath proceeded out of thy mouth; forasmuch as the LORD hath taken vengeance for thee of thy enemies, even of the children of Ammon.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%37%%And she said to her father, Let this thing be done for me: Let me alone two months, that I may go up and down upon the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my fellows.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%38%%And he said, Go. And he sent her away for two months: and she went with her companions, and bewailed her virginity upon the mountains.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%39%%And it came to pass at the end of two months, that she returned to her father, who did with her according to his vow which he had vowed: and she knew no man. And it was a custom in Israel,
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%11%%40%%That the daughters of Israel went yearly to lament the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in a year.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%1%%And the men of Ephraim assembled, and went northward, and said to Jephthah, Why didst thou pass over to fight against the children of Ammon, and didst not call us to go with thee; we will burn thy house upon thee with fire.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%2%%And Jephthah said to them, I and my people were at great strife with the children of Ammon; and when I called you, ye delivered me not out of their hands.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%3%%And when I saw that ye delivered me not, I put my life in my hands, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and the LORD delivered them into my hand: why then have ye come up to me this day, to fight against me?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%4%%Then Jephthah collected all the men of Gilead, and fought with Ephraim: and the men of Gilead smote Ephraim, because they said, Ye Gileadites are fugitives of Ephraim among the Ephraimites, and among the Manassites.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%5%%And the Gileadites took the passages of Jordan before the Ephraimites: and it was so, that when those Ephraimites who had escaped, said, Let me go over; that the men of Gilead said to him, Art thou an Ephraimite? If he said, No;
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%6%%Then said they to him, Say now Shibboleth: and he said Sibboleth: for he could not frame to pronounce it right. Then they took him, and slew him at the passages of Jordan. And there fell at that time of the Ephraimites forty and two thousand.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%7%%And Jephthah judged Israel six years: then died Jephthah the Gileadite, and was buried in one of the cities of Gilead.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%8%%And after him Ibzan of Beth-lehem judged Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%9%%And he had thirty sons and thirty daughters whom he sent abroad, and took in thirty daughters from abroad for his sons: and he judged Israel seven years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%10%%Then died Ibzan, and was buried at Beth-lehem.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%11%%And after him Elon, a Zebulonite, judged Israel, and he judged Israel ten years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%12%%And Elon the Zebulonite died, and was buried in Ajalon in the country of Zebulun.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%13%%And after him Abdon the son of Hillel, a Pirathonite, judged Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%14%%And he had forty sons and thirty nephews, that rode on seventy ass colts: and he judged Israel eight years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%12%%15%%And Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite died, and was buried in Pirathon in the land of Ephraim, in the mount of the Amalekites.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%1%%And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD delivered them into the hand of the Philistines forty years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%2%%And there was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and his wife was barren, and bore not.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%3%%And the angel of the LORD appeared to the woman, and said to her, Behold, now, thou art barren, and bearest not: but thou shalt conceive, and bear a son.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%4%%Now therefore beware, I pray thee, and drink not wine, nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean thing:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%5%%For lo, thou shalt conceive, and bear a son; and no razor shall come on his head: for the child shall be a Nazarite to God from his birth: and he shall begin to deliver Israel from the hand of the Philistines.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%6%%Then the woman came and told her husband, saying, A man of God came to me, and his countenance was like the countenance of an angel of God, very terrible: but I asked him not whence he was, neither did he tell me his name:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%7%%But he said to me, Behold, thou shalt conceive, and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, neither eat any unclean thing: for the child shall be a Nazarite to God from his birth to the day of his death.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%8%%Then Manoah entreated the LORD, and said, O my Lord, let the man of God, whom thou didst send come again to us, and teach us what we shall do to the child that shall be born.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%9%%And God hearkened to the voice of Manoah; and the angel of God came again to the woman as she sat in the field: but Manoah her husband was not with her.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%10%%And the woman made haste, and ran, and showed her husband, and said to him, Behold, the man hath appeared to me, that came to me the other day.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%11%%And Manoah arose, and went after his wife, and came to the man, and said to him, Art thou the man that didst speak to the woman? And he said, I am.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%12%%And Manoah said, Now let thy words come to pass. How shall we order the child, and how shall we do to him?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%13%%And the angel of the LORD said to Manoah, Of all that I said to the woman, let her beware.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%14%%She may not eat of any thing that cometh of the vine, neither let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat any unclean thing; all that I commanded her let her observe.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%15%%And Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, I pray thee, let us detain thee, until we shall have made ready a kid for thee.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%16%%And the angel of the LORD said to Manoah, Though thou shouldst detain me, I will not eat of thy bread: and if thou wilt offer a burnt-offering, thou must offer it to the LORD. For Manoah knew not that he was an angel of the LORD.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%17%%And Manoah said to the angel of the LORD, What is thy name, that when thy sayings come to pass, we may do thee honor?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%18%%And the angel of the LORD said to him, why askest thou thus after my name, seeing it is secret?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%19%%So Manoah took a kid, with a meat-offering, and offered it upon a rock to the LORD; and the angel did wonderously, and Manoah and his wife looked on.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%20%%For it came to pass, when the flame ascended towards heaven from off the altar, that the angel of the LORD ascended in the flame of the altar. And Manoah and his wife looked on it, and fell on their faces to the ground.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%21%%But the angel of the LORD did no more appear to Manoah and to his wife. Then Manoah knew that he was an angel of the LORD.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%22%%And Manoah said to his wife, We shall surely die, because we have seen God.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%23%%But his wife said to him, If the LORD were pleased to kill us, he would not have received a burnt-offering and a meat-offering at our hands, neither would he have showed us all these things, nor would, as at this time, have told us such things as these.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%24%%And the woman bore a son, and called his name Samson. And the child grew, and the LORD blessed him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%13%%25%%And the Spirit of the LORD began to move him at times in the camp of Dan, between Zorah and Eshtaol.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%1%%And Samson went down to Timnath, and saw a woman in Timnath of the daughters of the Philistines.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%2%%And he came up, and told his father and his mother, and said, I have seen a woman in Timnath of the daughters of the Philistines: now therefore get her for me for a wife.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%3%%Then his father and his mother said to him, Is there not a woman among the daughters of thy brethren, or among all my people, that thou goest to take a wife of the uncircumcised Philistines? And Samson said to his father, Get her for me; for she pleaseth me well.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%4%%But his father and his mother knew not that it was of the LORD, that he sought an occasion against the Philistines: for at that time the Philistines had dominion over Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%5%%Then went Samson down, and his father and his mother, to Timnath, and came to the vineyards of Timnath: and behold, a young lion roared against him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%6%%And the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon him, and he rent him as he would have rent a kid, and he had nothing in his hand: but he told not his father or his mother what he had done.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%7%%And he went down, and talked with the woman; and she pleased Samson well.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%8%%And after a time he returned to take her, and he turned aside to see the carcass of the lion: and behold, there was a swarm of bees and honey in the carcass of the lion.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%9%%And he took of it in his hands, and went on eating, and came to his father and mother, and he gave them, and they ate: but he told them not that he had taken the honey out of the carcass of the lion.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%10%%So his father went down to the woman: and Samson made there a feast; for so used the young men to do.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%11%%And it came to pass, when they saw him, that they brought thirty companions to be with him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%12%%And Samson said to them, I will now propose a riddle to you: if ye can certainly declare it me within the seven days of the feast, and find it out, then I will give you thirty sheets and thirty change of garments:
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%13%%But if ye cannot declare it to me, then shall ye give me thirty sheets and thirty change of garments. And they said to him, propose thy riddle, that we may hear it.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%14%%And he said to them, Out of the eater came forth food, and out of the strong came forth sweetness. And they could not in three days expound the riddle.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%15%%And it came to pass on the seventh day, that they said to Samson's wife, Entice thy husband, that he may declare to us the riddle, lest we burn thee and thy father's house with fire: have ye called us to take what we possess? is it not so?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%16%%And Samson's wife wept before him, and said, Thou dost but hate me, and lovest me not: thou hast proposed a riddle to the children of my people, and hast not told it to me. And he said to her, Behold, I have not told it to my father nor to my mother, and shall I tell it to thee?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%17%%And she wept before him the seven days, while their feast lasted: and it came to pass on the seventh day, that he told her, because she urged him: and she told the riddle to the children of her people.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%18%%And the men of the city said to him on the seventh day before the sun went down, What is sweeter than honey? and what is stronger than a lion? And he said to them, If ye had not plowed with my heifer, ye had not found out my riddle.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%19%%And the Spirit of the LORD came upon him, and he went down to Ashkelon, and slew thirty men of them, and took their spoil, and gave change of garments to them who expounded the riddle. And his anger was kindled, and he went up to his father's house.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%14%%20%%But Samson's wife was given to his companion, whom he had used as his friend.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%1%%But it came to pass after a while, in the time of wheat-harvest, that Samson visited his wife with a kid; and he said, I will go in to my wife into the chamber. But her father would not suffer him to go in.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%2%%And her father said, I verily thought that thou hadst utterly hated her; therefore I gave her to thy companion: is not her younger sister fairer than she? take her, I pray thee, instead of her.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%3%%And Samson said concerning them, Now shall I be more blameless than the Philistines, though I do them a displeasure.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%4%%And Samson went and caught three hundred foxes, and took fire-brands, and turned tail to tail, and put a fire-brand in the midst between two tails.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%5%%And when he had set the brands on fire, he let them go into the standing corn of the Philistines, and burnt up both the shocks and also the standing corn, with the vineyards and olives.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%6%%Then the Philistines said, Who hath done this? And they answered, Samson, the son-in-law of the Timnite, because he had taken his wife, and given her to his companion. And the Philistines came up, and burnt her and her father with fire.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%7%%And Samson said to them, Though ye have done this, yet will I be avenged of you, and after that I will cease.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%8%%And he smote them hip and thigh with a great slaughter. And he went down and dwelt in the top of the rock Etam.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%9%%Then the Philistines went up, and encamped in Judah, and spread themselves in Lehi.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%10%%And the men of Judah said, Why have ye come up against us? And they answered, We have come to bind Samson, to do to him as he hath done to us.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%11%%Then three thousand men of Judah went to the top of the rock Etam, and said to Samson, Knowest thou not that the Philistines are rulers over us? what is this that thou hast done to us? And he said to them, As they did to me, so have I done to them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%12%%And they said to him, We have come down to bind thee, that we may deliver thee into the hand of the Philistines. And Samson said to them, Swear to me, that ye will not fall upon me yourselves.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%13%%And they spoke to him, saying, No; but we will bind thee fast, and deliver thee into their hand: but surely we will not kill thee. And they bound him with two new cords, and brought him up from the rock.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%14%%And when he came to Lehi, the Philistines shouted against him: and the Spirit of the LORD came mightily upon him, and the cords that were upon his arms became as flax that was burnt with fire, and his bands loosed from off his the hands.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%15%%And he found a fresh jaw-bone of an ass, and put forth his hand, and took it, and slew a thousand men with it.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%16%%And Samson said, With the jaw-bone of an ass, heaps upon heaps, with the jaw of an ass have I slain a thousand men.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%17%%And it came to pass when he had made an end of speaking, that he cast away the jaw-bone out of his hand, and called that place Ramath-lehi.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%18%%And he was very thirsty, and called on the LORD, and said, Thou hast given this great deliverance into the hand of thy servant: and now shall I die by thirst, and fall into the hand of the uncircumcised?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%19%%But God cleaved a hollow place that was in the jaw, and there came water out of it; and when he had drank, his spirit came again, and he revived. Wherefore he called the name of it En-hakkore, which is in Lehi to this day.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%15%%20%%And he judged Israel, in the days of the Philistines, twenty years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%1%%Then went Samson to Gaza, and saw there a harlot, and went in to her.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%2%%And it was told the Gazites, saying, Samson is come hither. And they encompassed him, and laid wait for him all night in the gate of the city, and were quiet all the night, saying, In the morning when it is day we shall kill him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%3%%And Samson lay till midnight, and arose at midnight, and took the doors of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and went away with them, bar and all, and put them upon his shoulders, and carried them up to the top of a hill that is before Hebron.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%4%%And it came to pass afterward, that he loved a woman in the valley of Sorek, whose name was Delilah.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%5%%And the lords of the Philistines came to her, and said to her, Entice him, and see in what his great strength lieth, and by what means we may prevail against him, that we may bind him to afflict him: and we will give thee every one of us eleven hundred pieces of silver.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%6%%And Delilah said to Samson, Tell me, I pray thee, in what thy great strength lieth, and with what thou mayest be bound to afflict thee.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%7%%And Samson said to her, If they bind me with seven green withs, that were never dried, then shall I be weak, and be as another man.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%8%%Then the lords of the Philistines brought to her seven green withs, which had not been dried, and she bound him with them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%9%%(Now there were men lying in wait, abiding with her in the chamber.) And she said to him, The Philistines are upon thee, Samson. And he broke the withs as a thread of tow is broken when it toucheth the fire. So his strength was not known.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%10%%And Delilah said to Samson, Behold, thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: now tell me, I pray thee, with what thou mayest be bound.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%11%%And he said to her, If they bind me fast with new ropes that never were used, then shall I be weak, and be as another man.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%12%%Delilah therefore took new ropes, and bound him with them, and said to him, The Philistines are upon thee, Samson. (And there were liers in wait abiding in the chamber.) And he broke them from off his arms like a thread.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%13%%And Delilah said to Samson, hitherto thou hast mocked me, and told me lies: tell me with what thou mayest be bound. And he said to her, If thou weavest the seven locks of my head with the web.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%14%%And she fastened it with the pin, and said to him, The Philistines are upon thee, Samson. And he awaked out of his sleep, and went away with the pin of the beam, and with the web.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%15%%And she said to him, How canst thou say, I love thee, when thy heart is not with me? Thou hast mocked me these three times, and hast not told me in what thy great strength lieth.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%16%%And it came to pass when she pressed him daily with her words, and urged him, so that his soul was vexed to death;
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%17%%That he told her all his heart, and said to her, There hath not come a razor upon my head; for I have been a Nazarite to God from my birth: if I be shaved, then my strength will go from me, and I shall become weak, and be like any other man.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%18%%And when Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart, she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines, saying, Come up this once, for he hath disclosed to me all his heart. Then the lords of the Philistines came up to her and brought money in their hand.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%19%%And she made him sleep upon her knees; and she called for a man, and she caused him to shave off the seven locks of his head; and she began to afflict him, and his strength went from him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%20%%And she said, the Philistines are upon thee, Samson. And he awoke out of his sleep, and said, I will go out as at other times before, and shake myself. And he knew not that the LORD had departed from him.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%21%%But the Philistines took him and put out his eyes, and brought him down to Gaza, and bound him with fetters of brass; and he did grind in the prison-house.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%22%%However the hair of his head began to grow again after he was shaved.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%23%%Then the lords of the Philistines assembled to offer a great sacrifice to Dagon their god, and to rejoice: for they said, Our god hath delivered Samson our enemy into our hand.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%24%%And when the people saw him, they praised their god: for they said, Our god hath delivered into our hands our enemy, and the destroyer of our country; who slew many of us.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%25%%And it came to pass, when their hearts were merry, that they said, Call for Samson that he may make us sport. And they called for Samson out of the prison-house; and he made them sport: and they set him between the pillars.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%26%%And Samson said to the lad that held him by the hand, Suffer me that I may feel the pillars upon which the house standeth, that I may lean upon them.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%27%%Now the house was full of men and women: and all the lords of the Philistines were there: and there were upon the roof about three thousand men and women, that beheld while Samson made sport.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%28%%And Samson called to the LORD, and said, O Lord GOD, remember me, I pray thee, and strengthen me, I pray thee, only this once, O God, that I may be at once avenged of the Philistines for my two eyes.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%29%%And Samson took hold of the two middle pillars upon which the house stood, and on which it was supported, of the one with his right hand, and of the other with his left.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%30%%And Samson said, Let me die with the Philistines. And he bowed himself with all his might; and the house fell upon the lords, and upon all the people that were in it. So the dead which he slew at his death were more than they which he slew in his life.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%16%%31%%Then his brethren and all the house of his father came down, and took him, and brought him up, and buried him between Zorah and Eshtaol in the burying-place of Manoah his father. And he judged Israel twenty years.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%1%%And there was a man of mount Ephraim, whose name was Micah.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%2%%And he said to his mother, The eleven hundred shekels of silver that were taken from thee, about which thou didst curse, and speak of also in my ears, behold, the silver is with me; I took it. And his mother said, Blessed be thou of the LORD, my son.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%3%%And when he had restored the eleven hundred shekels of silver to his mother, his mother said, I had wholly dedicated the silver to the LORD from my hand for my son, to make a graven image and a molten image: now therefore I will restore it to thee.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%4%%Yet he restored the money to his mother; and his mother took two hundred shekels of silver, and gave them to the founder, who made of it a graven image and a molten image: and they were in the house of Micah.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%5%%And the man Micah had a house of gods, and made an ephod, and teraphim, and consecrated one of his sons, who became his priest.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%6%%In those days there was no king in Israel, but every man did that which was right in his own eyes.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%7%%And there was a young man out of Beth-lehem-judah of the family of Judah, who was a Levite, and he sojourned there.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%8%%And the man departed out of the city from Beth-lehem-judah, to sojourn where he could find a place: and he came to mount Ephraim to the house of Micah, as he journeyed.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%9%%And Micah said to him, Whence comest thou? And he said to him, I am a Levite of Beth-lehem-judah, and I go to sojourn where I may find a place.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%10%%And Micah said to him, Dwell with me, and be to me a father and a priest, and I will give thee ten shekels of silver by the year, and a suit of apparel, and thy victuals. So the Levite went in.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%11%%And the Levite was content to dwell with the man; and the young man was to him as one of his sons.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%12%%And Micah consecrated the Levite; and the young man became his priest, and was in the house of Micah.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%17%%13%%Then said Micah, Now I know that the LORD will do me good, seeing I have a Levite for my priest.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%1%%In those days there was no king in Israel: and in those days the tribe of the Danites sought for themselves an inheritance to dwell in; for to that day all their inheritance had not fallen to them among the tribes of Israel.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%2%%And the children of Dan sent of their family five men from their borders, men of valor, from Zorah, and from Eshtaol, to explore the land, and to search it; and they said to them, Go, search the land: who when they came to mount Ephraim, to the house of Micah, they lodged there.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%3%%When they were by the house of Micah, they knew the voice of the young man the Levite: and they turned in thither, and said to him, Who brought thee hither? and what makest thou in this place? and what hast thou here?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%4%%And he said to them, Thus and thus dealeth Micah with me, and hath hired me, and I am his priest.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%5%%And they said to him, Ask counsel, we pray thee, of God, that we may know whether our way which we go shall be prosperous.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%6%%And the priest said to them, Go in peace: before the LORD is your way in which ye go.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%7%%Then the five men departed, and came to Laish, and saw the people that were in it, how they dwelt careless, after the manner of the Zidonians, quiet and secure; and there was no magistrate in the land, that might put them to shame in any thing; and they were far from the Zidonians, and had no business with any man.
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%8%%And they came to their brethren to Zorah and Eshtaol: and their brethren said to them, What say ye?
1000005%%Judges%%OT%%18%%9%%And they said, Arise, that we may go up against them: for we have seen the land, and behold, it is very good: and are ye still? be not slothful to go, and to enter to possess the land.
