1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%11%%And it came to pass when all that formerly knew him saw, that, behold, he prophesied among the prophets, then the people said one to another, What is this that hath come to the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%12%%And one of the same place answered and said, But who is their father? Therefore it became a proverb, Is Saul also among the prophets?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%13%%And when he had made an end of prophesying, he came to the high place.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%14%%And Saul's uncle said to him and to his servant, Whither went ye? And he said, To seek the asses: and when we saw that they were no where, we came to Samuel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%15%%And Saul's uncle said, Tell me, I pray thee, What Samuel said to you.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%16%%And Saul said to his uncle, He told us plainly that the asses were found. But of the matter of the kingdom, of which Samuel spoke, he told him not.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%17%%And Samuel called the people together to the LORD to Mizpeh;
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%18%%And said to the children of Israel, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, I brought Israel out of Egypt, and delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all kingdoms, and of them that oppressed you:
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%19%%And ye have this day rejected your God, who himself saved you out of all your adversities, and your tribulations; and ye have said to him, No, but set a king over us. Now therefore present yourselves before the LORD by your tribes, and by your thousands.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%20%%And when Samuel had caused all the tribes of Israel to come near, the tribe of Benjamin was taken.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%21%%When he had caused the tribe of Benjamin to come near by their families, the family of Matri was taken, and Saul the son of Kish was taken: and when they sought him, he could not be found.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%22%%Therefore they inquired of the LORD further, if the man would yet come thither. And the LORD answered, Behold, he hath hid himself among the stuff.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%23%%And they ran and brought him thence: and when he stood among the people, he was higher than any of the people from his shoulders and upward.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%24%%And Samuel said to all the people, See ye him whom the LORD hath chosen, that there is none like him among all the people? And all the people shouted, and said, God save the king.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%25%%Then Samuel told the people the manner of the kingdom, and wrote it in a book, and laid it up before the LORD. And Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%26%%And Saul also went home to Gibeah; and there went with him a band of men, whose hearts God had touched.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%10%%27%%But the children of Belial said, How shall this man save us? And they despised him, and brought him no presents. But he held his peace.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%1%%Then Nahash the Ammonite came up, and encamped against Jabesh-gilead: and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, Make a covenant with us, and we will serve thee.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%2%%And Nahash the Ammonite answered them, On this condition will I make a covenant with you, that I may thrust out all your right eyes, and lay it for a reproach upon all Israel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%3%%And the elders of Jabesh said to him, Give us seven days respit, that we may send messengers to all the borders of Israel: and then, if there is no man to save us, we will come out to thee.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%4%%Then came the messengers to Gibeah of Saul, and told the tidings in the ears of the people; and all the people lifted up their voices, and wept.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%5%%And behold, Saul came after the herd out of the field; and Saul said, What aileth the people that they weep? And they told him the tidings of the men of Jabesh.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%6%%And the Spirit of God came upon Saul when he heard those tidings, and his anger was kindled greatly.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%7%%And he took a yoke of oxen, and hewed them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hands of messengers, saying, Whoever cometh not forth after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen. And the fear of the LORD fell on the people, and they came out with one consent.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%8%%And when he numbered them in Bezek, the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%9%%And they said to the messengers that came, thus shall ye say to the men of Jabesh-gilead, To-morrow by the time the sun is hot, ye shall have help. And the messengers came and showed it to the men of Jabesh; and they were glad.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%10%%Therefore the men of Jabesh said, To-morrow we will come out to you, and ye shall do with us all that seemeth good to you.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%11%%And it was so on the morrow, that Saul disposed the people in three companies; and they came into the midst of the host in the morning-watch, and slew the Ammonites until the heat of the day: and it came to pass, that they who remained were scattered, so that two of them were not left together.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%12%%And the people said to Samuel, Who is he that said, Shall Saul reign over us? bring the men, that we may put them to death.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%13%%And Saul said, There shall not a man be put to death this day: for to-day the LORD hath wrought salvation in Israel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%14%%Then said Samuel to the people, Come, and let us go to Gilgal, and renew the kingdom there.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%11%%15%%And all the people went to Gilgal; and there they made Saul king before the LORD in Gilgal: and there they sacrificed sacrifices of peace-offerings before the LORD; and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%1%%And Samuel said to all Israel, behold, I have hearkened to your voice in all that ye said to me, and have made a king over you.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%2%%And now, behold, the king walketh before you: and I am old and gray-headed; and behold, my sons are with you: and I have walked before you from my childhood to this day.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%3%%Behold, here I am: witness against me before the LORD, and before his anointed; whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or from whose hand have I received any bribe to blind my eyes with it? and I will restore it you.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%4%%And they said thou hast not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither hast thou taken aught from any man's hand.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%5%%And he said to them, The LORD is witness against you, and his anointed is witness this day, that ye have not found aught in my hand. And they answered, He is witness.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%6%%And Samuel said to the people, It is the LORD that advanced Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers out of the land of Egypt.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%7%%Now therefore stand still, that I may reason with you before the LORD of all the righteous acts of the LORD, which he did to you and to your fathers.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%8%%When Jacob had come into Egypt, and your fathers cried to the LORD, then the LORD sent Moses and Aaron, who brought forth your fathers from Egypt, and made them dwell in this place.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%9%%And when they forgot the LORD their God, he sold them into the hand of Sisera, captain of the host of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the king of Moab, and they fought against them.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%10%%And they cried to the LORD, and said, We have sinned, because we have forsaken the LORD, and have served Baalim and Ashtaroth: but now deliver us from the hand of our enemies, and we will serve thee.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%11%%And the LORD sent Jerubbaal and Bedan, and Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you from the hand of your enemies on every side, and ye dwelt safe.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%12%%And when ye saw that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon came against you, ye said to me, No; but a king shall reign over us: when the LORD your God was your king.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%13%%Now therefore, behold the king whom ye have chosen, and whom ye have desired! and behold, the LORD hath set a king over you.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%14%%If ye will fear the LORD, and serve him, and obey his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of the LORD, then shall both ye, and also the king that reigneth over you continue following the LORD your God.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%15%%But if ye will not obey the voice of the LORD, but rebel against the commandment of the LORD, then shall the hand of the LORD be against you, as it was against your fathers.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%16%%Now therefore stand and see this great thing, which the LORD will do before your eyes.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%17%%Is it not wheat-harvest to-day? I will call to the LORD, and he will send thunder and rain; that ye may perceive and see that your wickedness is great, which ye have done in the sight of the LORD, in asking you a king.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%18%%So Samuel called to the LORD; and the LORD sent thunder and rain that day: and all the people greatly feared the LORD and Samuel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%19%%And all the people said to Samuel, Pray for thy servants to the LORD thy God, that we die not: for we have added to all our sins this evil, to ask us a king.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%20%%And Samuel said to the people, Fear not: ye have done all this wickedness: yet turn not aside from following the LORD, but serve the LORD with all your heart;
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%21%%And turn ye not aside: for then would ye go after vain things, which cannot profit nor deliver; for they are vain.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%22%%For the LORD will not forsake his people for his great name's sake: because it hath pleased the LORD to make you his people.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%23%%Moreover as for me, Far be it from me that I should sin against the LORD in ceasing to pray for you: but I will teach you the good and the right way:
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%24%%Only fear the LORD, and serve him in truth with all your heart: for consider how great things he hath done for you.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%12%%25%%But if ye shall still do wickedly, ye will be consumed, both ye and your king.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%1%%Saul reigned one year; and when he had reigned two years over Israel,
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%2%%Saul chose him three thousand men of Israel; of which two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in mount Beth-el, and a thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin: and the rest of the people he sent every man to his tent.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%3%%And Jonathan smote the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba; and the Philistines heard of it. And Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, Let the Hebrews hear.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%4%%And all Israel heard it said that Saul had smitten a garrison of the Philistines, and that Israel also was had in abomination with the Philistines: and the people were called together after Saul to Gilgal.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%5%%And the Philistines assembled to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots, and six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which is on the sea shore in multitude: and they came up, and encamped in Michmash, eastward from Beth-aven.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%6%%When the men of Israel saw that they were in a strait (for the people were distressed) then the people hid themselves in caves, and in thickets, and in rocks, and in high places, and in pits.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%7%%And some of the Hebrews went over Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead. As for Saul, he was yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%8%%And he tarried seven days, according to the set time that Samuel had appointed: but Samuel came not to Gilgal; and the people were scattered from him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%9%%And Saul said, Bring hither a burnt-offering to me, and peace-offerings. And he offered the burnt-offering.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%10%%And it came to pass, that as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt-offering, behold, Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might salute him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%11%%And Samuel said, What hast thou done? And Saul said, Because I saw that the people were scattered from me, and that thou camest not within the days appointed, and that the Philistines assembled at Michmash;
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%12%%Therefore said I, the Philistines will now come down upon me to Gilgal, and I have not made supplication to the LORD; I forced myself therefore, and offered a burnt-offering.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%13%%And Samuel said to Saul, Thou hast done foolishly: thou hast not kept the commandment of the LORD thy God, which he commanded thee: for now would the LORD have established thy kingdom upon Israel for ever.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%14%%But now thy kingdom shall not continue: the LORD hath sought him a man after his own heart, and the LORD hath commanded him to be captain over his people, because thou hast not kept that which the LORD commanded thee.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%15%%And Samuel arose, and went up from Gilgal to Gibeah of Benjamin. And Saul numbered the people that were present with him, about six hundred men.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%16%%And Saul, and Jonathan his son, and the people that were present with them, abode in Gibeah of Benjamin: but the Philistines encamped in Michmash.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%17%%And the spoilers came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned to the way that leadeth to Ophrah, to the land of Shual:
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%18%%And another company turned the way to Beth-horon: and another company turned to the way of the border that looketh to the valley of Zeboim towards the wilderness.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%19%%Now there was no smith found throughout all the land of Israel: (for the Philistines said, Lest the Hebrews make them swords or spears:)
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%20%%But all the Israelites went down to the Philistines, to sharpen every man his share, and his colter, and his ax, and his mattock.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%21%%Yet they had a file for the mattocks, and for the colters, and for the forks, and for the axes, and to sharpen the goads.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%22%%So it came to pass in the day of battle, that there was neither sword nor spear found in the hand of any of the people that were with Saul and Jonathan: but with Saul and with Jonathan his son was there found.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%13%%23%%And the garrison of the Philistines went out to the passage of Michmash.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%1%%Now it came to pass upon a day, that Jonathan, the son of Saul, said to the young man that bore his armor, Come, and let us go over to the garrison of the Philistines, that is on the other side. But he told not his father.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%2%%And Saul tarried in the uttermost part of Gibeah under a pomegranate tree which is in Migron: and the people that were with him were about six hundred men;
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%3%%And Ahiah, the son of Ahitub, I-chabod's brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the LORD'S priest in Shiloh, wearing an ephod. And the people knew not that Jonathan was gone.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%4%%And between the passages by which Jonathan sought to go over to the garrison of the Philistines, there was a sharp rock on the one side, and a sharp rock on the other side: and the name of the one was Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%5%%The front of the one was situated northward over against Michmash, and the other southward over against Gibeah.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%6%%And Jonathan said to the young man that bore his armor, Come, and let us go over to the garrison of these uncircumcised: it may be that the LORD will work for us: for there is no restraint to the LORD to save by many or by few.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%7%%And his armor-bearer said to him, Do all that is in thy heart: turn thee; behold, I am with thee according to thy heart.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%8%%Then said Jonathan, Behold, we will pass over to these men, and we will discover ourselves to them.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%9%%If they say thus to us, Tarry until we come to you; then we will stand still in our place, and will not go up to them.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%10%%But if they say thus, Come up to us; then we will go up: for the LORD hath delivered them into our hand; and this shall be a sign to us.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%11%%And both of them discovered themselves to the garrison of the Philistines: and the Philistines said, Behold, the Hebrews come forth out of the holes where they had hid themselves.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%12%%And the men of the garrison answered Jonathan and his armor-bearer, and said, Come up to us, and we will show you a thing. And Jonathan said to his armor-bearer, Come up after me: for the LORD hath delivered them into the hand of Israel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%13%%And Jonathan climbed up upon his hands and upon his feet, and his armor-bearer after him: and they fell before Jonathan; and his armor-bearer slew after him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%14%%And that first slaughter, which Jonathan and his armor-bearer made, was about twenty men, within as it were a half-acre of land, which a yoke of oxen might plow.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%15%%And there was trembling in the host, in the field, and among all the people: the garrison, and the spoilers, they also trembled, and the earth quaked: so it was a very great trembling.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%16%%And the watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and behold, the multitude melted away, and they went on beating down one another.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%17%%Then said Saul to the people that were with him, Number now, and see who is gone from us. And when they had numbered, behold, Jonathan and his armor-bearer were not there.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%18%%And Saul said to Ahiah, Bring hither the ark of God. For the ark of God was at that time with the children of Israel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%19%%And it came to pass while Saul talked to the priest, that the noise that was in the host of the Philistines went on, and increased: and Saul said to the priest, Withdraw thy hand.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%20%%And Saul and all the people that were with him assembled themselves, and they came to the battle: and behold, every man's sword was against his fellow, and there was a very great discomfiture.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%21%%Moreover the Hebrews that were with the Philistines before that time, who went up with them into the camp from the country around, even they also turned to be with the Israelites that were with Saul and Jonathan.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%22%%Likewise all the men of Israel who had hid themselves in mount Ephraim, when they heard that the Philistines fled, even they also followed hard after them in the battle.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%23%%So the LORD saved Israel that day: and the battle passed over to Beth-aven.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%24%%And the men of Israel were distressed that day: for Saul had adjured the people, saying, Cursed be the man that eateth any food until evening, that I may be avenged on my enemies. So none of the people tasted any food.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%25%%And all they of the land came to a wood; and there was honey upon the ground.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%26%%And when the people had come into the wood, behold, the honey dropped; but no man put his hand to his mouth: for the people feared the oath.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%27%%But Jonathan heard not when his father charged the people with the oath: wherefore he put forth the end of the rod that was in his hand, and dipped it in a honey-comb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his eyes were enlightened.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%28%%Then answered one of the people, and said, Thy father strictly charged the people with an oath, saying, Cursed be the man that eateth any food this day. And the people were faint.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%29%%Then said Jonathan, My father hath troubled the land: see, I pray you, how my eyes have been enlightened, because I tasted a little of this honey.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%30%%How much more, if haply the people had eaten freely to-day of the spoil of their enemies which they found? for had there not been now a much greater slaughter among the Philistines?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%31%%And they smote the Philistines that day from Michmash to Ajalon: and the people were very faint.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%32%%And the people flew upon the spoil, and took sheep and oxen, and calves, and slew them on the ground: and the people ate them with the blood.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%33%%Then they told Saul, saying, Behold, the people sin against the LORD, in that they eat with the blood. And he said, Ye have transgressed: roll a great stone to me this day.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%34%%And Saul said, Disperse yourselves among the people, and say to them, Bring me hither every man his ox, and every man his sheep, and slay them here, and eat; and sin not against the LORD in eating with the blood. And all the people brought every man his ox with him that night, and slew them there.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%35%%And Saul built an altar to the LORD: the same was the first altar that he built to the LORD:
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%36%%And Saul said, Let us go down after the Philistines by night, and spoil them until the morning light, and let us not leave a man of them. And they said, Do whatever seemeth good to thee. Then said the priest, Let us draw near hither to God.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%37%%And Saul asked counsel of God, Shall I go down after the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into the hand of Israel? But he answered him not that day.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%38%%And Saul said, Draw ye near hither all the chief of the people: and know and see wherein this sin hath been this day.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%39%%For as the LORD liveth, who saveth Israel, though it is in Jonathan my son, he shall surely die. But there was not a man among all the people that answered him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%40%%Then said he to all Israel, Be ye on one side, and I and Jonathan my son will be on the other side. And the people said to Saul, Do what seemeth good to thee.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%41%%Therefore Saul said to the LORD God of Israel, Give a perfect lot. And Saul and Jonathan were taken: but the people escaped.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%42%%And Saul said, Cast lots between me and Jonathan my son. And Jonathan was taken.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%43%%Then Saul said to Jonathan, Tell me what thou hast done. And Jonathan told him, and said, I did but taste a little honey with the end of the rod that was in my hand, and, lo, I must die.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%44%%And Saul answered, God do so, and more also: for thou shalt surely die, Jonathan.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%45%%And the people said to Saul, Shall Jonathan die, who hath wrought this great salvation in Israel? By no means: as the LORD liveth, there shall not one hair of his head fall to the ground; for he hath wrought with God this day. So the people rescued Jonathan, that he died not.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%46%%Then Saul went up from following the Philistines: and the Philistines went to their own place.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%47%%So Saul took the kingdom over Israel, and fought against all his enemies on every side, against Moab, and against the children of Ammon, and against Edom, and against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines: and whithersoever he turned himself, he harassed them.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%48%%And he gathered a host, and smote the Amalekites, and delivered Israel from the hands of them that spoiled them.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%49%%Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan, and Ishui, and Melchi-shua: and the names of his two daughters were these; the name of the first-born Merab, and the name of the younger Michal:
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%50%%And the name of Saul's wife was Ahinoam, the daughter of Ahimaaz: and the name of the captain of his host was Abner, the son of Ner, Saul's uncle.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%51%%And Kish was the father of Saul; and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Abiel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%14%%52%%And there was violent war against the Philistines all the days of Saul: and when Saul saw any strong man, or any valiant man, he took him to himself.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%1%%Samuel also said to Saul, the LORD sent me to anoint thee to be king over his people, over Israel: now therefore hearken thou to the voice of the words of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%2%%Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I remember that which Amalek did to Israel, how he laid wait for him in the way, when he came up from Egypt.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%3%%Now go and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%4%%And Saul assembled the people, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen, and ten thousand men of Judah.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%5%%And Saul came to a city of Amalek, and laid wait in the valley.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%6%%And Saul said to the Kenites, Go, depart, withdraw yourselves from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them: for ye showed kindness to all the children of Israel when they came up from Egypt. So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%7%%And Saul smote the Amalekites from Havilah, until thou comest to Shur, that is over against Egypt.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%8%%And he took Agag the king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%9%%But Saul and the people spared Agag, and the best of the sheep, and of the oxen, and of the fatlings, and the lambs, and all that was good, and would not utterly destroy them: but every thing that was vile and refuse, that they destroyed utterly.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%10%%Then came the word of the LORD to Samuel, saying,
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%11%%I repent that I have set up Saul to be king: for he is turned back from following me, and hath not performed my commandments. And it grieved Samuel; and he cried to the LORD all night.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%12%%And when Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning, it was told Samuel, saying, Saul came to Carmel, and behold, he set him up a place, and has gone about, and passed on, and gone down to Gilgal.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%13%%And Samuel came to Saul: and Saul said to him, Blessed be thou of the LORD: I have performed the commandment of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%14%%And Samuel said, What meaneth then this bleating of the sheep in my ears, and the lowing of the oxen which I hear?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%15%%And Saul said, They have brought them from the Amalekites: for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen, to sacrifice to the LORD thy God; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%16%%Then Samuel said to Saul, Stay, and I will tell thee what the LORD hath said to me this night. And he said to him, Say on.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%17%%And Samuel said, When thou wast little in thy own sight, wast thou not made the head of the tribes of Israel, and the LORD anointed thee king over Israel?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%18%%And the LORD sent thee on a journey, and said, Go, and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they are consumed.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%19%%Why then didst thou not obey the voice of the LORD, but didst fly upon the spoil, and didst evil in the sight of the LORD?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%20%%And Saul said to Samuel, Yea, I have obeyed the voice of the LORD, and have gone the way which the LORD sent me, and have brought Agag the king of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%21%%But the people took of the spoil, sheep and oxen, the chief of the things which should have been utterly destroyed, to sacrifice to the LORD thy God in Gilgal.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%22%%And Samuel said, Hath the LORD as great delight in burnt-offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the voice of the LORD? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of rams.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%23%%For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as iniquity and idolatry. Because thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, he hath also rejected thee from being king.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%24%%And Saul said to Samuel, I have sinned: for I have transgressed the commandment of the LORD, and thy words; because I feared the people, and obeyed their voice.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%25%%Now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship the LORD.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%26%%And Samuel said to Saul, I will not return with thee: for thou hast rejected the word of the LORD, and the LORD hath rejected thee from being king over Israel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%27%%And as Samuel turned about to depart, he laid hold upon the skirt of his mantle, and it rent.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%28%%And Samuel said to him, The LORD hath rent the kingdom of Israel from thee this day, and hath given it to a neighbor of thine, that is better than thou.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%29%%And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent: for he is not a man, that he should repent.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%30%%Then he said, I have sinned: yet honor me now, I pray thee, before the elders of my people, and before Israel, and turn again with me, that I may worship the LORD thy God.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%31%%So Samuel turned again after Saul; and Saul worshiped the LORD.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%32%%Then said Samuel, Bring ye hither to me Agag the king of the Amalekites. And Agag came to him delicately. And Agag said, Surely the bitterness of death is past.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%33%%And Samuel said, As thy sword hath made women childless, so shall thy mother be childless among women. And Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before the LORD in Gilgal.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%34%%Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to his house to Gibeah of Saul.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%15%%35%%And Samuel came no more to see Saul until the day of his death: nevertheless Samuel mourned for Saul: and the LORD repented that he had made Saul king over Israel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%1%%And the LORD said to Samuel, How long wilt thou mourn for Saul, seeing I have rejected him from reigning over Israel? fill thy horn with oil, and go, I will send thee to Jesse the Beth-lehemite: for I have provided me a king among his sons.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%2%%And Samuel said, How can I go? if Saul shall hear it, he will kill me. And the LORD said, Take a heifer with thee, and say, I have come to sacrifice to the LORD.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%3%%And call Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show thee what thou shalt do: and thou shalt anoint to me him whom I name to thee.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%4%%And Samuel did that which the LORD spoke, and came to Beth-lehem. And the elders of the town trembled at his coming, and said, Comest thou peaceably?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%5%%And he said, Peaceably: I have come to sacrifice to the LORD: sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice. And he sanctified Jesse and his sons, and called them to the sacrifice.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%6%%And it came to pass when they had come, that he looked on Eliab, and said, Surely the LORD'S anointed is before him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%7%%But the LORD said to Samuel, Look not on his countenance, or on the hight of his stature; because I have refused him: for the LORD seeth not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appearance, but the LORD looketh on the heart.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%8%%Then Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. And he said, Neither hath the LORD chosen this.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%9%%Then Jesse made Shammah to pass by. And he said, Neither hath the LORD chosen this.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%10%%Again, Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. And Samuel said to Jesse, The LORD hath not chosen these.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%11%%And Samuel said to Jesse, Are here all thy children? And he said, There remaineth yet the youngest, and behold, he keepeth the sheep. And Samuel said to Jesse, Send and bring him: for we will not sit down till he hath come hither.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%12%%And he sent, and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, and also of a beautiful countenance, and a good appearance. And the LORD said, Arise, anoint him: for this is he.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%13%%Then Samuel took the horn of oil, and anointed him in the midst of his brethren: and the Spirit of the LORD came upon David from that day forward. So Samuel arose, and went to Ramah.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%14%%But the Spirit of the LORD departed from Saul, and an evil spirit from the LORD troubled him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%15%%And Saul's servants said to him, Behold now, an evil spirit from God troubleth thee.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%16%%Let our lord now command thy servants, who are before thee, to seek a man who is a skillful player on a harp: and it shall come to pass, when the evil spirit from God is upon thee, that he will play with his hand, and thou wilt be well.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%17%%And Saul said to his servants, Provide me now a man that can play well, and bring him to me.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%18%%Then answered one of the servants, and said, Behold, I have seen a son of Jesse the Beth-lehemite, that is skillful in playing, and a mighty valiant man, and a man of war, and prudent in matters, and a comely person, and the LORD is with him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%19%%Wherefore Saul sent messengers to Jesse, and said, Send to me David thy son, who is with the sheep.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%20%%And Jesse took an ass laden with bread, and a bottle of wine, and a kid, and sent them by David his son to Saul.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%21%%And David came to Saul, and stood before him: and he loved him greatly; and he became his armor-bearer.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%22%%And Saul sent to Jesse, saying, Let David, I pray thee, stand before me; for he hath found favor in my sight.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%16%%23%%And it came to pass, when the evil spirit from God was upon Saul, that David took a harp, and played with his hand: so Saul was refreshed, and was well, and the evil spirit departed from him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%1%%Now the Philistines collected their armies to battle, and were assembled at Shochoh, which belongeth to Judah, and encamped between Shochoh and Azekah, in Ephes-dammim.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%2%%And Saul and the men of Israel were assembled and encamped by the valley of Elah, and they set the battle in array against the Philistines.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%3%%And the Philistines stood on a mountain on the one side, and Israel stood on a mountain on the other side: and there was a valley between them.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%4%%And there went out a champion from the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, of Gath, whose hight was six cubits and a span.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%5%%And he had a helmet of brass upon his head, and he was armed with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%6%%And he had greaves of brass upon his legs, and a target of brass between his shoulders.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%7%%And the staff of his spear was like a weaver's beam; and his spear's head weighed six hundred shekels of iron: and one bearing a shield went before him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%8%%And he stood and cried to the armies of Israel, and said to them, Why have ye come out to set your battle in array? am not I a Philistine, and ye servants to Saul? choose you a man for you, and let him come down to me.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%9%%If he shall be able to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be your servants: but if I shall prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%10%%And the Philistine said, I defy the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%11%%When Saul and all Israel heard those words of the Philistine, they were dismayed, and greatly afraid.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%12%%Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Beth-lehem-judah, whose name was Jesse; and he had eight sons: and the man went among men for an old man in the days of Saul.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%13%%And the three eldest sons of Jesse went and followed Saul to the battle: and the names of his three sons that went to the battle were Eliab the first-born, and next to him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%14%%And David was the youngest: and the three eldest followed Saul.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%15%%But David went and returned from Saul to feed his father's sheep at Beth-lehem.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%16%%And the Philistine drew near morning and evening, and presented himself forty days.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%17%%And Jesse said to David his son, Take now for thy brethren an ephah of this parched corn, and these ten loaves, and run to the camp to thy brethren;
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%18%%And carry these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand, and see how thy brethren fare, and take their pledge.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%19%%Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%20%%And David rose early in the morning, and left the sheep with a keeper, and took, and went, as Jesse had commanded him; and he came to the trench, as the host was going forth to the fight, and shouted for the battle.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%21%%For Israel and the Philistines had put the battle in array, army against army.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%22%%And David left his furniture in the hand of the keeper of the vessels, and ran into the army, and came and saluted his brethren.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%23%%And as he talked with them, behold, there came up the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, from the armies of the Philistines, and spoke according to the same words: and David heard them.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%24%%And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him, and were exceedingly afraid.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%25%%And the men of Israel said, Have ye seen this man that hath come up? surely to defy Israel hath he come: and it shall be, that the man who shall kill him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and will give him his daughter, and make his father's house free in Israel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%26%%And David spoke to the men that stood by him, saying, What shall be done to the man that killeth this Philistine, and taketh away the reproach from Israel? for who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%27%%And the people answered him after this manner, saying, So shall it be done to the man that killeth him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%28%%And Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab's anger was kindled against David, and he said, Why camest thou down hither? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know thy pride, and the naughtiness of thy heart; for thou art come down that thou mayest see the battle.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%29%%And David said, What have I now done? Is there not a cause?
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%30%%And he turned from him towards another, and spoke after the same manner: and the people answered him again after the former manner.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%31%%And when the words were heard which David spoke, they rehearsed them before Saul: and he sent for him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%32%%And David said to Saul, Let no man's heart fail because of him; thy servant will go and fight with this Philistine.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%33%%And Saul said to David, Thou art not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him: for thou art but a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%34%%And David said to Saul, Thy servant kept his father's sheep, and there came a lion, and a bear, and took a lamb out of the flock:
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%35%%And I went after him, and smote him, and delivered it out of his mouth: and when he arose against me, I caught him by his beard, and smote him, and slew him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%36%%Thy servant slew both the lion and the bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he hath defied the armies of the living God.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%37%%David said moreover, The LORD that delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. And Saul said to David, Go, and the LORD be with thee.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%38%%And Saul armed David with his armor, and he put a helmet of brass upon his head; also he armed him with a coat of mail.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%39%%And David girded his sword upon his armor, and he essayed to go; for he had not proved it. And David said to Saul, I cannot go with these, for I have not proved them. And David put them off from him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%40%%And he took his staff in his hand, and chose him five smooth stones out of the brook, and put them in a shepherd's bag which he had, even in a scrip; and his sling was in his hand; and he drew near to the Philistine.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%41%%And the Philistine advanced and drew near to David; and the man that bore the shield went before him.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%42%%And when the Philistine looked about, and saw David, he disdained him: for he was a youth, and ruddy, and of a fair countenance.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%43%%And the Philistine said to David, Am I a dog, that thou comest to me with staffs? and the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%44%%And the Philistine said to David, Come to me, and I will give thy flesh to the fowls of the air, and to the beasts of the field.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%45%%Then said David to the Philistine, Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a shield: but I come to thee in the name of the LORD of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom thou hast defied.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%46%%This day will the LORD deliver thee into my hand; and I will smite thee, and take thy head from thee; and I will give the carcasses of the host of the Philistines this day to the fowls of the air, and to the wild beasts of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%47%%And all this assembly shall know that the LORD saveth not with sword and spear: for the battle is the LORD'S, and he will give you into our hands.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%48%%And it came to pass, when the Philistine arose, and came and drew nigh to meet David, that David hasted, and ran towards the army to meet the Philistine.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%49%%And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and hurled it with his sling, and smote the Philistine in his forehead, that the stone sunk into his forehead; and he fell upon his face to the earth.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%50%%So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone, and smote the Philistine, and slew him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%51%%Therefore David ran and stood upon the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of its sheath, and slew him, and cut off his head with it. And when the Philistines saw their champion was dead, they fled.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%52%%And the men of Israel and of Judah arose, and shouted, and pursued the Philistines to the entrance of the valley, and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell down by the way to Shaaraim, even to Gath, and to Ekron.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%53%%And the children of Israel returned from chasing the Philistines, and they plundered their tents.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%54%%And David took the head of the Philistine, and brought it to Jerusalem; but he put his armor in his tent.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%55%%And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said to Abner the captain of the host, Abner, whose son is this youth? And Abner said, As thy soul liveth, O king, I cannot tell.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%56%%And the king said, Inquire thou whose son the stripling is.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%57%%And as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him, and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%17%%58%%And Saul said to him, Whose son art thou, thou young man? And David answered, I am the son of thy servant Jesse the Beth-lehemite.

1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%19%%1%%And Saul spoke to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should kill David.

1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%19%%4%%And Jonathan spoke good of David to Saul his father, and said to him, Let not the king sin against his servant, against David; because he hath not sinned against thee, and because his works have been toward thee very good:
1000005%%1 Samuel%%OT%%19%%5%%For he put his life in his hand, and slew the Philistine, and the LORD wrought a great salvation for all Israel: thou sawest it, and didst rejoice: Why then wilt thou sin against innocent blood, to slay David without a cause?
