And Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, How glorious was the king of Israel to-day, who uncovered himself to-day in the eyes of the handmaids of his servants, as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovereth himself!
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%6%%21%%And David said to Michal, It was before the LORD, who chose me before thy father, and before all his house, to appoint me ruler over the people of the LORD, over Israel: therefore will I play before the LORD.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%6%%22%%And I shall yet be more vile than thus, and shall be base in my own sight: and by the maid-servants which thou hast spoken of, by them shall I be had in honor.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%6%%23%%Therefore Michal the daughter of Saul had no child until the day of her death.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%1%%And it came to pass, when the king sat in his house, and the LORD had given him rest around from all his enemies;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%2%%That the king said to Nathan the prophet, See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of God dwelleth within curtains.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%3%%And Nathan said to the king, Go, do all that is in thy heart: for the LORD is with thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%4%%And it came to pass that night, that the word of the LORD came to Nathan, saying,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%5%%Go and tell my servant David, Thus saith the LORD, Wilt thou build me a house for me to dwell in?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%6%%Whereas I have not dwelt in any house since the time that I brought the children of Israel out of Egypt, even to this day, but have walked in a tent, and in a tabernacle.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%7%%In all the places in which I have walked with all the children of Israel have I spoken a word with any of the tribes of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people Israel, saying, Why do ye not build me a house of cedar?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%8%%Now therefore so shalt thou say to my servant David, thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheep-cote, from following the sheep, to be ruler over my people, over Israel:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%9%%And I was with thee whithersoever thou wentest, and have cut off all thy enemies out of thy sight, and have made thee a great name, like to the name of the great men that are in the earth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%10%%Moreover, I will appoint a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own, and move no more; neither shall the children of wickedness afflict them any more, as formerly.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%11%%And as since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel, and have caused thee to rest from all thy enemies. Also the LORD telleth thee that he will make thee a house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%12%%And when thy days shall be fulfilled, and thou shalt sleep with thy fathers, I will set up thy seed after thee, which shall proceed out of thy bowels, and I will establish his kingdom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%13%%He shall build a house for my name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom for ever.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%14%%I will be his father, and he shall be my son. If he shall commit iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%15%%But my mercy shall not depart from him, as I took it from Saul, whom I put away before thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%16%%And thy house and thy kingdom shall be established for ever before thee: thy throne shall be established for ever.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%17%%According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak to David.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%18%%Then king David went in, and sat before the LORD, and he said, Who am I, O Lord GOD? and what is my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%19%%And this was yet a small thing in thy sight, O Lord GOD; but thou hast spoken also of thy servant's house for a great while to come. And is this the manner of man, O Lord GOD?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%20%%And what can David say more to thee? for thou, Lord GOD, knowest thy servant.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%21%%For thy word's sake, and according to thy own heart, hast thou done all these great things, to make thy servant know them.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%22%%Wherefore thou art great, O LORD God: for there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%23%%And what one nation in the earth is like thy people, even like Israel, whom God went to redeem for a people to himself, and to make him a name, and to do for you great things and terrible, for thy land, before thy people which thou redeemedst to thee from Egypt, from the nations and their gods?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%24%%For thou hast confirmed to thyself thy people Israel to be a people to thee for ever: and thou, LORD, art become their God.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%25%%And now, O LORD God, the word that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant, and concerning his house, establish it for ever, and do as thou hast said.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%26%%And let thy name be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts is the God over Israel: and let the house of thy servant David be established before thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%27%%For thou, O LORD of hosts, God of Israel, hast revealed to thy servant, saying, I will build thee a house: therefore hath thy servant found in his heart to pray this prayer to thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%28%%And now, O Lord GOD, thou art that God, and thy words are true, and thou hast promised this goodness to thy servant:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%7%%29%%Therefore now let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may continue for ever before thee: for thou, O Lord GOD, hast spoken it: and with thy blessing let the house of thy servant be blessed for ever.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%1%%And after this it came to pass, that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them: and David took Metheg-ammah out of the hand of the Philistines.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%2%%And he smote Moab, and measured them with a line, casting them down to the ground; even with two lines he measured to put to death, and with one full line to keep alive. And so the Moabites became David's servants, and brought gifts.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%3%%David smote also Hadadezer, the son of Rehob, king of Zobah, as he went to recover his border at the river Euphrates.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%4%%And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven hundred horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: and David houghed all the chariot-horses, but reserved of them for a hundred chariots.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%5%%And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succor Hadadezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%6%%Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus: and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought gifts. And the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%7%%And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%8%%And from Betah, and from Berothai, cities of Hadadezer, king David took very much brass.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%9%%When Toi king of Hamath heard that David had smitten all the host of Hadadezer,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%10%%Then Toi sent Joram his son to king David, to salute him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer, and smitten him: (for Hadadezer had wars with Toi) and Joram brought with him vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and vessels of brass:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%11%%Which also king David dedicated to the LORD, with the silver and gold that he had dedicated of all nations which he subdued;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%12%%Of Syria, and of Moab, and of the children of Ammon, and of the Philistines, and of Amalek, and of the spoil of Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%13%%And David made him a name when he returned from smiting of the Syrians in the valley of Salt, being eighteen thousand men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%14%%And he put garrisons in Edom; throughout all Edom he put garrisons, and all they of Edom became David's servants. And the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%15%%And David reigned over all Israel; and David executed judgment and justice to all his people.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%16%%And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%17%%And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, were the priests: and Seraiah was the scribe;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%8%%18%%And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over both the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and David's sons were chief rulers.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%1%%And David said, Is there yet any that is left of the house of Saul, that I may show him kindness for Jonathan's sake?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%2%%And there was of the house of Saul a servant whose name was Ziba. And when they had called him to David, the king said to him, Art thou Ziba? And he said, Thy servant is he.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%3%%And the king said, Is there not yet any of the house of Saul, that I may show the kindness of God to him? and Ziba said to the king, Jonathan hath yet a son, who is lame in his feet.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%4%%And the king said to him, Where is he? And Ziba said to the king, Behold, he is in the house of Machir, the son of Ammiel, in Lo-debar.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%5%%Then king David sent, and brought him from the house of Machir, the son of Ammiel, from Lo-debar.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%6%%Now when Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, had come to David, he fell on his face, and did reverence. And David said, Mephibosheth. And he answered, Behold thy servant!
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%7%%And David said to him, Fear not: for I will surely show thee kindness for the sake of Jonathan thy father, and will restore thee all the land of Saul thy father; and thou shalt eat bread at my table continually.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%8%%And he bowed himself, and said, What is thy servant, that thou shouldst look upon such a dead dog as I am?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%9%%Then the king called to Ziba, Saul's servant, and said to him, I have given to thy master's son all that pertained to Saul, and to all his house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%10%%Thou therefore, and thy sons, and thy servants, shall till the land for him, and thou shalt bring in the fruits, that thy master's son may have food to eat: but Mephibosheth thy master's son shall eat bread always at my table. Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%11%%Then said Ziba to the king, According to all that my lord the king hath commanded his servant, so shall thy servant do. As for Mephibosheth, said the king, he shall eat at my table, as one of the king's sons.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%12%%And Mephibosheth had a young son, whose name was Micah. And all that dwelt in the house of Ziba were servants to Mephibosheth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%9%%13%%So Mephibosheth dwelt in Jerusalem: for he ate continually at the king's table; and was lame in both his feet.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%1%%And it came to pass after this, that the king of the children of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%2%%Then said David, I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, as his father showed kindness to me. And David sent to comfort him by the hand of his servants for his father. And David's servants came into the land of the children of Ammon.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%3%%And the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun their lord, Thinkest thou that David doth honor thy father, that he hath sent comforters to thee? hath not David rather sent his servants to thee, to search the city, and to spy it out, and to overthrow it?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%4%%Wherefore Hanun took David's servants, and shaved off the one half of their beards, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, and sent them away.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%5%%When they told it to David, he sent to meet them, because the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards are grown, and then return.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%6%%And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious before David, the children of Ammon sent and hired the Syrians of Beth-rehob, and the Syrians of Zoba, twenty thousand footmen, and of king Maacah a thousand men, and of Ish-tob twelve thousand men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%7%%And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%8%%And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the entrance of the gate: and the Syrians of Zoba, and of Rehob, and Ish-tob, and Maacah, were by themselves in the field.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%9%%When Joab saw that the front of the battle was against him before and behind, he selected of all the choice men of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%10%%And the rest of the people he delivered into the hand of Abishai his brother, that he might put them in array against the children of Ammon.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%11%%And he said, If the Syrians shall be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon shall be too strong for thee, then I will come and help thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%12%%Be of good courage, and let us play the men for our people, and for the cities of our God: and the LORD do that which seemeth him good.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%13%%And Joab and the people that were with him drew near to the battle against the Syrians: and they fled before him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%14%%And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, then fled they also before Abishai, and entered into the city. So Joab returned from the children of Ammon, and came to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%15%%And when the Syrians saw that they were smitten before Israel, they assembled themselves.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%16%%And Hadarezer sent, and brought out the Syrians that were beyond the river: and they came to Helam; and Shobach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%17%%And when it was told David, he assembled all Israel, and passed over Jordan, and came to Helam. And the Syrians set themselves in array against David, and fought with him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%18%%And the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew the men of seven hundred chariots of the Syrians, and forty thousand horsemen, and smote Shobach the captain of their host, who died there.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%10%%19%%And when all the kings that were servants to Hadarezer saw that they were smitten before Israel, they made peace with Israel, and served them. So the Syrians feared to help the children of Ammon any more.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%1%%And it came to pass, after the year had expired, at the time when kings go forth to battle, that David sent Joab, and his servants with him, and all Israel; and they destroyed the children of Ammon, and destroyed Rabbah. But David tarried still at Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%2%%And it came to pass in an evening, that David arose from off his bed, and walked upon the roof of the king's house: and from the roof he saw a woman washing herself; and the woman was very beautiful to look upon.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%3%%And David sent and inquired after the woman. And one said, Is not this Bath-sheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%4%%And David sent messengers, and took her; and she came in to him, and he lay with her; for she was purified from her uncleanness: and she returned to her house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%5%%And the woman conceived, and sent and told David, and said, I am with child.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%6%%And David sent to Joab, saying, Send me Uriah the Hittite. And Joab sent Uriah to David.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%7%%And when Uriah had come to him, David inquired of him how Joab did, and how the people did, and how the war prospered.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%8%%And David said to Uriah, Go down to thy house, and wash thy feet. And Uriah departed out of the king's house, and there followed him a mess of meat from the king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%9%%But Uriah slept at the door of the king's house with all the servants of his lord, and went not down to his house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%10%%And when they had told David, saying, Uriah went not down to his house, David said to Uriah, Camest thou not from thy journey? why then didst thou not go down to thy house?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%11%%And Uriah said to David, The ark, and Israel, and Judah, abide in tents; and my lord Joab, and the servants of my lord are encamped in the open fields; shall I then go into my house, to eat and to drink, and to lie with my wife? as thou livest, and as thy soul liveth, I will not do this thing.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%12%%And David said to Uriah, Tarry here to-day also, and to-morrow I will let thee depart. So Uriah abode in Jerusalem that day and the morrow.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%13%%And when David had called him, he ate and drank before him; and he made him drunk: and at evening he went out to lie on his bed with the servants of his lord, but went not down to his house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%14%%And it came to pass in the morning, that David wrote a letter to Joab, and sent it by the hand of Uriah.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%15%%And he wrote in the letter, saying, Set ye Uriah in the front of the hottest battle, and retire ye from him, that he may be smitten, and die.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%16%%And it came to pass, when Joab observed the city, that he assigned Uriah to a place where he knew that valiant men were.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%17%%And the men of the city went out, and fought with Joab: and there fell some of the people of the servants of David; and Uriah the Hittite died also.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%18%%Then Joab sent and told David all the things concerning the war;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%19%%And charged the messenger, saying, When thou hast made an end of telling the matters of the war to the king,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%20%%And if the king's wrath shall rise, and he shall say to thee, Why approached ye so nigh to the city for the fight? knew ye not that they would shoot from the wall?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%21%%Who smote Abimelech the son of Jerubbesheth? did not a woman cast a piece of a millstone upon him from the wall, that he died in Thebez? why went ye nigh the wall? then say thou, Thy servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%22%%So the messenger went, and came and showed David all that Joab had sent him for.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%23%%And the messenger said to David, Surely the men prevailed against us, and came out to us into the field, and we were upon them even to the entrance of the gate.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%24%%And the shooters shot from off the wall upon thy servants: and some of the king's servants are dead, and thy servant Uriah the Hittite is dead also.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%25%%Then David said to the messenger, Thus shalt thou say to Joab, Let not this thing displease thee, for the sword devoureth one as well as another: make thy battle more strong against the city, and overthrow it: and encourage thou him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%26%%And when the wife of Uriah heard that Uriah her husband was dead, she mourned for her husband.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%11%%27%%And when the mourning was past, David sent and brought her to his house, and she became his wife, and bore him a son. But the thing that David had done displeased the LORD.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%1%%And the LORD sent Nathan to David. And he came to him, and said to him, There were two men in one city; the one rich, and the other poor.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%2%%The rich man had very numerous flocks and herds:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%3%%But the poor man had nothing save one little ewe-lamb, which he had bought and nourished: and it grew up together with him, and with his children: it fed of his own meat, and drank of his own cup, and lay in his bosom, and was to him as a daughter.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%4%%And there came a traveler to the rich man, and he spared to take of his own flock and of his own herd, to dress for the way-faring man that had come to him; but took the poor man's lamb, and dressed it for the man that had come to him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%5%%And David's anger was greatly kindled against the man; and he said to Nathan, As the LORD liveth, the man that hath done this thing shall surely die:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%6%%And he shall restore the lamb four-fold, because he did this thing, and because he had no pity.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%7%%And Nathan said to David, Thou art the man. Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, I anointed thee king over Israel, and I delivered thee from the hand of Saul;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%8%%And I gave thee thy master's house, and thy master's wives into thy bosom, and gave thee the house of Israel and of Judah; and if that had been too little, I would moreover have given to thee such and such things.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%9%%Why hast thou despised the commandment of the LORD, to do evil in his sight? thou hast killed Uriah the Hittite with the sword, and hast taken his wife to be thy wife, and hast slain him with the sword of the children of Ammon.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%10%%Now therefore the sword shall never depart from thy house; because thou hast despised me, and hast taken the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be thy wife.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%11%%Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will raise up evil against thee out of thy own house, and I will take thy wives before thy eyes, and give them to thy neighbor, and he shall lie with thy wives in the sight of this sun.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%12%%For thou didst it secretly: but I will do this thing before all Israel, and before the sun.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%13%%And David said to Nathan, I have sinned against the LORD. And Nathan said to David, The LORD also hath put away thy sin; thou shalt not die.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%14%%But, because by this deed thou hast given great occasion to the enemies of the LORD to blaspheme, the child also that is born to thee shall surely die.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%15%%And Nathan departed to his house. And the LORD struck the child that Uriah's wife bore to David, and it was very sick.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%16%%David therefore besought God for the child; and David fasted, and went in, and lay all night upon the earth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%17%%And the elders of his house arose, and went to him, to raise him from the earth: but he would not, neither did he eat bread with them.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%18%%And it came to pass on the seventh day, that the child died. And the servants of David feared to tell him that the child was dead: for they said, Behold while the child was yet alive, we spoke to him, and he would not hearken to our voice: how will he then be grieved, if we tell him that the child is dead?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%19%%But when David saw that his servants whispered, David perceived that the child was dead: therefore David said to his servants, Is the child dead? And they said, He is dead.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%20%%Then David arose from the earth, and washed, and anointed himself, and changed his apparel, and came into the house of the LORD, and worshiped: then he came to his own house; and when he required, they set bread before him, and he ate.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%21%%Then said his servants to him, What thing is this that thou hast done? thou didst fast and weep for the child, while it was alive; but after the child was dead, thou didst rise and eat bread.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%22%%And he said, While the child was yet alive, I fasted, and wept: for I said, Who can tell whether GOD will be gracious to me, that the child may live?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%23%%But now he is dead, Why should I fast? can I bring him back again? I shall go to him, but he will not return to me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%24%%And David comforted Bath-sheba his wife, and went in to her, and lay with her: and she bore a son, and he called his name Solomon: and the LORD loved him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%25%%And he sent by the hand of Nathan the prophet; and he called his name Jedidiah, because of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%26%%And Joab fought against Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and took the royal city.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%27%%And Joab sent messengers to David, and said, I have fought against Rabbah, and have taken the city of waters.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%28%%Now therefore collect the rest of the people, and encamp against the city, and take it: lest I take the city, and it be called after my name.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%29%%And David collected all the people, and went to Rabbah, and fought against it, and took it.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%30%%And he took their king's crown from off his head, the weight of which was a talent of gold with the precious stones: and it was set on David's head. And he brought forth the spoil of the city in great abundance.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%12%%31%%And he brought forth the people that were in it, and put them under saws, and under harrows of iron, and under axes of iron, and made them pass through the brick-kiln: and thus he did to all the cities of the children of Ammon. So David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%1%%And it came to pass after this, that Absalom the son of David had a fair sister, whose name was Tamar; and Amnon the son of David loved her.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%2%%And Amnon was so afflicted, that he fell sick for his sister Tamar; for she was a virgin; and Amnon thought it hard for him to do any thing to her.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%3%%But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David's brother: and Jonadab was a very subtil man.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%4%%And he said to him, Why art thou, being the king's son, pining from day to day? wilt thou not tell me? And Amnon said to him, I love Tamar, my brother Absalom's sister.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%5%%And Jonadab said to him, Lay thee down on thy bed, and make thyself sick: and when thy father cometh to see thee, say to him, I pray thee, let my sister Tamar come, and give me food, and dress the food in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it at her hand.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%6%%So Amnon lay down and made himself sick: and when the king came to see him, Amnon said to the king, I pray thee, let Tamar my sister come, and make for me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may eat at her hand.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%7%%Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to thy brother Amnon's house, and dress meat for him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%8%%So Tamar went to her brother Amnon's house; and he was laid down. And she took flour, and kneaded it, and made cakes in his sight, and baked the cakes.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%9%%And she took a pan, and poured them out before him; but he refused to eat. And Amnon said, Have out all men from me. And they went out every man from him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%10%%And Amnon said to Tamar, Bring the food into the chamber, that I may eat from thy hand. And Tamar took the cakes which she had made, and brought them into the chamber to Amnon her brother.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%11%%And when she had brought them to him to eat, he took hold of her, and said to her, Come, lie with me, my sister.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%12%%And she answered him, Nay, my brother, do not force me; for no such thing ought to be done in Israel: do not thou this folly.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%13%%And I, whither shall I cause my shame to go? and as for thee, thou wilt be as one of the fools in Israel. Now therefore, I pray thee, speak to the king; for he will not withhold me from thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%14%%Howbeit, he would not hearken to her voice: but being stronger than she, forced her, and lay with her.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%15%%Then Amnon hated her exceedingly; so that the hatred with which he hated her was greater than the love with which he had loved her. And Amnon said to her, Arise, be gone.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%16%%And she said to him, There is no cause: this evil in sending me away is greater than the other that thou didst to me. But he would not hearken to her.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%17%%Then he called his servant that ministered to him, and said, Put now this woman out from me, and bolt the door after her.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%18%%And she had a garment of divers colors upon her: for with such robes were the king's daughters that were virgins appareled. Then his servant brought her out, and bolted the door after her.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%19%%And Tamar put ashes on her head, and rent her garment of divers colors that was on her, and laid her hand on her head, and went on crying.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%20%%And Absalom her brother said to her, Hath Amnon thy brother been with thee? but hold now thy peace, my sister: he is thy brother; regard not this thing. So Tamar remained desolate in her brother Absalom's house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%21%%But when king David heard of all these things, he was very wroth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%22%%And Absalom spoke to his brother Amnon neither good nor bad: for Absalom hated Amnon, because he had forced his sister Tamar.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%23%%And it came to pass after two full years, that Absalom had sheep-shearers in Baal-hazor, which is beside Ephraim: and Absalom invited all the king's sons.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%24%%And Absalom came to the king, and said, Behold now, thy servant hath sheep-shearers; let the king, I beseech thee, and his servants go with thy servant.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%25%%And the king said to Absalom, Nay, my son, let us not all now go, lest we be chargeable to thee. And he pressed him: yet he would not go, but blessed him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%26%%Then said Absalom, If not, I pray thee, let my brother Amnon go with us. And the king said to him, Why should he go with thee?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%27%%But Absalom pressed him that he should let Amnon and all the king's sons go with him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%28%%Now Absalom had commanded his servants, saying, Mark ye now when Amnon's heart is merry with wine, and when I say to you, Smite Amnon; then kill him, fear not: have I not commanded you? be courageous, and be valiant.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%29%%And the servants of Absalom did to Amnon as Absalom had commanded. Then all the king's sons arose, and every man rode upon his mule, and fled.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%30%%And it came to pass, while they were in the way, that information came to David, saying, Absalom hath slain all the king's sons, and there is not one of them left.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%31%%Then the king arose, and tore his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes rent.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%32%%And Jonadab, the son of Shimeah David's brother, answered and said, Let not my lord suppose that they have slain all the young men the king's sons; for Amnon only is dead: for by the appointment of Absalom this hath been determined from the day that he forced his sister Tamar.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%33%%Now therefore let not my lord the king take the thing to his heart, to think that all the king's sons are dead: for Amnon only is dead.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%34%%But Absalom fled. And the young man that kept the watch lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold, there came many people by the way of the hillside behind him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%35%%And Jonadab said to the king, Behold, the king's sons come; as thy servant said, so it is.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%36%%And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of speaking, that behold, the king's sons came, and lifted up their voice and wept: and the king also and all his servants wept exceedingly.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%37%%But Absalom fled, and went to Talmai, the son of Ammihud, king of Geshur. And David mourned for his son every day.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%38%%So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%13%%39%%And the soul of king David longed to go forth to Absalom: for he was comforted concerning Amnon, seeing he was dead.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%1%%Now Joab the son of Zeruiah perceived that the king's heart was towards Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%2%%And Joab sent to Tekoah, and brought thence a wise woman, and said to her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner, and put on now mourning apparel, and anoint not thyself with oil, but be as a woman that had a long time mourned for the dead:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%3%%And come to the king, and speak in this manner to him. So Joab put the words in her mouth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%4%%And when the woman of Tekoah spoke to the king, she fell on her face to the ground, and did obeisance, and said, Help, O king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%5%%And the king said to her, What aileth thee? And she answered, I am indeed a widow woman, and my husband is dead.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%6%%And thy handmaid had two sons, and they two strove together in the field, and there was none to part them, but the one smote the other and slew him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%7%%And behold, the whole family hath risen against thy handmaid, and they said, Deliver him that smote his brother, that we may kill him, for the life of his brother whom he slew; and we will destroy the heir also: and so they will quench my coal which is left, and will not leave to my husband neither name nor remainder upon the earth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%8%%And the king said to the woman, Go to thy house, and I will give charge concerning thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%9%%And the woman of Tekoah said to the king, My lord, O king, the iniquity be on me, and on my father's house: and the king and his throne be guiltless.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%10%%And the king said, Whoever saith aught to thee, bring him to me, and he shall not touch thee any more.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%11%%Then said she, I pray thee, let the king remember the LORD thy God, that thou wouldest not suffer the revengers of blood to destroy any more, lest they destroy my son. And he said, As the LORD liveth, there shall not one hair of thy son fall to the earth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%12%%Then the woman said, Let thy handmaid, I pray thee, speak one word to my lord the king. And he said, Say on.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%13%%And the woman said, Why then hast thou thought such a thing against the people of God? for the king doth speak this thing as one who is faulty, in that the king doth not bring home again his banished.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%14%%For we must needs die, and are as water spilt on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again; neither doth God respect any person: yet doth he devise means, that his banished be not expelled from him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%15%%Now therefore that I have come to speak of this thing to my lord the king, it is because the people have made me afraid: and thy handmaid said, I will now speak to the king; it may be that the king will perform the request of his handmaid.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%16%%For the king will hear, to deliver his handmaid from the hand of the man that would destroy me and my son together out of the inheritance of God.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%17%%Then thy handmaid said, The word of my lord the king, will now be comfortable: for as an angel of God, so is my lord the king to discern good and bad: therefore the LORD thy God will be with thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%18%%Then the king answered and said to the woman, Hide not from me, I pray thee, the thing that I shall ask thee. And the woman said, Let my lord the king now speak.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%19%%And the king said, Is not the hand of Joab with thee in all this? And the woman answered and said, As thy soul liveth, my lord the king, none can turn to the right hand or to the left from aught that my lord the king hath spoken: for thy servant Joab, he bade me, and he put all these words in the mouth of thy handmaid:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%20%%To bring about this form of speech hath thy servant Joab done this thing: and my lord is wise, according to the wisdom of an angel of God, to know all things that are on the earth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%21%%And the king said to Joab, Behold now, I have done this thing: go therefore, bring the young man Absalom again.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%22%%And Joab fell to the ground on his face, and bowed himself, and thanked the king: and Joab said, To-day thy servant knoweth that I have found grace in thy sight, my lord, O king, in that the king hath fulfilled the request of his servant.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%23%%So Joab arose and went to Geshur, and brought Absalom to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%24%%And the king said, Let him turn to his own house, and let him not see my face. So Absalom returned to his own house, and saw not the king's face.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%25%%But in all Israel there was none to be so much praised as Absalom for his beauty: from the sole of his foot even to the crown of his head there was no blemish in him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%26%%And when he polled his head, (for it was at every year's end that he polled it: because the hair was heavy on him, therefore he polled it:) he weighed the hair of his head at two hundred shekels after the king's weight.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%27%%And to Absalom there were born three sons, and one daughter, whose name was Tamar: she was a woman of a fair countenance.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%28%%So Absalom dwelt two full years in Jerusalem, and saw not the king's face.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%29%%Therefore Absalom sent for Joab, that he might send him to the king; but he would not come to him: and when he sent again the second time, he would not come.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%30%%Therefore he said to his servants, See, Joab's field is near mine, and he hath barley there; go and set it on fire. And Absalom's servants set the field on fire.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%31%%Then Joab arose, and came to Absalom, to his house, and said to him, Why have thy servants set my field on fire?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%32%%And Absalom answered Joab, Behold, I sent to thee, saying, Come hither, that I may send thee to the king, to say, Why am I come from Geshur? it had been good for me had I been there still: now therefore let me see the king's face; and if there is any iniquity in me, let him kill me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%14%%33%%So Joab came to the king, and told him: and when he had called for Absalom, he came to the king, and bowed himself on his face to the ground before the king: and the king kissed Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%1%%And it came to pass after this, that Absalom prepared him chariots and horses, and fifty men to run before him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%2%%And Absalom rose early, and stood beside the way of the gate: and it was so, that when any man that had a controversy came to the king for judgment, then Absalom called to him, and said, Of what city art thou? And he said, Thy servant is one of the tribes of Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%3%%And Absalom said to him, See, thy matters are good and right; but there is no man deputed by the king to hear thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%4%%Absalom said moreover, Oh that I were made judge in the land, that every man who hath any suit or cause might come to me, and I would do him justice!
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%5%%And it was so, that when any man came nigh to him to do him obeisance, he put forth his hand, and took him, and kissed him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%6%%And in this manner did Absalom to all Israel that came to the king for judgment: so Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%7%%And it came to pass after forty years, that Absalom said to the king, I pray thee, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vowed to the LORD, in Hebron.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%8%%For thy servant vowed a vow while I abode at Geshur in Syria, saying, If the LORD shall bring me again indeed to Jerusalem, then I will serve the LORD.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%9%%And the king said to him, Go in peace, So he arose, and went to Hebron.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%10%%But Absalom sent spies throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, As soon as ye hear the sound of the trumpet, then ye shall say, Absalom reigneth in Hebron.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%11%%And with Absalom went two hundred men from Jerusalem, that were called; and they went in their simplicity, and they knew not any thing.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%12%%And Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David's counselor, from his city, even from Giloh, while he offered sacrifices. And the conspiracy was strong; for the people increased continually with Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%13%%And there came a messenger to David, saying, The hearts of the men of Israel are after Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%14%%And David said to all his servants that were with him at Jerusalem, Arise, and let us flee; for we shall not else escape from Absalom: make speed to depart, lest he should overtake us suddenly, and bring evil upon us, and smite the city with the edge of the sword.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%15%%And the king's servants said to the king, Behold, thy servants are ready to do whatever my lord the king shall appoint.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%16%%And the king went forth, and all his household after him. And the king left ten women who were concubines to keep the house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%17%%And the king went forth, and all the people after him, and tarried in a place that was far off.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%18%%And all his servants passed on by his side; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, six hundred men who came after him from Gath, passed on before the king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%19%%Then said the king to Ittai the Gittite, Why goest thou also with us? return to thy place, and abide with the king; for thou art a stranger, and also an exile.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%20%%Whereas thou camest but yesterday, should I this day make thee go up and down with us? seeing I go whither I may; return thou, and take back thy brethren: mercy and truth be with thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%21%%And Ittai answered the king, and said, As the LORD liveth, and as my lord the king liveth, surely in what place my lord the king shall be, whether in death or life, even there also will thy servant be.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%22%%And David said to Ittai, Go and pass over. And Ittai the Gittite passed over, and all his men, and all the little ones that were with him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%23%%And all the country wept with a loud voice, and all the people passed over: the king also himself passed over the brook Kidron, and all the people passed over, towards the way of the wilderness.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%24%%And lo, Zadok also, and all the Levites were with him bearing the ark of the covenant of God: and they set down the ark of God; and Abiathar went up, until all the people had done passing out of the city.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%25%%And the king said to Zadok, Carry back the ark of God into the city: if I shall find favor in the eyes of the LORD, he will bring me again, and show me both it, and his habitation:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%26%%But if he shall thus say, I have no delight in thee; behold, here am I, let him do to me as seemeth good to him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%27%%The king said also to Zadok the priest, Art not thou a seer? return into the city in peace, and your two sons with you, Ahimaaz thy son, and Jonathan the son of Abiathar.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%28%%See, I will tarry in the plain of the wilderness, until word shall come from you to certify me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%29%%Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God again to Jerusalem: and they tarried there.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%30%%And David went up by the ascent of mount Olivet, and wept as he went, and had his head covered, and he went barefoot: and all the people that were with him covered every man his head, and they went up, weeping as they went.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%31%%And one told David, saying, Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom. And David said, O LORD, I pray thee, turn the counsel of Ahithophel into foolishness.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%32%%And it came to pass, that when David had come to the top of the mount, where he worshiped God, behold, Hushai the Archite came to meet him with his coat rent, and earth upon his head;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%33%%To whom David said, If thou shalt pass on with me, then thou wilt be a burden to me:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%34%%But if thou shalt return to the city, and say to Absalom, I will be thy servant, O king; as I have been thy father's servant hitherto, so will I now also be thy servant: then mayest thou for me defeat the counsel of Ahithophel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%35%%And hast thou not there with thee Zadok and Abiathar the priests? therefore it shall be, that whatever thing thou shalt hear out of the king's house, thou shalt tell it to Zadok and Abiathar the priests.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%36%%Behold, they have there with them their two sons, Ahimaaz Zadok's son, and Jonathan Abiathar's son; and by them ye shall send to me every thing that ye can hear.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%15%%37%%So Hushai David's friend came into the city, and Absalom came into Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%1%%And when David was a little past the top of the hill, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him, with a couple of asses saddled, and upon them two hundred loaves of bread, and a hundred bunches of raisins, and a hundred of summer fruits, and a bottle of wine.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%2%%And the king said to Ziba, What meanest thou by these? And Ziba said, The asses are for the king's household to ride on; and the bread and summer fruit for the young men to eat; and the wine, that such as are faint in the wilderness may drink.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%3%%And the king said, And where is thy master's son? And Ziba said to the king, Behold, he abideth at Jerusalem: for he said, To-day shall the house of Israel restore to me the kingdom of my father.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%4%%Then said the king to Ziba, Behold, thine are all that pertained to Mephibosheth. And Ziba said, I humbly beseech thee that I may find grace in thy sight, my lord, O king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%5%%And when king David came to Bahurim, behold, thence came out a man of the family of the house of Saul, whose name was Shimei, the son of Gera: he came forth, and cursed still as he came.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%6%%And he cast stones at David, and at all the servants of king David: and all the people and all the mighty men were on his right hand and on his left.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%7%%And thus said Shimei when he cursed, Come out, come out, thou bloody man, and thou man of Belial:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%8%%The LORD hath returned upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul, in whose stead thou hast reigned; and the LORD hath delivered the kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy son: and behold, thou art taken in thy mischief, because thou art a bloody man.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%9%%Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah to the king, Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? let me go over, I pray thee, and take off his head.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%10%%And the king said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah? so let him curse, because the LORD hath said to him, Curse David. Who shall then say, Why hast thou done so?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%11%%And David said to Abishai, and to all his servants, Behold, my son, who came forth from my bowels, seeketh my life: how much more now may this Benjaminite do it? let him alone, and let him curse; for the LORD hath bidden him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%12%%It may be that the LORD will look on my affliction, and that the LORD will requite me good for his cursing this day.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%13%%And as David and his men went by the way, Shimei went along on the hill's side over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones at him, and cast dust.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%14%%And the king, and all the people that were with him, came weary, and refreshed themselves there.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%15%%And Absalom, and all the people the men of Israel, came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel with him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%16%%And it came to pass, when Hushai the Archite, David's friend, had come to Absalom, that Hushai said to Absalom, God save the king, God save the king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%17%%And Absalom said to Hushai, Is this thy kindness to thy friend? why wentest thou not with thy friend?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%18%%And Hushai said to Absalom, Nay; but whom the LORD, and this people, and all the men of Israel choose, his will I be, and with him will I abide.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%19%%And again, whom should I serve? should I not serve in the presence of his son? as I have served in thy father's presence, so will I be in thy presence.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%20%%Then said Absalom to Ahithophel, Give counsel among you what we shall do.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%21%%And Ahithophel said to Absalom, Go in to thy father's concubines, which he hath left to keep the house; and all Israel shall hear that thou art abhorred by thy father: then shall the hands of all that are with thee be strong.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%22%%So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and Absalom went in to his father's concubines in the sight of all Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%16%%23%%And the counsel of Ahithophel, which he counseled in those days, was as if a man had inquired at the oracle of God: so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%1%%Moreover Ahithophel said to Absalom, Let me now choose out twelve thousand men, and I will arise and pursue after David this night;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%2%%And I will come upon him while he is weary and weak-handed, and will make him afraid: and all the people that are with him shall flee; and I will smite the king only:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%3%%And I will bring back all the people to thee: the man whom thou seekest is as if all returned: so all the people shall be in peace.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%4%%And the saying, pleased Absalom well, and all the elders of Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%5%%Then said Absalom, Call now Hushai the Archite also, and let us hear likewise what he saith.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%6%%And when Hushai had come to Absalom, Absalom spoke to him, saying, Ahithophel hath spoken after this manner: shall we do after his saying? if not, speak thou.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%7%%And Hushai said to Absalom, The counsel that Ahithophel hath given, is not good at this time.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%8%%For, said Hushai, thou knowest thy father and his men, that they are mighty men, and they are chafed in their minds, as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field: and thy father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%9%%Behold, he is hid now in some pit, or in some other place: and it will come to pass, when some of them are overthrown at the first, that whosoever heareth it will say, There is a slaughter among the people that follow Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%10%%And he also that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, will utterly melt: for all Israel knoweth that thy father is a mighty man, and they who are with him are valiant men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%11%%Therefore I counsel that all Israel should be generally gathered to thee, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that thou shouldst go to battle in thy own person.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%12%%So shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found, and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground: and of him and of all the men that are with him there shall not be left so much as one.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%13%%Moreover, if he shall have entered into a city, then shall all Israel bring ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the river, until there is not one small stone found there.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%14%%And Absalom and all the men of Israel said, The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel. For the LORD had appointed to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that the LORD might bring evil upon Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%15%%Then said Hushai to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, Thus and thus did Ahithophel counsel Absalom and the elders of Israel; and thus and thus have I counseled.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%16%%Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying, Lodge not this night in the plains of the wilderness, but speedily pass over; lest the king be swallowed up, and all the people that are with him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%17%%Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz stayed by En-rogel; for they might not be seen to come into the city: and a maid servant went and told them; and they went and told king David.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%18%%Nevertheless, a lad saw them, and told Absalom: but they went both of them away quickly, and came to the house of a man in Bahurim, who had a well in his court; into which they descended.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%19%%And the woman took and spread a covering over the well's mouth, and spread ground corn upon it; and the thing was not known.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%20%%And when Absalom's servants came to the woman to the house, they said, Where is Ahimaaz and Jonathan? And the woman said to them, they have gone over the brook of water. And when they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%21%%And it came to pass, after they had departed, that they came out of the well, and went and told king David, and said to David, Arise, and pass quickly over the water: for thus hath Ahithophel counseled against you.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%22%%Then David arose, and all the people that were with him, and they passed over Jordan: by the morning light there lacked not one of them that had not gone over Jordan.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%23%%And when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his ass, and arose, and went home to his house, to his city, and put his household in order, and hanged himself, and died. and was buried in the sepulcher of his father.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%24%%Then David came to Mahanaim. And Absalom passed over Jordan, he and all the men of Israel with him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%25%%And Absalom made Amasa captain of the host instead of Joab: which Amasa was a man's son, whose name was Ithra, an Israelite, that went in to Abigail the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah, Joab's mother.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%26%%So Israel and Absalom encamped in the land of Gilead.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%27%%And it came to pass, when David had come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%28%%Brought beds, and basins, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and flour, and parched corn, and beans, and lentils, and parched pulse,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%17%%29%%And honey, and butter, and sheep, and cheese of cows, for David, and for the people that were with him, to eat: for they said, The people are hungry, and weary, and thirsty, in the wilderness.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%1%%And David numbered the people that were with him, and set over them captains of thousands and captains of hundreds.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%2%%And David sent forth a third part of the people under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the king said to the people, I will surely go forth with you myself also.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%3%%But the people answered, Thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they care for us: but now thou art worth ten thousand of us: therefore now it is better that thou shouldst succor us out of the city.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%4%%And the king said to them, What seemeth to you best I will do. And the king stood by the gate side, and all the people came out by hundreds and by thousands.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%5%%And the king commanded Joab and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Deal gently for my sake with the young man, even with Absalom. And all the people heard when the king gave all the captains charge concerning Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%6%%So the people went out into the field against Israel: and the battle was in the wood of Ephraim;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%7%%Where the people of Israel were slain before the servants of David, and there was there a great slaughter that day of twenty thousand men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%8%%For the battle was there scattered over the face of all the country: and the wood devoured more people that day than the sword devoured.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%9%%And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was suspended between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went away.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%10%%And a certain man saw it, and told Joab, and said, Behold, I saw Absalom hanging in an oak.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%11%%And Joab said to the man that told him, And behold, thou sawest him, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have given thee ten shekels of silver, and a girdle.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%12%%And the man said to Joab, Though I should receive a thousand shekels of silver in my hand, yet would I not put forth my hand against the king's son: for in our hearing the king charged thee and Abishai and Ittai, saying, Beware that none touch the young man Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%13%%Otherwise I should have wrought falsehood against my own life: for there is no matter hid from the king, and thou thyself wouldst have set thyself against me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%14%%Then said Joab, I may not tarry thus with thee. And he took three darts in his hand, and thrust them through the heart of Absalom, while he was yet alive in the midst of the oak.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%15%%And ten young men that bore Joab's armor compassed about and smote Absalom, and slew him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%16%%And Joab blew the trumpet, and the people returned from pursuing Israel: for Joab restrained the people.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%17%%And they took Absalom, and cast him into a great pit in the wood, and laid a very great heap of stones upon him: and all Israel fled every one to his tent.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%18%%Now Absalom in his life-time had taken and raised for himself a pillar, which is in the king's dale: for he said, I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name: and it is called to this day, Absalom's place.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%19%%Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok, Let me now run, and inform the king, how the LORD hath avenged himself of his enemies.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%20%%And Joab said to him, Thou shalt not bear tidings this day, but thou shalt bear tidings another day: but this day thou shalt bear no tidings, because the king's son is dead.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%21%%Then said Joab to Cushi, Go, tell the king what thou hast seen. And Cushi bowed himself to Joab, and ran.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%22%%Then said Ahimaaz the son of Zadok yet again to Joab, But however, let me also, I pray thee, run after Cushi. And Joab said, Why wilt thou run, my son, seeing that thou hast no tidings ready?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%23%%But however, said he, let me run. And he said to him, Run. Then Ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and outran Cushi.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%24%%And David sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof over the gate to the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%25%%And the watchman called, and told the king. And the king said, If he is alone there is tidings in his mouth. And he came apace, and drew near.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%26%%And the watchman saw another man running: and the watchman called to the porter, and said, Behold another man running alone. And the king said, He also bringeth tidings.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%27%%And the watchman said, I think the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and cometh with good news.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%28%%And Ahimaaz called, and said to the king, All is well. And he fell down to the earth upon his face before the king, and said, Blessed be the LORD thy God, who hath delivered up the men that raised their hand against my lord the king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%29%%And the king said, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king's servant, and me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what it was.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%30%%And the king said to him, Turn aside, and stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%31%%And behold, Cushi came; and Cushi said, Tidings, my lord the king: for the LORD hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%32%%And the king said to Cushi, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Cushi answered, May the enemies of my lord the king, and all that rise against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%18%%33%%And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! O that I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%1%%And it was told to Joab, Behold, the king weepeth and mourneth for Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%2%%And the victory that day was turned into mourning to all the people: for the people heard it said that day how the king was grieved for his son.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%3%%And the people withdrew by stealth that day into the city, as people being ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%4%%But the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice, O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son!
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%5%%And Joab came into the house to the king, and said, thou hast shamed this day the faces of all thy servants, who this day have saved thy life, and the lives of thy sons and of thy daughters, and the lives of thy wives, and the lives of thy concubines;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%6%%In that thou lovest thy enemies, and hatest thy friends. For thou hast declared this day, that thou regardest neither princes nor servants: for this day I perceive, that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died this day, then it had pleased thee well.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%7%%Now therefore arise, go forth, and speak comfortably to thy servants: for I swear by the LORD, if thou shalt not go forth, there will not tarry one with thee this night: and that will be worse to thee than all the evil that hath befallen thee from thy youth until now.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%8%%Then the king rose, and sat in the gate. And they told to all the people, saying, Behold, the king doth sit in the gate. And all the people came before the king: for Israel had fled every man to his tent.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%9%%And all the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, The king saved us from the hand of our enemies, and he delivered us from the hand of the Philistines; and now he hath fled out of the land for Absalom.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%10%%And Absalom, whom we anointed over us, is dead in battle. Now therefore why speak ye not a word of bringing the king back?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%11%%And king David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, saying, Speak to the elders of Judah, saying, Why are ye the last to bring the king back to his house? seeing the speech of all Israel is come to the king, even to his house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%12%%Ye are my brethren, ye are my bones and my flesh: why then are ye the last to bring back the king?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%13%%And say ye to Amasa, Art thou not of my bone, and of my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if thou be not captain of the host before me continually in the room of Joab.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%14%%And he bowed the heart of all the men of Judah, even as the heart of one man; so that they sent this word to the king, Return thou, and all thy servants.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%15%%So the king returned, and came to Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the king, to conduct the king over Jordan.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%16%%And Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjaminite, who was of Bahurim, hasted and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%17%%And there were a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him; and they went over Jordan before the king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%18%%And there went over a ferry-boat to carry over the king's household, and to do what he thought good. And Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king, as he came over Jordan;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%19%%And said to the king, Let not my lord impute iniquity to me, neither do thou remember that which thy servant did perversely the day that my lord the king went out of Jerusalem, that the king should take it to his heart.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%20%%For thy servant doth know that I have sinned: therefore behold, I have come the first this day of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%21%%But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered and said, Shall not Shimei be put to death for this, because he cursed the LORD'S anointed?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%22%%And David said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah, that ye should this day be adversaries to me? shall there any man be put to death this day in Israel? for do not I know that I am this day king over Israel?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%23%%Therefore the king said to Shimei, Thou shalt not die. And the king swore to him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%24%%And Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king, and had neither dressed his feet, nor trimmed his beard, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he came again in peace.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%25%%And it came to pass, when he had come to Jerusalem to meet the king, that the king said to him, Why didst thou not go with me, Mephibosheth?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%26%%And he answered, My lord, O king, my servant deceived me: for thy servant said, I will saddle me an ass, that I may ride on it, and go to the king; because thy servant is lame.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%27%%And he hath slandered thy servant to my lord the king; but my lord the king is as an angel of God: do therefore what is good in thy eyes.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%28%%For all of my father's house were but dead men before my lord the king: yet didst thou set thy servant among them that ate at thy own table. What right therefore have I yet to cry any more to the king?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%29%%And the king said to him, Why speakest thou any more of thy matters? I have said, Thou and Ziba divide the land.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%30%%And Mephibosheth said to the king, Yes, let him take all, forasmuch as my lord the king hath come again in peace to his own house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%31%%And Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim, and went over Jordan with the king, to conduct him over Jordan.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%32%%Now Barzillai was a very aged man, even eighty years old: and he had provided the king with sustenance while he lay at Mahanaim: for he was a very great man.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%33%%And the king said to Barzillai, Come thou over with me, and I will feed thee with me in Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%34%%And Barzillai said to the king, How long have I to live, that I should go up with the king to Jerusalem?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%35%%I am this day eighty years old: and can I discern between good and evil? can thy servant taste what I eat or what I drink? can I hear any more the voice of singing-men and singing-women? why then should thy servant be yet a burden to my lord the king?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%36%%Thy servant will go a little way over Jordan with the king: and why should the king recompense me with such a reward?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%37%%Let thy servant, I pray thee, return again, that I may die in my own city, and be buried by the grave of my father and of my mother. But behold thy servant Chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what shall seem good to thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%38%%And the king answered, Chimham shall go over with me, and I will do to him that which shall seem good to thee: and whatever thou shalt require of me, that will I do for thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%39%%And all the people went over Jordan. And when the king had come over, the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him; and he returned to his own place.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%40%%Then the king went on to Gilgal, and Chimham went on with him: and all the people of Judah conducted the king, and also half the people of Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%41%%And behold, all the men of Israel came to the king, and said to him, Why have our brethren the men of Judah stolen thee away, and have brought the king, and his household, and all David's men with him, over Jordan?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%42%%And all the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, Because the king is near of kin to us: why then are ye angry for this matter? have we eaten at all at the king's cost? or hath he given us any gift?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%19%%43%%And the men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, We have ten parts in the king, and we have also more right in David than ye: why then did ye despise us, that our advice should not be first had in bringing back our king? And the words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%1%%And there happened to be there a man of Belial, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjaminite: and he blew a trumpet, and said, We have no part in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: every man to his tents, O Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%2%%So every man of Israel, withdrawing from David, followed Sheba the son of Bichri: but the men of Judah adhered to their king, from Jordan even to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%3%%And David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women his concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in custody, and fed them, but went not in to them. So they were shut up to the day of their death, living in widowhood.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%4%%Then said the king to Amasa, Assemble to me the men of Judah within three days, and be thou here present.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%5%%So Amasa went to assemble the men of Judah: but he tarried longer than the set time which he had appointed him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%6%%And David said to Abishai, Now shall Sheba the son of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom: take thou thy lord's servants, and pursue him, lest he get for himself fortified cities, and escape us.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%7%%And there went out after him Joab's men, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men: and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%8%%When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa went before them. And Joab's garment that he had put on was girded to him, and upon it a girdle with a sword fastened upon his loins in its sheath; and as he went forth it fell out.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%9%%And Joab said to Amasa, Art thou in health, my brother? And Joab took Amasa by the beard with the right hand to kiss him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%10%%But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab's hand: so he smote him in the fifth rib, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and struck him not again; and he died. So Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%11%%And one of Joab's men stood by him, and said, He that favoreth Joab, and he that is for David, let him go after Joab.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%12%%And Amasa wallowed in blood in the midst of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people stood still, he removed Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a cloth upon him, when he saw that every one that came by him stood still.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%13%%When he was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%14%%And he went through all the tribes of Israel to Abel, and to Beth-maachah, and all the Berites: and they were assembled, and went also after him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%15%%And they came and besieged him in Abel of Beth-maachah, and they cast up a bank against the city, and it stood in the trench: and all the people that were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%16%%Then cried a wise woman out of the city, Hear, hear; say, I pray you, to Joab, Come near hither, that I may speak with thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%17%%And when he was come near to her, the woman said, Art thou Joab? And he answered, I am he. Then she said to him, Hear the words of thy handmaid. And he answered, I do hear.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%18%%Then she spoke, saying, They were wont to speak in old time, saying, They will surely ask counsel at Abel: and so they ended the matter.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%19%%I am one of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel: thou seekest to destroy a city and a mother in Israel: why wilt thou swallow up the inheritance of the LORD?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%20%%And Joab answered and said, Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%21%%The matter is not so: but a man of mount Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, hath lifted up his hand against the king, even against David: deliver him only, and I will depart from the city. And the woman said to Joab, Behold, his head shall be thrown to thee over the wall.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%22%%Then the woman went to all the people in her wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and cast it out to Joab. And he blew a trumpet, and they retired from the city, every man to his tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem to the king.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%23%%Now Joab was over all the host of Israel: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%24%%And Adoram was over the tribute: and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%25%%And Sheva was scribe: and Zadok and Abiathar were the priests:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%20%%26%%And Ira also the Jairite was a chief ruler about David.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%1%%Then there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David inquired of the LORD. And the LORD answered, It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he slew the Gibeonites.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%2%%And the king called the Gibeonites, and said to them; (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn to them: and Saul sought to slay them, in his zeal to the children of Israel and Judah.)
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%3%%Wherefore David said to the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? and with what shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the LORD?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%4%%And the Gibeonites said to him, We will have no silver nor gold of Saul, nor of his house; neither for us shalt thou kill any man in Israel. And he said, What ye shall say, that will I do for you.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%5%%And they answered the king, The man that consumed us, and that devised against us that we should be destroyed from remaining within the borders of Israel,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%6%%Let seven men of his sons be delivered to us, and we will hang them up to the LORD in Gibeah of Saul, whom the LORD chose. And the king said, I will give them.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%7%%But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, because of the LORD'S oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%8%%But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bore to Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she brought up for Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%9%%And he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them on the hill before the LORD: and they fell all seven together, and were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, in the beginning of barley harvest.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%10%%And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water dropped upon them out of heaven, and suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%11%%And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah the concubine of Saul had done.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%12%%And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh-gilead, who had stolen them from the street of Beth-shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, when the Philistines had slain Saul in Gilboa:
