1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%13%%And he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%14%%And the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son they buried in the country of Benjamin in Zelah, in the sepulcher of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was entreated for the land.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%15%%Moreover, the Philistines had yet war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines: and David became faint.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%16%%And Ishbi-benob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%17%%But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succored him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David swore to him, saying, Thou shalt go out no more with us to battle, that thou mayest not extinguish the light of Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%18%%And it came to pass after this, that there was again a battle with the Philistines at Gob: then Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Saph, who was of the sons of the giant.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%19%%And there was again a battle in Gob with the Philistines, where Elhanan the son of Jaareoregim, a Beth-lehemite, slew the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%20%%And there was yet a battle in Gath, where was a man of great stature, that had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and he also was born to the giant.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%21%%And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimeah the brother of David slew him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%21%%22%%These four were born to the giant in Gath, and fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%1%%And David spoke to the LORD the words of this song in the day that the LORD had delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%2%%And he said, The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%3%%The God of my rock; in him will I trust: he is my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower, and my refuge, my preserver; thou savest me from violence.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%4%%I will call on the LORD, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from my enemies.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%5%%When the waves of death compassed me, the floods of ungodly-men made me afraid;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%6%%The sorrows of hell encompassed me; the snares of death seized me;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%7%%In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried to my God: and he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry entered into his ears.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%8%%Then the earth shook and trembled: the foundations of heaven moved and shook, because he was wroth.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%9%%There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%10%%He bowed the heavens also, and came down; and darkness was under his feet.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%11%%And he rode upon a cherub, and flew: and he was seen upon the wings of the wind.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%12%%And he made darkness pavilions around him, dark waters, and thick clouds of the skies.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%13%%Through the brightness before him were coals of fire kindled.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%14%%The LORD thundered from heaven, and the most High uttered his voice.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%15%%And he sent out arrows, and scattered them; lightning, and discomfited them.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%16%%And the channels of the sea appeared, the foundations of the world were laid open, at the rebuking of the LORD, at the blast of the breath of his nostrils.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%17%%He sent from above, he took me; he drew me out of many waters;
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%18%%He delivered me from my strong enemy, from them that hated me: for they were too strong for me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%19%%They fell upon me in the day of my calamity: but the LORD was my support.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%20%%He brought me forth also into a large place: he delivered me, because he delighted in me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%21%%The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness: according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%22%%For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%23%%For all his judgments were before me: and as for his statutes, I did not depart from them.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%24%%I was also upright before him, and have kept myself from my iniquity.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%25%%Therefore the LORD hath recompensed me according to my righteousness; according to my cleanness in his eye-sight.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%26%%With the merciful thou wilt show thyself merciful, and with the upright man thou wilt show thyself upright.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%27%%With the pure thou wilt show thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt contend.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%28%%And the afflicted people thou wilt save: but thy eyes are upon the haughty, that thou mayest bring them down.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%29%%For thou art my lamp, O LORD: and the LORD will lighten my darkness.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%30%%For by thee I have run through a troop: by my God have I leaped over a wall.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%31%%As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the LORD is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%32%%For who is God, save the LORD? and who is a rock, save our God?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%33%%God is my strength and power: and he maketh my way perfect.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%34%%He maketh my feet like hinds' feet: and setteth me upon my high places.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%35%%He teacheth my hands to war; so that a bow of steel is broken by my arms.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%36%%Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy gentleness hath made me great.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%37%%Thou hast enlarged my steps under me; so that my feet have not slipped.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%38%%I have pursued my enemies, and destroyed them; and turned not again until I had consumed them.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%39%%And I have consumed them, and wounded them, that they could not arise: yea, they have fallen under my feet.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%40%%For thou hast girded me with strength to battle: them that rose up against me hast thou subdued under me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%41%%Thou hast also given me the necks of my enemies, that I might destroy them that hate me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%42%%They looked, but there was none to save; even to the LORD, but he answered them not.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%43%%Then I beat them as small as the dust of the earth, I stamped them as the mire of the street, and spread them abroad.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%44%%Thou also hast delivered me from the strivings of my people, thou hast kept me to be head of the heathen: a people which I knew not shall serve me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%45%%Strangers shall submit themselves to me: as soon as they hear, they shall be obedient to me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%46%%Strangers shall fade away, and they shall tremble from their close places.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%47%%The LORD liveth; and blessed be my rock; and exalted be the God of the rock of my salvation.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%48%%It is God that avengeth me, and that bringeth down the people under me,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%49%%And that bringeth me forth from my enemies: thou also hast lifted me up on high above them that rose up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%50%%Therefore I will give thanks to thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and I will sing praises to thy name.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%22%%51%%He is the tower of salvation for his king: and he showeth mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%1%%Now these are the last words of David. David the son of Jesse said, and the man who was raised on high, the anointed of the God of Jacob, and the sweet psalmist of Israel, said,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%2%%The Spirit of the LORD spoke by me, and his word was on my tongue.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%3%%The God of Israel said, the Rock of Israel spoke to me, He that ruleth over men must be just, ruling in the fear of God.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%4%%And he shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth, even a morning without clouds; as the tender grass springing out of the earth by clear shining after rain.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%5%%Although my house is not so with God; yet he hath made with me an everlasting covenant, ordered in all things, and sure: for this is all my salvation, and all my desire, although he maketh it not to grow.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%6%%But the sons of Belial shall be all of them as thorns thrust away, because they cannot be taken with hands:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%7%%But the man that shall touch them must be fenced with iron and the staff of a spear; and they shall be utterly burned with fire in the same place.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%8%%These are the names of the mighty men whom David had: The Tachmonite that sat in the seat, chief among the captains; the same was Adino the Eznite: he lifted up his spear against eight hundred, whom he slew at one time.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%9%%And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the three mighty men with David, when they defied the Philistines that were there assembled to battle, and the men of Israel had gone away:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%10%%He arose, and smote the Philistines until his hand was weary, and his hand adhered to the sword: and the LORD wrought a great victory that day; and the people returned after him only to plunder.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%11%%And after him was Shammah the son of Agee the Hararite. And the Philistines were collected into a troop, where was a piece of ground full of lentils: and the people fled from the Philistines.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%12%%But he stood in the midst of the ground, and defended it, and slew the Philistines: and the LORD wrought a great victory.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%13%%And three of the thirty chiefs went down, and came to David in the harvest time to the cave of Adullam: and the troop of the Philistines encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%14%%And David was then in a hold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%15%%And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of the water of the well of Beth-lehem, which is by the gate!
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%16%%And the three mighty men broke through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: nevertheless he would not drink of it, but poured it out to the LORD.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%17%%And he said, Be it far from me, O LORD, that I should do this: is not this the blood of the men that went in jeopardy of their lives? therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mighty men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%18%%And Abishai, the brother of Joab, the son of Zeruiah, was chief among three. And he lifted up his spear against three hundred, and slew them, and had the name among three.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%19%%Was he not most honorable of three? therefore he was their captain: yet he attained not to the first three.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%20%%And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man, of Kabzeel, who had done many acts, he slew two lion-like men of Moab: he went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%21%%And he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%22%%These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among three mighty men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%23%%He was more honorable than the thirty, but he attained not to the first three. And David set him over his guard.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%24%%Asahel the brother of Joab was one of the thirty; Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%25%%Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%26%%Helez the Paltite, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%27%%Abiezer the Anethothite, Mebunnai the Hushathite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%28%%Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%29%%Heleb the son of Baanah, a Netophathite, Ittai the son of Ribai out of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%30%%Benaiah the Pirathonite, Hiddai of the brooks of Gaash,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%31%%Abi-albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%32%%Eliahba the Shaalbonite, of the sons of Jashen, Jonathan,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%33%%Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam the son of Sharar the Hararite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%34%%Eliphelet the son of Ahasbai, the son of the Maachathite, Eliam the son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%35%%Hezrai the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%36%%Igal the son of Nathan of Zobah, Bani, the Gadite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%37%%Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, armor-bearer to Joab the son of Zeruiah,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%38%%Ira an Ithrite, Gareb an Ithrite,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%23%%39%%Uriah the Hittite: thirty and seven in all.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%1%%And again the anger of the LORD was kindled against Israel, and he moved David against them to say, Go number Israel and Judah.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%2%%For the king said to Joab the captain of the host, who was with him, Go now through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, and number ye the people, that I may know the number of the people.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%3%%And Joab said to the king, Now the LORD thy God add to the people, how many soever they may be, a hundred-fold, and that the eyes of my lord the king may see it: but why doth my lord the king delight in this thing?
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%4%%Notwithstanding the king's word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the host. And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the king, to number the people of Israel.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%5%%And they passed over Jordan, and pitched in Aroer, on the right side of the city that lieth in the midst of the river of Gad, and towards Jazer:
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%6%%Then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtim-hodshi; and they came to Dan-jaan, and about to Zidon,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%7%%And came to the strong hold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites: and they went out to the south of Judah, even to Beer-sheba.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%8%%So when they had gone through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%9%%And Joab presented the sum of the number of the people to the king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%10%%And David's heart smote him after that he had numbered the people. And David said to the LORD, I have sinned greatly in what I have done: and now, I beseech thee, O LORD, take away the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%11%%For when David had risen in the morning, the word of the LORD came to the prophet Gad, David's seer, saying,
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%12%%Go and say to David, Thus saith the LORD, I offer thee three things; choose thee one of them, that I may do it to thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%13%%So Gad came to David, and told him, and said to him, Shall seven years of famine come upon thee in thy land? or wilt thou flee three months before thy enemies, while they pursue thee? or that there be three days' pestilence in thy land? Now consider, and see what answer I shall return to him that sent me.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%14%%And David said to Gad, I am in a great strait: let us fall now into the hand of the LORD; for his mercies are great: and let me not fall into the hand of man.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%15%%So the LORD sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning even to the time appointed: and there died of the people from Dan even to Beer-sheba seventy thousand men.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%16%%And when the angel stretched out his hand upon Jerusalem to destroy it, the LORD repented of the evil, and said to the angel that destroyed the people, It is enough: stay now thy hand. And the angel of the LORD was by the threshing-place of Araunah the Jebusite.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%17%%And David spoke to the LORD when he saw the angel that smote the people, and said, Lo, I have sinned, and I have done wickedly: but these sheep, what have they done? let thy hand, I pray thee, be against me, and against my father's house.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%18%%And Gad came that day to David, and said to him, Go up, rear an altar to the LORD in the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%19%%And David, according to the saying of Gad, went up as the LORD commanded.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%20%%And Araunah looked, and saw the king and his servants coming towards him: And Araunah went out, and bowed himself before the king on his face upon the ground.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%21%%And Araunah said, Why is my lord the king come to his servant? And David said, To buy the threshing-floor of thee, to build an altar to the LORD, that the plague may be stayed from the people.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%22%%And Araunah said to David, Let my lord the king take and offer up what seemeth good to him: behold, here are oxen for burnt-sacrifice, and threshing-instruments and other instruments of the oxen for wood.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%23%%All these things did Araunah, as a king, give to the king. And Araunah said to the king, The LORD thy God accept thee.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%24%%And the king said to Araunah, No; but I will surely buy it of thee at a price: neither will I offer burnt-offerings to the LORD my God of that which doth cost me nothing. So David bought the threshing-floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
1000005%%2 Samuel%%OT%%24%%25%%And David built there an altar to the LORD, and offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings. So the LORD was entreated for the land, and the plague was stayed from Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%1%%Now king David was old and advanced in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he got no heat.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%2%%Wherefore his servants said to him, Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin: and let her stand before the king, and let her cherish him, and let her lie in thy bosom, that my lord the king may get heat.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%3%%So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the borders of Israel, and found Abishag a Shunamite, and brought her to the king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%4%%And the damsel was very fair, and cherished the king, and ministered to him: but the king knew her not.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%5%%Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, I will be king: and he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%6%%And his father had not displeased him at any time in saying, Why hast thou done so? and he also was a very goodly man; and his mother bore him after Absalom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%7%%And he conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest: and they following Adonijah, helped him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%8%%But Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophet, and Shimei, and Rei, and the mighty men who belonged to David, were not with Adonijah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%9%%And Adonijah slew sheep, and oxen, and fat cattle, by the stone of Zoheleth, which is by En-rogel, and called all his brethren the king's sons, and all the men of Judah the king's servants:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%10%%But Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, and the mighty men, and Solomon his brother, he called not.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%11%%Wherefore Nathan spoke to Bath-sheba the mother of Solomon, saying, Hast thou not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith doth reign, and David our lord knoweth it not?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%12%%Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thy own life, and the life of thy son Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%13%%Go, and enter in to king David, and say to him, Didst not thou, my lord, O king, swear to thy handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne? why then doth Adonijah reign?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%14%%Behold, while thou art yet talking there with the king, I will also come in after thee, and confirm thy words.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%15%%And Bath-sheba went to the king into the chamber: and the king was very old; and Abishag the Shunamite ministered to the king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%16%%And Bath-sheba bowed, and did obeisance to the king. And the king said, What wouldst thou?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%17%%And she said to him, My lord, thou didst swear by the LORD thy God to thy handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%18%%And now, behold, Adonijah reigneth; and now, my lord the king, thou knowest it not:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%19%%And he hath slain oxen, and fat cattle, and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the host: but Solomon thy servant hath he not called.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%20%%And thou, my lord, O king, the eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou shouldst tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%21%%Otherwise it shall come to pass, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%22%%And lo, while she was yet talking with the king, Nathan the prophet also came in.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%23%%And they told the king, saying, Behold, Nathan the prophet. And when he had come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%24%%And Nathan said, My lord, O king, hast thou said, Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%25%%For he hath gone down this day, and hath slain oxen, and fat cattle, and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the king's sons, and the captains of the host, and Abiathar the priest; and behold, they eat and drink before him, and say, God save king Adonijah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%26%%But me, even me thy servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and thy servant Solomon, hath he not called.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%27%%Is this thing done by my lord the king, and thou hast not shown it to thy servant, who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%28%%Then king David answered and said, Call me Bath-sheba. And she came into the king's presence, and stood before the king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%29%%And the king swore, and said, As the LORD liveth, that hath redeemed my soul out of all distress,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%30%%Even as I swore to thee by the LORD God of Israel, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; even so will I certainly do this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%31%%Then Bath-sheba bowed with her face to the earth, and did reverence to the king, and said, Let my lord king David live for ever.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%32%%And king David said, Call me Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada. And they came before the king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%33%%The king also said to them, Take with you the servants of your lord, and cause Solomon my son to ride upon my own mule, and bring him down to Gihon:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%34%%And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel: and blow ye with the trumpet, and say, God save king Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%35%%Then ye shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%36%%And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, and said, Amen: the LORD God of my lord the king say so too.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%37%%As the LORD hath been with my lord the king, even so let him be with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%38%%So Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride upon king David's mule, and brought him to Gihon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%39%%And Zadok the priest took a horn of oil out of the tabernacle, and anointed Solomon. And they blew the trumpet; and all the people said, God save king Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%40%%And all the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth rent with the sound of them.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%41%%And Adonijah and all the guests that were with him heard it as they had made an end of eating. And when Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, Why is this noise of the city being in an uproar?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%42%%And while he yet spoke, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came: and Adonijah said to him, Come in; for thou art a valiant man, and bringest good tidings.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%43%%And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, Verily our lord king David hath made Solomon king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%44%%And the king hath sent with him Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and they have caused him to ride upon the king's mule:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%45%%And Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon: and they have come from thence rejoicing, so that the city resounded. This is the noise that ye have heard.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%46%%And also Solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%47%%And moreover the king's servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, God make the name of Solomon better than thy name, and make his throne greater than thy throne. And the king bowed himself upon the bed.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%48%%And also thus said the king, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, who hath given one to sit on my throne this day, my eyes even seeing it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%49%%And all the guests that were with Adonijah were afraid, and arose, and went every man his way.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%50%%And Adonijah feared because of Solomon, and arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%51%%And it was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah feareth king Solomon: for lo, he hath caught hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear to me to-day that he will not slay his servant with the sword.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%52%%And Solomon said, If he will show himself a worthy man, there shall not a hair of him fall to the earth: but if wickedness shall be found in him, he shall die.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%1%%53%%So king Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. And he came and bowed himself to king Solomon: and Solomon said to him, Go to thy house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%1%%Now the days of David drew nigh that he should die; and he charged Solomon his son, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%2%%I go the way of all the earth: be thou strong therefore, and show thyself a man;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%3%%And keep the charge of the LORD thy God, to walk in his ways, to keep his statutes, and his commandments, and his judgments, and his testimonies, as it is written in the law of Moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest, and whithersoever thou turnest thyself.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%4%%That the LORD may continue his word which he spoke concerning me, saying, If thy children take heed to their way, to walk before me in truth with all their heart and with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the throne of Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%5%%Moreover, thou knowest also what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, and what he did to the two captains of the armies of Israel, to Abner the son of Ner, and to Amasa the son of Jether, whom he slew, and shed the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon his girdle that was about his loins, and in his shoes that were on his feet.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%6%%Do therefore according to thy wisdom, and let not his hoary head go down to the grave in peace.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%7%%But show kindness to the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Absalom thy brother.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%8%%And behold, thou hast with thee Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjaminite of Bahurim, who cursed me with a grievous curse in the day when I went to Mahanaim: but he came down to meet me at Jordan, and I swore to him by the LORD, saying, I will not put thee to death with the sword.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%9%%Now therefore hold him not guiltless: for thou art a wise man, and knowest what thou oughtest to do to him; but his hoary head do thou bring down to the grave with blood.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%10%%So David slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%11%%And the days that David reigned over Israel were forty years: seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and three years reigned he in Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%12%%Then Solomon was seated upon the throne of David his father; and his kingdom was established greatly.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%13%%And Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bath-sheba the mother of Solomon. And she said, Comest thou peaceably? and he said, Peaceably.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%14%%He said moreover, I have somewhat to say to thee. And she said, Say on.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%15%%And he said, Thou knowest that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel set their faces on me, that I should reign: but the kingdom is turned about, and hath become my brother's: for it was his from the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%16%%And now I ask one petition of thee, deny me not. And she said to him, Say on.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%17%%And he said, Speak, I pray thee, to Solomon the king, (for he will not say to thee no,) that he give me Abishag the Shunamite for a wife.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%18%%And Bath-sheba said, Well; I will speak for thee to the king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%19%%Bath-sheba therefore went to king Solomon, to speak to him for Adonijah. And the king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself to her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a seat to be set for the king's mother; and she sat on his right hand.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%20%%Then she said, I desire one small petition of thee; I pray thee, deny me not. And the king said to her, Ask on, my mother: for I will not deny thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%21%%And she said, Let Abishag the Shunamite be given to Adonijah thy brother for a wife.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%22%%And king Solomon answered and said to his mother, And why dost thou ask Abishag the Shunamite for Adonijah? ask for him the kingdom also; for he is my elder brother; even for him, and for Abiathar the priest, and for Joab the son of Zeruiah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%23%%Then king Solomon swore by the LORD, saying, God do so to me, and more also, if Adonijah hath not spoken this word against his own life.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%24%%Now therefore, as the LORD liveth, who hath established me, and set me on the throne of David my father, and who hath made me a house, as he promised, Adonijah shall be put to death this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%25%%And king Solomon sent by the hand of Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell upon him that he died.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%26%%And to Abiathar the priest said the king, Depart to Anathoth, to thy own fields; for thou art worthy of death: but I will not at this time put thee to death, because thou didst bear the ark of the Lord GOD before David my father, and because thou hast been afflicted in all in which my father was afflicted.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%27%%So Solomon removed Abiathar from being priest to the LORD; that he might fulfill the word of the LORD, which he spoke concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%28%%Then tidings came to Joab: for Joab had turned after Adonijah, though he turned not after Absalom. And Joab fled to the tabernacle of the LORD, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%29%%And it was told to king Solomon that Joab had fled to the tabernacle of the LORD; and behold, he is by the altar. Then Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, Go, fall upon him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%30%%And Benaiah came to the tabernacle of the LORD, and said to him, Thus saith the king, Come forth. And he said, No; but I will die here. And Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%31%%And the king said to him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon him, and bury him; that thou mayest take away the innocent blood which Joab shed, from me, and from the house of my father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%32%%And the LORD shall return his blood upon his own head, who fell upon two men more righteous and better than he, and slew them with the sword, my father David not knowing of it, to wit, Abner the son of Ner captain of the host of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, captain of the host of Judah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%33%%Their blood shall therefore return upon the head of Joab, and upon the head of his seed for ever: but upon David, and upon his seed, and upon his house, and upon his throne, shall there be peace forever from the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%34%%So Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went, and fell upon him, and slew him: and he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%35%%And the king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada in his room over the army: and Zadok the priest the king put in the room of Abiathar.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%36%%And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said to him, Build thee a house in Jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence to any place whatever.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%37%%For it shall be, that on the day thou shalt go out, and pass over the brook Kidron, thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt surely die: thy blood shall be upon thy own head.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%38%%And Shimei said to the king, The saying is good: as my lord the king hath said, so will thy servant do. And Shimei dwelt in Jerusalem many days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%39%%And it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the servants of Shimei ran away to Achish son of Maachah king of Gath: and they told Shimei, saying, behold, thy servants are in Gath.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%40%%And Shimei arose, and saddled his ass, and went to Gath to Achish to seek his servants: and Shimei went and brought his servants from Gath.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%41%%And it was told to Solomon that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath, and had returned.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%42%%And the king sent and called for Shimei, and said to him, Did I not make thee to swear by the LORD, and protest to thee, saying, Know for a certain, on the day thou goest out, and walkest any where abroad, that thou shalt surely die? and thou saidst to me, The word that I have heard is good.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%43%%Why then hast thou not kept the oath of the LORD, and the commandment that I have charged thee with?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%44%%The king said moreover to Shimei, Thou knowest all the wickedness which thy heart is privy to, that thou didst to David my father: therefore the LORD will return thy wickedness upon thy own head;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%45%%And king Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before the LORD for ever.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%2%%46%%So the king commanded Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; who went out, and fell upon him, that he died. And the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%1%%And Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh's daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of the LORD, and the wall of Jerusalem on every side.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%2%%Only the people sacrificed in high places, because there was no house built to the name of the LORD, until those days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%3%%And Solomon loved the LORD, walking in the statutes of David his father: only he sacrificed and burnt incense in high places.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%4%%And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place: a thousand burnt-offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%5%%In Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night: and God said, Ask what I shall give thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%6%%And Solomon said, Thou hast shown to thy servant David my father great mercy, according as he walked before thee in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with thee; and thou hast kept for him this great kindness, that thou hast given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%7%%And now, O LORD my God, thou hast made thy servant king instead of David my father: and I am but a little child: I know not how to go out or come in.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%8%%And thy servant is in the midst of thy people which thou hast chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%9%%Give therefore to thy servant an understanding heart to judge thy people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this thy so great a people?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%10%%And the speech pleased the Lord, that Solomon had asked this thing.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%11%%And God said to him, Because thou hast asked this thing, and hast not asked for thyself long life; neither hast asked riches for thyself, nor hast asked the life of thy enemies: but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern judgment;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%12%%Behold, I have done according to thy words: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there hath been none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like to thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%13%%And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both riches, and honor: so that there shall not be any among the kings like to thee all thy days,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%14%%And if thou wilt walk in my ways, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as thy father David did walk, then I will lengthen thy days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%15%%And Solomon awoke; and behold, it was a dream. And he came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and offered up burnt-offerings, and offered peace-offerings, and made a feast to all his servants.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%16%%Then came there two women, that were harlots, to the king, and stood before him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%17%%And the one woman said, O my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%18%%And it came to pass the third day after I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also: and we were together; there was no stranger with us in the house, save us two in the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%19%%And this woman's child died in the night; because she overlaid it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%20%%And she arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while thy handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%21%%And when I rose in the morning to nurse my child, behold, it was dead: but when I had considered it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, which I bore.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%22%%And the other woman said, No; but the living is my son, and the dead is thy son. And this said, No; but the dead is thy son, and the living is my son. Thus they spoke before the king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%23%%Then said the king, The one saith, This is my son that liveth, and thy son is the dead; and the other saith, No; but thy son is the dead, and my son is the living.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%24%%And the king said, Bring me a sword. And they brought a sword before the king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%25%%And the king said, Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%26%%Then spoke the woman whose the living child was to the king, for her bowels yearned upon her son, and she said, O my lord, give her the living child, and in no wise slay it. But the other said, Let it be neither mine nor thine, but divide it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%27%%Then the king answered and said, Give her the living child, and in no wise slay it: she is the mother of it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%3%%28%%And all Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king: for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do judgment.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%1%%So king Solomon was king over all Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%2%%And these were the princes which he had; Azariah the son of Zadok the priest,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%3%%Elihoreph and Ahiah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehosaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%4%%And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the army: and Zadok and Abiathar were the priests:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%5%%And Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers: and Zabud the son of Nathan was principal officer, and the king's friend:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%6%%And Ahishar was over the household: and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the tribute.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%7%%And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided victuals for the king and his household: each man his month in a year made provision.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%8%%And these are their names: The son of Hur, in mount Ephraim:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%9%%The son of Dekar, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Beth-shemesh, and Elon-beth-hanan:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%10%%The son of Hesed, in Aruboth; to him pertained Sochoh, and all the land of Hepher:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%11%%The son of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; who had Taphath the daughter of Solomon for a wife:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%12%%Baana the son of Ahilud; to him pertained Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth-shean, which is by Zartanah beneath Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, even to the place that is beyond Jokneam:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%13%%The son of Geber, in Ramoth-gilead; to him pertained the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; to him also pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, sixty great cities with walls and brazen bars:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%14%%Ahinadab the son of Iddo had Mahanaim:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%15%%Ahimaaz was in Naphtali; he also took Basmath the daughter of Solomon for a wife:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%16%%Baanah the son of Hushai was in Asher and in Aloth:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%17%%Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%18%%Shimei the son of Elah, in Benjamin:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%19%%Geber the son of Uri was in the country of Gilead, in the country of Sihon king of the Amorites, and of Og king of Bashan; and he was the only officer who was in the land.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%20%%Judah and Israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking, and making merry.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%21%%And Solomon reigned over all kingdoms from the river to the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt: they brought presents, and served Solomon all the days of his life.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%22%%And Solomon's provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and sixty measures of meal.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%23%%Ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and a hundred sheep, besides harts, and roebucks, and fallow-deer, and fatted fowls.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%24%%For he had dominion over all the region on this side the river, from Tiphsah even to Azzah, over all the kings on this side of the river: and he had peace on all sides around him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%25%%And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig-tree, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, all the days of Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%26%%And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%27%%And those officers provided victuals for king Solomon, and for all that came to king Solomon's table, every man in his month: they lacked nothing.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%28%%Barley also and straw for the horses and dromedaries they brought to the place where the officers were, every man according to his charge.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%29%%And God gave Solomon great wisdom and understanding, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea-shore.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%30%%And Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country, and all the wisdom of Egypt.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%31%%For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all the surrounding nations.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%32%%And he spoke three thousand proverbs: and his songs were a thousand and five.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%33%%And he spoke of trees, from the cedar tree that is in Lebanon even to the hyssop that springeth out of the wall: he spoke also of beasts, and of fowls, and of creeping animals, and of fishes.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%4%%34%%And there came of all people to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%1%%And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father: for Hiram was ever a lover of David.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%2%%And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%3%%Thou knowest how that David my father could not build a house to the name of the LORD his God, for the wars which were about him on every side, until the LORD put them under the soles of his feet.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%4%%But now the LORD my God hath given me rest on every side, so that there is neither adversary nor evil occurrent.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%5%%And behold, I purpose to build a house to the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spoke to David my father, saying, Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build a house to my name.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%6%%Now therefore command thou, that they hew me cedar trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants: and to thee will I give hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us any that is skilled in hewing timber like the Sidonians.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%7%%And it came to pass, when Hiram heard the words of Solomon, that he rejoiced greatly, and said, Blessed be the LORD this day, who hath given to David a wise son over this great people.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%8%%And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, I have considered the things which thou sentest to me for: and I will perform all thy desire concerning timber of cedar, and concerning timber of fir.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%9%%My servants shall bring them down from Lebanon to the sea: and I will convey them by sea in floats to the place that thou shalt appoint me, and will cause them to be discharged there, and thou shalt receive them: and thou shalt accomplish my desire, in giving food for my household.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%10%%So Hiram gave Solomon cedar trees and fir trees according to all his desire.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%11%%And Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Solomon to Hiram year by year.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%12%%And the LORD gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him: and there was peace between Hiram and Solomon; and they two made a league together.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%13%%And king Solomon raised a levy out of all Israel; and the levy was thirty thousand men.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%14%%And he sent them to Lebanon ten thousand a month by courses; a month they were in Lebanon, and two months at home. And Adoniram was over the levy.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%15%%And Solomon had seventy thousand that bore burdens, and eighty thousand hewers in the mountains;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%16%%Besides the chief of Solomon's officers who were over the work, three thousand and three hundred, who ruled over the people that wrought in the work.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%17%%And the king commanded, and they brought great stones, costly stones, and hewed stones, to lay the foundation of the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%5%%18%%And Solomon's builders, and Hiram's builders did hew them, and the stone-squarers: so they prepared timber and stones to build the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%1%%And it came to pass in the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon's reign over Israel, in the month of Zif, which is the second month, that he began to build the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%2%%And the house which king Solomon built for the LORD, the length of it was sixty cubits, and the breadth of it twenty cubits, and the hight of it thirty cubits.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%3%%And the porch before the temple of the house, twenty cubits was the length of it, according to the breadth of the house; and ten cubits was the breadth of it, before the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%4%%And for the house he made windows of narrow lights.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%5%%And against the wall of the house he built chambers round about, against the walls of the house round about, both of the temple and of the oracle: and he made chambers round about:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%6%%The nethermost chamber was five cubits broad, and the middle was six cubits broad, and the third was seven cubits broad: for without in the wall of the house he made narrowed rests round about, that the beams should not be fastened in the walls of the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%7%%And the house, when it was in building, was built of stone made ready before it was brought thither; so that there was neither hammer nor ax nor any tool of iron heard in the house, while it was in building.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%8%%The door for the middle chamber was in the right side of the house: and they went up with winding stairs into the middle chamber, and out of the middle into the third;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%9%%So he built the house and finished it; and covered the house with beams and boards of cedar.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%10%%And then he built chambers against all the house, five cubits high: and they rested on the house with timber of cedar.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%11%%And the word of the LORD came to Solomon, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%12%%Concerning this house which thou art in building, if thou wilt walk in my statutes, and execute my judgments, and keep all my commandments to walk in them; then will I perform my word with thee, which I spoke to David thy father:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%13%%And I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will not forsake my people Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%14%%So Solomon built the house, and finished it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%15%%And he built the walls of the house within with boards of cedar, both the floor of the house, and the walls of the ceiling: and he covered them on the inside with wood, and covered the floor of the house with planks of fir.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%16%%And he built twenty cubits on the sides of the house, both the floor and the walls with boards of cedar: he even built them for it within, even for the oracle, even for the most holy place.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%17%%And the house, that is, the temple before it, was forty cubits long.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%18%%And the cedar of the house within was carved with knobs and open flowers: all was cedar; there was no stone seen.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%19%%And the oracle he prepared in the house within, to set there the ark of the covenant of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%20%%And the oracle in the forepart was twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in breadth, and twenty cubits in the hight of it, and he overlaid it with pure gold; and so covered the altar which was of cedar.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%21%%So Solomon overlaid the house within with pure gold: and he made a partition by the chains of gold before the oracle; and he overlaid it with gold.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%22%%And the whole house he overlaid with gold, until he had finished all the house: also the whole altar that was by the oracle he overlaid with gold.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%23%%And within the oracle he made two cherubim of olive tree, each ten cubits high.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%24%%And five cubits was the one wing of the cherub, and five cubits the other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing to the uttermost part of the other were ten cubits.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%25%%And the other cherub was ten cubits: both the cherubim were of one measure and one size.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%26%%The hight of the one cherub was ten cubits, and so was it of the other cherub.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%27%%And he set the cherubim within the inner house: and they stretched forth the wings of the cherubim, so that the wing of the one touched the one wall, and the wing of the other cherub touched the other wall; and their wings touched one another in the midst of the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%28%%And he overlaid the cherubim with gold.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%29%%And he carved all the walls of the house around with carved figures of cherubim, and palm trees, and open flowers, within and without.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%30%%And the floor of the house he overlaid with gold, within and without.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%31%%And for the entrance of the oracle he made doors of olive tree: the lintel and side-posts were a fifth part of the wall.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%32%%The two doors also were of olive tree; and he carved upon them carvings of cherubim, and palm trees, and open flowers, and overlaid them with gold, and spread gold upon the cherubim, and upon the palm trees.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%33%%So also he made for the door of the temple posts of olive tree a fourth part of the wall.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%34%%And the two doors were of fir tree: the two leaves of the one door were folding, and the two leaves of the other door were folding.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%35%%And he carved thereon cherubim, and palm trees, and open flowers; and covered them with gold, fitted upon the carved work.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%36%%And he built the inner court with three rows of hewn stone, and a row of cedar beams.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%37%%In the fourth year was the foundation of the house of the LORD laid, in the month Zif:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%6%%38%%And in the eleventh year, in the month Bul (which is the eighth month) was the house finished throughout all its parts, and according to all the fashion of it. So was he seven years in building it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%1%%But Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all his house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%2%%He built also the house of the forest of Lebanon; its length was a hundred cubits, and its breadth fifty cubits, and its hight thirty cubits, upon four rows of cedar pillars, with cedar beams upon the pillars.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%3%%And it was covered with cedar above upon the beams, that lay on forty-five pillars, fifteen in a row.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%4%%And there were windows in three rows, and light was against light in three ranks.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%5%%And all the doors and posts were square, with the windows: and light was against light in three ranks.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%6%%And he made a porch of pillars; its length was fifty cubits, and its breadth thirty cubits: and the porch was before them: and the other pillars and the thick beams were before them.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%7%%Then he made a porch for the throne where he might judge, even the porch of judgment: and it was covered with cedar from one side of the floor to the other.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%8%%And his house where he dwelt had another court within the porch, which was of the like work. Solomon made also a house for Pharaoh's daughter, whom he had married, like to this porch.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%9%%All these were of costly stones, according to the measures of hewn stones, sawed with saws, within and without, even from the foundation to the coping, and so on the outside towards the great court.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%10%%And the foundation was of costly stones, even great stones; stones of ten cubits, and stones of eight cubits.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%11%%And above were costly stones, after the measures of hewn stones, and cedars.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%12%%And the great court around was with three rows of hewn stones, and a row of cedar beams, both for the inner court of the house of the LORD, and for the porch of the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%13%%And king Solomon sent and brought Hiram out of Tyre.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%14%%He was a widow's son of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in brass: and he was filled with wisdom, and understanding, and ingenious to work all works in brass. And he came to king Solomon, and wrought all his work.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%15%%For he cast two pillars of brass, each of eighteen cubits high: and a line of twelve cubits did encompass each of them.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%16%%And he made two capitals of molten brass, to set upon the tops of the pillars: the hight of the one capital was five cubits, and the hight of the other capital was five cubits:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%17%%And nets of checker-work, and wreaths of chain-work, for the capitals which were upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one capital, and seven for the other capital.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%18%%And he made the pillars, and two rows around upon the one net-work, to cover the capitals that were upon the top, with pomegranates: and so he did for the other capital.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%19%%And the capitals that were upon the top of the pillars were of lily-work in the porch, four cubits.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%20%%And the capitals upon the two pillars had pomegranates also above, over against the belly which was by the net-work: and the pomegranates were two hundred in rows around upon the other capital.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%21%%And he set up the pillars in the porch of the temple: and he set up the right pillar, and called its name Jachin: and he set up the left pillar, and called its name Boaz.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%22%%And upon the top of the pillars was lily-work: so was the work of the pillars finished.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%23%%And he made a molten sea, ten cubits from the one brim to the other: it was entirely round, and its hight was five cubits: and a line of thirty cubits encompassed it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%24%%And under the brim of it around there were knobs compassing it, ten in a cubit, compassing the sea around: the knobs were cast in two rows, when it was cast.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%25%%It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking towards the north, and three looking towards the west, and three looking towards the south, and three looking towards the east: and the sea was set above upon them, and all their hinder parts were inward.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%26%%And it was a hand-breadth thick, and its brim was wrought like the brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies: it contained two thousand baths.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%27%%And he made ten bases of brass; four cubits was the length of one base, and four cubits the breadth of it, and three cubits the hight of it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%28%%And the work of the bases was in this manner: They had borders, and the borders were between the ledges:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%29%%And on the borders that were between the ledges were lions, oxen, and cherubim: and upon the ledges there was a base above: and beneath the lions and oxen were certain additions made of thin work.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%30%%And every base had four brazen wheels, and plates of brass: and the four corners of it had undersetters: under the laver were undersetters molten, at the side of every addition.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%31%%And the mouth of it within the capital and above was a cubit: but the mouth of it was round after the work of the base, a cubit and a half: and also upon the mouth of it were gravings with their borders, foursquare, not round.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%32%%And under the borders were four wheels; and the axletrees of the wheels were joined to the base: and the hight of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%33%%And the work of the wheels was like the work of a chariot wheel: their axletrees, and their naves, and their fellies, and their spokes, were all molten.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%34%%And there were four undersetters to the four corners of one base: and the undersetters were of the very base itself.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%35%%And in the top of the base was there a round compass of half a cubit high: and on the top of the base its ledges and its borders were of the same.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%36%%For on the plates of its ledges, and on its borders, he graved cherubim, lions, and palm trees, according to the proportion of every one, and additions around.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%37%%After this manner he made the ten bases: all of them had one casting, one measure, and one size.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%38%%Then he made ten lavers of brass: one laver contained forty baths: and every laver was four cubits: and upon every one of the ten bases one laver.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%39%%And he put five bases on the right side of the house, and five on the left side of the house: and he set the sea on the right side of the house eastward over against the south.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%40%%And Hiram made the lavers, and the shovels, and the basins. So Hiram made an end of doing all the work that he executed for king Solomon for the house of the LORD:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%41%%The two pillars, and the two bowls of the capitals that were on the top of the two pillars; and the two net-works, to cover the two bowls of the capitals which were upon the top of the pillars;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%42%%And four hundred pomegranates for the two net-works, even two rows of pomegranates for one net-work, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were upon the pillars;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%43%%And the ten bases, and ten lavers on the bases;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%44%%And one sea, and twelve oxen under the sea;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%45%%And the pots, and the shovels, and the basins: and all these vessels which Hiram made to king Solomon for the house of the LORD, were of bright brass.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%46%%In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zarthan.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%47%%And Solomon left all the vessels unweighed, because they were very numerous: neither was the weight of the brass ascertained.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%48%%And Solomon made all the vessels that pertained to the house of the LORD: the altar of gold, and the table of gold, upon which was the show-bread,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%49%%And the candlesticks of pure gold, five on the right side, and five on the left, before the oracle, with the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs of gold,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%50%%And the bowls, and the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and the censers of pure gold; and the hinges of gold, both for the doors of the inner house, the most holy place, and for the doors of the house, to wit, of the temple.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%7%%51%%So was ended all the work that king Solomon made for the house of the LORD. And Solomon brought in the things which David his father had dedicated; even the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, he placed among the treasures of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%1%%Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the chief of the fathers of the children of Israel, to king Solomon in Jerusalem, that they might bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD out of the city of David, which is Zion.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%2%%And all the men of Israel assembled themselves to king Solomon at the feast in the month Ethanim, which is the seventh month.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%3%%And all the elders of Israel came, and the priests took up the ark.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%4%%And they brought the ark of the LORD, and the tabernacle of the congregation, and all the holy vessels that were in the tabernacle, even those did the priests and the Levites bring.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%5%%And king Solomon, and all the congregation of Israel, that were assembled to him, were with him before the ark, sacrificing sheep and oxen, that could not be told nor numbered for multitude.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%6%%And the priests brought the ark of the covenant of the LORD to its place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%7%%For the cherubim spread forth their two wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim covered the ark and the staffs thereof above.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%8%%And they drew out the staffs, that the ends of the staffs were seen out in the holy place before the oracle, and they were not seen without: and there they are to this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%9%%There was nothing in the ark save the two tables of stone, which Moses deposited there at Horeb, when the LORD made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of the land of Egypt.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%10%%And it came to pass, when the priests had come out of the holy place, that the cloud filled the house of the LORD,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%11%%So that the priests could not stand to minister because of the cloud: for the glory of the LORD had filled the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%12%%Then spoke Solomon, The LORD said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%13%%I have surely built thee a house to dwell in, a settled place for thee to abide in for ever.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%14%%And the king turned his face about, and blessed all the congregation of Israel: and all the congregation of Israel were standing.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%15%%And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David my father, and hath with his hand fulfilled it, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%16%%Since the day that I brought forth my people Israel from Egypt, I have chosen no city out of all the tribes of Israel to build a house, that my name might be therein; but I chose David to be over my people Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%17%%And it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%18%%And the LORD said to David my father, Whereas it was in thy heart to build a house to my name, thou didst well that it was in thy heart.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%19%%Nevertheless, thou shalt not build the house; but thy son that shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house to my name.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%20%%And the LORD hath performed his word that he spoke, and I have risen in the room of David my father, and sit on the throne of Israel, as the LORD promised, and have built a house for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%21%%And I have set there a place for the ark, in which is the covenant of the LORD, which he made with our fathers, when he brought them from the land of Egypt.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%22%%And Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands towards Heaven:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%23%%And he said, LORD God of Israel, there is no God like thee, in heaven above, or on earth beneath, who keepest covenant and mercy with thy servants that walk before thee with all their heart.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%24%%Who hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou didst promise him: thou didst speak also with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thy hand, as it is this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%25%%Therefore now, LORD God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou didst promise him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel; provided thy children take heed to their way, that they walk before me as thou hast walked before me.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%26%%And now, O God of Israel, let thy word, I pray thee, be verified, which thou didst speak to thy servant David my father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%27%%But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have built?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%28%%Yet have thou respect to the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O LORD my God, to hearken to the cry and to the prayer, which thy servant prayeth before thee this day:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%29%%That thy eyes may be open towards this house night and day, even towards the place of which thou hast said, My name shall be there: that thou mayest hearken to the prayer which thy servant shall make towards this place.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%30%%And hearken thou to the supplication of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, when they shall pray towards this place: and hear thou in heaven thy dwelling-place: and when thou hearest, forgive.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%31%%If any man shall trespass against his neighbor, and an oath be laid upon him to cause him to swear, and the oath come before thy altar in this house:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%32%%Then hear thou in heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, condemning the wicked, to bring his way upon his head; and justifying the righteous, to give him according to his righteousness.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%33%%When thy people Israel shall be smitten before the enemy, because they have sinned against thee, and shall turn again to thee, and confess thy name, and pray, and make supplication to thee in this house:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%34%%Then hear thou in heaven, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again to the land which thou gavest to their fathers.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%35%%When heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; if they pray towards this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou afflictest them:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%36%%Then hear thou in heaven, and forgive the sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, that thou mayest teach them the good way in which they should walk, and give rain upon thy land, which thou hast given to thy people for an inheritance.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%37%%If there shall be in the land famine, if there shall be pestilence, blasting, mildew, locust, or if there shall be caterpillar; if their enemy shall besiege them in the land of their cities, whatever plague, whatever sickness there shall be;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%38%%Whatever prayer and supplication shall be made by any man, or by all thy people Israel, who shall know every man the plague of his own heart, and spread forth his hands towards this house:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%39%%Then hear thou in heaven thy dwelling-place, and forgive, and do, and give to every man according to his ways, whose heart thou knowest; (for thou, even thou only, knowest the hearts of all the children of men;)
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%40%%That they may fear thee all the days that they live in the land which thou gavest to our fathers.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%41%%Moreover, concerning a stranger, that is not of thy people Israel, but cometh out of a far country for thy name's sake;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%42%%(For they shall hear of thy great name, and of thy strong hand, and of thy out-stretched arm;) when he shall come and pray towards this house;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%43%%Hear thou in heaven thy dwelling-place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth to thee for: that all people of the earth may know thy name, to fear thee, as do thy people Israel; and that they may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%44%%If thy people go out to battle against their enemy, whithersoever thou shalt send them, and shall pray to the LORD towards the city which thou hast chosen, and towards the house that I have built for thy name:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%45%%Then hear thou in heaven their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%46%%If they shall sin against thee, (for there is no man that sinneth not,) and thou shalt be angry with them, and deliver them to the enemy, so that they carry them away captives to the land of the enemy, far or near;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%47%%Yet if they shall bethink themselves in the land whither they were carried captives, and repent and make supplication to thee in the land of them that carried them captives, saying, We have sinned, and have done perversely, we have committed wickedness;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%48%%And so return to thee with all their heart, and with all their soul, in the land of their enemies, who led them away captive, and pray to thee towards their land, which thou gavest to their fathers, the city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy name:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%49%%Then hear thou their prayer and their supplication in heaven thy dwelling-place, and maintain their cause,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%50%%And forgive thy people that have sinned against thee, and all their transgressions in which they have transgressed against thee, and give them compassion before them who carried them captive, that they may have compassion on them:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%51%%For they are thy people, and thy inheritance, which thou broughtest out of Egypt, from the midst of the furnace of iron:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%52%%That thy eyes may be open to the supplication of thy servant, and to the supplication of thy people Israel, to hearken to them in all their supplications to thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%53%%For thou didst separate them from among all the people of the earth, to be thy inheritance, as thou didst speak by the hand of Moses thy servant, when thou broughtest our fathers out of Egypt, O Lord GOD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%54%%And it was so, that when Solomon had made an end of praying all this prayer and supplication to the LORD, he arose from before the altar of the LORD, from kneeling on his knees, with his hands spread up to heaven.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%55%%And he stood, and blessed all the congregation of Israel with a loud voice, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%56%%Blessed be the LORD, that hath given rest to his people Israel, according to all that he promised: there hath not failed one word of all his good promise, which he promised by the hand of Moses his servant.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%57%%The LORD our God be with us, as he was with our fathers: let him not leave us, nor forsake us:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%58%%That he may incline our hearts to him, to walk in all his ways, and to keep his commandments, and his statutes, and his judgments, which he commanded our fathers.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%59%%And let these my words with which I have made supplication before the LORD, be nigh to the LORD our God day and night, that he may maintain the cause of his servant, and the cause of his people Israel at all times, as the matter shall require:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%60%%That all the people of the earth may know, that the LORD is God, and that there is none else.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%61%%Let your heart therefore be perfect with the LORD our God, to walk in his statutes, and to keep his commandments, as at this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%62%%And the king, and all Israel with him, offered sacrifice before the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%63%%And Solomon offered a sacrifice of peace-offerings, which he offered to the LORD, two and twenty thousand oxen, and a hundred and twenty thousand sheep. So the king and all the children of Israel dedicated the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%64%%The same day did the king consecrate the middle of the court that was before the house of the LORD: for there he offered burnt-offerings, and meat-offerings, and the fat of the peace-offerings: because the brazen altar that was before the LORD was too little to receive the burnt-offerings, and meat-offerings, and the fat of the peace-offerings.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%65%%And at that time Solomon held a feast, and all Israel with him, a great congregation, from the entrance into Hamath to the river of Egypt, before the LORD our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%8%%66%%On the eighth day he sent the people away: and they blessed the king, and went to their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that the LORD had done for David his servant, and for Israel his people.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%1%%And it came to pass, when Solomon had finished the building of the house of the LORD, and the king's house, and all Solomon's desire which he was pleased to perform,
