1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%2%%That the LORD appeared to Solomon the second time, as he had appeared to him at Gibeon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%3%%And the LORD said to him, I have heard thy prayer and thy supplication that thou hast made before me: I have hallowed this house, which thou hast built, to put my name there for ever; and my eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%4%%And if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, in integrity of heart, and in uprightness, to do according to all that I have commanded thee, and wilt keep my statutes and my judgments:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%5%%Then I will establish the throne of thy kingdom upon Israel for ever, as I promised to David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man upon the throne of Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%6%%But if ye shall at all turn from following me, ye or your children, and will not keep my commandments and my statutes which I have set before you, but go and serve other gods, and worship them:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%7%%Then will I cut off Israel from the land which I have given them; and this house which I have hallowed for my name, will I cast out of my sight; and Israel shall be a proverb and a by-word among all people:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%8%%And at this house which is high, every one that passeth by it shall be astonished, and shall hiss; and they shall say, Why hath the LORD done thus to this land, and to this house?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%9%%And they shall answer, Because they forsook the LORD their God, who brought forth their fathers from the land of Egypt, and have taken hold upon other gods, and have worshiped them, and served them: therefore hath the LORD brought upon them all this evil.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%10%%And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, when Solomon had built the two houses, the house of the LORD, and the king's house,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%11%%(Now Hiram the king of Tyre had furnished Solomon with cedar trees and fir trees, and with gold, according to all his desire,) that then king Solomon gave Hiram twenty cities in the land of Galilee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%12%%And Hiram came out from Tyre to see the cities which Solomon had given him; and they pleased him not.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%13%%And he said, What cities are these which thou hast given me, my brother? And he called them the land of Cabul to this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%14%%And Hiram sent to the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%15%%And this is the reason of the levy which king Solomon raised, to build the house of the LORD, and his own house, and Millo, and the wall of Jerusalem, and Hazor, and Megiddo, and Gezer.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%16%%For Pharaoh king of Egypt had gone up, and taken Gezer, and burnt it with fire, and slain the Canaanites that dwelt in the city, and given it for a present to his daughter, Solomon's wife.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%17%%And Solomon built Gezer, and Beth-horon the nether,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%18%%And Baalath, and Tadmor in the wilderness, in the land,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%19%%And all the cities of store that Solomon had, and cities for his chariots, and cities for his horsemen, and that which Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%20%%And all the people that were left of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites, who were not of the children of Israel,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%21%%Their children that were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel also were not able utterly to destroy, upon those did Solomon levy a tribute of bond-service to this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%22%%But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no bond-men: but they were men of war, and his servants, and his princes, and his captains, and rulers of his chariots, and his horsemen.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%23%%These were the chief of the officers that were over Solomon's work, five hundred and fifty, who bore rule over the people that wrought in the work.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%24%%But Pharaoh's daughter came up from the city of David to her house which Solomon had built for her: then he built Millo.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%25%%And three times in a year did Solomon offer burnt-offerings and peace-offerings upon the altar which he built to the LORD, and he burnt incense upon the altar that was before the LORD. So he finished the house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%26%%And king Solomon made a navy of ships in Ezion-geber, which is beside Eloth, on the shore of the Red Sea, in the land of Edom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%27%%And Hiram sent in the navy his servants, shipmen that had knowledge of the sea, with the servants of Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%9%%28%%And they came to Ophir, and imported from thence gold, four hundred and twenty talents, and brought it to king Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%1%%And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of the LORD, she came to prove him with hard questions.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%2%%And she came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bore spices, and very much gold, and precious stones: and when she had come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%3%%And Solomon told her all her questions: there was not any thing hid from the king, which he told her not.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%4%%And when the queen of Sheba had seen all Solomon's wisdom, and the house that he had built,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%5%%And the provisions of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel, and his cup-bearers, and his ascent by which he went up to the house of the LORD; there was no more spirit in her.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%6%%And she said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in my own land of thy acts and of thy wisdom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%7%%Howbeit, I believed not the words, until I came, and my eyes had seen it: and behold, the half was not told me: thy wisdom and prosperity exceed the fame which I heard.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%8%%Happy are thy men, happy are these thy servants, who stand continually before thee, and that hear thy wisdom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%9%%Blessed be the LORD thy God, who delighted in thee, to set thee on the throne of Israel: because the LORD loved Israel for ever, therefore he made thee king, to do judgment and justice.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%10%%And she gave the king a hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices a very great quantity, and precious stones: there came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%11%%And the navy also of Hiram, that brought gold from Ophir, brought in from Ophir great plenty of almug trees, and precious stones.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%12%%And the king made of the almug trees pillars for the house of the LORD, and for the king's house, harps also and psalteries for singers: there came no such almug-trees, nor have they been seen to this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%13%%And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, besides that which Solomon gave her of his royal bounty. So she turned and went to her own country, she and her servants.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%14%%Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and sixty six talents of gold,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%15%%Besides what he had of the merchants, and of the traffic of the spice-merchants, and of all the kings of Arabia, and of the governors of the country.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%16%%And king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of gold went to one target.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%17%%And he made three hundred shields of beaten gold; three pounds of gold went to one shield: and the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%18%%Moreover, the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with the best gold.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%19%%The throne had six steps, and the top of the throne was round behind: and there were stays on either side on the place of the seat, and two lions stood beside the stays.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%20%%And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps: there was not the like made in any kingdom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%21%%And all king Solomon's drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold; none were of silver: it was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%22%%For the king had at sea a navy of Tharshish with the navy of Hiram: once in three years came the navy of Tharshish, bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%23%%So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth for riches and for wisdom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%24%%And all the earth sought to Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%25%%And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and garments, and armor, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%26%%And Solomon collected chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, whom he bestowed in the cities for chariots, and with the king at Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%27%%And the king made silver to be in Jerusalem as stones, and cedars he made to be as the sycamore trees that are in the vale, for abundance.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%28%%And Solomon had horses brought from Egypt, and linen yarn: the king's merchants received the linen yarn at a price.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%10%%29%%And a chariot came up and went out of Egypt for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty: and so for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, did they bring them out by their means.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%1%%But king Solomon loved many foreign women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Zidonians, and Hittites;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%2%%Of the nations concerning which the LORD said to the children of Israel, Ye shall not go in to them, neither shall they come in to you: for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods: Solomon cleaved to these in love.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%3%%And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%4%%For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods: and his heart was not perfect with the LORD his God, as was the heart of David his father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%5%%For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%6%%And Solomon did evil in the sight of the LORD, and went not fully after the LORD, as did David his father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%7%%Then Solomon built a high place for Chemosh, the abomination of Moab, in the hill that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech, the abomination of the children of Ammon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%8%%And likewise did he for all his foreign wives, who burnt incense and sacrificed to their gods.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%9%%And the LORD was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned from the LORD God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%10%%And had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he kept not that which the LORD commanded.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%11%%Wherefore the LORD said to Solomon, Forasmuch as this is done by thee, and thou hast not kept my covenant and my statutes which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend the kingdom from thee, and will give it to thy servant.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%12%%Notwithstanding, in thy days, I will not do it, for David thy father's sake: but I will rend it out of the hand of thy son.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%13%%Yet, I will not rend away all the kingdom; but will give one tribe to thy son for David my servant's sake, and for Jerusalem's sake which I have chosen.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%14%%And the LORD stirred up an adversary to Solomon, Hadad the Edomite: he was of the king's seed in Edom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%15%%For it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the host had gone up to bury the slain, after he had smitten every male in Edom;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%16%%(For six months did Joab remain there with all Israel, until he had cut off every male in Edom:)
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%17%%That Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father's servants with him, to go into Egypt; Hadad being yet a little child.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%18%%And they arose out of Midian, and came to Paran: and they took men with them from Paran, and they came to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt; who gave him a house, and appointed him victuals, and gave him land.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%19%%And Hadad found great favor in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him for a wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%20%%And the sister of Tahpenes bore him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh's house: and Genubath was in Pharaoh's household among the sons of Pharaoh.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%21%%And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the host was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to my own country.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%22%%Then Pharaoh said to him, But what hast thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seekest to go to thy own country? And he answered, Nothing: yet, in any wise let me go.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%23%%And God stirred him up another adversary, Rezon the son of Eliadah, who fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%24%%And he gathered men to him, and became captain over a band, when David slew them of Zobah: and they went to Damascus, and dwelt in it, and reigned in Damascus.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%25%%And he was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, besides the mischief that Hadad did: and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%26%%And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephrathite of Zereda, Solomon's servant, whose mother's name was Zeruah, a widow woman, even he raised his hand against the king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%27%%And this was the cause why he raised his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired the breaches of the city of David his father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%28%%And the man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valor: and Solomon, seeing the young man that he was industrious, he made him ruler over all the charge of the house of Joseph.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%29%%And it came to pass at that time when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; and he had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%30%%And Ahijah caught the new garment that was on him, and rent it in twelve pieces:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%31%%And he said to Jeroboam, Take thee ten pieces: for thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel, Behold, I will rend the kingdom from the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to thee:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%32%%(But he shall have one tribe for my servant David's sake, and for Jerusalem's sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel:)
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%33%%Because they have forsaken me, and have worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon, and have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in my eyes, and to keep my statutes and my judgments, as did David his father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%34%%Yet I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant's sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%35%%But I will take the kingdom out of his son's hand, and will give it to thee, even ten tribes.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%36%%And to his son will I give one tribe, that David my servant may have a light always before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen for me to put my name there.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%37%%And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth, and shalt be king over Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%38%%And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken to all that I command thee, and wilt walk in my ways, and do right in my sight, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with thee, and build thee a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel to thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%39%%And I will for this afflict the seed of David, but not for ever.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%40%%Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam. And Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, to Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%41%%And the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%42%%And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%11%%43%%And Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%1%%And Rehoboam went to Shechem: for all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%2%%And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who was yet in Egypt, heard of it, (for he had fled from the presence of king Solomon, and Jeroboam dwelt in Egypt;)
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%3%%That they sent and called him. And Jeroboam and all the congregation of Israel came, and spoke to Rehoboam, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%4%%Thy father made our yoke grievous: now therefore make thou the grievous service of thy father, and his heavy yoke which he put upon us, lighter, and we will serve thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%5%%And he said to them, Depart yet for three days, then come again to me. And the people departed.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%6%%And king Rehoboam consulted with the old men that stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, and said, How do ye advise that I may answer this people?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%7%%And they spoke to him, saying, If thou wilt be a servant to this people this day, and wilt serve them, and answer them, and speak good words to them, then they will be thy servants for ever.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%8%%But he forsook the counsel of the old men, which they had given him, and consulted with the young men that had grown up with him, and who stood before him:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%9%%And he said to them, What counsel give ye that we may answer this people, who have spoken to me, saying, Make the yoke which thy father did put upon us lighter?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%10%%And the young men that had grown up with him spoke to him, saying, Thus shalt thou speak to this people who spoke to thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter to us; thus shalt thou say to them, My little finger shall be thicker than my father's loins.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%11%%And now whereas my father burdened you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke: my father hath chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%12%%So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam the third day, as the king had appointed, saying, Come to me again the third day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%13%%And the king answered the people roughly, and forsook the old men's counsel that they gave him;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%14%%And spoke to them after the counsel of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, and I will add to your yoke: my father also chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%15%%Wherefore the king hearkened not to the people; for the cause was from the LORD, that he might perform his saying, which the LORD spoke by Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%16%%So when all Israel saw that the king hearkened not to them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: to your tents, O Israel: now see to thy own house, David. So Israel departed to their tents.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%17%%But as for the children of Israel who dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%18%%Then king Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was over the tribute; and all Israel stoned him with stones, that he died. Therefore king Rehoboam made speed to enter his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%19%%So Israel rebelled against the house of David to this day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%20%%And it came to pass when all Israel heard that Jeroboam had come again, that they sent and called him to the congregation, and made him king over all Israel: there was none that followed the house of David, but the tribe of Judah only.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%21%%And when Rehoboam had come to Jerusalem, he assembled all the house of Judah, with the tribe of Benjamin, a hundred and eighty thousand chosen men, who were warriors, to fight against the house of Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam the son of Solomon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%22%%But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%23%%Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon king of Judah, and to all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the remnant of the people, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%24%%Thus saith the LORD, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren the children of Israel: return every man to his house; for this thing is from me. They hearkened therefore to the word of the LORD, and returned to depart, according to the word of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%25%%Then Jeroboam built Shechem in mount Ephraim, and dwelt in it, and went out from thence, and built Penuel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%26%%And Jeroboam said in his heart, Now shall the kingdom return to the house of David:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%27%%If this people go up to perform sacrifice in the house of the LORD at Jerusalem, then shall the heart of this people turn again to their lord, even to Rehoboam king of Judah, and they shall kill me, and return to Rehoboam king of Judah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%28%%Upon which the king took counsel, and made two calves of gold, and said to them, It is too much for you to go up to Jerusalem: behold thy gods, O Israel, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%29%%And he set the one in Beth-el, and the other he placed in Dan.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%30%%And this thing became a sin: for the people went to worship before the one, even to Dan.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%31%%And he made a house of high places, and made priests of the lowest of the people, who were not of the sons of Levi.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%32%%And Jeroboam ordained a feast in the eighth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, like the feast that is in Judah, and he offered upon the altar. So did he in Beth-el, sacrificing to the calves that he had made: and he placed in Beth-el the priests of the high places which he had made.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%12%%33%%So he offered upon the altar which he had made in Beth-el the fifteenth day of the eighth month, even in the month which he had devised of his own heart; and ordained a feast to the children of Israel: and he offered upon the altar, and burnt incense.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%1%%And behold, there came a man of God out of Judah by the word of the LORD to Beth-el: and Jeroboam stood by the altar to burn incense.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%2%%And he cried against the altar in the word of the LORD, and said, O altar, altar, thus saith the LORD; Behold, a child shall be born to the house of David, Josiah by name; and upon thee shall he offer the priests of the high places that burn incense upon thee, and men's bones shall be burnt upon thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%3%%And he gave a sign the same day, saying, This is the sign which the LORD hath spoken; Behold, the altar shall be rent, and the ashes that are upon it shall be poured out.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%4%%And it came to pass when king Jeroboam heard the saying of the man of God, who had cried against the altar in Beth-el, that he put forth his hand from the altar, saying, Lay hold on him. And his hand, which he put forth against him, dried up, so that he could not draw it to him again.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%5%%The altar also was rent, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%6%%And the king answered and said to the man of God, Entreat now the face of the LORD thy God, and pray for me, that my hand may be restored to me again. And the man of God besought the LORD, and the king's hand was restored to him again, and became as it was before.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%7%%And the king said to the man of God, Come home with me, and refresh thyself, and I will give thee a reward.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%8%%And the man of God said to the king, If thou wilt give me half thy house, I will not go in with thee, neither will I eat bread nor drink water in this place:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%9%%For so was it charged me by the word of the LORD, saying, Eat no bread, nor drink water, nor turn again by the same way that thou camest.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%10%%So he went another way, and returned not by the way that he came to Beth-el.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%11%%Now there dwelt an old prophet in Beth-el; and his sons came and told him all the works that the man of God had done that day in Beth-el: the words which he had spoken to the king, them they told also to their father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%12%%And their father said to them, What way went he? for his sons had seen what way the man of God went, who came from Judah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%13%%And he said to his sons, Saddle me the ass. So they saddled him the ass: and he rode upon it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%14%%And went after the man of God, and found him sitting under an oak: and he said to him, Art thou the man of God that camest from Judah? And he said, I am.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%15%%Then he said to him, Come home with me, and eat bread.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%16%%And he said, I may not return with thee, nor go in with thee: neither will I eat bread nor drink water with thee in this place:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%17%%For it was said to me by the word of the LORD, Thou shalt eat no bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that thou camest.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%18%%He said to him, I am a prophet also as thou art; and an angel spoke to me by the word of the LORD, saying, Bring him back with thee into thy house, that he may eat bread and drink water. But he lied to him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%19%%So he went back with him, and ate bread in his house, and drank water.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%20%%And it came to pass, as they sat at the table, that the word of the LORD came to the prophet that brought him back:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%21%%And he cried to the man of God that came from Judah, saying, Thus saith the LORD, Forasmuch as thou hast disobeyed the mouth of the LORD, and hast not kept the commandment which the LORD thy God commanded thee,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%22%%But hast returned, and hast eaten bread and drank water in the place, of which the LORD said to thee, Eat no bread, and drink no water; thy carcass shall not come to the sepulcher of thy fathers.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%23%%And it came to pass, after he had eaten bread, and after he had drank, that he saddled for him the ass, to wit, for the prophet whom he had brought back.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%24%%And when he had gone, a lion met him by the way, and slew him: and his carcass was cast in the way, and the ass stood by it, the lion also stood by the carcass.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%25%%And behold, men passed by, and saw the carcass cast in the way, and the lion standing by the carcass: and they came and told it in the city where the old prophet dwelt.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%26%%And when the prophet that brought him back from the way heard of it, he said, It is the man of God, who was disobedient to the word of the LORD: therefore the LORD hath delivered him to the lion, which hath torn him, and slain him, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke to him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%27%%And he spoke to his sons, saying, Saddle me the ass. And they saddled him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%28%%And he went and found his carcass cast in the way, and the ass and the lion standing by the carcass: the lion had not eaten the carcass, nor torn the ass.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%29%%And the prophet took up the carcass of the man of God, and laid it upon the ass, and brought it back: and the old prophet came to the city, to mourn and to bury him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%30%%And he laid his carcass in his own grave; and they mourned over him, saying, Alas, my brother!
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%31%%And it came to pass, after he had buried him, that he spoke to his sons, saying, When I am dead, then bury me in the sepulcher in which the man of God is buried; lay my bones beside his bones:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%32%%For the saying which he cried by the word of the LORD against the altar in Beth-el, and against all the houses of the high places which are in the cities of Samaria, shall surely come to pass.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%33%%After this thing Jeroboam returned not from his evil way, but made again of the lowest of the people priests of the high places: whoever would, he consecrated him, and he became one of the priests of the high places.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%13%%34%%And this thing became sin to the house of Jeroboam, even to cut it off, and to destroy it from the face of the earth.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%1%%At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam fell sick.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%2%%And Jeroboam said to his wife, Arise, I pray thee, and disguise thyself, that thou mayest not be known to be the wife of Jeroboam; and go to Shiloh: behold, there is Ahijah the prophet, who told me that I should be king over this people.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%3%%And take with thee ten loaves, and cracknels, and a cruse of honey, and go to him: he will tell thee what shall become of the child.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%4%%And Jeroboam's wife did so, and arose, and went to Shiloh, and came to the house of Ahijah. But Ahijah could not see; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%5%%And the LORD said to Ahijah, Behold, the wife of Jeroboam cometh to ask a thing of thee for her son; for he is sick: thus and thus shalt thou say to her: for it shall be, when she cometh in, that she will feign herself to be another woman.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%6%%And it was so, when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet, as she came in at the door, that he said, Come in, thou wife of Jeroboam; why feignest thou thyself to be another? for I am sent to thee with heavy tidings.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%7%%Go, tell Jeroboam, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Forasmuch as I exalted thee from among the people, and made thee prince over my people Israel,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%8%%And rent the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it to thee: and yet thou hast not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments, and who followed me with all his heart, to do that only which was right in my eyes;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%9%%But hast done evil above all that were before thee: for thou hast gone and made thee other gods, and molten images, to provoke me to anger, and hast cast me behind thy back:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%10%%Therefore behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam, and will cut off from Jeroboam the males, and him that is shut up and left in Israel, and will take away the remnant of the house of Jeroboam, as a man taketh away dung, till it is all gone.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%11%%Him that dieth of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat; and him that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat: for the LORD hath spoken it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%12%%Arise thou therefore, depart to thy own house: and when thy feet enter into the city, the child shall die.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%13%%And all Israel shall mourn for him, and bury him: for he only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave, because in him there is found some good thing towards the LORD God of Israel in the house of Jeroboam.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%14%%Moreover, the LORD shall raise him up a king over Israel, who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam that day: but what? even now.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%15%%For the LORD will smite Israel, as a reed is shaken in the water, and he will root up Israel out of this good land, which he gave to their fathers, and will scatter them beyond the river, because they have made their groves, provoking the LORD to anger.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%16%%And he will give up Israel because of the sins of Jeroboam, who sinned, and who made Israel to sin.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%17%%And Jeroboam's wife arose, and departed, and came to Tirzah: and when she came to the threshhold of the door, the child died;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%18%%And they buried him; and all Israel mourned for him, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke by the hand of his servant Ahijah the prophet.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%19%%And the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he warred, and how he reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%20%%And the days which Jeroboam reigned were two and twenty years: and he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%21%%And Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty and one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the LORD chose out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. And his mother's name was Naamah an Ammonitess.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%22%%And Judah did evil in the sight of the LORD, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins which they had committed, above all that their fathers had done.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%23%%For they also built for themselves high places, and images and groves, on every high hill, and under every green tree.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%24%%And there were also sodomites in the land: and they did according to all the abominations of the nations which the LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%25%%And it came to pass in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%26%%And he took away the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king's house; he even took away all; and he took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%27%%And king Rehoboam made in their stead brazen shields, and committed them to the hands of the chief of the guard, who kept the door of the king's house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%28%%And it was so, when the king went into the house of the LORD, that the guard bore them, and brought them back into the guard chamber.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%29%%Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%30%%And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all their days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%14%%31%%And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And his mother's name was Naamah an Ammonitess. And Abijam his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%1%%Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat reigned Abijam over Judah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%2%%Three years he reigned in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%3%%And he walked in all the sins of his father, which he had done before him: and his heart was not perfect with the LORD his God, as the heart of David his father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%4%%Nevertheless, for David's sake the LORD his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, to set up his son after him, and to establish Jerusalem:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%5%%Because David did that which was right in the eyes of the LORD, and turned not aside from any thing that he commanded him all the days of his life, save only in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%6%%And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%7%%Now the rest of the acts of Abijam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%8%%And Abijam slept with his fathers; and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%9%%And in the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel reigned Asa over Judah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%10%%And forty and one years reigned he in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Maachah, the daughter of Abishalom.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%11%%And Asa did that which was right in the eyes of the LORD, as did David his father.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%12%%And he banished the sodomites from the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%13%%And also Maachah his mother, even her he removed from being queen, because she had made an idol in a grove; and Asa destroyed her idol, and burnt it by the brook Kidron.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%14%%But the high places were not removed: nevertheless Asa's heart was perfect with the LORD all his days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%15%%And he brought the things which his father had dedicated, and the things which himself had dedicated, into the house of the LORD, silver, and gold, and vessels.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%16%%And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%17%%And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not suffer any to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%18%%Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king's house, and delivered them into the hand of his servants: and king Asa sent them to Ben-hadad, the son of Tabrimon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%19%%There is a league between me and thee, and between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent to thee a present of silver and gold; come and break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%20%%So Ben-hadad hearkened to king Asa, and sent the captains of the armies which he had against the cities of Israel, and smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abel-beth-maachah, and all Cinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%21%%And it came to pass, when Baasha heard of it, that he left off building of Ramah, and dwelt in Tirzah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%22%%Then king Asa made a proclamation throughout all Judah; none was exempted: and they took away the stones of Ramah, and its timber, with which Baasha had built it; and king Asa built with them Geba of Benjamin, and Mizpah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%23%%The rest of all the acts of Asa, and all his might, and all that he did, and the cities which he built, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah? Nevertheless in the time of his old age he was diseased in his feet.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%24%%And Asa slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%25%%And Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned over Israel two years.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%26%%And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%27%%And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines; for Nadab and all Israel laid siege to Gibbethon.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%28%%Even in the third year of Asa king of Judah did Baasha slay him, and reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%29%%And it came to pass, when he reigned, that he smote all the house of Jeroboam; he left not to Jeroboam any that breathed, until he had destroyed him, according to the saying of the LORD, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%30%%Because of the sins of Jeroboam which he sinned, and which he made Israel sin, by his provocation with which he provoked the LORD God of Israel to anger.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%31%%Now the rest of the acts of Nadab, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%32%%And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%33%%In the third year of Asa king of Judah began Baasha the son of Ahijah to reign over all Israel in Tirzah, twenty and four years.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%15%%34%%And he did evil in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%1%%Then the word of the LORD came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%2%%Forasmuch as I exalted thee from the dust, and made thee prince over my people Israel; and thou hast walked in the way of Jeroboam, and hast made my people Israel to sin, to provoke me to anger with their sins;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%3%%Behold, I will take away the posterity of Baasha, and the posterity of his house; and will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%4%%Him that dieth of Baasha in the city shall the dogs eat; and him that dieth of his in the fields shall the fowls of the air eat.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%5%%Now the rest of the acts of Baasha, and what he did, and his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%6%%So Baasha slept with his fathers, and was buried in Tirzah: and Elah his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%7%%And also by the hand of the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani came the word of the LORD against Baasha, and against his house, even for all the evil that he did in the sight of the LORD, in provoking him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam; and because he killed him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%8%%In the twenty and sixth year of Asa king of Judah began Elah the son of Baasha to reign over Israel in Tirzah, two years.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%9%%And his servant Zimri, captain of half his chariots, conspired against him, as he was in Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza steward of his house in Tirzah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%10%%And Zimri went in and smote him, and killed him, in the twenty and seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%11%%And it came to pass, when he began to reign, as soon as he sat on his throne, that he slew all the house of Baasha: he left him not one male, neither of his kinsman, nor of his friends.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%12%%Thus did Zimri destroy all the house of Baasha, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke against Baasha, by Jehu the prophet,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%13%%For all the sins of Baasha, and the sins of Elah his son, by which they sinned, and by which they made Israel to sin, in provoking the LORD God of Israel to anger with their vanities.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%14%%Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%15%%In the twenty and seventh year of Asa king of Judah did Zimri reign seven days in Tirzah. And the people were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%16%%And the people that were encamped heard it said, Zimri hath conspired, and hath also slain the king: wherefore all Israel made Omri, the captain of the host, king over Israel that day in the camp.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%17%%And Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%18%%And it came to pass, when Zimri saw that the city was taken, that he went into the palace of the king's house, and burnt the king's house over him with fire, and died,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%19%%For his sins which he sinned in doing evil in the sight of the LORD, in walking in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin which he did, to make Israel to sin.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%20%%Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and his treason that he wrought, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%21%%Then were the people of Israel divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king; and half followed Omri.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%22%%But the people that followed Omri prevailed against the people that followed Tibni the son of Ginath: so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%23%%In the thirty and first year of Asa king of Judah began Omri to reign over Israel, twelve years: six years reigned he in Tirzah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%24%%And he bought the hill Samaria of Shemer for two talents of silver, and built on the hill, and called the name of the city which he built, after the name of Shemer, owner of the hill, Samaria.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%25%%But Omri wrought evil in the eyes of the LORD, and did worse than all that were before him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%26%%For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin, to provoke the LORD God of Israel to anger with their vanities.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%27%%Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did, and his might that he showed, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%28%%So Omri slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria: and Ahab his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%29%%And in the thirty and eighth year of Asa king of Judah began Ahab the son of Omri to reign over Israel: and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria twenty and two years.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%30%%And Ahab the son of Omri did evil in the sight of the LORD above all that were before him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%31%%And it came to pass, as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, that he took to wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Zidonians, and went and served Baal, and worshiped him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%32%%And he erected an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he had built in Samaria.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%33%%And Ahab made a grove; and Ahab did more to provoke the LORD God of Israel to anger than all the kings of Israel that were before him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%16%%34%%In his days Hiel the Beth-elite built Jericho: he laid the foundation of it in Abiram his first-born, and set up the gates of it in his youngest son Segub, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke by Joshua the son of Nun.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%1%%And Elijah the Tishbite who was of the inhabitants of Gilead, said to Ahab, As the LORD God of Israel liveth, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%2%%And the word of the LORD came to him, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%3%%Depart hence, and turn thee eastward, and hide thyself by the brook Cherith, that is before Jordan.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%4%%And it shall be, that thou shalt drink of the brook; and I have commanded the ravens to feed thee there.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%5%%So he went and did according to the word of the LORD: for he went and dwelt by the brook Cherith, that is before Jordan.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%6%%And the ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morning, and bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%7%%And it came to pass after a while, that the brook dried up, because there had been no rain in the land.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%8%%And the word of the LORD came to him, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%9%%Arise, go to Zarephath, which belongeth to Zidon, and dwell there: behold, I have commanded a widow woman there to sustain thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%10%%So he arose and went to Zarephath. And when he came to the gate of the city, behold, the widow woman was there gathering sticks: and he called to her, and said, Bring me, I pray thee, a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%11%%And as she was going to bring it, he called to her, and said, Bring me, I pray thee, a morsel of bread in thy hand.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%12%%And she said, As the LORD thy God liveth, I have not a cake, but a handful of meal in a barrel, and a little oil in a cruse: and behold, I am gathering two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for me and my son, that we may eat it, and die.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%13%%And Elijah said to her, Fear not; go and do as thou hast said: but make me of it a little cake first, and bring it to me, and afterward make for thee and for thy son.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%14%%For thus saith the LORD God of Israel, The barrel of meal shall not waste, neither shall the cruse of oil fail, until the day that the LORD sendeth rain upon the earth.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%15%%And she went and did according to the saying of Elijah: and she, and he, and her house, did eat many days.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%16%%And the barrel of meal wasted not, neither did the cruse of oil fail, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke by Elijah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%17%%And it came to pass after these things that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and his sickness was so severe, that there was no breath left in him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%18%%And she said to Elijah, What have I to do with thee, O thou man of God? art thou come to me to call my sin to remembrance, and to slay my son?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%19%%And he said to her, Give me thy son. And he took him out of her bosom, and carried him up into a loft, where he abode, and laid him upon his own bed.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%20%%And he cried to the LORD, and said, O LORD my God, hast thou also brought evil upon the widow with whom I sojourn, by slaying her son?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%21%%And he stretched himself upon the child three times, and cried to the LORD, and said, O LORD my God, I pray thee, let this child's soul come into him again.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%22%%And the LORD heard the voice of Elijah; and the soul of the child came into him again, and he revived.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%23%%And Elijah took the child, and brought him down from the chamber into the house, and delivered him to his mother: and Elijah said, See, thy son liveth.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%17%%24%%And the woman said to Elijah, Now by this I know that thou art a man of God, and that the word of the LORD in thy mouth is truth.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%1%%And it came to pass after many days, that the word of the LORD came to Elijah in the third year, saying, Go, show thyself to Ahab; and I will send rain upon the earth.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%2%%And Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. And there was a grievous famine in Samaria.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%3%%And Ahab called Obadiah who was the governor of his house. (Now Obadiah feared the LORD greatly:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%4%%For it was so, when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the LORD, that Obadiah took a hundred prophets, and hid them by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water.)
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%5%%And Ahab said to Obadiah, Go into the land, to all fountains of water, and to all brooks: it may be we may find grass to save the horses and mules alive, that we lose not all the beasts.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%6%%So they divided the land between them to pass throughout it: Ahab went one way by himself, and Obadiah went another way by himself.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%7%%And as Obadiah was in the way, behold, Elijah met him: and he knew him, and fell on his face, and said, Art thou that my lord Elijah?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%8%%And he answered him, I am: go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%9%%And he said, What have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliver thy servant into the hand of Ahab to slay me?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%10%%As the LORD thy God liveth, there is no nation nor kingdom, whither my lord hath not sent to seek thee: and when they said, He is not there; he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they found thee not.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%11%%And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%12%%And it will come to pass, as soon as I have gone from thee, that the Spirit of the LORD will carry thee whither I know not; and so when I come and tell Ahab, and he cannot find thee, he will slay me: but I thy servant fear the LORD from my youth.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%13%%Was it not told my lord what I did when Jezebel slew the prophets of the LORD, how I hid a hundred men of the LORD'S prophets by fifty in a cave, and fed them with bread and water?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%14%%And now thou sayest, Go, tell thy lord, Behold, Elijah is here: and he will slay me.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%15%%And Elijah said, As the LORD of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him to-day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%16%%So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him; and Ahab went to meet Elijah.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%17%%And it came to pass, when Ahab saw Elijah, that Ahab said to him, Art thou he that troubleth Israel?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%18%%And he answered, I have not troubled Israel; but thou, and thy father's house, in that ye have forsaken the commandments of the LORD, and thou hast followed Baalim.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%19%%Now therefore send, and gather to me all Israel to mount Carmel, and the prophets of Baal four hundred and fifty, and the prophets of the groves four hundred, who eat at Jezebel's table.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%20%%So Ahab sent to all the children of Israel, and gathered the prophets to mount Carmel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%21%%And Elijah came to all the people, and said, How long halt ye between two opinions? if the LORD is God, follow him: but if Baal, then follow him. And the people answered him not a word.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%22%%Then said Elijah to the people, I even I only, remain a prophet of the LORD; but Baal's prophet's are four hundred and fifty men.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%23%%Let them therefore give us two bullocks; and let them choose one bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on wood, and put no fire under: and I will dress the other bullock, and lay it on wood, and put no fire under:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%24%%And call ye on the name of your gods, and I will call on the name of the LORD: and the God that answereth by fire, let him be God. And all the people answered and said, It is well spoken.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%25%%And Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress it first; for ye are many; and call on the name of your gods, but put no fire under.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%26%%And they took the bullock which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, O Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any that answered. And they leaped upon the altar which was made.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%27%%And it came to pass at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, Cry aloud: for he is a god; either he is talking, or he is pursuing, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he sleepeth, and must be awaked.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%28%%And they cried aloud, and cut themselves after their manner with knives and lancets, till the blood gushed out upon them.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%29%%And it came to pass, when mid-day was past, and they prophesied until the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that there was neither voice, nor any to answer, nor any that regarded.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%30%%And Elijah said to all the people, Come near to me. And all the people came near to him. And he repaired the altar of the LORD that was broken down.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%31%%And Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of the LORD came, saying, Israel shall be thy name:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%32%%And with the stones he built an altar in the name of the LORD: and he made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two measures of seed.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%33%%And he put the wood in order, and cut the bullock in pieces, and laid him on the wood, and said, Fill four barrels with water, and pour it on the burnt-sacrifice, and on the wood.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%34%%And he said, Do it the second time. And they did it the second time. And he said, Do it the third time. And they did it the third time.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%35%%And the water ran around the altar; and he filled the trench also with water.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%36%%And it came to pass at the time of the offering of the evening sacrifice, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that thou art God in Israel, and that I am thy servant, and that I have done all these things at thy word.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%37%%Hear me, O LORD, hear me, that this people may know that thou art the LORD God, and that thou hast turned their heart back again.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%38%%Then the fire of the LORD fell, and consumed the burnt-sacrifice, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%39%%And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces: and they said, The LORD, he is the God; the LORD, he is the God.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%40%%And Elijah said to them, Take the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape. And they took them: and Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon, and slew them there.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%41%%And Elijah said to Ahab, Go up, eat and drink; for there is a sound of abundance of rain.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%42%%So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Carmel; and he cast himself down upon the earth, and put his face between his knees,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%43%%And said to his servant, Go up now, look towards the sea. And he went up and looked, and said, There is nothing. And he said, Go again seven times.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%44%%And it came to pass at the seventh time, that he said, Behold, there ariseth a little cloud out of the sea, like a man's hand. And he said, Go up, say to Ahab, Prepare thy chariot, and go down, that the rain may not hinder thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%45%%And it came to pass in the mean while, that the heaven was black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%18%%46%%And the hand of the LORD was on Elijah; and he girded his loins, and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%1%%And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and how he had slain all the prophets with the sword.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%2%%Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, So let the gods do to me, and more also, if I make not thy life as the life of one of them by to-morrow about this time.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%3%%And when he saw that, he arose, and went for his life, and came to Beer-sheba, which belongeth to Judah, and left his servant there.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%4%%But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness, and came and sat down under a juniper-tree: and he requested for himself that he might die; and said, It is enough; now, O LORD, take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%5%%And as he lay and slept under a juniper-tree, behold, then an angel touched him, and said to him, Arise and eat.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%6%%And he looked, and behold, there was a cake baked on the coals, and a cruse of water at his head. And he ate and drank, and laid himself down again.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%7%%And the angel of the LORD came again the second time, and touched him, and said, Arise and eat, because the journey is too great for thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%8%%And he arose, and ate and drank, and went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb the mount of God.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%9%%And he came thither to a cave, and lodged there; and behold, the word of the LORD came to him, and he said to him, What doest thou here, Elijah?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%10%%And he said, I have been very jealous for the LORD God of hosts: for the children of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, thrown down thy altars, and slain thy prophets with the sword; and I, I only, am left; and they seek my life to take it away.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%11%%And he said, Go forth, and stand upon the mount before the LORD. And behold, the LORD passed by, and a great and strong wind rent the mountains, and broke in pieces the rocks before the LORD; but the LORD was not in the wind: and after the wind an earthquake; but the LORD was not in the earthquake:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%12%%And after the earthquake a fire; but the LORD was not in the fire: and after the fire a still small voice.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%13%%And it was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle, and went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. And behold, there came a voice to him, and said, What doest thou here, Elijah?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%14%%And he said, I have been very jealous for the LORD God of hosts: because the children of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, thrown down thy altars, and slain thy prophets with the sword; and I, I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%15%%And the LORD said to him, Go, return on thy way to the wilderness of Damascus: and when thou comest, anoint Hazael to be king over Syria:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%16%%And Jehu the son of Nimshi shalt thou anoint to be king over Israel: and Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah shalt thou anoint to be prophet in thy room.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%17%%And it shall come to pass, that him that escapeth the sword of Hazael shall Jehu slay: and him that escapeth from the sword of Jehu shall Elisha slay.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%18%%Yet I have left to me seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed to Baal, and every mouth which hath not kissed him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%19%%So he departed thence, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing with twelve yoke of oxen before him, and he with the twelfth: and Elijah passed by him, and cast his mantle upon him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%20%%And he left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said, Let me, I pray thee, kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow thee. And he said to him, Go back again: for what have I done to thee?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%19%%21%%And he returned back from him, and took a yoke of oxen, and slew them, and boiled their flesh with the instruments of the oxen, and gave to the people, and they ate. Then he arose, and went after Elijah, and ministered to him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%1%%And Ben-hadad the king of Syria collected all his army: and there were thirty and two kings with him, and horses, and chariots: and he went up and besieged Samaria, and warred against it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%2%%And he sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel into the city, and said to him, Thus saith Ben-hadad,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%3%%Thy silver and thy gold is mine; thy wives also and thy children, even the most comely, are mine.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%4%%And the king of Israel answered and said, My lord, O king, according to thy saying, I am thine, and all that I have.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%5%%And the messengers came again, and said, Thus speaketh Ben-hadad, saying, Although I have sent to thee, saying, Thou shalt deliver to me thy silver, and thy gold, and thy wives, and thy children;
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%6%%Yet I will send my servants to thee to-morrow about this time, and they shall search thy house, and the houses of thy servants; and it shall be, that whatever is pleasant in thy eyes, they shall take it in their hand, and carry it away.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%7%%Then the king of Israel called all the elders of the land, and said, Mark, I pray you, and see how this man seeketh mischief: for he sent to me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and for my gold, and I denied him not.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%8%%And all the elders and all the people said to him, Hearken not to him, nor consent.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%9%%Wherefore he said to the messengers of Ben-hadad, Tell my lord the king, All that thou didst send for to thy servant at the first, I will do: but this thing I may not do. And the messengers departed, and brought him word again.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%10%%And Ben-hadad sent to him, and said, The gods do so to me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people that follow me.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%11%%And the king of Israel answered and said, Tell him, Let not him that girdeth on his harness boast himself as he that putteth it off.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%12%%And it came to pass, when Ben-hadad heard this message as he was drinking, he and the kings in the pavilions, that he said to his servants, Set yourselves in array. And they set themselves in array against the city.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%13%%And behold, there came a prophet to Ahab king of Israel, saying, Thus saith the LORD, Hast thou seen all this great multitude? behold, I will deliver it into thy hand this day; and thou shalt know that I am the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%14%%And Ahab said, By whom? And he said, Thus saith the LORD, Even by the young men of the princes of the provinces. Then he said, Who shall order the battle? And he answered, Thou.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%15%%Then he numbered the young men of the princes of the provinces, and they were two hundred and thirty two: and after them he numbered all the people, even all the children of Israel, being seven thousand.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%16%%And they went out at noon. But Ben-hadad was drinking himself drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirty and two kings that helped him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%17%%And the young men of the princes of the provinces went out first; and Ben-hadad sent out, and they told him, saying, There are men come out of Samaria.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%18%%And he said, Whether they have come out for peace, take them alive; or whether they have come out for war, take them alive.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%19%%So these young men of the princes of the provinces came out of the city, and the army which followed them.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%20%%And they slew every one his man: and the Syrians fled; and Israel pursued them: and Ben-hadad the king of Syria escaped on a horse with the horsemen.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%21%%And the king of Israel went out, and smote the horses and chariots, and slew the Syrians with a great slaughter.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%22%%And the prophet came to the king of Israel, and said to him, Go, strengthen thyself, and mark, and see what thou doest: for at the return of the year the king of Syria will come up against thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%23%%And the servants of the king of Syria said to him, Their gods are gods of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we; but let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%24%%And do this thing, Take the kings away, every man out of his place, and put captains in their rooms:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%25%%And number thee an army, like the army that thou hast lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot: and we will fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they. And he hearkened to their voice, and did so.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%26%%And it came to pass at the return of the year, that Ben-hadad numbered the Syrians, and went up to Aphek, to fight against Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%27%%And the children of Israel were numbered, and were all present, and went against them: and the children of Israel encamped before them like two little flocks of kids; but the Syrians filled the country.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%28%%And there came a man of God, and spoke to the king of Israel, and said, Thus saith the LORD, Because the Syrians have said, The LORD is God of the hills, but he is not God of the valleys, therefore will I deliver all this great multitude into thy hand, and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%29%%And they encamped one over against the other seven days. And so it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined: and the children of Israel slew of the Syrians a hundred thousand footmen in one day.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%30%%But the rest fled to Aphek, into the city; and there a wall fell upon twenty and seven thousand of the men that were left. And Ben-hadad fled, and came into the city, into an inner chamber.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%31%%And his servants said to him, Behold now, we have heard that the kings of the house of Israel are merciful kings: let us, I pray thee, put sackcloth on our loins, and ropes upon our heads, and go out to the king of Israel: it may be he will save thy life.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%32%%So they girded sackcloth on their loins, and put ropes on their heads, and came to the king of Israel, and said, Thy servant Ben-hadad saith, I pray thee, let me live. And he said, Is he yet alive? he is my brother.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%33%%Now the men diligently observed whether any thing would come from him, and did hastily catch it: and they said, Thy brother Ben-hadad. Then he said, Go ye, bring him. Then Ben-hadad came forth to him; and he caused him to come up into the chariot.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%34%%And Ben-hadad said to him, The cities, which my father took from thy father, I will restore; and thou shalt make streets for thee in Damascus, as my father made in Samaria. Then said Ahab, I will send thee away with this covenant. So he made a covenant with him, and sent him away.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%35%%And a certain man of the sons of the prophets said to his neighbor in the word of the LORD, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man refused to smite him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%36%%Then said he to him, Because thou hast not obeyed the voice of the LORD, behold, as soon as thou hast departed from me, a lion will slay thee. And as soon as he had departed from him, a lion found him, and slew him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%37%%Then he found another man, and said, Smite me, I pray thee. And the man smote him, so that in smiting he wounded him.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%38%%So the prophet departed, and waited for the king by the way, and disguised himself with ashes upon his face.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%39%%And as the king passed by, he cried to the king: and he said, Thy servant went out into the midst of the battle; and behold, a man turned aside, and brought a man to me, and said, Keep this man: if by any means he shall be missing, then shall thy life be for his life, or else thou shalt pay a talent of silver.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%40%%And as thy servant was busy here and there, he was gone. And the king of Israel said to him, So shall thy judgment be; thyself hast decided it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%41%%And he hasted, and took the ashes away from his face; and the king of Israel discerned him that he was of the prophets.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%42%%And he said to him, Thus saith the LORD, Because thou hast let go out of thy hand a man whom I appointed to utter destruction, therefore thy life shall go for his life, and thy people for his people.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%20%%43%%And the king of Israel went to his house heavy and displeased, and came to Samaria.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%1%%And it came to pass after these things, that Naboth the Jezreelite had a vineyard, which was in Jezreel, hard by the palace of Ahab king of Samaria.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%2%%And Ahab spoke to Naboth, saying, Give me thy vineyard, that I may have it for a garden of herbs, because it is near to my house: and I will give thee for it a better vineyard than it; or if it seemeth good to thee, I will give thee the worth of it in money.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%3%%And Naboth said to Ahab, The LORD forbid it me, that I should give the inheritance of my fathers to thee.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%4%%And Ahab came into his house heavy and displeased, because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him: for he had said, I will not give thee the inheritance of my fathers. And he laid himself down upon his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no bread.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%5%%But Jezebel his wife came to him, and said to him, Why is thy spirit so sad, that thou eatest no bread?
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%6%%And he said to her, Because I spoke to Naboth the Jezreelite, and said to him, Give me thy vineyard for money; or else, if it pleaseth thee, I will give thee another vineyard for it: and he answered, I will not give thee my vineyard.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%7%%And Jezebel his wife said to him, Dost thou now govern the kingdom of Israel? arise, and eat bread, and let thy heart be merry: I will give thee the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%8%%So she wrote letters in Ahab's name, and sealed them with his seal, and sent the letters to the elders and to the nobles that were in his city, dwelling with Naboth.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%9%%And she wrote in the letters, saying, Proclaim a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people:
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%10%%And set two men, sons of Belial, before him, to bear witness against him, saying, Thou didst blaspheme God and the king. And then carry him out, and stone him, that he may die.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%11%%And the men of his city, even the elders and the nobles who were the inhabitants in his city, did as Jezebel had sent to them, and as it was written in the letters which she had sent to them.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%12%%They proclaimed a fast, and set Naboth on high among the people.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%13%%And there came in two men, children of Belial, and sat before him: and the men of Belial witnessed against him, even against Naboth, in the presence of the people, saying, Naboth blasphemed God and the king. Then they carried him forth out of the city, and stoned him with stones, that he died.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%14%%Then they sent to Jezebel, saying, Naboth is stoned, and is dead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%15%%And it came to pass, when Jezebel heard that Naboth was stoned, and was dead, that Jezebel said to Ahab, Arise, take possession of the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, which he refused to give thee for money: for Naboth is not alive, but dead.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%16%%And it came to pass, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab arose to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%17%%And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%18%%Arise, go down to meet Ahab king of Israel, who is in Samaria: behold, he is in the vineyard of Naboth, whither he is gone down to possess it.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%19%%And thou shalt speak to him, saying, Thus saith the LORD, Hast thou killed, and also taken possession? And thou shalt speak to him, saying, Thus saith the LORD, In the place where dogs licked the blood of Naboth shall dogs lick thy blood, even thine.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%20%%And Ahab said to Elijah, Hast thou found me, O my enemy? And he answered, I have found thee: because thou hast sold thyself to work evil in the sight of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%21%%Behold, I will bring evil upon thee, and will take away thy posterity, and will cut off from Ahab the males, and him that is shut up and left in Israel,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%22%%And will make thy house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and like the house of Baasha the son of Ahijah, for the provocation with which thou hast provoked me to anger, and made Israel to sin.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%23%%And of Jezebel also spoke the LORD, saying, the dogs shall eat Jezebel by the wall of Jezreel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%24%%Him that dieth of Ahab in the city the dogs shall eat; and him that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%25%%But there was none like Ahab, who sold himself to work wickedness in the sight of the LORD, whom Jezebel his wife instigated.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%26%%And he did very abominably in following idols, according to all things as did the Amorites, whom the LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%27%%And it came to pass, when Ahab heard those words, that he rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his flesh, and fasted, and lay in sackcloth, and went softly.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%28%%And the word of the LORD came to Elijah the Tishbite, saying,
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%21%%29%%Seest thou how Ahab humbleth himself before me? because he humbleth himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days: but in his son's days will I bring the evil upon his house.
1000005%%1 Kings%%OT%%22%%1%%And they continued three years without war between Syria and Israel.
