1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%4%%And the king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea: for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt, and brought no present to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year: therefore the king of Assyria shut him up, and bound him in prison.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%5%%Then the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land, and went up to Samaria, and besieged it three years.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%6%%In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria took Samaria, and carried Israel away into Assyria, and placed them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%7%%For so it was, that the children of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God, who had brought them out of the land of Egypt, from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and had feared other gods,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%8%%And walked in the statutes of the heathen, whom the LORD cast out from before the children of Israel, and of the kings of Israel which they had made.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%9%%And the children of Israel did secretly things that were not right against the LORD their God, and they built for themselves high places in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%10%%And they set up for themselves images and groves on every high hill, and under every green tree:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%11%%And there they burnt incense on all the high places, as did the heathen whom the LORD carried away before them; and wrought wicked things to provoke the LORD to anger:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%12%%For they served idols, of which the LORD had said to them, Ye shall not do this thing.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%13%%Yet the LORD testified against Israel, and against Judah, by all the prophets, and by all the seers, saying, Turn ye from your evil ways, and keep my commandments and my statutes, according to all the law which I commanded your fathers, and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%14%%Notwithstanding, they would not hear, but hardened their necks, like the neck of their fathers, that did not believe in the LORD their God.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%15%%And they rejected his statutes, and his covenant that he made with their fathers, and his testimonies which he testified against them; and they followed vanity, and became vain, and went after the heathen that were around them, concerning whom the LORD had charged them, that they should not do like them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%16%%And they left all the commandments of the LORD their God, and made for themselves molten images, even two calves, and made a grove, and worshiped all the host of heaven, and served Baal.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%17%%And they caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire, and used divination and enchantments, and sold themselves to do evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%18%%Therefore the LORD was very angry with Israel, and removed them out of his sight: there was none left but the tribe of Judah only.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%19%%Also Judah kept not the commandments of the LORD their God, but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%20%%And the LORD rejected all the seed of Israel, and afflicted them, and delivered them into the hand of spoilers, until he had cast them out of his sight.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%21%%For he rent Israel from the house of David; and they made Jeroboam the son of Nebat king: and Jeroboam drove Israel from following the LORD, and made them sin a great sin.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%22%%For the children of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he did; they departed not from them;
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%23%%Until the LORD removed Israel out of his sight, as he had said by all his servants the prophets. So was Israel carried away out of their own land to Assyria to this day.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%24%%And the king of Assyria brought men from Babylon, and from Cuthah, and from Ava, and from Hamath, and from Sepharvaim, and placed them in the cities of Samaria instead of the children of Israel: and they possessed Samaria, and dwelt in its cities.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%25%%And so it was at the beginning of their dwelling there, that they feared not the LORD: therefore the LORD sent lions among them, which slew some of them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%26%%Wherefore they spoke to the king of Assyria, saying, The nations which thou hast removed, and placed in the cities of Samaria, know not the manner of the God of the land: therefore he hath sent lions among them, and behold, they slay them, because they know not the manner of the God of the land.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%27%%Then the king of Assyria commanded, saying, Carry thither one of the priests whom ye brought from thence; and let them go and dwell there, and let him teach them the manner of the God of the land.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%28%%Then one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and dwelt in Beth-el, and taught them how they should fear the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%29%%Yet, every nation made gods of their own, and put them in the houses of the high places which the Samaritans had made, every nation in their cities in which they dwelt.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%30%%And the men of Babylon made Succoth-benoth, and the men of Cuth made Nergal, and the men of Hamath made Ashima,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%31%%And the Avites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burnt their children in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%32%%So they feared the LORD, and made to themselves of the lowest of them priests of the high places, who sacrificed for them in the houses of the high places.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%33%%They feared the LORD, and served their own gods, after the manner of the nations whom they carried away from thence.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%34%%To this day they do after the former manners: they fear not the LORD, neither do they after their statutes, or after their ordinances, or after the law and commandment which the LORD commanded the children of Jacob, whom he named Israel;
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%35%%With whom the LORD had made a covenant, and charged them, saying, Ye shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%36%%But the LORD, who brought you out of the land of Egypt with great power and an out-stretched arm, him shall ye fear, and him shall ye worship, and to him shall ye do sacrifice.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%37%%And the statutes, and the ordinances, and the law, and the commandment which he wrote for you, ye shall observe to do for evermore; and ye shall not fear other gods.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%38%%And the covenant that I have made with you ye shall not forget; neither shall ye fear other gods.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%39%%But the LORD your God ye shall fear; and he will deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%40%%Yet they did not hearken, but they did after their former manner.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%17%%41%%So these nations feared the LORD, and served their graven images, both their children, and their children's children: as did their fathers, so do they to this day.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%1%%Now it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%2%%Twenty and five years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Abi, the daughter of Zachariah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%3%%And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that David his father did.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%4%%He removed the high places, and broke the images, and cut down the groves, and broke in pieces the brazen serpent that Moses had made: for till those days the children of Israel burnt incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%5%%He trusted in the LORD God of Israel; so that after him was none like him among all the kings of Judah, nor any that were before him.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%6%%For he cleaved to the LORD, and departed not from following him, but kept his commandments, which the LORD commanded Moses.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%7%%And the LORD was with him; and he prospered whithersoever he went forth: and he rebelled against the king of Assyria, and served him not.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%8%%He smote the Philistines, even to Gaza, and its borders, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%9%%And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria, and besieged it.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%10%%And at the end of three years they took it: even in the sixth year of Hezekiah, that is the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%11%%And the king of Assyria carried away Israel to Assyria, and put them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%12%%Because they obeyed not the voice of the LORD their God, but transgressed his covenant, and all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded, and would not hear them, nor do them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%13%%Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah, and took them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%14%%And Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria to Lachish, saying, I have offended; return from me: that which thou puttest on me I will bear. And the king of Assyria appointed to Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%15%%And Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of the LORD, and in the treasures of the king's house.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%16%%At that time did Hezekiah cut off the gold from the doors of the temple of the LORD, and from the pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid, and gave it to the king of Assyria.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%17%%And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rab-saris and Rab-shakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great army against Jerusalem: and they went up, and came to Jerusalem: and when they had come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fuller's field.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%18%%And when they had called to the king, there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%19%%And Rab-shakeh said to them, Speak ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this in which thou trustest?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%20%%Thou sayest, but they are but vain words, I have counsel and strength for the war. Now in whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%21%%Now behold, thou trustest upon the staff of this bruised reed, even upon Egypt, on which if a man leaneth, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all that trust on him.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%22%%But if ye say to me, We trust in the LORD our God: is not that he whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and hath said to Judah and Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%23%%Now therefore, I pray thee, give pledges to my lord the king of Assyria, and I will deliver thee two thousand horses, if thou shalt be able on thy part to set riders upon them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%24%%How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master's servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%25%%Have I now come up without the LORD against this place to destroy it? The LORD said to me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%26%%Then said Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, and Shebna and Joah, to Rab-shakeh, Speak, I pray thee, to thy servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and talk not with us in the Jews language in the ears of the people that are on the wall.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%27%%But Rab-shakeh said to them, Hath my master sent me to thy master, and to thee, to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men who sit on the wall, that they may feed on their vilest excretions with you?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%28%%Then Rab-shakeh stood and cried with a loud voice in the Jews language, and spoke, saying, Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%29%%Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you out of his hand:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%30%%Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying, The LORD will surely deliver us, and this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%31%%Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me, and then eat ye every man of his own vine, and every one of his fig-tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his cistern:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%32%%Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of olive-oil and of honey, that ye may live, and not die: and hearken not to Hezekiah, when he persuadeth you, saying, The LORD will deliver us.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%33%%Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered at all his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%34%%Where are the gods of Hamath, and of Arpad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah? have they delivered Samaria out of my hand?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%35%%Who are they among all the gods of the countries, that have delivered their country out of my hand, that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of my hand?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%36%%But the people held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the king's commandment was, saying, Answer him not.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%18%%37%%Then came Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rab-shakeh.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%1%%And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%2%%And he sent Eliakim, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%3%%And they said to him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and blasphemy: for the children have come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%4%%It may be the LORD thy God will hear all the words of Rab-shakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God; and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that are left.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%5%%So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%6%%And Isaiah said to them, Thus shall ye say to your master, Thus saith the LORD, Be not afraid of the words which thou hast heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%7%%Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumor, and shall return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%8%%So Rab-shakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he had departed from Lachish.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%9%%And when he heard it said of Tirhakah king of Cush, Behold, he hath come out to fight against thee: he sent messengers again to Hezekiah, saying,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%10%%Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God in whom thou trustest deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%11%%Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly: and shalt thou be delivered?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%12%%Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed; as Gozan and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden who were in Thelasar?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%13%%Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivah?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%14%%And Hezekiah received the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up into the house of the LORD, and spread it before the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%15%%And Hezekiah prayed before the LORD, and said, O LORD God of Israel, who dwellest between the cherubim, thou art the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; thou hast made heaven and earth.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%16%%LORD, bow down thy ear, and hear: open, LORD, thy eyes, and see: and hear the words of Sennacherib, who hath sent him to reproach the living God.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%17%%Of a truth, LORD, the kings of Assyria have destroyed the nations and their lands,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%18%%And have cast their gods into the fire: for they were no gods, but the work of men's hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%19%%Now therefore, O LORD our God, I beseech thee, save thou us from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the LORD God, even thou only.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%20%%Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, That which thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%21%%This is the word that the LORD hath spoken concerning him; The virgin the daughter of Zion hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%22%%Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thy eyes on high: even against the Holy One of Israel.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%23%%By thy messengers thou hast reproached the Lord, and hast said, With the multitude of my chariots I am come up to the hight of the mountains, to the sides of Lebanon, and will cut down its tall cedar trees, and its choice fir trees: and I will enter into the lodgings of his borders, and into the forest of his Carmel.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%24%%I have digged and drank strange waters, and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of besieged places.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%25%%Hast thou not heard long ago how I have done it, and of ancient times that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldst be to lay waste fortified cities in ruinous heaps.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%26%%Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded; they were as the grass of the field, and as the green herb, as the grass on the house-tops, and as corn blasted before it is grown up.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%27%%But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%28%%Because thy rage against me and thy tumult is come up into my ears, therefore I will put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%29%%And this shall be a sign to thee, Ye shall eat this year such things as grow of themselves, and in the second year that which springeth of the same; and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruits of it.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%30%%And the remnant that hath escaped of the house of Judah shall yet again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%31%%For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape from mount Zion: the zeal of the LORD of hosts shall do this.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%32%%Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shield, nor cast a bank against it.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%33%%By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%34%%For I will defend this city, to save it, for my own sake, and for my servant David's sake.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%35%%And it came to pass that night, that the angel of the LORD went out, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred and eighty five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%36%%So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%19%%37%%And it came to pass, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword: and they escaped into the land of Armenia. And Esar-haddon his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%1%%In those days was Hezekiah sick to death. And the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz came to him, and said to him, Thus saith the LORD, Set thy house in order; for thou shalt die, and not live.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%2%%Then he turned his face to the wall, and prayed to the LORD, saying,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%3%%I beseech thee, O LORD, remember now how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept grievously.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%4%%And it came to pass, before Isaiah had gone out into the middle court, that the word of the LORD came to him, saying,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%5%%Turn again, and tell Hezekiah the captain of my people, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will heal thee: on the third day thou shalt go up to the house of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%6%%And I will add to thy days fifteen years; and I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will defend this city for my own sake, and for my servant David's sake.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%7%%And Isaiah said, Take a lump of figs. And they took and laid it on the boil, and he recovered.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%8%%And Hezekiah said to Isaiah, What shall be the sign that the LORD will heal me, and that I shall go up into the house of the LORD the third day?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%9%%And Isaiah said, This sign shalt thou have of the LORD, that the LORD will do the thing that he hath spoken: shall the shadow go forward ten degrees, or go back ten degrees?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%10%%And Hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go forward ten degrees: no, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%11%%And Isaiah the prophet cried to the LORD: and he brought the shadow ten degrees backward, by which it had gone down on the dial of Ahaz.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%12%%At that time Berodach-baladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah: for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%13%%And Hezekiah hearkened to them, and showed them all the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armor, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah showed them not.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%14%%Then came Isaiah the prophet to king Hezekiah, and said to him, What said these men? and from whence came they to thee? And Hezekiah said, They have come from a far country even from Babylon.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%15%%And he said, What have they seen in thy house? And Hezekiah answered, All the things that are in my house have they seen: there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shown them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%16%%And Isaiah said to Hezekiah, Hear the word of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%17%%Behold, the days come, that all that is in thy house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store to this day, shall be carried into Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%18%%And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%19%%Then said Hezekiah to Isaiah, Good is the word of the LORD which thou hast spoken. And he said, Is it not good, if peace and truth shall be in my days?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%20%%And the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and all his might, and how he made a pool, and a conduit, and brought water into the city, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%20%%21%%And Hezekiah slept with his fathers: and Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%1%%Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hephzi-bah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%2%%And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, after the abominations of the heathen, whom the LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%3%%For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had destroyed; and he reared altars for Baal, and made a grove, as did Ahab king of Israel; and worshiped all the host of heaven, and served them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%4%%And he built altars in the house of the LORD, of which the LORD said, In Jerusalem will I put my name.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%5%%And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%6%%And he made his son pass through the fire, and observed times, and used enchantments, and dealt with familiar spirits and wizards: he committed much wickedness in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%7%%And he set a graven image of the grove that he had made in the house, of which the LORD said to David, and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%8%%Neither will I make the feet of Israel move any more out of the land which I gave their fathers; only if they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that my servant Moses commanded them.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%9%%But they hearkened not: and Manasseh seduced them to do more evil than did the nations whom the LORD destroyed before the children of Israel.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%10%%And the LORD spoke by his servants the prophets, saying,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%11%%Because Manasseh king of Judah hath done these abominations, and hath done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, who were before him, and hath made Judah also to sin with his idols:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%12%%Therefore thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Behold, I am bringing such evil upon Jerusalem and Judah, that whoever heareth of it, both his ears shall tingle.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%13%%And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab: and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipeth a dish, wiping it, and turning it upside down.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%14%%And I will forsake the remnant of my inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies; and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies;
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%15%%Because they have done that which was evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came out of Egypt, even to this day.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%16%%Moreover, Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, till he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another; besides his sin with which he made Judah to sin, in doing evil in the sight of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%17%%Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all that he did, and his sin that he sinned, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%18%%And Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%19%%Amon was twenty and two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Meshullemeth, the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%20%%And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, as his father Manasseh did.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%21%%And he walked in all the way that his father walked in, and served the idols that his father served, and worshiped them:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%22%%And he forsook the LORD God of his fathers, and walked not in the way of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%23%%And the servants of Amon conspired against him, and slew the king in his own house.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%24%%And the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%25%%Now the rest of the acts of Amon which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%21%%26%%And he was buried in his sepulcher in the garden of Uzza: and Josiah his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%1%%Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned thirty and one years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jedidah the daughter of Adaiah of Boscath.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%2%%And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, and walked in all the way of David his father, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%3%%And it came to pass in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, that the king sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, the scribe, to the house of the LORD, saying,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%4%%Go to Hilkiah the high priest, that he may sum the silver which is brought into the house of the LORD, which the keepers of the door have gathered from the people:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%5%%And let them deliver it into the hand of the doers of the work, that have the oversight of the house of the LORD: and let them give it to the doers of the work, which is in the house of the LORD, to repair the breaches of the house,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%6%%To carpenters, and builders, and masons, and to buy timber, and hewn stone to repair the house.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%7%%But there was no reckoning made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand, because they dealt faithfully.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%8%%And Hilkiah the high priest said to Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of the LORD. And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan, and he read it.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%9%%And Shaphan the scribe came to the king, and brought the king word again, and said, Thy servants have gathered the money that was found in the house, and have delivered it into the hand of them that do the work, that have the oversight of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%10%%And Shaphan the scribe showed the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest hath delivered me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%11%%And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he rent his clothes.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%12%%And the king commanded Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Achbor the son of Michaiah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asahiah a servant of the king's, saying,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%13%%Go ye, inquire of the LORD for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found: for great is the wrath of the LORD that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not hearkened to the words of this book, to do according to all that which is written concerning us.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%14%%So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asahiah, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college;) and they communed with her.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%15%%And she said to them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Tell the man that sent you to me,
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%16%%Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon its inhabitants, even all the words of the book which the king of Judah hath read:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%17%%Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place and shall not be quenched.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%18%%But to the king of Judah who sent you to inquire of the LORD, thus shall ye say to him, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, concerning the words which thou hast heard;
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%19%%Because thy heart was tender, and thou hast humbled thyself before the LORD, when thou heardest what I spoke against this place, and against its inhabitants, that they should become a desolation and a curse, and hast rent thy clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard thee, saith the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%22%%20%%Behold therefore, I will gather thee to thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered into thy grave in peace; and thy eyes shall not see all the evil which I will bring upon this place. And they brought the king word again.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%1%%And the king sent, and they gathered to him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%2%%And the king went up into the house of the LORD, and all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the people, both small and great: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in the house of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%3%%And the king stood by a pillar, and made a covenant before the LORD, to walk after the LORD, and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all their heart and all their soul, to perform the words of this covenant that were written in this book. And all the people stood to the covenant.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%4%%And the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the door, to bring forth out of the temple of the LORD all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the grove, and for all the host of heaven: and he burned them without Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron, and carried the ashes of them to Beth-el.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%5%%And he put down the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places around Jerusalem; them also that burned incense to Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets, and to all the host of heaven.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%6%%And he brought out the grove from the house of the LORD, without Jerusalem, to the brook Kidron, and burned it at the brook Kidron, and stamped it small to powder, and cast the powder of it upon the graves of the children of the people.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%7%%And he broke down the houses of the sodomites that were by the house of the LORD, where the women wove hangings for the grove.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%8%%And he brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burnt incense, from Geba to Beer-sheba, and broke down the high places of the gates that were in the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man's left hand at the gate of the city.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%9%%Nevertheless, the priests of the high places came not up to the altar of the LORD in Jerusalem, but they ate of the unleavened bread among their brethren.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%10%%And he defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the children of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%11%%And he took away the horses that the kings of Judah had given to the sun, at the entrance of the house of the LORD, by the chamber of Nathan-melech the chamberlain, which was in the suburbs, and burned the chariots of the sun with fire.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%12%%And the altars that were on the top of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars which Manasseh had made in the two courts of the house of the LORD, did the king beat down, and broke them down from thence, and cast the dust of them into the brook Kidron.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%13%%And the high places that were before Jerusalem, which were on the right hand of the mount of corruption, which Solomon the king of Israel had built for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Zidonians, and for Chemosh the abomination of the Moabites, and for Milcom the abomination of the children of Ammon, did the king defile.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%14%%And he broke in pieces the images, and cut down the groves, and filled their places with the bones of men.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%15%%Moreover, the altar that was at Beth-el, and the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, both that altar and the high place he broke down, and burned the high place, and stamped it small to powder, and burned the grove.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%16%%And as Josiah turned himself, he espied the sepulchers that were there on the mount, and sent, and took the bones out of the sepulchers, and burned them upon the altar, and polluted it, according to the word of the LORD which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these words.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%17%%Then he said, What title is that which I see? And the men of the city told him, It is the sepulcher of the man of God, who came from Judah, and proclaimed these things that thou hast done against the altar of Beth-el.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%18%%And he said, Let him alone; let no man move his bones. So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet that came out of Samaria.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%19%%And all the houses also of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke the LORD to anger, Josiah took away, and did to them according to all the acts that he had done in Beth-el.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%20%%And he slew all the priests of the high places, that were there upon the altars, and burnt men's bones upon them, and returned to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%21%%And the king commanded all the people, saying, Keep the passover to the LORD your God, as it is written in the book of this covenant.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%22%%Surely there was not held such a passover from the days of the judges that judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel, nor of the kings of Judah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%23%%But in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, in which this passover was held to the LORD in Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%24%%Moreover the workers with familiar spirits, and the wizards, and the images, and the idols, and all the abominations that were seen in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, did Josiah put away, that he might perform the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%25%%And like him was there no king before him, that turned to the LORD with all his heart, and with all his soul, and with all his might, according to all the law of Moses; neither after him arose there any like him.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%26%%Notwithstanding, the LORD turned not from the fierceness of his great wrath, with which his anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocations by which Manasseh had provoked him.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%27%%And the LORD said, I will remove Judah also out of my sight, as I have removed Israel, and will reject this city Jerusalem which I have chosen, and the house of which I said, My name shall be there.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%28%%Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%29%%In his days Pharaoh-nechoh king of Egypt went up against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates: and king Josiah went against him; and he slew him at Megiddo, when he had seen him.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%30%%And his servants carried him in a chariot dead from Megiddo, and brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own sepulcher. And the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah and anointed him, and made him king in his father's stead.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%31%%Jehoahaz was twenty and three years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%32%%And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his fathers had done.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%33%%And Pharaoh-nechoh put him in bands at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem; and subjected the land to a tribute of a hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%34%%And Pharaoh-nechoh made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in the room of Josiah his father, and turned his name to Jehoiakim, and took Jehoahaz away: and he came to Egypt and died there.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%35%%And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh: he exacted the silver and the gold from the people of the land, from every one according to his taxation, to give it to Pharaoh-nechoh.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%36%%Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Zebudah, the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%23%%37%%And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his fathers had done.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%1%%In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant three years: then he turned and rebelled against him.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%2%%And the LORD sent against him bands of the Chaldees, and bands of the Syrians, and bands of the Moabites, and bands of the children of Ammon, and sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the LORD, which he spoke by his servants the prophets.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%3%%Surely at the commandment of the LORD came this upon Judah, to remove them out of his sight, for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he did;
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%4%%And also for the innocent blood that he shed: for he filled Jerusalem with innocent blood; which the LORD would not pardon.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%5%%Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%6%%So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers: and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%7%%And the king of Egypt came not again any more out of his land: for the king of Babylon had taken from the river of Egypt to the river Euphrates all that pertained to the king of Egypt.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%8%%Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months. And his mother's name was Nehushta, the daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%9%%And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father had done.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%10%%At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against Jerusalem, and the city was besieged.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%11%%And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came against the city, and his servants besieged it.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%12%%And Jehoiachin the king of Judah went out to the king of Babylon, he, and his mother, and his servants, and his princes, and his officers: and the king of Babylon took him in the eighth year of his reign.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%13%%And he carried out thence all the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king's house, and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of the LORD, as the LORD had said.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%14%%And he carried away all Jerusalem, and all the princes, and all the mighty men of valor, even ten thousand captives, and all the artificers, and smiths: none remained, save the poorest sort of the people of the land.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%15%%And he carried away Jehoiachin to Babylon, and the king's mother, and the king's wives, and his officers, and the mighty of the land, those carried he into captivity from Jerusalem to Babylon.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%16%%And all the men of might, even seven thousand, and artificers and smiths a thousand, all that were strong and apt for war, even them the king of Babylon brought captive to Babylon.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%17%%And the king of Babylon made Mattaniah his father's brother king in his stead, and changed his name to Zedekiah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%18%%Zedekiah was twenty and one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%19%%And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%24%%20%%For through the anger of the LORD it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence, that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%1%%And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he, and all his army, against Jerusalem, and encamped against it; and they built forts against it on all sides.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%2%%And the city was besieged to the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%3%%And on the ninth day of the fourth month the famine prevailed in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%4%%And the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between two walls, which is by the king's garden: (now the Chaldees were against the city on all sides:) and the king went the way towards the plain.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%5%%And the army of the Chaldees pursued the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho: and all his army were scattered from him.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%6%%So they took the king, and brought him to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they gave judgment upon him.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%7%%And they slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him with fetters of brass, and carried him to Babylon.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%8%%And in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which is the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzar-adan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, to Jerusalem:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%9%%And he burnt the house of the LORD, and the king's house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great man's house he burnt with fire.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%10%%And all the army of the Chaldees, that were with the captain of the guard, broke down the walls of Jerusalem on all sides.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%11%%Now the rest of the people that were left in the city, and the fugitives that fell away to the king of Babylon, with the remnant of the multitude, did Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard carry away.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%12%%But the captain of the guard left of the poor of the land to be vine-dressers and husbandmen.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%13%%And the pillars of brass that were in the house of the LORD, and the bases, and the brazen sea that was in the house of the LORD, did the Chaldees break in pieces, and carried the brass of them to Babylon.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%14%%And the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass with which they ministered, they took away.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%15%%And the fire-pans, and the bowls, and such things as were of gold, in gold, and of silver, in silver, the captain of the guard took away.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%16%%The two pillars, one sea, and the bases which Solomon had made for the house of the LORD; the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%17%%The hight of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and the capital upon it was brass: and the hight of the capital three cubits; and the wreathen work, and pomegranates upon the capital around, all of brass: and like to these had the second pillar with wreathen work.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%18%%And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%19%%And out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war, and five men of them that were in the king's presence, who were found in the city, and the principal scribe of the host, who mustered the people of the land, and sixty men of the people of the land that were found in the city:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%20%%And Nebuzar-adan captain of the guard took these, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah:
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%21%%And the king of Babylon smote them, and slew them at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away out of their land.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%22%%And as for the people that remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, ruler.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%23%%And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of Maachathite, they and their men.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%24%%And Gedaliah swore to them, and to their men, and said to them, Fear not to be the servants of the Chaldees: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon; and it shall be well with you.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%25%%But it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, came, and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah, that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldees that were with him at Mizpah.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%26%%And all the people, both small and great, and the captains of the armies, arose, and came to Egypt: for they were afraid of the Chaldees.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%27%%And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, that Evil-merodach king of Babylon, in the year that he began to reign, lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%28%%And he spoke kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon;
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%29%%And changed his prison garments: and he ate bread continually before him all the days of his life.
1000005%%2 Kings%%OT%%25%%30%%And his allowance was a continual allowance given him by the king, a daily rate for every day, all the days of his life.

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%28%%The sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%30%%Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%34%%And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%35%%The sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%36%%The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%37%%The sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%38%%And the sons of Seir; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezar, and Dishan.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%39%%And the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna was Lotan's sister.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%40%%The sons of Shobal; Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%41%%The sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%42%%The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zavan, and Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%43%%Now these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel; Bela the son of Beor: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%44%%And when Bela was dead Jobab the son of Zera of Bozrah reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%45%%And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%46%%And when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%47%%And when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%48%%And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%49%%And when Shaul was dead, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%50%%And when Baal-hanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pai; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%51%%Hadad died also. And the dukes of Edom were; duke Timna, duke Aliah, duke Jetheth,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%52%%Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%53%%Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%54%%Duke Magdiel, duke Iram. These are the dukes of Edom.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%1%%These are the sons of Israel; Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%2%%Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%3%%The sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah: which three were born to him of the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess. And Er, the first-born of Judah, was evil in the sight of the LORD; and he slew him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%4%%And Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Pharez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%5%%The sons of Pharez; Hezron, and Hamul.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%6%%And the sons of Zerah; Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara: five of them in all.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%7%%And the sons of Carmi; Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the thing accursed.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%8%%And the sons of Ethan; Azariah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%9%%The sons also of Hezron, that were born to him; Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%10%%And Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%11%%And Nahshon begat Salma, and Salma begat Boaz,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%12%%And Boaz begat Obed, and Obed begat Jesse,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%13%%And Jesse begat his first-born Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimma the third,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%14%%Nethaneel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%15%%Ozem the sixth, David the seventh:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%16%%Whose sisters were Zeruiah, and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah; Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%17%%And Abigail bore Amasa: and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%18%%And Caleb the son of Hezron begat children of Azubah his wife, and of Jerioth: her sons are these; Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%19%%And when Azubah was dead, Caleb took to him Ephrath, who bore to him Hur,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%20%%And Hur begat Uri, and Uri begat Bezaleel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%21%%And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%22%%And Segub begat Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%23%%And he took Geshur, and Aram, with the towns of Jair, from them, with Kenath and its towns, even sixty cities. All these belonged to the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%24%%And after that Hezron was dead in Caleb-ephratah, then Abiah Hezron's wife bore him Ashur the father of Tekoa.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%25%%And the sons of Jerahmeel the first-born of Hezron were, Ram the first-born, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, and Ahijah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%26%%Jerahmeel had also another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%27%%And the sons of Ram the first-born of Jerahmeel were, Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%28%%And the sons of Onam were, Shammai, and Jada. And the sons of Shammai; Nadab, and Abishur.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%29%%And the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bore him Ahban, and Molid.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%30%%And the sons of Nadab; Seled, and Appaim: but Seled died without children.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%31%%And the sons of Appaim; Ishi. And the sons of Ishi; Sheshan. And the children of Sheshan; Ahlai.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%32%%And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai; Jether, and Jonathan: and Jether died without children.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%33%%And the sons of Jonathan; Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%34%%Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%35%%And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant for a wife; and she bore him Attai.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%36%%And Attai begat Nathan, and Nathan begat Zabad,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%37%%And Zabad begat Ephlal, and Ephlal begat Obed,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%38%%And Obed begat Jehu, and Jehu begat Azariah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%39%%And Azariah begat Helez, and Helez begat Eleasah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%40%%And Eleasah begat Sisamai, and Sisamai begat Shallum,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%41%%And Shallum begat Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begat Elishama.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%42%%Now the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were, Mesha his first-born, who was the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%43%%And the sons of Hebron; Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%44%%And Shema begat Raham, the father of Jorkoam: and Rekem begat Shammai.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%45%%And the son of Shammai was Maon: and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%46%%And Ephah, Caleb's concubine, bore Haran, and Moza, and Gazez: and Haran begat Gazez.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%47%%And the sons of Jahdai; Regem, and Jotham, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%48%%Maachah, Caleb's concubine, bore Sheber, and Tirhanah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%49%%She bore also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah, and the father of Gibea: and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%50%%These were the sons of Caleb the son of Hur, the first-born of Ephratah; Shobal the father of Kirjath-jearim,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%51%%Salma the father of Beth-lehem, Hareph the father of Beth-gader.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%52%%And Shobal the father of Kirjath-jearim had sons; Haroeh, and half of the Manahethites.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%53%%And the families of Kirjath-jearim; the Ithrites, and the Puhites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zereathites, and the Eshtaulites.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%54%%The sons of Salma; Beth-lehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Menahethites, the Zorites.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%55%%And the families of the scribes who dwelt at Jabez; the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and Suchathites. These are the Kenites that came of Hemath, the father of the house of Rechab.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%1%%Now these were the sons of David, who were born to him in Hebron; the first-born Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%2%%The third, Absalom the son of Maachah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur: the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%3%%The fifth, Shephatiah of Abital: the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%4%%These six were born to him in Hebron; and there he reigned seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%5%%And these were born to him in Jerusalem; Shimea, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon, four, of Bath-shua the daughter of Ammiel:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%6%%Ibhar also, and Elishama, and Eliphelet,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%7%%And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%8%%And Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%9%%These were all the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%10%%And Solomon's son was Rehoboam, Abia his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%11%%Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%12%%Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%13%%Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%14%%Amon his son, Josiah his son.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%15%%And the sons of Josiah were, the first-born Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%16%%And the sons of Jehoiakim; Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%17%%And the sons of Jeconiah; Assir, Salathiel his son.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%18%%Malchiram also, and Pedaiah, and Shenazar, Jecamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%19%%And the sons of Pedaiah were, Zerubbabel, and Shimei: and the sons of Zerubbabel; Meshullam, and Hananiah, and Shelomith their sister:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%20%%And Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed, five.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%21%%And the sons of Hananiah; Pelatiah, and Jesaiah: the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shechaniah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%22%%And the sons of Shechaniah; Shemaiah; and the sons of Shemaiah; Hattush, and Igeal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat, six.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%23%%And the sons of Neariah; Elioenai, and Hezekiah, and Azrikam, three.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%24%%And the sons of Elioenai were, Hodaiah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Delaiah, and Anani, seven.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%1%%The sons of Judah; Pharez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and Shobal.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%2%%And Reaiah the son of Shobal begat Jahath; and Jahath begat Ahumai, and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%3%%And these were of the father of Etam; Jezreel, and Ishma, and Idbash: and the name of their sister was Hazelelponi:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%4%%And Penuel the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the first-born of Ephratah, the father of Beth-lehem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%5%%And Ashur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%6%%And Naarah bore him Ahuzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%7%%And the sons of Helah were, Zereth, and Jezoar, and Ethnan.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%8%%And Coz begat Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%9%%And Jabez was more honorable than his brethren: and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, Because I bore him with sorrow.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%10%%And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that thou wouldst bless me indeed, and enlarge my border, and that thy hand might be with me, and that thou wouldst keep me from evil, that it may not grieve me! And God granted him that which he requested.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%11%%And Chelub the brother of Shuah begat Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%12%%And Eshton begat Beth-rapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These are the men of Rechah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%13%%And the sons of Kenaz; Othniel, and Seraiah: and the sons of Othniel; Hathath.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%14%%And Meonothai begat Ophrah: and Seraiah begat Joab, the father of the valley of Charashim; for they were artificers.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%15%%And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh; Iru, Elah, and Naam: and the sons of Elah, even Kenaz.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%16%%And the sons of Jehaleleel; Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asareel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%17%%And the sons of Ezra were, Jethur, and Mered, and Epher, and Jalon: and she bore Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%18%%And his wife Jehudijah bore Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Socho, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh whom Mered took.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%19%%And the sons of his wife Hodiah the sister of Naham, the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%20%%And the sons of Shimon were, Amnon, and Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were, Zoheth, and Benzoheth.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%21%%The sons of Shelah the son of Judah were, Er the father of Lecah, and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of them that wrought fine linen, of the house of Ashbea,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%22%%And Jokim, and the men of Chozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had the dominion in Moab, and Jashubi-lehem. And these are ancient things.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%23%%These were the potters, and those that dwelt among plants and hedges: there they dwelt with the king for his work.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%24%%The sons of Simeon were Nemuel, and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%25%%Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%26%%And the sons of Mishma; Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, Shimei his son.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%27%%And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brethren had not many children, neither did all their family multiply, like the children of Judah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%28%%And they dwelt at Beer-sheba, and Moladah, and Hazar-shual,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%29%%And at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%30%%And at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%31%%And at Beth-marcaboth, and Hazar-susim, and at Beth-birei, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities to the reign of David.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%32%%And their villages were, Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%33%%And all their villages that were around the same cities to Baal. These were their habitations, and their genealogy.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%34%%And Meshobab, and Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%35%%And Joel, and Jehu the son of Josibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%36%%And Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%37%%And Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%38%%These mentioned by their names were princes in their families: and the house of their fathers increased greatly.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%39%%And they went to the entrance of Gedor, even to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%40%%And they found rich pasture and good, and the land was wide, and quiet, and peaceable; for they of Ham had dwelt there of old.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%41%%And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and smote their tents, and the habitations that were found there, and destroyed them utterly to this day, and dwelt in their room: because there was pasture there for their flocks.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%42%%And some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%43%%And they smote the rest of the Amalekites that had escaped, and have dwelt there to this day.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%1%%Now the sons of Reuben the first-born of Israel, (for he was the first-born; but, forasmuch as he defiled his father's bed, his birth-right was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel: and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birth-right.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%2%%For Judah prevailed above his brethren, and of him came the chief ruler; but the birth-right was Joseph's:)
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%3%%The sons, I say, of Reuben the first-born of Israel were, Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%4%%The sons of Joel; Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%5%%Micah his son, Reaia his son, Baal his son,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%6%%Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive: he was prince of the Reubenites.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%7%%And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned, were the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%8%%And Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, even to Nebo, and Baal-meon:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%9%%And eastward he inhabited to the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates: because their cattle were multiplied in the land of Gilead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%10%%And in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagarites, who fell by their hand: and they dwelt in their tents throughout all the east land of Gilead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%11%%And the children of Gad dwelt over against them, in the land of Bashan to Salcah:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%12%%Joel the chief, and Shapham the next, and Jaanai, and Shaphat in Bashan.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%13%%And their brethren of the house of their fathers were, Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia, and Heber, seven.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%14%%These are the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%15%%Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of the house of their fathers.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%16%%And they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in its towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, upon their borders.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%17%%All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%18%%The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, and to shoot with bow, and skillful in war, were four and forty thousand seven hundred and sixty, that went out to the war.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%19%%And they made war with the Hagarites, with Jetur, and Nephish, and Nodab.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%20%%And they were helped against them, and the Hagarites were delivered into their hand, and all that were with them: for they cried to God in the battle, and he was entreated by them; because they put their trust in him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%21%%And they took away their cattle; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and of asses two thousand, and of men a hundred thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%22%%For there fell down many slain, because the war was of God. And they dwelt in their steads until the captivity.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%23%%And the children of the half tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land: they increased from Bashan to Baal-hermon and Senir, and to mount Hermon.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%24%%And these were the heads of the house of their fathers, even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valor, famous men, and heads of the house of their fathers.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%25%%And they transgressed against the God of their fathers, and went astray after the gods of the people of the land, whom God destroyed before them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%26%%And the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, and Habor, and Hara, and to the river Gozan, to this day.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%1%%The sons of Levi; Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%31%%And these are they whom David set over the service of song in the house of the LORD, after that the ark had rest.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%32%%And they ministered before the dwelling-place of the tabernacle of the congregation with singing, until Solomon had built the house of the LORD in Jerusalem: and then they waited on their office, according to their order.

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%49%%But Aaron and his sons offered upon the altar of the burnt-offering, and on the altar of incense, and were appointed for all the work of the place most holy, and to make an atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%61%%And to the sons of Kohath who were left of the family of that tribe, were cities given out of the half tribe, namely, out of the half tribe of Manasseh, by lot, ten cities.

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%1%%Now the sons of Issachar, were, Tola, and Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%2%%And the sons of Tola; Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father's house, to wit, of Tola: they were valiant men of might in their generations; whose number was in the days of David two and twenty thousand and six hundred.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%3%%And the sons of Uzzi; Izrahiah: and the sons of Izrahiah; Michael, and Obadiah, and Joel, Ishaiah, five: all of them chief men.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%4%%And with them, by their generations, after the house of their fathers, were bands of soldiers for war, six and thirty thousand men: for they had many wives and sons.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%5%%And their brethren among all the families of Issachar were valiant men of might, reckoned in all by their genealogies eighty and seven thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%6%%The sons of Benjamin; Bela, and Becher, and Jediael, three.

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%8%%And the sons of Becher; Zemira, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jerimoth, and Abiah, and Anathoth, and Alameth. All these are the sons of Becher.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%9%%And the number of them, after their genealogy by their generations, heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valor, was twenty thousand and two hundred.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%10%%The sons also of Jediael; Bilhan: and the sons of Bilhan; Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tharshish, and Ahishahar.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%11%%All these the sons of Jediael, by the heads of their fathers, mighty men of valor, were seventeen thousand and two hundred soldiers, fit to go out for war and battle.
