1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%1%%So all Israel were reckoned by genealogies; and behold, they were written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, who were carried away to Babylon for their transgression.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%2%%Now the first inhabitants that dwelt in their possessions in their cities were, the Israelites, the priests, Levites, and the Nethinims.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%3%%And in Jerusalem dwelt of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim, and Manasseh;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%4%%Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Pharez the son of Judah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%5%%And of the Shilonites; Asaiah the first-born, and his sons.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%6%%And of the sons of Zerah; Jeuel, and their brethren, six hundred and ninety.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%7%%And of the sons of Benjamin; Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hasenuah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%8%%And Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%9%%And their brethren, according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty and six. All these men were chief of the fathers in the house of their fathers.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%10%%And of the priests; Jedaiah, and Jehoiarib, and Jachin,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%11%%And Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%12%%And Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasiai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%13%%And their brethren, heads of the house of their fathers, a thousand and seven hundred and sixty; very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%14%%And of the Levites; Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%15%%And Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Micah, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%16%%And Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, that dwelt in the villages of the Netophathites.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%17%%And the porters were Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brethren: Shallum was the chief;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%18%%Who hitherto waited in the king's gate eastward: they were porters in the companies of the children of Levi.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%19%%And Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren of the house of his father, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the gates of the tabernacle: and their fathers, being over the host of the LORD, were keepers of the entry.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%20%%And Phinehas the son of Eleazar was the ruler over them in time past, and the LORD was with him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%21%%And Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was porter of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%22%%All these who were chosen to be porters in the gates were two hundred and twelve. These were reckoned by their genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer ordained in their set office.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%23%%So they and their children had the oversight of the gates of the house of the LORD, namely, the house of the tabernacle, by wards.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%24%%In four quarters were the porters, towards the east, west, north and south.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%25%%And their brethren, who were in their villages, were to come after seven days from time to time with them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%26%%For these Levites, the four chief porters, were in their set office, and were over the chambers and treasuries of the house of God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%27%%And they lodged about the house of God, because the charge was upon them, and the opening of it every morning pertained to them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%28%%And certain of them had the charge of the ministering vessels, that they should bring them in and out by number.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%29%%Some of them also were appointed to oversee the vessels, and all the instruments of the sanctuary, and the fine flour, and the wine, and the oil, and the frankincense, and the spices.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%30%%And some of the sons of the priests made the ointment of the spices.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%31%%And Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the first-born of Shallum the Korahite, had the set office over the things that were made in the pans.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%32%%And others of their brethren, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the show-bread, to prepare it every sabbath.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%33%%And these are the singers, chief of the fathers of the Levites, who remaining in the chambers were free: for they were employed in that work day and night.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%34%%These chief fathers of the Levites were chief throughout their generations; these dwelt at Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%35%%And in Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon, Jehiel, whose wife's name was Maachah:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%36%%And his first-born son Abdon, then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Ner, and Nadab,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%37%%And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%38%%And Mikloth begat Shimeam. And they also dwelt with their brethren at Jerusalem, over against their brethren.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%39%%And Ner begat Kish; and Kish begat Saul; and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchi-shua, and Abinadab, and Esh-baal.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%40%%And the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal: and Merib-baal begat Micah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%41%%And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, and Ahaz.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%42%%And Ahaz begat Jarah; and Jarah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%43%%And Moza begat Binea; and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%44%%And Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan: these were the sons of Azel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%1%%Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%2%%And the Philistines followed hard after Saul, and after his sons; and the Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%3%%And the battle prevailed against Saul, and the archers hit him, and he was wounded by the archers.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%4%%Then said Saul to his armor-bearer, Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me. But his armor-bearer would not; for he was greatly afraid. So Saul took a sword, and fell upon it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%5%%And when his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell likewise on the sword, and died.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%6%%So Saul died, and his three sons, and all his house died together.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%7%%And when all the men of Israel that were in the valley saw that they fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, then they forsook their cities, and fled: and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%8%%And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen in mount Gilboa.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%9%%And when they had stripped him, they took his head, and his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines around, to carry tidings to their idols, and to the people.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%10%%And they put his armor in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the temple of Dagon.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%11%%And when all Jabesh-gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%12%%They arose, all the valiant men, and took away the body of Saul, and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%13%%So Saul died for his transgression which he committed against the LORD, even against the word of the LORD, which he kept not, and also for asking counsel of one that had a familiar spirit, to inquire of it;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%14%%And inquired not of the LORD: therefore he slew him, and turned the kingdom to David the son of Jesse.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%1%%Then all Israel gathered themselves to David to Hebron, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%2%%And moreover in time past, even when Saul was king, thou wast he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and the LORD thy God said to thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be ruler over my people Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%3%%Therefore came all the elders of Israel to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the LORD; and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD by Samuel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%4%%And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem, which is Jebus; where the Jebusites were, the inhabitants of the land.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%5%%And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, Thou shalt not come hither. Nevertheless David took the castle of Zion, which is the city of David.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%6%%And David said, Whoever smiteth the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. So Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was chief.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%7%%And David dwelt in the castle; therefore they called it, The city of David.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%8%%And he built the city around, even from Millo around: and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%9%%So David became greater and greater: for the LORD of hosts was with him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%10%%These also are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who strengthened themselves with him in his kingdom, and with all Israel, to make him king according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%11%%And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had; Jashobeam a Hachmonite, the chief of the captains: he lifted his spear against three hundred slain by him at one time.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%12%%And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighties.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%13%%He was with David at Pas-dammim, and there the Philistines were gathered to battle, where was a parcel of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%14%%And they set themselves in the midst of that parcel, and delivered it, and slew the Philistines; and the LORD saved them by a great deliverance.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%15%%Now three of the thirty captains went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the host of the Philistines encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%16%%And David was then in the hold, and the Philistines' garrison was then at Beth-lehem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%17%%And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of the water of the well of Beth-lehem, that is at the gate!
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%18%%And the three broke through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but David would not drink of it, but poured it out to the LORD,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%19%%And said, My God forbid it me, that I should do this thing: shall I drink the blood of these men that have put their lives in jeopardy? for with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mightiest.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%20%%And Abishai the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three: for lifting his spear against three hundred, he slew them, and had a name among the three.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%21%%Of the three, he was more honorable than the two; for he was their captain: but he attained not to the first three.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%22%%Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done many acts; he slew two lion-like men of Moab: also he went down and slew a lion in a pit in a snowy day.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%23%%And he slew an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high; and in the Egyptian's hand was a spear like a weaver's beam; and he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%24%%These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had the name among the three mighties.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%25%%Behold, he was honorable among the thirty, but attained not to the first three: and David set him over his guard.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%26%%Also the valiant men of the armies were, Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%27%%Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%28%%Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Antothite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%29%%Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%30%%Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%31%%Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah, that pertained to the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%32%%Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%33%%Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%34%%The sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shage the Hararite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%35%%Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphel the son of Ur,

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%40%%Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%41%%Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,

1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%47%%Eliel, and Obed, and Jasiel the Mesobaite.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%1%%Now these are they that came to David to Ziklag, while he yet kept himself close because of Saul the son of Kish: and they were among the mighty men, helpers of the war.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%2%%They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in hurling stones, and shooting arrows from a bow, even of Saul's brethren of Benjamin.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%3%%The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; and Jeziel, and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; and Berachah, and Jehu the Antothite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%4%%And Ismaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty; and Jeremiah, and Jahaziel, and Johanan, and Josabad the Gederathite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%5%%Eluzai, and Jerimoth, and Bealiah, and Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%6%%Elkanah, and Jesiah, and Azareel, and Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korhites.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%7%%And Joelah, and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%8%%And of the Gadites there separated themselves to David in the hold in the wilderness men of might, and men of war fit for the battle, that could handle shield and buckler, whose faces were like the faces of lions, and were as swift as the roes upon the mountains;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%9%%Ezer the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%10%%Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%11%%Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%12%%Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%13%%Jeremiah the tenth, Machbanai the eleventh.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%14%%These were of the sons of Gad, captains of the host: one of the least was over a hundred, and the greatest over a thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%15%%These are they that went over Jordan in the first month, when it had overflowed all its banks; and they put to flight all them of the valleys, both towards the east, and towards the west.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%16%%And there came of the children of Benjamin and Judah to the hold to David.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%17%%And David went out to meet them, and answered and said to them, If ye have come peaceably to me to help me, my heart shall be knit to you: but if ye have come to betray me to my enemies, seeing there is no wrong in my hands, the God of our fathers look on it, and rebuke it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%18%%Then the spirit came upon Amasai, who was chief of the captains, and he said, Thine are we, David, and on thy side, thou son of Jesse: peace, peace be to thee, and peace be to thy helpers; for thy God helpeth thee. Then David received them, and made them captains of the band.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%19%%And there fell some of Manasseh to David, when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle: but they helped them not: for the lords of the Philistines upon advisement sent him away, saying, He will fall to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%20%%And as he went to Ziklag, there fell to him of Manasseh, Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Jozabad, and Elihu, and Zilthai, captains of the thousands that were of Manasseh.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%21%%And they helped David against the band of the rovers: for they were all mighty men of valor, and were captains in the host.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%22%%For at that time day by day there came to David to help him, until it was a great host, like the host of God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%23%%And these are the numbers of the bands that were ready armed to the war, and came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%24%%The children of Judah that bore shield and spear were six thousand and eight hundred, ready armed for war.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%25%%Of the children of Simeon, mighty men of valor for war, seven thousand and one hundred.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%26%%Of the children of Levi four thousand and six hundred.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%27%%And Jehoiada was the leader of the Aaronites, and with him were three thousand and seven hundred;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%28%%And Zadok, a young man mighty of valor, and of his father's house twenty and two captains.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%29%%And of the children of Benjamin, the kindred of Saul, three thousand: for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept the ward of the house of Saul.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%30%%And of the children of Ephraim twenty thousand and eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous throughout the house of their fathers.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%31%%And of the half tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were expressed by name, to come and make David king.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%32%%And of the children of Issachar, who were men that had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do; the heads of them were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their command.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%33%%Of Zebulun, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, with all instruments of war, fifty thousand, who could keep rank: they were not of double heart.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%34%%And of Naphtali a thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty and seven thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%35%%And of the Danites expert in war twenty and eight thousand and six hundred.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%36%%And of Asher, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, forty thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%37%%And on the other side of Jordan, of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and of the half tribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, a hundred and twenty thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%38%%All these men of war, that could keep rank, came with a perfect heart to Hebron, to make David king over all Israel: and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%39%%And there they were with David three days, eating and drinking: for their brethren had prepared for them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%40%%Moreover, they that were nigh them, even to Issachar, and Zebulun, and Naphtali, brought bread on asses, and on camels, and on mules, and on oxen, and provision, meal, cakes of figs, and bunches of raisins, and wine, and oil, and oxen, and sheep abundantly: for there was joy in Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%1%%And David consulted with the captains of thousands, and of hundreds, and with every leader.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%2%%And David said to all the congregation of Israel, If it seemeth good to you, and that it is of the LORD our God, let us send abroad to our brethren every where, that are left in all the land of Israel, and with them also to the priests and Levites who are in their cities and suburbs, that they may assemble to us:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%3%%And let us bring again to us the ark of our God: for we inquired not at it in the days of Saul.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%4%%And all the congregation said that they would do so: for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%5%%So David assembled all Israel, from Shihor of Egypt even to the entrance of Hemath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjath-jearim.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%6%%And David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kirjath-jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up thence the ark of God the LORD, that dwelleth between the cherubim, whose name is called on it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%7%%And they carried the ark of God in a new cart out of the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%8%%And David and all Israel played before God with all their might, and with singing, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%9%%And when they came to the threshing-floor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%10%%And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Uzza, and he smote him, because he put his hand to the ark: and there he died before God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%11%%And David was displeased, because the LORD had made a breach upon Uzza: wherefore that place is called Perez-uzza to this day.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%12%%And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%13%%So David brought not the ark to himself to the city of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%14%%And the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house three months. And the LORD blessed the house of Obed-edom, and all that he had.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%1%%Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and timber of cedars, with masons and carpenters, to build him a house.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%2%%And David perceived that the LORD had confirmed him king over Israel, for his kingdom was exalted on high, because of his people Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%3%%And David took more wives at Jerusalem: and David begat more sons and daughters.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%4%%Now these are the names of his children which he had in Jerusalem; Shammua, and Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%5%%And Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpalet,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%6%%And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%7%%And Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphalet.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%8%%And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David. And David heard of it, and went out against them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%9%%And the Philistines came and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%10%%And David inquired of God, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines? and wilt thou deliver them into my hand? And the LORD said to him, Go up; for I will deliver them into thy hand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%11%%So they came up to Baal-perazim; and David smote them there. Then David said, God hath broken in upon my enemies by my hand like the breaking forth of waters: therefore they called the name of that place Baal-perazim.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%12%%And when they had left their gods there, David gave a commandment, and they were burned with fire.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%13%%And the Philistines yet again spread themselves abroad in the valley.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%14%%Therefore David inquired again of God: and God said to him, Go not up after them; turn away from them, and come upon them over against the mulberry trees.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%15%%And it shall be, when thou shalt hear a sound of going in the tops of the mulberry trees, then thou shalt go out to battle: for God hath gone forth before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%16%%David therefore did as God commanded him: and they smote the host of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gazer.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%17%%And the fame of David went out into all lands; and the LORD brought the fear of him upon all nations.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%1%%And David made him houses in the city of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it a tent.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%2%%Then David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites: for them hath the LORD chosen to carry the ark of God, and to minister to him for ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%3%%And David assembled all Israel to Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the LORD to its place, which he had prepared for it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%4%%And David assembled the children of Aaron, and the Levites:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%5%%Of the sons of Kohath; Uriel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twenty:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%6%%Of the sons of Merari; Asaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred and twenty:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%7%%Of the sons of Gershom; Joel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and thirty:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%8%%Of the sons of Elizaphan; Shemaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%9%%Of the sons of Hebron; Eliel the chief, and his brethren eighty:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%10%%Of the sons of Uzziel: Amminadab the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twelve.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%11%%And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, Shemaiah, and Eliel, and Amminadab,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%12%%And said to them, Ye are the chief of the fathers of the Levites: sanctify yourselves, both ye and your brethren, that ye may bring up the ark of the LORD God of Israel to the place that I have prepared for it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%13%%For because ye did it not at the first, the LORD our God made a breach upon us, for that we sought him not after the due order.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%14%%So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%15%%And the children of the Levites bore the ark of God upon their shoulders with the staffs on it, as Moses commanded, according to the word of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%16%%And David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brethren to be the singers with instruments of music, psalteries, and harps, and cymbals, sounding, by lifting up the voice with joy.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%17%%So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brethren, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%18%%And with them their brethren of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, the porters.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%19%%So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were appointed to sound with cymbals of brass;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%20%%And Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with psalteries on Alamoth;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%21%%And Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps on the Sheminith to excel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%22%%And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was for song: he instructed about the song, because he was skillful.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%23%%And Berechiah and Elkanah were door-keepers for the ark.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%24%%And Shebaniah, and Jehoshaphat, and Nethaneel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer the priests, did blow with the trumpets before the ark of God: and Obed-edom and Jehiah were door-keepers for the ark.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%25%%So David and the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-edom with joy.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%26%%And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites that bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, that they offered seven bullocks and seven rams.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%27%%And David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, and all the Levites that bore the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the master of the song with the singers: David also had upon him an ephod of linen.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%28%%Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouting, and with sound of the cornet, and with trumpets, and with cymbals, making a noise with psalteries and harps.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%29%%And it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of the LORD came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul, looking out at a window, saw king David dancing and playing: and she despised him in her heart.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%1%%So they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt-sacrifices and peace-offerings before God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%2%%And when David had made an end of offering the burnt-offerings and the peace-offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%3%%And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%4%%And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, and to record, and to thank and praise the LORD God of Israel:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%5%%Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-edom: and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps; but Asaph made a sound with cymbals;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%6%%Benaiah also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%7%%Then on that day David delivered first this psalm to thank the LORD into the hand of Asaph and his brethren.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%8%%Give thanks to the LORD, call upon his name, make known his deeds among the people.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%9%%Sing to him, sing psalms to him, talk ye of all his wonderous works.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%10%%Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%11%%Seek the LORD and his strength, seek his face continually.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%12%%Remember his wonderful works that he hath done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%13%%O ye seed of Israel his servant, ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%14%%He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%15%%Be ye mindful always of his covenant; the word which he commanded to a thousand generations;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%16%%Even of the covenant which he made with Abraham, and of his oath to Isaac;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%17%%And which he confirmed to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%18%%Saying, To thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%19%%When ye were but few, even a few, and strangers in it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%20%%And when they went from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%21%%He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%22%%Saying, Touch not my anointed, and do my prophets no harm.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%23%%Sing to the LORD, all the earth; show forth from day to day his salvation.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%24%%Declare his glory among the heathen; his wonderful works among all nations.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%25%%For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised: he also is to be feared above all gods.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%26%%For all the gods of the people are idols: but the LORD made the heavens.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%27%%Glory and honor are in his presence; strength and gladness are in his place.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%28%%Give to the LORD, ye kindreds of the people, give to the LORD glory and strength.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%29%%Give to the LORD the glory due to his name: bring an offering, and come before him: worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%30%%Fear before him, all the earth: the world also shall be stable, that it be not moved.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%31%%Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice: and let men say among the nations, The LORD reigneth.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%32%%Let the sea roar, and the fullness thereof: let the fields rejoice, and all that is therein.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%33%%Then shall the trees of the wood sing at the presence of the LORD, because he cometh to judge the earth.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%34%%O give thanks to the LORD; for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%35%%And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us together, and deliver us from the heathen, that we may give thanks to thy holy name, and glory in thy praise.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%36%%Blessed be the LORD God of Israel for ever and ever. And all the people said, Amen, and praised the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%37%%So he left there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every day's work required:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%38%%And Obed-edom with their brethren, sixty and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be porters:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%39%%And Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the LORD in the high place that was at Gibeon,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%40%%To offer burnt-offerings to the LORD upon the altar of the burnt-offering continually morning and evening, and to do according to all that is written in the law of the LORD, which he commanded Israel;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%41%%And with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because his mercy endureth for ever;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%42%%And with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were porters.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%43%%And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%1%%Now it came to pass, as David sat in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, Lo, I dwell in a house of cedars, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD remaineth under curtains.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%2%%Then Nathan said to David, Do all that is in thy heart; for God is with thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%3%%And it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%4%%Go and tell David my servant, Thus saith the LORD, Thou shalt not build me a house to dwell in:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%5%%For I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel to this day; but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%6%%Wherever I have walked with all Israel, have I spoken a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people, saying, Why have ye not built me a house of cedars?
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%7%%Now therefore thus shalt thou say to my servant David, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheep-cote, even from following the sheep, that thou shouldst be ruler over my people Israel:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%8%%And I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and have cut off all thy enemies from before thee, and have made thee a name like the name of the great men that are in the earth.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%9%%Also I will ordain a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, and they shall dwell in their place, and shall be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness waste them any more, as at the beginning.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%10%%And since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. Moreover, I will subdue all thy enemies. Furthermore, I tell thee that the LORD will build thee a house.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%11%%And it shall come to pass, when thy days shall be ended that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will raise up thy seed after thee, who shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%12%%He shall build me a house, and I will establish his throne for ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%13%%I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%14%%But I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom for ever: and his throne shall be established for evermore.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%15%%According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak to David.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%16%%And David the king came and sat before the LORD, and said, Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%17%%And yet this was a small thing in thy eyes, O God; for thou hast also spoken of thy servant's house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O LORD God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%18%%What can David speak more to thee for the honor of thy servant? for thou knowest thy servant.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%19%%O LORD, for thy servant's sake, and according to thy own heart, hast thou done all this greatness, in making known all these great things.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%20%%O LORD, there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%21%%And what one nation in the earth is like thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem to be his own people, to make thee a name of greatness and terribleness, by driving out nations from before thy people, whom thou hast redeemed out of Egypt?
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%22%%For thy people Israel didst thou make thy own people for ever; and thou, LORD, becamest their God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%23%%Therefore now, LORD, Let the thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant and concerning his house be established for ever, and do as thou hast said.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%24%%Let it even be established, that thy name may be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel: and let the house of David thy servant be established before thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%25%%For thou, O my God, hast told thy servant that thou wilt build him a house: therefore thy servant hath found in his heart to pray before thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%26%%And now, LORD, thou art God, and hast promised this goodness to thy servant:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%27%%Now therefore let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may be before thee for ever: for thou blessest, O LORD, and it shall be blessed for ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%1%%Now after this it came to pass that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%2%%And he smote Moab; and the Moabites became David's servants, and brought gifts.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%3%%And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah to Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the river Euphrates.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%4%%And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: David also houghed all the chariot-horses, but reserved of them a hundred chariots.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%5%%And when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%6%%Then David put garrisons in Syria-damascus; and the Syrians became David's servants, and brought gifts. Thus the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%7%%And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%8%%Likewise from Tibhath, and from Chun, cities of Hadarezer, David brought very much brass, with which Solomon made the brazen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%9%%Now when Tou king of Hamath heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadarezer king of Zobah;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%10%%He sent Hadoram his son to king David to inquire of his welfare, and to congratulate him, because he had fought against Hadarezer, and smitten him; (for Hadarezer had warred with Tou;) and with him all manner of vessels of gold, and silver, and brass.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%11%%Them also king David dedicated to the LORD, with the silver and the gold that he brought from all these nations; from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%12%%Moreover, Abishai the son of Zeruiah slew of the Edomites in the valley of salt eighteen thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%13%%And he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became David's servants. Thus the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%14%%So David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice among all his people.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%15%%And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, recorder;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%16%%And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were the priests; and Shavsha was scribe;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%18%%17%%And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief about the king.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%1%%Now it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%2%%And David said, I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me. And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%3%%But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honor thy father, that he hath sent comforters to thee? are not his servants come to thee to search, and to overthrow, and to explore the land?
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%4%%Wherefore Hanun took David's servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the midst hard by their buttocks, and sent them away.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%5%%Then there went certain, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them: for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards are grown, and then return.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%6%%And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syria-maachah, and out of Zobah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%7%%So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba. And the children of Ammon assembled from their cities, and came to battle.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%8%%And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%9%%And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array before the gate of the city: and the kings that had come were by themselves in the field.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%10%%Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he selected all the choice of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%11%%And the rest of the people he delivered to the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against the children of Ammon.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%12%%And he said, If the Syrians shall be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon shall be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%13%%Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for the cities of our God: and let the LORD do that which is good in his sight.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%14%%So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh before the Syrians to the battle; and they fled before him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%15%%And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%16%%And when the Syrians saw that they were defeated before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the river: and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%17%%And it was told to David; and he gathered all Israel, and passed over Jordan, and came upon them, and set the battle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%18%%But the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew of the Syrians seven thousand men who fought in chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%19%%19%%And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were defeated before Israel, they made peace with David, and became his servants: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%20%%1%%And it came to pass, that after the year had expired, at the time that kings go out to battle, Joab led forth the power of the army, and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab smote Rabbah, and destroyed it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%20%%2%%And David took the crown of their king from his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were precious stones in it; and it was set upon David's head: and he brought also a great quantity of spoil out of the city.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%20%%3%%And he brought out the people that were in it, and cut them with saws, and with harrows of iron, and with axes. Even so David dealt with all the cities of the children of Ammon. And David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%20%%4%%And it came to pass after this, that there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines: at which time Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Sippai, that was of the children of the giant: and they were subdued.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%20%%5%%And there was war again with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair slew Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, whose spear-staff was like a weaver's beam.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%20%%6%%And yet again there was war at Gath, where was a man of great stature, whose fingers and toes were four and twenty, six on each hand, and six on each foot: and he also was the son of the giant.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%20%%7%%But when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David's brother, slew him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%20%%8%%These were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%1%%And Satan stood up against Israel, and incited David to number Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%2%%And David said to Joab and to the rulers of the people, Go, number Israel from Beer-sheba even to Dan; and bring the number of them to me, that I may know it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%3%%And Joab answered, the LORD make his people a hundred times more numerous than they are: but, my lord the king, are they not all my lord's servants? why then doth my lord require this thing? why will he be a cause of trespass to Israel?
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%4%%Nevertheless the king's word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed, and went throughout all Israel, and came to Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%5%%And Joab gave the sum of the number of the people to David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and a hundred thousand men that drew sword: and Judah was four hundred and seventy thousand men that drew sword.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%6%%But Levi and Benjamin he counted not among them: for the king's word was abominable to Joab.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%7%%And God was displeased with this thing, therefore he smote Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%8%%And David said to God, I have sinned greatly, because I have done this thing: but now, I beseech thee, do away the iniquity of thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%9%%And the LORD spoke to Gad, David's seer, saying,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%10%%Go and tell David, saying, Thus saith the LORD, I offer thee three things; choose thee one of them, that I may do it to thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%11%%So Gad came to David, and said to him, Thus saith the LORD, Choose thee
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%12%%Either three years' famine; or three months to be destroyed before thy foes, while the sword of thy enemies overtaketh thee; or else three days the sword of the LORD, even the pestilence, in the land, and the angel of the LORD destroying throughout all the borders of Israel. Now therefore advise thyself what word I shall bring again to him that sent me.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%13%%And David said to Gad, I am in a great strait: let me fall now into the hand of the LORD; for very great are his mercies: but let me not fall into the hand of man.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%14%%So the LORD sent pestilence upon Israel: and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%15%%And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it: and as he was destroying, the LORD beheld, and he repented of the evil, and said to the angel that destroyed, It is enough, stay now thy hand. And the angel of the LORD stood by the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%16%%And David lifted up his eyes, and saw the angel of the LORD stand between the earth and the heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders of Israel, who were clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%17%%And David said to God, Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? even I it is that have sinned and done evil indeed; but as for these sheep, what have they done? let thy hand, I pray thee, O LORD my God, be on me, and on my father's house; but not on thy people, that they should be afflicted.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%18%%Then the angel of the LORD commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and erect an altar to the LORD in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%19%%And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spoke in the name of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%20%%And Ornan turned back, and saw the angel; and his four sons with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshing wheat.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%21%%And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked, and saw David, and went out of the threshing-floor, and bowed himself to David with his face to the ground.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%22%%Then David said to Ornan, Grant me the place of this threshing-floor, that I may build an altar in it to the LORD: thou shalt grant it to me for the full price: that the plague may be stayed from the people.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%23%%And Ornan said to David, Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes: lo, I give thee the oxen also for burnt-offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meat-offering; I give it all.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%24%%And king David said to Ornan, No; but I will verily buy it for the full price: for I will not take that which is thine for the LORD, nor offer burnt-offerings without cost.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%25%%So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%26%%And David built there an altar to the LORD, and offered burnt-offerings and peace-offerings, and called upon the LORD; and he answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt-offering.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%27%%And the LORD commanded the angel; and he put up his sword again into its sheath.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%28%%At that time when David saw that the LORD had answered him in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then he sacrificed there.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%29%%For the tabernacle of the LORD, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of the burnt-offering, were at that season in the high place at Gibeon.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%21%%30%%But David could not go before it to inquire of God: for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%1%%Then David said, This is the house of the LORD God, and this is the altar of the burnt-offering for Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%2%%And David commanded to assemble the strangers that were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wrought stones to build the house of God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%3%%And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the joinings; and brass in abundance without weight;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%4%%Also cedar trees in abundance: for the Zidonians and they of Tyre brought much cedar wood to David.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%5%%And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be built for the LORD must be very magnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore now make preparation for it. So David made abundant preparation before his death.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%6%%Then he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build a house for the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%7%%And David said to Solomon, My son, as for me, it was in my mind to build a house to the name of the LORD my God:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%8%%But the word of the LORD came to me, saying, Thou hast shed blood abundantly, and hast made great wars: thou shalt not build a house to my name, because thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%9%%Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies around: for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness to Israel in his days.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%10%%He shall build a house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel for ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%11%%Now, my son, the LORD be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of the LORD thy God, as he hath said of thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%12%%Only the LORD give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee charge concerning Israel, that thou mayest keep the law of the LORD thy God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%13%%Then shalt thou prosper, if thou shalt take heed to fulfill the statutes and judgments which the LORD charged Moses with concerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%14%%Now behold, in my trouble I have prepared for the house of the LORD a hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousand thousand talents of silver; and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add to them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%15%%Moreover, there are workmen with thee in great numbers, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all manner of skillful men for every manner of work.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%16%%Of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise therefore, and be doing, and the LORD be with thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%17%%David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son, saying,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%18%%Is not the LORD your God with you? and hath he not given you rest on every side? for he hath given the inhabitants of the land into my hand; and the land is subdued before the LORD, and before his people.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%22%%19%%Now set your heart and your soul to seek the LORD your God; arise, therefore, and build ye the sanctuary of the LORD God, to bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the name of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%1%%So when David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%2%%And he assembled all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%3%%Now the Levites were numbered from the age of thirty years and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirty and eight thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%4%%Of which, twenty and four thousand were to oversee the work of the house of the LORD; and six thousand were officers and judges:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%5%%Moreover, four thousand were porters; and four thousand praised the LORD with the instruments which I made, said David, to praise with them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%6%%And David divided them into courses among the sons of Levi, namely, Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%7%%Of the Gershonites, were, Laadan and Shimei.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%8%%The sons of Laadan: the chief was Jehiel, and Zetham, and Joel, three.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%9%%The sons of Shimei; Shelomith, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the chief of the fathers of Laadan.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%10%%And the sons of Shimei were, Jahath, Zina, and Jeush and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%11%%And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they were in one reckoning, according to their father's house.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%12%%The sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%13%%The sons of Amram; Aaron and Moses: and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and his sons for ever, to burn incense before the LORD, to minister to him, and to bless in his name for ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%14%%Now concerning Moses the man of God, his sons were named of the tribe of Levi.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%15%%The sons of Moses were, Gershom, and Eliezer.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%16%%Of the sons of Gershom; Shebuel was the chief.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%17%%And the sons of Eliezer were, Rehabiah the chief. And Eliezer had no other sons; but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%18%%Of the sons of Izhar; Shelomith the chief.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%19%%Of the sons of Hebron; Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jehaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%20%%Of the sons of Uzziel; Micah the first, and Jesiah the second.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%21%%The sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. The sons of Mahli; Eleazar, and Kish.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%22%%And Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters: and their brethren the sons of Kish took them.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%23%%The sons of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%24%%These were the sons of Levi after the house of their fathers; even the chief of the fathers, as they were counted by number of names by their polls, that did the work for the service of the house of the LORD, from the age of twenty years and upward.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%25%%For David said, The LORD God of Israel hath given rest to his people, that they may dwell in Jerusalem for ever;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%26%%And also to the Levites: they shall no more carry the tabernacle, nor any vessels of it for its service.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%27%%For by the last words of David the Levites were numbered from twenty years old and above:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%28%%Because their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the LORD, in the courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, and the work of the service of the house of God;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%29%%Both for the show-bread, and for the fine flour for meat-offering, and for the unleavened cakes, and for that which is baked in the pan, and for that which is fried, and for all manner of measure and size;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%30%%And to stand every morning to thank and praise the LORD, and likewise at evening;
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%31%%And to offer all burnt-sacrifices to the LORD on the sabbaths, in the new moons, and on the set feasts, by number, according to the order commanded to them, continually before the LORD:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%23%%32%%And that they should keep the charge of the tabernacle of the congregation, and the charge of the holy place, and the charge of the sons of Aaron their brethren, in the service of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%1%%Now these are the divisions of the sons of Aaron. The sons of Aaron; Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%2%%But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priests' office.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%3%%And David distributed them, both Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, according to their offices in their service.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%4%%And there were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar; and thus were they divided. Among the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen chief men of the house of their fathers, and eight among the sons of Ithamar according to the house of their fathers.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%5%%Thus were they divided by lot, one sort with another; for the governors of the sanctuary, and governors of the house of God, were of the sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%6%%And Shemaiah the son of Nethaneel the scribe, one of the Levites, wrote them before the king, and the princes, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and before the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites: one principal household being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%7%%Now the first lot came forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%8%%The third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%9%%The fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%10%%The seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%11%%The ninth to Jeshuah, the tenth to Shecaniah,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%12%%The eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%13%%The thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%14%%The fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%15%%The seventeenth to Hezer, the eighteenth to Aphses,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%16%%The nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezekel,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%17%%The one and twentieth to Jachin, the two and twentieth to Gamul,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%18%%The three and twentieth to Delaiah, the four and twentieth to Maaziah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%19%%These were the orderings of them in their service to come into the house of the LORD, according to their manner, under Aaron their father, as the LORD God of Israel had commanded him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%20%%And the rest of the sons of Levi were these: Of the sons of Amram; Shubael: of the sons of Shubael; Jehdeiah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%21%%Concerning Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, the first was Isshiah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%22%%Of the Izharites; Shelomoth: of the sons of Shelomoth; Jahath.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%23%%And the sons of Hebron; Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jehaziel the third, Jekameam the fourth.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%24%%Of the sons of Uzziel; Michah: of the sons of Michah; Shamir.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%25%%The brother of Michah was Isshiah: of the sons of Isshiah; Zechariah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%26%%The sons of Merari were Mahli, and Mushi: the sons of Jaaziah; Beno.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%27%%The sons of Merari by Jaaziah; Beno, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Ibri.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%28%%Of Mahli came Eleazar, who had no sons.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%29%%Concerning Kish: the son of Kish was Jerahmeel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%30%%The sons also of Mushi; Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after the house of their fathers.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%24%%31%%These likewise cast lots over against their brethren the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites, even the principal fathers over against their younger brethren.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%1%%Moreover David and the captains of the host separated to the service of the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals: and the number of the workmen according to their service was:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%2%%Of the sons of Asaph; Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asarelah, the sons of Asaph under the hands of Asaph, who prophesied according to the order of the king.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%3%%Of Jeduthun: the sons of Jeduthun; Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with a harp, to give thanks and to praise the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%4%%Of Heman: the sons of Heman; Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, and Mahazioth:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%5%%All these were the sons of Heman the king's seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteen sons and three daughters.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%6%%All these were under the hands of their father for song in the house of the LORD, with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, for the service of the house of God, according to the king's order to Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%7%%So the number of them, with their brethren that were instructed in the songs of the LORD, even all that were skillful, was two hundred and eighty eight.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%8%%And they cast lots, ward against ward, as well the small as the great, the teacher as the scholar.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%9%%Now the first lot came forth for Asaph to Joseph: the second to Gedaliah, who with his brethren and sons were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%10%%The third to Zaccur, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%11%%The fourth to Izri, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%12%%The fifth to Nethaniah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%13%%The sixth to Bukkiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%14%%The seventh to Jesharelah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%15%%The eighth to Jeshaiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%16%%The ninth to Mattaniah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%17%%The tenth to Shimei, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%18%%The eleventh to Azareel, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%19%%The twelfth to Hashabiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%20%%The thirteenth to Shubael, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%21%%The fourteenth to Mattithiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%22%%The fifteenth to Jeremoth, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%23%%The sixteenth to Hananiah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%24%%The seventeenth to Joshbekashah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%25%%The eighteenth to Hanani, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%26%%The nineteenth to Mallothi, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%27%%The twentieth to Eliathah, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%28%%The one and twentieth to Hothir, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%29%%The two and twentieth to Giddalti, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%30%%The three and twentieth to Mahazioth, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%25%%31%%The four and twentieth to Romamti-ezer, he, his sons, and his brethren, were twelve.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%1%%Concerning the divisions of the porters: Of the Korhites was Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%2%%And the sons of Meshelemiah were, Zechariah the first-born, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%3%%Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Elioenai the seventh.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%4%%Moreover the sons of Obed-edom were, Shemaiah the first-born, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethaneel the fifth,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%5%%Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth: for God blessed him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%6%%Also to Shemaiah his son were sons born, that ruled throughout the house of their father: for they were mighty men of valor.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%7%%The sons of Shemaiah; Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad, whose brethren were strong men, Elihu, and Semachiah.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%8%%All these of the sons of Obed-edom: they and their sons and their brethren, able men for strength for the service, were sixty and two of Obed-edom.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%9%%And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, strong men, eighteen.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%10%%Also Hosah of the children of Merari, had sons; Simri the chief, (for though he was not the first-born, yet his father made him the chief;)
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%11%%Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%12%%Among these were the divisions of the porters, even among the chief men, having wards one against another, to minister in the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%13%%And they cast lots, as well the small as the great, according to the house of their fathers, for every gate.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%14%%And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counselor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%15%%To obed-edom southward; and to his sons the house of Asuppim.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%16%%To Shuppim and Hosah the lot came forth westward, with the gate Shallecheth, by the way of the ascent, ward against ward.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%17%%Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and towards Asuppim, two and two.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%18%%At Parbar westward, four at the causey, and two at Parbar.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%19%%These are the divisions of the porters among the sons of Kore, and among the sons of Merari.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%20%%And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated things.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%21%%As concerning the sons of Laadan; the sons of the Gershonite Laadan, chief fathers, even of Laadan the Gershonite, were Jehieli.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%22%%The sons of Jehieli; Zetham, and Joel his brother, who were over the treasures of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%23%%Of the Amramites, and the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%24%%And Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasures.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%25%%And his brethren by Eliezer; Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%26%%Which Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasures of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the chief fathers, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the host, had dedicated.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%27%%Out of the spoils won in battles did they dedicate to maintain the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%28%%And all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, had dedicated; and whoever had dedicated any thing, it was under the hand of Shelomith, and of his brethren.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%29%%Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%30%%And of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of valor, a thousand and seven hundred, were officers among them of Israel on this side of Jordan westward in all the business of the LORD, and in the service of the king.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%31%%Among the Hebronites was Jerijah the chief, even among the Hebronites, according to the generations of his fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valor at Jazer of Gilead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%26%%32%%And his brethren, men of valor, were two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers, whom king David made rulers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God, and affairs of the king.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%1%%Now the children of Israel after their number, to wit, the chief fathers, and captains of thousands and hundreds, and their officers that served the king in any matter of the courses, which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, of every course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%2%%Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%3%%Of the children of Perez, was the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%4%%And over the course of the second month was Dodai an Ahohite, and of his course was Mikloth also the ruler: in his course likewise were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%5%%The third captain of the host for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, a chief priest: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
