1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%6%%This is that Benaiah, who was mighty among the thirty, and above the thirty: and in his course was Ammizabad his son.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%7%%The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%8%%The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%9%%The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%10%%The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%11%%The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zarhites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%12%%The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anetothite, of the Benjaminites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%13%%The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%14%%The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%15%%The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%16%%Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: the ruler of the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri: of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%17%%Of the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel: of the Aaronites, Zadok:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%18%%Of Judah, Elihu, one of the brethren of David: of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%19%%Of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah: of Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%20%%Of the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah: of the half tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%21%%Of the half tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah: of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%22%%Of Dan, Azareel the son of Jeroham. These were the princes of the tribes of Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%23%%But David took not the number of them from twenty years old and under: because the LORD had said he would increase Israel like to the stars of the heavens.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%24%%Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number, but he finished not, because there fell wrath for it against Israel; neither was the number put in the account of the chronicles of king David.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%25%%And over the king's treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel: and over the store-houses in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the castles, was Jehonathan the son of Uzziah:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%26%%And over them that did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%27%%And over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite: over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%28%%And over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the low plains was Baal-hanan the Gederite: and over the cellars of oil was Joash:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%29%%And over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%30%%Over the camels also was Obil the Ishmaelite: and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%31%%And over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagerite. All these were the rulers of the substance which was king David's.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%32%%Also Jonathan, David's uncle, was a counselor, a wise man, and a scribe: and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king's sons:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%33%%And Ahithophel was the king's counselor: and Hushai the Archite was the king's companion:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%27%%34%%And after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar: and the general of the king's army was Joab.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%1%%And David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the companies that ministered to the king by course, and the captains over the thousands, and captains over the hundreds, and the stewards over all the substance and possession of the king, and of his sons, with the officers, and with the mighty men, and with all the valiant men to Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%2%%Then David the king stood upon his feet, and said, Hear me, my brethren, and my people: As for me, I had in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and for the footstool of our God, and had made ready for the building:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%3%%But God said to me, Thou shalt not build a house for my name, because thou hast been a man of war, and hast shed blood.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%4%%However the LORD God of Israel chose me before all the house of my father to be king over Israel for ever: for he hath chosen Judah to be the ruler; and of the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father he approved me to make me king over all Israel:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%5%%And of all my sons, (for the LORD hath given me many sons,) he hath chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%6%%And he said to me, Solomon thy son, he shall build my house and my courts: for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his father.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%7%%Moreover I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he shall be constant to do my commandments and my judgments, as at this day.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%8%%Now therefore in the sight of all Israel the congregation of the LORD, and in the audience of our God, keep and seek for all the commandments of the LORD your God: that ye may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance for your children after you for ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%9%%And thou, Solomon my son, know thou the God of thy father, and serve him with a perfect heart, and with a willing mind: for the LORD searcheth all hearts and understandeth all the imaginations of the thoughts: if thou shalt seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou shalt forsake him, he will cast thee off for ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%10%%Take heed now; for the LORD hath chosen thee to build a house for the sanctuary: be strong, and do it.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%11%%Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porch, and of the houses of it, and of its treasuries, and of its upper chambers, and of its inner parlors, and of the place of the mercy-seat,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%12%%And the pattern of all that he had by the spirit, of the courts of the house of the LORD, and of all the chambers around, of the treasuries of the house of God, and of the treasuries of the dedicated things:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%13%%Also for the courses of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of the LORD, and for all the vessels of service in the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%14%%He gave of gold by weight for things of gold, for all instruments of all manner of service; silver also for all instruments of silver by weight, for all instruments of every kind of service:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%15%%Even the weight for the candlesticks of gold, and for their lamps of gold, by weight for every candlestick, and for its lamps: and for the candlesticks of silver by weight, both for the candlestick, and also for its lamps, according to the use of every candlestick.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%16%%And by weight he gave gold for the tables of show-bread, for every table; and likewise silver for the tables of silver:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%17%%Also pure gold for the flesh-hooks, and the bowls, and the cups: and for the golden basins he gave gold by weight for every basin; and likewise silver by weight for every basin of silver:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%18%%And for the altar of incense refined gold by weight; and gold for the pattern of the chariot of the cherubim, that spread out their wings, and covered the ark of the covenant of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%19%%All this, said David, the LORD made me understand in writing by his hand upon me, even all the works of this pattern.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%20%%And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong, and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed, for the LORD God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until thou hast finished all the work for the service of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%28%%21%%And behold, the courses of the priests and the Levites, even they shall be with thee for all the service of the house of God: and there shall be with thee for all manner of workmanship every willing skillful man, for any manner of service: also the princes and all the people will be wholly at thy command.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%1%%Furthermore David the king said to all the congregation, Solomon my son, whom alone God hath chosen, is yet young and tender, and the work is great: for the palace is not for man, but for the LORD God.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%2%%Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for things to he made of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and the brass for things of brass, the iron for things of iron, and wood for things of wood; onyx-stones, and stones to be set, glittering stones, and of divers colors, and all manner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%3%%Moreover, because I have set my affection to the house of my God, I have of my own possessions, of gold and silver, which I have given to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%4%%Even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, to overlay the walls of the houses:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%5%%The gold for things of gold, and the silver for things of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by the hands of artificers. And who then is willing to consecrate his service this day to the LORD?
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%6%%Then the chief of the fathers and princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, with the rulers over the king's work, offered willingly,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%7%%And gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand drams, and of silver ten thousand talents, and of brass eighteen thousand talents, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%8%%And they with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of the house of the LORD, by the hand of Jehiel the Gershonite.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%9%%Then the people rejoiced, for that they offered willingly, because with perfect heart they offered willingly to the LORD: and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%10%%Wherefore David blessed the LORD before all the congregation: and David said, Blessed be thou, LORD God of Israel our father, for ever and ever.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%11%%Thine, O LORD, is the greatness, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty: for all that is in the heaven and on the earth is thine; thine is the kingdom, O LORD, and thou art exalted as head above all.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%12%%Both riches and honor come from thee, and thou reignest over all; and in thy hand is power and might; and in thy hand it is to make great, and to give strength to all.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%13%%Now therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise thy glorious name.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%14%%But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things come from thee, and of thy own have we given thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%15%%For we are strangers before thee, and sojourners, as were all our fathers: our days on the earth are as a shadow, and there is no abiding.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%16%%O LORD our God, all this store that we have prepared to build thee a house for thy holy name cometh from thy hand, and is all thy own.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%17%%I know also, my God, that thou triest the heart, and hast pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of my heart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy thy people, who are present here, to offer willingly to thee.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%18%%O LORD God of Abraham, Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this for ever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of thy people, and prepare their heart to thee:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%19%%And give to Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep thy commandments, thy testimonies, and thy statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for which I have made provision.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%20%%And David said to all the congregation, Now bless the LORD your God. And all the congregation blessed the LORD God of their fathers, and bowed their heads, and worshiped the LORD, and the king.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%21%%And they sacrificed sacrifices to the LORD, and offered burnt-offerings to the LORD, on the morrow after that day, even a thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink-offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel:
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%22%%And ate and drank before the LORD on that day with great gladness. And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him to the LORD to be the chief governor, and Zadok to be priest.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%23%%Then Solomon sat on the throne of the LORD as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%24%%And all the princes, and the mighty men, and all the sons likewise of king David, submitted themselves to Solomon the king.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%25%%And the LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had not been on any king before him in Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%26%%Thus David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%27%%And the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; seven years he reigned in Hebron, and thirty and three years he reigned in Jerusalem.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%28%%And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor: and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%29%%Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of Samuel the seer, and in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer,
1000005%%1 Chronicles%%OT%%29%%30%%With all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of the countries.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%1%%And Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom, and the LORD his God was with him, and magnified him exceedingly.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%2%%Then Solomon spoke to all Israel, to the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every governor in all Israel, the chief of the fathers.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%3%%So Solomon, and all the congregation with him, went to the high place that was at Gibeon: for there was the tabernacle of the congregation of God, which Moses the servant of the LORD had made in the wilderness.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%4%%But the ark of God David had brought up from Kirjath-jearim to the place which David had prepared for it: for he had pitched a tent for it at Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%5%%Moreover the brazen altar, that Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, he put before the tabernacle of the LORD: and Solomon and the congregation sought to it.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%6%%And Solomon went up thither to the brazen altar before the LORD, which was at the tabernacle of the congregation, and offered a thousand burnt-offerings upon it.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%7%%In that night God appeared to Solomon, and said to him, Ask what I shall give thee.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%8%%And Solomon said to God, Thou hast shown great mercy to David my father, and hast made me to reign in his stead.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%9%%Now, O LORD God, let thy promise to David my father be established: for thou hast made me king over a people like the dust of the earth in multitude.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%10%%Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in before this people: for who can judge this thy great people?
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%11%%And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thy heart, and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honor, nor the life of thy enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee king:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%12%%Wisdom and knowledge are granted to thee; and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honor, such as none of the kings have had that have been before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%13%%Then Solomon came from his journey to the high place that was at Gibeon to Jerusalem, from before the tabernacle of the congregation, and reigned over Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%14%%And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, which he placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%15%%And the king made silver and gold at Jerusalem as plenteous as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycamore trees that are in the vale for abundance.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%16%%And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn: the king's merchants received the linen yarn at a price.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%1%%17%%And they fetched up, and brought out of Egypt a chariot for six hundred shekels of silver, and a horse for a hundred and fifty: and so they brought out horses for all the kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, by their means.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%1%%And Solomon determined to build a house for the name of the LORD, and a house for his kingdom.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%2%%And Solomon numbered out seventy thousand men to bear burdens, and eighty thousand to hew in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred to oversee them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%3%%And Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre, saying, As thou didst deal with David my father, and didst send him cedars to build him a house to dwell in it, even so deal with me.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%4%%Behold, I build a house to the name of the LORD my God, to dedicate it to him, and to burn before him sweet incense, and for the continual show-bread, and for the burnt-offerings morning and evening, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the solemn feasts of the LORD our God. This is an ordinance for ever to Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%5%%And the house which I build is great: for great is our God above all gods.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%6%%But who is able to build him a house, seeing the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain him? who am I then that I should build him a house, save only to burn sacrifice before him?
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%7%%Send me now therefore a man skillful to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and that hath skill to grave with the skillful men that are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father provided.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%8%%Send me also cedar trees, fir trees, and algum trees out of Lebanon: for I know that thy servants have skill to cut timber in Lebanon; and behold, my servants shall be with thy servants,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%9%%Even to prepare me timber in abundance: for the house which I am about to build shall be wonderfully great.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%10%%And behold, I will give to thy servants, the hewers that cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and twenty thousand baths of oil.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%11%%Then Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing, which he sent to Solomon, Because the LORD hath loved his people, he hath made thee king over them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%12%%Huram said moreover, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who hath given to David the king a wise son, endued with prudence and understanding, that may build a house for the LORD, and a house for his kingdom.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%13%%And now I have sent a skillful man, endued with understanding, of Huram my father's,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%14%%The son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, and his father was a man of Tyre, skillful to work in gold, and in silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue, and in fine linen, and in crimson; also to engrave any manner of engraving, and to find out every device which shall be put to him, with thy skillful men, and with the skillful men of my lord David thy father.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%15%%Now therefore the wheat, and the barley, the oil, and the wine which my lord hath spoken of, let him send to his servants;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%16%%And we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shalt need: and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa; and thou mayest convey it to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%17%%And Solomon numbered all the strangers that were in the land of Israel, after the numbering with which David his father had numbered them; and they were found a hundred and fifty thousand and three thousand and six hundred.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%2%%18%%And he set seventy thousand of them to be bearers of burdens, and eighty thousand to be hewers in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred overseers to set the people to work.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%1%%Then Solomon began to build the house of the LORD at Jerusalem in mount Moriah, where the LORD appeared to David his father, in the place that David had prepared in the threshing-floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%2%%And he began to build in the second day of the second month, in the fourth year of his reign.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%3%%Now these are the things in which Solomon was instructed for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the first measure was sixty cubits, and the breadth twenty cubits.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%4%%And the porch that was in the front of the house, the length of it was according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the hight was a hundred and twenty: and he overlaid it within with pure gold.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%5%%And the greater house he cieled with fir tree, which he overlaid with fine gold, and set on it palm trees and chains.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%6%%And he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty: and the gold was gold of Parvaim.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%7%%He overlaid also the house, the beams, the posts, and the walls of it, and the doors of it, with gold; and engraved cherubim on the walls.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%8%%And he made the most holy house, the length of which was according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the breadth of it twenty cubits: and he overlaid it with fine gold, amounting to six hundred talents.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%9%%And the weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. And he overlaid the upper chambers with gold.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%10%%And in the most holy house he made two cherubim of image work, and overlaid them with gold.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%11%%And the wings of the cherubim were twenty cubits long: one wing of the one cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing was likewise five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%12%%And one wing of the other cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing was five cubits also, joining to the wing of the other cherub.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%13%%The wings of these cherubim spread themselves forth twenty cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their faces were inward.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%14%%And he made the vail of blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine linen, and wrought cherubim upon it.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%15%%Also he made before the house two pillars of thirty and five cubits high, and the capital that was on the top of each of them was five cubits.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%16%%And he made chains, as in the oracle, and put them on the heads of the pillars; and made a hundred pomegranates, and put them on the chains.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%3%%17%%And he erected the pillars before the temple, one on the right hand, and the other on the left; and called the name of that on the right hand Jachin, and the name of that on the left Boaz.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%1%%Moreover he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits the length of it, and twenty cubits the breadth of it, and ten cubits the hight of it.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%2%%Also he made a molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim, round in compass, and five cubits the hight of it; and a line of thirty cubits encompassed it.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%3%%And under it was the similitude of oxen, which encompassed it: ten in a cubit, encompassing the sea. Two rows of oxen were cast, when it was cast.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%4%%It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking towards the north, and three looking towards the west, and three looking towards the south, and three looking towards the east: and the sea was set above upon them, and all their hinder parts were inward.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%5%%And the thickness of it was a hand-breadth, and the brim of it like the work of the brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies; and it received and held three thousand baths.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%6%%He made also ten lavers, and put five on the right hand, and five on the left, to wash in them: such things as they offered for the burnt-offering they washed in them; but the sea was for the priests to wash in.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%7%%And he made ten candlesticks of gold according to their form, and set them in the temple, five on the right hand, and five on the left.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%8%%He made also ten tables, and placed them in the temple, five on the right side, and five on the left. And he made a hundred basins of gold.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%9%%Furthermore he made the court of the priests, and the great court, and doors for the court, and overlaid the doors of them with brass.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%10%%And he set the sea on the right side of the east end, over against the south.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%11%%And Huram made the pots, and the shovels, and the basins. And Huram finished the work that he was to make for king Solomon for the house of God;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%12%%To wit, the two pillars, and the pommels, and the capitals which were on the top of the two pillars, and the two wreaths to cover the two pommels of the capitals which were on the top of the pillars;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%13%%And four hundred pomegranates on the two wreaths; two rows of pomegranates on each wreath, to cover the two pommels of the capitals which were upon the pillars.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%14%%He made also bases, and lavers he made upon the bases;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%15%%One sea, and twelve oxen under it.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%16%%The pots also, and the shovels, and the flesh-hooks, and all their instruments, did Huram his father make to king Solomon for the house of the LORD of bright brass.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%17%%In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground between Succoth and Zeredathah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%18%%Thus Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance: for the weight of the brass could not be ascertained.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%19%%And Solomon made all the vessels that were for the house of God, the golden altar also, and the tables on which the show-bread was set;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%20%%Moreover the candlesticks with their lamps, that they should burn after the manner before the oracle, of pure gold;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%21%%And the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, made he of gold, and that perfect gold;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%4%%22%%And the snuffers, and the basins, and the spoons, and the censers, of pure gold: and the entry of the house, the inner doors of it for the most holy place, and the doors of the house of the temple, were of gold.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%1%%Thus all the work that Solomon made for the house of the LORD was finished: and Solomon brought in all the things that David his father had dedicated; and the silver, and the gold, and all the instruments, he put among the treasures of the house of God.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%2%%Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the chief of the fathers of the children of Israel, to Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the city of David, which is Zion.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%3%%Wherefore all the men of Israel assembled themselves to the king in the feast which was in the seventh month.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%4%%And all the elders of Israel came; and the Levites took up the ark.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%5%%And they brought up the ark, and the tabernacle of the congregation, and all the holy vessels that were in the tabernacle, these did the priests and the Levites bring up.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%6%%Also king Solomon, and all the congregation of Israel that were assembled to him before the ark, sacrificed sheep and oxen, which could not be told nor numbered for multitude.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%7%%And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the LORD to its place, to the oracle of the house, into the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%8%%For the cherubim spread forth their wings over the place of the ark, and the cherubim covered the ark, and the staffs of it above.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%9%%And they drew out the staffs of the ark, that the ends of the staffs were seen from the ark before the oracle; but they were not seen without. And there it is to this day.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%10%%There was nothing in the ark save the two tables which Moses put in it at Horeb, when the LORD made a covenant with the children of Israel, when they came out of Egypt.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%11%%And it came to pass, when the priests had come out of the holy place: (for all the priests that were present were sanctified, and did not then wait by course:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%12%%Also the Levites who were the singers, all of them of Asaph, of Heman, of Jeduthun, with their sons and their brethren; being arrayed in white linen, having cymbals and psalteries and harps, stood at the east end of the altar, and with them a hundred and twenty priests sounding with trumpets:)
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%13%%It came even to pass, as the trumpeters and singers were as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking the LORD; and when they lifted up their voice with the trumpets and cymbals and instruments of music, and praised the LORD, saying, For he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever: that then the house was filled with a cloud, even the house of the LORD;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%5%%14%%So that the priests could not stand to minister by reason of the cloud: for the glory of the LORD had filled the house of God.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%1%%Then said Solomon, The LORD hath said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%2%%But I have built a house of habitation for thee, and a place for thy dwelling for ever.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%3%%And the king turned his face, and blessed the whole congregation of Israel: and all the congregation of Israel stood.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%4%%And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, who hath with his hands fulfilled that which he spoke with his mouth to my father David, saying,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%5%%Since the day that I brought forth my people from the land of Egypt I chose no city among all the tribes of Israel to build a house in, that my name might be there; neither chose I any man to be a ruler over my people Israel:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%6%%But I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there; and have chosen David to be over my people Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%7%%Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of the LORD God of Israel:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%8%%But the LORD said to David my father, Forasmuch as it was in thy heart to build a house for my name, thou didst well in that it was in thy heart;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%9%%Notwithstanding thou shalt not build the house; but thy son who shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%10%%The LORD therefore hath performed his word that he hath spoken; for I am raised up in the room of David my father, and am set on the throne of Israel, as the LORD promised, and have built the house for the name of the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%11%%And in it have I put the ark, in which is the covenant of the LORD, that he made with the children of Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%12%%And he stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%13%%(For Solomon had made a brazen scaffold, of five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the court: and upon it he stood, and kneeled upon his knees before all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands towards heaven,)
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%14%%And said, O LORD God of Israel, there is no God like thee in the heaven, nor on the earth; who keepest covenant, and showest mercy to thy servants, that walk before thee with all their hearts:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%15%%Thou who hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him; and hast spoken with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thy hand, as it is this day.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%16%%Now therefore, O LORD God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne of Israel; provided thy children take heed to their way to walk in my law, as thou hast walked before me.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%17%%Now then, O LORD God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou hast spoken to thy servant David.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%18%%But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house which I have built!
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%19%%Have respect therefore to the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O LORD my God, to hearken to the cry and the prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%20%%That thy eyes may be open upon this house day and night, upon the place of which thou hast said, that thou wouldst put thy name there; to hearken to the prayer which thy servant prayeth towards this place.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%21%%Hearken therefore to the supplications of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, which they shall make towards this place: hear thou from thy dwelling-place, even from heaven; and when thou hearest, forgive.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%22%%If a man shall sin against his neighbor, and an oath be laid upon him to make him swear, and the oath shall come before thy altar in this house;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%23%%Then hear thou from heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, by requiting the wicked, by recompensing his way upon his own head; and by justifying the righteous, by giving him according to his righteousness.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%24%%And if thy people Israel shall be put to the worse before the enemy, because they have sinned against thee; and shall return and confess thy name, and pray and make supplication before thee in this house;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%25%%Then hear thou from the heavens, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again to the land which thou gavest to them and to their fathers.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%26%%When the heaven is shut, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; yet if they pray towards this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%27%%Then hear thou from heaven, and forgive the sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, when thou hast taught them the good way in which they should walk; and send rain upon thy land, which thou hast given to thy people for an inheritance.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%28%%If there shall be dearth in the land, if there be pestilence, if there be blasting, or mildew, locusts, or caterpillars; if their enemies shall besiege them in the cities of their land; whatever calamity, or whatever sickness there be:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%29%%Then whatever prayer, or whatever supplication shall be made by any man, or by all the people of Israel, when every one shall know his own calamity, and his own grief, and shall spread forth his hands in this house:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%30%%Then hear thou from heaven thy dwelling-place, and forgive, and render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart thou knowest (for thou only knowest the hearts of the children of men:)
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%31%%That they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways, so long as they live in the land which thou gavest to our fathers.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%32%%Moreover concerning the stranger, who is not of thy people Israel, but hath come from a distant country for thy great name's sake, and thy mighty hand, and thy out-stretched arm; if they come and pray in this house;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%33%%Then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling-place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth to thee for; that all people of the earth may know thy name, and fear thee, as do thy people Israel, and may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%34%%If thy people go out to war against their enemies by the way that thou shalt send them, and they pray to thee towards this city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy name;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%35%%Then hear thou from the heavens their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%36%%If they sin against thee, (for there is no man who sinneth not,) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them over before their enemies, and they carry them away captives to a land far off or near;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%37%%Yet if they bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried captive, and turn and pray to thee in the land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done amiss, and have dealt wickedly;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%38%%If they return to thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have carried them captives, and pray towards their land which thou gavest to their fathers, and towards the city which thou hast chosen, and towards the house which I have built for thy name:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%39%%Then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling-place, their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive thy people who have sinned against thee.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%40%%Now, my God, let, I beseech thee, thy eyes be open, and let thy ears be attentive to the prayer that is made in this place.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%41%%Now therefore arise, O LORD God, into thy resting-place, thou, and the ark of thy strength: let thy priests, O LORD God, be clothed with salvation, and let thy saints rejoice in goodness.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%6%%42%%O LORD God, turn not away the face of thy anointed: remember the mercies of David thy servant.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%1%%Now when Solomon had made an end of praying, the fire came down from heaven, and consumed the burnt-offering and the sacrifices; and the glory of the LORD filled the house.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%2%%And the priests could not enter into the house of the LORD, because the glory of the LORD had filled the LORD'S house.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%3%%And when all the children of Israel saw how the fire came down, and the glory of the LORD upon the house, they bowed themselves with their faces to the ground upon the pavement, and worshiped, and praised the LORD, saying, For he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%4%%Then the king and all the people offered sacrifices before the LORD.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%5%%And king Solomon offered a sacrifice of twenty and two thousand oxen, and a hundred and twenty thousand sheep: so the king and all the people dedicated the house of God.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%6%%And the priests waited on their offices: the Levites also with instruments of music of the LORD, which David the king had made to praise the LORD, because his mercy endureth for ever, when David praised by their ministry; and the priests sounded trumpets before them, and all Israel stood.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%7%%Moreover Solomon hallowed the middle of the court that was before the house of the LORD: for there he offered burnt-offerings, and the fat of the peace-offerings, because the brazen altar which Solomon had made was not able to receive the burnt-offerings, and the meat-offerings, and the fat.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%8%%Also at the same time Solomon kept the feast seven days, and all Israel with him, a very great congregation, from the entrance of Hamath to the river of Egypt.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%9%%And on the eighth day they made a solemn assembly: for they kept the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%10%%And on the three and twentieth day of the seventh month he sent the people away to their tents, glad and merry in heart for the goodness that the LORD had shown to David, and to Solomon, and to Israel his people.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%11%%Thus Solomon finished the house of the LORD, and the king's house: and all that came into Solomon's heart to make in the house of the LORD, and in his own house, he prosperously effected.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%12%%And the LORD appeared to Solomon by night, and said to him, I have heard thy prayer, and have chosen this place to myself for a house of sacrifice.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%13%%If I shut up heaven that there be no rain, or if I command the locusts to devour the land, or if I send pestilence among my people;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%14%%If my people, who are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%15%%Now my eyes shall be open, and my ears attentive to the prayer that is made in this place.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%16%%For now have I chosen and sanctified this house, that my name may be there for ever: and my eyes and my heart shall be there perpetually.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%17%%And as for thee, if thou wilt walk before me, as David thy father walked, and do according to all that I have commanded thee, and shalt observe my statutes and my judgments;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%18%%Then will I establish the throne of thy kingdom, according as I have covenanted with David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%19%%But if ye turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments, which I have set before you, and shall go and serve other gods, and worship them;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%20%%Then will I pluck them up by the roots out of my land which I have given them; and this house, which I have sanctified for my name, will I cast out of my sight, and will make it to be a proverb and a by-word among all nations.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%21%%And this house, which is high, shall be an astonishment to every one that passeth by it; so that he shall say, Why hath the LORD done thus to this land, and to this house?
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%7%%22%%And it shall be answered, Because they forsook the LORD God of their fathers, who brought them out of the land of Egypt, and laid hold on other gods, and worshiped them, and served them: therefore hath he brought all this evil upon them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%1%%And it came to pass at the end of twenty years, wherein Solomon had built the house of the LORD, and his own house,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%2%%That the cities which Huram had restored to Solomon, Solomon built them, and caused the children of Israel to dwell there.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%3%%And Solomon went to Hamath-zobah, and prevailed against it.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%4%%And he built Tadmor in the wilderness, and all the store cities, which he built in Hamath.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%5%%Also he built Beth-horon the upper, and Beth-horon the nether, fortified cities, with walls, gates, and bars;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%6%%And Baalath, and all the store cities that Solomon had, and all the chariot cities, and the cities of the horsemen, and all that Solomon desired to build in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and throughout all the land of his dominion.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%7%%As for all the people that were left of the Hittites, and the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites, who were not of Israel,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%8%%But of their children, who were left after them in the land, whom the children of Israel consumed not, them did Solomon make to pay tribute until this day.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%9%%But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no servants for his work; but they were men of war, and chief of his captains, and captains of his chariots and horsemen.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%10%%And these were the chief of king Solomon's officers, even two hundred and fifty, that bore rule over the people.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%11%%And Solomon brought up the daughter of Pharaoh from the city of David to the house that he had built for her: for he said, My wife shall not dwell in the house of David king of Israel, because the places are holy, to which the ark of the LORD hath come.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%12%%Then Solomon offered burnt-offerings to the LORD on the altar of the LORD, which he had built before the porch,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%13%%Even after a certain rate every day, offering according to the commandment of Moses, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the solemn feasts, three times in the year, even in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%14%%And he appointed, according to the order of David his father, the courses of the priests to their service, and the Levites to their charges, to praise and minister before the priests, as the duty of every day required: the porters also by their courses at every gate: for so had David the man of God commanded.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%15%%And they departed not from the commandment of the king to the priests and Levites concerning any matter, or concerning the treasures.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%16%%Now all the work of Solomon was prepared to the day of the foundation of the house of the LORD, and until it was finished. So the house of the LORD was perfected.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%17%%Then went Solomon to Ezion-geber, and to Eloth, at the sea side in the land of Edom.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%8%%18%%And Huram sent to him by the hands of his servants, ships, and servants that had knowledge of the sea; and they went with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and took thence four hundred and fifty talents of gold, and brought them to king Solomon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%1%%And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great company, and camels that bore spices, and gold in abundance, and precious stones: and when she had come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%2%%And Solomon told her all her questions: and there was nothing hid from Solomon which he told her not.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%3%%And when the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%4%%And the provisions of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel; his cup-bearers also, and their apparel; and his ascent by which he went up into the house of the LORD; there was no more spirit in her.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%5%%And she said to the king, It was a true report which I heard in my own land of thy acts, and of thy wisdom:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%6%%Yet, I believed not their words, until I came, and my eyes had seen it: and behold, the one half of the greatness of thy wisdom was not told to me: for thou exceedest the fame that I heard.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%7%%Happy are thy men, and happy are these thy servants, who stand continually before thee, and hear thy wisdom.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%8%%Blessed be the LORD thy God, who delighted in thee to set thee on his throne, to be king for the LORD thy God: because thy God loved Israel, to establish them for ever, therefore he made thee king over them, to do judgment and justice.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%9%%And she gave the king a hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices great abundance, and precious stones: neither was there any such spice as the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%10%%And the servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon, who brought gold from Ophir, brought algum trees and precious stones.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%11%%And the king made of the algum trees terraces to the house of the LORD, and to the king's palace, and harps and psalteries for singers: and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%12%%And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, besides that which she had brought to the king. So she turned, and went away to her own land, she and her servants.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%13%%Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and sixty and six talents of gold;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%14%%Besides that which chapmen and merchants brought. And all the kings of Arabia and governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%15%%And king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one target.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%16%%And three hundred shields made he of beaten gold: three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield. And the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%17%%Moreover, the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%18%%And there were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne, and stays on each side of the sitting-place, and two lions standing by the stays:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%19%%And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps. There was not the like made in any kingdom.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%20%%And all the drinking vessels of king Solomon were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: none were of silver; it was not any thing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%21%%For the king's ships went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram: once every three years came the ships of Tarshish bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%22%%And king Solomon surpassed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%23%%And all the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, that God had put in his heart.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%24%%And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, harness, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%25%%And Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen; whom he bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%26%%And he reigned over all the kings from the river even to the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%27%%And the king made silver in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar trees he made as the sycamore trees that are in the low plains in abundance.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%28%%And they brought to Solomon horses from Egypt, and from all lands.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%29%%Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, are they not written in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer against Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%30%%And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%9%%31%%And Solomon slept with his fathers, and he was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%1%%And Rehoboam went to Shechem: for to Shechem had all Israel come to make him king.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%2%%And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who was in Egypt, whither he had fled from the presence of Solomon the king, heard it, that Jeroboam returned from Egypt.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%3%%And they sent and called him. So Jeroboam and all Israel came and spoke to Rehoboam, saying,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%4%%Thy father made our yoke grievous: now therefore ease thou somewhat the grievous servitude of thy father, and his heavy yoke that he put upon us, and we will serve thee.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%5%%And he said to them, Come again to me after three days. And the people departed.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%6%%And king Rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, What counsel give ye me to return answer to this people?
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%7%%And they spoke to him, saying, If thou wilt be kind to this people, and please them, and speak good words to them, they will be thy servants for ever.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%8%%But he forsook the counsel which the old men gave him, and took counsel with the young men that were brought up with him, that stood before him.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%9%%And he said to them, What advice give ye, that we may return answer to this people, who have spoken to me, saying, Ease somewhat the yoke that thy father put upon us?
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%10%%And the young men that were brought up with him, spoke to him, saying, Thus shalt thou answer the people that spoke to thee, saying, Thy father made our yoke heavy, but make thou it somewhat lighter for us; thus shalt thou say to them, My little finger shall be thicker than my father's loins.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%11%%For whereas my father put a heavy yoke upon you, I will put more to your yoke: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%12%%So Jeroboam and all the people came to Rehoboam on the third day, as the king directed, saying, Come again to me on the third day.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%13%%And the king answered them roughly; and king Rehoboam forsook the counsel of the old men,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%14%%And answered them after the advice of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, but I will add to it; my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%15%%So the king hearkened not to the people: for the cause was of God, that the LORD might perform his word, which he spoke by the hand of Ahijah the Shilonite to Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%16%%And when all Israel saw that the king would not hearken to them, the people answered the king, saying, What portion have we in David? and we have no inheritance in the son of Jesse: every man to your tents, O Israel: and now, David, see to thy own house. So all Israel went to their tents.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%17%%But as for the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah, Rehoboam reigned over them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%18%%Then king Rehoboam sent Hadoram that was over the tribute; and the children of Israel stoned him with stones, that he died. But king Rehoboam made speed to get into his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%10%%19%%And Israel rebelled against the house of David to this day.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%1%%And when Rehoboam had come to Jerusalem, he gathered of the house of Judah and Benjamin a hundred and eighty thousand chosen men who were warriors, to fight against Israel, that he might bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%2%%But the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%3%%Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all Israel in Judah and Benjamin, saying,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%4%%Thus saith the LORD, Ye shall not go up, nor fight against your brethren: return every man to his house: for this thing is done by me. And they obeyed the words of the LORD, and returned from going against Jeroboam.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%5%%And Rehoboam dwelt in Jerusalem, and built cities for defense in Judah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%6%%He built even Beth-lehem, and Etam, and Tekoa,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%7%%And Beth-zur, and Shocho, and Adullam,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%8%%And Gath, and Mareshah, and Ziph,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%9%%And Adoraim, and Lachish, and Azekah,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%10%%And Zorah, and Ajalon, and Hebron, which are in Judah and in Benjamin, fortified cities.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%11%%And he fortified the strong holds, and put captains in them, and store of provisions, and of oil and wine.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%12%%And in every several city he put shields and spears, and made them exceeding strong, having Judah and Benjamin on his side.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%13%%And the priests and the Levites that were in all Israel resorted to him from all their borders.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%14%%For the Levites left their suburbs and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem: for Jeroboam and his sons had cast them off from executing the priest's office to the LORD:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%15%%And he ordained him priests for the high places, and for the devils, and for the calves which he had made.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%16%%And after them out of all the tribes of Israel, such as set their hearts to seek the LORD God of Israel came to Jerusalem, to sacrifice to the LORD God of their fathers.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%17%%So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and made Rehoboam the son of Solomon strong, three years: for three years they walked in the way of David and Solomon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%18%%And Rehoboam took to himself Mahalath the daughter of Jerimoth the son of David for a wife, and Abihail the daughter of Eliab the son of Jesse;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%19%%Who bore him children, Jeush, and Shamariah, and Zaham.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%20%%And after her he took Maachah the daughter of Absalom; who bore him Abijah, and Attai, and Ziza, and Shelomith.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%21%%And Rehoboam loved Maachah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines: (for he took eighteen wives, and sixty concubines; and begat twenty and eight sons, and sixty daughters.)
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%22%%And Rehoboam made Abijah the son of Maachah the chief, to be ruler among his brethren: for he thought to make him king.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%11%%23%%And he dealt wisely, and dispersed of all his children throughout all the countries of Judah and Benjamin, to every fortified city: and he gave them provisions in abundance. And he desired many wives.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%1%%And it came to pass, when Rehoboam had established the kingdom, and had strengthened himself, he forsook the law of the LORD, and all Israel with him.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%2%%And it came to pass, that in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had transgressed against the LORD,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%3%%With twelve hundred chariots, and sixty thousand horsemen: and the people were without number that came with him out of Egypt; the Lubims, the Sukkiims, and the Cushites.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%4%%And he took the fortified cities which pertained to Judah, and came to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%5%%Then came Shemaiah the prophet to Rehoboam, and to the princes of Judah, that were assembled at Jerusalem because of Shishak, and said to them, Thus saith the LORD, Ye have forsaken me, and therefore have I also left you in the hand of Shishak.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%6%%Upon which the princes of Israel, and the king humbled themselves; and they said, The LORD is righteous.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%7%%And when the LORD saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the LORD came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance; and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%8%%Nevertheless they shall be his servants; that they may know my service, and the service of the kingdoms of the countries.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%9%%So Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king's house; he took all: he carried away also the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%10%%Instead of which, king Rehoboam made shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the chief of the guard, that kept the entrance of the king's house.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%11%%And when the king entered into the house of the LORD, the guard came and conveyed them, and brought them again into the guard-chamber.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%12%%And when he humbled himself, the wrath of the LORD turned from him, that he would not destroy him altogether: and also in Judah things went well.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%13%%So king Rehoboam strengthened himself in Jerusalem, and reigned: for Rehoboam was one and forty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the LORD had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. And his mother's name was Naamah an Ammonitess.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%14%%And he did evil, because he prepared not his heart to seek the LORD.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%15%%Now the acts of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the book of Shemaiah the prophet, and of Iddo the seer, concerning genealogies? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%12%%16%%And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David: and Abijah his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%1%%Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam began Abijah to reign over Judah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%2%%He reigned three years in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Michaiah the daughter of Uriel of Gibeah. And there was war between Abijah and Jeroboam.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%3%%And Abijah set the battle in array with an army of valiant men of war, even four hundred thousand chosen men: Jeroboam also set the battle in array against him with eight hundred thousand chosen men, being mighty men of valor.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%4%%And Abijah stood upon mount Zemaraim, which is in mount Ephraim, and said, Hear me, thou Jeroboam, and all Israel;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%5%%Ought ye not to know that the LORD God of Israel gave the kingdom over Israel to David for ever, even to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%6%%Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat the servant of Solomon the son of David, hath risen up, and hath rebelled against his lord.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%7%%And there are gathered to him vain men, the children of Belial, and they have strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and tender-hearted, and could not withstand them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%8%%And now ye think to withstand the kingdom of the LORD in the hand of the sons of David; and ye are a great multitude, and there are with you golden calves, which Jeroboam made you for gods.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%9%%Have ye not cast out the priests of the LORD, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites, and have made for you priests after the manner of the nations of other lands? so that whoever cometh to consecrate himself with a young bullock and seven rams, the same may be a priest of them that are no gods.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%10%%But as for us, the LORD is our God, and we have not forsaken him; and the priests, who minister to the LORD, are the sons of Aaron, and the Levites wait upon their business:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%11%%And they burn to the LORD every morning and every evening burnt-sacrifices and sweet incense: the show-bread also they set in order upon the pure table; and the candlestick of gold with its lamps to burn every evening: for we keep the charge of the LORD our God; but ye have forsaken him.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%12%%And behold, God himself is with us for our captain, and his priests with sounding trumpets to cry alarm against you. O children of Israel, fight ye not against the LORD God of your fathers; for ye will not prosper.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%13%%But Jeroboam caused an ambush to come about behind them: so they were before Judah, and the ambush was behind them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%14%%And when Judah looked back, behold, the battle was before and behind: and they cried to the LORD, and the priests sounded with the trumpets.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%15%%Then the men of Judah gave a shout: and as the men of Judah shouted, it came to pass, that God smote Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%16%%And the children of Israel fled before Judah: and God delivered them into their hand.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%17%%And Abijah and his people slew them with a great slaughter: so there fell down slain of Israel five hundred thousand chosen men.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%18%%Thus the children of Israel were brought under at that time, and the children of Judah prevailed, because they relied upon the LORD God of their fathers.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%19%%And Abijah pursued Jeroboam, and took cities from him, Beth-el with its towns, and Jeshanah with its towns, and Ephron with its towns.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%20%%Neither did Jeroboam recover strength again in the days of Abijah: and the LORD struck him, and he died.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%21%%But Abijah became mighty, and married fourteen wives, and begat twenty and two sons, and sixteen daughters.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%13%%22%%And the rest of the acts of Abijah, and his ways, and his sayings, are written in the story of the prophet Iddo.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%1%%So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Asa his son reigned in his stead. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%2%%And Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of the LORD his God:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%3%%For he took away the altars of the strange gods, and the high places, and broke down the images, and cut down the groves:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%4%%And commanded Judah to seek the LORD God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%5%%Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%6%%And he built fortified cities in Judah: for the land had rest, and he had no war in those years; because the LORD had given him rest.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%7%%Therefore he said to Judah, Let us build these cities, and make about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is yet before us; because we have sought the LORD our God, we have sought him, and he hath given us rest on every side. So they built, and prospered.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%8%%And Asa had an army of men that bore targets and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bore shields and drew bows, two hundred and eighty thousand: all these were mighty men of valor.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%9%%And there came out against them Zerah the Cushite, with a host of a thousand thousand, and three hundred chariots; and came to Mareshah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%10%%Then Asa went out against him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathath at Mareshah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%11%%And Asa cried to the LORD his God, and said, LORD, it is nothing with thee to help, whether with many, or with them that have no power: help us, O LORD our God; for we rest on thee, and in thy name we go against this multitude. O LORD, thou art our God; let not man prevail against thee.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%12%%So the LORD smote the Cushites before Asa, and before Judah; and the Cushites fled.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%13%%And Asa and the people that were with him pursued them to Gerar: and the Cushites were overthrown, that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before the LORD, and before his host; and they carried away very much spoil.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%14%%And they smote all the cities about Gerar; for the fear of the LORD came upon them: and they plundered all the cities; for there was exceeding much spoil in them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%14%%15%%They smote also the tents of cattle, and carried away sheep and camels in abundance, and returned to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%1%%And the Spirit of God came upon Azariah the son of Oded:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%2%%And he went out to meet Asa, and said to him, Hear ye me, Asa, and all Judah and Benjamin; The LORD is with you, while ye are with him; and if ye seek him, he will be found of you; but if ye forsake him, he will forsake you.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%3%%Now for a long season Israel hath been without the true God, and without a teaching priest, and without law.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%4%%But when they in their trouble returned to the LORD God of Israel, and sought him, he was found by them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%5%%And in those times there was no peace to him that went out, nor to him that came in, but great vexations were upon all the inhabitants of the countries.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%6%%And nation was destroyed by nation, and city by city: for God troubled them with all adversity.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%7%%Be ye strong therefore, and let not your hands be weak; for your work shall be rewarded.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%8%%And when Asa heard these words, and the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage, and put away the abominable idols out of all the land of Judah and Benjamin, and out of the cities which he had taken from mount Ephraim, and renewed the altar of the LORD, that was before the porch of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%9%%And he gathered all Judah and Benjamin, and the strangers with them out of Ephraim and Manasseh, and out of Simeon: for they resorted to him out of Israel in multitudes, when they saw that the LORD his God was with him.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%10%%So they assembled at Jerusalem in the third month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%11%%And they offered to the LORD at the same time, of the spoil which they had brought, seven hundred oxen and seven thousand sheep.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%12%%And they entered into a covenant to seek the LORD God of their fathers with all their heart and with all their soul;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%13%%That whoever would not seek the LORD God of Israel should be put to death, whether small or great, whether man or woman.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%14%%And they swore to the LORD with a loud voice, and with shouting, and with trumpets, and with cornets.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%15%%And all Judah rejoiced at the oath: for they had sworn with all their heart, and sought him with their whole desire; and he was found by them: and the LORD gave them rest on all sides.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%16%%And also concerning Maachah the mother of Asa the king, he removed her from being queen, because she had made an idol in a grove: and Asa cut down her idol, and stamped it, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%17%%But the high places were not taken away out of Israel: nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect all his days.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%18%%And he brought into the house of God the things that his father had dedicated, and that he himself had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%15%%19%%And there was no more war until the five and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%1%%In the six and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa Baasha king of Israel came against Judah, and built Ramah, to the intent that he might let none go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%2%%Then Asa brought silver and gold out of the treasures of the house of the LORD and of the king's house, and sent to Ben-hadad king of Syria, that dwelt at Damascus, saying,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%3%%There is a league between me and thee, as there was between my father and thy father: behold, I have sent thee silver and gold; go, break thy league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%4%%And Ben-hadad hearkened to king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel; and they smote Ijon, and Dan, and Abelmaim, and all the store cities of Naphtali.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%5%%And it came to pass, when Baasha heard it, that he left off the building of Ramah, and let his work cease.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%6%%Then Asa the king took all Judah; and they carried away the stones of Ramah, and the timber of it, with which Baasha was building, and he built with it Geba and Mizpah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%7%%And at that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah, and said to him, Because thou hast relied on the king of Syria, and not relied on the LORD thy God, therefore hath the host of the king of Syria escaped out of thy hand.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%8%%Were not the Cushites and the Lubims a numerous army, with very many chariots and horsemen? yet, because thou didst rely on the LORD, he delivered them into thy hand.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%9%%For the eyes of the LORD run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to show himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect towards him. In this thou hast done foolishly: therefore from henceforth thou shalt have wars.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%10%%Then Asa was wroth with the seer, and put him in a prison house; for he was in a rage with him because of this thing. And Asa oppressed some of the people the same time.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%11%%And behold, the acts of Asa, first and last, lo, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%12%%And Asa in the thirty and ninth year of his reign was diseased in his feet, until his disease was exceedingly severe: yet in his disease he sought not to the LORD, but to the physicians.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%13%%And Asa slept with his fathers, and died in the one and fortieth year of his reign.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%16%%14%%And they buried him in his own sepulchers which he had made for himself in the city of David, and laid him in the bed which was filled with sweet odors and divers kinds of spices prepared by the apothecaries' art: and they made a very great burning for him.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%1%%And Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his stead, and strengthened himself against Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%17%%2%%And he placed forces in all the fortified cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah, and in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa his father had taken.
