1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%4%%Also he built altars in the house of the LORD, of which the LORD had said, In Jerusalem shall my name be for ever.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%5%%And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%6%%And he caused his children to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom: also he observed times, and used enchantments, and used witchcraft, and dealt with a familiar spirit, and with wizards: he wrought much evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%7%%And he set a carved image, the idol which he had made, in the house of God, of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen before all the tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%8%%Neither will I any more remove the foot of Israel from the land which I have appointed for your fathers; provided they will take heed to do all that I have commanded them, according to the whole law and the statutes and the ordinances by the hand of Moses.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%9%%So Manasseh made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to err, and to do worse than the heathen, whom the LORD had destroyed before the children of Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%10%%And the LORD spoke to Manasseh, and to his people: but they would not hearken.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%11%%Wherefore the LORD brought upon them the captains of the army of the king of Assyria, who took Manasseh among the thorns, and bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%12%%And when he was in affliction, he besought the LORD his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%13%%And prayed to him: and he was entreated by him, and heard his supplication, and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the LORD he is God.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%14%%Now after this, he built a wall without the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entrance at the fish-gate, and compassed about Ophel, and raised it up a very great highth, and put captains of war in all the fortified cities of Judah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%15%%And he took away the strange gods, and the idol out of the house of the LORD, and all the altars that he had built in the mount of the house of the LORD, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%16%%And he repaired the altar of the LORD, and sacrificed on it peace-offerings and thank-offerings, and commanded Judah to serve the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%17%%Nevertheless, the people sacrificed still in the high places, yet to the LORD their God only.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%18%%Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and his prayer to his God, and the words of the seers that spoke to him in the name of the LORD God of Israel, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%19%%His prayer also, and how God was entreated by him, and all his sin, and his trespass, and the places in which he built high places, and set up groves and graven images, before he was humbled: behold, they are written among the sayings of the seers.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%20%%So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%21%%Amon was two and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned two years in Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%22%%But he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, as did Manasseh his father: for Amon sacrificed to all the carved images which Manasseh his father had made, and served them;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%23%%And humbled not himself before the LORD, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but Amon trespassed more and more.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%24%%And his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%33%%25%%But the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%1%%Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem one and thirty years.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%2%%And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, and walked in the ways of David his father, and declined neither to the right hand, nor to the left.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%3%%For in the eighth year of his reign, while he was yet young, he began to seek after the God of David his father: and in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem from the high places, and the groves, and the carved images, and the molten images.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%4%%And they broke down the altars of Baalim in his presence; and the images, that were on high above them, he cut down; and the groves, and the carved images, and the molten images, he broke in pieces, and made dust of them and strewed it upon the graves of them that had sacrificed to them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%5%%And he burnt the bones of the priests upon their altars, and cleansed Judah and Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%6%%And so did he in the cities of Manasseh, and Ephraim, and Simeon, even to Naphtali, with their mattocks around.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%7%%And when he had broken down the altars and the groves, and had beaten the graven images into powder, and cut down all the idols throughout all the land of Israel, he returned to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%8%%Now in the eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged the land, and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah the governor of the city, and Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder, to repair the house of the LORD his God.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%9%%And when they came to Hilkiah the high priest, they delivered the money that was brought into the house of God, which the Levites that kept the doors had collected from the hand of Manasseh and Ephraim, and from all the remnant of Israel, and from all Judah and Benjamin; and they returned to Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%10%%And they put it in the hand of the workmen that had the oversight of the house of the LORD, and they gave it to the workmen that wrought in the house of the LORD, to repair and mend the house:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%11%%Even to the artificers and builders they gave it, to buy hewn stone, and timber for couplings, and to floor the houses which the kings of Judah had destroyed.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%12%%And the men did the work faithfully: and the overseers of them were Jahath and Obadiah, the Levites, of the sons of Merari; and Zechariah and Meshullam, of the sons of the Kohathites, to superintend it; and others of the Levites, all that had skill in instruments of music.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%13%%Also they were over the bearers of burdens, and were overseers of all that wrought the work in any manner of service: and of the Levites there were scribes, and officers, and porters.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%14%%And when they brought out the money that was brought into the house of the LORD, Hilkiah the priest found the book of the law of the LORD given by Moses.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%15%%And Hilkiah answered and said to Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of the LORD. And Hilkiah delivered the book to Shaphan.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%16%%And Shaphan carried the book to the king, and brought the king word back again, saying, All that was committed to thy servants, they perform.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%17%%And they have collected the money that was found in the house of the LORD, and have delivered it into the hand of the overseers, and to the hand of the workmen.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%18%%Then Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest hath given me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%19%%And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the law, that he rent his clothes.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%20%%And the king commanded Hilkiah, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Abdon the son of Micah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah a servant of the king's, saying,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%21%%Go, inquire of the LORD for me, and for them that are left in Israel, and in Judah, concerning the words of the book that is found: for great is the wrath of the LORD that is poured out upon us, because our fathers have not kept the word of the LORD, to do after all that is written in this book.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%22%%And Hilkiah, and they that the king had appointed, went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvath, the son of Hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college:) and they spoke to her to that effect.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%23%%And she answered them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Tell ye the man that sent you to me.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%24%%Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon its inhabitants, even all the curses that are written in the book which they have read before the king of Judah:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%25%%Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore my wrath shall be poured out upon this place, and shall not be quenched.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%26%%And as for the king of Judah, who sent you to inquire of the LORD, so shall ye say to him, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel concerning the words which thou hast heard;
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%27%%Because thy heart was tender, and thou didst humble thyself before God, when thou didst hear his words against this place, and against its inhabitants, and didst humble thyself before me, and didst rend thy clothes, and weep before me; I have even heard thee also, saith the LORD.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%28%%Behold, I will gather thee to thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered to thy grave in peace, neither shall thy eyes see all the evil that I will bring upon this place, and upon the inhabitants of the same. So they brought the king word again.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%29%%Then the king sent and convened all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%30%%And the king went into the house of the LORD, and all the men of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and the priests, and the Levites, and all the people, great and small: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant that was found in the house of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%31%%And the king stood in his place, and made a covenant before the LORD, to walk after the LORD, and to keep his commandments, and his testimonies, and his statutes, with all his heart, and with all his soul, to perform the words of the covenant which are written in this book.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%32%%And he caused all that were present in Jerusalem and Benjamin, to stand to it. And the inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to the covenant of God, the God of their fathers.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%34%%33%%And Josiah took away all the abominations out of all the countries that pertained to the children of Israel, and made all that were present in Israel, to serve, even to serve the LORD their God. And all his days they departed not from following the LORD, the God of their fathers.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%1%%Moreover, Josiah kept a passover to the LORD in Jerusalem: and they killed the passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%2%%And he set the priests in their charges, and encouraged them to the service of the house of the LORD,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%3%%And said to the Levites that taught all Israel, who were holy to the LORD, Put the holy ark in the house which Solomon the son of David king of Israel built; it shall not be a burden upon your shoulders: serve now the LORD your God, and his people Israel,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%4%%And prepare yourselves by the houses of your fathers after your courses, according to the writing of David king of Israel, and according to the writing of Solomon his son.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%5%%And stand in the holy place according to the divisions of the families of the fathers of your brethren the people, and after the division of the families of the Levites.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%6%%So kill the passover, and sanctify yourselves, and prepare your brethren, that they may do according to the word of the LORD by the hand of Moses.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%7%%And Josiah gave to the people, of the flock, lambs and kids, all for the passover-offerings, for all that were present, to the number of thirty thousand, and three thousand bullocks: these were of the king's substance.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%8%%And his princes gave willingly to the people, to the priests, and to the Levites: Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, rulers of the house of God, gave to the priests for the passover-offerings two thousand and six hundred small cattle, and three hundred oxen.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%9%%Conaniah also, and Shemaiah, and Nethaneel, his brethren, and Hashabiah and Jehiel and Jozabad, chief of the Levites, gave to the Levites for passover-offerings five thousand small cattle, and five hundred oxen.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%10%%So the service was prepared, and the priests stood in their place, and the Levites in their courses, according to the king's commandment.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%11%%And they killed the passover, and the priests sprinkled the blood from their hands, and the Levites flayed them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%12%%And they removed the burnt-offerings, that they might give according to the divisions of the families of the people, to offer to the LORD, as it is written in the book of Moses. And so did they with the oxen.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%13%%And they roasted the passover with fire according to the ordinance: but the other holy offerings they boiled in pots, and in caldrons, and in pans, and divided them speedily among all the people.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%14%%And afterwards they made ready for themselves, and for the priests: because the priests the sons of Aaron were busied in offering burnt-offerings and the fat until night; therefore the Levites prepared for themselves, and for the priests the sons of Aaron.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%15%%And the singers the sons of Asaph were in their place, according to the commandment of David, and Asaph, and Heman, and Jeduthun the king's seer; and the porters waited at every gate; they might not depart from their service; for their brethren the Levites prepared for them.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%16%%So all the service of the LORD was prepared the same day, to keep the passover, and to offer burnt-offerings upon the altar of the LORD, according to the commandment of king Josiah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%17%%And the children of Israel that were present kept the passover at that time, and the feast of unleavened bread seven days.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%18%%And there was no passover like that kept in Israel from the days of Samuel the prophet; neither did all the kings of Israel keep such a passover as Josiah kept, and the priests, and the Levites, and all Judah and Israel that were present, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%19%%In the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah was this passover kept.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%20%%After all this, when Josiah had prepared the temple, Necho king of Egypt came up to fight against Charchemish by Euphrates: and Josiah went out against him.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%21%%But he sent embassadors to him, saying, What have I to do with thee, thou king of Judah? I come not against thee this day, but against the house with which I have war: for God commanded me to make haste: forbear thee from meddling with God, who is with me, that he may not destroy thee.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%22%%Nevertheless Josiah would not turn his face from him, but disguised himself that he might fight with him, and hearkened not to the words of Necho from the mouth of God, and came to fight in the valley of Megiddo.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%23%%And the archers shot at king Josiah; and the king said to his servants, Have me away; for I am severely wounded.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%24%%His servants therefore took him out of that chariot, and put him in the second chariot that he had; and they brought him to Jerusalem, and he died, and was buried in one of the sepulchers of his fathers. And all Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%25%%And Jeremiah lamented for Josiah: and all the singing men and the singing women have spoken of Josiah in their lamentations to this day, and made them an ordinance in Israel: and behold, they are written in the lamentations.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%26%%Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and his goodness, according to that which was written in the law of the LORD,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%35%%27%%And his deeds, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%1%%Then the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and made him king in his father's stead in Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%2%%Jehoahaz was twenty and three years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months in Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%3%%And the king of Egypt deposed him at Jerusalem, and condemned the land in a hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%4%%And the king of Egypt made Eliakim his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem, and changed his name to Jehoiakim. And Necho took Jehoahaz his brother, and carried him to Egypt.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%5%%Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD his God.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%6%%Against him came up Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and bound him in fetters, to carry him to Babylon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%7%%Nebuchadnezzar also carried of the vessels of the house of the LORD to Babylon, and put them in his temple at Babylon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%8%%Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and his abominations which he did, and that which was found in him, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah. And Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%9%%Jehoiachin was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned three months and ten days in Jerusalem: and he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%10%%And when the year had expired, king Nebuchadnezzar sent, and brought him to Babylon, with the goodly vessels of the house of the LORD, and made Zedekiah his brother king over Judah and Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%11%%Zedekiah was one and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned eleven years in Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%12%%And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD his God, and humbled not himself before Jeremiah the prophet speaking from the mouth of the LORD.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%13%%And he also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God: but he stiffened his neck, and hardened his heart from turning to the LORD God of Israel.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%14%%Moreover, all the chief of the priests, and the people, transgressed very much after all the abominations of the heathen; and polluted the house of the LORD which he had hallowed in Jerusalem.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%15%%And the LORD God of their fathers sent to them by his messengers, rising up betimes, and sending; because he had compassion on his people, and on his dwelling-place:
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%16%%But they mocked the messengers of God, and despised his words, and misused his prophets, until the wrath of the LORD arose against his people, till there was no remedy.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%17%%Therefore he brought upon them the king of the Chaldees, who slew their young men with the sword in the house of their sanctuary, and had no compassion upon young man or maiden, old man, or him that stooped for age: he gave them all into his hand.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%18%%And all the vessels of the house of God, great and small, and the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king, and of his princes; all these he brought to Babylon.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%19%%And they burnt the house of God, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all its palaces with fire, and destroyed all its goodly vessels.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%20%%And them that had escaped from the sword he carried away to Babylon; where they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%21%%To fulfill the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah, until the land had enjoyed her sabbaths: for as long as she lay desolate she kept sabbath, to fulfill seventy years.
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%22%%Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD spoken by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
1000005%%2 Chronicles%%OT%%36%%23%%Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, All the kingdoms of the earth hath the LORD God of heaven given me; and he hath charged me to build him a house in Jerusalem, which is in Judah. Who is there among you of all his people? The LORD his God be with him, and let him go up.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%1%%Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%2%%Thus saith Cyrus king of Persia, The LORD God of heaven hath given me all the kingdoms of the earth; and he hath charged me to build him a house at Jerusalem, which is in Judah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%3%%Who is there among you of all his people? his God be with him, and let him go up to Jerusalem, which is in Judah, and build the house of the LORD God of Israel, (he is the God,) who is in Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%4%%And whoever remaineth in any place where he sojourneth, let the men of his place help him with silver, and with gold, and with goods, and with beasts, besides the free-will-offering for the house of God that is in Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%5%%Then arose the chief of the fathers of Judah and Benjamin, and the priests, and the Levites, with all them whose spirit God had raised, to go up to build the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%6%%And all they that were about them strengthened their hands with vessels of silver, with gold, with goods, and with beasts, and with precious things, besides all that was willingly offered.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%7%%Also Cyrus the king brought forth the vessels of the house of the LORD, which Nebuchadnezzar had brought from Jerusalem, and had put them in the house of his gods;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%8%%Even those did Cyrus king of Persia bring forth by the hand of Mithredath the treasurer, and numbered them to Sheshbazzar, the prince of Judah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%9%%And this is the number of them: thirty chargers of gold, a thousand chargers of silver, nine and twenty knives,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%10%%Thirty basins of gold, silver basins of a second sort four hundred and ten, and other vessels a thousand.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%1%%11%%All the vessels of gold and of silver were five thousand and four hundred. All these did Sheshbazzar bring with them of the captivity that were brought from Babylon to Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%1%%Now these are the children of the province that went up from the captivity, of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away to Babylon, and came again to Jerusalem and Judah, every one to his city;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%2%%Who came with Zerubbabel: Jeshua, Nehemiah, Seraiah, Reelaiah, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mizpar, Bigvai, Rehum, Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%3%%The children of Parosh, two thousand a hundred seventy and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%4%%The children of Shephatiah, three hundred seventy and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%5%%The children of Arah, seven hundred seventy and five.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%6%%The children of Pahath-moab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred and twelve.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%7%%The children of Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%8%%The children of Zattu, nine hundred forty and five.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%9%%The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and sixty.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%10%%The children of Bani, six hundred forty and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%11%%The children of Bebai, six hundred twenty and three.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%12%%The children of Azgad, a thousand two hundred twenty and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%13%%The children of Adonikam, six hundred sixty and six.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%14%%The children of Bigvai, two thousand fifty and six.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%15%%The children of Adin, four hundred fifty and four.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%16%%The children of Ater of Hezekiah, ninety and eight.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%17%%The children of Bezai, three hundred twenty and three.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%18%%The children of Jorah, an hundred and twelve.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%19%%The children of Hashum, two hundred twenty and three.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%20%%The children of Gibbar, ninety and five.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%21%%The children of Beth-lehem, a hundred twenty and three.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%22%%The men of Netophah, fifty and six.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%23%%The men of Anathoth, a hundred twenty and eight.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%24%%The children of Azmaveth, forty and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%25%%The children of Kirjath-arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty and three.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%26%%The children of Ramah and Gaba, six hundred twenty and one.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%27%%The men of Michmas, a hundred twenty and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%28%%The men of Beth-el and Ai, two hundred twenty and three.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%29%%The children of Nebo, fifty and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%30%%The children of Magbish, a hundred fifty and six.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%31%%The children of the other Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%32%%The children of Harim, three hundred and twenty.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%33%%The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred twenty and five.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%34%%The children of Jericho, three hundred forty and five.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%35%%The children of Senaah, three thousand and six hundred and thirty.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%36%%The priests: the children of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred seventy and three.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%37%%The children of Immer, a thousand fifty and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%38%%The children of Pashur, a thousand two hundred forty and seven.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%39%%The children of Harim, a thousand and seventeen.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%40%%The Levites: the children of Jeshua and Kadmiel, of the children of Hodaviah, seventy and four.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%41%%The singers: the children of Asaph, a hundred twenty and eight.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%42%%The children of the porters: the children of Shallum, the children of Ater, the children of Talmon, the children of Akkub, the children of Hatita, the children of Shobai, in all a hundred thirty and nine.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%43%%The Nethinims: the children of Ziha, the children of Hasupha, the children of Tabbaoth,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%44%%The children of Keros, the children of Siaha, the children of Padon,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%45%%The children of Lebanah, the children of Hagabah, the children of Akkub,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%46%%The children of Hagab, the children of Shalmai, the children of Hanan,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%47%%The children of Giddel, the children of Gahar, the children of Reaiah,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%48%%The children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda, the children of Gazzam,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%49%%The children of Uzza, the children of Paseah, the children of Besai,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%50%%The children of Asnah, the children of Mehunim, the children of Nephusim,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%51%%The children of Bakbuk, the children of Hakupha, the children of Harhur,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%52%%The children of Bazluth, the children of Mehida, the children of Harsha,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%53%%The children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Thamah,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%54%%The children of Neziah, the children of Hatipha.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%55%%The children of Solomon's servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Sophereth, the children of Peruda,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%56%%The children of Jaalah, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%57%%The children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth of Zebaim, the children of Ami.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%58%%All the Nethinims, and the children of Solomon's servants, were three hundred ninety and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%59%%And these were they who went up from Tel-melah, Tel-harsa, Cherub, Addan, and Immer: but they could not show their fathers' house, and their seed, whether they were of Israel:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%60%%The children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children of Nekoda, six hundred fifty and two.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%61%%And of the children of the priests: the children of Habaiah, the children of Koz, the children of Barzillai: who took a wife of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite, and was called after their name:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%62%%These sought their register among those that were reckoned by genealogy, but they were not found: therefore were they, as polluted, put from the priesthood.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%63%%And the Tirshatha said to them, that they should not eat of the most holy things, till there stood up a priest with Urim and with Thummim.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%64%%The whole congregation together was forty and two thousand three hundred and sixty,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%65%%Besides their servants and their maids, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty and seven: and there were among them two hundred singing-men and singing-women.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%66%%Their horses were seven hundred thirty and six; their mules, two hundred forty and five;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%67%%Their camels, four hundred thirty and five; their asses, six thousand seven hundred and twenty.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%68%%And some of the chief of the fathers, when they came to the house of the LORD which is at Jerusalem, offered freely for the house of God to set it up in its place:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%69%%They gave after their ability to the treasure of the work sixty and one thousand drams of gold, and five thousand pounds of silver, and one hundred priests garments.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%2%%70%%So the priests, and the Levites, and some of the people, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinims, dwelt in their cities, and all Israel in their cities.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%1%%And when the seventh month had come, and the children of Israel were in the cities, the people assembled themselves as one man at Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%2%%Then stood up Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brethren the priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and his brethren, and built the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt-offerings on it as it is written in the law of Moses the man of God.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%3%%And they set the altar upon its bases; for fear was upon them because of the people of those countries: and they offered burnt-offerings on it to the LORD, even burnt-offerings morning and evening.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%4%%They kept also the feast of tabernacles, as it is written, and offered the daily burnt-offerings by number, according to the custom, as the duty of every day required;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%5%%And afterward offered the continual burnt-offering, both of the new moons, and of all the set feasts of the LORD that were consecrated, and of every one that willingly offered a free-will-offering to the LORD.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%6%%From the first day of the seventh month they began to offer burnt-offerings to the LORD. But the foundation of the temple of the LORD was not yet laid.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%7%%They gave money also to the masons, and to the carpenters; and provisions, and drink, and oil, to them of Zidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea of Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%8%%Now in the second year of their coming to the house of God at Jerusalem, in the second month, began Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and the remnant of their brethren the priests and the Levites, and all they that had come out of the captivity to Jerusalem; and appointed the Levites, from twenty years old and upward, to set forward the work of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%9%%Then stood Jeshua with his sons and his brethren, Kadmiel and his sons, the sons of Judah, together, to set forward the workmen in the house of God: the sons of Henadad, with their sons and their brethren the Levites.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%10%%And when the builders laid the foundation of the temple of the LORD, they set the priests in their apparel with trumpets, and the Levites the sons of Asaph with cymbals, to praise the LORD, after the ordinance of David king of Israel.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%11%%And they sang together by course in praising and giving thanks to the LORD; because he is good, for his mercy endureth for ever towards Israel. And all the people shouted with a great shout, when they praised the LORD, because the foundation of the house of the LORD was laid.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%12%%But many of the priests and Levites and chief of the fathers, old men, that had seen the first house, when the foundation of this house was laid before their eyes, wept with a loud voice; and many shouted aloud for joy:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%3%%13%%So that the people could not discern the noise of the shout of the joy from the noise of the weeping of the people: for the people shouted with a loud shout, and the noise was heard afar off.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%1%%Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity were building the temple to the LORD God of Israel;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%2%%Then they came to Zerubbabel, and to the chief of the fathers, and said to them, Let us build with you: for we seek your God, as ye do; and we do sacrifice to him since the days of Esar-haddon king of Assur, who brought us up hither.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%3%%But Zerubbabel, and Jeshua, and the rest of the chief of the fathers of Israel, said to them, Ye have nothing to do with us to build a house to our God; but we ourselves together will build to the LORD God of Israel, as king Cyrus the king of Persia hath commanded us.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%4%%Then the people of the land weakened the hands of the people of Judah, and troubled them in building,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%5%%And hired counselors against them, to frustrate their purpose, all the days of Cyrus king of Persia, even until the reign of Darius king of Persia.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%6%%And in the reign of Ahasuerus, in the beginning of his reign, they wrote to him an accusation against the inhabitants of Judah and Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%7%%And in the days of Artaxerxes wrote Bishlam, Mithredath, Tabeel, and the rest of their companions to Artaxerxes king of Persia, and the writing of the letter was written in the Syrian language, and interpreted in the Syrian language.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%8%%Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%9%%Then wrote Rehum the chancellor, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions; the Dianites, the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Susanchites, the Dehavites, and the Elamites,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%10%%And the rest of the nations whom the great and noble Asnapper brought over, and set in the cities of Samaria, and the rest that are on this side of the river, and at such a time.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%11%%This is the copy of the letter that they sent to him, even to Artaxerxes the king: Thy servants the men on this side of the river, and at such a time.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%12%%Be it known to the king, that the Jews who came from thee to us are come to Jerusalem, building the rebellious and the noxious city, and have set up its walls, and joined the foundations.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%13%%Be it known now to the king, that, if this city shall be built, and the walls set up again, then they will not pay toll, tribute, and custom, and so thou wilt endamage the revenue of the kings.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%14%%Now because we have maintenance from the king's palace, and it was not meet for us to see the king's dishonor, therefore have we sent and certified the king;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%15%%That search may be made in the book of the records of thy fathers: so wilt thou find in the book of the records, and know that this city is a rebellious city, and hurtful to kings and provinces, and that they have moved sedition within the same of old time: for which cause was this city destroyed.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%16%%We certify the king that, if this city shall be built again, and its walls set up, by this means thou wilt have no portion on this side of the river.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%17%%Then the king sent an answer to Rehum the chancellor, and to Shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companions that dwell in Samaria, and to the rest beyond the river, Peace, and at such a time.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%18%%The letter which ye sent to us hath been plainly read before me.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%19%%And I commanded, and search hath been made, and it is found that this city of old time hath made insurrection against kings, and that rebellion and sedition have been made in it.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%20%%There have also been mighty kings over Jerusalem, who have ruled over all countries beyond the river; and toll, tribute, and custom, was paid to them.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%21%%Give ye now commandment to cause these men to cease, and that this city be not built, until another commandment shall be given from me.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%22%%Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%23%%Now when the copy of king Artaxerxes' letter was read before Rehum, and Shimshai the scribe, and their companions, they went up in haste to Jerusalem to the Jews, and made them to cease by force and power.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%4%%24%%Then ceased the work of the house of God which is at Jerusalem. So it ceased until the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%1%%Then the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews that were in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, even to them.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%2%%Then rose up Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and began to build the house of God which is at Jerusalem: and with them were the prophets of God helping them.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%3%%At the same time came to them Tatnai, governor on this side of the river, and Shethar-boznai, and their companions, and said thus to them, Who hath commanded you to build this house, and to make up this wall?
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%4%%Then said we to them after this manner, What are the names of the men that make this building?
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%5%%But the eye of their God was upon the elders of the Jews, that they could not cause them to cease, till the matter came to Darius: and then they returned answer by letter concerning this matter.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%6%%The copy of the letter that Tatnai, governor on this side of the river, and Shethar-boznai, and his companions the Apharsachites, who were on this side of the river, sent to Darius the king:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%7%%They sent a letter to him, in which was written thus; To Darius the king, all peace.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%8%%Be it known to the king, that we went into the province of Judea, to the house of the great God, which is built with great stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and this work proceedeth rapidly, and prospereth in their hands.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%9%%Then we asked those elders, and said to them thus, Who commanded you to build this house, and to erect these walls?
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%10%%We asked their names also, to certify thee, that we might write the names of the men that were the chief of them.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%11%%And thus they returned us answer, saying, We are the servants of the God of heaven and earth, and build the house that was erected these many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and set up.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%12%%But after that our fathers had provoked the God of heaven to wrath, he gave them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon, the Chaldean, who destroyed this house, and carried the people away into Babylon.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%13%%But in the first year of Cyrus the king of Babylon, the same king Cyrus made a decree to build this house of God.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%14%%And the vessels also of gold and silver of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple that was in Jerusalem, and brought them into the temple of Babylon, those did Cyrus the king take out of the temple of Babylon, and they were delivered to one, whose name was Sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%15%%And said to him, Take these vessels, go, carry them into the temple that is in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be built in its place.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%16%%Then came the same Sheshbazzar, and laid the foundation of the house of God which is in Jerusalem: and since that time even until now hath it been in building, and yet it is not finished.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%5%%17%%Now therefore, if it seemeth good to the king, let there be search made in the king's treasure-house, which is there at Babylon, whether it is so, that a decree was made by Cyrus the king to build this house of God at Jerusalem, and let the king send his pleasure to us concerning this matter.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%1%%Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the rolls, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%2%%And there was found at Achmetha, in the palace that is in the province of the Medes, a roll, and in it was a record thus written:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%3%%In the first year of Cyrus the king, the same Cyrus the king made a decree concerning the house of God at Jerusalem, Let the house be built, the place where they offered sacrifices, and let the foundations of it be strongly laid; the hight of it sixty cubits, and the breadth of it sixty cubits;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%4%%With three rows of great stones, and a row of new timber: and let the expenses be given out of the king's house:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%5%%And also let the golden and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought to Babylon, be restored, and brought again to the temple which is at Jerusalem, every one to its place, and place them in the house of God.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%6%%Now therefore, Tatnai governor beyond the river, Shethar-boznai, and your companions the Apharsachites, who are beyond the river, be ye far from thence:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%7%%Let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews, and the elders of the Jews, build this house of God in its place.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%8%%Moreover, I make a decree what ye shall do to the elders of these Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king's goods, even of the tribute beyond the river, forthwith expenses be given to these men, that they be not hindered.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%9%%And that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for the burnt-offerings of the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the appointment of the priests who are at Jerusalem, let it be given to them day by day without fail:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%10%%That they may offer sacrifices of sweet savors to the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%11%%Also I have made a decree, that whoever shall alter this word, let timber be pulled down from his house, and being set up, let him be hanged upon it; and let his house be made a dunghill for this.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%12%%And the God that hath caused his name to dwell there destroy all kings and people, that shall attempt to alter and to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with speed.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%13%%Then Tatnai governor on this side the river, Shethar-boznai, and their companions, according to that which Darius the king had sent, so they did speedily.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%14%%And the elders of the Jews built, and they prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. And they built, and finished it, according to the commandment of the God of Israel, and according to the commandment of Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%15%%And this house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which was in the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%16%%And the children of Israel, the priests, and the Levites, and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%17%%And offered at the dedication of this house of God a hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin-offering for all Israel, twelve he-goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%18%%And they set the priests in their divisions, and the Levites in their courses, for the service of God, who is at Jerusalem; as it is written in the book of Moses.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%19%%And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%20%%For the priests and the Levites were purified together, all of them were pure, and they killed the passover for all the children of the captivity, and for their brethren the priests, and for themselves.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%21%%And the children of Israel, who had returned from captivity, and all such as had separated themselves to them from the filthiness of the heathen of the land, to seek the LORD God of Israel, did eat,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%6%%22%%And kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy: for the LORD had made them joyful, and turned the heart of the king of Assyria to them, to strengthen their hands in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%1%%Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%2%%The son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%3%%The son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%4%%The son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%5%%The son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%6%%This Ezra went from Babylon; and he was a ready scribe in the law of Moses, which the LORD God of Israel had given: and the king granted him all his request, according to the hand of the LORD his God upon him.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%7%%And there went some of the children of Israel, and of the priests, and the Levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the Nethinims, to Jerusalem, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes the king.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%8%%And he came to Jerusalem in the fifth month, which was in the seventh year of the king.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%9%%For upon the first day of the first month he began to go from Babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month he came to Jerusalem, according to the good hand of his God upon him.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%10%%For Ezra had prepared his heart to seek the law of the LORD, and to do it, and to teach in Israel statutes and judgments.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%11%%Now this is the copy of the letter that the king Artaxerxes gave to Ezra the priest, the scribe, even a scribe of the words of the commandments of the LORD, and of his statutes to Israel.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%12%%Artaxerxes, king of kings, To Ezra the priest, a scribe of the law of the God of heaven, perfect peace, and at such a time.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%13%%I make a decree, that all they of the people of Israel, and of his priests and Levites, in my realm, who are disposed of their own free will to go to Jerusalem, go with thee.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%14%%Forasmuch as thou art sent by the king, and by his seven counselors, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of thy God which is in thy hand;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%15%%And to carry the silver and gold, which the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose habitation is in Jerusalem,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%16%%And all the silver and gold that thou canst find in all the province of Babylon, with the free-will-offering of the people, and of the priests, offering willingly for the house of their God which is in Jerusalem:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%17%%That thou mayest buy speedily with this money bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meat-offerings and their drink-offerings, and offer them upon the altar of the house of your God which is in Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%18%%And whatever shall seem good to thee, and to thy brethren, to do with the rest of the silver and gold, that do after the will of your God.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%19%%The vessels also that are given thee for the service of the house of thy God, those deliver thou before the God of Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%20%%And whatever more shall be needful for the house of thy God, which thou shalt have occasion to bestow, bestow it out of the king's treasure-house.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%21%%And I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers who are beyond the river, that whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done speedily,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%22%%To a hundred talents of silver, and to a hundred measures of wheat, and to a hundred baths of wine, and to a hundred baths of oil, and salt without prescribing how much.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%23%%Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be diligently done for the house of the God of heaven: for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%24%%Also we certify you, that concerning any of the priests and Levites, singers, porters, Nethinims, or ministers of this house of God, it shall not be lawful to impose toll, tribute, or custom upon them.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%25%%And thou, Ezra, after the wisdom of thy God, that is in thy hand, set magistrates and judges, who may judge all the people that are beyond the river, all such as know the laws of thy God; and teach ye them that know them not.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%26%%And whoever will not do the law of thy God, and the law of the king, let judgment be executed speedily upon him, whether it be to death, or to banishment, or to confiscation of goods, or to imprisonment.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%27%%Blessed be the LORD God of our fathers, who hath put such a thing as this in the king's heart, to beautify the house of the LORD which is in Jerusalem:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%7%%28%%And hath extended mercy to me before the king, and his counselors, and before all the king's mighty princes. And I was strengthened as the hand of the LORD my God was upon me, and I assembled out of Israel chief men to go up with me.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%1%%These are now the chief of their fathers, and this is the genealogy of them that went up with me from Babylon, in the reign of Artaxerxes the king.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%2%%Of the sons of Phinehas; Gershom: of the sons of Ithamar; Daniel: of the sons of David; Hattush.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%3%%Of the sons of Shechaniah, of the sons of Pharosh; Zechariah: and with him were reckoned by genealogy of the males a hundred and fifty.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%4%%Of the sons of Pahath-moab; Elihoenai the son of Zerahiah, and with him two hundred males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%5%%Of the sons of Shechaniah; the son of Jahaziel, and with him three hundred males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%6%%Of the sons also of Adin; Ebed the son of Jonathan, and with him fifty males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%7%%And of the sons of Elam; Jeshaiah the son of Athaliah, and with him seventy males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%8%%And of the sons of Shephatiah; Zebadiah the son of Michael, and with him eighty males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%9%%Of the sons of Joab; Obadiah the son of Jehiel, and with him two hundred and eighteen males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%10%%And of the sons of Shelomith; the son of Josiphiah, and with him a hundred and sixty males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%11%%And of the sons of Bebai; Zechariah the son of Bebai, and with him twenty and eight males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%12%%And of the sons of Azgad; Johanan the son of Hakkatan, and with him a hundred and ten males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%13%%And of the last sons of Adonikam, whose names are these, Eliphelet, Jeiel, and Shemaiah, and with them sixty males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%14%%Of the sons also of Bigvai; Uthai, and Zabbud, and with them seventy males.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%15%%And I assembled them at the river that runneth to Ahava; and there we abode in tents three days: and I viewed the people, and the priests, and found there none of the sons of Levi.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%16%%Then sent I for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah, and for Elnathan, and for Jarib, and for Elnathan, and for Nathan, and for Zechariah, and for Meshullam, chief men; also for Joiarib, and for Elnathan, men of understanding.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%17%%And I sent them with commandment to Iddo the chief at the place Casiphia, and I told them what they should say to Iddo, and to his brethren the Nethinims, at the place Casiphia, that they should bring to us ministers for the house of our God.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%18%%And by the good hand of our God upon us they brought us a man of understanding, of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel; and Sherebiah, with his sons and his brethren, eighteen;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%19%%And Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brethren and their sons, twenty;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%20%%Also of the Nethinims, whom David and the princes had appointed for the service of the Levites, two hundred and twenty Nethinims: all of them were expressed by name.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%21%%Then I proclaimed a fast there, at the river Ahava, that we might afflict ourselves before our God, to seek of him a right way for us, and for our little ones, and for all our substance.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%22%%For I was ashamed to require of the king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy in the way: because we had spoken to the king, saying, The hand of our God is upon all them for good that seek him; but his power and his wrath is against all them that forsake him.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%23%%So we fasted and besought our God for this: and he was entreated by us.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%24%%Then I separated twelve of the chief of the priests, Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brethren with them,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%25%%And weighed to them the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, even the offering of the house of our God, which the king, and his counselors, and his lords, and all Israel there present, had offered:
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%26%%I even weighed to their hand six hundred and fifty talents of silver, and silver vessels a hundred talents, and of gold a hundred talents;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%27%%Also twenty basins of gold, of a thousand drams; and two vessels of fine copper, precious as gold.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%28%%And I said to them, Ye are holy to the LORD; the vessels are holy also; and the silver and the gold are a free-will-offering to the LORD God of your fathers.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%29%%Watch ye, and keep them, until ye weigh them, before the chief of the priests and the Levites, and chief of the fathers of Israel, at Jerusalem, in the chambers of the house of the LORD.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%30%%So the priests and the Levites took the weight of the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, to bring them to Jerusalem to the house of our God.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%31%%Then we departed from the river Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go to Jerusalem: and the hand of our God was upon us, and he delivered us from the hand of the enemy, and of such as lay in wait by the way.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%32%%And we came to Jerusalem, and abode there three days.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%33%%Now on the fourth day was the silver and the gold and the vessels weighed in the house of our God by the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest; and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah the son of Binnui, Levites;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%34%%By number and by weight of every one: and all the weight was written at that time.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%35%%Also the children of those that had been carried away, who had come out of the captivity, offered burnt-offerings to the God of Israel, twelve bullocks for all Israel, ninety and six rams, seventy and seven lambs, twelve he-goats for a sin-offering: all this was a burnt-offering to the LORD.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%8%%36%%And they delivered the king's commissions to the king's lieutenants, and to the governors on this side of the river: and they furthered the people, and the house of God.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%1%%Now when these things were done, the princes came to me, saying, The people of Israel, and the priests, and the Levites, have not separated themselves from the people of the lands, doing according to their abominations, even of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%2%%For they have taken of their daughters for themselves, and for their sons: so that the holy seed have mingled themselves with the people of those lands: yea, the hand of the princes and rulers hath been chief in this trespass.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%3%%And when I heard this thing, I rent my garment and my mantle, and plucked off the hair of my head and of my beard, and sat down confounded.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%4%%Then were assembled to me every one that trembled at the words of the God of Israel, because of the transgression of those that had been carried away; and I sat confounded until the evening sacrifice.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%5%%And at the evening sacrifice I arose from my heaviness; and having rent my garment and my mantle, I fell upon my knees, and spread out my hands to the LORD my God,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%6%%And said, O my God, I am ashamed and blush to lift up my face to thee, my God: for our iniquities are increased over our head, and our trespass is grown up to the heavens.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%7%%Since the days of our fathers have we been in a great trespass to this day; and for our iniquities have we, our kings, and our priests, been delivered into the hand of the kings of the lands, to the sword, to captivity, and to a spoil, and to confusion of face, as it is this day.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%8%%And now for a little space grace hath been shown from the LORD our God, to leave us a remnant to escape, and to give us a nail in his holy place, that our God may lighten our eyes, and give us a little reviving in our bondage.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%9%%For we were bond-men; yet our God hath not forsaken us in our bondage, but hath extended mercy to us in the sight of the kings of Persia, to give us a reviving, to set up the house of our God, and to repair the desolations of it, and to give us a wall in Judah and in Jerusalem.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%10%%And now, O our God, what shall we say after this? for we have forsaken thy commandments,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%11%%Which thou hast commanded by thy servants the prophets, saying, The land, to which ye go to possess it, is an unclean land with the filthiness of the people of the lands, with their abominations, which have filled it from one end to another with their uncleanness.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%12%%Now therefore give not your daughters to their sons, neither take their daughters to your sons, nor seek their peace or their wealth for ever: that ye may be strong, and eat the good of the land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children for ever.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%13%%And after all that hath come upon us for our evil deeds, and for our great trespass, seeing that thou our God hast punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and hast given us such deliverance as this;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%14%%Should we again break thy commandments, and join in affinity with the people of these abominations? wouldst thou not be angry with us till thou hadst consumed us, so that there should be no remnant nor escaping?
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%9%%15%%O LORD God of Israel, thou art righteous: for we having escaped, remain yet, as it is this day: behold, we are before thee in our trespasses: for we cannot stand before thee because of this.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%1%%Now when Ezra had prayed, and when he had confessed, weeping and casting himself down before the house of God, there assembled to him out of Israel a very great congregation of men and women and children: for the people wept very bitterly.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%2%%And Shechaniah the son of Jehiel, one of the sons of Elam, answered and said to Ezra, We have trespassed against our God, and have taken foreign wives of the people of the land: yet now there is hope in Israel concerning this thing.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%3%%Now therefore let us make a covenant with our God to put away all the wives, and such as are born of them, according to the counsel of my lord, and of those that tremble at the commandment of our God; and let it be done according to the law.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%4%%Arise; for this matter belongeth to thee: we also will be with thee: be of good courage, and do it.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%5%%Then arose Ezra, and made the chief priests, the Levites, and all Israel, to swear that they would do according to this word. And they swore.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%6%%Then Ezra arose from before the house of God, and went into the chamber of Johanan the son of Eliashib: and when he came thither, he ate no bread, nor drank water: for he mourned because of the transgression of them that had been carried away.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%7%%And they made proclamation throughout Judah and Jerusalem to all the children of the captivity, that they should assemble at Jerusalem;
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%8%%And that whoever would not come within three days, according to the counsel of the princes and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and himself separated from the congregation of those that had been carried away.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%9%%Then all the men of Judah and Benjamin assembled at Jerusalem within three days. It was the ninth month, and the twentieth day of the month; and all the people sat in the street of the house of God, trembling because of this matter, and for the great rain.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%10%%And Ezra the priest stood up, and said to them, Ye have transgressed, and have taken foreign wives to increase the trespass of Israel.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%11%%Now therefore make confession to the LORD God of your fathers, and do his pleasure: and separate yourselves from the people of the land, and from the foreign wives.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%12%%Then all the congregation answered and said with a loud voice, As thou hast said, so must we do.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%13%%But the people are many, and it is a time of much rain, and we are not able to stand abroad, neither is this a work of one day or two: for we are many that have transgressed in this thing.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%14%%Let now our rulers of all the congregation stand, and let all them who have taken foreign wives in our cities come at appointed times, and with them the elders of every city, and its judges, until the fierce wrath of our God for this matter shall be turned from us.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%15%%Only Jonathan the son of Asahel and Jahaziah the son of Tikvah were employed about this matter: and Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite helped them.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%16%%And the children of the captivity did so. And Ezra the priest, with certain chief of the fathers, after the house of their fathers, and all of them by their names, were separated, and sat down in the first day of the tenth month to examine the matter.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%17%%And they made an end with all the men that had taken foreign wives by the first day of the first month.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%18%%And among the sons of the priests there were found that had taken foreign wives: namely, of the sons of Jeshua the son of Jozadak, and his brethren; Maaseiah, and Eliezer, and Jarib, and Gedaliah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%19%%And they gave their hands that they would put away their wives; and being guilty, they offered a ram of the flock for their trespass.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%20%%And of the sons of Immer; Hanani, and Zebadiah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%21%%And of the sons of Harim; Maaseiah, and Elijah, and Shemaiah, and Jehiel, and Uzziah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%22%%And of the sons of Pashur; Elioenai, Maaseiah, Ishmael, Nethaneel, Jozabad, and Elasah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%23%%Also of the Levites; Jozabad, and Shimei, and Kelaiah (the same is Kelita,) Pethahiah, Judah, and Eliezer.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%24%%Of the singers also; Eliashib: and of the porters; Shallum, and Telem, and Uri.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%25%%Moreover, of Israel: of the sons of Parosh; Ramiah, and Jeziah, and Malchiah, and Miamin, and Eleazar, and Malchijah, and Benaiah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%26%%And of the sons of Elam; Mattaniah, Zechariah, and Jehiel, and Abdi, and Jeremoth, and Eliah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%27%%And of the sons of Zattu; Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, and Jeremoth, and Zabad, and Aziza.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%28%%Of the sons also of Bebai; Jehohanan, Hananiah, Zabbai, and Athlai.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%29%%And of the sons of Bani; Meshullam, Malluch, and Adaiah, Jashub, and Sheal, and Ramoth.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%30%%And of the sons of Pahath-moab; Adna, and Chelal, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattaniah, Bezaleel, and Binnui, and Manasseh.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%31%%And of the sons of Harim; Eliezer, Ishijah, Malchiah, Shemaiah, Shimeon,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%32%%Benjamin, Malluch, and Shemariah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%33%%Of the sons of Hashum; Mattenai, Mattathah, Zabad, Eliphelet, Jeremai, Manasseh, and Shimei.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%34%%Of the sons of Bani; Maadai, Amram, and Uel,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%35%%Benaiah, Bedeiah, Chelluh,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%36%%Vaniah, Meremoth, Eliashib,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%37%%Mattaniah, Mattenai, and Jaasau,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%38%%And Bani, and Binnui, Shimei,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%39%%And Shelemiah, and Nathan, and Adaiah,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%40%%Machnadebai, Shashai, Sharai,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%41%%Azareel, and Shelemiah, Shemariah,
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%42%%Shallum, Amariah, and Joseph.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%43%%Of the sons of Nebo; Jeiel, Mattithiah, Zabad, Zebina, Jadau, and Joel, Benaiah.
1000005%%Ezra%%OT%%10%%44%%All these had taken foreign wives: and some of them had wives by whom they had children.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%1%%The words of Nehemiah the son of Hachaliah. And it came to pass in the month Chisleu, in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan the palace,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%2%%That Hanani, one of my brethren, came, he and certain men of Judah; and I asked them concerning the Jews that had escaped, who were left of the captivity, and concerning Jerusalem.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%3%%And they said to me, The remnant that are left of the captivity there in the province are in great affliction and reproach: the wall of Jerusalem also is broken down, and its gates are burned with fire.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%4%%And it came to pass, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned certain days, and fasted, and prayed before the God of heaven,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%5%%And said, I beseech thee, O LORD God of heaven, the great and terrible God, that keepeth covenant and mercy for them that love him and observe his commandments:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%6%%Let thy ear now be attentive, and thy eyes open, that thou mayest hear the prayer of thy servant, which I pray before thee now, day and night, for the children of Israel thy servants, and confess the sins of the children of Israel, which we have sinned against thee: both I and my father's house have sinned.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%7%%We have dealt very corruptly against thee, and have not kept the commandments, nor the statutes, nor the judgments, which thou commandedst thy servant Moses.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%8%%Remember, I beseech thee, the word that thou commandedst thy servant Moses, saying, If ye transgress, I will scatter you abroad among the nations:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%9%%But if ye turn to me, and keep my commandments, and do them; though there were of you driven to the uttermost part of the heaven, yet will I gather them from thence, and will bring them to the place that I have chosen to set my name there.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%10%%Now these are thy servants and thy people, whom thou hast redeemed by thy great power, and by thy strong hand.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%1%%11%%O Lord, I beseech thee, let now thy ear be attentive to the prayer of thy servant, and to the prayer of thy servants, who desire to fear thy name: and prosper, I pray thee, thy servant this day, and grant him mercy in the sight of this man. For I was the king's cup-bearer.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%1%%And it came to pass in the month Nisan, in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king, that wine was before him: and I took up the wine, and gave it to the king. Now I had not before been sad in his presence.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%2%%Wherefore the king said to me, Why is thy countenance sad, seeing thou art not sick? this is nothing but sorrow of heart. Then I was very greatly afraid,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%3%%And said to the king, Let the king live for ever: why should not my countenance be sad, when the city, the place of my fathers' sepulchers, lieth waste, and its gates are consumed with fire?
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%4%%Then the king said to me, For what dost thou make request? So I prayed to the God of heaven.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%5%%And I said to the king, If it should please the king, and if thy servant hath found favor in thy sight, that thou wouldst send me to Judah, to the city of my fathers' sepulchers, that I may build it.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%6%%And the king said to me, (the queen also sitting by him,) For how long shall thy journey be? and when wilt thou return? So it pleased the king to send me; and I set him a time.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%7%%Moreover, I said to the king, If it should please the king, let letters be given me to the governors beyond the river, that they may convey me over till I come into Judah:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%8%%And a letter to Asaph the keeper of the king's forest, that he may give me timber to make beams for the gates of the palace which appertained to the house, and for the wall of the city, and for the house that I shall enter. And the king granted me, according to the good hand of my God upon me.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%9%%Then I came to the governors beyond the river, and gave them the king's letters. Now the king had sent captains of the army and horsemen with me.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%10%%When Sanballat the Horonite, and Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite, heard of it, it grieved them exceedingly that there had come a man to seek the welfare of the children of Israel.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%11%%So I came to Jerusalem, and was there three days.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%12%%And I arose in the night, I and some few men with me; neither told I any man what my God had put in my heart to do at Jerusalem: neither was there any beast with me, save the beast that I rode upon.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%13%%And I went out by night by the gate of the valley, even before the dragon-well, and to the dung-port, and viewed the walls of Jerusalem, which were broken down, and their gates were consumed with fire.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%14%%Then I went on to the gate of the fountain, and to the king's pool: but there was no place for the beast that was under me to pass.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%15%%Then I went up in the night by the brook, and viewed the wall, and turned back, and entered by the gate of the valley, and so returned.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%16%%And the rulers knew not whither I went, or what I did; neither had I as yet told it to the Jews, nor to the priests, nor to the nobles, nor to the rulers, nor to the rest that did the work.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%17%%Then said I to them, Ye see the distress that we are in, how Jerusalem lieth waste, and its gates are burned with fire: come, and let us build up the wall of Jerusalem, that we may be no more a reproach.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%18%%Then I told them of the hand of my God which was good upon me; as also the king's words that he had spoken to me. And they said, Let us rise and build. So they strengthened their hands for this good work.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%19%%But when Sanballat the Horonite, and Tobiah the servant, the Ammonite, and Geshem the Arabian, heard it, they laughed us to scorn, and despised us, and said, What is this thing that ye do? will ye rebel against the king?
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%2%%20%%Then I answered them, and said to them, The God of heaven, he will prosper us; therefore we his servants will arise and build: but ye have no portion, nor right, nor memorial, in Jerusalem.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%1%%Then Eliashib the high priest arose with his brethren the priests, and they built the sheep-gate; they sanctified it, and set up the doors of it; even to the tower of Meah they sanctified it, to the tower of Hananeel.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%2%%And next to him built the men of Jericho. And next to them built Zaccur the son of Imri.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%3%%But the fish-gate did the sons of Hassenaah build, who also laid its beams, and set up its doors, its locks and its bars.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%4%%And next to them repaired Meremoth the son of Urijah, the son of Koz. And next to them repaired Meshullam the son of Berechiah, the son of Meshezabeel. And next to them repaired Zadok the son of Baana.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%5%%And next to them the Tekoites repaired; but their nobles put not their necks to the work of their Lord.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%6%%Moreover, the old gate repaired Jehoiada the son of Paseah, and Meshullam the son of Besodeiah; they laid its beams, and set up its doors, and its locks, and its bars.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%7%%And next to them repaired Melatiah the Gibeonite, and Jadon the Meronothite, the men of Gibeon, and of Mizpah, to the throne of the governor on this side of the river.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%8%%Next to him repaired Uzziel the son of Harhaiah, of the goldsmiths. Next to him also repaired Hananiah the son of one of the apothecaries, and they fortified Jerusalem to the broad wall.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%9%%And next to them repaired Rephaiah the son of Hur, the ruler of the half part of Jerusalem.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%10%%And next to them repaired Jedaiah the son of Harumaph, even over against his house. And next to him repaired Hattush the son of Hashabniah.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%11%%Malchijah the son of Harim, and Hashub the son of Pahath-moab, repaired the other piece, and the tower of the furnaces.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%12%%And next to him repaired Shallum the son of Halohesh, the ruler of the half part of Jerusalem, he and his daughters.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%13%%The valley-gate repaired Hanun, and the inhabitants of Zanoah; they built it, and set up its doors, its locks, and its bars, and a thousand cubits on the wall to the dung-gate.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%14%%But the dung-gate repaired Malchiah the son of Rechab, the ruler of part of Beth-haccerem; he built it, and set up its doors, its locks, and its bars.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%15%%But the gate of the fountain repaired Shallun the son of Col-hozeh, the ruler of part of Mizpah; he built it, and covered it, and set up its doors, its locks, and its bars, and the wall of the pool of Siloah by the king's garden, and to the stairs that go down from the city of David.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%16%%After him repaired Nehemiah the son of Azbuk, the ruler of the half part of Beth-zur, to the place over against the sepulchers of David, and to the pool that was made, and to the house of the mighty.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%17%%After him repaired the Levites Rehum the son of Bani. Next to him repaired Hashabiah the ruler of the half part of Keilah, in his part.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%18%%After him repaired their brethren, Bavai the son of Henadad, the ruler of the half part of Keilah.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%19%%And next to him repaired Ezer the son of Jeshua, the ruler of Mizpah, another piece over against the ascent to the armory, at the turning of the wall.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%20%%After him Baruch the son of Zabbai, earnestly repaired the other piece, from the turning of the wall to the door of the house of Eliashib the high priest.
