1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%21%%After him repaired Meremoth the son of Urijah the son of Koz another piece, from the door of the house of Eliashib, even to the end of the house of Eliashib.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%22%%And after him repaired the priests, the men of the plain.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%23%%After him repaired Benjamin and Hashub, over against their house. After him repaired Azariah, the son of Maaseiah, the son of Ananiah, by his house.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%24%%After him repaired Binnui, the son of Henadad, another piece, from the house of Azariah to the turning of the wall, even to the corner.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%25%%Palal, the son of Uzai, over against the turning of the wall, and the tower which lieth out from the king's high house, that was by the court of the prison. After him Pedaiah, the son of Parosh.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%26%%Moreover, the Nethinims dwelt in Ophel, to the place over against the water-gate towards the east, and the projecting tower.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%27%%After them the Tekoites repaired another piece, over against the great projecting tower, even to the wall of Ophel.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%28%%From above the horse-gate repaired the priests, every one over against his house.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%29%%After them repaired Zadok the son of Immer over against his house. After him repaired also Shemaiah the son of Shechaniah, the keeper of the east gate.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%30%%After him repaired Hananiah the son of Shelemiah, and Hanun the sixth son of Zalaph, another piece. After him repaired Meshullam the son of Berechiah over against his chamber.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%31%%After him repaired Malchiah the goldsmith's son, to the place of the Nethinims, and of the merchants, over against the gate Miphkad, and to the ascent of the corner.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%3%%32%%And between the ascent of the corner to the sheep-gate repaired the goldsmiths and the merchants.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%1%%But it came to pass that when Sanballat heard that we were building the wall, he was wroth, and took great indignation, and mocked the Jews.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%2%%And he spoke before his brethren, and the army of Samaria, and said, What do these feeble Jews? will they fortify themselves? will they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they revive the stones out of the heaps of the rubbish which are burned?
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%3%%Now Tobiah the Ammonite was by him, and he said, Even that which they build, if a fox should go up, he would even break down their stone wall.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%4%%Hear, O our God; for we are despised: and turn their reproach upon their own head, and give them for a prey in the land of captivity:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%5%%And cover not their iniquity, and let not their sin be blotted out from before thee: for they have provoked thee to anger before the builders.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%6%%So we built the wall; and all the wall was joined together to the half of it, for the people had a mind to work.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%7%%But it came to pass, when Sanballat, and Tobiah, and the Arabians, and the Ammonites, and the Ashdodites, heard that the walls of Jerusalem were set up, and that the breaches began to be stopped, then they were very wroth,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%8%%And conspired all of them together to come and to fight against Jerusalem, and to hinder it.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%9%%Nevertheless we made our prayer to our God, and set a watch against them day and night, because of them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%10%%And Judah said, The strength of the bearers of burdens is decayed, and there is much rubbish; so that we are not able to build the wall.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%11%%And our adversaries said, They shall not know, neither see, till we come in the midst among them, and slay them, and cause the work to cease.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%12%%And it came to pass, that when the Jews who dwelt by them came, they said to us ten times, From all places whence ye shall return to us they will be upon you.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%13%%Therefore I set in the lower places behind the wall, and on the higher places, I even set the people after their families with their swords, their spears, and their bows.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%14%%And I looked, and arose, and said to the nobles, and to the rulers, and to the rest of the people, Be ye not afraid of them: remember the Lord who is great and terrible, and fight for your brethren, your sons, and your daughters, your wives, and your houses.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%15%%And it came to pass, when our enemies heard that it was known to us, and God had brought their counsel to naught, that we returned all of us to the wall, every one to his work.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%16%%And it came to pass, from that time forth, that the half of my servants wrought in the work, and the other half of them held both the spears, the shields, and the bows, and the habergeons; and the rulers were behind all the house of Judah.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%17%%They who built on the wall, and they that bore burdens, with those that laded, every one with one of his hands wrought in the work, and with the other hand held a weapon.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%18%%For the builders, every one had his sword girded by his side, and so built. And he that sounded the trumpet was by me.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%19%%And I said to the nobles, and to the rulers, and to the rest of the people, The work is great and large, and we are separated upon the wall, one far from another.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%20%%In what place therefore ye hear the sound of the trumpet, resort ye thither to us: our God will fight for us.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%21%%So we labored in the work: and half of them held the spears from the rising of the morning till the stars appeared.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%22%%Likewise at the same time said I to the people, Let every one with his servant lodge within Jerusalem, that in the night they may be a guard to us, and labor in the day.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%4%%23%%So neither I, nor my brethren, nor my servants, nor the men of the guard who followed me, none of us put off our clothes, saving that every one put them off for washing.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%1%%And there was a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brethren the Jews.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%2%%For there were that said, We, our sons, and our daughters, are many: therefore we take up corn for them, that we may eat, and live.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%3%%Some also there were that said, We have mortgaged our lands, vineyards, and houses, that we might buy corn, because of the dearth.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%4%%There were also that said, We have borrowed money for the king's tribute, and that upon our lands and vineyards.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%5%%Yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brethren, our children as their children: and lo, we bring into bondage our sons and our daughters to be servants, and some of our daughters are brought to bondage already: neither is it in our power to redeem them; for other men have our lands and vineyards.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%6%%And I was very angry when I heard their cry and these words.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%7%%Then I consulted with myself, and I rebuked the nobles, and the rulers, and said to them, Ye exact interest, every one of his brother. And I set a great assembly against them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%8%%And I said to them, We after our ability have redeemed our brethren the Jews, who were sold to the heathen; and will ye even sell your brethren? or shall they be sold to us? Then they held their peace, and found nothing to answer.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%9%%Also I said, That is not good which ye do: ought ye not to walk in the fear of our God because of the reproach of the heathen our enemies?
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%10%%I likewise, my brethren, and my servants, might exact of them money and corn: I pray you, let us leave off this usury.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%11%%Restore, I pray you, to them, even this day, their lands, their vineyards, their olive-yards, and their houses, also the hundredth part of the money, and of the corn, the wine, and the oil, that ye exact of them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%12%%Then said they, We will restore them, and will require nothing of them; so will we do as thou sayest. Then I called the priests, and took an oath of them, that they would do according to this promise.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%13%%Also I shook my lap, and said, So God shake out every man from his house, and from his labor, that performeth not this promise, even thus be he shaken out, and emptied. And all the congregation said, Amen, and praised the LORD. And the people did according to this promise.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%14%%Moreover, from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year even to the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes the king, that is, twelve years, I and my brethren have not eaten the bread of the governor.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%15%%But the former governors, that had been before me were chargeable to the people, and had taken of them bread and wine, besides forty shekels of silver; yes, even their servants bore rule over the people: but so did not I, because of the fear of God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%16%%Yea, also I continued in the work of this wall, neither bought we any land: and all my servants were gathered thither to the work.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%17%%Moreover, there were at my table a hundred and fifty of the Jews and rulers, besides those that came to us from among the heathen that were about us.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%18%%Now that which was prepared for me daily was one ox and six choice sheep; also fowls were prepared for me, and once in ten days an abundance of all sorts of wine: yet for all this I required not the bread of the governor, because the bondage was heavy upon this people.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%5%%19%%Think upon me, my God, for good, according to all that I have done for this people.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%1%%Now it came to pass, when Sanballat, and Tobiah, and Geshem the Arabian, and the rest of our enemies, heard that I had built the wall, and that there was no breach left in it, (though at that time I had not set up the doors upon the gates;)
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%2%%That Sanballat and Geshem sent to me, saying, Come, let us meet together in some one of the villages in the plain of Ono. But they thought to do me mischief.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%3%%And I sent messengers to them, saying, I am doing a great work, so that I cannot come down: why should the work cease, whilst I leave it, and come down to you?
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%4%%Yet they sent to me four times after this sort; and I answered them after the same manner.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%5%%Then Sanballat sent his servant to me in like manner the fifth time with an open letter in his hand;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%6%%In which was written, It is reported among the heathen, and Gashmu saith it, that thou and the Jews think to rebel: for which cause thou buildest the wall that thou mayest be their king, according to these words.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%7%%And thou hast also appointed prophets to preach of thee at Jerusalem, saying, There is a king in Judah: and now shall it be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore, and let us take counsel together.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%8%%Then I sent to him, saying, There are no such things done as thou sayest, but thou feignest them out of thy own heart.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%9%%For they all made us afraid, saying, Their hands shall be weakened from the work, that it may not be done. Now therefore, O God, strengthen my hands.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%10%%Afterward I came to the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah the son of Mehetabeel, who was shut up; and he said, Let us meet together in the house of God, within the temple, and let us shut the doors of the temple: for they will come to slay thee; yea, in the night will they come to slay thee.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%11%%And I said, Should such a man as I flee? and who is there, that, being as I am, would go into the temple to save his life? I will not go in.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%12%%And lo, I perceived that God had not sent him; but that he pronounced this prophecy against me: for Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%13%%Therefore was he hired, that I should be afraid, and do so, and sin, and that they might have matter for an evil report, that they might reproach me.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%14%%My God, think thou upon Tobiah and Sanballat according to these their works, and on the prophetess Noadiah, and the rest of the prophets, that would have put me in fear.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%15%%So the wall was finished in the twenty and fifth day of the month Elul, in fifty and two days.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%16%%And it came to pass, that when all our enemies heard of it, and all the heathen that were about us saw these things, they were much cast down in their own eyes: for they perceived that this work was wrought by our God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%17%%Moreover, in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters to Tobiah, and the letters of Tobiah came to them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%18%%For there were many in Judah sworn to him, because he was the son-in-law of Shechaniah the son of Arah; and his son Johanan had taken the daughter of Meshullam the son of Berechiah.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%6%%19%%Also they reported his good deeds before me, and uttered my words to him. And Tobiah sent letters to put me in fear.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%1%%Now it came to pass, when the wall was built, and I had set up the doors, and the porters and the singers and the Levites were appointed,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%2%%That I gave my brother Hanani, and Hananiah the ruler of the palace, charge over Jerusalem: for he was a faithful man, and feared God above many.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%3%%And I said to them, Let not the gates of Jerusalem be opened until the sun shall be hot; and while they stand by, let them shut the doors, and bar them: and appoint watches of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, every one in his watch, and every one to be over against his house.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%4%%Now the city was large and great: but the people in it were few, and the houses were not built.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%5%%And my God put into my heart to assemble the nobles, and the rulers, and the people, that they might be reckoned by genealogy. And I found a register of the genealogy of them who came up at the first, and found written in it,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%6%%These are the children of the province, that went up out of the captivity, of those that had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away, and came again to Jerusalem and to Judah, every one to his city;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%7%%Who came with Zerubbabel, Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nehum, Baanah. The number, I say, of the men of the people of Israel was this;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%8%%The children of Parosh, two thousand a hundred and seventy two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%9%%The children of Shephatiah, three hundred and seventy two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%10%%The children of Arah, six hundred and fifty two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%11%%The children of Pahath-moab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand and eight hundred and eighteen.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%12%%The children of Elam, a thousand two hundred and fifty four.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%13%%The children of Zattu, eight hundred and forty five.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%14%%The children of Zaccai, seven hundred and sixty.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%15%%The children of Binnui, six hundred and forty eight.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%16%%The children of Bebai, six hundred and twenty eight.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%17%%The children of Azgad, two thousand three hundred and twenty two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%18%%The children of Adonikam, six hundred and sixty seven.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%19%%The children of Bigvai, two thousand and sixty seven.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%20%%The children of Adin, six hundred and fifty five.

1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%22%%The children of Hashum, three hundred and twenty eight.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%23%%The children of Bezai, three hundred and twenty four.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%24%%The children of Hariph, a hundred and twelve.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%25%%The children of Gibeon, ninety five.

1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%28%%The men of Beth-azmaveth, forty two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%29%%The men of Kirjath-jearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty three.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%30%%The men of Ramah and Gaba, six hundred and twenty one.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%31%%The men of Michmas, a hundred and twenty two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%32%%The men of Beth-el and Ai, a hundred and twenty three.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%33%%The men of the other Nebo, fifty two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%34%%The children of the other Elam, a thousand two hundred and fifty four.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%35%%The children of Harim, three hundred and twenty.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%36%%The children of Jericho, three hundred and forty five.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%37%%The children of Lod, Hadid, and Ono, seven hundred and twenty one.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%38%%The children of Senaah, three thousand nine hundred and thirty.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%39%%The priests: the children of Jedaiah, of the house of Jeshua, nine hundred and seventy three.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%40%%The children of Immer, a thousand and fifty two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%41%%The children of Pashur, a thousand two hundred and forty seven.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%42%%The children of Harim, a thousand and seventeen.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%43%%The Levites: the children of Jeshua, of Kadmiel, and of the children of Hodevah, seventy four.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%44%%The singers: the children of Asaph, a hundred and forty eight.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%45%%The porters: the children of Shallum, the children of Ater, the children of Talmon, the children of Akkub, the children of Hatita, the children of Shobai, a hundred and thirty eight.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%46%%The Nethinims: the children of Ziha, the children of Hashupha, the children of Tabbaoth,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%47%%The children of Keros, the children of Sia, the children of Padon,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%48%%The children of Lebana, the children of Hagaba, the children of Shalmai,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%49%%The children of Hanan, the children of Giddel, the children of Gahar,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%50%%The children of Reaiah, the children of Rezin, the children of Nekoda,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%51%%The children of Gazzam, the children of Uzza, the children of Phaseah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%52%%The children of Besai, the children of Meunim, the children of Nephishesim,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%53%%The children of Bakbuk, the children of Hakupha, the children of Harhur,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%54%%The children of Bazlith, the children of Mehida, the children of Harsha,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%55%%The children of Barkos, the children of Sisera, the children of Tamah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%56%%The children of Neziah, the children of Hatipha.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%57%%The children of Solomon's servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Sophereth, the children of Perida,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%58%%The children of Jaala, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%59%%The children of Shephatiah, the children of Hattil, the children of Pochereth of Zebaim, the children of Amon.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%60%%All the Nethinims, and the children of Solomon's servants, were three hundred and ninety two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%61%%And these were they who went up also from Tel-mela, Tel-haresha, Cherub, Addon, and Immer: but they could not show their fathers house, nor their seed, whether they were of Israel.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%62%%The children of Delaiah, the children of Tobiah, the children of Nekoda, six hundred and forty two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%63%%And of the priests: the children of Habaiah, the children of Koz, the children of Barzillai, who took one of the daughters of Barzillai the Gileadite for a wife, and was called after their name.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%64%%These sought their register among those that were reckoned by genealogy, but it was not found: therefore were they, as polluted, put from the priesthood.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%65%%And the Tirshatha said to them, that they should not eat of the most holy things, till there should stand up a priest with Urim and Thummim.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%66%%The whole congregation together was forty two thousand three hundred and sixty.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%67%%Besides their man-servants and their maid-servants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred and thirty seven: and they had two hundred and forty five singing-men and singing-women.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%68%%Their horses, seven hundred and thirty six: their mules, two hundred and forty five:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%69%%Their camels, four hundred and thirty five: six thousand seven hundred and twenty asses.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%70%%And some of the chief of the fathers gave to the work. The Tirshatha gave to the treasure a thousand drams of gold, fifty basins, five hundred and thirty priests' garments.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%71%%And some of the chief of the fathers gave to the treasure of the work, twenty thousand drams of gold, and two thousand and two hundred pounds of silver.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%72%%And that which the rest of the people gave was twenty thousand drams of gold, and two thousand pounds of silver, and sixty seven priests' garments.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%7%%73%%So the priests, and the Levites, and the porters, and the singers, and some of the people, and the Nethinims, and all Israel, dwelt in their cities; and when the seventh month came, the children of Israel were in their cities.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%1%%And all the people assembled as one man in the street that was before the water-gate; and they spoke to Ezra the scribe to bring the book of the law of Moses, which the LORD had commanded to Israel.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%2%%And Ezra the priest brought the law before the congregation both of men and women, and all that could hear with understanding, upon the first day of the seventh month.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%3%%And he read therein before the street that was before the water-gate from the morning until mid-day, before the men and the women, and those that could understand; and the ears of all the people were attentive to the book of the law.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%4%%And Ezra the scribe stood upon a pulpit of wood, which they had made for the purpose; and beside him stood Mattithiah, and Shema, and Anaiah, and Urijah, and Hilkiah, and Maaseiah, on his right hand; and on his left hand, Pedaiah, and Mishael, and Malchiah, and Hashum, and Hashbadana, Zechariah, and Meshullam.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%5%%And Ezra opened the book in the sight of all the people; (for he was above all the people;) and when he opened it, all the people stood up:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%6%%And Ezra blessed the LORD, the great God. And all the people answered, Amen, Amen, with lifting their hands: and they bowed their heads, and worshiped the LORD with their faces to the ground.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%7%%Also Jeshua, and Bani, and Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodijah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, Pelaiah, and the Levites, caused the people to understand the law: and the people stood in their place.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%8%%So they read in the book in the law of God distinctly, and gave the sense, and caused them to understand the reading.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%9%%And Nehemiah, who is the Tirshatha, and Ezra the priest, the scribe, and the Levites that taught the people, said to all the people, This day is holy to the LORD your God; mourn not, nor weep. For all the people wept, when they heard the words of the law.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%10%%Then he said to them, Go your way, eat the fat, and drink the sweet, and send portions to them for whom nothing is prepared: for this day is holy to our Lord: neither be ye sad; for the joy of the LORD is your strength.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%11%%So the Levites stilled all the people, saying, Hold your peace, for the day is holy; neither be ye grieved.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%12%%And all the people went their way to eat, and to drink, and to send portions, and to make great mirth, because they had understood the words that were declared to them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%13%%And on the second day were assembled the chief of the fathers of all the people, the priests, and the Levites, to Ezra the scribe, even to understand the words of the law.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%14%%And they found written in the law which the LORD had commanded by Moses, that the children of Israel should dwell in booths in the feast of the seventh month:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%15%%And that they should publish and proclaim in all their cities, and in Jerusalem, saying, Go forth to the mount, and fetch olive branches, and pine branches, and myrtle branches, and palm branches, and branches of thick trees, to make booths, as it is written.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%16%%So the people went forth, and brought them, and made themselves booths, every one upon the roof of his house, and in their courts, and in the courts of the house of God, and in the street of the water-gate, and in the street of the gate of Ephraim.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%17%%And all the congregation of them that had returned from the captivity made booths, and sat under the booths: for since the days of Jeshua the son of Nun to that day, had not the children of Israel done so. And there was very great gladness.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%8%%18%%Also day by day, from the first day to the last day, he read in the book of the law of God. And they kept the feast seven days; and on the eighth day was a solemn assembly, according to the manner.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%1%%Now in the twenty and fourth day of this month the children of Israel were assembled with fasting, and with sackclothes, and earth upon them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%2%%And the seed of Israel separated themselves from all strangers, and stood and confessed their sins, and the iniquities of their fathers.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%3%%And they stood up in their place, and read in the book of the law of the LORD their God one fourth part of the day; and another fourth part they confessed, and worshiped the LORD their God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%4%%Then stood upon the stairs, of the Levites, Jeshua, and Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani, and cried with a loud voice to the LORD their God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%5%%Then the Levites, Jeshua, and Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabniah, Sherebiah, Hodijah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah, said, Stand up and bless the LORD your God for ever and ever: and blessed be thy glorious name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%6%%Thou, even thou, art LORD alone; thou hast made heaven, the heaven of heavens, with all their host, the earth, and all things that are in it, the seas, and all that is in them, and thou preservest them all; and the host of heaven worshipeth thee.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%7%%Thou art the LORD the God, who chosest Abram, and broughtest him forth from Ur of the Chaldees, and gavest him the name of Abraham;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%8%%And foundest his heart faithful before thee, and madest a covenant with him, to give the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Jebusites, and the Girgashites, to give it, I say, to his seed, and hast performed thy words; for thou art righteous:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%9%%And thou sawest the affliction of our fathers in Egypt, and heardest their cry by the Red sea;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%10%%And shewedst signs and wonders upon Pharaoh, and on all his servants, and on all the people of his land: for thou knewest that they dealt proudly against them. So didst thou get thee a name, as it is this day.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%11%%And thou didst divide the sea before them, so that they went through the midst of the sea on the dry land; and their persecutors thou threwest into the deeps, as a stone into the mighty waters.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%12%%Moreover, thou leddest them in the day by a cloudy pillar; and in the night by a pillar of fire, to give them light in the way in which they should go.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%13%%Thou camest down also upon mount Sinai, and spokest with them from heaven, and gavest them right judgments, and true laws, good statutes and commandments:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%14%%And madest known to them thy holy sabbath, and commandedst them precepts, statutes, and laws, by the hand of Moses thy servant:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%15%%And gavest them bread from heaven for their hunger, and broughtest forth water for them out of the rock for their thirst, and promisedst them that they should go in to possess the land which thou hadst sworn to give them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%16%%But they and our fathers dealt proudly, and hardened their necks, and hearkened not to thy commandments,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%17%%And refused to obey, neither were mindful of thy wonders that thou didst perform among them; but hardened their necks, and in their rebellion appointed a captain to return to their bondage: but thou art a God ready to pardon, gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and forsookest them not.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%18%%Yea, when they had made them a molten calf, and said, This is thy God that brought thee out of Egypt, and had wrought great provocations;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%19%%Yet thou in thy manifold mercies forsookest them not in the wilderness: the pillar of the cloud departed not from them by day, to lead them in the way; neither the pillar of fire by night, to show them light, and the way in which they should go.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%20%%Thou gavest also thy good spirit to instruct them, and withheldest not thy manna from their mouth, and gavest them water for their thirst.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%21%%Yea, forty years didst thou sustain them in the wilderness, so that they lacked nothing; their clothes grew not old, and their feet swelled not.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%22%%Moreover, thou gavest them kingdoms and nations, and didst divide them into corners: so they possessed the land of Sihon, and the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og king of Bashan.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%23%%Their children also multipliedst thou as the stars of heaven, and broughtest them into the land, concerning which thou hadst promised to their fathers, that they should go in to possess it.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%24%%So the children went in and possessed the land, and thou subduedst before them the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, and gavest them into their hands, with their kings, and the people of the land, that they might do with them as they would.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%25%%And they took strong cities, and a fat land, and possessed houses full of all goods, wells digged, vineyards and olive-yards, and fruit trees in abundance: so they ate and were filled, and became fat, and delighted themselves in thy great goodness.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%26%%Nevertheless, they were disobedient, and rebelled against thee, and cast thy law behind their backs, and slew thy prophets who testified against them to turn them to thee, and they wrought great provocations.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%27%%Therefore thou deliveredst them into the hand of their enemies, who distressed them: and in the time of their trouble, when they cried to thee, thou hearedest them from heaven; and according to thy manifold mercies thou gavest them deliverers, who saved them out of the hand of their enemies.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%28%%But after they had rest, they did evil again before thee: therefore thou leftest them in the hand of their enemies, so that they had the dominion over them: yet when they returned and cried to thee, thou hearedest them from heaven; and many times didst thou deliver them according to thy mercies;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%29%%And testifiedst against them, that thou mightest bring them again to thy law: yet they dealt proudly, and hearkened not to thy commandments, but sinned against thy judgments, (which if a man doeth, he shall live in them:) and withdrew the shoulder, and hardened their neck, and would not hear.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%30%%Yet many years didst thou forbear over them, and testifiedst against them by thy spirit in thy prophets: yet would they not give ear: therefore thou gavest them into the hand of the people of the lands.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%31%%Nevertheless, for thy great mercies' sake thou didst not utterly consume them, nor forsake them; for thou art a gracious and merciful God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%32%%Now therefore, our God, the great, the mighty, and the terrible God, who keepest covenant and mercy, let not all the trouble seem little before thee, that hath come upon us, on our kings, on our princes, and on our priests, and on our prophets, and on our fathers, and on all thy people, since the time of the kings of Assyria to this day.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%33%%But thou art just in all that is brought upon us; for thou hast done right, but we have done wickedly:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%34%%Neither have our kings, our princes, our priests, nor our fathers, kept thy law, nor hearkened to thy commandments and thy testimonies, with which thou didst testify against them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%35%%For they have not served thee in their kingdom, and in thy great goodness that thou gavest them, and in the large and fat land which thou gavest before them, neither turned they from their wicked works.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%36%%Behold, we are servants this day, and for the land that thou gavest to our fathers to eat the fruit of it and the good of it, behold, we are servants in it:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%37%%And it yieldeth much increase to the kings whom thou hast set over us because of our sins: also they have dominion over our bodies, and over our cattle, at their pleasure, and we are in great distress.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%9%%38%%And because of all this we make a sure covenant, and write it; and our princes, Levites, and priests, set their seals to it.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%1%%Now those that sealed were, Nehemiah, the Tirshatha, the son of Hachaliah, and Zidkijah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%2%%Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%3%%Pashur, Amariah, Malchijah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%4%%Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%5%%Harim, Meremoth, Obadiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%6%%Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%7%%Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%8%%Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah: these were the priests.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%9%%And the Levites: both Jeshua the son of Azaniah, Binnui of the sons of Henadad, Kadmiel;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%10%%And their brethren, Shebaniah, Hodijah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%11%%Micha, Rehob, Hashabiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%12%%Zaccur, Sherebiah, Shebaniah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%13%%Hodijah, Bani, Beninu,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%14%%The chief of the people; Parosh, Pahath-moab, Elam, Zatthu, Bani,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%15%%Bunni, Azgad, Bebai,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%16%%Adonijah, Bigvai, Adin,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%17%%Ater, Hizkijah, Azzur,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%18%%Hodijah, Hashum, Bezai,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%19%%Hariph, Anathoth, Nebai,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%20%%Magpiash, Meshullam, Hezir,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%21%%Meshezabeel, Zadok, Jaddua,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%22%%Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%23%%Hoshea, Hananiah, Hashub,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%24%%Hallohesh, Pileha, Shobek,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%25%%Rehum, Hashabnah, Maaseiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%26%%And Ahijah, Hanan, Anan,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%27%%Malluch, Harim, Baanah.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%28%%And the rest of the people, the priests, the Levites, the porters, the singers, the Nethinims, and all they that had separated themselves from the people of the lands to the law of God, their wives, their sons, and their daughters, every one having knowledge, and having understanding;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%29%%They united with their brethren, their nobles, and entered into a curse, and into an oath, to walk in God's law, which was given by Moses the servant of God, and to observe and do all the commandments of the LORD our Lord, and his judgments and his statutes;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%30%%And that we would not give our daughters to the people of the land, nor take their daughters for our sons:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%31%%And if the people of the land should bring wares or any provisions on the sabbath day to sell, that we would not buy it of them on the sabbath, or on the holy day: and that we would leave the seventh year, and the exaction of every debt.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%32%%Also we made ordinances for us, to charge ourselves yearly with the third part of a shekel for the service of the house of our God;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%33%%For the show-bread, and for the continual meat-offering, and for the continual burnt-offering, of the sabbaths, of the new moons, for the set feasts, and for the holy things, and for the sin-offerings to make an atonement for Israel, and for all the work of the house of our God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%34%%And we cast the lots among the priests, the Levites, and the people, for the wood-offering, to bring it into the house of our God, after the houses of our fathers, at times appointed year by year, to burn upon the altar of the LORD our God, as it is written in the law:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%35%%And to bring the first-fruits of our ground, and the first-fruits of all fruit of all trees, year by year, to the house of the LORD:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%36%%Also the first-born of our sons, and of our cattle, as it is written in the law, and the firstlings of our herds and of our flocks, to bring to the house of our God, to the priests that minister in the house of our God:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%37%%And that we should bring the first-fruits of our dough, and our offerings, and the fruit of all manner of trees, of wine and of oil, to the priests, to the chambers of the house of our God; and the tithes of our ground to the Levites, that the same Levites might have the tithes in all the cities of our tillage.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%38%%And the priest the son of Aaron shall be with the Levites, when the Levites take tithes: and the Levites shall bring up the tenth of the tithes to the house of our God, to the chambers, into the treasure house.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%10%%39%%For the children of Israel and the children of Levi shall bring the offering of the corn, of the new wine, and the oil, to the chambers, where are the vessels of the sanctuary, and the priests that minister, and the porters, and the singers: and we will not forsake the house of our God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%1%%And the rulers of the people dwelt at Jerusalem: the rest of the people also cast lots, to bring one of ten to dwell in Jerusalem the holy city, and nine parts to dwell in other cities.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%2%%And the people blessed all the men that willingly offered themselves to dwell at Jerusalem.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%3%%Now these are the chief of the province that dwelt in Jerusalem: but in the cities of Judah dwelt every one in his possession in their cities, to wit, Israel, the priests, and the Levites, and the Nethinims, and the children of Solomon's servants.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%4%%And at Jerusalem dwelt certain of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin. Of the children of Judah; Athaiah the son of Uzziah, the son of Zechariah, the son of Amariah, the son of Shephatiah, the son of Mahalaleel, of the children of Perez;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%5%%And Maaseiah the son of Baruch, the son of Col-hozeh, the son of Hazaiah, the son of Adaiah, the son of Joiarib, the son of Zechariah, the son of Shiloni.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%6%%All the sons of Perez that dwelt at Jerusalem were four hundred sixty and eight valiant men.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%7%%And these are the sons of Benjamin; Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Joed, the son of Pedaiah, the son of Kolaiah, the son of Maaseiah, the son of Ithiel, the son of Jesaiah.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%8%%And after him, Gabbai, Sallai, nine hundred twenty and eight.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%9%%And Joel the son of Zichri was their overseer: and Judah the son of Senuah was second over the city.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%10%%Of the priests: Jedaiah the son of Joiarib, Jachin.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%11%%Seraiah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, was the ruler of the house of God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%12%%And their brethren that performed the work of the house were eight hundred twenty and two: and Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pelaliah, the son of Amzi, the son of Zechariah, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%13%%And his brethren, chief of the fathers, two hundred forty and two: and Amashai the son of Azareel, the son of Ahasai, the son of Meshillemoth, the son of Immer,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%14%%And their brethren, mighty men of valor, a hundred twenty and eight: and their overseer was Zabdiel, the son of one of the great men.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%15%%Also of the Levites: Shemaiah the son of Hashub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, the son of Bunni;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%16%%And Shabbethai and Jozabad, of the chief of the Levites, had the oversight of the outward business of the house of God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%17%%And Mattaniah the son of Micha, the son of Zabdi, the son of Asaph, was the principal to begin the thanksgiving in prayer: and Bakbukiah the second among his brethren, and Abda the son of Shammua, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%18%%All the Levites in the holy city were two hundred and eighty four.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%19%%Moreover the porters, Akkub, Talmon, and their brethren that kept the gates, were an hundred and seventy two.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%20%%And the residue of Israel, of the priests, and the Levites, were in all the cities of Judah every one in his inheritance.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%21%%But the Nethinims dwelt in Ophel: and Ziha and Gispa were over the Nethinims.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%22%%The overseer also of the Levites at Jerusalem was Uzzi the son of Bani, the son of Hashabiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Micha. Of the sons of Asaph, the singers were over the business of the house of God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%23%%For it was the king's commandment concerning them, that a certain portion should be for the singers, due for every day.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%24%%And Pethahiah the son of Meshezabeel, of the children of Zerah the son of Judah was at the king's hand in all matters concerning the people.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%25%%And for the villages, with their fields, some of the children of Judah dwelt at Kirjath-arba, and in its villages, and at Dibon, and in its villages, and at Jekabzeel, and in its villages,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%26%%And at Jeshua, and at Moladah, and at Beth-phelet,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%27%%And at Hazar-shual, and at Beer-sheba, and in its villages,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%28%%And at Ziklag, and at Mekonah, and in its villages,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%29%%And at En-rimmon, and at Zareah, and at Jarmuth,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%30%%Zanoah, Adullam, and in their villages, at Lachish, and its fields, at Azekah, and in its villages. And they dwelt from Beer-sheba to the valley of Hinnom.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%31%%The children also of Benjamin from Geba dwelt at Michmash, and Aija, and Beth-el, and in their villages.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%32%%And at Anathoth, Nob, Ananiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%33%%Hazor, Ramah, Gittaim,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%34%%Hadid, Zeboim, Neballat,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%35%%Lod, and Ono, the valley of artificers.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%11%%36%%And of the Levites were divisions in Judah, and in Benjamin.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%1%%Now these are the priests and the Levites that went up with Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%2%%Amariah, Malluch, Hattush,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%3%%Shechaniah, Rehum, Meremoth,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%4%%Iddo, Ginnetho, Abijah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%5%%Miamin, Maadiah, Bilgah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%6%%Shemaiah, and Joiarib, Jedaiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%7%%Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, Jedaiah. These were the chief of the priests and of their brethren in the days of Jeshua.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%8%%Moreover the Levites: Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, who was over the thanksgiving, he and his brethren.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%9%%Also Bakbukiah and Unni, their brethren, were over against them in the watches.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%10%%And Jeshua begat Joiakim, Joiakim also begat Eliashib, and Eliashib begat Joiada,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%11%%And Joiada begat Jonathan, and Jonathan begat Jaddua.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%12%%And in the days of Joiakim were priests, the chief of the fathers: of Seraiah, Meraiah; of Jeremiah, Hananiah;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%13%%Of Ezra, Meshullam; of Amariah, Jehohanan;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%14%%Of Melicu, Jonathan; of Shebaniah, Joseph;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%15%%Of Harim, Adna; of Meraioth, Helkai;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%16%%Of Iddo, Zechariah; of Ginnethon, Meshullam;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%17%%Of Abijah, Zichri; of Miniamin, of Moadiah, Piltai;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%18%%Of Bilgah, Shammua; of Shemaiah, Jehonathan;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%19%%And of Joiarib, Mattenai; of Jedaiah, Uzzi;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%20%%Of Sallai, Kallai; of Amok, Eber;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%21%%Of Hilkiah, Hashabiah; of Jedaiah, Nethaneel.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%22%%The Levites in the days of Eliashib, Joiada, and Johanan, and Jaddua, were recorded chief of the fathers: also the priests, to the reign of Darius the Persian.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%23%%The sons of Levi, the chief of the fathers, were written in the book of the chronicles, even till the days of Johanan the son of Eliashib.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%24%%And the chief of the Levites: Hashabiah, Sherebiah, and Jeshua the son of Kadmiel, with their brethren over against them, to praise and to give thanks according to the commandment of David the man of God, ward over against ward.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%25%%Mattaniah, and Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, Akkub, were porters keeping the ward at the threshholds of the gates.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%26%%These were in the days of Joiakim the son of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and in the days of Nehemiah the governor, and of Ezra the priest, the scribe.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%27%%And at the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem they sought the Levites out of all their places, to bring them to Jerusalem, to keep the dedication with gladness, both with thanksgivings, and with singing, with cymbals, psalteries, and with harps.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%28%%And the sons of the singers assembled, both out of the plain country around Jerusalem, and from the villages of Netophathi;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%29%%Also from the house of Gilgal, and from the fields of Geba and Azmaveth: for the singers had built them villages around Jerusalem.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%30%%And the priests and the Levites purified themselves, and purified the people, and the gates, and the wall.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%31%%Then I brought up the princes of Judah upon the wall, and appointed two great companies of them that gave thanks, of which one went on the right hand upon the wall towards the dung-gate:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%32%%And after them went Hoshaiah, and half of the princes of Judah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%33%%And Azariah, Ezra, and Meshullam,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%34%%Judah, and Benjamin, and Shemaiah, and Jeremiah,
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%35%%And certain of the priests' sons with trumpets; namely, Zechariah the son of Jonathan, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Michaiah, the son of Zaccur, the son of Asaph:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%36%%And his brethren, Shemaiah, and Azarael, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethaneel, and Judah, Hanani, with the musical instruments of David the man of God, and Ezra the scribe before them.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%37%%And at the fountain-gate, which was over against them, they went up by the stairs of the city of David, at the ascent of the wall, above the house of David, even to the water-gate eastward.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%38%%And the other company of them that gave thanks went over against them, and I after them, and the half of the people upon the wall, from beyond the tower of the furnaces even to the broad wall;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%39%%And from above the gate of Ephraim, and above the old gate, and above the fish-gate, and the tower of Hananeel, and the tower of Meah, even to the sheep-gate: and they stood still in the prison-gate.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%40%%So stood the two companies of them that gave thanks in the house of God, and I, and the half of the rulers with me:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%41%%And the priests; Eliakim, Maaseiah, Miniamin, Michaiah, Elioenai, Zechariah, and Hananiah, with trumpets;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%42%%And Maaseiah, and Shemaiah, and Eleazar, and Uzzi, and Jehohanan, and Malchijah, and Elam, and Ezer. And the singers sang loud, with Jezrahiah their overseer.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%43%%Also that day they offered great sacrifices, and rejoiced: for God had made them rejoice with great joy: the wives also and the children rejoiced: so that the joy of Jerusalem was heard even afar off.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%44%%And at that time were some appointed over the chambers for the treasures, for the offerings, for the first-fruits, and for the tithes, to gather into them out of the fields of the cities the portions of the law for the priests and Levites: for Judah rejoiced for the priests and for the Levites that waited.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%45%%And both the singers and the porters kept the ward of their God, and the ward of the purification, according to the commandment of David, and of Solomon his son.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%46%%For in the days of David, and Asaph of old there were chief of the singers, and songs of praise and thanksgiving to God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%12%%47%%And all Israel in the days of Zerubbabel, and in the days of Nehemiah, gave the portions of the singers and the porters, every day his portion: and they sanctified holy things to the Levites; and the Levites sanctified them to the children of Aaron.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%1%%On that day they read in the book of Moses in the audience of the people; and therein was found written, that the Ammonite and the Moabite should not come into the congregation of God for ever:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%2%%Because they met not the children of Israel with bread and with water, but hired Baalam against them, that he should curse them: but our God turned the curse into a blessing.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%3%%Now it came to pass, when they had heard the law, that they separated from Israel all the mixed multitude.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%4%%And before this, Eliashib the priest, having the oversight of the chamber of the house of our God, was allied to Tobiah:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%5%%And he had prepared for him a great chamber, where formerly they laid the meat-offerings, the frankincense, and the vessels, and the tithes of the corn, the new wine, and the oil, which was commanded to be given to the Levites, and the singers, and the porters; and the offerings of the priests.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%6%%But in all this time I was not at Jerusalem: for in the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes king of Babylon I came to the king, and after certain days I obtained leave of the king:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%7%%And I came to Jerusalem, and understood of the evil that Eliashib did for Tobiah, in preparing for him a chamber in the courts of the house of God.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%8%%And it grieved me greatly: therefore I cast forth all the household stuff of Tobiah out of the chamber.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%9%%Then I commanded, and they cleansed the chambers: and thither I brought again the vessels of the house of God, with the meat-offering and the frankincense.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%10%%And I perceived that the portions of the Levites had not been given them: for the Levites and the singers, that did the work, had fled every one to his field.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%11%%Then I contended with the rulers, and said, Why is the house of God forsaken? and I assembled them, and set them in their place.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%12%%Then all Judah brought the tithe of the corn and the new wine and the oil to the treasuries.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%13%%And I made treasurers over the treasuries, Shelemiah the priest, and Zadok the scribe, and of the Levites, Pedaiah: and next to them was Hanan the son of Zaccur, the son of Mattaniah: for they were accounted faithful; and their office was to distribute to their brethren.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%14%%Remember me, O my God, concerning this, and wipe not out my good deeds that I have done for the house of my God, and for its offices.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%15%%In those days I saw in Judah some treading wine presses on the sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and lading asses; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all manner of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day in which they sold provisions.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%16%%There dwelt men of Tyre also therein, who brought fish, and all manner of wares, and sold on the sabbath to the children of Judah, and in Jerusalem.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%17%%Then I contended with the nobles of Judah, and said to them, What evil thing is this that ye do, and profane the sabbath day?
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%18%%Did not your fathers thus, and did not our God bring all this evil upon us, and upon this city? yet ye bring more wrath upon Israel by profaning the sabbath.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%19%%And it came to pass, that, when the gates of Jerusalem began to be dark before the sabbath, I commanded that the gates should be shut, and charged that they should not be opened till after the sabbath: and I set some of my servants at the gates, that there should no burden be brought in on the sabbath day.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%20%%So the merchants and sellers of all kind of wares lodged without Jerusalem once or twice.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%21%%Then I testified against them, and said to them, Why lodge ye about the wall? if ye do so again, I will lay hands on you. From that time forth they came no more on the sabbath.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%22%%And I commanded the Levites, that they should cleanse themselves, and that they should come and keep the gates, to sanctify the sabbath day. Remember me, O my God, concerning this also, and spare me according to the greatness of thy mercy.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%23%%In those days also I saw Jews that had married wives of Ashdod, of Ammon, and of Moab:
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%24%%And their children spoke half in the speech of Ashdod, and could not speak in the Jews language, but according to the language of each people.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%25%%And I contended with them, and cursed them, and smote certain of them, and plucked off their hair, and made them swear by God, saying, Ye shall not give your daughters to their sons, nor take their daughters to your sons, or for yourselves.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%26%%Did not Solomon king of Israel sin by these things? yet among many nations was there no king like him, who was beloved by his God, and God made him king over all Israel: nevertheless even him did outlandish women cause to sin.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%27%%Shall we then hearken to you to do all this great evil, to transgress against our God in marrying foreign wives?
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%28%%And one of the sons of Joiada, the son of Eliashib the high priest, was son-in-law to Sanballat the Horonite: therefore I chased him from me.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%29%%Remember them, O my God, because they have defiled the priesthood, and the covenant of the priesthood and of the Levites.
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%30%%Thus I cleansed them from all strangers, and appointed the wards of the priests and the Levites, every one in his business;
1000005%%Nehemiah%%OT%%13%%31%%And for the wood-offering, at times appointed, and for the first-fruits. Remember me, O my God, for good.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%1%%Now it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus, (this is Ahasuerus who reigned from India even to Cush, over a hundred and seven and twenty provinces:)
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%2%%That in those days, when the king Ahasuerus sat on the throne of his kingdom, which was in Shushan the palace,
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%3%%In the third year of his reign, he made a feast to all his princes and his servants; the power of Persia and Media, the nobles and princes of the provinces, being before him:
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%4%%When he showed the riches of his glorious kingdom and the honor of his excellent majesty many days, even a hundred and eighty days.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%5%%And when these days had expired, the king made a feast for all the people that were present in Shushan the palace, both for great and small, seven days, in the court of the garden of the king's palace;
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%6%%Where were white, green, and blue hangings, fastened with cords of fine linen and purple to silver rings and pillars of marble: the beds were of gold and silver, upon a pavement of red, and blue, and white, and black marble.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%7%%And they gave them drink in vessels of gold, (the vessels being diverse one from another,) and royal wine in abundance, according to the state of the king.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%8%%And the drinking was according to the law; none constrained: for so the king had appointed to all the officers of his house, that they should do according to every man's pleasure.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%9%%Also Vashti the queen made a feast for the women in the royal house which belonged to king Ahasuerus.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%10%%On the seventh day, when the heart of the king was merry with wine, he commanded Mehuman, Biztha, Harbona, Bigtha, and Abagtha, Zethar, and Carcas, the seven chamberlains that served in the presence of Ahasuerus the king,
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%11%%To bring Vashti the queen before the king with the crown royal, to show the people and the princes her beauty: for she was fair to look on.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%12%%But the queen Vashti refused to come at the king's commandment by his chamberlains: therefore was the king very wroth, and his anger burned in him.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%13%%Then the king said to the wise men, who knew the times, (for so was the king's manner towards all that knew law and judgment:
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%14%%And the next to him was Carshena, Shethar, Admatha, Tarshish, Meres, Marsena, and Memucan, the seven princes of Persia and Media, who saw the king's face, and who sat the first in the kingdom;)
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%15%%What shall we do to the queen Vashti according to law, because she hath not performed the commandment of the king Ahasuerus by the chamberlains?
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%16%%And Memucan answered before the king and the princes, Vashti the queen hath not done wrong to the king only, but also to all the princes, and to all the people that are in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%17%%For this deed of the queen will come abroad to all women, so that they will despise their husbands in their eyes, when it shall be reported, The king Ahasuerus commanded Vashti the queen to be brought in before him, but she came not.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%18%%Likewise will the ladies of Persia and Media say this day to all the king's princes, who have heard of the deed of the queen. Thus will there arise too much contempt and wrath.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%19%%If it pleaseth the king, let a royal commandment go from him, and let it be written among the laws of the Persians and the Medes, that it be not altered, That Vashti come no more before king Ahasuerus; and let the king give her royal estate to another that is better than she.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%20%%And when the king's decree which he shall make shall be published throughout all his empire, (for it is great,) all the wives will give to their husbands honor, both to great and small.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%21%%And the saying pleased the king and the princes; and the king did according to the word of Memucan:
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%1%%22%%For he sent letters into all the king's provinces, into every province according to the writing of it, and to every people after their language, that every man should bear rule in his own house, and that it should be published according to the language of every people.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%1%%After these things, when the wrath of king Ahasuerus was appeased, he remembered Vashti, and what she had done, and what was decreed against her.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%2%%Then said the king's servants that ministered to him, Let there be fair young virgins sought for the king:
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%3%%And let the king appoint officers in all the provinces of his kingdom, that they may collect all the fair young virgins to Shushan the palace, to the house of the women, into the custody of Hege the king's chamberlain, keeper of the women; and let their things for purification be given them:
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%4%%And let the maiden who pleaseth the king be queen instead of Vashti. And the thing pleased the king; and he did so.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%5%%Now in Shushan the palace there was a certain Jew, whose name was Mordecai, the son of Jair, the son of Shimei, the son of Kish, a Benjaminite;
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%6%%Who had been carried away from Jerusalem with the captivity which had been carried away with Jeconiah king of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%7%%And he brought up Hadassah, that is, Esther, his uncle's daughter: for she had neither father nor mother, and the maid was fair and beautiful; whom Mordecai, when her father and mother were dead, took for his own daughter.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%8%%So it came to pass, when the king's commandment and his decree were heard, and when many maidens were assembled at Shushan the palace, to the custody of Hegai, that Esther was brought also to the king's house, to the custody of Hegai, keeper of the women.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%9%%And the maiden pleased him, and she obtained kindness from him; and he speedily gave her her things for purification, with such things as belonged to her, and seven maidens who were meet to be given her, out of the king's house: and he preferred her and her maids to the best place of the house of the women.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%10%%Esther had not showed her people nor her kindred: for Mordecai had charged her that she should not show it.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%11%%And Mordecai walked every day before the court of the women's house, to know how Esther did, and what would become of her.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%12%%Now when every maid's turn had come to go in to king Ahasuerus, after that she had been twelve months, according to the manner of the women, (for so were the days of their purifications accomplished, to wit, six months with oil of myrrh, and six months with sweet odors, and with other things for the purifying of the women;)
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%13%%Then thus came every maiden to the king; whatever she desired was given her to go with her out of the house of the women to the king's house.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%14%%In the evening she went, and on the morrow she returned into the second house of the women, to the custody of Shaashgaz, the king's chamberlain, who kept the concubines: she came in to the king no more, except that the king delighted in her, and she was called by name.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%15%%Now when the turn of Esther, the daughter of Abihail the uncle of Mordecai, who had taken her for his daughter, had come to go in to the king, she required nothing but what Hegai the king's chamberlain, the keeper of the women, appointed. And Esther obtained favor in the sight of all them that looked upon her.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%16%%So Esther was taken to king Ahasuerus into his house royal in the tenth month, which is the month Tebeth, in the seventh year of his reign.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%17%%And the king loved Esther above all the women, and she obtained grace and favor in his sight more than all the virgins; so that he set the royal crown upon her head, and made her queen instead of Vashti.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%18%%Then the king made a great feast to all his princes and his servants, even Esther's feast; and he made a release to the provinces, and gave gifts, according to the state of the king.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%19%%And when the virgins were assembled the second time, then Mordecai sat in the king's gate.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%20%%Esther had not yet showed her kindred, nor her people; as Mordecai had charged her: for Esther performed the commandment of Mordecai, as when she was brought up with him.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%21%%In those days, while Mordecai sat in the king's gate, two of the king's chamberlains, Bigthan and Teresh, of those who kept the door, were wroth, and sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%22%%And the thing was known to Mordecai, who told it to Esther the queen; and Esther certified the king of it in Mordecai's name.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%2%%23%%And when inquisition was made of the matter, it was discovered; therefore they were both hanged on a tree: and it was written in the book of the chronicles before the king.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%1%%After these things king Ahasuerus promoted Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, and advanced him, and set his seat above all the princes that were with him.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%2%%And all the king's servants that were in the king's gate, bowed, and reverenced Haman; for the king had so commanded concerning him. But Mordecai bowed not, nor did him reverence.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%3%%Then the king's servants who were in the king's gate, said to Mordecai, Why dost thou transgress the king's commandment?
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%4%%Now it came to pass, when they spoke daily to him, and he hearkened not to them, that they told Haman, to see whether Mordecai's matters would stand: for he had told them that he was a Jew.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%5%%And when Haman saw that Mordecai bowed not, nor did him reverence, then was Haman full of wrath.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%6%%And he scorned to lay hands on Mordecai alone; for they had shown him the people of Mordecai: wherefore Haman sought to destroy all the Jews that were throughout the whole kingdom of Ahasuerus, even the people of Mordecai.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%7%%In the first month, (that is, the month Nisan,) in the twelfth year of king Ahasuerus, they cast Pur, that is, the lot, before Haman from day to day, and from month to month, to the twelfth month, that is, the month Adar.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%8%%And Haman said to king Ahasuerus, There is a certain people scattered abroad and dispersed among the people in all the provinces of thy kingdom; and their laws are diverse from all people; neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the king's profit to suffer them.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%9%%If it shall please the king, let it be written that they may be destroyed: and I will pay ten thousand talents of silver to the hands of those that have the charge of the business, to bring it into the king's treasuries.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%10%%And the king took his ring from his hand, and gave it to Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, the Jews enemy.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%11%%And the king said to Haman, The silver is given to thee, the people also, to do with them as it seemeth good to thee.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%12%%Then were the king's scribes called on the thirteenth day of the first month, and there was written according to all that Haman had commanded to the king's lieutenants, and to the governors that were over every province, and to the rulers of every people of every province, according to the writing of it, and to every people after their language; in the name of king Ahasuerus was it written, and sealed with the king's ring.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%13%%And the letters were sent by posts into all the king's provinces, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all Jews, both young and old, little children and women, in one day, even upon the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, and to take the spoil of them for a prey.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%14%%The copy of the writing for a commandment to be given in every province, was published to all people, that they should be ready against that day.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%3%%15%%The posts departed, being hastened by the king's commandment, and the decree was given in Shushan the palace. And the king and Haman sat down to drink; but the city Shushan was perplexed.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%1%%When Mordecai perceived all that was done, Mordecai rent his clothes, and put on sackcloth with ashes, and went out into the midst of the city, and cried with a loud and a bitter cry;
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%2%%And came even before the king's gate: for none might enter into the king's gate clothed with sackcloth.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%3%%And in every province whithersoever the king's commandment and his decree came, there was great mourning among the Jews, and fasting, and weeping, and wailing; and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%4%%So Esther's maids and her chamberlains came and told it to her. Then was the queen exceedingly grieved; and she sent raiment to clothe Mordecai, and to take away his sackcloth from him: but he received it not.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%5%%Then called Esther for Hatach, one of the king's chamberlains, whom he had appointed to attend upon her, and gave him a commandment to Mordecai, to know what it was, and why it was.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%6%%So Hatach went forth to Mordecai, to the street of the city, which was before the king's gate.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%7%%And Mordecai told him all that had happened to him, and of the sum of the money that Haman had promised to pay to the king's treasuries for the Jews, to destroy them.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%8%%Also he gave him the copy of the writing of the decree that was given at Shushan to destroy them, to show it to Esther, and to declare it to her, and to charge her that she should go in to the king, to make supplication to him, and to make request before him for her people.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%9%%And Hatach came and told Esther the words of Mordecai.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%10%%Again Esther spoke to Hatach, and gave him commandment to Mordecai;
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%11%%All the king's servants, and the people of the king's provinces, do know, that whoever, whether man or woman, shall come to the king into the inner court, who is not called, there is one law of his to put him to death, except him to whom the king shall hold out the golden scepter, that he may live: but I have not been called to come in to the king these thirty days.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%12%%And they told to Mordecai Esther's words.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%13%%Then Mordecai commanded to answer Esther, Think not with thyself that thou shalt escape in the king's house more than all the Jews.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%14%%For if thou shalt altogether hold thy peace at this time, then will there enlargement and deliverance arise to the Jews from another place; but thou and thy father's house will be destroyed: and who knoweth, whether thou hast come to the kingdom for such a time as this?
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%15%%Then Esther bade them return Mordecai this answer,
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%16%%Go, assemble all the Jews that are present in Shushan, and fast ye for me, and neither eat nor drink three days, night or day: I also and my maidens will fast likewise; and so will I go in to the king, which is not according to the law; and if I perish, I perish.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%4%%17%%So Mordecai went his way, and did according to all that Esther had commanded him.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%1%%Now it came to pass on the third day, that Esther put on her royal apparel, and stood in the inner court of the king's house, over against the king's house: and the king sat upon his royal throne in the royal house, over against the gate of the house.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%2%%And it was so, when the king saw Esther the queen standing in the court, that she obtained favor in his sight: and the king held out to Esther the golden scepter that was in his hand. So Esther drew near, and touched the top of the scepter.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%3%%Then said the king to her, What wilt thou, queen Esther? and what is thy request? it shall be even given thee to the half of the kingdom.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%4%%And Esther answered, If it shall seem good to the king, let the king and Haman come this day to the banquet that I have prepared for him.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%5%%Then the king said, Cause Haman to make haste, that he may do as Esther hath said. So the king and Haman came to the banquet that Esther had prepared.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%6%%And the king said to Esther at the banquet of wine, What is thy petition? and it shall be granted thee: and what is thy request? even to the half of the kingdom it shall be performed.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%7%%Then answered Esther, and said, My petition and my request is:
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%8%%If I have found favor in the sight of the king, and if it shall please the king to grant my petition, and to perform my request, let the king and Haman come to the banquet that I shall prepare for them, and I will do to-morrow as the king hath said.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%9%%Then went Haman forth that day joyful and with a glad heart: but when Haman saw Mordecai in the king's gate, that he stood not up, nor moved for him, he was full of indignation against Mordecai.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%10%%Nevertheless, Haman refrained himself: and when he came home, he sent and called for his friends, and Zeresh his wife.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%11%%And Haman told them of the glory of his riches, and the multitude of his children, and all the things in which the king had promoted him, and how he had advanced him above the princes and servants of the king.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%12%%Haman said moreover, Yes, Esther the queen let no man come in with the king to the banquet that she had prepared but myself; and to-morrow I am invited to her also with the king.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%13%%Yet all this availeth me nothing, so long as I see Mordecai the Jew sitting at the king's gate.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%5%%14%%Then said Zeresh his wife and all his friends to him, Let a gallows be made fifty cubits high, and to-morrow speak thou to the king that Mordecai may be hanged upon it: then go thou in merrily with the king to the banquet. And the thing pleased Haman; and he caused the gallows to be made.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%1%%In that night the king could not sleep, and he commanded to bring the book of records of the chronicles; and they were read before the king.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%2%%And it was found written, that Mordecai had informed of Bigthana and Teresh, two of the king's chamberlains, the keepers of the door, who sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%3%%And the king said, What honor and dignity hath been done to Mordecai for this? Then said the king's servants that ministered to him, There is nothing done for him.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%4%%And the king said, Who is in the court? Now Haman had come into the outward court of the king's house, to speak to the king to hang Mordecai on the gallows that he had prepared for him.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%5%%And the king's servants said to him, Behold, Haman standeth in the court. And the king said, Let him come in.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%6%%So Haman came in. And the king said to him, What shall be done to the man whom the king delighteth to honor? Now Haman thought in his heart, To whom would the king delight to do honor more than to myself?
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%7%%And Haman answered the king, For the man whom the king delighteth to honor,
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%8%%Let the royal apparel be brought which the king useth to wear, and the horse that the king rideth upon, and the crown royal which is set upon his head:
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%9%%And let this apparel and horse be delivered to the hand of one of the king's most noble princes, that they may array the man whom the king delighteth to honor, and bring him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaim before him, Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delighteth to honor.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%10%%Then the king said to Haman, Make haste, and take the apparel and the horse, as thou hast said, and do even so to Mordecai the Jew, that sitteth at the king's gate: let nothing fail of all that thou hast spoken.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%11%%Then Haman took the apparel and the horse, and arrayed Mordecai, and brought him on horseback through the street of the city, and proclaimed before him, Thus shall it be done to the man whom the king delighteth to honor.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%12%%And Mordecai came again to the king's gate. But Haman hasted to his house mourning, and having his head covered.
1000005%%Esther%%OT%%6%%13%%And Haman told Zeresh his wife and all his friends every thing that had befallen him. Then said his wise men and Zeresh his wife to him, If Mordecai is of the seed of the Jews, before whom thou hast begun to fall, thou wilt not prevail against him, but wilt surely fall before him.
