1000005%%Job%%OT%%24%%20%%The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%24%%21%%He oppresseth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%24%%22%%He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%24%%23%%Though it is given him to be in safety, on which he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%24%%24%%They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all others, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%24%%25%%And if it is not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech of no worth?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%25%%1%%Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%25%%2%%Dominion and fear are with him, he maketh peace in his high places.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%25%%3%%Is there any number of his armies? and upon whom doth not his light arise?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%25%%4%%How then can man be justified with God? or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%25%%5%%Behold even to the moon, and it shineth not; and the stars are not pure in his sight.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%25%%6%%How much less man, that is a worm; and the son of man, who is a worm?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%1%%But Job answered and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%2%%How hast thou helped him that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%3%%How hast thou counseled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou abundantly declared the thing as it is?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%4%%To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%5%%Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%6%%Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%7%%He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%8%%He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%9%%He holdeth back the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud upon it.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%10%%He hath encompassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%11%%The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%12%%He divideth the sea by his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%13%%By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%26%%14%%Lo, these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%1%%Moreover, Job continued his parable, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%2%%As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty who hath afflicted my soul;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%3%%All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%4%%My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%5%%Far be it from me that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove my integrity from me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%6%%My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%7%%Let my enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%8%%For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%9%%Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%10%%Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%11%%I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%12%%Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%13%%This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%14%%If his children are multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%15%%Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%16%%Though he should heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%17%%He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%18%%He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%19%%The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%20%%Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%21%%The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%22%%For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%27%%23%%Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%1%%Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%2%%Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is melted out of the stone.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%3%%He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shades of death.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%4%%The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant: even the waters forgotten by the foot: they are dried up, they have gone away from men.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%5%%As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%6%%The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%7%%There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vultur's eye hath not seen:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%8%%The lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%9%%He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%10%%He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%11%%He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid he bringeth forth to light.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%12%%But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%13%%Man knoweth not the price of it; neither is it found in the land of the living.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%14%%The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%15%%It cannot be obtained for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price of it.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%16%%It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%17%%The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%18%%No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%19%%The topaz of Cush shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%20%%Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%21%%Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%22%%Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame of it with our ears.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%23%%God understandeth the way of it, and he knoweth its place.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%24%%For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%25%%To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%26%%When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%27%%Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%28%%28%%And to man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%1%%Moreover, Job continued his parable, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%2%%Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%3%%When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%4%%As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%5%%When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%6%%When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%7%%When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%8%%The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%9%%The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%10%%The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%11%%When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%12%%Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%13%%The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%14%%I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%15%%I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%16%%I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%17%%And I broke the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%18%%Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%19%%My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%20%%My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%21%%To me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%22%%After my words they spoke not again; and my speech dropped upon them.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%23%%And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%24%%If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%29%%25%%I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%1%%But now they that are younger than I, have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to set with the dogs of my flock.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%2%%Yes, to what might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age had perished?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%3%%For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%4%%Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their food.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%5%%They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them, as after a thief;)
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%6%%To dwell in the clefts of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%7%%Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were collected.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%8%%They were children of fools, yes, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%9%%And now I am their song, yes, I am their by-word.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%10%%They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%11%%Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%12%%Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%13%%They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%14%%They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%15%%Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%16%%And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%17%%My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%18%%By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%19%%He hath cast me into the mire, and I have become like dust and ashes.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%20%%I cry to thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%21%%Thou hast become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%22%%Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%23%%For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%24%%Yet he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%25%%Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%26%%When I looked for good, then evil came: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%27%%My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction came upon me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%28%%I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%29%%I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%30%%My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%30%%31%%My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%1%%I Made a covenant with my eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%2%%For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%3%%Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%4%%Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%5%%If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%6%%Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know my integrity.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%7%%If my step hath turned out of the way, and my heart walked after my eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to my hands;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%8%%Then let me sow, and let another eat; yes, let my offspring be rooted out.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%9%%If my heart hath been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbor's door;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%10%%Then let my wife grind to another, and let others bow down upon her.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%11%%For this is a hainous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%12%%For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all my increase.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%13%%If I despised the cause of my man-servant or of my maid-servant, when they contended with me;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%14%%What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%15%%Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%16%%If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%17%%Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten of it;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%18%%(For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb;)
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%19%%If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%20%%If his loins have not blessed me, and if he hath not been warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%21%%If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%22%%Then let my arm fall from my shoulder-blade, and my arm be broken from the bone.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%23%%For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%24%%If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%25%%If I have rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because my hand had gained much;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%26%%If I have beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%27%%And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%28%%This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%29%%If I have rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or have lifted up myself when evil found him:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%30%%Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%31%%If the men of my tabernacle have not said, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%32%%The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveler.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%33%%If I have covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding my iniquity in my bosom:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%34%%Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%35%%Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that my adversary had written a book.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%36%%Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%37%%I would declare to him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near to him.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%38%%If my land crieth against me, or its furrows likewise complain;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%39%%If I have eaten the fruits of it without money, or have caused its owners to lose their life:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%31%%40%%Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%1%%So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%2%%Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%3%%Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%4%%Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken because they were older than he.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%5%%When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%6%%And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not show you my opinion.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%7%%I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%8%%But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%9%%Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%10%%Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will show my opinion.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%11%%Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%12%%Yes, I attended to you, and behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%13%%Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%14%%Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%15%%They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%16%%When I had waited, (for they spoke not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%17%%I said, I will answer also my part, I also will show my opinion.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%18%%For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%19%%Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%20%%I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%21%%Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles to man.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%32%%22%%For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing, my Maker would soon take me away.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%1%%Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%2%%Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%3%%My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%4%%The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%5%%If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%6%%Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%7%%Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%8%%Surely thou hast spoken in my hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%9%%I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%10%%Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%11%%He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%12%%Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%13%%Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%14%%For God speaketh once, yes twice, yet man perceiveth it not.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%15%%In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%16%%Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%17%%That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%18%%He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%19%%He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%20%%So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty food.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%21%%His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%22%%Yes, his soul draweth near to the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%23%%If there is a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to show to man his uprightness:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%24%%Then he is gracious to him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%25%%His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he will return to the days of his youth:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%26%%He shall pray to God, and he will be favorable to him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render to man his righteousness.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%27%%He looketh upon men, and if any shall say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%28%%He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%29%%Lo, all these things God often worketh with man,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%30%%To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%31%%Mark well, O Job, hearken to me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%32%%If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%33%%33%%If not, hearken to me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%1%%Furthermore Elihu answered and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%2%%Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear to me, ye that have knowledge.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%3%%For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth food.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%4%%Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%5%%For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%6%%Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%7%%What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%8%%Who goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%9%%For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%10%%Therefore hearken to me, ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%11%%For the work of a man he shall render to him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%12%%Yes, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%13%%Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%14%%If he should set his heart upon man, if he should gather to himself his spirit and his breath;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%15%%All flesh would perish together, and man would turn again to dust.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%16%%If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%17%%Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%18%%Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art wicked? and to princes, Ye are ungodly?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%19%%How much less to him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%20%%In a moment they shall die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%21%%For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%22%%There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%23%%For he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%24%%He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%25%%Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%26%%He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%27%%Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%28%%So that they cause the cry of the poor to come to him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%29%%When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%30%%That the hypocrite may not reign, lest the people should be ensnared.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%31%%Surely it is meet to be said to God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%32%%That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%33%%Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou shalt refuse, or whether thou shalt choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%34%%Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken to me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%35%%Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%36%%My desire is that Job may be tried to the end, because of his answers for wicked men.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%34%%37%%For he addeth rebellion to his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%1%%Elihu spoke moreover, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%2%%Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than God's?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%3%%For thou saidst, What advantage will it be to thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%4%%I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%5%%Look to the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%6%%If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions are multiplied, what doest thou to him?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%7%%If thou art righteous, what givest thou to him? or what receiveth he from thy hand?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%8%%Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art: and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%9%%By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%10%%But none saith, Where is God my maker, who giveth songs in the night;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%11%%Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%12%%There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%13%%Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%14%%Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust thou in him.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%15%%But now, because it is not so, he hath visited in his anger; yet he knoweth it not in great extremity:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%35%%16%%Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%1%%Elihu also proceeded, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%2%%Suffer me a little, and I will show thee that I have yet to speak on God's behalf.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%3%%I will bring my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%4%%For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%5%%Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%6%%He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%7%%He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yes, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%8%%And if they are bound in fetters, and are held in cords of affliction;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%9%%Then he showeth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%10%%He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%11%%If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%12%%But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%13%%But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%14%%They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%15%%He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%16%%Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table would be full of fatness.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%17%%But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%18%%Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%19%%Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%20%%Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%21%%Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%22%%Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%23%%Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%24%%Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%25%%Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%26%%Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%27%%For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapor of it.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%28%%Which the clouds do drop and distill upon man abundantly.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%29%%Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%30%%Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%31%%For by them he judgeth the people; he giveth food in abundance.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%32%%With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the intervening cloud.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%36%%33%%The noise of it showeth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapor.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%1%%At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of its place.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%2%%Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%3%%He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning to the ends of the earth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%4%%After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellence; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%5%%God thundereth marvelously with his voice; great things he doeth, which we cannot comprehend.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%6%%For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%7%%He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%8%%Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%9%%From the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold from the north.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%10%%By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%11%%Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%12%%And it is turned around by his counsels: that they may do whatever he commandeth them upon the face of the world on the earth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%13%%He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%14%%Hearken to this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%15%%Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%16%%Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%17%%How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%18%%Hast thou with him spread out the sky which is strong, and as a molten looking-glass?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%19%%Teach us what we shall say to him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%20%%Shall it be told him that I speak? If a man shall speak, surely he will be swallowed up.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%21%%And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%22%%Fair weather cometh from the north: with God is terrible majesty.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%23%%Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in abundance of justice: he will not afflict.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%37%%24%%Men therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%1%%Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%2%%Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%3%%Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%4%%Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%5%%Who hath laid the measures of it, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%6%%Upon what are the foundations of it fastened? or who laid its corner stone;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%7%%When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%8%%Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it broke forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%9%%When I made a cloud its garment, and thick darkness a swaddling band for it,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%10%%And broke up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%11%%And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%12%%Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the day-spring to know its place;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%13%%That it might take hold of the ends of earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%14%%It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%15%%And from the wicked their light is withheld, and the high arm shall be broken.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%16%%Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%17%%Have the gates of death been opened to thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shades of death?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%18%%Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%19%%Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is its place,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%20%%That thou shouldest take it to its bound, and that thou shouldest know the paths to its house?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%21%%Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%22%%Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%23%%Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%24%%By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%25%%Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%26%%To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness in which there is no man;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%27%%To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%28%%Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of the dew?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%29%%Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%30%%The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%31%%Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%32%%Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in its season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with its sons?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%33%%Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set its dominion on the earth?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%34%%Canst thou lift thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%35%%Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say to thee, Here we are?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%36%%Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%37%%Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%38%%38%%When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%1%%Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%2%%When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%3%%Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry to God, they wander for want of food.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%4%%Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%5%%Canst thou number the months that they fulfill? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%6%%They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%7%%Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not to them.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%8%%Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%9%%Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%10%%He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%11%%The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%12%%Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%13%%Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%14%%Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labor to him?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%15%%Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%16%%Gavest thou the goodly wings to the peacocks? or wings and feathers to the ostrich!
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%17%%Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in the dust,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%18%%And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%19%%She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labor is in vain without fear;
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%20%%Because God hath withheld wisdom from her, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%21%%When she lifteth herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%22%%Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%23%%Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%24%%He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%25%%He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%26%%The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%27%%He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%28%%He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%29%%Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings towards the south?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%30%%Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%31%%She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%32%%From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%33%%Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%34%%Moreover, the LORD answered Job, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%35%%Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%36%%Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%37%%Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay my hand upon my mouth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%39%%38%%Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yes, twice; but I will proceed no further.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%1%%Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%2%%Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou to me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%3%%Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%4%%Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like his?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%5%%Deck thyself now with majesty and excellence; and array thyself with glory and beauty.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%6%%Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%7%%Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%8%%Hide them in the dust together; bind their faces in secret.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%9%%Then will I also confess to thee that thy own right hand can save thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%10%%Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%11%%Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%12%%He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his male organs are wrapped together.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%13%%His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%14%%He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach him.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%15%%Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%16%%He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%17%%The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook encompass him.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%18%%Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%19%%He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%20%%Canst thou draw out leviathan with a hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%21%%Canst thou put a hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%22%%Will he make many supplications to thee? will he speak soft words to thee?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%23%%Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%24%%Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%25%%Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%26%%Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%27%%Lay thy hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%40%%28%%Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%1%%None is so fierce that he dare rouse him: who then is able to stand before me?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%2%%Who hath first benefited me, that I should repay him? whatever is under the whole heaven is mine.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%3%%I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%4%%Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%5%%Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible around.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%6%%His scales are his pride, shut together as with a close seal.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%7%%One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%8%%They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%9%%His sneezings flash light, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%10%%Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire dart forth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%11%%Out of his nostrils issueth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%12%%His breath kindleth coals, and a flame issueth from his mouth.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%13%%In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%14%%The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%15%%His heart is as firm as a stone; yes, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%16%%When he raiseth himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%17%%The sword of him that attacketh him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%18%%He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%19%%The arrow cannot make him flee: sling-stones are turned with him into stubble.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%20%%Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%21%%Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%22%%He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%23%%He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%24%%Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%41%%25%%He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%1%%Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%2%%I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withheld from thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%3%%Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefore have I uttered that which I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%4%%Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will ask of thee, and declare thou to me.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%5%%I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now my eye seeth thee.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%6%%Wherefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%7%%And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words to Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%8%%Therefore take to you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer for yourselves a burnt-offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal with you after your folly, in that ye have not spoken of me the thing which is right, like my servant Job.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%9%%So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the LORD commanded them: the LORD also accepted Job.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%10%%And the LORD turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%11%%Then came there to him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and ate bread with him in his house: and they condoled with him, and comforted him over all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an ear-ring of gold.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%12%%So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%13%%He had also seven sons, and three daughters.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%14%%And he called the name of the first, Jemima; and the name of the second, Kezia; and the name of the third, Keren-happuch.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%15%%And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%16%%After this Job lived a hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, even four generations.
1000005%%Job%%OT%%42%%17%%So Job died, being old and full of days.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%1%%1%%Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of scoffers.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%1%%2%%But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%1%%3%%And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth its fruit in season; its leaf also shall not wither; and whatever he doeth shall prosper.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%1%%4%%The ungodly are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%1%%5%%Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%1%%6%%For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%1%%Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%2%%The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the LORD, and against his anointed, saying,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%3%%Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%4%%He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%5%%Then shall he speak to them in his wrath, and trouble them in his sore displeasure.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%6%%Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%7%%I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said to me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%8%%Ask of me, and I will give thee the heathen for thy inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%9%%Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter's vessel.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%10%%Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%11%%Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%2%%12%%Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%3%%2%%A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son. LORD, how are they multiplied that trouble me? many are they that rise up against me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%3%%3%%Many there are who say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%3%%4%%But thou, O LORD, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of my head.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%3%%5%%I cried to the LORD with my voice, and he heard me from his holy hill. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%3%%6%%I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the LORD sustained me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%3%%7%%I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me on all sides.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%3%%8%%Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all my enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%3%%9%%Salvation belongeth to the LORD: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%4%%2%%To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm of David. Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%4%%3%%O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after falsehood? Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%4%%4%%But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call to him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%4%%5%%Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%4%%6%%Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%4%%7%%There are many that say, Who will show us any good? LORD, lift thou upon us the light of thy countenance.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%4%%8%%Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time when their corn and their wine increased.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%4%%9%%I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep; for thou only, LORD, makest me dwell in safety.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Nehiloth, A Psalm of David. Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my meditation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%3%%Hearken to the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for to thee will I pray.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%4%%My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD; in the morning will I direct my prayer to thee, and will look up.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%5%%For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%6%%The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%7%%Thou shalt destroy them that speak falsehood: the LORD will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%8%%But as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship towards thy holy temple.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%9%%Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness, because of my enemies; make thy way straight before my face.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%10%%For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulcher; they flatter with their tongue.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%11%%Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%12%%But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%5%%13%%For thou, LORD, wilt bless the righteous; with favor wilt thou compass him as with a shield.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%2%%To the chief Musician on Neginoth upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David. O LORD, rebuke me not in thy anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%3%%Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are agitated.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%4%%My soul is also greatly disquieted: but thou, O LORD, how long?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%5%%Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: Oh save me for thy mercies sake.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%6%%For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who will give thee thanks?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%7%%I am weary with my groaning; all the night I make my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%8%%My eye is consumed because of grief; it groweth old because of all my enemies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%9%%Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%10%%The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%6%%11%%Let all my enemies be ashamed and greatly disquieted: let them return and be suddenly ashamed.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%2%%Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the LORD, concerning the words of Cush the Benjaminite. O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%3%%Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%4%%O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there is iniquity in my hands;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%5%%If I have rewarded evil to him that was at peace with me; (yes, I have delivered him that without cause is my enemy:)
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%6%%Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yes, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay my honor in the dust. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%7%%Arise, O LORD, in thy anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of my enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%8%%So shall the congregation of the people encompass thee: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%9%%The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to my integrity that is in me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%10%%Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%11%%My defense is from God, who saveth the upright in heart.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%12%%God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%13%%If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%14%%He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%15%%Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%16%%He made a pit, and digged it, and hath fallen into the ditch which he made.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%17%%His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%7%%18%%I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm of David. O LORD our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%3%%Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thy enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%4%%When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers; the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%5%%What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou visitest him?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%6%%For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast crowned him with glory and honor.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%7%%Thou hast made him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all things under his feet:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%8%%All sheep and oxen, yes, and the beasts of the field;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%9%%The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatever passeth through the paths of the seas.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%8%%10%%O LORD our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Muthlabben, A Psalm of David. I will praise thee, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will show forth all thy wonderful works.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%3%%I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%4%%When my enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%5%%For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou sattest on the throne judging right.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%6%%Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%7%%O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial hath perished with them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%8%%But the LORD shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%9%%And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%10%%The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%11%%And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%12%%Sing praises to the LORD, who dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%13%%When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%14%%Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble which I suffer from them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%15%%That I may show forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%16%%The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%17%%The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%18%%The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%19%%For the needy shall not always be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%20%%Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%9%%21%%Put them in fear, O LORD: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%1%%Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%2%%The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%3%%For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%4%%The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%5%%His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%6%%He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%7%%His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%8%%He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%9%%He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%10%%He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%11%%He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%12%%Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thy hand: forget not the humble.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%13%%Why doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%14%%Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself to thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%15%%Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou shalt find none.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%16%%The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen have perished out of his land.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%17%%LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thy ear to hear:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%10%%18%%To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%11%%1%%To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. In the LORD I put my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%11%%2%%For lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%11%%3%%If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%11%%4%%The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD'S throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try the children of men.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%11%%5%%The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%11%%6%%Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and a horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%11%%7%%For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance beholdeth the upright.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%12%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Sheminith. A Psalm of David. Help, LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%12%%3%%They speak vanity every one with his neighbor: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%12%%4%%The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%12%%5%%Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%12%%6%%For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the LORD; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%12%%7%%The words of the LORD are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%12%%8%%Thou shalt keep them, O LORD, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%12%%9%%The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%13%%1%%To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%13%%2%%How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall my enemy be exalted over me?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%13%%3%%Consider and hear me, O LORD my God: lighten my eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%13%%4%%Lest my enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%13%%5%%But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%13%%6%%I will sing to the LORD, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%14%%1%%To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%14%%2%%The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%14%%3%%They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%14%%4%%Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%14%%5%%There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%14%%6%%Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the LORD is his refuge.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%14%%7%%Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the LORD bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%15%%1%%A Psalm of David. LORD, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy holy hill?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%15%%2%%He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%15%%3%%He that backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbor, nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbor.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%15%%4%%In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but he honoreth them that fear the LORD. He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%15%%5%%He that putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%1%%Michtam of David. Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%2%%O my soul, thou hast said to the LORD, Thou art my Lord: my goodness extendeth not to thee;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%3%%But to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%4%%Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god: their drink-offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take their names into my lips.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%5%%The LORD is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%6%%The lines have fallen to me in pleasant places; yes, I have a goodly heritage.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%7%%I will bless the LORD, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night season.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%8%%I have set the LORD always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%9%%Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%10%%For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thy Holy One to see corruption.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%16%%11%%Thou wilt show me the path of life: in thy presence is fullness of joy; at thy right hand are pleasures for evermore.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%1%%A Prayer of David. Hear the right, O LORD, attend to my cry, give ear to my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%2%%Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thy eyes behold the things that are equal.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%3%%Thou hast proved my heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I have purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%4%%Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%5%%Uphold my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%6%%I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thy ear to me, and hear my speech.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%7%%Show thy wonderful loving-kindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them who put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%8%%Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shade of thy wings.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%9%%From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who encompass me,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%10%%They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%11%%They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%12%%Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%13%%Arise, O LORD disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, who is thy sword:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%14%%From men who are thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, who have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%17%%15%%As for me, I shall behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%2%%To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David, the servant of the LORD, who spoke to the LORD the words of this song in the day that the LORD delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul: And he said, I will love thee, O LORD, my strength.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%3%%The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%4%%I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from my enemies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%5%%The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%6%%The sorrows of hell encompassed me: the snares of death seized me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%7%%In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried to my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%8%%Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%9%%There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%10%%He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness was under his feet.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%11%%And he rode upon a cherub, and flew; yes, he flew upon the wings of the wind.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%12%%He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion around him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%13%%At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%14%%The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail stones and coals of fire.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%15%%Yes, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%16%%Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were uncovered at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%17%%He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%18%%He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them who hated me: for they were too strong for me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%19%%They attacked me in the day of my calamity: but the LORD was my stay.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%20%%He brought me forth also in a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%21%%The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%18%%22%%For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.
