1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%2%%To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, Michtam of David, when he fled from Saul in the cave. Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me: for my soul trusteth in thee: yes, in the shadow of thy wings will I make my refuge, until these calamities are overpast.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%3%%I will cry to God most high; to God that performeth all things for me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%4%%He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him that would swallow me up. Selah. God shall send forth his mercy and his truth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%5%%My soul is among lions: and I lie even among them that are set on fire, even the sons of men, whose teeth are spears and arrows, and their tongue a sharp sword.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%6%%Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens; let thy glory be above all the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%7%%They have prepared a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down: they have digged a pit before me, into the midst of which they have fallen themselves. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%8%%My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed: I will sing and give praise.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%9%%Awake, my glory; awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%10%%I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: I will sing to thee among the nations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%11%%For thy mercy is great to the heavens, and thy truth to the clouds.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%57%%12%%Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: let thy glory be above all the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%2%%To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, Michtam of David. Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge uprightly, O ye sons of men?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%3%%Yes, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violence of your hands in the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%4%%The wicked are estranged from their birth: they go astray as soon as they are born, speaking lies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%5%%Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%6%%Which will not hearken to the voice of charmers, charming never so wisely.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%7%%Break their teeth, O God, in their mouth: break out the great teeth of the young lions, O LORD.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%8%%Let them melt away as waters which run continually: when he bendeth his bow to shoot his arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%9%%As a snail which melteth, let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%10%%Before your pots can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as with a whirlwind, both living, and in his wrath.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%11%%The righteous shall rejoice when he seeth the vengeance: he shall wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%58%%12%%So that a man shall say, Verily there is a reward for the righteous: verily he is a God that judgeth in the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%2%%To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, Michtam of David; when Saul sent, and they watched the house to kill him. Deliver me from my enemies, O my God: defend me from them that rise up against me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%3%%Deliver me from the workers of iniquity, and save me from bloody men.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%4%%For lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighty are gathered against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O LORD.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%5%%They run and prepare themselves without my fault: awake to help me, and behold.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%6%%Thou therefore, O LORD God of hosts, the God of Israel, awake to visit all the heathen: be not merciful to any wicked transgressors. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%7%%They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go about the city.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%8%%Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%9%%But thou, O LORD, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the heathen in derision.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%10%%Because of his strength will I wait upon thee: for God is my defense.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%11%%The God of my mercy will succor me: God will let me see my desire upon my enemies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%12%%Slay them not, lest my people forget: scatter them by thy power; and bring them down, O Lord our shield.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%13%%For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%14%%Consume them in wrath, consume them, that they may not be: and let them know that God ruleth in Jacob to the ends of the earth. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%15%%And at evening let them return; and let them make a noise like a dog, and go about the city.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%16%%Let them wander up and down for food, and grudge if they are not satisfied.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%17%%But I will sing of thy power; yes, I will sing aloud of thy mercy in the morning: for thou hast been my defense and refuge in the day of my trouble.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%59%%18%%To thee, O my strength, will I sing: for God is my defense, and the God of my mercy.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%3%%To the chief Musician upon Shushan-eduth, Michtam of David, to teach; when he strove with Aram-naharaim and with Aram-zobah, when Joab returned, and smote of Edom in the valley of salt twelve thousand. O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%4%%Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal its breaches; for it shaketh.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%5%%Thou hast shown thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%6%%Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%7%%That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%8%%God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succoth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%9%%Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of my head; Judah is my lawgiver;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%10%%Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%11%%Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%12%%Wilt thou not, O God, who hadst cast us off? and thou, O God, who didst not go out with our armies?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%13%%Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%60%%14%%Through God we shall do valiantly: for he will tread down our enemies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%61%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Neginah, A Psalm of David. Hear my cry, O God; attend to my prayer.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%61%%3%%From the end of the earth will I cry to thee, when my heart is overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%61%%4%%For thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the enemy.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%61%%5%%I will abide in thy tabernacle for ever: I will trust in the covert of thy wings. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%61%%6%%For thou, O God, hast heard my vows: thou hast given me the heritage of those that fear thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%61%%7%%Thou wilt prolong the king's life: and his years as many generations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%61%%8%%He shall abide before God for ever: O prepare mercy and truth, which may preserve him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%61%%9%%So will I sing praise to thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%2%%To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of David. Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%3%%He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defense; I shall not be greatly moved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%4%%How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%5%%They only consult to cast him down from his excellence: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%6%%My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%7%%He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defense; I shall not be moved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%8%%In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%9%%Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%10%%Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%11%%Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%12%%God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth to God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%62%%13%%Also to thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%2%%A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, thou art my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%3%%To see thy power and thy glory, so as I have seen thee in the sanctuary.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%4%%Because thy loving-kindness is better than life, my lips shall praise thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%5%%Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%6%%My soul shall be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise thee with joyful lips:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%7%%When I remember thee upon my bed, and meditate on thee in the night watches.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%8%%Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%9%%My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%10%%But those that seek my soul to destroy it, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%11%%They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%63%%12%%But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%2%%To the chief Musician, a Psalm of David. Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%3%%Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%4%%Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%5%%That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%6%%They encourage themselves in an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who will see them?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%7%%They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward thought of every one of them, and the heart, is deep.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%8%%But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%9%%So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%10%%And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%64%%11%%The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%2%%To the chief Musician, A Psalm and Song of David. Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Zion: and to thee shall the vow be performed.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%3%%O thou that hearest prayer, to thee shall all flesh come.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%4%%Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%5%%Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach to thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%6%%By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%7%%Who by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%8%%Who stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%9%%They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%10%%Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%11%%Thou waterest the ridges of it abundantly: thou settlest the furrows of it: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing of it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%12%%Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%13%%They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%65%%14%%The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%1%%To the chief Musician, A Song or Psalm. Make a joyful noise to God, all ye lands:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%2%%Sing forth the honor of his name: make his praise glorious.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%3%%Say to God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thy enemies submit themselves to thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%4%%All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing to thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%5%%Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing towards the children of men.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%6%%He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there we rejoiced in him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%7%%He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%8%%O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%9%%Who holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%10%%For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%11%%Thou hast brought us into the net; thou hast laid affliction upon our loins.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%12%%Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%13%%I will go into thy house with burnt-offerings: I will pay thee my vows,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%14%%Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%15%%I will offer to thee burnt-sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%16%%Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%17%%I cried to him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%18%%If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%19%%But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%66%%20%%Blessed be God, who hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%67%%2%%To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm or Song. God be merciful to us, and bless us; and cause his face to shine upon us. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%67%%3%%That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%67%%4%%Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%67%%5%%O let the nations be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon earth. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%67%%6%%Let the people praise thee, O God; let all the people praise thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%67%%7%%Then shall the earth yield her increase; and God, even our own God, will bless us.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%67%%8%%God will bless us, and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%2%%To the chief Musician, A Psalm or Song of David. Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%3%%As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%4%%But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yes, let them exceedingly rejoice.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%5%%Sing to God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%6%%A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%7%%God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those who are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%8%%O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%9%%The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%10%%Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, by which thou didst confirm thy inheritance, when it was weary.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%11%%Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%12%%The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%13%%Kings of armies fled apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%14%%Though ye have lain among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%15%%When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%16%%The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; a high hill as the hill of Bashan.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%17%%Why leap ye, ye lofty hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yes, the LORD will dwell in it for ever.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%18%%The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%19%%Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yes, for the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell among them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%20%%Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%21%%He that is our God is the God of salvation; and to GOD the Lord belong the issues from death.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%22%%But God will wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such one as goeth on still in his trespasses.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%23%%The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%24%%That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thy enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%25%%They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%26%%The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%27%%Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%28%%There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their counsel, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%29%%Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%30%%Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents to thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%31%%Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one shall submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%32%%Princes shall come out of Egypt; Cush shall soon stretch out her hands to God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%33%%Sing to God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises to the Lord; Selah:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%34%%To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%35%%Ascribe ye strength to God: his excellence is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%68%%36%%O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power to his people. Blessed be God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, A Psalm of David. Save me, O God; for the waters are come in to my soul.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%3%%I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into deep waters, where the floods overflow me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%4%%I am weary of my crying: my throat is dried: my eyes fail while I wait for my God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%5%%They that hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head: they that would destroy me, being my enemies wrongfully, are mighty: then I restored that which I took not away.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%6%%O God, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sins are not hid from thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%7%%Let not them that wait on thee, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confounded for my sake, O God of Israel.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%8%%Because for thy sake I have borne reproach; shame hath covered my face.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%9%%I am become a stranger to my brethren, and an alien to my mother's children.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%10%%For the zeal of thy house hath eaten me up; and the reproaches of them that reproached thee have fallen upon me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%11%%When I wept, and chastened my soul with fasting, that was to my reproach.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%12%%I made sackcloth also my garment; and I became a proverb to them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%13%%They that sit in the gate speak against me; and I was the song of the drunkards.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%14%%But as for me, my prayer is to thee, O LORD, in an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy hear me, in the truth of thy salvation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%15%%Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%16%%Let not the water-flood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%17%%Hear me, O LORD; for thy loving-kindness is good: turn to me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%18%%And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble: hear me speedily.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%19%%Draw nigh to my soul, and redeem it: deliver me because of my enemies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%20%%Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonor: my adversaries are all before thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%21%%Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity, but there was none; and for comforters, but I found none.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%22%%They gave me also gall for my food; and in my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%23%%Let their table become a snare before them: and that which should have been for their welfare, let it become a trap.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%24%%Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their loins continually to shake.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%25%%Pour out thy indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful anger take hold of them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%26%%Let their habitation be desolate; and let none dwell in their tents.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%27%%For they persecute him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%28%%Add iniquity to their iniquity: and let them not come into thy righteousness.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%29%%Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be written with the righteous.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%30%%But I am poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O God, set me up on high.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%31%%I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify him with thanksgiving.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%32%%This also shall please the LORD better than an ox or bullock that hath horns and hoofs.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%33%%The humble shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall live that seek God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%34%%For the LORD heareth the poor, and despiseth not his prisoners.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%35%%Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that moveth therein.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%36%%For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah: that they may dwell there, and have it in possession.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%69%%37%%The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that love his name shall dwell therein.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%70%%2%%To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David to bring to remembrance. Make haste, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help me, O LORD.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%70%%3%%Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul: let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my hurt.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%70%%4%%Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say, Aha, aha.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%70%%5%%Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%70%%6%%But I am poor and needy: make haste to me, O God: thou art my help and my deliverer; O LORD, make no delay.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%1%%In thee, O LORD, do I put my trust: let me never be put to confusion.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%2%%Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline thy ear to me, and save me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%3%%Be thou my strong habitation, to which I may continually resort: thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou art my rock and my fortress.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%4%%Deliver me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked, from the hand of the unrighteous and cruel man.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%5%%For thou art my hope, O Lord GOD: thou art my trust from my youth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%6%%By thee have I been sustained from my birth: thou art he that brought me into life: my praise shall be continually of thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%7%%I am as a wonder to many; but thou art my strong refuge.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%8%%Let my mouth be filled with thy praise and with thy honor all the day.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%9%%Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength faileth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%10%%For my enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait for my soul take counsel together,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%11%%Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for there is none to deliver him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%12%%O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%13%%Let them be confounded and consumed that are adversaries to my soul; let them be covered with reproach and dishonor that seek my hurt.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%14%%But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%15%%My mouth shall show forth thy righteousness and thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers thereof.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%16%%I will go in the strength of the Lord GOD: I will make mention of thy righteousness, even of thine only.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%17%%O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I declared thy wondrous works.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%18%%Now also when I am old and gray-headed, O God, forsake me not; until I have shown thy strength to this generation, and thy power to every one that is to come.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%19%%Thy righteousness also, O God, is very high, who hast done great things: O God, who is like to thee!
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%20%%Thou, who hast shown me great and severe troubles, wilt revive me again, and wilt bring me again from the depths of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%21%%Thou wilt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%22%%I will also praise thee with the psaltery, even thy truth, O my God: to thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy One of Israel.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%23%%My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing to thee; and my soul, which thou hast redeemed.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%71%%24%%My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day long: for they are confounded, for they are brought to shame, that seek my hurt.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%1%%A Psalm for Solomon. Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness to the king's son.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%2%%He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%3%%The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little hills, by righteousness.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%4%%He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%5%%They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout all generations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%6%%He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers that water the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%7%%In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of peace so long as the moon endureth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%8%%He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river to the ends of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%9%%They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his enemies shall lick the dust.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%10%%The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%11%%Yes, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall serve him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%12%%For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and him that hath no helper.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%13%%He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls of the needy.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%14%%He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious shall be their blood in his sight.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%15%%And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daily shall he be praised.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%16%%There shall be a handful of corn in the earth upon the top of the mountains; the fruit of it shall shake like Lebanon: and they of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%17%%His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued as long as the sun: and men shall be blessed in him: all nations shall call him blessed.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%18%%Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who only doeth wondrous things.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%19%%And blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen, and amen.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%72%%20%%The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%1%%A Psalm of Asaph. Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%2%%But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well nigh slipped.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%3%%For I was envious at the foolish, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%4%%For there are no bands in their death: but their strength is firm.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%5%%They are not in trouble as other men; neither are they afflicted like other men.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%6%%Therefore pride encompasseth them as a chain; violence covereth them as a garment.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%7%%Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%8%%They are corrupt, and speak wickedly concerning oppression: they speak loftily.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%9%%They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue walketh through the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%10%%Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full cup are wrung out to them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%11%%And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the Most High?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%12%%Behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they increase in riches.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%13%%Verily I have cleansed my heart in vain, and washed my hands in innocence.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%14%%For all the day long have I been afflicted, and chastened every morning.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%15%%If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the generation of thy children.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%16%%When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%17%%Until I went into the sanctuary of God; then I understood their end.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%18%%Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou didst cast them down into destruction.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%19%%How are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%20%%As a dream when one awaketh; so, O Lord, when thou awakest, thou wilt despise their image.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%21%%Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%22%%So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%23%%Nevertheless I am continually with thee: thou hast held me by my right hand.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%24%%Thou wilt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me to glory.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%25%%Whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth that I desire besides thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%26%%My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%27%%For lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast destroyed all them that go astray from thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%73%%28%%But it is good for me to draw near to God: I have put my trust in the Lord GOD, that I may declare all thy works.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%1%%Maschil of Asaph. O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thy anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%2%%Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old: the rod of thy inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, in which thou hast dwelt.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%3%%Lift up thy feet to the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%4%%Thy enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%5%%A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%6%%But now they break down the carved work of it at once with axes and hammers.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%7%%They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling-place of thy name to the ground.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%8%%They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%9%%We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%10%%O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%11%%Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%12%%For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%13%%Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou didst break the heads of the dragons in the waters.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%14%%Thou didst break the head of leviathan in pieces, and didst give him to be food to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%15%%Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou didst dry up mighty rivers.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%16%%The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%17%%Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%18%%Remember this, the enemy hath reproached, O LORD, and the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%19%%O deliver not the soul of thy turtle dove to the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%20%%Have respect to the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%21%%O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%22%%Arise, O God, plead thy own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%74%%23%%Forget not the voice of thy enemies: the tumult of those that rise against thee increaseth continually.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%2%%To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, A Psalm or Song of Asaph. To thee, O God, do we give thanks, to thee do we give thanks: for that thy name is near, thy wondrous works declare.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%3%%When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%4%%The earth and all its inhabitants are dissolved: I bear up the pillars of it. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%5%%I said to the fools, Deal not foolishly; and to the wicked, Lift not up the horn:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%6%%Lift not up your horn on high: speak not with a stiff neck.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%7%%For promotion cometh neither from the east, nor from the west, nor from the south.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%8%%But God is the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up another.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%9%%For in the hand of the LORD there is a cup, and the wine is red; it is full of mixture, and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs of it all the wicked of the earth shall wring them out, and drink them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%10%%But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%75%%11%%All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; but the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%2%%To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm or Song of Asaph. In Judah is God known: his name is great in Israel.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%3%%In Salem also is his tabernacle, and his dwelling place in Zion.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%4%%There he broke the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword, and the battle. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%5%%Thou art more glorious and excellent than the mountains of prey.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%6%%The stout-hearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep: and none of the men of might have found their hands.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%7%%At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead sleep.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%8%%Thou, even thou, art to be feared: and who may stand in thy sight when once thou art angry?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%9%%Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth feared, and was still,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%10%%When God arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%11%%Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee: the remainder of wrath wilt thou restrain.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%12%%Vow, and pay to the LORD your God: let all that are about him bring presents to him that ought to be feared.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%76%%13%%He shall cut off the spirit of princes: he is terrible to the kings of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%2%%To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of Asaph. I cried to God with my voice, even to God with my voice; and he gave ear to me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%3%%In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, and ceased not: my soul refused to be comforted.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%4%%I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%5%%Thou holdest my eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%6%%I have considered the days of old, the years of ancient times.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%7%%I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with my own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%8%%Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favorable no more?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%9%%Is his mercy wholly gone for ever? doth his promise fail for evermore?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%10%%Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his tender mercies? Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%11%%And I said, This is my infirmity: but I will remember the years of the right hand of the Most High.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%12%%I will remember the works of the LORD: surely I will remember thy wonders of old.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%13%%I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%14%%Thy way, O God, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a God as our God!
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%15%%Thou art the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared thy strength among the people.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%16%%Thou hast with thy arm redeemed thy people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%17%%The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were afraid: the depths also were disturbed.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%18%%The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thy arrows also went abroad.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%19%%The voice of thy thunder was in the heaven: the lightnings lightened the world: the earth trembled and shook.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%20%%Thy way is in the sea, and thy path in the great waters, and thy footsteps are not known.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%77%%21%%Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%1%%Maschil of Asaph. Give ear, O my people, to my law: incline your ear to the words of my mouth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%2%%I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings of old:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%3%%Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%4%%We will not hide them from their children, showing to the generation to come the praises of the LORD, and his strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%5%%For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them known to their children:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%6%%That the generation to come might know them, even the children who should be born; who should arise and declare them to their children:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%7%%That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep his commandments:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%8%%And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation; a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not steadfast with God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%9%%The children of Ephraim, being armed, and carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%10%%They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in his law;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%11%%And forgot his works, and his wonders that he had shown them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%12%%Marvelous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%13%%He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the waters to stand as a heap.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%14%%In the day-time also he led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%15%%He cleaved the rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out of the great depths.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%16%%He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%17%%And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the Most High in the wilderness.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%18%%And they tempted God in their heart by asking food for their desire.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%19%%Yes, they spoke against God; they said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%20%%Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the streams overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provide flesh for his people?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%21%%Therefore the LORD heard this, and was wroth: so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against Israel;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%22%%Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%23%%Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened the doors of heaven,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%24%%And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given them of the corn of heaven.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%25%%Man ate angels' food: he sent them food to the full.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%26%%He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power he brought in the south wind.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%27%%He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls like as the sand of the sea:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%28%%And he let it fall in the midst of their camp, around their habitations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%29%%So they ate, and were well filled: for he gave them their own desire;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%30%%They were not estranged from their desire: but while their meat was yet in their mouths,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%31%%The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote down the chosen men of Israel.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%32%%For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous works.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%33%%Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years in trouble.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%34%%When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned and inquired early after God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%35%%And they remembered that God was their rock, and the high God their redeemer.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%36%%Nevertheless they flattered him with their mouth, and they lied to him with their tongues.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%37%%For their heart was not right with him, neither were they steadfast in his covenant.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%38%%But he, being full of compassion, forgave their iniquity, and destroyed them not: yes, many a time he turned his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%39%%For he remembered that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%40%%How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert!
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%41%%Yes, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%42%%They remembered not his hand, nor the day when he delivered them from the enemy.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%43%%How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the field of Zoan:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%44%%And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods, that they could not drink.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%45%%He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%46%%He gave also their increase to the caterpillar, and their labor to the locust.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%47%%He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with frost.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%48%%He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to hot thunderbolts.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%49%%He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels among them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%50%%He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%51%%And smote all the first-born in Egypt; the chief of their strength in the tabernacles of Ham:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%52%%But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%53%%And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%54%%And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, even to this mountain, which his right hand had purchased.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%55%%He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%56%%Yet they tempted and provoked the most high God, and kept not his testimonies:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%57%%But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers: they were turned aside like a deceitful bow.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%58%%For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to jealousy with their graven images.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%59%%When God heard this, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred Israel:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%60%%So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%61%%And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the enemy's hand.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%62%%He gave over his people also to the sword; and was wroth with his inheritance.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%63%%The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to marriage.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%64%%Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%65%%Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, and like a mighty man that shouteth by reason of wine.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%66%%And he smote his enemies in the hinder part: he put them to a perpetual reproach.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%67%%Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%68%%But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%69%%And he built his sanctuary like high palaces, like the earth which he hath established for ever.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%70%%He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheep-folds:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%71%%From following the ewes great with young he brought him to feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%78%%72%%So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%1%%A Psalm of Asaph. O God, the heathen have come into thy inheritance; thy holy temple have they defiled; they have laid Jerusalem on heaps.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%2%%The dead bodies of thy servants have they given to be food to the fowls of the heaven, the flesh of thy saints, to the beasts of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%3%%Their blood have they shed like water around Jerusalem; and there was none to bury them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%4%%We have become a reproach to our neighbors, a scorn and derision to them that are around us.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%5%%How long, LORD? wilt thou be angry for ever? shall thy jealousy burn like fire?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%6%%Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the kingdoms that have not called upon thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%7%%For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his dwelling-place.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%8%%O remember not against us former iniquities: let thy tender mercies speedily succor us: for we are brought very low.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%9%%Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name: and deliver us, and purge away our sins, for thy name's sake.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%10%%Why should the heathen say, Where is their God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight by avenging the blood of thy servants which is shed.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%11%%Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee; according to the greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to die;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%12%%And render to our neighbors seven-fold into their bosom their reproach, with which they have reproached thee, O Lord.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%79%%13%%So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks for ever: we will show forth thy praise to all generations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim Eduth, A Psalm of Asaph. Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubim, shine forth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%3%%Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, and come and save us.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%4%%Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%5%%O LORD God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%6%%Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them tears to drink in great measure.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%7%%Thou makest us a strife to our neighbors: and our enemies laugh among themselves.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%8%%Turn us again, O God of hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%9%%Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%10%%Thou preparedst room before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%11%%The hills were covered with the shade of it, and its boughs were like the goodly cedars.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%12%%She sent out her boughs to the sea, and her branches to the river.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%13%%Why hast thou then broke down her hedges, so that all they who pass by the way do pluck her?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%14%%The boar from the wood doth waste it, and the wild beast of the field doth devour it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%15%%Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%16%%And the vineyard which thy right hand planted, and the branch that thou madest strong for thyself.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%17%%It is burnt with fire, it is cut down: they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%18%%Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%19%%So will we not go back from thee: revive us, and we will call upon thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%80%%20%%Turn us again, O LORD God of hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm  of Asaph. Sing aloud to God our strength: make a joyful noise to the God of Jacob.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%3%%Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%4%%Blow the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%5%%For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%6%%This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%7%%I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%8%%Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%9%%Hear, O my people, and I will testify to thee; O Israel, if thou wilt hearken to me;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%10%%There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%11%%I am the LORD thy God who brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%12%%But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would not obey me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%13%%So I gave them up to their own hearts lust: and they walked in their own counsels.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%14%%O that my people had hearkened to me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%15%%I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%16%%The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves to him: and their time should have endured for ever.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%81%%17%%He would have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock I should have satisfied thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%82%%1%%A Psalm of Asaph. God standeth in the congregation of the mighty; he judgeth among the gods.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%82%%2%%How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the wicked? Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%82%%3%%Defend the poor and fatherless: do justice to the afflicted and needy.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%82%%4%%Deliver the poor and needy: deliver them from the hand of the wicked.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%82%%5%%They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%82%%6%%I have said, Ye are gods; and all of you are children of the Most High.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%82%%7%%But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%82%%8%%Arise, O God, judge the earth: for thou wilt inherit all nations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%2%%A song, or Psalm of Asaph. Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not still, O God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%3%%For lo, thy enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted up the head.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%4%%They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%5%%They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from being a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%6%%For they have consulted together with one consent: they are confederate against thee,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%7%%The tabernacles of Edom, and the Ishmaelites; of Moab, and the Hagarenes;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%8%%Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; the Philistines with the inhabitants of Tyre;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%9%%Assur also is joined with them: they have helped the children of Lot. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%10%%Do to them as to the Midianites; as to Sisera, as to Jabin, at the brook of Kison:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%11%%Who perished at En-dor: they became as dung for the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%12%%Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yes, all their princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%13%%Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%14%%O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the wind.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%15%%As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the mountains on fire;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%16%%So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy storm.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%17%%Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name, O LORD.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%18%%Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yes, let them be put to shame, and perish:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%83%%19%%That men may know that thou, whose name alone is JEHOVAH, art the most high over all the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%2%%To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. How amiable are thy tabernacles, O LORD of hosts!
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%3%%My soul longeth, and even fainteth for the courts of the LORD: my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%4%%Yes, the sparrow hath found a house, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, even thy altars, O LORD of hosts, my King, and my God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%5%%Blessed are they that dwell in thy house: they will be still praising thee. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%6%%Blessed is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are the ways of them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%7%%Who passing through the valley of Baca make it a well; the rain also filleth the pools.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%8%%They go from strength to strength, every one of them in Zion appeareth before God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%9%%O LORD God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%10%%Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thy anointed.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%11%%For a day in thy courts is better than a thousand. I had rather be a door-keeper in the house of my God, than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%12%%For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%84%%13%%O LORD of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%85%%4%%Thou hast taken away all thy wrath; thou hast turned thyself from the fierceness of thy anger.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%85%%5%%Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thy anger towards us to cease.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%85%%6%%Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thy anger to all generations?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%85%%7%%Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%85%%10%%Surely his salvation is nigh them that fear him; that glory may dwell in our land.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%85%%11%%Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%85%%12%%Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look down from heaven.

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%1%%A Prayer of David. Bow down thy ear, O LORD, hear me: for I am poor and needy.

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%3%%Be merciful to me, O Lord: for I cry to thee daily.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%4%%Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for to thee, O Lord, do I lift up my soul.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%5%%For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and abundant in mercy to all them that call upon thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%6%%Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer; and attend to the voice of my supplications.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%7%%In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt answer me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%8%%Among the gods there is none like thee, O Lord; neither are there any works like thy works.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%9%%All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%10%%For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%11%%Teach me thy way, O LORD; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%12%%I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will glorify thy name for evermore.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%13%%For great is thy mercy towards me: and thou hast delivered my soul from the lowest hell.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%14%%O God, the proud have risen against me, and the assemblies of violent men have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%15%%But thou, O Lord, art a God full of compassion, and gracious; long-suffering, and abundant in mercy and truth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%16%%O turn to me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength to thy servant, and save the son of thy handmaid.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%86%%17%%Show me a token for good; that they who hate me may see it, and be ashamed: because thou, LORD, hast helped me, and comforted me.

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%2%%A Song or Psalm for the sons of Korah, to the chief Musician upon Mahalath Leannoth, Maschil of Heman the Ezrahite. O LORD God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before thee:

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%7%%Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%10%%My eye mourneth by reason of affliction: LORD, I have called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands to thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%11%%Wilt thou show wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise and praise thee? Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%12%%Shall thy loving-kindness be declared in the grave? or thy faithfulness in destruction?

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%14%%But to thee have I cried, O LORD; and in the morning shall my prayer come before thee.

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%16%%I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer thy terrors I am distracted.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%17%%Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%88%%18%%They came around me daily like water; they encompassed me together.

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%2%%Maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite. I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%3%%For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness wilt thou establish in the very heavens.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%4%%I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn to David my servant,
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%5%%Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%6%%And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD; thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%7%%For who in the heaven can be compared to the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened to the LORD?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%8%%God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence by all them that are about him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%9%%O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like to thee? or to thy faithfulness around thee?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%10%%Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when its waves arise, thou stillest them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%11%%Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thy enemies with thy strong arm.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%12%%The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world, and the fullness of it, thou hast founded them.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%13%%The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%14%%Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%15%%Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%16%%Blessed are the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%17%%In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%18%%For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favor our horn shall be exalted.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%19%%For the LORD is our defense; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%20%%Then thou didst speak in vision to thy holy one, and say, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%21%%I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%22%%With whom my hand shall be established: my arm also shall strengthen him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%23%%The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%24%%And I will beat down his foes before his face, and afflict them that hate him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%25%%But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%26%%I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%27%%He shall cry to me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%28%%Also I will make him my first-born, higher than the kings of the earth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%29%%My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%30%%His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%31%%If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%32%%If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%33%%Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%34%%Nevertheless my loving-kindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%35%%My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that hath gone out of my lips.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%36%%Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie to David.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%37%%His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%38%%It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%39%%But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thy anointed.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%40%%Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%41%%Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%42%%All that pass by the way plunder him: he is a reproach to his neighbors.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%43%%Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%44%%Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%45%%Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%46%%The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%47%%How long, LORD, wilt thou hide thyself? for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%48%%Remember how short my time is: why hast thou made all men in vain?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%49%%What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%50%%Lord, where are thy former loving-kindnesses, which thou didst swear to David in thy truth?
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%51%%Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%89%%52%%With which thy enemies have reproached, O LORD; with which they have reproached the footsteps of thy anointed

1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%1%%A prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord, thou hast been our dwelling-place in all generations.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%2%%Before the mountains were brought forth, or ever thou hadst formed the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, thou art God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%3%%Thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, Return, ye children of men.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%4%%For a thousand years in thy sight are but as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%5%%Thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep; in the morning they are like grass which groweth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%6%%In the morning it flourisheth, and groweth; in the evening it is cut down, and withereth.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%7%%For we are consumed by thy anger, and by thy wrath are we troubled.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%8%%Thou hast set our iniquities before thee, our secret sins in the light of thy countenance.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%9%%For all our days are passed away in thy wrath: we spend our years, as a tale that is told.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%10%%The days of our years are seventy years; and if by reason of strength they are eighty years, yet is their strength labor and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fly away.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%11%%Who knoweth the power of thy anger? even according to thy fear, so is thy wrath.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%12%%So teach us to number our days, that we may apply our hearts to wisdom.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%13%%Return, O LORD, how long? and repent thou concerning thy servants.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%14%%O satisfy us early with thy mercy; that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%15%%Make us glad according to the days in which thou hast afflicted us, and the years in which we have seen evil.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%16%%Let thy work appear to thy servants, and thy glory to their children.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%90%%17%%And let the beauty of the LORD our God be upon us: and establish thou the work of our hands upon us; yes, the work of our hands establish thou it.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%1%%He that dwelleth in the secret place of the Most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%2%%I will say of the LORD, He is my refuge and my fortress: my God; in him will I trust.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%3%%Surely he shall deliver thee from the snare of the fowler, and from the noisome pestilence.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%4%%He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%5%%Thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the arrow that flieth by day;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%6%%Nor for the pestilence that walketh in darkness; nor for the destruction that wasteth at noon-day.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%7%%A thousand shall fall at thy side, and ten thousand at thy right hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%8%%Only with thy eyes shalt thou behold and see the reward of the wicked.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%9%%Because thou hast made the LORD who is my refuge, even the Most High, thy habitation;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%10%%There shall no evil befall thee, neither shall any plague come nigh thy dwelling.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%11%%For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%12%%They shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%13%%Thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the dragon shalt thou trample under feet.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%14%%Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%15%%He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honor him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%91%%16%%With long life will I satisfy him, and show him my salvation.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%2%%A Psalm or Song for the sabbath day. It is a good thing to give thanks to the LORD, and to sing praises to thy name, O Most High.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%3%%To show forth thy loving-kindness in the morning, and thy faithfulness every night.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%4%%Upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon the harp with a solemn sound.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%5%%For thou, LORD, hast made me glad through thy work: I will triumph in the works of thy hands.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%6%%O LORD, how great are thy works! and thy thoughts are very deep.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%7%%A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%8%%When the wicked spring as the grass, and when all the workers of iniquity do flourish; it is that they shall be destroyed for ever:
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%9%%But thou, LORD, art most high for evermore.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%10%%For lo, thy enemies, O LORD, for lo, thy enemies shall perish; all the workers of iniquity shall be scattered.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%11%%But my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: I shall be anointed with fresh oil.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%12%%My eye also shall see my desire on my enemies, and my ears shall hear my desire of the wicked that rise up against me.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%13%%The righteous shall flourish like the palm-tree; he shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%14%%Those that are planted in the house of the LORD shall flourish in the courts of our God.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%15%%They shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat and flourishing;
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%92%%16%%To show that the LORD is upright: he is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%93%%1%%The LORD reigneth, he is clothed with majesty; the LORD is clothed with strength, with which he hath girded himself: the world also is established, that it cannot be moved.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%93%%2%%Thy throne is established of old: thou art from everlasting.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%93%%3%%The floods have lifted up, O LORD, the floods have lifted up their voice; the floods lift their waves.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%93%%4%%The LORD on high is mightier than the noise of many waters, yes, than the mighty waves of the sea.
1000005%%Psalms%%OT%%93%%5%%Thy testimonies are very sure: holiness becometh thy house, O LORD, for ever.
